Title: Mary's Mexican Ranchero Salsa
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons corn oil', '3 medium ripe tomatoes', '5 medium jalapeno peppers, stemmed', '1 medium onion, diced', '1 cup water', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a medium skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add oil to the hot skillet and place whole tomatoes and jalapenos in the pan.
', 'Step 3: Cook, turning every 2 minutes, until all sides are scalded.
', 'Step 4: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 5: Transfer tomatoes and jalapenos carefully to a blender and process until pureed.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir onion in the same skillet over medium heat until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add tomato-jalapeno puree and pour in water; bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 8: Simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Season with salt and serve warm.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '82.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '4.8 g', 'fatContent': '7.1 g', 'fiberContent': '1.4 g', 'proteinContent': '0.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '5.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.8 g'}

Title: Uncle Tim's Mole Sauce
Ingredients: ['4 red bell peppers', '4 tomatoes', '1 tablespoon corn oil', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon ground cloves', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '2 medium onions, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 cup chicken broth', '¼ cup raisins', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '½ cup coarsely chopped Mexican dark chocolate', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: n Cut the peppers in half from top to bottom.
', 'Step 4: Place the peppers cut-sides down onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: n Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Place the blackened peppers into a bowl and tightly seal with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 7: Allow the peppers to steam as they cool, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove and discard excess blackened skin and stems.
', 'Step 9: Tear peppers with your hands and place in a bowl.
', 'Step 10: n Cut the top off of each tomato around the stem.
', "Step 11: Scoop seeds and pulp out of each tomato and squeeze into a bowl to create a thick tomato 'juice'.
", 'Step 12: Chop tomatoes and place in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 13: n Heat corn oil and olive oil together in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 14: Cook and stir black pepper, paprika, cloves, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper in hot oil until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 15: n Stir onion and garlic into hot spiced oil; cook and stir until onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
', "Step 16: Pour tomato 'juice' into the pot and bring mixture to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon.
", 'Step 17: Add chopped tomatoes, chicken broth, raisins, and brown sugar.
', 'Step 18: Bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 19: n Reduce heat to low and add the chocolate; stir until chocolate melts.
', 'Step 20: Add roasted peppers and stir.
', 'Step 21: Bring sauce to a simmer and cook until flavors blend, at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 22: n Pour sauce into a blender no more than half full.
', 'Step 23: Cover and hold lid down; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend.
', 'Step 24: Puree in batches until smooth.
', 'Step 25: Return sauce to the pot and season with salt.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '138.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '23.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '0.6 mg', 'fatContent': '5.1 g', 'fiberContent': '3.5 g', 'proteinContent': '2.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '130.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '16.9 g'}

Title: Pumpkin Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 (15 ounce) can solid-pack pumpkin', '1 (14.5 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '1 medium onion, chopped', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 clove garlic, chopped', '5 cups low-sodium chicken broth', '4 cubes chicken bouillon', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon chili powder, or to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 cups chopped cooked chicken', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '3 tablespoons avocado oil', '½ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '½ cup sour cream', '1 avocado, sliced', '1 lime, cut into wedges', '1 jalapeno pepper, sliced', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place diced tomatoes with chiles, pumpkin, fire-roasted tomatoes, onion, cilantro, and garlic into the bowl of a food processor and puree until texture is uniformly smooth, 1 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Pour pureed mixture into a 6-quart pot and add chicken broth, bouillon, cumin, coriander, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil over medium heat and continue to boil, stirring occasionally, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat, cover, and let simmer, 45 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add chicken and simmer for 30 minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Line half sheet baking pans with parchment paper.
', 'Step 8: Brush each tortilla with oil on each side, slice into 1/2-inch pieces, and spread onto the prepared baking sheets in a single layer.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned and crispy, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Ladle soup into bowls, garnish with tortilla strips and Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 11: Top with sour cream, avocado, lime, jalapeno, and cilantro as desired.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '318.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '27.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '43.9 mg', 'fatContent': '15.9 g', 'fiberContent': '6.1 g', 'proteinContent': '18.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '1052.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.9 g'}

Title: Candice's Butternut Squash Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 butternut squash - peeled, halved lengthwise, and seeded', '¼ cup vegetable oil for frying, or as needed', '12 corn tortillas', '1 (28 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon garlic salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '⅓ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 cup shredded Colby-Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place squash halves in a microwave-safe bowl and cover bowl with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 2: Cook in microwave until flesh is very tender, 12 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Pour about 1 inch of oil in a skillet and place over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 4: Fry tortillas in oil until softened and lightly browned, about 10 seconds per side.
', 'Step 5: Drain tortillas on paper towel-lined plates.
', 'Step 6: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Spread a thin layer of enchilada sauce into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle cinnamon, garlic salt, and black pepper over squash; mash until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Stir black beans and cilantro into squash mixture until filling is well mixed.
', 'Step 10: Place a tortilla in the bottom of the baking dish; spoon filling down the middle and roll tortilla around filling, keeping it seam-side down.
', 'Step 11: Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.
', 'Step 12: Stack rolled tortillas on top of each other, if needed.
', 'Step 13: Pour remaining enchilada sauce over tortillas and top with Colby-Jack cheese.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, 25 to 30 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '383.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '58.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '21.8 mg', 'fatContent': '12.5 g', 'fiberContent': '10.7 g', 'proteinContent': '13.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '829.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '5 g'}

Title: Charred Corn and Black Bean Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 cup corn', '1 large tomato, sliced', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and halved', '6 cloves garlic, halved', '2 teaspoons olive oil', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can fire-roasted tomatoes', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon cumin', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ lime, juiced']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Place corn, sliced tomato, jalapeno pepper, garlic, and olive oil in a large bowl and toss to lightly coat.
', 'Step 3: Spread oiled ingredients on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Broil in the preheated oven until vegetables begin to char, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from the oven and let cool slightly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Transfer charred ingredients to a food processor and add black beans, fire-roasted tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, and lime juice; blend to desired consistency.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '102.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '18.1 g', 'fatContent': '1.8 g', 'fiberContent': '5.3 g', 'proteinContent': '4.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '647.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.7 g'}

Title: Fiesta Guacamole
Ingredients: ['2 ripe avocados, halved and pitted', '¼ cup hot salsa', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '¼ tablespoon chili powder', '1 ¼ teaspoons hot pepper sauce, or to taste', '½ cup mayonnaise']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Scoop avocado meat into a bowl and mash with a fork.
', 'Step 2: Stir salsa, garlic powder, chili powder, and hot pepper sauce into mashed avocados.
', 'Step 3: Spread mayonnaise over guacamole.
', 'Step 4: Cover bowl with plastic wrap; chill in refrigerator for about 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Stir mayonnaise into guacamole just before serving.
']

Title: Chocolate Atole
Ingredients: ['1 cup cold water', '¼ cup masa harina', '1 cup milk', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ cup evaporated milk', '1 (2 ounce) bar dark chocolate, chopped', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk water and masa harina together in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Add milk and cinnamon.
', 'Step 4: Continue stirring until thick and bubbly.
', 'Step 5: Add evaporated milk, chocolate, brown sugar, and vanilla extract.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir until chocolate and sugar are just melted, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat and pour into mugs.
', 'Step 8: Serve hot.
']

Title: Mexican Hot Chocolate Brownie Tortes
Ingredients: ['1 (18.25 ounce) package brownie mix (such as Betty Crocker®)', '½ cup vegetable oil', '2 eggs', '3 tablespoons water', '1 pint heavy whipping cream', '3 tablespoons sugar', '1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground red chile pepper', '½ cup strong brewed coffee']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking pan.
', 'Step 3: Stir brownie mix, oil, eggs, and water together in a bowl until well blended.
', 'Step 4: Pour batter into the pan.
', 'Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 22 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Let brownies cool completely, at least 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Beat cream in a bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form.
', 'Step 8: Add sugar gradually, continuing to beat until fully incorporated.
', 'Step 9: Beat in cinnamon and ground chile pepper.
', 'Step 10: Cut brownies into an even number of circles using a cookie cutter.
', 'Step 11: Poke small holes into brownies with a toothpick.
', 'Step 12: Brush on coffee, making sure it seeps into the brownie.
', 'Step 13: Spread cinnamon-chile whipped cream on top, cover with another brownie circle, and pipe or spread more whipped cream on top.
', 'Step 14: Repeat with the remaining brownies and whipped cream.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Meatless Taco Filling
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14 ounce) can refried beans', '1 cup water', '1 cup textured vegetable protein (TVP) granules', '1 cup salsa', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 ½ teaspoons dried minced onion', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '¾ teaspoon vegetable bouillon', '¼ teaspoon white sugar', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '⅛ teaspoon onion powder']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine black beans, refried beans, water, textured vegetable protein, salsa, chili powder, onion, paprika, bouillon, sugar, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder in a slow cooker; stir until well mixed.
', 'Step 2: Cover and cook on Low for 2 hours.
', 'Step 3: Stir well and serve.
']

Title: JJ's Vegan Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 red bell pepper, finely chopped', '1 small white onion, finely chopped', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and finely chopped, divided', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 bunch green onions, finely chopped', '⅓ cup fresh oregano leaves', '6 flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a large pie pan with olive oil.
', 'Step 3: Combine black beans, bell pepper, onion, 1 jalapeno pepper, taco seasoning, and salt in a frying pan.
', 'Step 4: Cook until juices are released, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat and mix in green onions, oregano, and remaining jalapeno pepper.
', 'Step 6: Fill a tortilla with 1/6 of the black bean mixture and wrap into a burrito.
', 'Step 7: Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.
', 'Step 8: Place burritos in the prepared pie pan.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until crisp and slightly brown, about 10 minutes.
']

Title: Lisa Lynn's Fideo Soup
Ingredients: ['2 cups beef broth', '2 cups chicken broth', '4 cups vegetable broth, divided', '½ (14 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '1 medium tomato, cored and halved', '½ medium white onion, roughly chopped', '2 cloves garlic, peeled', '1 teaspoon chicken soup base (such as Better than Bouillon®)', '1 tablespoon grapeseed oil', '1 (7 ounce) package Pasta, fideo, enrich, dry, all brands', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 medium zucchini, diced', '1 pinch salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine beef broth, chicken broth, and 2 cups vegetable broth in a large pot over medium heat; bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 2: Meanwhile, combine remaining vegetable broth, fire-roasted tomatoes, tomato halves, onion, garlic, and chicken soup base in the bowl of a food processor; blend until fully combined, 1 to 1 1/2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove the processor blade and set the bowl aside.
', 'Step 4: Heat oil in a 10-inch frying pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Add fideo pasta and cook, stirring constantly, until golden brown, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in oregano and cumin.
', 'Step 7: Hold a 6-inch strainer over the pan and pour in the blended tomato mixture.
', "Step 8: Quickly stir the sizzling mixture with a wooden spoon so it doesn't stick or burn; continue stirring for 1 minute.
", 'Step 9: Discard any tomato solids left in the strainer.
', 'Step 10: Pour fideo-tomato mixture into the simmering broth.
', 'Step 11: Increase heat to high and cook for about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Reduce heat to medium-high and stir in zucchini and salt.
', 'Step 13: Cook until fideo is tender yet firm to the bite, about 2 minutes more.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '149 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '25.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '1.7 mg', 'fatContent': '2.8 g', 'fiberContent': '2.1 g', 'proteinContent': '5.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '906.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.7 g'}

Title: Chicken Thighs with Calabaza Squash and Corn
Ingredients: ['⅓ cup water', '¼ cup lime juice', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '4 cloves garlic, crushed', '2 teaspoons soy sauce', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon liquid smoke flavoring', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 2-inch pieces', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 large sweet onion, chopped', '1 Calabaza', '1 medium yellow squash, cubed', '1 medium zucchini, cubed', '1 (16 ounce) package frozen corn', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 cup chicken broth', '1 medium tomato, chopped', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', '2 teaspoons salt, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix water, lime juice, olive oil, garlic, soy sauce, salt, and liquid smoke for marinade together in a large, resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 2: Stir in cayenne and black pepper.
', 'Step 3: Add chicken and let marinate in the refrigerator, at least 2 hours, to overnight.
', 'Step 4: Remove chicken from the marinade and shake off excess.
', 'Step 5: Discard the remaining marinade.
', 'Step 6: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Add chicken and cook and stir until just golden, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add onion, calabaza, yellow squash, and zucchini; cook and stir until squash are slightly tender, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add corn, tomato sauce, chicken broth, tomato, garlic powder, cumin, black pepper, and salt; stir well.
', 'Step 10: Cover, reduce heat to medium-low, and let simmer for 30 minutes, stirring once halfway through the cooking.
']

Title: Mexican Shrimp with Linguine
Ingredients: ['½ cup olive oil', '1 lime, zested and juiced', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper, divided', '1 teaspoon Cajun seasoning', '1 teaspoon salt, divided', '1 pound peeled and deveined shrimp', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 pound chorizo sausage links, sliced', '1 (16 ounce) package linguine pasta', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 cup white wine', '1 ½ cups chicken stock', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk 1/2 cup olive oil, lime zest, lime juice, 1 teaspoon pepper, Cajun seasoning, and 1/2 teaspoon salt together in a large glass or ceramic bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add shrimp and toss to evenly coat.
', 'Step 3: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator while you prepare the sausage.
', 'Step 4: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Add sausage and cook until browned and cooked through, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain, and drain and discard most of the grease from the skillet.
', 'Step 7: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Cook linguine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes.
', 'Step 9: While the pasta is cooking, remove shrimp from the marinade and shake off excess.
', 'Step 10: Discard the remaining marinade.
', 'Step 11: Place garlic in the same skillet used to cook the sausage.
', 'Step 12: Cook garlic over medium-high heat until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 13: Add shrimp and cook until pink, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 14: Pour wine into the pan and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 15: Add sausage, chicken stock, cumin, remaining 1 teaspoon pepper, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt; cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Add drained pasta and cilantro; toss to combine.
', 'Step 17: Serve immediately.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '572.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '45.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '135 mg', 'fatContent': '30 g', 'fiberContent': '2.4 g', 'proteinContent': '26 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '1030.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.5 g'}

Title: BREAKSTONE'S Halibut Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds halibut fillets', '1 ½ cups KRAFT Mexican Style Shredded Cheese, divided', "½ cup BREAKSTONE'S Reduced Fat Sour Cream", '½ cup MIRACLE WHIP Dressing', '½ cup chopped onions', '1 (2.25 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained, divided', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained', '1 (1.25 ounce) package TACO BELL® HOME ORIGINALS® Taco Seasoning Mix', '1 (19 ounce) can enchilada sauce, divided', '12 each flour tortillas', '1 cup shredded lettuce', '1 tomato, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Place fish in single layer in shallow baking dish.
', 'Step 2: Bake 25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.
', 'Step 3: Flake fish; place in medium bowl.
', 'Step 4: Stir in 1 cup cheese, sour cream, dressing, onions, 1/4 cup olives, chilies and seasoning mix.
', 'Step 5: Spoon down centers of tortillas; roll up.
', 'Step 6: Pour 1/2 the enchilada sauce onto bottom of 13x9-inch pan.
', 'Step 7: Top with enchiladas, seam-sides down.
', 'Step 8: Cover with remaining sauce and cheese.
', 'Step 9: Bake 25 to 35 minutes or until heated through.
', 'Step 10: Top with lettuce, tomatoes and remaining olives.
']

Title: Holy Guacamole Soup with Grilled Lemon-Jerk Chicken
Ingredients: ['1 cup fresh lemon juice', '1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', '1 clove garlic, minced', 'salt and freshly cracked black pepper to taste', '2 (10 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 tablespoon Jamaican jerk seasoning', '1 large lime, juiced', '2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '1 small red onion, diced, divided', '3 large cloves garlic, minced', '4 ripe avocados, chopped, divided', '½ cup fresh squeezed orange juice', '1 tablespoon chicken bouillon (such as Knorr®)', '1 ½ cups hot water', '2 limes, juiced', '3 ears fresh sweet corn kernels', '2 Roma tomatoes, chopped', '1 ½ cups chopped fresh cilantro', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 jalapeno chile, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine lemon juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and 1 clove garlic in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Season marinade with salt and pepper, keeping in mind that you will also use jerk seasoning on the chicken later.
', 'Step 3: Pound chicken with the flat side of a meat mallet or a rolling pin until about 1/2 inch thick, being careful not to pierce the meat.
', 'Step 4: Put chicken in a gallon-sized resealable plastic bag and add marinade.
', 'Step 5: Squish bag to coat chicken; marinate in the fridge for at least 3 hours, ideally overnight for the fullest flavor.
', 'Step 6: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle chicken with jerk seasoning and place on grill.
', 'Step 8: Grill chicken breasts until cooked through and juices run clear, about 4 minutes on each side.
', 'Step 9: Brush with juice of 1 lime immediately after coming off the grill.
', 'Step 10: Cool slightly and shred.
', 'Step 11: Cover and keep warm.
', 'Step 12: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large nonstick pan over medium heat until fragrant.
', 'Step 13: Add onion and 3 cloves garlic.
', 'Step 14: Cook until garlic is lightly browned and fragrant and onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Reduce heat to low and add 3 avocados.
', 'Step 16: Saute just until avocados are warm and edges are slightly browned.
', 'Step 17: Pour in orange juice and cook for 2 minutes, stirring once.
', 'Step 18: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 19: Combine hot water and chicken bouillon to make a broth.
', 'Step 20: Pour into a blender.
', 'Step 21: Add avocado mixture and juice of 2 limes; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 22: Pour into bowls and serve with the shredded chicken, sweet corn, tomatoes, remaining avocado, cilantro, Cheddar cheese, and jalapeno.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '851.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '53.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '117 mg', 'fatContent': '55.8 g', 'fiberContent': '19.5 g', 'proteinContent': '46.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '14.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '719.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '12.2 g'}

Title: Mexican-Inspired Stuffed Acorn Squash
Ingredients: ['2 (1 pound) acorn squash, halved and seeded', '1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste', '1 medium white onion, diced', '1 medium green bell pepper, chopped', '1 (16 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (16 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 cup frozen corn', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 teaspoon ground cumin, or to taste']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Fill a baking pan with 1/2 inch of water.

Title: Potato and Cheese Flautas
Ingredients: ['4 large potatoes, peeled and cubed', '1 cup shredded Chihuahua cheese', '1 tablespoon milk', '1 teaspoon salt', '24 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 cup oil for frying, or as needed']

['Step 1: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes.

['Step 1: Combine condensed milk, water, and cinnamon stick in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-low heat.

', 'Step 8: Remove from heat and fish out cinnamon stick.

', 'Step 10: n Cool completely, about 2 hours.

Title: Mexican-Inspired Watermelon Sorbet (Nieve de Sandia)
Ingredients: ['7 ½ cups seedless watermelon, chopped into chunks, divided', '1 ½ cups white sugar', '3 limes, juiced, or more to taste', '4 tablespoons chamoy (Mexican chili fruit condiment), or more to taste', '2 tablespoons chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place 2 1/2 cups watermelon into an electric blender and liquefy.
', 'Step 2: Transfer juice to a saucepan and add sugar and lime juice.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and let simmer until all sugar has dissolved, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Set aside and allow to cool, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Chill and store simple syrup in a closed glass jar in the refrigerator.
', 'Step 6: Place remaining watermelon chunks on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper and freeze until solid, about 4 hours.
', 'Step 7: Add frozen watermelon pieces, a few at a time, to the bowl of a food processor and puree.
', 'Step 8: Add 1/3 to 1/2 cup of the simple syrup mixture, followed by chamoy and chile-lime seasoning; process until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Serve right away or store in an airtight plastic container in the freezer.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Tacos with Chorizo and Saffron Yogurt Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 breast half, bone and skin removed (blank)s skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 cup chicken broth', '1 onion, chopped, or to taste', '2 each jalapeno peppers, minced, or to taste', '1 pound chorizo sausage', '2 cups plain Greek yogurt', '2 (.5 gram) packets saffron', '½ teaspoon vegetable oil, or as needed', '4 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '2 fruit (2" dia)s limes, cut into wedges']

Ingredients: ['¾ cup all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ cup butter or margarine, softened', '½ cup white sugar', '1 egg', '¾ cup mashed banana', '1 tablespoon canola oil', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 cup semisweet chocolate chips', '12 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '½ cup semisweet chocolate chips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a baking dish.
', 'Step 3: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; set aside.
', 'Step 4: Beat butter and sugar until creamy.
', 'Step 5: Beat in eggs one at a time, then add mashed banana, canola oil, and vanilla.
', 'Step 6: Fold in flour and 1 cup of chocolate chips.
', 'Step 7: Place a dollop of batter into each tortilla, then roll up in a cylinder to form an "enchilada"; place into prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Bake "enchiladas" in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 30 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Melt the remaining 1/2 cup of chocolate chips in a small bowl using the microwave.
', 'Step 10: Drizzle over the "enchiladas" as soon as they come out of the oven.
']

Title: Mexican Cold Pea Soup
Ingredients: ['2 (10 ounce) packages frozen peas, defrosted', '½ cup fresh lime juice', '2 cups plain yogurt', '½ cup olive oil', '4 cloves garlic, smashed', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 cups ice water', '2 tablespoons kosher salt', '¼ cup red bell pepper, chopped, or more to taste', '2 tablespoons chopped tomatoes, or to taste', '1 tablespoon chopped jalapeno pepper, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Puree peas in a food processor or blender, constantly scraping down the sides.
', 'Step 2: If peas are too dry, add a little of the lime juice.
', 'Step 3: Add remaining lime juice, yogurt, olive oil, garlic, and chili powder.
', 'Step 4: Blend until liquefied.
', 'Step 5: Pour into a large bowl; add ice water and salt and stir to incorporate.
', 'Step 6: Refrigerate until flavors combine, at least 4 to 6 hours.
', 'Step 7: Garnish each serving with red pepper, tomato, and jalapeno.
']

Title: Real Homemade Tamales
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ pounds pork loin', '1 large onion, halved', '1 clove garlic', '4 dried California chile pods', '2 cups water', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '2 cups masa harina', '1 (10.5 ounce) can beef broth', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '⅔ cup lard', '1 (8 ounce) package dried corn husks', '1 cup sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place pork into a Dutch oven with onion and garlic, and add water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer until the meat is cooked through, about 2 hours.
', 'Step 3: Use rubber gloves to remove stems and seeds from the chile pods.
', 'Step 4: Place chiles in a saucepan with 2 cups of water.
', 'Step 5: Simmer, uncovered, for 20 minutes, then remove from heat to cool.
', 'Step 6: Transfer the chiles and water to a blender and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Strain the mixture, stir in salt, and set aside.
', 'Step 8: Shred the cooked meat and mix in one cup of the chile sauce.
', 'Step 9: Soak the corn husks in a bowl of warm water.
', 'Step 10: In a large bowl, beat the lard with a tablespoon of the broth until fluffy.
', 'Step 11: Combine the masa harina, baking powder and salt; stir into the lard mixture, adding more broth as necessary to form a spongy dough.
', 'Step 12: Spread the dough out over the corn husks to 1/4 to 1/2 inch thickness.
', 'Step 13: Place one tablespoon of the meat filling into the center.
', 'Step 14: Fold the sides of the husks in toward the center and place in a steamer.
', 'Step 15: Steam for 1 hour.
', 'Step 16: Remove tamales from husks and drizzle remaining chile sauce over.
', 'Step 17: Top with sour cream.
', 'Step 18: For a creamy sauce, mix sour cream into the chile sauce.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '235.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '12.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '36.8 mg', 'fatContent': '16.6 g', 'fiberContent': '2.1 g', 'proteinContent': '9.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '401.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.4 g'}

Title: Green Chili and Cheese Chicken
Ingredients: ['4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts', '1 ½ cups shredded pepperjack cheese', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers, drained', '1 tablespoon dry fajita seasoning']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Coat a 9 inch square baking dish (or similar size) with cooking spray.
', "Step 3: Make a deep cut into the side of each chicken breast half to form a pocket or 'purse'.
", 'Step 4: Stuff 1/4 cup of cheese and about 1 tablespoon of the chilies onto each one.
', 'Step 5: Close, and secure with a toothpick so that the cheese does not escape while in the oven.
', 'Step 6: Place the stuffed chicken into the baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Season with Fajita seasoning, and then sprinkle the remaining cheese and chilies over the top.
', 'Step 8: Bake uncovered for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until the chicken juices run clear, and cheese is melted and lightly browned.
']

Title: Roasted Tomato Salsa
Ingredients: ['4 large Roma tomatoes, halved lengthwise', '2 medium jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise', '½ medium white onion, coarsely chopped', '1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 medium lime, juiced', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set an oven rack about 10 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler for 5 minutes.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with foil.
', 'Step 3: Spread tomatoes and jalapenos, skin-side up, on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Add onion.
', 'Step 5: Drizzle with a little olive oil and season lightly with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 6: Cook under the broiler for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from the oven and let cool.
', 'Step 8: Remove stems from tomatoes and jalapenos.
', 'Step 9: Transfer to a blender with onions and all roasting juices.
', 'Step 10: Add lime juice and more salt, to taste.
', 'Step 11: Pulse to blend.
', 'Step 12: Transfer to a serving bowl and mix in cilantro.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Tacos al Pastor
Ingredients: ['3 pounds pork butt, cut into 2-inch cubes', '2 cups pineapple juice', '¼ cup white vinegar', '1 medium orange, juiced', '1 medium lime, juiced', '1 cup chopped onion', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon cumin', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 (1.41 ounce) package sazon seasoning with achiote', 'vegetable oil as needed', '20 ounces pineapple chunks, drained', '12 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '½ cup chopped red onion', 'pico de gallo salsa', '1 medium avocado, diced', '⅛ cup chopped cilantro', '1 lime, cut into wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place pork in a large lidded container.
', 'Step 2: Combine pineapple juice, vinegar, orange juice, lime juice, onion, garlic, chipotle peppers, chili powder, cumin, salt, pepper, and sazon in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Pour sauce over the pork and make sure all chunks of meat are covered.
', 'Step 4: Seal the container and marinate for at least 8 hours or up to 24 hours.
', 'Step 5: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 6: Add vegetable oil and heat until hot.
', 'Step 7: Add chunks of marinated pork and brown on all sides, reserving extra sauce, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: You may need to work in batches depending on the size of your Instant Pot®.
', 'Step 9: Turn off Saute mode and pour reserved sauce over the pork.
', 'Step 10: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 11: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 35 minutes.
", 'Step 12: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 13: Release pressure first using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 10 minutes.
", "Step 14: Release remaining pressure using the manufacturer's quick release method, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 15: Unlock and remove the lid.
', "Step 16: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 17: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 18: Remove the pork chunks from the pot using tongs or a slotted spoon, and place them on the baking sheet.
', 'Step 19: Reserve the sauce in the Instant Pot® for now.
', 'Step 20: Use forks to coarsely shred the pork, removing and discarding any excess fatty chunks.
', 'Step 21: Spread meat out evenly on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 22: Add pineapple chunks to the baking sheet with the meat, then place the baking sheet under the broiler.
', 'Step 23: Broil until the tips of the meat and pineapple are beginning to get a little brown and crispy, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Remove from the oven.
', 'Step 25: Use a spoon to drizzle the reserved sauce from the Instant Pot® over the meat to moisten it and add some more of the marinade flavor.
', 'Step 26: Create tacos by portioning the pork and pineapple chunks on flour tortillas.
', 'Step 27: Add chopped red onion, pico de gallo salsa, avocado, and cilantro.
', 'Step 28: Garnish with lime wedges.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '431.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '54.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '42.6 mg', 'fatContent': '14.1 g', 'fiberContent': '4.7 g', 'proteinContent': '21.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '1338.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '14 g'}

Title: Baked Chicken and Cheese Flautas
Ingredients: ['2 ½ cups shredded cooked chicken', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '¼ cup green salsa (such as Herdez®)', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '12 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat a skillet over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 3: Add chicken, chilies, salsa, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, heat 2 to 3 tortillas at a time in a microwave until soft and pliable, 20 to 25 seconds.
', 'Step 7: Continue with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 8: Lay a tortilla on a work surface.
', 'Step 9: Add some chicken mixture in a line, towards one end of the tortilla, and top with some cheese.
', 'Step 10: Roll tightly, being careful not to tear the tortilla.
', 'Step 11: Secure with two toothpicks.
', 'Step 12: Repeat until all tortillas, chicken, and cheese are used.
', 'Step 13: Transfer tortillas to a baking dish.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven for 7 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Flip and continue to bake until golden, about 7 minutes more.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 pound lean ground beef', '10 (6 inch) corn tortillas, quartered', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 ¼ cups water', '1 (12 ounce) jar chunky salsa', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '4 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Crumble the ground beef into a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir until evenly browned.
', 'Step 3: Add taco seasoning and water; simmer for 15 minutes over low heat.
', 'Step 4: In a medium bowl, stir together the salsa, cream of mushroom soup and cream of chicken soup.
', 'Step 5: Mix in most of the cheese, reserving 3/4 cup for later.
', 'Step 6: Place a layer of tortillas covering the bottom of a slow cooker.
', 'Step 7: Scoop a layer of the ground beef over that, and then spoon a layer of the cheese mixture.
', 'Step 8: Repeat the layers until you run out of stuff, ending with a layer of tortillas on the top.
', 'Step 9: Top with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 10: Cover, and cook on High for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
']

Title: Mexican-Inspired Chicken and Gnocchi Corn Chowder
Ingredients: ['¼ cup butter', '1 large yellow onion, thinly sliced', '1 anaheim pepper, raw', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground paprika', '¼ teaspoon ground thyme', '⅓ cup all-purpose flour', '3 cups chicken broth', '2 cups half-and-half', '¾ pound cubed, cooked chicken', '1 ½ cups canned whole kernel corn, drained', '1 large tomato, diced', '2 large carrots, sliced', '3 peppers dried red chile peppers, chopped', '1 (16 ounce) package gnocchi']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onion, Anaheim pepper, garlic, chili powder, black pepper, salt, red pepper flakes, oregano, cumin, paprika, and thyme.
', 'Step 3: Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir flour into the skillet until thoroughly combined; cook and stir until mixture becomes paste-like and light golden brown, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Gradually whisk in chicken broth and half-and-half, and bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 6: Add chicken, corn, tomato, carrots, and dried chile peppers.
', 'Step 7: Cook, stirring often, until heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add gnocchi and cook until it floats to the top, about 2 minutes.
']

Title: Vegetarian Enchilada Casserole with Kale and Sweet Potatoes

Title: Spicy Steamed Chicken in Parchment
Ingredients: ['2 dried ancho chile peppers', '2 dried chipotle chile peppers', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '3 cloves garlic, peeled', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', 'sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '4 chicken breasts with bones', '4 chicken thighs with bones', '4 sheets parchment paper', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer, or as needed', '12 ounces water, or as needed', '2 cups cooked rice', '2 tablespoons fresh cilantro leaves, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Reconstitute dried ancho chile peppers by placing in a bowl, covering with boiling water, and letting sit for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Do the same with the chipotle chile peppers, but give them 15 minutes to sit.
', 'Step 3: Remove ancho chile peppers from the water, remove seeds and veins, and cut into small strips.
', 'Step 4: Remove chipotle chile peppers from the water and remove stems, leaving peppers whole.
', 'Step 5: Combine ancho chiles, chipotle chiles, tomato sauce, and garlic in a blender and process until fairly smooth.
', 'Step 6: While mixing, add cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper to the marinade and blend.
', 'Step 7: Place chicken breasts and thighs in a large bowl and cover with marinade.
', 'Step 8: Cover and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 9: Divide chicken and sauce evenly onto 4 sheets of parchment paper and tie closed with string.
', 'Step 10: Pour equal amounts of beer and water into a saucepan and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 11: Add a bamboo steamer and place parchment packets inside.
', 'Step 12: Steam until chicken is no longer pink at the bone and juices run clear, about 35 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Serve chicken with hot cooked rice and garnish with cilantro.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '484.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '17.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '162.1 mg', 'fatContent': '18.3 g', 'fiberContent': '1.7 g', 'proteinContent': '56.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5 g', 'sodiumContent': '332 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.2 g'}

Title: Pork and Corn Tacos with Cilantro-Lime Crema
Ingredients: ['1 medium lime', '2 medium shallots, thinly sliced', '1 medium jalapeno pepper, thinly sliced, or to taste', '½ teaspoon white sugar', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ cup sour cream', '½ medium lime, juiced', '2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', '½ teaspoon ancho chile powder', '1 teaspoon water, or as needed', '1 (16 ounce) package frozen corn kernels', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 teaspoon ancho chile powder', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon salted butter', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 pounds ground pork', '4 teaspoons ancho chile powder', '4 teaspoons taco seasoning', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chicken bouillon powder', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '¼ cup water', '8 (6 inch) warm corn tortillas, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Prepare pickled vegetables: zest and juice the lime.
', 'Step 2: Set zest aside for cilantro-lime crema.
', 'Step 3: Combine lime juice with shallots, jalapeno, sugar, and salt in a small bowl; set aside.
', 'Step 4: Stir occasionally while preparing the rest of the meal.
', 'Step 5: Prepare cilantro-lime crema: combine reserved lime zest with sour cream, lime juice, cilantro, and ancho chili powder in a small bowl.
', 'Step 6: Add water, a little at a time, until crema has a pourable consistency.
', 'Step 7: Refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 8: Prepare charred corn: place frozen corn in a microwave-safe bowl; microwave on high until thawed, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Spread corn between two paper towels and blot to dry.
', 'Step 10: Heat a large dry pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 11: Spread corn evenly in the pan and roast until browned on the bottom, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Stir and continue to cook until charred on all sides, 5 to 7 minutes more.
', 'Step 13: Transfer to a serving bowl.
', 'Step 14: Prepare pork tacos: combine butter and olive oil in the same pan over medium-high heat until butter has melted.
', 'Step 15: Cook and stir pork in the hot pan until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Stir in 4 teaspoons chile powder, taco seasoning, garlic powder, cumin, bouillon powder, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 17: Add water and cook until liquid has reduced and mixture has thickened, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Taste and adjust spices as needed.
', 'Step 19: While the liquid is reducing, drain the pickling juice from the vegetables and pour it into the corn.
', 'Step 20: Stir in 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 teaspoon chile powder, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 21: Fill warm tortillas with pork and corn.
', 'Step 22: Top with pickled vegetables and drizzle with crema.
']

Title: Vegan Tacos with Mushrooms and Tomatillos
Ingredients: ['15 tomatillos, husked and halved', '2 dried chile de arbol peppers', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '18 ounces cremini mushrooms, sliced', 'salt to taste', '9 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '½ onion, chopped', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

', 'Step 16: Divide mushroom mixture amongst tortillas and top with chopped onion and cilantro.
']

Title: Chipotle Mushroom and Cheese Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '½ onion, diced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '10 mushrooms, sliced small', '1 jalapeno pepper, diced', '1 (7 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 (19 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas, or more to taste', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add onion and garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add mushrooms and jalapeno pepper.
', 'Step 5: Add 1 spoonful of chipotle sauce from the can.
', 'Step 6: Cook, stirring frequently, over medium-low heat until mushrooms are soft and have shrunk in size, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 8: Pour enchilada sauce into a bowl and add 2 to 3 chipotle peppers.
', 'Step 9: Smash the peppers into enchilada sauce using the side of a spoon and mix into the sauce.
', 'Step 10: Pour a small amount of the combined sauce into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish, just enough to coat the bottom.
', 'Step 11: Heat each tortilla in a frying pan or directly over a burner until soft and warm, about 30 seconds each.
', 'Step 12: Lay a warm tortilla on a work surface and add a spoonful of cooked mushroom mixture to the center.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle Cheddar cheese on top and roll up tortilla tightly.
', 'Step 14: Place in the pan and repeat with remaining tortillas, packing enchiladas tightly side-by-side.
', 'Step 15: Pour remaining sauce on top and sprinkle with remaining Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbling, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Serve hot.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '340.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '34 g', 'cholesterolContent': '29.7 mg', 'fatContent': '17.8 g', 'fiberContent': '5.8 g', 'proteinContent': '12.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '580.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.1 g'}

Title: Beef, Chorizo, and Chile Flautas
Ingredients: ['7 peppers Anaheim chile peppers', '2 pounds ground chuck', '⅓ pound bulk chorizo sausage', '¼ cup canola oil, or as needed', '2 ½ (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles light beer', '¾ cup salsa', '2 tablespoons ground ancho chile powder', '2 tablespoons garlic powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon onion powder', '1 tablespoon sea salt', '1 teaspoon dried marjoram', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '24 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Colby-Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Place peppers, cut-sides down, onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Roast peppers in the preheated oven until the skins are brown and crispy, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Place blackened peppers into a bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 6: Allow peppers to steam as they cool, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove and discard skins.
', 'Step 8: Dice flesh and set aside.
', 'Step 9: Combine ground chuck and chorizo in a bowl, kneading together as evenly as possible.
', 'Step 10: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Add meat and cook and stir until browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Strain out 90% of the grease.
', 'Step 13: Stir beer, salsa, chile powder, garlic powder, cumin, onion powder, salt, marjoram, black pepper, and cayenne into the meat.
', 'Step 14: Stir in 1/2 of the diced chile peppers.
', 'Step 15: Crank up the heat and bring to a boil.
', "Step 16: Reduce heat to low and simmer until most of the liquid has disappeared, about 2 hours; don't let all the liquid evaporate or you'll have dry meat.
", 'Step 17: Brush one side of a tortilla with some of the remaining canola oil.
', 'Step 18: On the dry side, about 1/2 inch from one side of the tortilla, spoon a line of beef and chorizo, sprinkle with Colby-Jack cheese, and top with some diced chile peppers.
', 'Step 19: Roll the loaded side over multiple times until the tortilla is in a tight roll.
', 'Step 20: Make sure it is tight by tucking the first rotation up under the meat.
', 'Step 21: Set rolled tortilla seam-side down on the wire rack of an air fryer.
', 'Step 22: Repeat with remaining tortillas.
', "Step 23: Preheat an air fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions.
", 'Step 24: Fry in the preheated air fryer for 6 minutes.
', 'Step 25: Serve immediately.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '685.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '63.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '77.9 mg', 'fatContent': '32.1 g', 'fiberContent': '4.2 g', 'proteinContent': '30.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '12.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '1512.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.4 g'}

Title: Corn Tortillas
Ingredients: ['1 ¾ cups masa harina', '1 ⅛ cups water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a medium bowl, mix together masa harina and hot water until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 2: Turn dough onto a clean surface and knead until pliable and smooth.
', 'Step 3: If dough is too sticky, add more masa harina; if it begins to dry out, sprinkle with water.
', 'Step 4: Cover dough tightly with plastic wrap and allow to stand for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Preheat a cast iron skillet or griddle to medium-high.
', 'Step 6: Divide dough into 15 equal-size balls.
', 'Step 7: Using a tortilla press, a rolling pin, or your hands, press each ball of dough flat between two sheets of plastic wrap.
', 'Step 8: Immediately place tortilla in preheated pan and allow to cook for approximately 30 seconds, or until browned and slightly puffy.
', 'Step 9: Turn tortilla over to brown on second side for approximately 30 seconds more, then transfer to a plate.
', 'Step 10: Repeat process with each ball of dough.
', 'Step 11: Keep tortillas covered with a towel to stay warm and moist until ready to serve.
']

Title: Chef Julian's Smoked Tuna Tacos
Ingredients: ['½ cup brown sugar', '¼ cup sea salt', '1 pound ahi tuna', '2 cups masa corn flour', '1 ¼ cups water, or as needed', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 cup tomatillos, husked', '1 onion, halved', '2 jalapeno peppers', '1 pinch salt to taste', '4 tomatoes, diced', '2 avocados, diced', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '3 limes, juiced', '½ head cabbage, shredded', '½ (12 ounce) package queso fresco, crumbled']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat a smoker to 225 degrees F (110 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions.
", 'Step 2: Mix brown sugar and 1/4 cup salt together in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Score ahi tuna skin with a sharp knife; rub with brown sugar and salt mixture.
', 'Step 4: Smoke tuna until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads 140 degrees F to 155 degrees F (60 degrees C to 68 degrees C), about 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Mix masa corn flour and water together in a bowl until a slightly sticky dough forms.
', 'Step 6: Divide dough into large balls.
', 'Step 7: Heat a lightly oiled griddle over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 8: Flatten balls of masa to 1/4-inch thickness and cook until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
', 'Step 9: Cool sopes on a wire rack.
', 'Step 10: Preheat a grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 11: Place tomatillos, half the onion, and 1 jalapeno pepper on the grill; cook until charred on all sides, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Transfer to a blender; blend into a smooth sauce.
', 'Step 13: Season with salt.
', 'Step 14: Dice remaining onion and jalapeno.
', 'Step 15: Mix with tomatoes, avocados, and cilantro in a bowl.
', 'Step 16: Season with lime juice and salt.
', 'Step 17: Place cooked sopes on serving plates.
', 'Step 18: Top with smoked tuna, tomatillo sauce, and avocado mixture.
', 'Step 19: Garnish with shredded cabbage and queso fresco.
']

Title: Delicious Pulled Chicken Taco Filling

Title: Grilled Chipotle Tenderloin

']

Title: Half-Baked Taco Salad
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon sea salt', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 pound 93% lean ground beef', '½ cup water', '1 (15 ounce) can no salt-added kidney beans', '4 tomatoes', '2 heads romaine lettuce, chopped', '4 large green bell peppers, sliced', '1 ounce finely grated Parmesan cheese', '4 ounces coarsely grated extra-sharp Cheddar cheese', '1 cup salsa']

Title: Molletes

Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons vegetable oil', '2 cups tomato sauce', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '3 cups thinly sliced zucchini', '2 cups crispy tortilla strips', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 cup frozen corn kernels, thawed', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles, drained', '1 cup sour cream, or to taste', '3 medium green onions, chopped']

Title: Charro Beans (Frijoles Charros)
Ingredients: ['4 hocks smoked ham hocks', '1 white onion', '6 slices thick-cut bacon, cut into chunks', '½ pound fresh chorizo sausage', '2 medium whole (2-3/5" dia) (blank)s tomatoes, chopped', '2 each jalapeno peppers, sliced', '5 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans, undrained', '4 cups water as needed', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 teaspoon chicken bouillon granules', '1 pinch salt to taste']

', 'Step 13: Add water to cover and bring to a boil over medium or medium-high heat.
', 'Step 14: Meanwhile, heat bacon grease in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 15: Add chorizo and vegetable mixture and saute until vegetables are soft, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 16: When beans boil, add the remaining onion half and garlic.
', 'Step 17: Let boil for 3 to 4 minutes; add sauteed vegetables and meat.
', 'Step 18: Return to a boil; add cilantro and chicken bouillon.
', 'Step 19: Continue to boil for 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Remove bones, season with salt, and serve.

Title: Tiny Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '⅓ cup finely diced onion', '1 pound ground beef', '1 teaspoon kosher salt, or to taste', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground dried chipotle pepper', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '⅛ teaspoon dried oregano', '2 pinches cayenne pepper', '2 teaspoons tomato paste', '½ cup water', '2 tablespoons minced jalapeno peppers', '15 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 cup grated Monterey Jack cheese', '1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Add oil, onion, and ground beef to a cast iron skillet set over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add salt, chili powder, cumin, chipotle, garlic powder, black pepper, oregano, and cayenne.
', 'Step 3: Break beef apart with a spatula to mix in spices; cook until browned and crumbled into very small pieces, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in tomato paste and water and return to a simmer.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in jalapeno peppers and cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 7: Turn off the heat, taste, and adjust seasoning.
', 'Step 8: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Stack up 2 or 3 corn tortillas at a time and use a 2-inch round pastry cutter to cut 4 small circles out of each stack, making 60 total.
', 'Step 10: Place circles in a single layer, 1/2 inch apart, on sheet pans.
', 'Step 11: Mix Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheeses together.
', 'Step 12: Top each tortilla circle with cheese, using the pastry cutter to keep it from spilling onto the pan.
', 'Step 13: Repeat with remaining tortillas and cheese.
', 'Step 14: Top each with about 1 teaspoon taco beef and another teaspoon cheese.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese melts, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Remove from the oven.
', 'Step 17: Carefully fold each tortilla in half, being careful not to press out the filling.
', 'Step 18: Allow to cool for a few minutes, then chill in the refrigerator until firm, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Heat vegetable oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 20: Working in batches and adding more oil as necessary, pan-fry tacos until crispy and heated through and the edges are a bit caramelized, about 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 21: Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
']

Title: Spicy Breakfast Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 (4 ounce) links spicy pork breakfast sausage', '3 large eggs', '2 tablespoons milk', '3 tablespoons chopped green onions', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '4 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '2 tablespoons nacho cheese sauce, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Spray a skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 2: Add sausages and cook, turning often, until cooked through and browned, 12 to 16 minutes.
', 'Step 3: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Remove sausages from the skillet and chop when cool enough to handle.
', 'Step 5: Beat eggs in a small bowl with milk.
', 'Step 6: Spray a small skillet with cooking spray and set over low heat.
', 'Step 7: Add the beaten eggs, green onions, salt, and pepper; cook until edges are set, then gently turn with a spatula until scrambled, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove eggs to a plate and wipe out the skillet with a paper towel.
', 'Step 9: Place 1 tortilla in the skillet over low heat.
', 'Step 10: Top with 1/2 of the nacho cheese sauce, 1/2 of the chopped sausage, and 1/2 of the scrambled eggs.
', 'Step 11: Top with another tortilla and cook, carefully turning once, just until lightly browned on both sides, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove to a plate and repeat to cook remaining quesadilla.
']

Title: Oven Roasted Parmesan Corn on the Cob
Ingredients: ['5 ears corn, husks and silk removed', '½ cup mayonnaise', '1 cup shredded Parmesan cheese', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cut 5 squares of aluminum foil 1 1/2 times the size of the ears of corn; place each ear of corn in the center of a piece of foil.
', 'Step 3: Stir mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, chili powder, ground black pepper, and fresh parsley together in a bowl until it forms a thick paste; rub about 2 tablespoons of the paste over each ear of corn.
', 'Step 4: Wrap the aluminum foil around the corn and seal.
', 'Step 5: Arrange corn on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 6: Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes, turn, and continue baking another 10 minutes.
']

Title: Fiesta Sweet Potato Soup
Ingredients: ['1 (32 fluid ounce) container vegetable broth', '4 cups peeled and cubed sweet potatoes', '1 (15 ounce) can reduced-sodium black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 cup mild picante sauce', '1 (12 ounce) jar roasted red peppers, coarsely chopped', '¼ cup chopped cilantro', '1 tablespoon smoked paprika', '2 medium limes, juiced']

['Step 1: Combine vegetable broth and sweet potatoes in a pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil and cook until sweet potatoes are softened, about 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, combine black beans and picante sauce in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Add the black bean mixture and roasted red peppers to the soup.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat.
', 'Step 6: Add cilantro, smoked paprika, and lime juice.
', 'Step 7: Stir soup and cook until heated through, 5 to 7 minutes.
']

Title: Non-Dairy Horchata
Ingredients: ['¾ cup basmati rice', '6 cardamom pods, seeds removed and crushed', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, or more to taste', '⅓ cup peeled, slivered almonds', '5 cups water', '¼ cup white sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place rice in a blender and grind to a fine texture.
', 'Step 2: Transfer to a large pitcher.
', 'Step 3: Add crushed cardamom and cinnamon.
', 'Step 4: n Grind almonds and 1/3 cup water together in the blender.
', 'Step 5: Add to rice mixture in the pitcher.
', 'Step 6: Add 4 cups water and stir.
', 'Step 7: Cover pitcher and let horchata sit 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 8: n Transfer horchata to the blender and add sugar.
', 'Step 9: Blend, gradually adding 2/3 cup water, until smooth.
', 'Step 10: Pour mixture through cheesecloth into a separate container, squeezing gently to extract the milk.
', 'Step 11: Refrigerate horchata 15 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Albuquerque Delight
Ingredients: ['1 (14 ounce) can refried beans', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '3 avocados - peeled, pitted, and mashed', '2 teaspoons lemon juice', '2 tablespoons minced onion', '1 dash garlic salt', '1 cup sour cream', '1 cup chopped green chile peppers', '½ pound shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '½ pound shredded mild Cheddar cheese', '2 medium fresh tomatoes, chopped', '1 (2.25 ounce) can pitted black olives, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix the refried beans and taco seasoning mix, and spread over the bottom of a large pie dish.
', 'Step 2: Mix mashed avocados with lemon juice, onion, and garlic salt, and spread over the beans.
', 'Step 3: Layer with sour cream, green chile peppers, Monterey Jack cheese, and Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 4: Top with tomatoes, and garnish with olives.
', 'Step 5: Chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Tinga Tostadas
Ingredients: ['2 peppers dried ancho chile peppers', '2 large tomatoes, cored', '4 teaspoons olive oil, divided', '1 medium roasted red pepper', '1 medium onion, finely chopped, divided', '4 cloves garlic, whole', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '3 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '4 each crispy tostada shells']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler to low.
", 'Step 2: Stem and seed chile peppers.
', 'Step 3: Place peppers in a bowl and cover with boiling water.
', 'Step 4: Soak for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain, reserving 1/2 cup soaking water.
', 'Step 6: Rub tomatoes with 1 teaspoon oil and place in a baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Broil tomatoes in the preheated oven until they are starting to split and sizzle, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove from the oven.
', 'Step 9: Place chile peppers, reserved soaking water, tomatoes, roasted red pepper, 1/2 of the onion, whole garlic cloves, oregano, and cumin in a blender.
', 'Step 10: Blend on medium or high speed until very smooth.
', 'Step 11: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®), add remaining 3 teaspoons oil, and select Saute function.
', 'Step 12: Add remaining onion and saute until tender and starting to turn brown, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Add minced garlic and saute for 1 minute.
', 'Step 14: Pour in blended sauce.
', 'Step 15: Add chicken, ensuring it is covered by the sauce.
', 'Step 16: Cancel Saute function.
', 'Step 17: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 18: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 18 minutes.
", 'Step 19: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 20: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 21: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 22: Select Saute function.
', 'Step 23: Shred chicken and cook until sauce is thick and combined with meat, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 25: Serve on tostada shells.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '266.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '20.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '54.7 mg', 'fatContent': '10.4 g', 'fiberContent': '4.2 g', 'proteinContent': '24 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '182.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.3 g'}

Title: Arroz a la Mexicana
Ingredients: ['1 medium white onion', '2 medium jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded', '2 cloves garlic', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 tablespoons Country Crock® Spread', '1 cup uncooked parboiled (converted) rice', '1 cup frozen peas and carrots', 'Salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In food processor or blender, process onion, peppers, garlic, tomato paste, 1/4 cup water, and salt until smooth; set aside.
', 'Step 2: In 12-inch skillet, melt Country Crock® Spread over medium-high heat and cook rice, stirring occasionally, 2 minutes or until golden.
', 'Step 3: Stir in remaining 2 1/4 cups water, green peas and carrots, and onion mixture.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, 20 minutes or until rice is tender.
', 'Step 6: Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
', 'Step 7: Season, if desired, with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Chili and Rice Casserole
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons salted butter', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 cup shredded rotisserie chicken', '1 (15.25 ounce) can Mexican-style corn, drained', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chili-seasoned diced tomatoes', '1 cup instant brown rice, uncooked', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 cup salsa']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add onion and cook and stir until tender, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add shredded chicken and cook until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour chicken mixture into a casserole dish.
', 'Step 6: Add corn, beans, tomatoes, rice, chiles, cumin, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Mix all ingredients together in the pan and spread to cover the dish.
', 'Step 8: Spread salsa evenly over the top.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Serve in bowls.
']

Title: Turkey Chilaquiles
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 ½ cups chopped red onion, divided', '2 cups diced cooked turkey', '2 (7 ounce) cans diced green chiles', '3 cups salsa', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '4 cups tortilla chips', '2 cups crumbled queso fresco', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ cup Mexican crema, or to taste']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Add 1 1/4 cups onion; saute until onion begins to soften, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add turkey and chiles; saute for 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in salsa and simmer until heated through, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Stir in tortilla chips.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle queso fresco on top.
', 'Step 9: Transfer skillet to the oven and bake just until cheese melts, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle remaining onion and cilantro over chilaquiles.
', 'Step 11: Drizzle with crema before serving.
']

Title: Pepperidge Farm® Southwestern Strudel
Ingredients: ['1 sheet Pepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry', '1 egg', '1 tablespoon water', '1 ½ cups chopped cooked chicken', '1 cup shredded Colby-Jack cheese', '1 (11 ounce) can Mexican-style corn, drained', '½ cup fresh bread crumbs', '1 cup Pace® Picante Sauce', '2 teaspoons chopped fresh parsley', '1 (5 ounce) package mixed salad greens', '6 tablespoons Sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Thaw the pastry sheet at room temperature for 40 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Stir the egg and water in a small bowl with a fork.
', 'Step 3: Stir the chicken, cheese, corn, bread crumbs and picante sauce in a medium bowl.
', 'Step 4: Unfold the pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.
', 'Step 5: Roll the pastry sheet into a 16x12-inch rectangle.
', 'Step 6: With the short side facing you, spoon the chicken mixture onto the bottom half of the pastry sheet to within 1-inch of the edges.
', 'Step 7: Starting at the short side, roll up like a jellyroll.
', 'Step 8: Place the pastry roll seam-side down on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 9: Tuck the ends under to seal.
', 'Step 10: Brush with the egg mixture and sprinkle with the parsley.
', 'Step 11: Cut 2-inch slits 2 inches apart on the top.
', 'Step 12: Bake for 30 minutes or until the pastry is golden.
', 'Step 13: Slice and serve warm on the salad greens with the sour cream, if desired.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '430.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '30 g', 'cholesterolContent': '85.3 mg', 'fatContent': '25.2 g', 'fiberContent': '4 g', 'proteinContent': '21 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '11 g', 'sodiumContent': '958.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.1 g'}

Title: Mexican Christmas Punch (Ponche Navideno)
Ingredients: ['12 whole cloves', '2 navel oranges', '6 Mexican hawthorns (tejocotes)', '12 cups water', '¼ cup dried hibiscus petals (flor de jamaica)', '3 cinnamon sticks', '2 Granny Smith apples, sliced', '1 sugar cane stick, cut into 4-inch pieces', '1 pear, sliced', '½ cup packed dark brown sugar', '12 fluid ounces rum']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Stud each orange with 6 whole cloves, using the pointed ends of the cloves to pierce the skin.
', 'Step 2: Cut oranges into wedges.
', 'Step 3: Reserve 12 wedges for garnish.
', 'Step 4: Cut some slits into each hawthorn.
', 'Step 5: n Bring water, hibiscus petals, and cinnamon sticks to a boil over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat and simmer until water is a deep pink color, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: n Remove hibiscus petals but leave cinnamon sticks in the water to infuse further.
', 'Step 8: Stir in orange wedges, hawthorns, apples, sugar cane, pear, and brown sugar.
', 'Step 9: Simmer, stirring occasionally, for at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 10: n Ladle the punch into 12 mugs, making sure each mug gets some slices of fruit.
', 'Step 11: Add 1 fluid ounce rum to each mug to give the punch an extra kick.
', 'Step 12: Garnish mugs with reserved orange slices.
']

Title: Watermelon Vidalia® Salsa
Ingredients: ['2 cups diced watermelon', '1 cup chopped sweet onion (such as Vidalia®)', '1 serrano chile pepper, diced', '1 serrano chile pepper, seeded and diced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ teaspoon coarse salt', '2 pinches garlic powder']

Title: Homemade Green Enchilada Sauce with Tomatillos
Ingredients: ['8 cups water', '2 tomatoes, halved', '12 jalapeno peppers, stems removed', '1 large white onion, quartered', '10 tomatillos, halved', '8 serrano peppers, stems removed', '6 cloves garlic, peeled', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine water, tomatoes, jalapeno peppers, onion, tomatillos, serrano peppers, and garlic in a large pot.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat and cook until vegetables are fork-tender, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Transfer the vegetables to a blender with a slotted spoon, allowing the cooking liquid to drain back into the pot.
', 'Step 5: Cover the blender and hold the lid down with a potholder; pulse a few times to combine.
', 'Step 6: Blend until smooth, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Season sauce with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Mashed Potato and Poblano Flautas
Ingredients: ['2 medium russet potatoes, scrubbed', 'nonstick cooking spray', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '1 small poblano pepper, diced', '½ medium onion, diced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon whole cumin seeds', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon unsweetened almond milk', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas, warmed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Prick potatoes several times with a fork and place onto a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are easily pierced with a fork, 50 minutes to 1 hour.
', 'Step 4: Remove potatoes from the oven and allow to cool, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Reduce oven temperature to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Peel away and discard potato skins.
', 'Step 7: Transfer potato flesh to a large bowl.
', 'Step 8: Lightly spray a nonstick baking sheet with cooking spray.
', 'Step 9: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Saute poblano and onion until the onion is translucent, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add garlic, cumin seeds, salt, and pepper; saute for 4 more minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 13: Add onion mixture to the cooked potato.
', 'Step 14: Add almond milk and mash well.
', 'Step 15: Some visible chunks are fine.
', 'Step 16: Place 2 tablespoons of potato filling in a tortilla and roll it up tightly.
', 'Step 17: Place flauta on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 18: Repeat with remaining filling and tortillas.
', 'Step 19: Lightly spray the flautas with cooking spray.
', 'Step 20: Bake in the preheated oven until the edges of the tortillas are brown and crispy, 10 to 12 minutes, turning the pan halfway through for even cooking.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '276.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '56.4 g', 'fatContent': '3.7 g', 'fiberContent': '8 g', 'proteinContent': '7.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '628.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.4 g'}

Title: Slow Cooker Carne Picada
Ingredients: ['¼ cup flour', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon sea salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 ½ pounds round steak, cut into strips', '2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '1 small onion, diced', '2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with green chiles (such as Rotel®)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine flour, paprika, salt, pepper, and garlic powder in a large bowl, mix to combine.
', 'Step 2: Toss meat in flour mixture until well coated.
', 'Step 3: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Sear meat until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Depending on the size of your skillet, you might need to sear the meat in batches.
', 'Step 6: Remove from skillet.
', 'Step 7: Add onion, scraping off all the browned bits, and sautè until softened and translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add meat, onions, and diced tomatoes, undrained, into a slow cooker; mix to combine.
', 'Step 9: Cook on Low until meat is tender and flavors have combined, 2 to 3 hours.
']

Title: Vegan Yuca Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds frozen yuca', '1 cup frozen corn', '1 medium green bell pepper, diced', '1 medium onion, diced', 'salt to taste', '1 (16 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '3 tablespoons olive oil, divided, or as needed', '10 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '10 toothpicks']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place yuca into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain.
', 'Step 4: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 5: Combine corn, bell pepper, and onion in an aluminum pan.
', 'Step 6: Add 1 tablespoon olive oil, or enough to coat the vegetables and the bottom of the pan.
', 'Step 7: Cook on the grill, stirring every 5 minutes, until pepper is tender and onion is translucent, 10 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 9: Mash yuca and black beans together in a large bowl until smooth and well blended, adding about 1 tablespoon olive oil as needed.
', 'Step 10: Add the grilled vegetables; mix well, kneading by hand if necessary.
', 'Step 11: Warm tortillas in the microwave, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
', 'Step 12: Add equal amounts of the yuca mixture to the tortillas.
', 'Step 13: Fold each taco in half over the filling and secure with a toothpick.
', 'Step 14: Paint the top of each tortilla with remaining olive oil.
', 'Step 15: Place the tacos on a grill topper.
', 'Step 16: Grill for about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Remove from heat and remove the toothpicks.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '235.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '42.6 g', 'fatContent': '5.1 g', 'fiberContent': '6.4 g', 'proteinContent': '7.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '207.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.3 g'}

Title: S.O.B. (South of the Border) Casserole
Ingredients: ['½ pound ground turkey', '¼ cup chopped onion', '1 (16 ounce) can stewed tomatoes, undrained', '1 (.75 ounce) packet brown gravy mix', '1 teaspoon chili powder, or to taste', '½ cup frozen corn kernels', '½ cup uncooked elbow macaroni', '1 cup shredded lettuce', '3 tablespoons sour cream', '2 cups corn tortilla chips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring a small saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Add macaroni and cook until almost tender, about 6 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Crumble the turkey in a large skillet set over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir until evenly brown; drain.
', 'Step 6: Add onion to browned turkey meat and cook until onion is tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in tomatoes, gravy mix and chili powder until combined then mix in the corn and macaroni.
', 'Step 8: Cover; reduce heat to low and simmer, for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 9: Serve on a bed of tortilla chips topped with shredded lettuce and sour cream.
']
