Title: Pollo en Salsa
Ingredients: ['3 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 (14.5 ounce) can petite diced tomatoes in juice', '½ (24 ounce) jar chipotle salsa', '1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '1 cup sour cream', 'salt to taste', '4 cups steamed white rice', '½ cup shredded Mexican-style cheese blend', '1 medium avocado, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken in a slow cooker.
', 'Step 2: Combine diced tomatoes with juice, chipotle salsa, and condensed soup in a bowl; pour over chicken.
', 'Step 3: Cover and cook on Low until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 6 to 8 hours.
', 'Step 4: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Remove chicken from the sauce, shred, then return to the sauce.
', 'Step 6: Simmer on Low heat for an additional 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Turn slow cooker off.
', 'Step 8: Stir in sour cream and season with salt.

Title: Pineapple Sopaipillas
Ingredients: ['2 cups all-purpose flour', '3 teaspoons baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon peanut oil', '¾ cup water', '2 ½ tablespoons white sugar', '2 tablespoons cornstarch', '1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple, with juice', '1 quart peanut oil for frying', "½ cup confectioners' sugar for dusting"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Sift the flour, baking powder and salt into a medium bowl.
', 'Step 2: Stir in 1 tablespoon of peanut oil and water using a fork.
', 'Step 3: Divide into 4 pieces, and form into rounds.
', 'Step 4: Set aside.
', 'Step 5: In a saucepan, stir together the sugar and cornstarch.
', 'Step 6: Stir in pineapple and juice using a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 7: Bring to a boil over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Boil for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
', 'Step 9: Set aside to cool slightly.
', 'Step 10: Heat the peanut oil in a large deep skillet to 385 degrees F (195 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Roll out the balls of dough on a lightly floured surface to about 8x5 inch rectangles.
', 'Step 12: Cut into four smaller rectangles.
', 'Step 13: Fry a few pieces at a time in the hot oil until they puff like pillows, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 14: Turn over and fry until browned on the other side.
', 'Step 15: Remove to drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 16: While the pillows are still hot, make a slit along two connecting sides of each one.
', 'Step 17: Open up and fill each one with a rounded tablespoonful of the pineapple filling.
', "Step 18: Dust with confectioners' sugar and serve warm.
"]

Title: Mexican Shakshuka aka 'Eggs in a Pot'
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) package chorizo sausage', '1 (8 ounce) can sliced mushrooms, drained', '¼ large onion, diced', '1 (22 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '2 cups chicken broth, or more to taste', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '1 loaf French bread, cut into 1/4-inch slices', '¼ cup butter, or to taste', '2 tablespoons baking soda', '8 eggs, or more to taste', '½ cup crumbled queso fresco', '⅔ cup Mexican crema, crema fresca']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir chorizo with mushrooms and onion in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain and discard fat.
', 'Step 4: Combine diced tomatoes, chicken broth, and tomato paste in a Dutch oven over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a simmer and stir in the chorizo mixture and most of the crema, reserving a small amount to drizzle on top later.
', 'Step 6: Cover and let simmer, stirring occasionally, until stew is the texture of a thick chili, at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Lightly butter both sides of the bread slices and place on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 9: Toast in the preheated oven, turning bread halfway, for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Fill a pot with water and add baking soda.
', 'Step 11: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 12: Add eggs and boil for exactly 5 minutes and 45 seconds.
', 'Step 13: Remove eggs and immediately place into an ice water bath to stop the cooking process.
', 'Step 14: Remove shells.
', 'Step 15: Place eggs into the chorizo stew to re-warm them.
', 'Step 16: Top with queso fresco and drizzle with the remaining crema.
', 'Step 17: Serve in bowls with pieces of toasted bread.
']

Title: Incredibly Hearty Vegan Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['1 cup uncooked brown rice', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '2 tablespoons ground cumin, divided', '2 tablespoons paprika, divided', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper, or to taste', '2 cups water', '2 medium yellow onions, diced', '2 stalks celery, diced', '1 large green bell pepper, diced', '2 teaspoons minced garlic', '1 pound frozen corn', '1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained', '2 (15 ounce) cans fire-roasted diced tomatoes with juice', '2 tablespoons ground coriander', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '5 cups vegetable broth', '7 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into strips', '1 small lime, zested and juiced', 'coarsely crumbled tortilla chips (optional)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine rice, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 tablespoon cumin, 1 tablespoon paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, oregano, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and crushed red pepper in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Toast rice until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add water and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 4: Cover, reduce heat, and simmer until rice is cooked through according to package directions, 45 to 50 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, heat remaining tablespoon of oil in a large stockpot over medium heat and cook onions, celery, bell pepper, and garlic until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add frozen corn and saute until hot, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add pinto, black, and kidney beans, tomatoes with their juices, coriander, remaining 1 tablespoon cumin, remaining 1 tablespoon paprika, and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Cook for about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Pour in vegetable broth and add tortilla strips.
', 'Step 10: Once rice is cooked, add it to the soup.
', 'Step 11: Cook tortilla soup over medium heat until tortillas begin to break down and thicken the broth, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add lime zest and juice and cook for 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 13: Serve hot and garnish with coarsely crumbled tortilla chips.
']

Title: Green Brown Rice with Corn
Ingredients: ['2 cups brown rice', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '4 ears corn, cut from cob', '¼ onion, chopped', '6 poblano chiles, deveined and cut into strips', '4 cups water', '4 cloves garlic', 'salt to taste', '1 sprig fresh epazote leaves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cover brown rice with hot water and soak for 1 hour.
', 'Step 2: Drain and rinse.
', 'Step 3: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Add rice and corn kernels and cook until rice is lightly browned, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large pot and cook onion and 3 poblanos until they have softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add rice and corn; mix well.
', 'Step 7: Combine remaining 3 poblano peppers, 1 cup water, and garlic in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 8: Pour over rice and add remaining water.
', 'Step 9: Add epazote and salt; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 10: Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook until all the water is absorbed and rice is cooked through, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove the rice from the heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes before serving.
']

Title: "OOO-MAMI" Sweet and Spicy Dip and Marinade
Ingredients: ['¼ cup soy sauce', '2 tablespoons prepared salsa verde', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons water', '1 tablespoon sriracha hot sauce', '1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root', '1 tablespoon rice vinegar']

Title: Mango-Tomatillo Guacamole
Ingredients: ['2 ripe Hass avocados - halved, pitted, and peeled', '2 tomatillos, husked and chopped', '1 ripe mango - peeled, seeded, and cut into cubes', '½ small red onion, finely chopped', '1 serrano chile pepper, finely chopped', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint', '1 ½ tablespoons fresh lemon juice', 'kosher salt to taste']

', 'Step 2: Fold tomatillos, mango, onion, serrano chile pepper, cilantro, and mint through the avocado; add lemon juice and gently mix.

Title: Monterey Jack and White Bean Dip
Ingredients: ['2 (15.5 ounce) cans white beans (cannellini or Great Northern), drained and rinsed', '¾ cup chicken or vegetable stock', '1 cup shredded or grated California Monterey Jack (or substitute a flavored variety such as California Pepper Jack)', '2 tablespoons sour cream', '½ cup crumbled California cow’s milk feta', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 pinch Salt and cayenne pepper to taste', '1 teaspoon Drizzle of olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a medium saucepan, heat beans and stock on medium heat until warmed through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove from heat and stir in shredded Monterey Jack.
', 'Step 3: Cool slightly.
', 'Step 4: Place the warm bean mixture in a food processor or blender.
', 'Step 5: Puree to a smooth consistency, adding a little more stock or water if needed.
', 'Step 6: Pour the warm bean mixture back into the saucepan or into a bowl and stir in sour cream, feta, lemon juice, oregano, salt and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 7: Transfer to a serving dish.
', 'Step 8: Drizzle with olive oil if desired.
', 'Step 9: Serve warm or at room temperature with chips and vegetables.
']

Title: Black Bean and Corn Pancakes with Tomatillo Salsa
Ingredients: ['½ cup all-purpose flour', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '¾ teaspoon baking soda', '¼ teaspoon salt', '⅔ cup yellow cornmeal', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (11 ounce) can Mexican-style corn, drained', '1 cup milk', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '2 large eggs, lightly beaten', '½ medium red bell pepper, finely chopped', '3 stalks green onions, chopped', '1 tablespoon cider vinegar', 'nonstick vegetable cooking spray', '1 (7 ounce) can green salsa', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon cider vinegar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Prepare pancakes: sift flour, baking powder, sugar, cumin, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Stir in cornmeal until combined.
', 'Step 3: Combine black beans, corn, milk, Mexican cheese, cilantro, chile peppers, eggs, bell pepper, green onions, and vinegar in another bowl.
', 'Step 4: Add to cornmeal mixture; stir until combined.
', 'Step 5: Let sit for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, prepare salsa: combine green salsa, vinegar, and cumin in a small bowl.
', 'Step 7: Place in the refrigerator while you make the pancakes.
', 'Step 8: Heat a griddle to medium heat and spray with nonstick spray.
', 'Step 9: Spoon 1/4 to 1/3 cupfuls batter onto the griddle, placing about 2 inches apart.
', 'Step 10: Cook until edges are firm and tiny holes appear on the surface, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Flip and cook until brown on the other side, 2 to 3 minutes more.
', 'Step 12: Repeat with remaining batter.
', 'Step 13: Serve hot pancakes with salsa.
']

Title: Creamy Chicken Tostadas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 large onion, chopped', '2 small red, green, and/or yellow bell peppers, chopped', '1 cup frozen whole kernel corn, thawed', '1 cup canned black beans, rinsed and drained', '2 cups shredded cooked chicken', "1 (10.75 ounce) can Campbell's® Condensed Creamy Poblano & Queso Soup", '¾ cup milk', '1 lime', '1 medium avocado, pitted, peeled and diced', '8 corn tostada shells, warmed', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves']

Title: Chipotle Turkey Tacos
Ingredients: ['6 peppers chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ½ pounds ground turkey', '10 piece (blank)s pineapple chunks in juice, drained, juice reserved', '½ onion, chopped', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning', '1 tablespoon water, or as needed', '6 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '2 teaspoons chopped fresh cilantro']

['Step 1: Remove chipotle peppers from sauce and slice into thin strips; keep adobo sauce for later.
', 'Step 2: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Add garlic and cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 4: Add ground turkey, stirring to break up while cooking, until mostly browned, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add pineapple chunks, onion, and chipotle peppers.
', 'Step 6: Cook until turkey is no longer pink and fully cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes more.
', 'Step 7: Stir reserved adobo sauce, 1/4 cup reserved pineapple juice, taco seasoning, and water into the pan.
', 'Step 8: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and let simmer, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Divide meat mixture evenly between tortillas and top with cilantro.
', 'Step 10: Fold and serve.
']

Title: Grilled BBQ Chicken Tacos
Ingredients: ['2 large skinless, boneless chicken breasts, pounded to 1/2-inch thickness', '1 cup chipotle barbecue sauce', '½ onion, chopped', '2 tablespoons chile-garlic sauce', '6 large flour tortillas, warmed', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '½ cup sliced black olives', '1 large tomato, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Cook chicken on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
', 'Step 3: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Remove chicken from the grill and set aside until cool enough to handle.
', 'Step 5: Shred cooled chicken and transfer to a saucepan.
', 'Step 6: Add barbecue sauce, onion, and chile-garlic sauce and stir until chicken is coated.
', 'Step 7: Cook over medium-low heat, stirring often, until steaming, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Place a few spoonfuls of chicken mixture onto each tortilla and sprinkle with Cheddar cheese, black olives, and tomato.
', 'Step 9: Roll up and serve.
']

Title: Chipotle Chicken Tostadas

Title: Corn with Roasted Chiles, Creme Fraiche, Cotija Cheese
Ingredients: ['1 small poblano pepper', '1 small serrano pepper', '3 tablespoons canola oil', '½ onion, thinly sliced, or to taste', '2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', '8 ears corn, shucked and kernels removed', '1 roasted red pepper, diced', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 lime, juiced', '2 tablespoons cold unsalted butter', '2 tablespoons creme fraiche', '2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ cup grated Cotija cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Cut poblano and serrano peppers in 1/2 from top to bottom; remove stems, seeds, and ribs.
', 'Step 4: Place peppers with cut sides down onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Place blackened peppers into a bowl and tightly seal with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 7: Allow peppers to steam as they cool, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove and discard skins.
', 'Step 9: Dice peppers.
', 'Step 10: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 11: Add onions; cook and stir until softened, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add garlic and serrano pepper; saute until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 13: Add corn, red pepper, and poblano pepper.
', 'Step 14: Saute until corn is tender, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Season vegetable mixture with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 16: Stir lime juice, butter, creme fraiche, and cilantro into the vegetable mixture.
', 'Step 17: Transfer to a serving bowl and sprinkle with Cotija cheese.
']

Title: Elote Bowl with Grilled Pineapple
Ingredients: ['1 medium fresh pineapple, peeled and cut into 1/2 inch slices', '2 ears corn, husks and silks removed', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or more as needed', '2 cups cooked brown rice', '2 tablespoons crema Mexicana (Mexican cream)', '2 dashes hot sauce, or to taste', '2 tablespoons crumbled cotija cheese', '1 bunch fresh cilantro', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 lime, cut in wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Brush pineapple and corn with oil and place carefully on the grill.
', 'Step 3: Cook pineapple until grill marks appear, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Flip and leave on heat just until grill marks appear on the second side, about 3 minutes more; do not overcook, as pineapple will become mushy.
', 'Step 5: Grill corn, turning throughout, until somewhat charred, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from grill and cool until safe too handle.
', 'Step 7: Cut kernels off cobs into a bowl.
', 'Step 8: Assemble 2 bowls by spooning equal amounts of rice into the bottom and topping each with 1/2 the roasted corn kernels.
', 'Step 9: Spoon crema over over corn and drizzle with hot sauce.
', 'Step 10: Add 2 to 3 pineapple rings to each bowl and top with cotija cheese and cilantro.
', 'Step 11: Add salt and pepper and a squeeze of lime juice.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Pozole
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 medium onion, diced', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '1 tablespoon tomato paste', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 teaspoons cumin', '2 teaspoons salt, or more to taste', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '½ teaspoon chipotle chile powder, or to taste', '2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs', '4 cups chicken broth', '3 cups Cooked hominy', '1 dried guajillo chile', '1 medium lime, juiced']

', 'Step 4: Add chili powder, cumin, salt, oregano, and ground chipotle.

', "Step 11: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes.

', 'Step 13: Add lime juice.
', 'Step 14: Taste and adjust seasonings.
', 'Step 15: Let sit on Warm setting until ready to serve.
']

Title: Sloppy Chicken "Chorizos"
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground chicken', '1 (9 ounce) package ground chorizo sausage', '½ cup chopped yellow onion', '1 tablespoon butter', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 cup ketchup', '¾ cup beef broth', '1 tablespoon brown sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons chipotle chile powder', '½ teaspoon dry mustard powder', '½ teaspoon hot sauce', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon beef broth, or more as needed', '6 pretzel rolls, split and toasted']

Title: Jungle Lobster
Ingredients: ['4 large fresh poblano chile peppers', '4 lobster tails', '4 tablespoons butter, divided', '½ small sweet onion, minced', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 egg, beaten']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Roast the poblano peppers whole over a hot grill, under a broiler or on a gas stove flame, turning frequently until evenly blackened.
', 'Step 2: Place in a bowl when done, and cover.
', 'Step 3: Leave them to sweat for about 10 minutes to loosen the burnt skin.
', 'Step 4: When cool enough to handle, peel the skin off by rubbing with your hands, leaving the chilies intact.
', 'Step 5: Rinse off the peppers.
', 'Step 6: Cut a slit down one side and open to remove the seeds and stem.
', 'Step 7: Set aside.
', 'Step 8: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil.
', 'Step 9: Add the lobster tails and cook for about 10 minutes, until bright red.
', 'Step 10: Drain and cool slightly.
', 'Step 11: Cut the shell lenghtwise and remove the tail meat in one piece.
', 'Step 12: Set aside.
', 'Step 13: Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 14: Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until tender and golden.
', 'Step 15: Slit the lobster tails lengthwise about halfway through.
', 'Step 16: Fill the pocket with sauteed onion and garlic.
', 'Step 17: Wrap each tail in one of the peppers so that the openings do not match up.
', 'Step 18: Dip in egg to seal.
', 'Step 19: Heat the remaining butter in the same skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 20: Place the stuffed peppers in the pan with the seam side down to seal.
', 'Step 21: Fry on each side just until golden.
', 'Step 22: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Spicy Beef Chili
Ingredients: ['½ tablespoon olive oil', '3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', '½ medium onion, chopped', '1 pound ground beef', '½ teaspoon crushed red pepper, or more to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '1 (15 ounce) can chili beans in zesty sauce', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans', '1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 pinch chili powder, or to taste', '1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, or more to taste']

', 'Step 2: Add garlic and onion and cook until tender, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add beef, crushed red pepper, and black pepper.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir until beef is browned, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 6: Drain and discard fat and excess oil.
', 'Step 7: Add tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, chili beans, black beans, and corn to the saucepan and return to low heat.
', 'Step 8: Add cayenne pepper and chili powder.
', 'Step 9: Season with additional black pepper if desired.
', 'Step 10: Add Worcestershire sauce.
', 'Step 11: Blend well and cover.
', 'Step 12: Simmer, stirring occasionally, 20 to 30 minutes.
']

Title: Vegan Chili Verde
Ingredients: ['4 fresh tomatillos, husks removed and halved', '4 cloves garlic', '2 poblano peppers, tops, seeds, and membranes removed', '3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '1 medium white onion, diced', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '4 cups low-sodium vegetable broth, divided', '1 (15 ounce) can low-sodium great Northern beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can low-sodium pinto beans, rinsed and drained', '1 ½ cups chopped Tuscan kale', '1 cup fresh corn kernels', '¾ cup bulgur wheat', '¾ teaspoon kosher salt']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set an oven rack 4 to 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Place tomatillos, garlic cloves, and poblano peppers on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Broil in the preheated oven until the peppers start to blacken and blister, 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove garlic and transfer to a plate.
', 'Step 5: Turn tomatillos and peppers over and broil until peppers are blackened and tomatillos are soft, 5 to 6 minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat until shimmering.
', 'Step 7: Add onion and cook, stirring frequently, until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir in oregano, cumin, and chili powder; cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 9: Add 3 cups vegetable broth, great Northern beans, pinto beans, kale, corn, bulgur wheat, and salt.
', 'Step 10: Return to a simmer.
', 'Step 11: Transfer roasted garlic, peppers, and tomatillos to a blender.
', 'Step 12: Add remaining 1 cup vegetable broth.
', 'Step 13: Cover and blend until just smooth.
', 'Step 14: Pour into the simmering pot.
', 'Step 15: Simmer chili gently until bulgur is tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
']

Title: Mesquite-Marinated Salmon Tacos

Title: Kosher Pineapple Cranberry Salsa (Pareve)
Ingredients: ['1 (12 ounce) bag fresh cranberries', '1 cup white sugar', '½ cup water', '1 fresh pineapple - peeled, cored, and cut into small chunks', '1 mango - peeled, seeded, and diced', '1 bunch cilantro, chopped', '3 Satsuma mandarin oranges, peeled and segmented', '1 sweet onion, diced', '1 jalapeno pepper, diced', '¼ cup orange juice']

', 'Step 6: Refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour.

Title: Chimichurri Chicken Soup
Ingredients: ['1 whole chicken', '4 cups chicken broth', '2 cups beef broth', '6 small whole tomatoes, or to taste', '4 bell peppers, stemmed and seeded', '1 large red onion', '3 jalapeno peppers, stemmed', '4 cloves garlic, or to taste', '1 cup parsley, chopped, or more to taste', '¾ cup extra-virgin olive oil', '3 tablespoons red wine vinegar', '3 tablespoons minced garlic, or to taste', '3 tablespoons dried oregano', '3 teaspoons ground cumin', '½ tablespoon hot sauce (such as Tabasco®)', '½ teaspoon salt', '4 medium potatoes, peeled and chopped', '4 parsnips, peeled and chopped', '3 carrots, chopped', '1 cup chopped cilantro', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine whole chicken, chicken broth, beef broth, tomatoes, bell peppers, red onion, jalapenos, and garlic in a large stockpot and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat and let simmer until chicken can be easily pulled off the bone, 40 minutes to 1 hour Make chimichurri while chicken is boiling.
', 'Step 3: Place parsley, olive oil, vinegar, minced garlic, oregano, cumin, hot sauce, and salt in the container of a blender or food processor.
', 'Step 4: Blend on medium speed until evenly combined, about 10 seconds.
', 'Step 5: Remove chicken from the broth and let cool in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 6: Fill blender halfway with stock.
', 'Step 7: Cover and hold lid down with a potholder; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend.
', 'Step 8: Pour back into pot.
', 'Step 9: Repeat with remaining stock.
', 'Step 10: Return stock to the heat and add potatoes, parsnips, carrots, and cilantro.
', 'Step 11: Simmer until vegetables are tender, 25 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Pull chicken meat off the bones and add to the soup.
', 'Step 13: Stir in 1/4 to 1/2 cup chimichurri.
', 'Step 14: Season with salt and freshly ground pepper.
']

Title: Avocado-Egg Salad Tostada Filling

', 'Step 11: Season to taste with salt and cayenne pepper.

Title: Mexican Christmas Beet Salad

Title: Chipotle BBQ Chicken Tinga Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 large yellow onion, chopped, divided', '6 garlic clove (blank)s whole garlic cloves', '½ cup ketchup', '½ cup beer', '⅓ cup distilled white vinegar', '1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '2 teaspoons ground dried chipotle chili pepper', '1 teaspoon dry mustard', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon salted butter, or more to taste', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '6 (6 inch) corn tortillas, or as needed']

', 'Step 12: Serve chicken mixture in tortillas.

Title: Rio Grande Especial

Title: Mexican Corn Bread Casserole with Turkey
Ingredients: ['2 pounds ground turkey', '1 cup diced onion', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ½ cups salsa', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon chili powder, or to taste', '1 ¼ cups milk', '1 cup polenta', '½ cup butter, softened', '½ cup corn flour', '3 tablespoons egg whites', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '2 cups shredded Mexican-style Cheddar cheese blend, divided', '2 cups salsa']

', 'Step 2: Add turkey, onion, and garlic.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir in the hot skillet until turkey is no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add 1 1/2 cups salsa, cumin, salt, black pepper, and chili powder.

', 'Step 10: Bake casserole in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle 1 1/2 cups shredded Mexican-style Cheddar cheese blend on top.

']

Title: Vegetable Soup with Chicken and Tomatillos
Ingredients: ['2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '4 stalks celery, chopped', '1 large onion, chopped', '4 cubes chicken bouillon', '3 (32 fluid ounce) containers vegetable broth', '4 cups fresh green beans, trimmed and cut into bite-size pieces', '2 (14 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with green chiles', '2 cups chopped fresh tomatillos', '6 cloves garlic, minced', '4 small zucchini, cubed', '2 medium jalapeno peppers, finely chopped', '2 medium Spanish onions, chopped', '2 medium green bell peppers, chopped', '1 medium poblano pepper, chopped', '2 teaspoons chopped fresh oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '4 roasted red peppers', '2 tablespoons chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '2 cups chopped fresh cilantro', '4 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '1 ½ teaspoons salt']

['Step 1: Place chicken, celery, onion, and chicken bouillon into a large soup pot and add water just to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil over high heat; reduce heat to low and let simmer until chicken breasts are no longer pink in the centers, 20 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer chicken to a plate and shred into medium-size pieces using 2 forks.
', 'Step 4: Set aside.
', 'Step 5: Add vegetable broth, green beans, diced tomatoes with chiles, tomatillos, garlic, zucchini, jalapeno peppers, onions, bell peppers, poblano pepper, oregano, and cumin to the pot.
', 'Step 6: Puree roasted red peppers and chipotle peppers in adobo in a blender or food processor; add to soup and stir to combine.
', 'Step 7: Cover and bring to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 8: Stir in shredded chicken.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to low and let simmer, partly covered, for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir in cilantro, lime juice, and salt.
', 'Step 11: Serve.
']

Title: A Big, Honkin' Margarita
Ingredients: ['5 lemons', '5 limes', '¾ cup white sugar, or to taste', '1 (750 milliliter) bottle tequila', '4 cups ice cubes, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Wash the lemons and limes, and cut the fruit into quarters.
', 'Step 2: Squeeze juice from the fruit quarters into a 1-gallon glass ice tea jar, and place the squeezed fruit quarters into the jar.
', 'Step 3: Fill the jar with ice cubes, and pour in the sugar and tequila.
', 'Step 4: Top off the jar with more ice cubes if some have melted from the tequila.
', 'Step 5: Seal the jar, and wrap the jar with a wet (but not sopping wet) hand towel.
', 'Step 6: n Gather 8 or so people in a circle, and pass the jar from one to the next, each person shaking the jar for 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: The drink is ready when the sugar has dissolved and the hand towel freezes and sticks to the jar.
', 'Step 8: Dispense into ice-filled glasses and serve.
']

Title: Mexican Pambazo My Way
Ingredients: ['2 pounds extra-lean ground beef', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '3 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 tablespoon chili powder, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon white vinegar', 'salt to taste', '2 large potatoes, peeled and cubed', '2 large carrots, chopped', '12 medium sandwich rolls', '1 (28 ounce) can red enchilada sauce (also called red chili sauce)', '1 cup vegetable oil, or as needed', '1 cup shredded lettuce, or to taste', '½ cup crumbled queso fresco, or to taste', '1 medium avocado, sliced, or to taste', '¼ cup sour cream, or to taste']

', 'Step 2: Cook and stir beef, onion, jalapeno, garlic, chili powder, vinegar, and salt in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil.

', 'Step 10: Fry the sauce-soaked roll halves in batches until browned on the outside, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.

Title: Grilled Catfish Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 pound catfish fillets', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon paprika', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground coriander', 'cooking spray', '¼ cup sour cream', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 cup shredded red cabbage', '½ medium red onion, thinly sliced', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 ½ tablespoons lime juice', '1 tablespoon olive oil', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (12 ounce) package corn tortillas', '½ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese, or to taste', '1 medium tomato, chopped, or to taste', '1 avocado, diced, or to taste', '2 tablespoons chopped green onions, or to taste']

', 'Step 5: Combine sour cream, lime juice, cilantro, and chipotle peppers for crema until well blended; set aside.
', 'Step 6: Combine red cabbage, onion, and cilantro in a large bowl and squeeze lime juice over it.

', 'Step 9: Wrap corn tortillas in a damp paper towel.

Title: Make-Ahead Southwestern Breakfast Burritos
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 teaspoons olive oil', '1 red bell pepper, diced', '½ large sweet onion, chopped', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '12 eggs', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, stems removed', '1 large jalapeno pepper, stem removed', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon paprika', '2 medium tomatoes, cored and chopped', '¼ cup salsa', '1 ¼ cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '8 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '1 cup cooked white rice, at room temperature', "1 (15 ounce) can cuban-seasoned black beans (such as Bush's Cocina Latina® Cuban Black Beans)"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray an 18x13-inch rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Add bell pepper, onion, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Saute until vegetables begin to soften, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat and set aside.
', 'Step 7: Place eggs, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, and paprika into the bowl of a food processor.
', 'Step 8: Process on high until jalapeno has been finely chopped.
', 'Step 9: Add tomatoes and process until finely chopped.
', 'Step 10: Add onion-bell pepper mixture and salsa and pulse to combine.
', 'Step 11: Pour egg mixture into the prepared pan.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove from the oven and allow to cool to room temperature in the refrigerator, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Keep oven on; line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray paper with cooking spray.
', 'Step 15: Slice chilled eggs into 20 equal-sized rectangles.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle 1 1/2 tablespoons Cheddar cheese in the center of each tortilla.
', 'Step 17: Top each with 1 egg rectangle.
', 'Step 18: Sprinkle egg with 1 1/2 tablespoons Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 19: Top with 1 1/2 tablespoons each of rice and black beans.
', 'Step 20: Top rice and beans with another egg rectangle; fold tortilla into a burrito.
', 'Step 21: Place burritos seam-side down onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 22: Spray tops lightly with cooking spray.
', 'Step 23: Bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Flip burritos over and bake for an additional 12 minutes.
', 'Step 25: Let cool completely on a cooling rack before wrapping in foil or freezer paper and freezing in a freezer bag.
']

Title: Little Gasparilla Jalapeno Cheddar Potatoes

['Step 1: Place potatoes in a large pot of salted water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes; drain.
', 'Step 3: Heat peanut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

Title: Chorizo con Queso

Title: Fresas con Crema my Way

Title: Polish Sausage Corn Chip Quesadillas

['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.

Title: Tamale Pie with Chicken
Ingredients: ['3 large skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into thick strips', '½ cup chili powder', '(12 ounce) bottle olive oil', '2 tablespoons minced garlic', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '2 cups water', '1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '2 poblano peppers, chopped', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '4 cups masa flour', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 cup butter, softened', '1 teaspoon lime juice', '3 cups hot water, or as needed', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives', '1 (16 ounce) container sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chicken, chili powder, 2 tablespoons oil, minced garlic, lime juice, salt, black pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, cumin, and oregano in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Let marinate 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 3: Pour chicken with marinade into a pot; add water.
', 'Step 4: Cover and cook over medium-high heat until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes, stirring as needed.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to medium-low and let simmer for 1 hour.
', 'Step 6: Transfer chicken to a large bowl and shred using 2 forks; set aside and keep warm.
', 'Step 7: Add tomatoes, beans, poblano peppers, jalapeno peppers, onion, and bell pepper to the pot.
', 'Step 8: Cook veggie mixture over medium-high heat until slightly softened and onion is translucent, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Adjust liquid by either adding while cooking covered, or condensing water by cooking uncovered; final product should be the consistency of a thick stew.
', 'Step 10: Combine vegetable mixture with shredded chicken and set filling aside.
', 'Step 11: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
', 'Step 13: Mix masa flour, chili powder, sugar, baking powder, salt, and pepper for crust together in a bowl.
', 'Step 14: Mix in butter and lime juice.
', 'Step 15: Add hot water and mix until dough reaches the consistency of a thick cookie dough; mix or knead thoroughly.
', 'Step 16: Place about 1/2 of the crust mixture into the prepared pan to form a 1/2- to 3/4-inch layer covering the bottom and 3/4 up the sides.
', 'Step 17: Spread filling into crust.
', 'Step 18: Flatten handfuls of remaining crust mixture to about 1/2- to 3/4-inch thickness.
', 'Step 19: Lay on top of pie; continue until top is mostly covered.
', 'Step 20: Spread enchilada sauce over crust.
', 'Step 21: Cover with Mexican cheese.
', 'Step 22: Scatter olives on top.
', 'Step 23: Bake in the preheated oven until golden and bubbly, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Serve with a little enchilada sauce and a dollop of sour cream on top of each serving.
']

Title: Eric and Debi's Seafood Seviche
Ingredients: ['½ pound halibut fillets, cut into 1/4 inch cubes', '10 peeled and deveined shrimp, cut into small pieces', '4 large sea scallops, cut into small pieces', '½ cup fresh lemon juice', '¼ cup fresh grapefruit juice', '1 yellow bell pepper, diced', '3 large jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced', '⅓ cup diced Maui onion', '¼ cup chopped green olives', '1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root', '1 tablespoon brown sugar', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '1 large tomato, diced']

', 'Step 4: Drain the seafood, and add to the vegetable mixture along with the tomatoes.
', 'Step 5: Gently stir until evenly combined, then return to the refrigerator to chill at least 15 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Tinga Tostadas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '1 onion, halved and sliced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (6.5 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (7 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cubed', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 pinch salt', '1 (12 ounce) package tostada shells']

Title: Green Rice with Poblano Chiles
Ingredients: ['5 poblano peppers, halved and seeded', '3 ½ cups chicken broth, divided', '½ small onion', '1 clove garlic', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 ½ cups uncooked white rice', '1 sprig fresh epazote leaves', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Place poblano peppers cut-side down on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Place blackened peppers into a bowl and tightly seal with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 6: Allow peppers to steam as they cool, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove and discard skins.
', 'Step 8: Combine 4 poblano peppers, 1 cup chicken broth, onion, and garlic in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat and fry the rice, stirring continuously, until evenly browned, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add poblano chile mixture and remaining 2 1/2 cups chicken broth, epazote, and salt.
', 'Step 11: Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and cook until rice is soft and all the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Slice remaining poblano chile and serve as a garnish with the rice.
']

Title: Mexican-Style Couscous with Roasted Corn
Ingredients: ['2 ears fresh corn', '2 cups couscous', '4 stalks green onion, chopped', '½ medium red bell pepper, chopped', '1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 cups chicken stock', '½ cup crumbled cotija cheese', '½ medium lime, juiced', '1 tablespoon thinly sliced fresh basil or basil chiffonade', '1 pinch chili-lime seasoning, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Trim and partially shuck corn by cutting off any long silk from the top and removing and discarding the outer layer of husk.
', 'Step 3: Place corn directly on the middle rack of the preheated oven and roast for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from the oven and let sit for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove and discard husks and silk.
', 'Step 6: Slice kernels off with a knife.
', 'Step 7: While the corn is roasting, place couscous in a heat-proof bowl with green onion, bell pepper, jalapeno, and olive oil.
', 'Step 8: Bring chicken stock to a boil in a small saucepan.
', 'Step 9: Pour boiling stock over couscous mixture and cover tightly with foil.
', 'Step 10: Let sit for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Uncover and stir in roasted corn kernels, cotija cheese, lime juice, and basil.
', 'Step 12: Season with chili-lime seasoning.
']

Title: Truffle Cheese and Potato Tacos
Ingredients: ['10 small potatoes', '4 tomatoes, diced, divided', '1 onion, diced, divided', '1 green chile pepper, diced, divided', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ cup olive oil, divided', '10 corn tortillas', "5 ounces truffle-infused cow's milk cheese, grated"]

', 'Step 5: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Heat 1/4 cup oil in a large skillet over medium heat; add potatoes and mash with the back of a wooden spoon or fork.

', 'Step 15: Serve salsa alongside tacos.
']

', 'Step 5: In same skillet, prepare Knorr® Fiesta SidesTM - Mexican Rice according to package directions.
', 'Step 6: Transfer tilapia to the rice mixture.
', 'Step 7: Divide lettuce between four salad bowls or plates.
', 'Step 8: Divide the rice and tilapia mixture among the dishes.
', 'Step 9: Top with tomatoes and onions.
', 'Step 10: Serve with your favorite light dressing, such as Ranch.
']

Title: Salsa Verde Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '1 large onion, minced', '2 medium fresh poblano peppers, seeded and sliced into strips', '4 medium fresh jalapeno peppers, seeded and diced', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '3 (12.5 fl oz) cans chicken chunks, drained', '1 medium lime, halved, or more to taste', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon ground paprika', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '34 ounces salsa verde', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '8 (6 inch) corn tortillas, or as needed', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a 9x13-inch casserole dish.
', 'Step 3: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Add onion, poblano peppers, jalapeno peppers, and garlic; cook and stir until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add chicken; squeeze lime halves over chicken, then place rinds and pulp into the skillet.
', 'Step 6: Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 25 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove and discard lime rinds.
', 'Step 8: Stir in cream cheese, 1 tablespoon plus 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, cayenne pepper, paprika, chili powder, and cumin.
', 'Step 9: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 10: Once cream cheese is melted, remove from heat.
', 'Step 11: Puree salsa verde, sour cream, and cilantro in a blender or food processor.
', 'Step 12: Heat tortillas in a microwave until soft, 15 to 30 seconds.
', 'Step 13: Pour enough of the sour cream mixture into the prepared baking dish to coat the bottom.
', 'Step 14: Place 2 heaping tablespoons or more of the chicken mixture in each tortilla, roll up, and place seam side-down in the baking dish.
', 'Step 15: Pour remaining sour cream mixture over all enchiladas and top with shredded Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 16: Cover the dish with foil.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the preheated oven until heated through and bubbling, 30 to 35 minutes.
']

Title: Mexican-Inspired Chicken Pot Pie
Ingredients: ['1 pound cooked skinless, boneless chicken thighs, chopped', '1 (14 ounce) package frozen fire-roasted corn, thawed', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '1 (4 ounce) can sliced black olives', '4 ounces processed cheese food (such as Velveeta®), cubed', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (8 ounce) package refrigerated crescent rolls', '1 cup shredded Mexican blend cheese']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine chicken, corn, enchilada sauce, and black olives in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook until sauce has thickened slightly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add processed cheese food and stir until melted.
', 'Step 5: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 6: Separate 1/2 of the crescent rolls and place in the bottom of an 8-inch square baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Put corn mixture on top of crescents, then top with shredded cheese and remaining crescents.

Title: Bell Peppers Stuffed with Mexican Cauliflower Rice
Ingredients: ['½ head cauliflower, or more to taste', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans diced roasted tomatoes', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 teaspoon garlic salt', '1 teaspoon Italian seasoning', '4 green bell peppers, tops and seeds removed', '1 pound hamburger meat', '1 (10 ounce) package beef chorizo', '4 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Chop cauliflower into rice-like shapes using a vegetable chopper and set aside.
', 'Step 2: Mix diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, garlic salt, and Italian seasoning together in a bowl and set aside.
', 'Step 3: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
', 'Step 4: Add bell peppers and cook 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from water and set aside to cool.
', 'Step 6: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Cook and stir hamburger meat in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 10: Clear an area in the center of the skillet and add chorizo.
', 'Step 11: Cook about 5 minutes; stir into hamburger meat in the skillet.
', 'Step 12: Add chopped cauliflower and cook, stirring frequently, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove skillet from heat and add 1/2 the tomato sauce mixture.
', 'Step 14: Stir thoroughly.
', 'Step 15: Fill each bell pepper with meat mixture and place in a small glass casserole dish.
', 'Step 16: Cover with remaining tomato sauce mixture.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Remove stuffed peppers from the oven and cover with shredded Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 19: Return to the hot oven and bake until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes more.
']

Title: Gringa Caldo de Res for the Instant Pot®
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '1 pound beef stew meat', '2 tablespoons adobo seasoning (such as Goya®), divided', '1 teaspoon garlic granules, divided', '1 teaspoon salt, divided', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided', '½ teaspoon ground cumin, divided', '¼ teaspoon ground coriander divided', '4 cloves fresh garlic, minced', '2 cups beef broth, divided', '2 russet potatoes, peeled and cubed', '2 ears fresh corn, shucked, cut into 1-inch-thick slices', '2 carrots, sliced', '1 chayote squash - peeled, cored, and cubed', '1 onion, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 2: Add butter once the pot is hot.
', 'Step 3: Add beef and season with 1 tablespoon adobo seasoning, 1/2 teaspoon garlic granules, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, 1/4 teaspoon cumin, and 1/8 teaspoon coriander.
', 'Step 4: Cook until beef is browned on all sides, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add fresh minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 6: Pour 1 cup beef broth into the pot and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off the bottom with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 7: Cancel Saute mode.
', 'Step 8: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 9: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 15 minutes.
", 'Step 10: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 11: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 25 minutes.
", 'Step 12: Quick-release the remaining pressure for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 14: Stir in potatoes, corn, carrots, chayote squash, and onion.
', 'Step 15: Pour in remaining 1 cup beef broth.
', 'Step 16: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 17: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 8 minutes.
", 'Step 18: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 19: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 12 minutes.
", 'Step 20: Quick-release the remaining pressure for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 22: Add remaining 1 tablespoon adobo seasoning, 1/2 teaspoon garlic granules, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, 1/4 teaspoon cumin, and 1/8 teaspoon coriander to taste.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '359.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '26.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '70.8 mg', 'fatContent': '17.9 g', 'fiberContent': '4.9 g', 'proteinContent': '24.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '740.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '4 g'}

Title: Mexican Coconut Hot Chocolate Cookies
Ingredients: ['1 cup butter, softened', '1 cup white sugar', '1 cup brown sugar', '2 eggs', '1 tablespoon instant coffee granules', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '1 ¾ cups all-purpose flour', '⅔ cup cocoa powder', '1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or more to taste', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon cream of tartar', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '1 cup sweetened flaked coconut', '2 cups milk chocolate chips']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Beat butter, white sugar, brown sugar, eggs, instant coffee, and vanilla extract together in a large bowl using an electric mixer until fluffy.

', 'Step 4: Stir flour mixture into the butter mixture slowly until blended.
', 'Step 5: Fold in coconut and chocolate chips.
', 'Step 6: Drop batter by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until set, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Cool slightly on the baking sheet before transferring to a rack to cool completely, about 15 minutes.
']

Title: Healthier Poached Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['4 (5 ounce) fillets tilapia', '½ cup tequila', '1 medium lime, juiced', '2 teaspoons canola oil', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '½ (8 ounce) container light sour cream', '1 tablespoon chopped chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, or more to taste', '¾ (5.8 ounce) package hard taco shells', '½ head iceberg lettuce, chopped', '2 medium roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '1 medium avocado, chopped']

Title: Mexican Lasagna Roll Ups
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package lasagna noodles', '1 pound ground beef', '¾ cup water', '1 (1 ounce) package hot taco seasoning mix', '1 (1 pound) package shredded Mexican cheese blend, or as needed', '1 (4 ounce) can sliced black olives', '1 (28 ounce) jar spaghetti sauce', '1 (8 ounce) jar taco sauce', '¼ cup sour cream, or as desired']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Cook lasagna in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain.
', 'Step 4: Pat noodles dry with paper towels.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes; drain excess grease.
', 'Step 6: Stir water and taco seasoning mix into ground beef; cook and stir until thickened, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat and let meat cool.
', 'Step 8: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Lay a noodle flat on a work surface and place 1 tablespoon seasoned meat at one end of noodle; roll up just to enclose meat filling.
', 'Step 10: Place 1 to 2 tablespoons shredded Mexican cheese blend onto noodle and roll just to cover cheese; sprinkle a few black olives on noodle and roll noodle to the end.
', 'Step 11: Repeat with remaining noodles.
', 'Step 12: Pour enough spaghetti sauce into a 9x13-inch baking dish to cover the bottom; lay rolled noodles with seam sides down into dish over sauce.
', 'Step 13: Spread taco sauce over noodles and spoon remaining spaghetti sauce over the top.
', 'Step 14: Scatter any remaining meat sauce over the rolls and cover dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven until the sauce is bubbling and cheese has melted, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Serve with sour cream on top.
']

Title: Big Pappy's Posole Verde with Tomatillos
Ingredients: ['1 pound fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '1 pound poblano peppers', '1 drizzle olive oil', '1 cup water', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed', '1 medium white onion, diced', '4 cups chicken broth', '2 serrano peppers, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoons chipotle chile powder', 'salt to taste', '¼ cup cornmeal']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place tomatillos and poblanos into a roasting pan and drizzle with olive oil, tossing to coat.
', 'Step 3: Roast in the preheated oven until poblanos are blackened, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from the oven and let cool enough to handle, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove skins from poblanos and place them into an electric blender with tomatillos.
', 'Step 6: Add water and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 8: Saute chicken and onion in the hot oil until onions soften and show color and chicken is browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add blended poblanos and tomatillos, chicken broth, serrano peppers, garlic, cumin, chipotle powder, and salt.
', 'Step 10: Bring mixture to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and let simmer until chicken is no longer pink in the center and flavors have melded, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 11: Stir in cornmeal to thicken.
']

Title: Deep-Dish Mexican Cornbread Pizza
Ingredients: ['2 (8.5 ounce) packages cornbread mix (such as Jiffy®)', '1 ½ cups milk', '2 large eggs', '1 pound ground beef', '1 onion, chopped', '1 red bell pepper, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 (10 ounce) cans refrigerated pie crusts, at room temperature', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', '½ cup frozen corn', '1 (14 ounce) can refried beans', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese']

Title: Paddy's Chile Verde
Ingredients: ['4 pounds fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '2 large onions (keep the skin on)', '2 poblano peppers', '1 head garlic', '3 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '2 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles lager-style beer', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', '4 tablespoons vegetable oil', '4 pounds cubed lamb stew meat']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 2: Arrange the tomatillos, onions, poblano peppers, and garlic on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Cook the vegetables under the broiler until the skins are charred on the side facing the heater elements; turn the vegetables and continue cooking until equally charred, 3 to 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 4: Remove and discard the root and outer skin from the onion and garlic; remove and discard the stem and seeds from the peppers.
', 'Step 5: Working in batches, combine some of the tomatillos, onion, poblano peppers, garlic, chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, lager-style beer, cumin, salt, and pepper in a blender to about half full.
', 'Step 6: Holding the lid in place, pulse a few times to get the mixture moving before leaving the blender on to puree to a smooth texture; pour into a slow cooker.
', 'Step 7: Heat the oil in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 8: Cook and stir the lamb cubes in the hot oil until browned on all side, about 5 minutes; transfer to the slow cooker.
', 'Step 9: Cook on High for 4 hours.
']

Title: Cheesy Spinach Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 (340 gram) package Yves Veggie Cuisine® Veggie Ground Round Mexican or Original', "12 nuggets Europe's Best® Chef's Spinach, thawed, drained and squeezed dry", '1 ¾ cups shredded Monterey Jack, Cheddar or Mexican blend cheese', '¾ cup cooked Casbah® Freekeh', '⅓ cup finely chopped green onion', '1 (15 ounce) jar picante sauce', '6 (9 inch) original or whole wheat flour tortillas', '¼ cup chopped fresh coriander', 'Sour cream']

Title: Jackfruit Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 medium Roma tomato', '6 peppers de arbol chile peppers', '5 peppers guajillo chile peppers', '1 medium morita chile pepper', '1 pasilla chile pepper', '2 cups vegetable broth', '½ small white onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '½ teaspoon vegetable base', '½ teaspoon cider vinegar', 'salt to taste', '1 tablespoon peanut oil', '2 tablespoons peanut oil, or more as needed', '1 large white onion, chopped', '1 medium red bell pepper, chopped', '1 large portobello mushroom, chopped', '½ teaspoon tamari', '¼ teaspoon liquid smoke flavoring', '2 (14 ounce) cans jackfruit, drained', '1 teaspoon pollo asada seasoning', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon sazon seasoning (such as Goya®)', '½ teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', 'salt to taste', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '½ cup shredded vegan cheese, or to taste']

['Step 1: Roast Roma tomato over a gas burner.
', 'Step 2: Core tomato and cut into 8 pieces; set aside.

', 'Step 8: Add fire-roasted tomato, onion, garlic, vegetable base, cider vinegar, salt, and a small amount of broth to the blender.
', 'Step 9: Pulse, adding more broth as necessary, to desired consistency.
', 'Step 10: Reserve remaining broth for the filling.
', 'Step 11: Heat 1 teaspoon peanut oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 12: Add sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon oil for filling in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 14: Add onion and bell pepper and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Remove to a bowl.

', 'Step 21: Add onion mixture along with some reserved broth.
', 'Step 22: Reduce heat to low, cover, and steam for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 24: Meanwhile, brush tortillas with more peanut oil and fry in a skillet.
', 'Step 25: Stuff each tortilla with filling and roll up.
', 'Step 26: Place in a 9x13-inch casserole dish.
', 'Step 27: Top with some sauce, reserving some for serving.
', 'Step 28: Sprinkle with vegan cheese.

', 'Step 31: Top with remaining sauce.

Title: Instant Pot® Mexican-Style Meatballs and Quinoa

Title: Chile Verde Stew with Pork and Tomatillos
Ingredients: ['3 ½ pounds pork tenderloin, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '½ cup all-purpose flour, or as needed', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '¾ pound fresh tomatillos, husks removed and halved', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '2 medium onion, chopped', '2 cups chicken broth', '½ tablespoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon chopped fresh oregano', '1 bay leaf', '½ pound serrano chile peppers, seeded and chopped', '½ pound green chile peppers, seeded and chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped', '⅛ cup chopped fresh cilantro']

", 'Step 2: Dust pork cubes in flour and season with salt and pepper.

Title: Spicy Chicken and Egg Breakfast Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons salted butter, divided', '½ medium yellow onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, chopped', '2 (4 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, chopped', '½ cup chicken stock', '½ (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '4 large eggs, or more to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, drained', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '4 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '2 tablespoons sour cream, or to taste', '2 tablespoons guacamole, or to taste', '1 dash hot sauce, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet over medium heat; stir in onion.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Add chicken, chicken stock, and taco seasoning; bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 5: Cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from the heat and drain, being careful to remove as much liquid as possible, while keeping onions and garlic.

', 'Step 8: Melt remaining butter in the same skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 9: Whisk eggs in a small bowl with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 10: Pour into the skillet and add chicken mixture, diced tomatoes and chiles, and cilantro; scramble until eggs are set, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add an additional beaten egg, if desired.
', 'Step 12: Remove from the heat and add 1/4 cup cheese, stirring until cheese is melted.
', 'Step 13: Place 2 tortillas in a separate, large skillet over low heat.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle part of the remaining cheese on top and let melt.
', 'Step 15: Spoon 1/2 of the chicken-egg mixture onto each tortilla, sprinkle with remaining cheese, and top with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 16: Flip carefully and cook on the other side for about 1 minute.
', 'Step 17: Remove from the skillet and place each tortilla on a plate.
', 'Step 18: Slice, garnish with sour cream, guacamole, and hot sauce, and serve.
']

Title: Eggnog Poke Cake (Tres Leches Style)
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter, or as needed', '4 eggs, at room temperature', '¾ cup white sugar', '¼ cup white rum', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 ½ cups eggnog, at room temperature', '3 tablespoons white rum']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Coat an 11x7-inch baking pan with butter.
', 'Step 3: Beat eggs in a bowl until frothy.
', 'Step 4: Add sugar and continue to beat until thick and creamy, 4 to 5 minutes.

Title: Cheesy Chicken Tortilla Soup in the Slow Cooker
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds chicken tenders', 'salt to taste', '1 pinch ground cumin, or to taste', '1 pinch chili powder, or to taste', '1 pinch garlic powder, or to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste', '1 (32 ounce) container chicken broth', '2 (15.5 ounce) jars queso dip', '2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 (16 ounce) package frozen pepper and onion stir-fry blend', '2 cups crushed tortilla chips', '⅔ (15 ounce) can black beans, drained', '2 medium jalapeno peppers - stemmed, seeded, and minced', '¼ medium lime, juiced', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '¼ cup crushed tortilla chips, or to taste']

['Step 1: Rub chicken with salt, then follow with cumin, chili powder, and pepper.
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.

', 'Step 4: Remove from the heat and cut into chunks.
', 'Step 5: Combine chicken broth, queso, diced tomatoes and chiles, pepper and onion blend, tortilla chips, black beans, jalapeno peppers, and lime juice in a slow cooker.

Title: Mexican Chicken Lasagna with Salsa Verde
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package lasagna noodles', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '3 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, diced', '1 cup chopped onion', '1 (16 ounce) package cottage cheese', '2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '2 eggs', '1 tablespoon water, or as needed', '1 (28 ounce) jar spaghetti sauce', '1 (7 ounce) can salsa verde (such as Herdez®)', '1 (7 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place a pan on a lower rack to catch any drippings.

Title: Shiitake Mushroom Ceviche

Title: Roasted Green Tomato Salsa

Title: Chicharrones de Pollo
Ingredients: ['1 cup fresh lime juice', '½ cup light rum', '1 medium onion, chopped', '6 cloves garlic, mashed', '1 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into strips', '1 large egg', '2 teaspoons water', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin, or more to taste', '¼ teaspoon crushed oregano, or more to taste', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons salt, or more to taste', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper, or more to taste', '2 cups vegetable oil for frying']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk lime juice, rum, onion, and garlic together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Place chicken strips in a shallow glass baking pan and pour marinade over top.
', 'Step 3: Mix up chicken so all pieces are well coated.
', 'Step 4: Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours.
', 'Step 5: Beat egg and water together in a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 6: Mix flour, 2 teaspoons salt, and 2 teaspoons pepper together in a second shallow bowl.
', 'Step 7: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 8: While the oil is heating, remove chicken from the marinade and shake off excess.
', 'Step 9: Discard the remaining marinade.
', 'Step 10: Dip chicken in the egg wash, then dredge in the seasoned flour mixture until well coated.
', "Step 11: Fry chicken in small batches (don't overcrowd the skillet) in the hot oil until all sides are golden brown and the juices run clear, 8 to 10 minutes per side.
", 'Step 12: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
']

Title: Mexican Bean and Tortilla Soup (Sopa Tarasca)
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '2 pasilla chile peppers - stems, seeds, and veins removed', '4 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into thin strips', '1 Roma tomato', '2 serrano peppers, or to taste', '1 cup water', '½ small onion, sliced', '4 cups black beans, with liquid', '1 pinch ground dried oregano', 'salt to taste', '3 tablespoons grated Cotija cheese, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a skillet over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook pasilla chiles until light brown, being careful not to burn them, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer chiles to a plate.
', 'Step 4: Increase skillet heat to medium-high; cook tortillas in the same oil until crisp and golden brown, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from skillet.
', 'Step 6: Wipe out skillet and place back over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 7: Add tomato and serrano peppers.
', 'Step 8: Roast in the dry skillet, turning occasionally, until skin is charred and flesh is soft, 8 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Let cool briefly.
', 'Step 10: Peel tomatoes and place in a blender along with serrano peppers.
', 'Step 11: Add water and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 12: Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Pour in the tomato mixture; cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Pour beans into the blender; process until smooth.
', 'Step 16: Add to the saucepan with the tomato mixture.
', 'Step 17: Add oregano and season with salt.
', 'Step 18: Bring soup to a simmer until beans are heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Garnish soup with the toasted pasilla chile, tortilla strips, and Cotija cheese.
']

Title: Easy Slow Cooker Pulled Chicken Tacos

Title: Carne Aravada
Ingredients: ['2 cups water', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 pounds beef stew meat, cut into 1 1/2 inch cubes', '4 tablespoons guajillo chile powder', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ¼ teaspoons dried Mexican oregano', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a saucepan, combine water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and beef cubes.
', 'Step 2: Bring to boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Combine the chile powder, minced garlic, and oregano in a small bowl.
', 'Step 4: Add enough of the beef cooking water to make a paste.
', 'Step 5: After 30 minutes, stir the spice paste into the beef mixture.
', 'Step 6: Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Cook flour, stirring constantly, until golden brown.
', 'Step 8: Take 1 cup of the spiced cooking water and whisk it into the flour mixture until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Stir in the cumin, chopped parsley, and salt.
', 'Step 10: Transfer the thickened sauce mixture into the saucepan with the beef.
', 'Step 11: Simmer until tender, about 1 1/2 hours.
']

Title: Squash Blossom Chile Relleno with Walnut Cream Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 cup shelled walnut halves', '2 cups milk, or more as needed, divided', '¼ pound crumbled queso fresco', '1 ½ cups sour cream', '1 ½ tablespoons white sugar', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '6 poblano peppers', '1 pound chorizo sausage', '1 cup squash blossoms, chopped', '½ cup black beans, rinsed and drained', '½ cup whole kernel corn, drained', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican cheese blend', '3 eggs, separated', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '1 cup all-purpose flour', 'vegetable oil for frying', '1 teaspoon pomegranate seeds, or to taste', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place walnuts into a bowl and cover with milk; soak in the refrigerator 3 to 4 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 2: Drain walnuts and place into a food processor.
', 'Step 3: Add queso fresco, sour cream, sugar, and cinnamon.
', 'Step 4: Puree until completely smooth.
', 'Step 5: Add milk to the food processor as necessary to make creamy.
', 'Step 6: Set sauce aside.
', "Step 7: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 8: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 9: Place poblano peppers onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 10: Broil peppers in the preheated oven until skins blacken and blister, about 10 minutes, making sure to turn peppers halfway through cooking time.
', 'Step 11: Remove from the oven and place peppers directly into a plastic resealable bag.
', 'Step 12: Seal and allow to sit and steam for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove skins from peppers carefully by scraping them using a spoon or your fingers.
', 'Step 14: Cut a slit down the long side of each pepper.
', 'Step 15: Remove and discard seeds and veins and set peppers aside.
', 'Step 16: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 17: Saute chorizo in the skillet for 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Add squash blossoms and continue cooking until meat is browned and crumbly and blossoms are wilted, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Stir in black beans and corn; cook 1 to 2 minutes more.
', 'Step 20: Turn off heat and mix in Mexican cheese.
', 'Step 21: Stuff peppers carefully with chorizo mixture, making sure not to overstuff so that peppers can be closed completely.
', 'Step 22: Set aside.
', 'Step 23: Place egg whites and yolks into 2 separate bowls.
', 'Step 24: Whisk 1 tablespoon flour into yolks to make a paste.
', 'Step 25: Beat egg whites using an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
', 'Step 26: Fold beaten egg whites into yolk mixture very gently to preserve volume of egg whites.
', 'Step 27: Place 1 cup flour onto a plate.
', 'Step 28: Dredge stuffed peppers into flour, covering all sides completely.
', 'Step 29: Dip flour-covered stuffed peppers into egg mixture; entire peppers should be completely covered.
', 'Step 30: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or a deep, heavy pan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 31: Deep-fry each pepper in the hot oil until golden, 2 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 32: Transfer to a wire rack to drain grease.
', 'Step 33: Place cooked poblanos onto plates; pour walnut sauce over.
', 'Step 34: Top with pomegranate seeds and cilantro.
', 'Step 35: Serve.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Beef Tinga
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 ½ pounds beef chuck, cut into 2-inch cubes', '1 large onion, diced', '5 cloves garlic, pressed', '½ pound chorizo sausage', '1 (14 ounce) can dark red kidney beans, rinsed', '1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '14 fluid ounces water', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '6 chipotle chiles in adobo sauce, finely chopped', '3 cups tomato juice, or as needed', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste']

', 'Step 4: Transfer mixture to a slow cooker.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir chorizo in the same skillet until browned and crumbly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Transfer to the slow cooker.
', 'Step 7: Add kidney beans and diced tomatoes to the slow cooker; fill an empty can with water and pour in over the beans.

', 'Step 10: Cook on Low until beef is very tender and sauce is thick, 5 to 7 hours.
']

Title: Gracie's Amazing Vegetarian Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, chopped', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '1 tablespoon chili powder, divided', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper, divided', '2 teaspoons cayenne pepper, divided', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 cup canned pinto beans, rinsed and drained', '1 cup canned black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 cup frozen corn, thawed, drained', '1 cup cooked brown rice', '6 burrito-size flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir onion, garlic, 1 1/2 teaspoons chili powder, 1 teaspoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, and cumin in hot oil until onion softens, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir pinto beans, black beans, corn, and rice together in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Add bean mixture to skillet 1 cup at a time, stirring well after each addition.
', 'Step 5: Stir remaining chili powder, black pepper, and cayenne pepper into beans mixture, reduce heat to medium, cover the skillet with a lid, and cook, stirring as necessary, until heated through and flavors blend, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Spoon 1/6 of the bean mixture in a line across the middle of 1 tortilla.
', 'Step 7: Fold opposing edges of the tortilla to overlap the filling.
', 'Step 8: Roll 1 of the opposing edges around the filling into a burrito.
', 'Step 9: Repeat with remaining bean mixture and tortillas.
']

Title: Catfish Tacos with Avocado Crema
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 ½ teaspoons hot smoked paprika', '1 ½ teaspoons onion powder', '1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon salt, optional', '4 (6 ounce) fillets catfish', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 medium ripe avocado, peeled and pitted', '½ cup milk', '¼ cup sour cream', '2 teaspoons onion powder', '1 ½ teaspoons salt, or to taste', '1 medium lime, halved', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 medium bell peppers, sliced', '1 medium onion, sliced', '8 large (6-1/2" dia)s taco shells']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a baking pan with foil.
', 'Step 3: Mix cumin, paprika, onion powder, cayenne, garlic powder, pepper, and salt together in a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 4: Press catfish fillets into the seasoning mixture, pressing firmly on both sides, until coated.
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Add catfish and sear for about 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 7: Transfer to the prepared baking pan and wipe out the skillet.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from the oven and cut into smaller pieces.
', 'Step 10: Meanwhile, combine avocado, milk, sour cream, onion powder, and salt in a blender.
', 'Step 11: Add one lime half (rind and all) to the blender.
', 'Step 12: Squeeze the juice form the other half into the blender, and add cilantro.
', 'Step 13: Blend until completely smooth.
', 'Step 14: Heat oil for fajita vegetables in the clean skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 15: Add peppers and onion; cook until slightly browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Put catfish, avocado crema, and fajita vegetables in taco shells.
']
