Title: Fish Tamales
Ingredients: ['50 dried corn husks', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped roasted green chile peppers', '¼ cup lemon juice', '5 teaspoons hot sauce (such as Cholula®)', '5 cloves garlic, pressed, divided', '1 tablespoon finely minced white onion', '¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil', '5 pounds tilapia fillets', '3 roasted red peppers, drained and chopped', '5 bay leaves', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '2 cups coarsely chopped green cabbage', '¼ cup finely shredded red cabbage', '3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', '2 tablespoons whole-grain mustard', '1 (2 pound) package masa harina', '2 tablespoons lard', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '2 cups water', '5 tablespoons chili powder']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Soak corn husks in water for at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 2: Drain.
', 'Step 3: Combine green chiles, lemon juice, hot sauce, 1 garlic clove, and onion in a blender and blend.
', 'Step 4: Add olive oil slowly, blending sauce on low speed.
', 'Step 5: Place tilapia on a griddle over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Top fillets with roasted red peppers and 1 bay leaf each.
', 'Step 7: Pour sauce evenly over the fish.
', 'Step 8: Add 3 garlic cloves, salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 9: Cook for 5 minutes; flip and cook until lightly browned, about 3 minutes more.
', 'Step 10: Remove sauce and reserve in a bowl.
', 'Step 11: Transfer tilapia to a separate bowl and mash.
', 'Step 12: Combine green cabbage, red cabbage, vinegar, and mustard in a bowl.
', 'Step 13: Combine the reserved sauce, masa, lard, and baking powder in a large bowl; mix well.
', 'Step 14: Add water, 1 teaspoon at a time, until the mixture is as thick as biscuit dough.
', 'Step 15: Divide dough into 50 equal-sized balls.
', 'Step 16: Flatten balls into circles using a tortilla press or 2 cutting boards and 2 sheets of waxed paper.
', 'Step 17: Place a circle into a soaked and drained corn husk; add 1 1/2 ounces of fish mix in a line parallel with the husk.
', 'Step 18: Top with a small amount of cabbage.
', 'Step 19: Fold sides of dough over the filling and roll the husk around the tamale, folding in 1 end after rolling.
', 'Step 20: Repeat with remaining husks, fish, and cabbage.
', 'Step 21: Combine water, chili powder, and remaining 2 garlic cloves in a saucepan with a steamer basket; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 22: Stand tamales in basket with the folded ends down.
', 'Step 23: Cover and steam for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Remove from heat and remove tamales from husks.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '267.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '30.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '34.3 mg', 'fatContent': '6.3 g', 'fiberContent': '5.7 g', 'proteinContent': '22.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '441.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '1 g'}

Title: Helado de Cinco
Ingredients: ['1 large ripe papaya', '2 cups heavy whipping cream', '1 cup packed dark brown sugar', '5 teaspoons chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®)', '2 cups chopped strawberries']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cut the papaya in half lengthwise.
', 'Step 2: Scoop out the seeds and pulp.
', 'Step 3: Spoon out the flesh and place in a blender or food processor.
', 'Step 4: Add heavy whipping cream, brown sugar, and chili-lime seasoning to the blender or food processor; blend until smooth, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 5: Place the mixture into an airtight bowl and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight.
', "Step 6: Pour mixture into an ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes.
", 'Step 7: Add chopped strawberries in the last 5 minutes of churning.
']

Title: Charred Corn and Heirloom Tomato Steak Fajitas from Mission®
Ingredients: ['4 Mission® Soft Taco Flour Tortillas', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '½ jalapeno pepper, minced', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ cup cilantro, chopped', '2 limes, juiced', '1 teaspoon sugar', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 (12 ounce) flank steak', '½ cup heirloom tomatoes, cut into large chunks', '1 tablespoon crumbled cotija cheese', '4 Bibb lettuce leaves', 'Salt and pepper as needed', '1 cup corn, fresh cut from cob, or frozen sweet corn kernels', '½ cup red onion, diced', '1 poblano pepper, cut into strips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine garlic, jalapeno, cumin, cilantro, lime juice, sugar and oil in a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 2: Whisk until well combined and transfer to a plastic gallon-size zip top bag, add flank steak and marinate under refrigeration for 1 to 4 hours.
', 'Step 3: Assemble tomatoes, cheese and lettuce leaves on a platter.
', 'Step 4: Preheat grill to medium-high heat and place 8-inch cast iron pan directly on the grill or over side burner set to medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Remove steak from marinade, pat dry and season with salt and pepper as desired.
', 'Step 6: Grill steak for 6 to 8 minutes per side or to desired doneness.
', 'Step 7: Remove and allow steak to rest 5 minutes before slicing into 1/2-inch thick slices.
', 'Step 8: Meanwhile, coat preheated cast iron pan with non-stick spray.
', 'Step 9: Add corn, red onion and poblano peppers; saute for 6 to 8 minutes or until corn has nice char marks and peppers are tender crisp.
', 'Step 10: At the same time, coat Mission® Soft Taco Flour Tortillas with non-stick spray and grill on each side no more than 30 seconds.
', 'Step 11: Immediately place sliced steak on top of corn mixture in cast iron pan and serve sizzling hot.
']

Title: Race Day Salsa
Ingredients: ['4 ears corn on the cob with husks', '2 (15 ounce) cans no-salt-added black beans, drained and rinsed', '6 Roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '1 red onion, diced', '2 jalapeno peppers, chopped', '1 lime, juiced', '2 teaspoons chopped fresh cilantro', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can tomato juice', '1 (14 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 pinch kosher salt, or to taste', '1 pinch ground black pepper, or to taste']

', 'Step 6: Lightly toss corn with black beans, plum tomatoes, green bell pepper, red onion, jalapeno peppers, lime juice, cilantro, and garlic.
', 'Step 7: Pour tomato juice and tomato sauce over the salsa; toss again.
', 'Step 8: Season with kosher salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 9: Chill salsa at least 1 hour, preferably overnight.
']

Title: Roasted Veggie Salsa
Ingredients: ['2 poblano peppers', '1 ear corn', '1 white onion, peeled and cut into 4 slices', '1 large carrot, peeled', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pinch salt', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 lime, juiced', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Place poblano peppers, corn, onion, carrot, and garlic on the preheated grill.
', 'Step 3: Roast for 2 to 3 minutes and remove garlic and onion.
', 'Step 4: Continue roasting poblano pepper, corn, and carrot until you get a nice, even char, 3 to 4 minutes more.
', 'Step 5: Place blackened peppers into a bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 6: Allow peppers to steam as they cool, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove and discard skins and seeds.
', 'Step 8: Cut kernels off of corn cob.
', 'Step 9: Dice onions, carrots, and poblanos into medium-sized pieces.
', 'Step 10: Mix garlic and 1 pinch salt together in a bowl to make a paste.
', 'Step 11: Whisk cilantro, olive oil, lime juice, and garlic paste together in a medium bowl.
', 'Step 12: Mix in roasted vegetables.
', 'Step 13: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 14: Refrigerate until ready to serve, at least 30 minutes; serve chilled.
']

Title: Buffalo Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 pounds cooked chicken, shredded', '1 (1.6 oz) package Buffalo wing seasoning mix (such as McCormick®)', '1 (1 ounce) package dry ranch salad dressing mix (such as Hidden Valley Ranch®)', '2 cups shredded pepper Jack cheese', '2 cups shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese', "1 cup chili sauce (such as Frank's® RedHot Wings® Buffalo sauce)", '8 burrito-sized flour tortillas', '1 (4.5 ounce) package crumbled blue cheese']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a baking pan.
', 'Step 3: Place chicken in a large bowl and add Buffalo wing seasoning and ranch dressing mix.
', 'Step 4: Toss to coat.
', 'Step 5: Combine pepper Jack cheese and Colby-Monterey Jack cheese in a bowl; reserve 1 cup of cheese mixture.
', 'Step 6: Reserve about 1/2 cup Buffalo sauce and pour the rest into a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 7: Coat both sides of a tortilla with Buffalo sauce and place on a plate.
', 'Step 8: Add desired amount of chicken and cheese mixture.
', 'Step 9: Roll tortilla and place seam-side down in the prepared baking pan.

', 'Step 13: Top with blue cheese before serving.

Title: Mexican Bean Soup with Chicken
Ingredients: ['1 pound mayocoba beans (such as Rancho Gordo®)', 'water to cover', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '1 white onion, chopped', '4 Roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '1 serrano chile pepper, minced', '2 rotisserie chicken breasts, diced', '1 quart chicken stock', '½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', 'sea salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Put mayocoba beans into a large container with enough cool water to cover by several inches.
', 'Step 2: Let beans soak 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 3: Drain and rinse beans thoroughly; put into a large stockpot.
', 'Step 4: Add enough water to cover beans by 2 inches.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cover the pot.
', 'Step 6: Simmer until beans are soft in the center, about 90 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add onion; cook and stir until tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add tomatoes and serrano pepper; simmer until softened slightly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Reduce heat to medium-low and continue cooking until liquid begins to thicken, about 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 11: Season tomato mixture with salt and remove from heat.
', 'Step 12: Heat remaining oil in another large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Add chicken meat and cook, stirring occasionally, until evenly browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Stir in the tomato mixture and simmer 10 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Pour in chicken stock.
', 'Step 16: Bring soup to a boil and simmer until flavors combine, 15 minutes more.
', 'Step 17: Stir into the pot of beans.
', 'Step 18: Add cilantro and salt.
', 'Step 19: Bring to a simmer and cook until beans are completely softened, about 30 minutes more.
']

Title: Pulled Pork Tamale Pie
Ingredients: ['1 ½ teaspoons butter, or as needed', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 small onion, minced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 ½ cups prepared pulled pork', '1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 (4.5 ounce) can diced green chiles', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning', '2 (6 ounce) boxes cornbread mix (such as Martha White®)', '1 ⅓ cups milk', '2 large eggs', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican-blend cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a large casserole dish with butter.
', 'Step 3: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; stir in onion.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add garlic and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 6: Stir in pulled pork and cook until heated through, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Discard about 1/2 of the liquid from the corn and diced tomatoes with chiles; add remaining corn, diced tomatoes with chiles, and liquid to the pork mixture.
', 'Step 8: Stir in diced green chiles and taco seasoning; cook until desired consistency and heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 10: Whisk cornbread mix, milk, and eggs together in a bowl.
', 'Step 11: Pour a little more than 1/2 of the batter into the prepared casserole dish.
', 'Step 12: Bake cornbread in the preheated oven for 6 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove from the oven and pour pork mixture on top.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle with Mexican cheese, then pour the remaining cornbread batter over top.
', 'Step 15: Bake until cornbread topping is golden brown, 30 to 45 minutes.
']

Title: Zucchini Chip Nachos
Ingredients: ['1 large zucchini, sliced', 'cooking spray', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '2 tablespoons sliced black olives', '2 tablespoons chopped red onion', '8 slices pickled jalapeno pepper', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Trim ends of zucchini; use a mandoline on the thinnest setting to cut zucchini into 1/8-inch slices.

', 'Step 10: Add black olives, red onion, jalapeno peppers, and Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 11: Microwave on high power until cheese is melted, about 30 seconds.
']

Title: Chilaquiles Verdes
Ingredients: ['8 (7 inch) corn tortillas', '2 tablespoons avocado oil, divided', '½ teaspoon sea salt', '2 cups salsa verde', '2 cups black beans, cooked and drained', '4 large eggs', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 large avocado - peeled, pitted, and cubed', '2 medium tomatoes, diced', '½ small red onion, diced', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']

', 'Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour salsa verde into a skillet and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat and add baked tortilla chips.
', 'Step 7: Toss to coat and let sit for 3 to 5 minutes.

', 'Step 10: Crack eggs into the skillet and cook until outer edges become opaque, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 11: Cover, reduce heat to low, and cook until whites are completely set, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 13: Distribute salsa verde and tortillas amongst 4 bowls.
', 'Step 14: Top with a fried egg, black beans, avocado, tomatoes, red onion, and cilantro.
']

Title: Romulan Margarita

Title: Steak Brunchallta
Ingredients: ['¼ cup Worcestershire sauce', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '¾ cup chopped fresh tomatoes', '½ cup chopped red onion', '1 to taste salt and pepper to taste', '24 ounces beef top sirloin steak', '1 ½ cups sliced green bell peppers', '1 ½ cups sliced fresh mushrooms', '1 clove garlic, crushed', '5 eggs, beaten', '1 to taste salt and pepper to taste', '¼ teaspoon hot pepper sauce', '4 (10 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a medium bowl, combine Worcestershire sauce, olive oil, lime juice, cilantro, tomatoes, red onion, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 2: Place steak in a shallow non-metallic container and cover with marinate.
', 'Step 3: Refrigerate for 1 hour.
', 'Step 4: Grill steak under a preheated broiler or on a grill for 4 minutes on one side and 1 minute on the other.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat, dice into small cubes and set aside.
', 'Step 6: In a lightly oiled skillet, cook and scramble eggs to desired firmness.
', 'Step 7: Season with hot pepper sauce, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Pour marinade into a medium sauce pan and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
', 'Step 9: Add green peppers, mushrooms and garlic; simmer for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Warm tortillas on a grill or in microwave.
', 'Step 11: Line tortillas with meat and vegetables; place eggs on top.
', 'Step 12: Wrap and serve.
']

Title: Mexican Christmas Roast Pork
Ingredients: ['12 pounds boneless pork leg', '2 cups hard apple cider, divided', '1 onion, quartered', '6 cloves garlic, peeled', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ cup blanched almonds', '15 pitted prunes, sliced', '1 ½ (20 ounce) cans pineapple rings, juice drained and reserved', '2 tablespoons lard']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Pierce pork with a sharp knife, making several slits all over the top of the leg; place into a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Combine 1 cup cider, onion, garlic, salt, and pepper in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Pour over pork.
', 'Step 4: Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator, 6 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Remove pork leg from the refrigerator and bring to room temperature.
', 'Step 7: Transfer pork leg to a roasting pan, reserving juices that have collected in the bowl.
', 'Step 8: Mix pineapple juice into the bowl; pour over the pork.
', 'Step 9: Insert almonds and prunes into the slits on top and in the center of the pork.
', 'Step 10: Inject some of the remaining cider into the pork using a baster.
', 'Step 11: Pour any remaining cider on top.
', 'Step 12: Rub lard over the top of the pork and cover with pineapple slices.
', 'Step 13: Cover the roasting pan with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven, basting every 30 minutes with pan juices, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), 5 to 6 hours.
', 'Step 15: Remove foil and bake until browned, about 30 minutes more.
', 'Step 16: Remove from oven, cover with foil, and let sit for 10 minutes before carving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '328.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '13.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '124.8 mg', 'fatContent': '9.1 g', 'fiberContent': '1.2 g', 'proteinContent': '47.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '1477.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '11.6 g'}

Title: Air Fryer Vegan Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 large russet potato, peeled', '1 teaspoon plant-based butter (such as Country Crock®)', '2 tablespoons diced onion', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ cup plant-based butter (such as Country Crock®)', '2 tablespoons unsweetened plain almond milk', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '6 (6 inch) corn tortillas', 'avocado oil cooking spray']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place potato into a saucepan and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: While potato is boiling, melt 1 teaspoon plant-based butter in a skillet and saute onion until soft and translucent, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 5: Set aside.
', 'Step 6: Drain potato and transfer to a bowl.
', 'Step 7: Add 1/4 cup plant-based butter and almond milk, season with salt and pepper, and mash.
', 'Step 8: Mix in onion and garlic until well combined.
', 'Step 9: Heat tortillas in a skillet or directly on the grates of a gas stove until soft and pliable.
', 'Step 10: Place 3 tablespoons of potato mixture down one side of each tortilla; fold over.
', 'Step 11: Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Place tacos in the air fryer basket, making sure they are not touching, and mist with avocado oil.
', 'Step 13: Cook in batches if necessary.
', 'Step 14: Air fry until tacos are golden brown and crispy, 9 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Turn tacos over, mist with avocado oil, and air fry for 4 to 5 minutes more.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '180.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '23 g', 'fatContent': '8.9 g', 'fiberContent': '3.1 g', 'proteinContent': '2.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '99.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '1 g'}

Title: Almond Conchas
Ingredients: ['½ cup whole milk', '½ cup evaporated milk', '⅓ cup white sugar', '⅓ cup canola oil', '½ (4 ounce) package marzipan, cut into small pieces', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 egg', '1 (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast', '4 cups all-purpose flour, or as needed', '½ teaspoon canola oil', '⅔ cup white sugar', '½ cup butter, cut into small pieces', '½ (4 ounce) package marzipan, cut into very small pieces', '1 teaspoon almond extract', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 cup all-purpose flour']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine milk, evaporated milk, sugar, 1/3 cup canola oil, marzipan, and salt in a large microwave-safe bowl.
', 'Step 2: Microwave for 50 seconds.
', 'Step 3: Mix in egg, then yeast.
', 'Step 4: Let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add 3 cups flour and mix well.
', 'Step 6: Add enough of the remaining flour to bring dough together.
', 'Step 7: Knead dough in the bowl until pliable, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Move dough to one side and grease bowl with 1/2 teaspoon oil.
', 'Step 9: Cover bowl with plastic wrap and set aside until dough doubles in size, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 10: Meanwhile, make topping.
', 'Step 11: Combine sugar and butter in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment.
', 'Step 12: Beat on low speed for 1 minute.
', 'Step 13: Increase speed to high and continue beating.
', 'Step 14: Add marzipan, almond extract, and salt; beat until creamy.
', 'Step 15: Add flour and beat until combined and pliable.
', 'Step 16: Cover bowl and set aside.
', 'Step 17: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 18: Line a baking pan with parchment paper.
', 'Step 19: Cut dough into 20 pieces.
', 'Step 20: Shape into semi-flat rolls.
', 'Step 21: Arrange them in the baking pan.
', 'Step 22: Cut topping mixture into 20 equal pieces.
', 'Step 23: Place each piece between 2 sheets of parchment paper and press into a 2-inch circle.
', 'Step 24: Place 1 circle over each roll.
', 'Step 25: Use a butter knife to score the tops in a decorative pattern.
', 'Step 26: Cover baking pan with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 27: Let rise until doubled, 45 to 55 minutes.
', 'Step 28: Bake in the preheated oven until puffed and golden, about 18 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '264.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '37.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '22.8 mg', 'fatContent': '10.6 g', 'fiberContent': '1.2 g', 'proteinContent': '4.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '220.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '13.7 g'}

Title: Drunken Peachanero Salsa
Ingredients: ['8 ounces diced canned peaches, drained', '1 firm peach, chopped', '1 red onion, chopped', '2 habanero peppers, seeded and minced', '8 sprigs fresh cilantro, minced', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '¼ cup tequila', '2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Toss together the canned peaches, fresh peach, onion, habanero pepper, and cilantro in a mixing bowl; stir.
', 'Step 2: Pour the lime juice, tequila, and olive oil over the mixture and mix well.
', 'Step 3: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 4: Cover; refrigerate overnight or 8 hours before serving.
']

Title: Limeshot Mexi-Martini
Ingredients: ['1 (3 ounce) package lime-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®)', '1 cup boiling water', '1 cup tequila', 'coarse salt, as needed', '1 cup ice cubes, or as needed', '1 cup margarita mix', '½ cup tequila', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer', '1 lime, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine lime-flavored gelatin mix and boiling water in a bowl; stir until gelatin is dissolved.
', 'Step 2: Stir 1 cup tequila into gelatin mixture.
', 'Step 3: Pour into about 24 shot glasses and place in refrigerator to set, at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 4: n Salt the rims of 4 to 6 martini glasses.
', 'Step 5: n Combine ice, margarita mix, and 1/2 cup tequila in a cocktail shaker; shake until well mixed.
', 'Step 6: Place a lime-flavored gelatin shot in the bottom of each prepared martini glass.
', 'Step 7: Pour margarita mixture over the shot, leaving enough room to top with beer.
', 'Step 8: Top each margarita-martini with beer.
', 'Step 9: Garnish with a lime slice.
']

Title: Meatball and Olive Stew (Albondigas Verdes)
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 pound ground pork', '2 tablespoons uncooked white rice', '½ small onion, minced', '2 eggs, beaten', '¼ pound fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '2 jalapenos', '1 ½ small white onions, quartered', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '½ cup chopped cilantro', '8 ounces pitted green olives', '1 cup water', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '3 cups water', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix the ground beef, ground pork, white rice, minced onion, and eggs together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Form into 1 inch meatballs; set aside.
', 'Step 3: Place the tomatillos and jalapenos in a saucepan and cover with water.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil and simmer until tomatillos have softened and begin to turn a yellow color, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain, then transfer contents of saucepan to a blender along with the quartered onions, garlic, cilantro, green olives, and 1 cup of water.
', 'Step 6: Blend until almost smooth.
', 'Step 7: Heat the oil in the saucepan used to cook the tomatillos.
', 'Step 8: When hot, pour in the tomatillo sauce and bring to a boil, stirring.
', 'Step 9: Pour in 3 cups of water and return to a boil.
', 'Step 10: Season to taste with salt.
', 'Step 11: Stir in the meatballs.
', 'Step 12: Add water, if needed, to cover completely.
', 'Step 13: Simmer, covered, until meatballs are cooked through and the soup is thick, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Beanie Weenie Quesadilla Rolls
Ingredients: ['¼ cup condensed bean with bacon soup', '1 (8 inch) flour tortilla', '1 turkey hot dog', '¼ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']

', 'Step 2: Wrap tortilla and hot dog with a clean, lightly moist cloth.
', 'Step 3: Place soup, tortilla, and hot dog in microwave and cook on high approximately 30 seconds, or until tortilla is hot and pliable and the soup is hot.
', 'Step 4: Place hot dog and soup in center of tortilla; sprinkle with cheese and roll.
', 'Step 5: Microwave for an additional 10 seconds to fully melt the cheese.
']

Title: Mexican-Style Chicken-Stuffed Peppers
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '3 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces', '¼ cup water', '3 tablespoons chili powder', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 pinch ground cumin, or to taste', '1 pinch crushed red pepper, or to taste', '1 cup cooked rice', '½ cup black beans, rinsed and drained', '4 large green bell peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded', '1 ½ (28 ounce) cans crushed tomatoes', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 medium avocado, sliced, or to taste', '¼ cup sour cream, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 385 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat butter and oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Saute onion in the hot pan until soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add chicken; cook and stir until browned and no longer pink in the center, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to medium, and add water and chili powder.
', 'Step 6: Stir in garlic, salt, cumin, and red pepper; let cook for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add rice and black beans.
', 'Step 8: Transfer chicken mixture to a bowl.
', 'Step 9: Pour most of the crushed tomatoes into a large baking pan so it is 1 inch deep.
', 'Step 10: Stuff the chicken mixture into the bell pepper halves until slightly overfilled and place open-side up in the tomatoes.
', 'Step 11: Pour remaining crushed tomatoes over the peppers so they are just covered.
', 'Step 12: Sprinkle with Mexican cheese, and cover the pan.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until peppers are soft, about 50 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Serve hot with avocado and sour cream to garnish.
']

Title: Lisa's Favorite Mexican Rice
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 teaspoons olive oil, or to taste', '½ onion, chopped fine', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 pounds ground beef', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '4 cups cooked rice', '1 (16 ounce) package southwestern-style mixed frozen vegetables', '1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained', '2 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, divided', '½ cup salsa', '¼ cup sliced Kalamata olives']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Prepare a casserole dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Saute onion and garlic in hot oil until the onion is tender, about 5 minutes; add ground beef and continue to cook while breaking beef into small pieces with a wooden spoon until the beef is completely browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Season beef mixture with the taco seasoning mix.
', 'Step 6: Stir beef mixture, rice, vegetables, kidney beans, 1 cup Cheddar cheese, salsa, and olives together in the prepared casserole dish.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle remaining cheese over the mixture.
', 'Step 8: Bake in preheated oven until the cheese is melted and the dish is hot in the center, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Chicken Mexicala
Ingredients: ['4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cooked and chopped', '1 cup chopped onion', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '1 (5 ounce) can evaporated milk', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese']

']

Title: Chili-Flavored Turkey Stew With Hominy and Tomatoes
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large onion, cut into medium dice', '½ red bell pepper, stemmed, seeded and cut into small dice', '3 large garlic cloves, minced', '¼ cup chili powder', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth', '2 cups canned hominy, drained', '4 cups leftover turkey meat, pulled into large pieces', 'Salt and pepper, to taste', '2 tablespoons minced fresh cilantro']

', 'Step 9: Serve with tortilla or corn chips if you like.
']

Title: Mini Huevos Rancheros
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '½ medium onion, finely chopped', '½ green bell pepper, finely chopped', '½ jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', 'nonstick cooking spray', '8 large eggs', '4 (6 inch) corn tortillas', 'chopped fresh cilantro']

Title: Taco Bake with Cauliflower Veggie Tots
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds ground beef', '1 (1.25 ounce) package ORTEGA® Taco Seasoning mix', '1 cup chopped tomato', '1 cup frozen corn, thawed and drained', '½ cup sliced pitted ripe olives', '1 cup shredded Mexican blend cheese', '1 (16 ounce) package Green Giant™ Cauliflower Veggie Tots']

Title: Mindy's Pork Tacos

', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil.

Title: Ultimate Queso Dip

Title: Carrot Ceviche (Vegan)

Title: Pineapple-Shrimp Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['nonstick cooking spray', '1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', '1 small yellow onion, diced', '1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, minced', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '½ teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '2 (14 ounce) cans tomato sauce', '1 (14 ounce) can pineapple chunks, drained with juice reserved', '½ (8 ounce) package fresh baby spinach, or to taste', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 pound uncooked shrimp - peeled, deveined, and chopped', '4 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 cup freshly shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with nonstick spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat oil over medium to medium-high heat in a large, nonstick skillet until hot.
', "Step 4: Add onion and cook until it begins to caramelize and become tender, 3 to 5 minutes; reduce the temperature if it's cooking too quickly.
", 'Step 5: Add chipotle pepper in adobo, garlic, chili powder, cumin, paprika, and oregano.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat if needed and stir for 1 more minute until seasonings are fragrant.
', 'Step 7: Add tomato sauce, pineapple chunks, 1 tablespoon pineapple juice, and spinach.
', 'Step 8: Simmer over low heat, stirring frequently, until spinach is wilted.
', 'Step 9: Taste and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 10: Adjust other seasonings to your preference.
', 'Step 11: Spread 1/2 to 1 cup of the sauce in a thin layer all over the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 12: Add raw shrimp to the remaining sauce.
', 'Step 13: Simmer until shrimp are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Lay a tortilla on a baking sheet and fill with the pineapple-shrimp filling.
', 'Step 15: Roll up carefully and set into the baking dish, seam-side down.
', 'Step 16: Finish filling remaining tortillas and arranging in the baking dish, reserving about 3/4 cup of filling.
', 'Step 17: Spread the remaining filling over the enchiladas and sprinkle evenly with Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 18: Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbly and cheese is melted, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Remove from oven and allow to sit for 15 to 20 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Light Southwestern Tomato Pasta

Title: BJ's Chicken Chimichangas
Ingredients: ['2 pounds cooked skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®)', '3 (4.5 ounce) cans chopped green chile peppers', '⅔ cup sesame oil', '½ cup white sugar', '3 tablespoons minced chipotle chile peppers', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 tablespoon salt', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '10 large flour tortillas', '1 (16 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chicken, diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, chopped green chile peppers, sesame oil, sugar, chipotle chile peppers, garlic, and salt in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Cover bowl with plastic wrap and marinate chicken in the refrigerator, 1 hour to overnight.
', 'Step 3: Drain chicken in a colander.
', 'Step 4: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Cook 1 tortilla in the hot oil for 5 seconds; flip tortilla and cook for 5 seconds more.
', 'Step 6: Repeat with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 7: Spoon about 1/2 cup chicken mixture onto each tortilla.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle Monterey Jack cheese over filling.
', 'Step 9: Spoon filling in a line down the middle of a tortilla.
', 'Step 10: Fold opposing edges of the tortilla to overlap the filling.
', 'Step 11: Roll 1 of the opposing edges around the filling.
', 'Step 12: Place each chimichanga, seam-side down, in the hot oil of the same skillet until browned, about 3 minutes per side.
']

Title: Spicy Roasted Tomatillo Salsa
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '8 fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '1 serrano pepper', '1 jalapeno pepper', '½ medium yellow onion, quartered', '3 cloves garlic, unpeeled', '½ cup cilantro leaves', '1 lime, juiced', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '½ tablespoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 cup water']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler to high.
", 'Step 2: Spray a baking sheet with fat-free cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Cut tomatillos in half and place cut-side-down on the prepared baking sheet with serrano pepper, jalapeno pepper, onion, and garlic.
', 'Step 4: Broil in the preheated oven until charred, about 20 minutes, turning peppers halfway through cooking time.
', 'Step 5: Remove vegetables from the oven and let cool completely, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove stems from peppers and peel garlic.
', 'Step 7: Combine tomatillos, serrano pepper, jalapeno pepper, onion, garlic, cilantro, lime juice, and salt in a food processor and pulse to desired consistency.
', 'Step 8: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to meld flavors.
']

Title: Mango Agua Fresca with Mint
Ingredients: ['4 tablespoons white sugar', '4 ¼ cups water, divided', '3 medium ripe mangoes', '1 lime, juiced', '½ cup fresh mint leaves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine sugar and 1/4 cup water in a small saucepan and cook over low heat until the sugar melts, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove from the heat and set aside to cool, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Combine mangoes, the simple syrup (water and sugar mixture), lime juice, and 1 cup of water in the bowl of an electric blender; blend until smooth, then strain through a fine sieve into a pitcher.
', 'Step 4: Add remaining water and fresh mint, stir, and chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
']

Title: Roasted Bell Pepper Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 green bell pepper, seeded and halved', '1 red bell pepper, seeded and halved', '1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and halved', '1 tablespoon canola oil, or as needed', '2 Roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '⅓ cup chopped green onions', '¼ cup fresh chopped cilantro', '1 jalapeno pepper, minced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 lime, juiced', '½ teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set an oven rack about 4 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Place bell peppers on a broiler pan, cut-side-down.
', 'Step 3: Brush with canola oil.
', 'Step 4: Broil in the preheated oven until charred, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Transfer peppers to a bowl and cover with plastic wrap for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Peel off and discard skin and chop peppers.
', 'Step 7: Combine chopped peppers, Roma tomatoes, green onions, cilantro, jalapeno, garlic, and lime juice in a blender.

Title: Sweet Spiced Tamales
Ingredients: ['32 dried corn husks', '1 cup vegetable shortening', '1 teaspoon salt', '3 cups masa harina', '1 ½ cups warm water', '½ cup firmly packed brown sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '1 teaspoon vanilla', '⅔ cup chopped pecans', '½ cup brown sugar, divided', '32 5-inch lengths of kitchen twine']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Soak the dried corn husks in hot water until soft, 30-60 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Beat the shortening and salt with an electric mixer in a bowl until light and fluffy, and slowly beat in the masa harina 1/4 cup at a time, alternating with 1/4 cup water per addition, until the masa mixture is very light and fluffy.
', 'Step 3: Beat in 1/2 cup brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla until the mixture forms a soft, fluffy dough, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: To assemble the tamales, drain the corn husks and pat them dry.
', 'Step 5: Spread about 2 tablespoons of the masa dough onto a corn husk, forming a rectangle of dough 1/4 inch thick and about 2x3 inches in size.
', 'Step 6: Spread the dough all the way to the right edge of the corn husk, and about 1/2 inch from the left edge.
', 'Step 7: Spoon about 1 teaspoon pecans in a line down the center of the masa dough, and sprinkle the nuts with about 1 teaspoon of brown sugar.
', 'Step 8: Roll the right edge of the corn husk over the filling to the center of the tamale.
', 'Step 9: Fold the left edge towards the center, rolling the filling into the dough, so the plain edge overlaps the rolled tamale.
', 'Step 10: Fold the top end down and the bottom end up, making a tidy package, and tie securely with a piece of kitchen twine.
', 'Step 11: Fill a large saucepan with water, and place a steamer rack in the pan so the top of the rack is about 2 inches above the water.
', 'Step 12: Place the filled tamales into the steamer with seam sides down.
', 'Step 13: Bring to a boil, cover, and steam the tamales until firm and the dough releases easily from the corn husk, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
']

', 'Step 2: Cook and stir Impossible Burger in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until browned and crumbly, 5 to 6 minutes.

', 'Step 4: Lay tortillas on a flat work surface and place about 1/3 cup of filling in the center of each tortilla.
', 'Step 5: Fold tortilla sides up over filling and roll up like burritos.
', 'Step 6: Place chimichangas on a foil-lined baking sheet and brush with oil.
', 'Step 7: Bake until golden and crisp, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Buffalo Taco Dip
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 pound ground buffalo meat', '2 (1 ounce) packets taco seasoning mix', '1 (14.25 ounce) can refried beans', '2 cups guacamole', '2 cups sour cream', '1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives', '1 bunch green onions, chopped', '3 jalapeno peppers, chopped', '2 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook the onion in the oil until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the ground buffalo.
', 'Step 6: Cook, breaking up meat with a spoon as it browns, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle the contents of 1 taco seasoning packet over meat and onion; mix well.
', 'Step 8: Combine the remaining packet of taco seasoning mix and the refried beans in a small bowl.
', 'Step 9: Spread seasoned beans in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Layer the buffalo and onion mixture, guacamole, and sour cream over the beans.
', 'Step 11: Top with the black olives, green onions, jalapenos, and the shredded Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted, and the ingredients are hot, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Tortilla Sundae With Minted Mango Salsa
Ingredients: ['2 cups vegetable or canola oil', '¼ cup sugar', '1 tablespoon cinnamon', '10 (6 inch) corn tortillas (cut 2 into 1/2-inch strips)', '1 small mango, cut into small dice', '½ Granny Smith apple, unpeeled, cut into small dice', '4 large strawberries, hulled and cut into small dice', '1 ½ tablespoons chopped fresh mint', '1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', '2 tablespoons orange marmalade', '1 ½ teaspoons minced fresh ginger', '1 pint peach sorbet', '1 pint raspberry sherbet', '1 pint vanilla ice cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a 10-inch skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat to 370 degrees or until a tortilla strip dropped in sizzles vigorously.
', 'Step 2: Mix sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl.
', 'Step 3: Set aside.
', 'Step 4: Using tongs, slide one tortilla into the oil.
', 'Step 5: Fry, turning once, until it stops sizzling and turns golden brown, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove and set on paper towels lining a large wire rack set over a shallow pan.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle liberally with cinnamon sugar.
', 'Step 8: Repeat with one tortilla at a time, then the tortilla strips.
', 'Step 9: (Can be stored in foil or a large tin overnight.
', 'Step 10: ) Up to 4 hours ahead, mix next 7 ingredients for salsa; refrigerate until ready to serve.
', 'Step 11: Put 3 small scoops of sorbet or ice cream on each tortilla.
', 'Step 12: Top with fruit, garnish with tortilla strips and serve immediately.
']

Title: Eggplant Salsa and Homemade Pita Chips
Ingredients: ['4 medium eggplants', '1 large red bell pepper, halved and seeded', '4 large tomatoes, seeded and diced', '1 clove chopped fresh garlic', '1 lime, juiced', 'salt and pepper to taste', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ cup olive oil', '1 (10 ounce) package pita bread rounds', '¼ cup butter, melted']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Slice the tops off of the eggplants, and place on a baking sheet with the red pepper halves.
', 'Step 3: Drizzle with olive oil to lightly coat.
', 'Step 4: Bake for about 40 minutes in the preheated oven, until eggplant is tender.
', 'Step 5: Remove from the oven, and place the eggplant and peppers into a large resealable bag.
', 'Step 6: Seal, and let sit for 15 minutes to loosen the skin.
', 'Step 7: Remove from the bag, peel off the skins, and dice the eggplants and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Transfer to a large bowl.
', 'Step 9: Place the tomatoes, and garlic in to the bowl with the roasted vegetables, and season with salt, pepper and cilantro.
', 'Step 10: Mix until well blended.
', 'Step 11: Set aside.
', 'Step 12: Set the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Peel apart the pita breads into two thin circles.
', 'Step 14: You may cut off the edges to make it easier.
', 'Step 15: Brush melted butter onto what used to be the inside, and stack together.
', 'Step 16: Cut into strips, then cut across at a diagonal to make diamond shapes.
', 'Step 17: If you have kitchen scissors, it will be easy.
', 'Step 18: Place them on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 19: Bake the pita chips for 5 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until lightly toasted.
', 'Step 20: Stir occasionally if they overlap.
']

Title: Cheesy Rolled Tacos with Chicken
Ingredients: ['¾ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground paprika', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 drizzle olive oil, or to taste', '¾ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '12 (8 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Mix oregano, onion powder, salt, paprika, chili powder, cumin, and pepper together in a bowl until well combined.
', 'Step 4: Place chicken breasts on the prepared baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
', 'Step 5: Spread 1/2 of the seasoning mixture on both sides of chicken.
', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven, flipping halfway through cooking time, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the chicken reads at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from the oven and transfer chicken to a cutting board.
', 'Step 8: Leave the oven on, and line baking sheet with a fresh piece of parchment paper.
', 'Step 9: Shred cooked chicken with 2 forks and transfer to a bowl.
', 'Step 10: Mix in Mexican cheese, cream cheese, and remaining seasoning blend until well combined.
', 'Step 11: Place a couple of scoops of the mixture across the bottom 1/3 of a tortilla.
', 'Step 12: Roll up tightly and place on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 13: Repeat with remaining mixture and tortillas.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until golden and crispy, about 15 minutes.
']

Title: Joanne's Jalapeno Chicken
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '6 jalapeno peppers, or to taste, seeded and chopped', '1 onion, chopped', '1 pound chicken tenders, cut into bite-size pieces', '¼ teaspoon chicken seasoning blend, or to taste', '½ (10 ounce) can pina colada mix', '1 cup sour cream', '½ (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle bock beer']

', 'Step 3: Sprinkle the chicken tenders with chicken seasoning, and cook and stir in the olive oil until slightly golden brown and no longer pink inside, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Transfer the chicken to a bowl.
', 'Step 5: Return the jalapeno peppers and onions to the skillet, and stir in the pina colada mix and sour cream.
', 'Step 6: Bring the mixture just to a simmer, reduce heat, and simmer for 5 minutes; stir in the chicken, and mix in the bock beer.
', 'Step 7: Simmer until the flavors have blended and the sauce has slightly thickened, 15 to 30 more minutes.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken and Vegetable Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil, or more as needed', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '1 medium onion, diced', '1 ½ cups diced carrots', '1 cup diced celery', '5 cloves garlic, chopped', '2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '1 (10 ounce) package frozen corn', '1 (8 ounce) can red enchilada sauce', '4 ½ cups chicken broth', '2 ½ cups water', '3 large red potatoes, chopped', '1 medium lime, juiced, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground dried chipotle pepper', '1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 cup tortilla strips']

Title: World's Best Guacamole

['Step 1: Combine the onion with the juice of 2 limes in a small bowl; allow the onion to soak in the lime juice for 2 hours.

Title: Purslane Pork Stew
Ingredients: ['2 pounds pork ribs, cut into 2-inch sections', '1 pound boneless pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes', '½ cup water', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 onion, quartered', '6 tomatillos, husked and quartered', '2 serrano chile peppers', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', 'water to cover', '4 cloves garlic, peeled', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 bunches purslane']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine pork ribs, pork shoulder, water, and salt in a Dutch oven over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Uncover and increase heat to medium-high.
', 'Step 4: Continue cooking and stirring constantly until all liquid has evaporated and pork has browned, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Combine onion, tomatillos, serrano peppers, and cilantro in a medium saucepan.
', 'Step 6: Add enough water to cover.
', 'Step 7: Bring to a boil and cook until tomatillos are tender and have changed color, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Transfer vegetable mixture to a blender; add garlic and and blend carefully until sauce is smooth.
', 'Step 9: Pour sauce into the Dutch oven, season stew with salt and pepper, and simmer for 1 hour.
', 'Step 10: Add purslane and simmer until pork is tender and purslane is soft, about 20 minutes more.
']

Title: Spicy Chicken Taquitos

Title: Mexican Chicken and Corn Soup (Pozolillo Verde)
Ingredients: ['1 (2 to 3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces', '2 quarts chicken stock', '1 small head garlic', 'salt to taste', '10 large fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '2 small avocados, peeled and pitted', '1 ½ cups chopped fresh cilantro', '1 cup water', '¼ head romaine lettuce, chopped', '2 poblano chiles, seeded and deveined', '2 serrano peppers', '6 cups white corn kernels']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Rinse skin-on chicken pieces under cold running water.
', 'Step 2: Trim off extra pieces of fat.
', 'Step 3: Place chicken in a large pot and add chicken stock, garlic, and salt.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover, and simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Skim off any foam that rises to the surface.
', 'Step 6: Combine tomatillos, avocados, cilantro, water, lettuce, poblano chiles, and serrano peppers in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Strain and pour into the pot with the chicken.
', 'Step 8: Bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Season with salt.
', 'Step 10: Stir in corn kernels and bring to a boil again.
', 'Step 11: Simmer until flavors are well combined and corn is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Discard garlic and serve.
']

Title: Gorditas Mexicanas
Ingredients: ['2 cups water', '1 pound chicken thighs and drumsticks', '2 tablespoons chicken bouillon granules', '½ onion', '1 clove garlic', '2 cups instant corn masa flour (such as Maseca®)', '1 ¼ cups water, or more as needed', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ cup oil for frying, or as needed', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans (such as Goya®)', '½ head lettuce, finely chopped', '1 large tomato, diced', '1 large avocado, sliced', '8 ounces grated cotija cheese', '1 cup sour cream, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken, chicken bouillon, onion, and garlic.
', 'Step 3: Cover and simmer until chicken is no longer pink the middle, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Meanwhile, preheat a pancake grill to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Mix corn flour, 1 1/4 cups water, and salt together in a bowl until a smooth, moist dough is formed.
', 'Step 6: Add more water if the dough seems too dry.
', 'Step 7: Divide dough into 8 to 10 medium-sized balls and pat each into a 1/4-inch thick round.
', 'Step 8: Cook dough rounds on the preheated grill until cooked on the outside, about 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 9: Pull the edges out while still hot, making a little indention in the center of each gordita.
', 'Step 10: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Deep fry gorditas until golden brown on both sides, 2 to 5 minutes per gordita.
', 'Step 12: Set aside on a wire cooling rack.
', 'Step 13: Pour beans into a small saucepan and warm over medium heat.
', 'Step 14: Drain chicken, reserving cooking liquid.
', 'Step 15: Remove meat from the bones and transfer meat to a food processor.
', 'Step 16: Add a few tablespoons of cooking liquid and chop to desired consistency.
', 'Step 17: Spread a layer of warm beans on each gordita, then top with chopped chicken, lettuce, tomato, avocado, and cotija cheese.
', 'Step 18: Finish with a dollop of sour cream.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '591.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '39 g', 'cholesterolContent': '77.6 mg', 'fatContent': '39 g', 'fiberContent': '10.6 g', 'proteinContent': '24 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '13.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '1155.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.1 g'}

Title: Fiesta Turkey Tavern
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 ¼ pounds ground turkey', '1 cup finely chopped white onion', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 ½ tablespoons prepared yellow mustard, divided', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '⅛ teaspoon chili powder', '1 cup water', '¼ cup finely chopped jalapeno', '5 hamburger buns']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the olive oil over medium-low heat; cook and stir the ground turkey, using the back of a wooden spoon to work the meat into small crumbles as it cooks.
', 'Step 2: When the meat is about half browned, stir in the onion, garlic, and black pepper; cook and stir until the turkey is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink.
', 'Step 3: Stir in 1 tablespoon of the prepared mustard, the cayenne pepper, chili powder, and water.
', 'Step 4: Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce the heat, and simmer, stirring, until the water has evaporated, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the remaining mustard and the chopped jalapeno, and cook until heated through, about 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 6: Spoon the mixture onto the hamburger buns.
']

Title: Mexican Gazpacho
Ingredients: ['1 large poblano pepper', '1 teaspoon olive oil', '1 cucumber - peeled, seeded, and diced', '½ cup onion, finely diced', '2 ½ pounds fresh ripe tomatoes - stemmed, peeled, and seeded', '1 jalapeno pepper, stemmed and chopped', '3 cloves garlic, smashed', '1 lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cumin']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Rub the poblano pepper with olive oil.
', 'Step 2: Roast over the gas flame of your stove, turning often, until the skin is black, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Place pepper into a paper bag and seal; set aside to cool, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Combine cucumber and onion in a bowl.
', 'Step 5: Set aside.
', 'Step 6: Take cooled poblano from the bag and scrape off the burned skin.
', 'Step 7: Remove stem and seeds; roughly chop the pepper.
', 'Step 8: Place tomatoes, poblano, jalapeno, garlic, lime juice, sugar, salt, pepper, and cumin into the bowl of a food processor and pulse until thick and not runny.
', 'Step 9: Add cucumber and onion; pulse 3 to 4 times to incorporate.
', 'Step 10: Refrigerate until chilled, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Serve.
']

Title: Fried Fish Tacos to Remind You of Baja California
Ingredients: ['1 onion, cut into thin slices', '2 teaspoons salt, divided', '1 teaspoon dried basil', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '4 limes, divided', 'water to cover', '¾ cup sour cream', '⅓ cup mayonnaise', '1 quart canola oil for frying', '18 corn tortillas', '2 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle dark beer', '1 ¼ pounds whitefish, cut into 3x1-inch strips', '1 egg', '⅓ head cabbage, thinly sliced', '1 cup pico de gallo salsa', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place onion in resealable plastic bag with 1 teaspoon salt, basil, and oregano.
', 'Step 2: Squeeze in juice from 1 1/2 limes.
', 'Step 3: Add enough water to help spread marinade all over the onion slices.
', 'Step 4: Seal and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 5: Combine sour cream, mayonnaise, and the juice of 1 lime in a bowl.
', 'Step 6: Mix, adding more lime juice as needed, until the white sauce is runny.

', 'Step 9: Preheat the oven to 225 degrees F (110 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Place tortillas in oven to keep warm.

', 'Step 12: Dip 3 to 4 pieces of fish into the mixture and fry in the hot oil until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 14: Repeat with remaining fish.
', 'Step 15: Place fried fish over warmed tortillas, topped with the marinated onions, white sauce, lime wedges, cabbage, pico de gallo, and cilantro.

Title: Sopa Azteca
Ingredients: ['5 dried red chile pepper pods', '5 tomatoes, cut into wedges', '1 small onion, cut into wedges', '1 cube chicken bouillon', '4 teaspoons dried oregano', '2 teaspoons ground thyme', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', 'vegetable oil as needed', '4 corn tortillas, cut into strips', '¼ cup Mexican crema, or to taste', '2 limes, cut into wedges', '1 avocado, cubed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add chile peppers and boil until soft, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer peppers to a dish and let cool slightly, about 5 minutes; reserve chile water.
', 'Step 4: Remove and discard stems and seeds from peppers, keeping a few seeds if you like a spicy soup.
', 'Step 5: Combine chiles, tomatoes, onion, bouillon, oregano, and thyme in an electric blender; add as much reserved chile water as possible to fill line.
', 'Step 6: Blend until liquefied.
', 'Step 7: Strain chile mixture into a large pot.
', 'Step 8: Add remaining chile water, adding additional water if necessary.
', 'Step 9: Bring to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 10: Reduce heat to low and let simmer, 20 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 12: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Fry tortilla strips in the hot oil under golden brown and crispy, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to absorb excess oil.
', 'Step 15: Distribute soup evenly between serving bowls and garnish with fried tortilla strips, crema, lime wedges, and avocado.
']

Title: Air Fryer Tofu Milanesa
Ingredients: ['1 (8 ounce) container firm tofu, drained and pressed', '⅓ cup dry bread crumbs', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning mix', '2 eggs', 'cooking spray']

', 'Step 2: Cut each slab into two triangles.
', 'Step 3: Mix bread crumbs and taco seasoning together in a shallow pan or plate.

', 'Step 5: Preheat the air fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

', 'Step 7: Dredge them in the bread crumb mixture.
', 'Step 8: Gently press down to coat each side.
', 'Step 9: Arrange in a single layer on a plate.
', 'Step 10: Spray lightly with cooking spray.
', 'Step 11: Cook in the air fryer on one side for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Flip each triangle and spray lightly with cooking spray.

', 'Step 14: You may need to cook in batches, depending on the size of your air fryer basket.
']

Title: Blackened Fish Tacos with Creamy Avocado Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons garlic powder', '1 ½ teaspoons smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon brown sugar', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 (4 ounce) fillets flounder', '1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed', '6 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '½ (8 ounce) package coleslaw mix', '½ cup chopped cilantro', '2 medium limes, juiced', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 large avocado, diced', '½ cup chopped cilantro', '¼ cup water', '2 medium limes, juiced', '3 tablespoons mayonnaise', '2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ tablespoon chopped pickled jalapeno peppers']

Title: Meatless Mexican Lasagna
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 medium yellow squash, grated', '¼ cup finely chopped onion', '1 (16 ounce) can vegetarian refried beans', '4 (10 inch) whole wheat tortillas', '1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 cup cottage cheese', '½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (16 ounce) jar salsa']

Title: Instant Pot® Taco Pasta
Ingredients: ['½ pound 93% lean ground turkey', '1 ½ cups uncooked large elbow macaroni', '1 ¼ cups water', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chiles (such as Rotel®)', '2 tablespoons tomato powder', '1 ½ cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese', '¼ cup Mexican crema (such as Cacique(R) Crema Mexicana Agria)', '2 tablespoons taco seasoning mix, or more to taste', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 medium fresh jalapeno pepper, sliced', '2 tablespoons sliced black olives']

", 'Step 9: Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Unlock and remove the lid.

', 'Step 12: Serve immediately, garnished with jalapeno and black olive slices.

Title: Ahi Tuna Tacos with Pineapple Salsa
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons ground black pepper', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons garlic powder', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', '1 pound ahi tuna steaks', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '4 tablespoons fat-free sour cream', '4 (10 inch) flour tortillas, warmed', '½ whole fresh pineapple - peeled, cored, and diced', '½ medium red onion, diced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '1 tablespoon crushed red pepper', '2 teaspoons grated lime zest']

Title: Shredded Chicken and Cheese Taquitos
Ingredients: ['3 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, chopped', '1 cup sliced olives', '1 (7 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained', '¾ cup water', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend', '10 (6 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken in a single layer in the bottom of a large saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Pour in cool water until chicken is covered by 1 inch.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to a simmer, cover, and cook until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 10 to 14 minutes.
', 'Step 5: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Transfer chicken to a cutting board and shred meat with 2 forks when cool enough to handle.
', 'Step 7: Discard poaching liquid.
', 'Step 8: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Grease a baking sheet.
', 'Step 10: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat; add onion.
', 'Step 11: Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add shredded chicken, olives, chiles, water, and taco seasoning; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 13: Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Add Mexican cheese and stir until melted.
', 'Step 15: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 16: Warm tortillas on a griddle over medium-high heat until soft, about 10 seconds per side.
', 'Step 17: Add chicken filling to each tortilla, roll up tightly, and place seam-side down on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 18: Bake in the preheated oven until edges are brown, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Baked Chicken Flautas
Ingredients: ['2 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '½ medium onion, cut into chunks', '2 cloves garlic', '1 tablespoon salt', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 (1.41 ounce) package sazon seasoning with saffron (such as Goya® Azafran)', '½ cup vegetable oil for frying', '14 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken breasts, onion, garlic, and salt in a deep pot.
', 'Step 2: Cover with water and cook over medium heat, adding water if it starts to get low, until chicken is no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 30 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat and shred chicken with 2 forks.
', 'Step 4: Reserve 1/2 cup stock.
', 'Step 5: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Add shredded chicken and sazon seasoning.
', 'Step 7: Add the reserved chicken stock, stir well, and reduce heat.
', 'Step 8: Cook until all stock has evaporated.
', 'Step 9: Remove from the heat and allow to cool.
', 'Step 10: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Place another frying pan over medium heat with 1/2 cup of vegetable oil.
', 'Step 12: Begin frying corn tortillas one at a time until soft, but not crispy, 30 seconds to 1 minute, flipping once.
', 'Step 13: Place the tortillas aside as you fry them.
', 'Step 14: Place 1 tablespoon of cooked chicken on one end of each tortilla along with 1 tablespoon of Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 15: Roll into flautas and place side by side on a cookie sheet.
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes.
']

Title: Vegan Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['3 (6 inch) corn tortillas, divided', '1 tablespoon avocado oil', '1 guajillo chile, seeded and deveined', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '½ small onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '6 Roma tomatoes, chopped', '2 cups vegetable stock', 'salt to taste', '½ avocado, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cut 2 tortillas in half and then into 1/8-inch strips.
', 'Step 3: Place in a bowl and toss with avocado oil.
', 'Step 4: Arrange strips in a single layer on a baking sheet.

', 'Step 6: Remove from oven and set aside for garnishing.

', 'Step 18: Blend until smooth.

', 'Step 20: If you prefer a very fine soup, you can strain it into the saucepan.
', 'Step 21: Bring to a boil and let simmer until flavors meld, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Garnish with baked tortilla strips and avocado slices.
']

Title: Mexican Vegetable Rice Bowl
Ingredients: ['4 teaspoons liquid amino acid (such as Bragg®), divided', '¼ teaspoon onion powder', '1 large zucchini, diced small', '2 large kale leaves, cut into 1-inch squares', '½ (14 ounce) can coconut milk', '½ cup raw macadamia nuts', '¼ cup raw cashews', '¼ cup nutritional yeast', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 pinch red pepper flakes, or to taste', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '1 cup hot cooked brown rice']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Stir 1 tablespoon liquid amino acid and onion powder together in a small bowl to dissolve the powder into liquid; pour into a large plastic resealable bag; add zucchini and kale and work the bag to coat vegetables with the marinade.
', 'Step 2: Squeeze bag to remove excess air and seal.
', 'Step 3: Marinate vegetables for 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Blend coconut milk, macadamia nuts, cashews, nutritional yeast, chili powder, remaining liquid amino acid, cayenne pepper, and red pepper flakes in a blender until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Pour zucchini and kale from the plastic bag into the skillet; saute just until heated through, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Divide cooked rice between two bowls; top each portion with about half the vegetable mixture.
', 'Step 8: Drizzle the blended sauce over the vegetables.
']

Title: Smoky Pico de Gallo
Ingredients: ['1 large sweet onion, diced', '2 jalapeno chile peppers, diced', '1 habanero chile pepper, diced', '6 cloves garlic, peeled and finely chopped', '1 ½ tablespoons olive oil', '12 Roma (plum) tomatoes, diced', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 fresh limes, juiced, with pulp reserved', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon seasoned salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat a smoker grill for 200 degrees F (95 degrees C).
', "Step 2: Add water to the bowl and wood chips to the side tray according to manufacturer's directions.
", 'Step 3: Place onion, jalapeno peppers, habanero peppers, and garlic in an aluminum roasting pan small enough to fit into your smoker.
', 'Step 4: Drizzle with olive oil, stirring to completely cover.
', 'Step 5: Place the roasting pan into the preheated smoker.
', 'Step 6: Smoke, using 1 to 2 pans of wood chips, until vegetables are tender but not dried out, about 1 to 2 hours.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, place tomatoes in a large glass bowl.
', 'Step 8: Add cilantro, lime juice, lime pulp, cumin, and seasoned salt.
', 'Step 9: Mix to combine, cover, and refrigerate.
', 'Step 10: Add smoked vegetables to the tomato mixture, stir to combine, and return to refrigerator to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
']

Title: Jan's 20-Minute One-Pot Fajitas
Ingredients: ['2 cups chicken stock, divided', '3 cups chopped assorted bell peppers, such as yellow, green and red', '1 onion, diced', '1 (15 ounce) can reduced sodium black beans, drained', '1 (5.4 ounce) package Knorr® Fiesta Sides™ - Mexican Rice or Spanish Rice', '2 cooked chicken breasts (skin and bones removed), sliced into strips', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese', '10 flour tortillas']

Title: Pressure Cooker Taco Pulled Pork

', 'Step 2: Season each portion with salt.
', 'Step 3: Heat canola oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook pork, working in batches, until brown crust forms, about 8 minutes per side.
', 'Step 5: Transfer to a plate and coat evenly with taco seasoning.
', 'Step 6: Pour broth into a pressure cooker with rack insert; place pork on rack.
', 'Step 7: Place lid on pressure cooker and lock; bring to low pressure over medium-low heat until pork is tender and shreds easily, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Let pressure come down naturally, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Shred pork using 2 forks.
']

Title: Carne Con Chilies
Ingredients: ['4 large boneless pork chops, fat trimmed and reserved', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '½ teaspoon garlic powder, or to taste', '½ teaspoon seasoning salt, or to taste', '1 lime, cut into 4 wedges', '10 tomatillos, husked and cut in half', '1 tomato, quartered', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and halved', '3 dried red chile peppers, chopped', '1 clove garlic', '½ teaspoon salt, or to taste']

['Step 1: Slice pork chops into strips, and season with pepper, garlic powder and seasoning salt.
', 'Step 2: Squeeze lime juice over pieces.
', 'Step 3: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Add fat, and cook, stirring until pan is coated.
', 'Step 5: Remove fat, and put the seasoned meat in the pan.
', 'Step 6: Fry until browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: At the same time, make the green sauce.
', 'Step 8: Combine the tomatillos, tomato, jalapenos, and dried chilies in a saucepan.

', 'Step 10: Drain excess liquid, and transfer to a blender or food processor along with the garlic and salt.
', 'Step 11: Blend until smooth.

', 'Step 13: Taste, and adjust salt and pepper if necessary.
']

Title: Vegan Chili-Lime Jackfruit Tacos
Ingredients: ['2 (20 ounce) cans young green jackfruit packed in water, drained', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon black pepper', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon salt', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large shallot, minced', '¾ cup water', '¼ cup orange juice', '1 medium lime, juiced', '1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, minced', '2 tablespoons maple syrup', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '2 leaf (blank)s bay leaves', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '8 (6 inch) corn tortillas, warmed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix jackfruit with garlic, paprika, onion powder, black pepper, chili powder, cumin, and salt in a large bowl, using your hands to shred the jackfruit while mixing until it has a pulled pork consistency.
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add shallot and saute until soft, 2 to 3 minutes.
', "Step 4: Add seasoned jackfruit and let cook together, 4 to 5 minutes; it's okay if the jackfruit starts sticking to the pan.
", 'Step 5: Pour in water and stir, making sure you get any yummy pieces that may be sticking to the bottom of the pan.
', 'Step 6: Add orange juice, lime juice, chipotle pepper, maple syrup, oregano, bay leaves, salt, and pepper; mix together well.
', 'Step 7: Let simmer, stirring occasionally and breaking down the jackfruit more if necessary, for 25 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Drain if there is an excess of liquid during the cooking process; you want all of the liquid cooked down.
', 'Step 9: Taste and add more salt or pepper if needed.
', 'Step 10: Serve on warm corn tortillas.
']

Title: Meatballs Mexicana and Rice
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 ½ teaspoons dried oregano', '1 tablespoon dried parsley', 'salt, to taste', '1 cup rice', '2 cups water', '1 tablespoon cooking oil', '2 small onions, minced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (14.25 ounce) can tomato puree', '1 bay leaf', '2 tablespoons white vinegar', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon dried parsley', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon brown sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (11 ounce) can Mexican-style corn, drained']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix together the ground beef, 1 1/2 teaspoon oregano, 1 tablespoon parsley, and salt in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Bring rice and water to a boil in a pot.
', 'Step 3: Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: While the rice cooks, heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Cook 1 minced onion and 1 minced clove in the hot oil until the onion is soft; add to the beef mixture; form into 24 small meatballs.
', 'Step 6: Cook the meatballs in the skillet until evenly browned on all sides; drain.
', 'Step 7: Place the remaining minced onion and minced garlic clove in the skillet; cook and stir until the onion is soft.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the tomato puree, bay leaf, vinegar, 1 teaspoon oregano, 1 tablespoon parsley, chili powder, brown sugar, cumin, salt, and pepper; cook until thick, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add the meatballs and cook until the meatballs are no longer pink in the middle, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: When the rice has finished cooking, stir in the corn.
', 'Step 11: Serve the meatballs and sauce over the rice.
']

Title: Mexican Rice Soup with Mushrooms
Ingredients: ['2 cups hot water', '1 cup uncooked white rice', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '4 cups water, divided', '5 sprigs flat-leaf parsley', '¼ white onion', '2 cloves garlic', '1 (8 ounce) package sliced fresh mushrooms', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped', '2 tablespoons chicken bouillon granules']

', 'Step 2: Rinse until water runs clear and drain very well.

', 'Step 4: Add rice and cook, stirring constantly, until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Combine 1 cup water, parsley, onion, and garlic in a blender.

Title: Taco Cheesecake
Ingredients: ['1 cup crushed tortilla chips', '1 tablespoon butter, melted', '1 pound lean ground beef', '1 package taco seasoning, divided', '⅓ cup salsa', '2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened', '2 large eggs', '2 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '½ cup shredded lettuce', '1 tomato, chopped', '4 slices avocado']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Stir tortilla chips and butter together in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
', 'Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove crust from oven, leaving oven on.
', 'Step 6: Cool on a wire rack.
', 'Step 7: Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add beef and cook, stirring, until crumbly and no longer pink, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 10: Pat beef dry with paper towels and return to the skillet.
', 'Step 11: Reserve 1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix.
', 'Step 12: Stir remaining taco seasoning and salsa into beef.
', 'Step 13: Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until liquid evaporates, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Beat cream cheese in a bowl using an electric mixer until fluffy.
', 'Step 15: Add eggs and reserved taco seasoning mix, beating until blended.
', 'Step 16: Add Cheddar cheese and beat until blended.
', 'Step 17: Spread mixture evenly over crust and 1 inch up sides of pan.
', 'Step 18: Spoon in beef mixture.
', 'Step 19: Combine sour cream and flour in a bowl; spread over cheesecake.
', 'Step 20: Bake in the hot oven for 25 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Run a knife around the edges and release sides of pan.
', 'Step 23: Serve warm, cold, or room temperature with a topping of lettuce, tomato, and avocado.
']

Title: Fish Tacos With Cabbage Salsa and Yogurt Sauce
Ingredients: ['½ medium head cabbage, shredded', '2 medium tomatoes, chopped, or more to taste', '2 cups chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '¼ cup honey', '4 medium limes, juiced, divided', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 cup plain yogurt', '1 tablespoon mayonnaise, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon dried dill weed', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper, divided, or to taste', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon sumac powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '4 (4 ounce) tilapia fillets', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '8 (6 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine cabbage, tomatoes, 1 1/2 cups cilantro, jalapeno pepper, honey, and 3/4 of the lime juice in a big bowl.
', 'Step 2: Mix well and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 3: Mix yogurt and 1 tablespoon mayonnaise in a small bowl.
', 'Step 4: Add remaining 1/2 cup cilantro, remaining lime juice, dill, and 1/8 teaspoon cayenne and season with salt.
', "Step 5: If it's too tart for your taste, add more mayonnaise.
", 'Step 6: Mix oregano, sumac, cumin, and remaining 1/8 teaspoon cayenne in a bowl.
', 'Step 7: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Rub spice mix onto both sides of the tilapia fillets.
', 'Step 9: Heat oil in a cast iron skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering.
', 'Step 10: Add tilapia and cook until blackened and fish flakes easily with a fork, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 11: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 12: Heat tortillas in a dry skillet over medium-high heat for 30 to 60 seconds per side.
', 'Step 13: Put some blackened tilapia in each tortilla and top with cabbage salsa.
', 'Step 14: Fold in half and return to the hot skillet to lightly crisp on each side.
', 'Step 15: Serve immediately with yogurt sauce on the side, to be used as a dip.
']

Title: Pineapple Tepache
Ingredients: ['1 large ripe fresh pineapple', '1 ½ gallons water', '2 cups brown sugar', '1 medium apple, cored and sliced', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Wash and remove the pineapple crown.
', 'Step 2: Carefully remove the rind and set aside.
', 'Step 3: Cut one 1/2-inch slice of pineapple and set it aside for this recipe.
', 'Step 4: Reserve remaining pineapple for a different use.
', 'Step 5: Place the pineapple rind in a large pot with water, brown sugar, apple slices, and cinnamon over medium-high heat; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Boil for about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Turn off heat and allow mixture to cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add pineapple slice, cover, and allow to sit at room temperature until tepache has fermented to the desired degree, about 36 hours.
', 'Step 9: Strain tepache though a sieve in order to remove solids and store drink covered in the refrigerator.
']
