Title: Flank Steak with Grilled PPN Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 California peach, pitted', '1 California plum, pitted', '1 California nectarine, pitted', '1 jalapeno pepper, stemmed and seeded, or more to taste', '¼ cup minced red onion', '2 tablespoons minced cilantro', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '2 pounds flank steak', '2 teaspoons garlic salt', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon oregano', '½ teaspoon chipotle or ancho chili powder, or more to taste']

', 'Step 2: Place fruit and jalapenos on a well-oiled grill over medium heat and cook for a few minutes on each side to lightly char.

', 'Step 7: Stir together garlic salt, cumin, oregano and chili powder in a small bowl and rub onto both sides of meat.
', 'Step 8: Place on grill over medium heat and cook for 5 to 7 minutes on each side or until meat is cooked to your liking.
', 'Step 9: Let stand for 5 minutes before thinly carving at an angle against the grain.
', 'Step 10: Transfer meat and juices to a platter.
', 'Step 11: Serve with grilled PPN salsa.

Title: Acorn Squash Wonder Tacos/Chalupas
Ingredients: ['1 cup canola oil, or as needed', '1 large acorn squash - peeled, seeded, and grated', '2 tablespoons grated red onion', '1 serrano chile pepper, finely chopped', '3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 egg', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon salt, or more to taste', '1 pinch freshly ground black pepper', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '4 corn tortillas', '¼ cup shredded lettuce, or to taste', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and chopped', '1 tomato, chopped', '¼ cup freshly grated cotija cheese']

['Step 1: Heat canola oil in a deep fryer or heavy pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Mix squash, onion, serrano pepper, flour, egg, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Drop squash mixture by the spoonful, working in batches, in the hot oil; fry until golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Transfer squash fritters to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
', 'Step 5: Fry the corn tortillas in the hot oil until crisp, about 2 minutes per side.

Title: Mexican-Inspired Shepherd's Pie
Ingredients: ['2 ¼ cups peeled and cubed potatoes', '1 pound ground beef', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 onion, diced', '1 red bell pepper, diced', '½ (10 ounce) package frozen corn', '3 tablespoons water', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 cup shredded Emmentaler cheese', '3 tablespoons taco sauce', '2 tablespoons butter, cut into pieces', '½ cup milk', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']

['Step 1: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 25 minutes.

', 'Step 11: Transfer corn mixture to a shallow baking dish and spread to cover the bottom.
', 'Step 12: Top with seasoned meat.
', 'Step 13: Drain potatoes.
', 'Step 14: Add Emmentaler cheese, taco sauce, and butter and mash with potatoes.
', 'Step 15: Add milk, salt, and pepper, mash until smooth, and spread on top of seasoned meat.

']

Title: One-Pot Texas Borracho Beans
Ingredients: ['6 ounces bacon, roughly chopped', '1 yellow onion, chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped', '2 cups chicken stock', '1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 cup water', '1 green onion, chopped', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or more to taste', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon ground dried chipotle pepper']

['Step 1: Place bacon in a 2-quart pot.

', 'Step 3: Remove some bacon grease, as needed, to keep from boiling the bacon.
', 'Step 4: Drain bacon slices on paper towels.
', 'Step 5: Add onion to the pot; saute in the remaining bacon grease until translucent, about 5 minutes.

', 'Step 7: Add the bacon, pinto beans, tomatoes, water, green onion, cilantro, salt, garlic powder, and chipotle to the onion mixture.

Title: Air Fryer Chicken Fajitas for Two
Ingredients: ['½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '½ teaspoon ancho chile powder, or to taste', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon ground coriander', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ pound chicken breast tenderloins', '½ medium green bell pepper, sliced into strips', '½ medium onion, sliced into rings', '2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided', '½ lime', '4 (8 inch) flour tortillas']

", 'Step 2: Combine cumin, smoked paprika, ancho chile powder, garlic powder, coriander, salt, and pepper in a bowl.

Title: Birria de Chivo
Ingredients: ['8 dried ancho chiles - stemmed, seeded, and cut into strips', '8 dried guajillo chiles - stemmed, seeded, and cut into strips', '2 dried cascabel chiles - stemmed, seeded, and cut into strips', '5 ½ cups chicken broth', '7 pounds goat meat', '1 large onion, diced', '12 cloves garlic, minced', '4 teaspoons salt', '3 teaspoons dried oregano', '2 teaspoons ground thyme', '1 ½ teaspoons cumin seeds', '1 teaspoon ground allspice', '4 whole cloves', 'ground black pepper to taste', '5 bay leaves', '8 medium plum tomatoes, quartered', '4 tablespoons apple cider vinegar', '2 fluid ounces tequila (such as Sauza®)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a dry skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Toast chiles until fragrant, about 20 seconds.
', 'Step 3: Transfer to a heat-proof container with a lid.
', 'Step 4: Bring 5 cups of water to a boil and pour over chiles until just covered.
', 'Step 5: Cover the container and set aside for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Pour chicken broth into a slow cooker set on Low.
', 'Step 7: Add goat meat, onion, garlic, salt, oregano, thyme, cumin, allspice, whole cloves, black pepper, and bay leaves.
', 'Step 8: Combine tomatoes, vinegar, and tequila in a blender and process until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Add drained chiles and blend until as smooth as possible.
', 'Step 10: Use a spoon to push the mixture through a small-holed strainer and add to the slow cooker; discard anything remaining in the strainer.
', 'Step 11: Cover the slow cooker and cook until meat is tender, 8 to 10 hours.
', 'Step 12: Skim fat and strain juices before serving.
']

Title: Super Chicken Mole

Title: Instant Pot® Green Chile Chicken Chili
Ingredients: ['2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '1 (16 ounce) jar green salsa (such as Herdez®), divided', '2 (32 ounce) containers chicken broth, divided', '2 (15 ounce) cans cannellini beans, drained and rinsed', '2 (4 ounce) cans chopped green chilies', '1 teaspoon ground cumin, or to taste', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 (14.5 ounce) package tortilla chips, crumbled', '1 cup sour cream, or as needed', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, or as needed', '1 bunch chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and pour 1/2 the salsa on top.
', 'Step 2: Add 1 cup broth.
', 'Step 3: Close and lock the lid.
', 'Step 4: Choose Manual pressure and set the timer for 12 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 6: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 7: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 8: Transfer chicken to a bowl and shred using a fork.
', 'Step 9: Return shredded chicken to the pot.
', 'Step 10: Add remaining salsa, remaining broth, cannellini beans, green chiles, cumin, and cayenne pepper to the pot with the chicken.
', 'Step 11: Close and lock the lid.
', 'Step 12: Choose Manual pressure and set the timer for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 14: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 15: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 16: Top servings of chili with crumbled tortilla chips, sour cream, Cheddar cheese, and cilantro.
']

Title: Pan-Fried Tilapia with Tomatillo Red Pepper Sauce
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 large red bell pepper, seeds removed and pepper quartered lengthwise', '2 teaspoons canola oil', '1 cup husked, cored and chopped tomatillos', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ cup chopped fresh parsley, or to taste', '2 tablespoons rice vinegar', '1 teaspoon honey', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '4 tilapia fillets', '2 teaspoons canola oil', '1 lemon, halved and seeds removed', '1 sprig fresh cilantro, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack at about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, and spray with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Place the pepper pieces cut sides down onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the pepper has blackened and blistered, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Place the blackened pepper pieces into a bowl, and tightly seal with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 6: Allow the pepper to steam as it cools, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Once cool, remove and discard the skins.
', 'Step 8: Heat 2 teaspoons of canola oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, and cook and stir the tomatillos until softened, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle with salt and black pepper, and mix in the garlic.
', 'Step 10: Cook and stir until the garlic is softened, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 11: Place the hot tomatillos into a blender, and add the roasted red pepper, parsley, rice vinegar, and honey.
', 'Step 12: Blend the sauce until smooth, and set aside.
', 'Step 13: In a shallow bowl, mix together the flour, chili powder, and dried oregano.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle the fish fillets with salt and black pepper, and dredge in the flour mixture until coated.
', 'Step 15: Heat 2 teaspoons of canola oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 16: Cook the fish until browned, 2 to 3 minutes; carefully flip the fish over and cook on the other side until the meat is opaque and slightly flaky and the fish has browned, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Transfer fish to a serving platter.
', 'Step 18: Squeeze the lemon halves over the fish, and serve with sauce.
', 'Step 19: If sauce has cooled, pour into a microwave-safe bowl, and cook in microwave on medium setting until hot, about 2 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '213.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '12.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '41 mg', 'fatContent': '7.2 g', 'fiberContent': '2.7 g', 'proteinContent': '24.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '68.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.6 g'}

Title: Avocado Steak
Ingredients: ['2 cups water', '1 cup uncooked long-grain white rice', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', 'salt to taste', 'garlic powder to taste', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 small onions, chopped', '4 beef steaks', '2 avocados - peeled, pitted and sliced']

['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil grate.
', 'Step 2: In a medium saucepan, bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Stir in rice, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Place refried beans in a medium saucepan over medium heat, and season with salt and garlic powder.
', 'Step 5: Cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through.
', 'Step 6: Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Saute onions until browned and tender.
', 'Step 8: On the prepared grill, cook steaks 7 to 10 minutes, to an internal temperature of 145 degrees F (65 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Spread steaks with refried beans, and top with onions and avocado slices.
', 'Step 10: Serve over rice.
']

Title: Jen's Nine Layer Dip
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 ½ tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '4 slices lean bacon, chopped', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix', '1 cup sour cream', '¾ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 cup prepared guacamole', '1 cup diced tomatoes', '1 ½ tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons sliced black olives', '2 tablespoons finely sliced green onions', '¼ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the chicken, 1 1/2 tablespoons of cilantro, and vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat, and pan-fry the chicken breasts until lightly golden brown, no longer pink in the middle, and the juices run clear, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 2: Remove the chicken and set aside.
', 'Step 3: When cooled, cut into cubes.
', 'Step 4: Place the bacon in the same skillet, and cook over medium-high heat, stirring often, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Mix the refried beans into the skillet with the bacon, and cook, stirring frequently, until the beans are hot and bubbling, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Mix the taco seasoning and sour cream together in a bowl.
', 'Step 7: To assemble, spread the hot bean and bacon mixture into the bottom of an 8x8-inch glass dish.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle the chicken cubes over the bean mixture, then follow with these layers: 3/4 cup of Cheddar cheese, guacamole, sour cream mixture, and sliced tomatoes.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle the top with 1 1/2 tablespoons of cilantro, black olives, green onions, and 1/4 cup of shredded cheddar cheese.
']

Title: Miguelina's Poblanos and Cheese
Ingredients: ['4 fresh poblano chile peppers', '2 cups oil for frying, or as needed', '8 ounces queso asadero', '½ cup all-purpose flour for coating']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Rinse the poblano peppers, and remove the stem and core.
', 'Step 2: Remove any remaining seeds.
', 'Step 3: Heat a heavy skillet over high heat.
', 'Step 4: Place peppers in the skillet, and cook until blistered and blackened.
', 'Step 5: Turn frequently to blacken all of the skin.
', 'Step 6: You want to make sure that no part of the pepper remains crispy.
', 'Step 7: Place the peppers into a paper bag, fold the top closed, and let the peppers steam for a few minutes to loosen the skin.
', 'Step 8: Heat about 1/2 inch of oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 9: Rinse the peppers under cold running water to remove as much of the black skin as possible.
', "Step 10: Don't get prissy about it; you can eat the skins, even if they're black - most people like some of the black skin.
", "Step 11: Next, WASH your hands well with soap and water, or you'll be sorry later when you touch your eyes or mouth.
", 'Step 12: Insert a nice thick piece of cheese into each pepper, and secure the opening with a toothpick.
', 'Step 13: Coat the peppers in flour.
', 'Step 14: Gently place the peppers into the hot oil, and reduce the heat to medium.
', 'Step 15: Fry for 3 to 5 minutes per side.
', "Step 16: Don't try to turn them over until the bottom has a firm crust on it.
", 'Step 17: Try to avoid letting the cheese run out.
', 'Step 18: When both sides are slightly browned and the coating is firm, remove from the pan, and drain on paper towels.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Soup
Ingredients: ['6 boneless chicken thighs, or more to taste', '2 (15 ounce) cans chicken broth', '2 (15 ounce) cans diced tomatoes', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 tablespoon shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste', '1 tablespoon sour cream, or to taste', '1 tablespoon crushed tortilla chips, or to taste', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken thighs in a large pot of water.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil over high heat; reduce heat to medium-high and boil until no longer pink in the centers, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from the pot and let cool until able to handle, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Shred chicken.
', 'Step 5: Place chicken broth, tomatoes, black beans, corn, tomato sauce, chiles, and taco seasoning into the bottom of a slow cooker.
', 'Step 6: Add shredded chicken.
', 'Step 7: Cover and cook on Low, 6 to 8 hours.
', 'Step 8: Serve topped with Cheddar cheese, sour cream, tortilla chips, and cilantro.
']

Title: Roasted Mexican Corn Salad with Black Beans
Ingredients: ['4 ears corn, husks and silks removed', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 medium red bell pepper, seeded and diced', '1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '3 tablespoons diced red onion', '3 tablespoons mayonnaise', '3 tablespoons sour cream', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '2 teaspoons taco seasoning mix, or to taste', '½ teaspoon salt, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '⅓ cup crumbled cotija cheese', '⅓ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '3 medium green onions, white and green parts, finely chopped', '½ cup cherry tomatoes, or to taste']

['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Brush corn with vegetable oil.
', 'Step 3: Grill corn on the preheated grill until some kernels are lightly charred on all sides, about 12 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Use tongs to turn corn, every 3 to 4 minutes, to expose more kernels to the heat.
', 'Step 5: Remove from grill and allow to cool.
', 'Step 6: Cut kernels into a large bowl.
', 'Step 7: Add black beans, bell pepper, jalapeno pepper, and red onion.
', 'Step 8: Combine mayonnaise, sour cream, lime juice, taco seasoning, salt, black pepper, and cayenne in a small bowl; mix until well combined.
', 'Step 9: Pour over the salad and toss until well mixed.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle with cotija crumbles, cilantro, and green onions.
', 'Step 11: Garnish with cherry tomatoes.
', 'Step 12: Serve chilled, or at room temperature.
']

Title: Taco Pie Pizza
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 cup yellow cornmeal', '½ cup sugar', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 cup milk', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '1 egg, beaten', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '½ cup mayonnaise', '¼ cup blue cheese salad dressing', '1 (15 ounce) can turkey chili without beans', '2 cups shredded iceberg lettuce', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, drained']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a medium bowl, mix together the flour, cornmeal, sugar and baking powder.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the milk, oil and eggs, mixing until just moist.
', 'Step 4: Spread in a greased 12 inch deep-dish pizza pan, or a 10x15 inch baking pan.
', 'Step 5: Bake the crust for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from the oven, and sprinkle with 1 cup of the cheese.
', 'Step 7: Bake for another 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Spread the refried beans and mayonnaise over the melted cheese.
', 'Step 9: Top with blue cheese dressing, turkey chili, and remaining cheese.

Title: Kingfish Enchiladas

Title: Capirotada de Leche
Ingredients: ['4 cups milk, divided', '6 tablespoons cornstarch', '1 (1 inch) piece cinnamon stick', '1 (1 inch) piece vanilla bean', '8 large egg yolks', '1 (14 ounce) can condensed milk', '½ cup white sugar, or to taste', '1 ½ teaspoons unsalted butter, or as needed', '20 small dinner rolls', '1 ½ cups chopped pecans', '1 cup raisins', '¾ cup flaked coconut', '2 ½ ounces colored candy sprinkles']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix 1 cup milk and cornstarch in a bowl until no lumps remain.
', 'Step 2: Combine remaining 3 cups milk in a large pan with cinnamon stick and vanilla bean.
', 'Step 3: Stir in milk-cornstarch mixture.
', 'Step 4: Hold an egg yolk over the bowl and break its skin to release the inner yolk into the bowl; discard the skin.
', 'Step 5: Repeat to add remaining yolks and whisk to combine.
', 'Step 6: Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to medium-low, and add condensed milk.
', "Step 8: Taste to see if it's sweet enough; if not, add sugar.
", "Step 9: Cook and stir until it's thick like a yogurt drink, 5 to 10 minutes.
", 'Step 10: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 11: Remove and discard cinnamon stick and vanilla bean.
', 'Step 12: Grease a 9x13-inch pan with butter.
', 'Step 13: Slice dinner rolls into 1/2-inch thick pieces.
', 'Step 14: Making about 3 or 4 layers in the prepared pan, start with a layer of bread.
', "Step 15: Cover bread with some of the milk mixture, but don't overdo it.
", 'Step 16: Decorate with pecans, raisins, coconut, and sprinkles.
', 'Step 17: Repeat layers until all ingredients are used up.
', 'Step 18: Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
']

Title: Sous Vide Carnitas
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons granulated garlic', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon black pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 (4 pound) boneless pork butt', '1 tablespoon chicken soup base (such as Better than Bouillon®)', '1 medium orange, sliced', '3 large bay leaves', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Fill a large pot with water and place a sous vide immersion cooker into the water.
', "Step 2: Set temperature to 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) according to manufacturer's directions.
", 'Step 3: Combine granulated garlic, cumin, salt, oregano, coriander, and black pepper in a small bowl.
', 'Step 4: Cut pork butt into 2 chunks and rub with soup base.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle with spice mixture and rub until evenly distributed.
', 'Step 6: Place pork into a large vacuum bag.
', 'Step 7: Add orange slices and bay leaves throughout the bag.
', 'Step 8: Seal using a vacuum sealer.

', 'Step 13: Drizzle with reserved juices, if desired.
', 'Step 14: Alternately, you may crisp under an oven broiler for 3 to 4 minutes.
']

Title: Mexican Chocolate Frozen Yogurt

"]

Title: Vegetarian Taquitos
Ingredients: ['1 cup sunflower oil, divided, or as needed', '1 vegetarian burger patty, crumbled', '1 (8 ounce) package mushrooms, finely chopped', '1 medium yellow squash, finely chopped', '1 carrot, finely chopped', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '16 corn tortillas', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 1/4 cup oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add mushrooms, squash, carrot, and vegetarian patty.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir until vegetables are soft and tender, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add taco seasoning and stir to combine.
', 'Step 5: Set aside and let cool.
', 'Step 6: Heat 1 inch of oil in another frying pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Dip a corn tortilla into the hot oil with tongs.
', 'Step 8: Wait for 3 seconds, flip, and cook another 3 seconds; remove to paper towels to drain and cool.
', 'Step 9: Repeat with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 10: Stir Cheddar cheese into the cooled filling mixture.
', 'Step 11: Place 1 1/2 tablespoons of filling down the center of one tortilla and roll up; repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.
', 'Step 12: Place as many taquitos into the hot oil that will fit, seam side-down, using tongs.
', 'Step 13: Cook until the bottoms are golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Flip and continue to cook until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Remove to paper towels to drain.
', 'Step 16: Repeat to cook remaining taquitos.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '433 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '29.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '9.1 mg', 'fatContent': '32.6 g', 'fiberContent': '4.7 g', 'proteinContent': '8.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '392.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.1 g'}

Title: Spicy Oven-Fried Chicken with Cheese Grits and Chorizo Reduction
Ingredients: ['1 cup buttermilk', '¼ cup Mexican-style hot sauce (such as Cholula®)', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch strips', 'cooking spray', '1 cup bread crumbs', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon thyme leaves', '½ teaspoon chipotle chili powder', '2 ½ cups milk', '2 ½ cups water', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 cup grits', '½ (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend', '4 tablespoons butter', '1 pound ground chorizo', '1 sweet onion, diced', '1 red bell pepper, diced', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 cup cherry tomatoes', '1 cup vegetable broth', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 tablespoon Mexican-style hot sauce (such as Cholula®)', '½ cup heavy cream', '1 teaspoon crumbled Cotija cheese, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Pour buttermilk and hot sauce into a large bowl or zip-top bag; mix well.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken and marinate for 4 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 3: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Place a wire rack on top of a baking sheet and spray with cooking spray.
', 'Step 5: Combine bread crumbs, flour, paprika, salt, garlic powder, black pepper, onion powder, oregano, thyme, and chili powder in a bowl.
', 'Step 6: Remove chicken from marinade and dredge in crumb mixture.
', 'Step 7: Place coated chicken onto the prepared wire rack.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the centers and juices run clear, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Meanwhile, add milk, water, salt, and pepper to a large saucepan.
', 'Step 10: Bring to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 11: Reduce heat to low and add grits.
', 'Step 12: Cook, covered, for 20 minutes, stirring every few minutes to prevent clumping.
', 'Step 13: Remove from heat and add Mexican cheese and butter; stir until well incorporated and creamy.
', 'Step 14: While chicken and grits are cooking, cook chorizo, onion, bell pepper, and jalapeno in a large skillet over medium-high heat until meat is browned and vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Drain grease from the skillet.
', 'Step 16: Stir in garlic and continue to cook over medium-high heat until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 17: Stir cherry tomatoes, vegetable broth, Worcestershire sauce, and hot sauce into the skillet, reduce heat to low, and let simmer until reduced, stirring as needed, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Add heavy cream; let simmer and continue to reduce until sauce coats a spoon, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 19: Place grits into a bowl, top with chorizo reduction sauce, and top with spicy fried chicken.
', 'Step 20: Garnish with Cotija cheese.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '712.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '44.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '139.3 mg', 'fatContent': '42.2 g', 'fiberContent': '2.5 g', 'proteinContent': '37.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '20.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '1950 mg', 'sugarContent': '8.3 g'}

Ingredients: ['2 (14.5 ounce) cans stewed tomatoes', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cups diced celery', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '2 tablespoons white sugar']

Title: Captain's Avocado Bean Dip
Ingredients: ['½ large avocado - peeled, pitted, and quartered', '3 tablespoons salsa', '3 tablespoons mayonnaise', '2 teaspoons lime juice', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ (16 ounce) can refried beans']

', 'Step 2: Stir salsa, mayonnaise, lime juice, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder into mashed avocado using a fork.
', 'Step 3: Gradually stir refried bean into dip.
', 'Step 4: Refrigerate until chilled, at least 30 minutes.
']

Title: Stuffed Poblanos
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground turkey', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '2 teaspoons taco seasoning mix', '4 ounces cream cheese', '½ cup salsa', '2 green onions, chopped', '1 pinch salt', '3 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '4 poblano peppers']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir turkey in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 4: Stir in green chiles and taco seasoning.
', 'Step 5: Add cream cheese in spoonfuls and blend into meat.
', 'Step 6: Stir in salsa and green onions.
', 'Step 7: Season with salt.
', 'Step 8: Simmer until bubbly, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add Monterey Jack cheese; cook and stir until melted, about 3 minutes more.
', "Step 10: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 11: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 12: Place peppers onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 13: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Remove peppers and turn the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 15: Place blackened peppers into a zip-top bag and let steam as they cool, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Pull off and discard the outer skins, being careful not to tear the peppers.
', 'Step 17: Slice peppers down one side and remove seeds.
', 'Step 18: Add stuffing to peppers and place in a baking pan.
', 'Step 19: Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
']

Title: Italian Taco Salad
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '3 cups crushed tortilla chips', '2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (10 ounce) package mixed salad greens', '1 (8 ounce) bottle zesty Italian dressing']

['Step 1: In a medium skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef until evenly browned.
', 'Step 2: Remove from heat, and drain.
', 'Step 3: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, tortilla chips, mozzarella cheese, Cheddar cheese, and salad greens.
', 'Step 4: Toss with Italian dressing until evenly coated, and serve.
']

Title: Caitlin's Mexican Rice
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups uncooked white rice', '3 cups water', '1 cup sour cream', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 cup grated Monterey Jack cheese', '1 cup sliced ripe olives, divided', '1 cup grated Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring the rice and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Combine sour cream, green chilies, and salt in a small bowl.
', 'Step 5: Layer 1/2 of the cooked rice on the bottom of a 1 1/2 quart baking dish.
', 'Step 6: Spread the sour cream mixture over the rice, and sprinkle the Monterey Jack cheese evenly on top.
', 'Step 7: Layer half of the olives, followed by the remaining cooked rice and the Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 8: Decorate the top of the casserole with the remaining olives.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese has melted, 30 to 40 minutes.
']

Title: Menudo de Sonora (Menudo Soup Sonora-Style)
Ingredients: ['6 quarts water', "1 (1/2 pound) cow's foot, cleaned and cut into pieces", '1 white onion, quartered', '1 head garlic, minced', '2 sprigs fresh thyme', '2 sprigs fresh marjoram', '4 whole black peppercorns', '2 bay leaves', '4 ½ pounds beef tripe, cut into bite-sized pieces', '2 (15.5 ounce) cans white hominy, drained and rinsed', 'salt to taste', '3 lime, cut into wedges', '1 white onion, finely chopped', '2 cups chopped fresh cilantro', '2 teaspoons dried oregano']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring water a boil in a large soup pot over high heat.
', "Step 2: Add cow's foot, onion quarters, garlic, thyme, marjoram, peppercorns, and bay leaves.
", 'Step 3: Boil, skimming off the foam the forms on the surface, until broth flavors intensify, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add beef tripe and bring to a boil.
', "Step 5: Reduce heat to medium, cover, and cook until cow's foot softens, about 1 hour.
", "Step 6: Remove cow's foot pieces from the broth and transfer to a dish.
", 'Step 7: Skim fat from the surface of the broth.
', 'Step 8: Add hominy; cook until tripe is softened, 30 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Do not overcook.
', "Step 10: Separate meat from the cow's foot.
", 'Step 11: Discard bones.
', 'Step 12: Discard onion quarters, garlic, thyme, marjoram, peppercorns, and bay leaves from the broth.
', 'Step 13: Stir in meat and season with salt.
', 'Step 14: Cook until flavors blend, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 15: Pour into bowls and garnish each serving with lime wedges, finely chopped onion, cilantro, and oregano.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '216.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '23.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '200.3 mg', 'fatContent': '6.2 g', 'fiberContent': '4.5 g', 'proteinContent': '17.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '311.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '3 g'}

Title: Mini Margarita Cheesecakes
Ingredients: ['1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '1 (6 ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate', '¼ cup tequila', '2 tablespoons triple sec', '75 scoop-style tortilla chips (such as Tostitos® Scoops!®)', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '2 teaspoons lime juice', '2 tablespoons white sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Beat sweetened condensed milk and cream cheese together using an electric mixer on low speed until smooth and creamy.
', 'Step 2: Add limeade, tequila, and triple sec; beat on medium-high speed until cheesecake mixture is creamy and thickened, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Spoon about 1 tablespoon cheesecake mixture into each scoop-style tortilla chip.
', 'Step 4: Arrange mini cheesecakes on a platter; refrigerate until chilled and set, 2 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 5: Beat cream and lime juice together in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth and thickened; gradually add sugar and continue beating until soft peaks form.
', 'Step 6: Top each cheesecake with about 1 teaspoon lime-flavored whipped cream.
']

Title: ChoriQueso

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

', 'Step 3: Crumble in the chorizo sausage; cook and stir until evenly browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from the pan, and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Place slices of cheese in a single layer to cover the bottom of the pan.
', 'Step 6: It is okay if they overlap a little bit.
', 'Step 7: When cheese melts, quickly pour into a nice casserole dish, or oven-proof bowl.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle the chorizo on top.

', 'Step 10: Remove from the oven, stick a fork in it and load your tortilla.
']

Title: Spicy Tortilla Bean Soup
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large onion, diced', '4 cloves garlic, diced', '2 (7 ounce) cans chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 quarts vegetable broth', '2 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans, drained', '2 (15 ounce) cans garbanzo beans, drained', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans diced spicy tomatoes', '2 (15.25 ounce) cans whole kernel corn, drained', '1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or more to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']

', 'Step 4: Stir broth, pinto beans, garbanzo beans, and black beans into onion mixture; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Add tomatoes, reduce heat, and simmer until soup is heated through and flavors have blended, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add corn and cinnamon; cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 more minutes.
', 'Step 7: Season with cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
']

Title: Fajitas On A Stick
Ingredients: ['¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil', '½ lime, zested and juiced', '2 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes, or more to taste', '¼ teaspoon ground chipotle pepper', '1 ½ pounds beef sirloin, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 green bell pepper, cut into 1-inch cubes', '½ onion, cut into 1-inch cubes', 'skewers']

['Step 1: Whisk olive oil, lime juice, lime zest, garlic, cumin, red pepper flakes, and chipotle pepper together in a large glass or ceramic bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add sirloin and toss to evenly coat.
', 'Step 3: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator, 30 minutes to 2 hours.
', 'Step 4: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 5: Remove sirloin from marinade and discard marinade.
', 'Step 6: Thread sirloin, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and onion onto skewers.
', 'Step 7: Cook on the preheated grill until sirloin is browned and vegetables are tender, about 4 minutes per side.
']

Title: Easy Chicken Enchiladas from Reynolds®
Ingredients: ['Reynolds Wrap® Pan Lining Paper', 'Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans diced fire-roasted tomatoes', '1 cup salsa', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '8 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 tablespoon canola oil', '1 cup peeled, chopped butternut squash or sweet potato', '1 medium onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 cup shredded cooked chicken', '1 ¼ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 2-quart rectangular baking dish with Reynolds Wrap® Pan Lining Paper, parchment side up.
', 'Step 2: No need to grease dish.
', 'Step 3: Combine the undrained tomatoes, salsa, and chili powder in a medium saucepan.
', 'Step 4: Bring to boiling; reduce heat.
', 'Step 5: Simmer, uncovered, about 10 minutes or until slightly thickened, stirring occasionally and mashing with the back of a spoon.
', 'Step 6: Stack tortillas; wrap tightly in Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil.
', 'Step 7: Bake tortillas about 10 minutes or until warm.
', 'Step 8: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 9: Add squash, onion, and garlic; cook and stir for 8 to 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
', 'Step 10: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 11: Stir in half of the tomato mixture, the black beans, chicken, and 3/4 cup of the cheese.
', 'Step 12: Divide the black bean mixture among the warm tortillas; roll up the tortillas.
', 'Step 13: Arrange the rolled tortillas, seam sides down, in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 14: Spoon the remaining tomato mixture over the tortillas.
', 'Step 15: Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup cheese.
', 'Step 16: Bake, uncovered, about 20 minutes or until heated through.
']

Title: Pork and Bean Burrito
Ingredients: ['1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®)', '2 onions, chopped, divided', '1 (1.25 ounce) package salsa seasoning mix', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 (4 ounce) pork steaks, or more to taste', '½ cup butter', '1 (15 ounce) can refried beans', '1 burrito seasoning', '8 large flour tortillas', '1 (15 ounce) can chili, or more as needed', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese']

Title: Horchata Iced Coffee
Ingredients: ['½ cup uncooked white rice', '1 (3 inch) cinnamon stick, broken into pieces', '4 cups water', '½ (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 cup milk', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ cup ice cubes, or as needed', '½ cup cold brew coffee, or as needed', '1 packet artificial sweetener, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine rice, cinnamon sticks, and water in a container and let sit for 2 hours.
', 'Step 2: Drain rice and cinnamon sticks, but save the water.
', 'Step 3: Combine rice and cinnamon sticks in a food processor or powerful blender.
', 'Step 4: Process or blend until mixture resembles coarse sand.
', 'Step 5: Place rice mixture back into soaking water and let sit for 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 6: Strain rice mixture through a fine sieve into a container.
', 'Step 7: Add sweetened condensed milk, milk, and vanilla extract.
', 'Step 8: Stir until well combined and refrigerate horchata until ready to use.
', 'Step 9: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes and pour equal amounts of cold coffee and horchata into the glass.
', 'Step 10: Add sweetener to taste.
']

Title: Huevos d'Elena (aka Huevostadas)
Ingredients: ['1 potato, diced', '½ pound lean ground beef', '½ cup diced yellow onion', '2 tablespoons diced red bell pepper', '1 clove garlic, minced', '½ cup salsa', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', 'seasoned salt to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste', '1 teaspoon olive oil, or as needed', '4 eggs', '4 crispy tostada shells, warmed', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place potato into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain.
', 'Step 4: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir beef, onion, red bell pepper, and garlic in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 6: Add potato, salsa, chili powder, cumin, seasoned salt, and pepper to ground beef mixture; cook and stir over low heat until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; crack eggs into the hot oil.
', 'Step 8: Cook until lightly browned, about 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 9: Place tostada shells on a serving plate; top each with beef-potato mixture.
', 'Step 10: Layer 1 egg onto each tostada; sprinkle with cilantro.
']

Title: Chipotle Meatballs
Ingredients: ['2 ½ pounds ground beef', '½ cup bread crumbs', '½ cup dried minced onion', '2 tablespoons dried cilantro', '2 teaspoons onion powder', '2 teaspoons garlic powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '11 ounces chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 egg']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Mix beef, bread crumbs, dried onion, cilantro, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Finely chop chipotle peppers and add peppers, adobo sauce, and egg to meat mixture.
', 'Step 4: Mix well.
', 'Step 5: Roll into 1 1/2-inch meatballs.
', 'Step 6: Heat a skillet over high heat.
', 'Step 7: Brown meatballs in the hot skillet, turning as needed, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Transfer to a rimmed baking sheet.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the centers, 8 to 10 minutes.
']

Title: Turkey Mole Poblano
Ingredients: ['2 dried pasilla chiles', '2 dried guajillo chilies', '2 dried ancho chile peppers', '1 dried cascabel chile', '1 dried morita chile', '3 large Roma tomatoes', '¾ cup vegetable oil, divided', '1 large white onion, diced', '5 cloves garlic, crushed', '4 whole cloves', '½ teaspoon sesame seeds', '¼ teaspoon coriander seeds', '⅓ cup sweetened dried cranberries (such as Craisins®)', '⅓ cup unsalted peanuts', '⅓ cup chopped almonds', '2 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '¾ Mexican hot chocolate drink tablet (such as Nestle® Abuelita)', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground white pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '1 ¼ cups turkey stock', '1 cinnamon stick', '2 pounds leftover turkey meat, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat about 3 cups water in a microwave-safe bowl for 3 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Heat a griddle or comal over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Toast pasilla chiles, guajillo chiles, ancho chiles, cascabel chile, and morita chile for about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Turn chiles over and toast until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove stems and seeds.
', 'Step 6: Place chiles in the bowl of water; cover and let soak, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Place tomatoes on the hot griddle.
', 'Step 8: Cook until blackened on all sides, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Transfer to a blender.
', 'Step 10: Heat 1/4 cup oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Transfer onion and garlic to the blender using tongs, tilting the skillet to reserve the oil.
', 'Step 13: Toast cloves, sesame seeds, and coriander seeds in the hot skillet until fragrant and lightly browned, 30 to 60 seconds.
', 'Step 14: Place in the blender.
', 'Step 15: Cook cranberries in the skillet until toasted, about 1 minute; place in the blender.
', 'Step 16: Pour an additional 1/4 cup oil in the skillet; reheat over medium heat.
', 'Step 17: Stir in peanuts and almonds; cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 18: Add to the blender, reserving oil in the skillet.
', 'Step 19: Place tortillas in the hot skillet; increase heat to medium-high.
', 'Step 20: Fry until slightly crisped, about 1 minute; place on a plate.
', 'Step 21: Add the remaining oil and chocolate tablet to the skillet; cook and stir until melted, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Pour into the blender.
', 'Step 23: Place softened chiles and 1/3 of the soaking liquid into the blender.
', 'Step 24: Add salt, white pepper, cumin, and oregano.
', 'Step 25: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 26: Tear tortillas and add to blender; blend mole until smooth.
', 'Step 27: Pour mixture into a large pot over low heat.
', 'Step 28: Stir in broth slowly and add cinnamon stick.
', 'Step 29: Simmer until slightly thickened and flavors meld, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 30: Remove cinnamon stick.
', 'Step 31: Pour mole over reheated turkey.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '519.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '31.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '115 mg', 'fatContent': '21.4 g', 'fiberContent': '6.2 g', 'proteinContent': '51.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '582 mg', 'sugarContent': '8.1 g'}

Title: Huevos Diablos
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can crushed tomatoes', '1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 dash cayenne pepper', '¾ cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, divided', '6 large eggs', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 dash paprika', '6 (6 inch) corn tortillas, warmed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a heavy saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook onion until soft, translucent, and just beginning to brown, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Stir in tomatoes, Worcestershire sauce, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a simmer, lower heat, and cook tomato sauce for about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Stir 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese into tomato sauce.
', 'Step 8: Add 1/4 cup of sauce to 6 small oven-safe bowls.
', 'Step 9: Break 1 egg on top of each and dot with butter.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and a dash of paprika for color.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven, uncovered, just until egg whites are set but yolks are still soft, 10 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Serve with tortillas.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Vegetarian Pozole Verde
Ingredients: ['1 pound tomatillos, husked and quartered', '½ cup stemmed and chopped fresh cilantro leaves', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 teaspoons olive oil', '1 large white onion, chopped', '1 small poblano pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 jalapeno, seeded and chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '2 (15.5 ounce) cans white hominy, drained and rinsed', '2 (15.5 ounce) cans pinto beans, drained and rinsed', '3 cups vegetable broth']

['Step 1: Add tomatillos, cilantro, lime juice, and salt to a blender.
', 'Step 2: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Set aside.
', 'Step 4: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 5: Add olive oil, onion, poblano, and jalapeno.
', 'Step 6: Cook for 4 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add garlic, cumin, and oregano; cook for 1 minute.

', 'Step 11: Stir to combine.

']

Title: Creamy, Spicy Guacamole
Ingredients: ['3 large avocados - peeled, pitted, and diced', '1 tomato, seeded and chopped', '2 green onions, finely chopped', '½ lime, juiced', '1 tablespoon salsa, or more to taste', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon sour cream', '1 teaspoon white vinegar', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']

', 'Step 2: Stir tomato, green onions, lime juice, salsa, garlic, sour cream, vinegar, cayenne pepper, and cumin with the mashed avocado until evenly mixed; season with salt and black pepper.

Title: Blackened Corn and Jicama Pico de Gallo
Ingredients: ['2 cups fresh corn kernels', '2 cups peeled, chopped jicama', '1 cup diced red onion', '1 cup small diced white onion', '1 cup small diced red bell pepper', '½ cup small diced green bell pepper', '¼ cup olive oil', '2 tablespoons white vinegar', '1 ½ tablespoons salt', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon red wine vinegar', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '2 cups fresh cilantro leaves, finely chopped', '1 ½ cups small diced tomatoes', '1 lime, zested and juiced']

', 'Step 2: Cook corn kernels in the hot skillet, turning frequently, until beginning to blacken slightly, about 5 minutes.

Title: Mexican Pulled Pork
Ingredients: ['1 (3 pound) boneless pork roast, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 ½ cups water, divided, or more as needed', '½ cup white vinegar', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 tablespoons lard', '2 peppers guajillo chile peppers, seeds and membranes removed', '1 ancho chile pepper, seeds and membranes removed', '⅓ cup coarsely chopped parsley', '6 cloves garlic', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground cumin']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place pork, 1/2 cup water, vinegar, and salt in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Simmer, covered, until all the liquid has cooked off and the pork cooks in its own rendered fat, 45 to 50 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add lard if there is not enough fat, so pork cooks to a golden brown.
', 'Step 4: Set aside.
', 'Step 5: Place the guajillo and ancho chiles in a small saucepan with 1 cup water.
', 'Step 6: Cover and cook over low heat for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Transfer to a blender and add parsley, garlic, oregano, and cumin; puree.
', 'Step 8: Add the pureed mixture to the pork.
', 'Step 9: Bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer, covered, until the pork is tender and can easily be cut with a fork, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 10: It may be necessary to add another cup of water to the pan, depending on the tenderness of the meat.
', 'Step 11: Let pork rest for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Shred with 2 forks.
']

Title: Roasted Salsa Verde
Ingredients: ['12 medium tomatillos, peeled', '3 Anaheim chile peppers', '2 large onions, peeled', '2 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '5 cloves garlic, peeled', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, stems removed', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 pinch salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Lay tomatillos, Anaheim peppers, onions, jalapeno peppers, and garlic on a large rimmed baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Broil in the preheated oven until tomatillos release their juices, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove tomatillos and garlic from the baking sheet; flip Anaheim peppers, jalapeno peppers, and onions and return to the oven.
', 'Step 5: Continue to broil until peppers are blackened, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Remove from the oven and let cool until safe to handle, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Peel away blackened parts from vegetables without taking off too much flesh.
', 'Step 8: Transfer tomatillos, Anaheim peppers, onions, jalapeno peppers, garlic, cilantro, lemon juice, and salt to a food processor and pulse until well combined and chopped.
', 'Step 9: Refrigerate salsa until cold, at least 30 minutes.
']

Title: Ancho Chile Fettuccini with Cilantro-Tomatillo Cream Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '3 ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded', '4 cloves unpeeled garlic', '2 eggs', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 bunch chopped fresh cilantro', '3 tomatillos, husked and chopped', '½ jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped', '½ cup cream cheese, softened', '½ cup sour cream', '¼ cup chicken stock', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat.
', 'Step 2: Roast ancho chiles and 4 cloves unpeeled garlic.
', 'Step 3: Press the chiles flat against the pan with a spatula until they begin to pop and smoke, then flip.
', 'Step 4: When done, rehydrate chiles in a bowl of warm water for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Turn garlic until all sides are browned, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Allow to cool, then peel.
', 'Step 7: In a blender or food processor, combine chiles, 2 cloves roasted garlic, and eggs.
', 'Step 8: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Place the flour in a mound on a clean surface.
', 'Step 10: Stir in 1/2 teaspoon salt with a fork, then make a well in the center.
', 'Step 11: Pour in egg mixture.
', 'Step 12: Working from the center outward, gradually incorporate the flour with a fork until dough is formed.
', 'Step 13: Knead dough for 5 minutes, adding more flour if necessary.
', "Step 14: Prepare fettuccini according to your pasta machine's instructions.
", 'Step 15: Lay the fettuccine flat on lightly floured surface for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 16: In a blender or food processor, combine 2 remaining cloves roasted garlic, cilantro, tomatillos, jalapeno, cream cheese, sour cream, chicken stock, 1 tablespoon olive oil, cumin, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 17: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 18: Pour into a saucepan over low heat, and cook until heated through.
', 'Step 19: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 20: Add pasta and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until pasta rises to the surface.
', 'Step 21: Drain, and divide into serving portions; pour sauce over top.
']

Title: Flan de Naranja (Orange Flan)
Ingredients: ['4 tablespoons white sugar', '½ teaspoon water', '5 large egg yolks, lightly beaten', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (14 ounce) can evaporated milk', '4 tablespoons fresh orange juice', '1 teaspoon grated orange zest']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Fill a baking dish half way with hot water for the water bath.
', 'Step 3: Heat sugar and water in a heavy-based saucepan over medium-low heat; constantly swirl the sugar mixture in the pan until sugar dissolves and turns into a golden-brown caramel syrup, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Watch carefully, as sugar burns easily.
', 'Step 5: Pour melted caramel into a shallow baking dish and gently tilt dish to coat the bottom with caramel.
', 'Step 6: Mix egg yolks, condensed milk, evaporated milk, orange juice, and orange zest in a large oven-safe bowl; gently pour custard over caramel in baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Cover the flan with foil to prevent a skin forming on top, if you like.
', 'Step 8: Set bowl into the water bath and bake in the preheated oven until until flan has set but still jiggles slightly when moved, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
', 'Step 9: Allow flan to cool to room temperature, then remove foil, and place flan in the fridge to chill, about 2 hours.
', 'Step 10: Run a knife around the edges of the flan to loosen from dish; turn flan onto a rimmed serving plate to release custard and let caramel sauce flow over the flan.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Salsa Verde Chicken
Ingredients: ['2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 ½ cups green salsa (salsa verde)', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '1 medium white onion, halved and thinly sliced', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '8 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (1.41 ounce) package sazon seasoning', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', 'kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 bunch cilantro, finely chopped', '1 tablespoon lime juice, or to taste']

', "Step 3: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 10 minutes.
", 'Step 4: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 5: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes.
", 'Step 6: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 7: Select Saute function and shred chicken with 2 forks; simmer until you reach the desired consistency with your sauce.
', 'Step 8: Season with more salt and pepper before serving with cilantro and lime juice.

Title: Tomatillo Chicken Breasts
Ingredients: ['1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer', '½ cup teriyaki sauce', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '8 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '8 slices Muenster cheese', '3 ½ pounds fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '½ cup water', '1 onion, chopped', '6 cloves garlic, chopped, or more to taste', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 cup sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk beer, teriyaki sauce, chili powder, and garlic powder together in a bowl; pour into a resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 2: Add the chicken, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag.
', 'Step 3: Marinate in the refrigerator 6 to 24 hours.
', 'Step 4: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 5: Remove chicken from the marinade and shake off excess.
', 'Step 6: Discard the remaining marinade.
', 'Step 7: Cook the chicken breasts on preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 7 to 10 minutes per side.
', 'Step 8: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Arrange chicken breasts in a baking dish and top each with a slice of Muenster cheese.
', 'Step 10: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Combine tomatillos and water in a large saucepan; bring water to a boil, place cover on saucepan, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until tomatillos begin to burst, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Stir onion and garlic into tomatillo sauce; season with salt and pepper; continue cooking at a low boil until onion is tender, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Pour tomatillo sauce into a blender.
', 'Step 14: Cover and hold lid down; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend until smooth.
', 'Step 15: Stir sour cream and cilantro into the tomatillo sauce; pour over the chicken and Muenster cheese.
', 'Step 16: Bake in preheated oven until cheese melts, about 15 minutes.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Cilantro-Lime Chicken Tacos
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil, divided', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish', '2 limes, divided', '1 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips', '½ onion, thinly sliced', '¼ cup canned diced tomatoes, undrained', '6 tortilla shells']

', 'Step 3: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 4: Heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil.
', 'Step 5: Add onion rings and cook until soft and translucent.
', 'Step 6: Add diced tomatoes with liquid.
', 'Step 7: Drain chicken from marinade and add to Instant Pot®.
', 'Step 8: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 9: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 10 minutes.
", 'Step 10: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 11: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, for 6 minutes.

', 'Step 15: Return to the Instant Pot® and mix with tomato sauce.

']

Title: Air Fryer Shrimp Tacos
Ingredients: ['4 cups shredded green cabbage', '½ cup sliced red bell pepper', '½ cup sliced yellow bell pepper', '½ cup sliced orange bell pepper', '¼ cup pepitas (roasted green pumpkin seeds)', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '¼ cup lime juice, divided', '4 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '1 teaspoon honey', '¾ teaspoon kosher salt, divided, or to taste', '1 ½ pounds uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '1 teaspoon grated lime zest', '12 (6 inch) flour tortillas, warmed', '¾ cup crumbled queso fresco', '3 medium avocados - peeled, pitted, and sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine cabbage, bell peppers, pepitas, lime and 1 tablespoon of the cilantro in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Combine 2 tablespoons lime juice, 3 tablespoons olive oil, honey, and 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt in a small bowl with a whisk.
', 'Step 3: Pour over vegetable mixture and toss to coat evenly.
', 'Step 4: Set aside.
', "Step 5: Preheat an air fryer to 360 degrees F (180 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions for 10 minutes.
", 'Step 6: Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels and place in a medium bowl with remaining tablespoon olive oil, remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, garlic powder, and pepper; toss to coat shrimp evenly with oil and spices.
', 'Step 7: Place shrimp in the preheated basket of the air fryer and cook until shrimp are opaque and lightly golden browned on outside, 8 to 9 minutes, tossing halfway through cooking time.
', 'Step 8: When shrimp are finished cooking, immediately transfer to a serving bowl with the butter, remaining 2 tablespoons lime juice, lime zest, and remaining tablespoon of cilantro; toss to melt butter and coat shrimp.
', 'Step 9: To serve, place 4 to 5 shrimp in each warmed tortilla, spoon 1/4 cup slaw on shrimp, and top with a pinch of queso fresco and avocado slices.
']

Title: My Mexican Beef
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 small yellow onion, chopped', '2 garlic cloves, minced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '1 tablespoon chopped chipotle peppers, or more to taste', '1 pound shaved steak', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon coriander seeds', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 cinnamon stick', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onion; cook and stir until softened, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in garlic; cook until tender, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Stir in tomatoes, green chile peppers, and chipotle peppers.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 6: Stir shaved steak, cumin, coriander, salt, pepper, and cinnamon stick into the saucepan.
', 'Step 7: Bring back to a simmer, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat and cover; cook, stirring occasionally, until steak is very tender, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 9: Discard cinnamon stick and stir cilantro into the saucepan.
']

Title: Spaghetti and Chipotle Meatballs
Ingredients: ['2 pounds ground beef', '1 (7 ounce) can minced chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, or to taste', '1 bunch green onions, minced', '¼ cup bread crumbs', '1 ½ teaspoons garlic powder, or to taste', '1 ½ teaspoons salt, or to taste', '1 ½ teaspoons ground black pepper, or to taste', '1 (16 ounce) package spaghetti', '1 (15 ounce) can spaghetti sauce', '¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Mix the ground beef, chipotle peppers with the adobo sauce, green onions, bread crumbs, garlic powder, salt, and pepper together in a bowl until evenly mixed.
', 'Step 4: Roll the mixture into balls the size of cherry tomatoes.
', 'Step 5: Arrange on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: While the meatballs bake, bring a large pot of lightly-salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Add the spaghetti and return to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Cook until tender but still firm to the bite, about 12 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Drain.
', 'Step 11: Pour the spaghetti sauce in a large saucepan over medium heat; cook until hot, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add the cooked meatballs and stir to coat.
', 'Step 13: Ladle over the drained spaghetti and top with the grated Parmesan cheese to serve.
']

Title: Hungry Dad's Mexican-Inspired Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '¼ cup diced yellow onion', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '1 (8 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 cup picante sauce', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning', 'nonstick cooking spray', '4 (7 inch) flour tortillas', '1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '1 ½ cups shredded pepper Jack cheese, divided', '3 cups crushed tortilla chips, divided', 'aluminum foil', '½ cup chopped green onion', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ cup sour cream, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add ground beef and onion to the hot skillet; cook and stir until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to low and stir in diced tomatoes, black beans, picante sauce, and taco seasoning.
', 'Step 4: Simmer until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 7: Spread flour tortillas in the prepared baking dish, overlapping to cover the bottom and sides.
', 'Step 8: Spread beef mixture over tortillas, and sprinkle with 3/4 cup Monterey Jack cheese, 3/4 cup pepper Jack cheese, and 1 1/2 cups crushed tortilla chips.
', 'Step 9: Cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove from oven and discard foil.
', 'Step 12: Sprinkle remaining Monterey Jack cheese, pepper Jack cheese, and crushed tortilla chips on top.
', 'Step 13: Place back in the oven and bake, uncovered, until cheese is melted and bubbly, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle with green onion and cilantro and serve with sour cream.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '653.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '41.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '111.1 mg', 'fatContent': '38.5 g', 'fiberContent': '5.3 g', 'proteinContent': '33.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '18.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '1524.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.8 g'}

Title: That's Good Moosh!
Ingredients: ['¼ pound ground beef, or to taste', '1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix, or to taste', '3 quarts water', '3 (3 ounce) packages chicken-flavored ramen noodle soup', '1 (14.5 ounce) can Mexican-style stewed tomatoes', '1 cup water', '½ cup sour cream', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cook and stir ground beef in a skillet until completely browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Season with taco seasoning; stir.
', 'Step 3: Set aside.
', 'Step 4: Bring 3 quarts water to a boil in a 5-quart stockpot.
', 'Step 5: Break ramen noodles into bite-sized pieces and add to boiling water.
', 'Step 6: Cook, stirring frequently, until noodles are tender, 3 to 5 minutes; drain.
', 'Step 7: Pour tomatoes into a bowl; break into small pieces using your hand or a spoon.
', 'Step 8: Dissolve 2 of the packets of seasoning from the ramen noodles in 1 cup water; stir into the tomatoes.
', 'Step 9: Pour the tomato mixture into the stockpot and place over medium heat.
', 'Step 10: Stir ground beef into the tomato mixture; cook and stir until hot, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add drained noodles to the beef mixture; stir to coat.
', 'Step 12: Season the mixture with the remaining packet of ramen noodle seasoning to taste.
', 'Step 13: Remove stockpot from heat; stir sour cream through the tomato mixture.
', 'Step 14: Top with Cheddar cheese to serve.
']

Title: Bloody Mary Ceviche
Ingredients: ['1 pound cooked, peeled, and deveined shrimp', '1 pound roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '½ red onion, chopped', '1 cucumber, chopped', '1 bunch cilantro, chopped', '¾ cup bottled Bloody Mary mix', '2 limes', 'hot pepper sauce to taste', 'salt and black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Lightly mix the shrimp, tomatoes, red onion, cucumber, and cilantro in a bowl, and pour in the Bloody Mary mix.
', 'Step 2: Squeeze the limes over the mixture, add a dash of hot pepper sauce, and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 3: Toss again, cover the bowl, and refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours, stirring occasionally.
']

Title: Chicken Chilaquiles from Campbell's Kitchen
Ingredients: ['10 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into 1-inch strips', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 teaspoon dried oregano leaves, crushed', '2 cloves garlic, minced', "1 (10.75 ounce) can Campbell's® Condensed Tomato, Chipotle & Olive Oil Soup", '1 cup water', '2 cups shredded cooked chicken', '¼ teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese or crumbled queso fresco', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', '4 wedges lime']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Arrange the tortilla strips on 2 baking sheets.
', 'Step 2: Bake for 10 minutes or until the tortilla strips are crisp and lightly browned.
', 'Step 3: Reserve 5 tortilla strips.
', 'Step 4: Heat the oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Add the onion and oregano and cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 6: Add the garlic and cook and stir for 1 minute.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the soup and water and heat to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Reduce the heat to medium.
', 'Step 9: Cook, uncovered, for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir in the chicken and black pepper and cook until the mixture is hot and bubbling.
', 'Step 11: Stir in the remaining tortilla strips and cook until the mixture is hot.
', 'Step 12: Remove the skillet from the heat.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle the chicken mixture with the cheese.
', 'Step 14: Top with the reserved tortilla strips and the cilantro, if desired.
', 'Step 15: Serve with the lime wedges.
']

Title: Megan's Spaghetti Squash Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 (3 pound) spaghetti squash', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon coarse salt', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '4 ounces queso fresco, crumbled', '¼ cup chopped red onion', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '16 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '¼ cup salsa']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Make 1-inch deep punctures all over squash with a serrated knife.
', 'Step 2: Microwave squash on high for 6 to 8 minutes; turn over and microwave until squash is steaming and cooked through, another 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Let cool for 5 minutes, cut in half lengthwise, take out seeds, and shred the flesh with a fork.
', 'Step 4: Mix fresh lime juice, chili powder, ground coriander, ground cumin, and coarse salt in a large bowl.
', 'Step 5: Add shredded spaghetti squash; mix well.
', 'Step 6: Place black beans (heat if desired), crumbled queso fresco, chopped red onion, and chopped cilantro into separate bowls.
', 'Step 7: Heat corn tortillas in a skillet over medium-low heat until warmed and flexible, about 30 seconds per side.
', 'Step 8: Spread each tortilla with a spoonful of black beans and squash mixture, and a sprinkling of queso fresco cheese, onion, and cilantro; top each serving with salsa.
']

Title: Milanesa de Res
Ingredients: ['2 large eggs, or more as needed', '40 saltine crackers, smashed', '4 thin slices boneless round steak', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', 'vegetable oil for frying']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Crack eggs in a medium bowl and beat slightly with a fork or whisk.
', 'Step 2: Set aside.
', 'Step 3: Place smashed crackers on a plate big enough for the steak.
', 'Step 4: Season steak with salt and pepper and soak in the beaten egg.
', 'Step 5: Transfer to the smashed crackers and cover both sides with the crackers using a spoon; you can press a little bit with the spoon so that the crackers stick better.
', 'Step 6: Heat a frying pan over medium heat and add enough oil to cover the bottom half of the steaks.
', 'Step 7: Cook 2 steaks in the hot oil until crackers have turned light golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Turn and continue to cook until golden and meat is no longer pink, 4 to 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 9: Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
', 'Step 10: Repeat with remaining steaks.
']

Title: Kim's Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 (28 ounce) can whole tomatoes, chopped and liquid reserved', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '½ onion, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '6 cloves garlic, minced', '¾ cup finely chopped jalapeno peppers', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 cup red wine vinegar', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 tablespoon ground cumin']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine the tomatoes, tomato paste, onion, green pepper, garlic, jalapenos, sugar, chili powder, vinegar, salt, and cumin in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Bring mixture to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the salsa is thickened and is noticeably darker in color, at least two hours.
', 'Step 3: Cool and store it in the refrigerator for up to two weeks or in the freezer for three months.
']

Title: Mediterranean Roasted Cauliflower with Olives
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '1 teaspoon fresh minced garlic', '½ teaspoon dried Italian herb seasoning', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 cups cauliflower, cut into 1-inch florets', '1 cup red onions, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 large red bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch squares', '2 ounces sliced black olives', '1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, or to taste', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a 12x18-inch baking sheet with foil or parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Combine olive oil, garlic, Italian seasoning, salt, and freshly ground pepper in a small, microwave-safe bowl.
', 'Step 4: Microwave on High for 20 to 30 seconds.
', 'Step 5: Watch carefully, and remove from the microwave when the oil bubbles.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Combine cauliflower florets, red onion, and red bell pepper in a large bowl.
', 'Step 8: Pour in the olive oil mixture and stir until all the vegetables are coated.
', 'Step 9: Spread out vegetables on the prepared baking sheet in a single layer.
', 'Step 10: Roast in the preheated oven until vegetables reach the desired doneness, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Broil if you like additional color, carefully watching that the vegetables do not burn, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Sprinkle sliced olives over the vegetables and drizzle with balsamic vinegar.
', 'Step 13: Garnish with fresh parsley.
', 'Step 14: Serve warm.
']

Title: Refreshing Avocado, Tomato, and Mango Salsa
Ingredients: ['4 tomatoes, diced', '2 mangos - peeled, seeded, and diced', '2 avocados - peeled, pitted, and diced', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '½ cup chopped red onion, minced', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste', '1 teaspoon fine sea salt']

['Step 1: Mix tomatoes, mangos, avocados, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, and garlic together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Stir red onion, lime juice, olive oil, and sea salt into the tomato mixture.
', 'Step 3: Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
']

Title: Sweet Almond Tamales with Pastry Cream
Ingredients: ['2 cups milk', '1 cup white sugar', '5 egg yolks', '2 tablespoons masa harina (such as Maseca®)', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', 'corn husks', '1 cup whole raw almonds', '1 cup unsalted butter, softened', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', '1 ¼ cups white sugar', '2 cups masa harina (such as Maseca®)', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 ½ cups milk, or as needed', '1 ½ cups rice flour']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine 2 cups milk and 1 cup sugar in a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 2: Whisk egg yolks and 2 tablespoons masa harina together in a bowl until well combined.
', 'Step 3: Add to milk, stirring constantly, until pastry cream thickens, about 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract.
', 'Step 5: Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to cool for 1 hour.
', 'Step 6: Place corn husks in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and soak for 30 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Drain, place on a work surface, and cover with a clean, damp towel.
', 'Step 8: Place almonds in a heat-proof bowl and cover with boiling water.
', 'Step 9: Let stand for a few minutes until cool enough to handle.
', 'Step 10: Slip the almonds out of their skins one by one, leaving the remaining almonds in the warm water.
', 'Step 11: Drain almonds in a colander and finely chop.
', 'Step 12: Beat 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons butter in a bowl with an electric mixer until creamy.
', 'Step 13: Add 1 1/4 cups sugar and continue to beat until mixture is very fluffy.
', 'Step 14: Add 2 cups masa harina and baking powder and continue mixing dough by hand.
', 'Step 15: Add milk, 1/4 cup at a time, until dough has a soft and fluffy texture.
', 'Step 16: Mix in rice flour and if necessary, add more milk.
', 'Step 17: Keep kneading dough until it is smooth and moist.
', 'Step 18: Add almonds and continue kneading until dough is smooth and elastic.
', 'Step 19: Select 1 wide corn husk or 2 small ones.
', 'Step 20: Spread about 2 tablespoons of dough onto the the corn husk, filling it up to 2 inches from the bottom and 1/4 inch from the top.
', 'Step 21: Add 1 tablespoon of pastry cream down the center of the dough.
', 'Step 22: Fold sides of husk together, one over the other.
', 'Step 23: Fold the bottom of the husk over the seam of the 2 folded sides.
', 'Step 24: Repeat with remaining husks.
', 'Step 25: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 26: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 27: Add tamales with the open side up and cook until filling is heated through and separates from the husk, about 1 hour and 15 minutes.
', 'Step 28: Let tamales rest for 15 minutes before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '285.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '37.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '68.4 mg', 'fatContent': '13.8 g', 'fiberContent': '2.3 g', 'proteinContent': '4.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '58.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '20.7 g'}

', 'Step 2: Fold seasoned nopales, Cheddar cheese, and cilantro inside tortillas.
