Title: Instant Pot® Chicken and Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['1 (32 fluid ounce) container chicken broth', '1 (15 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '1 ½ cups frozen corn', '1 onion, chopped', '½ cup cauliflower rice', '¼ cup quinoa', '3 cloves garlic', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '3 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 pound chicken breast', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil for frying', '2 (8 inch) corn tortillas, cut into bite-sized strips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chicken broth, tomatoes, corn, onion, cauliflower rice, quinoa, garlic, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®).
', 'Step 2: Add chicken breast.
', 'Step 3: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 4: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 7 minutes.
", 'Step 5: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile heat oil in a skillet over moderately high heat.
', 'Step 7: Add tortilla strips and cook until golden, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 8: Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
', "Step 9: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 15 minutes.
", "Step 10: Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 11: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 12: Remove chicken and shred or cut into bite-sized pieces.
', 'Step 13: Return chicken to pot to warm.
', 'Step 14: Ladle into soup bowls and top with fried tortilla strips.
']

Title: Chicken Enchiladas with Salsa Verde
Ingredients: ['5 large chicken breasts', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', 'water', '5 fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '1 serrano pepper, or more to taste', '2 cloves garlic', '3 poblano peppers', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 onion, chopped', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 lime, juiced', '½ cup vegetable oil', '12 corn tortillas', '2 (8 ounce) packages shredded queso quesadilla (white Mexican cheese)', '4 tablespoons Mexican crema']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Fill a large pot 3/4 full with water and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Add chicken and season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 4: Cook until chicken is no longer pink inside, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, bring 1 cup water to a boil in a medium-sized pot.
', 'Step 6: Add tomatillos, serrano pepper, and garlic.
', 'Step 7: Boil for 12 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Heat a cast iron skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 9: Place poblano peppers in a resealable plastic bag and add 1 tablespoon oil.
', 'Step 10: Toss to coat.
', 'Step 11: Transfer peppers to the hot skillet and roast until dark brown on all sides, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Return roasted peppers to the resealable bag and seal.
', 'Step 13: Set aside to steam for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Take out peppers from the bag; remove and discard skins and stems.
', 'Step 15: Use a slotted spoon to transfer tomatillos, serrano peppers, garlic, and 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid to a blender.
', 'Step 16: Add onion, cilantro, lime juice, roasted poblano peppers, salt, and pepper to the blender.
', 'Step 17: Liquefy into a smooth sauce.
', 'Step 18: Remove chicken from the water in the pot and shred using a fork.
', 'Step 19: Heat 1/2 cup oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 20: Fry tortillas in the hot oil until softened, about 5 seconds on each side.
', 'Step 21: Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil.
', 'Step 22: Pour 1/2 the sauce from the blender into the bottom of a long glass baking pan.
', 'Step 23: Roll a portion of chicken mixture and some shredded queso cheese on a tortilla, roll up, and place in the pan.
', 'Step 24: Repeat with remaining tortillas, chicken mixture, and queso cheese.
', 'Step 25: Cover enchiladas with remaining sauce.
', 'Step 26: Use a spoon to add crema in a zigzag design on top.
', 'Step 27: Top everything with remaining queso cheese.
', 'Step 28: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese starts to brown, about 20 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '476.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '21.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '100.4 mg', 'fatContent': '32 g', 'fiberContent': '3 g', 'proteinContent': '26.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '11.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '454 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.4 g'}

Title: Turkey Chorizo, Revised
Ingredients: ['2 dried red chile peppers', '1 tablespoon dried Mexican oregano', '2 teaspoons smoked salt', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '¾ teaspoon white sugar', '½ teaspoon multicolored peppercorns', '2 cloves garlic', '2 tablespoons New Mexico red chile powder', '2 tablespoons smoked paprika', '2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar', '1 tablespoon water', '1 ½ pounds ground turkey breast']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place dried peppers in a mortar and grind into medium-sized pieces.
', 'Step 2: Add oregano, salt, cumin, sugar, and peppercorns.
', 'Step 3: Grind into a rough powder.
', 'Step 4: Add garlic and continue to grind until a paste forms.
', 'Step 5: Use a wooden spoon to mix the chile powder and paprika into the paste.
', 'Step 6: Add the vinegar and water while stirring.
', 'Step 7: Mix well.
', 'Step 8: Place ground turkey in a large bowl.
', 'Step 9: Mix seasoning paste into turkey using your hands covered in clean rubber gloves.
', 'Step 10: Allow mixture to rest in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before using in your favorite recipe.
']

Title: Spicy Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['2 (4 ounce) tilapia fillets', '1 teaspoon Cajun seasoning, or to taste', '6 (8 inch) flour tortillas, warmed', '1 small red onion, finely chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped', '½ cup shredded lettuce', '¼ cup salsa']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease or line a rimmed baking sheet with foil.
', 'Step 3: Rinse tilapia and pat dry.

Title: Salpicon
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 (3 pound) beef brisket, trimmed', '2 (12 ounce) cans tomato paste', 'water to cover', '1 onion, halved', '1 large carrot, quartered', '1 stalk celery, quartered', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '4 ounces chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '⅓ cup apple cider vinegar', '⅓ cup extra-virgin olive oil', '1 onion, minced', '1 large tomato, chopped', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (12 ounce) package warm corn tortillas, or as needed', '½ pound Monterey Jack cheese, shredded']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Sprinkle kosher salt and 1 teaspoon black pepper over the fatty side of brisket.
', 'Step 3: Spread tomato paste over entire brisket.
', 'Step 4: Place brisket, fat-side up, in a heavy pot; pour in enough water to cover brisket.
', 'Step 5: Add halved onion, carrot, celery, 1/2 of the cilantro, and garlic to the pot.
', 'Step 6: Bring liquid to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Cover pot with a lid or aluminum foil and transfer to oven.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until brisket is very tender, about 6 hours.
', 'Step 9: Blend chipotle peppers in adobo sauce in a a food processor until finely chopped.
', 'Step 10: Add vinegar to peppers and continue processing; drizzle olive oil into mixture until smooth.
', 'Step 11: Remove brisket from liquid and cool slightly.
', 'Step 12: Slice meat across the grain into 2-inch slices; shred thoroughly with a fork.
', 'Step 13: Combine shredded meat, chopped onion, tomato, remaining cilantro, and pepper mixture in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 14: Serve meat mixture with corn tortillas and top meat with Monterey Jack cheese.
']

Title: Three-Pepper Rice and Chicken Pot
Ingredients: ['½ pound andouille sausage links', '1 poblano chile', '1 red bell pepper', '3 tablespoons canola oil', '1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks', '3 tablespoons Cajun-style seasoning', '1 ½ tablespoons butter', '2 yellow onions, finely chopped', '2 banana (or hot) peppers, seeded and chopped', '2 celery ribs, finely chopped', '6 cloves garlic, minced', '1 shallot, minced', '3 cups long grain white rice', '1 ½ tablespoons butter', '3 cups chicken stock', '1 (10 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with mild green chilies, undrained', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer', 'salt to taste', '1 cup frozen corn kernels, thawed']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat your oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with a sheet of foil.
', 'Step 3: Cook andouille sausage in a skillet over medium heat until cooked through, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from skillet and cut into 1/4-inch slices; set aside.
', 'Step 5: While the sausage is cooking, cut the peppers in half lengthwise and remove the stem and seeds.
', 'Step 6: Place peppers, cut-side-down onto baking sheet and place into preheated oven.
', 'Step 7: Broil peppers until the skins blacken, about 7 minutes, then place into a bowl and cover with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 8: Allow the peppers to steam for 10 minutes until the skins loosen, then remove and discard blackened skins; chop peppers into 1/2 inch pieces and set aside.
', 'Step 9: Heat the canola oil in a stockpot over high heat.
', 'Step 10: Toss the chicken with Cajun seasoning and sear in batches in the oil until light brown and no longer pink in the center, about 6 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove chicken, leaving oil in the stockpot, and drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 12: Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of butter to the oil.
', 'Step 13: Stir in the onion, banana peppers, celery, garlic, and shallot; cook until the onions are translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Stir in rice and 1 1/2 tablespoon butter.
', 'Step 15: Stir in the chicken stock, tomato sauce, and diced tomato with chilies.
', 'Step 16: Cover and simmer until liquid is mostly absorbed into the rice, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Stir in the beer and cover; cook another 5 minutes until the rice is tender.
', 'Step 18: Season with salt, then mix in the corn, poblano, bell pepper, chicken, and andouille sausage.
', 'Step 19: Return to a simmer, then turn off heat and allow to rest 5 minutes before serving.
']

Ingredients: ['10 dried chipotle peppers', '12 roma (plum) tomatoes', '¼ yellow onion, coarsely chopped', '2 cloves garlic, or more to taste', '2 tablespoons white vinegar', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 pinch ground black pepper, or to taste', '1 lime, juiced, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Fill a saucepan with water, stir in dried chipotle peppers, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to low and simmer until peppers are soft, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain and let cool.
', 'Step 4: When peppers are cool, remove stems, cut open peppers, and remove seeds.
', 'Step 5: Set peppers aside.
', 'Step 6: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 7: Grill tomatoes on hot grate until skin blackens and begins to peel, turning tomatoes often to blacken all sides, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Set grilled tomatoes aside to cool.
', 'Step 9: Place grilled tomatoes, chipotle peppers, yellow onion, white vinegar, salt, black pepper, and lime juice into a food processor; pulse a few times, then process until almost pureed.
', 'Step 10: Refrigerate until flavors have blended, at least 2 hours to overnight.
']

Title: Chipotle Tilapia Tacos with Mango-Cilantro Salsa
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons chipotle chile powder', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 tablespoon cracked black pepper', '1 pound tilapia fillets, cut in half lengthwise', '¼ cup canola oil', '1 mango - peeled, seeded and diced', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '1 small red onion, finely chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 bunch cilantro, chopped', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '1 tablespoon pureed chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ cup mayonnaise', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pinch salt', '3 cups hot cooked Spanish rice', '8 (6 inch) whole wheat tortillas', '1 (8.5 ounce) package coleslaw mix']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Stir together the chipotle chile powder, garlic powder, salt, and cracked black pepper in a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 2: Brush the tilapia fillets with the canola oil, and press into the spice mixture to coat, and set aside.
', 'Step 3: Make the salsa by stirring together the mango, jalapeno, red onion, 1 clove garlic, cilantro, and lime juice in a separate bowl, and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Make the aioli by stirring together the chipotle puree, 1 clove garlic, and mayonnaise in a small bowl, and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Bring the black beans and 2 cloves of garlic to a simmer in a saucepan with a pinch of salt.
', 'Step 6: Cover, and cook over low heat for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat, and cook the tilapia until opaque in the center, and crispy on both sides, about 7 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Heat the tortillas in a skillet over medium heat, and keep warm.
', 'Step 9: To serve, place the tortillas on a plate, spoon on some Spanish rice and black beans.
', 'Step 10: Top with some of the coleslaw mix, hot tilapia, and a spoonful of the mango-cilantro salsa.
', 'Step 11: Top with a dollop of chipotle aioli to serve.
']

Title: Black Bean Lasagna II
Ingredients: ['9 lasagna noodles', '½ cup chopped onion', '½ cup chopped red bell pepper', '½ cup frozen corn kernels, thawed', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (16 ounce) can refried black beans', '2 ¾ cups canned tomato sauce', '½ cup salsa', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '1 ½ cups cottage cheese', '1 cup ricotta cheese', '¼ cup sour cream', '8 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, shredded', '¼ cup sliced ripe olives', '8 sprigs fresh cilantro']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.

', 'Step 4: Coat a large skillet with non-stick cooking spray, and place over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Saute onion, red bell pepper, corn and garlic until tender.
', 'Step 6: Stir in black beans, refried beans, tomato sauce, salsa and 1/4 cup cilantro.

', 'Step 10: Arrange 3 of the cooked lasagna noodles in the bottom of the dish, cutting to fit if necessary.

Title: Wrapped Mexican Eggs
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds tomatillos, husked and cut in half', '2 cloves garlic, halved', '1 ½ cups chopped onion', '.3 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 cup water', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '4 tomatoes, chopped', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 green bell pepper, thinly sliced', '16 eggs, beaten', '1 teaspoon salt', 'ground black pepper to taste', '1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '8 (12 inch) flour tortillas', '½ cup sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Make the salsa: In a blender or food processor puree tomatillos, garlic, onions, cilantro, water, jalapeno pepper and salt.
', 'Step 3: In a saucepan, bring the salsa to a simmer.
', 'Step 4: Simmer for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Transfer the salsa into a bowl and set the bowl aside.
', 'Step 6: Make the filling: Put the chopped tomatoes into a sieve, and let them drain for 10 minutes or more.
', 'Step 7: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add the bell peppers, and saute them until they are soft, about 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add the eggs, and turn the heat to low.
', 'Step 10: Stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon, let the eggs cook until they begin to set.
', 'Step 11: Take the skillet off the heat and sprinkle in the salt, pepper, 1 cup Monterey Jack cheese and the drained tomatoes; stir gently.
', 'Step 12: Lay a flour tortilla on a work surface.
', 'Step 13: Spread about 2/3 cup of the egg filling down the middle of the tortilla.
', 'Step 14: Drop 1 tablespoon of the sour cream on top of the eggs.
', 'Step 15: Fold in the sides of the tortilla to partly cover the egg mixture, then roll the tortilla, folding in the outer edges as you roll, to enclose the egg mixture completely.
', 'Step 16: Continue this process with the remaining filling and the tortillas.
', 'Step 17: Place the filled tortillas close together in a 10x16 inch casserole dish.
', 'Step 18: At this point you can cover the dish and chill it for up to 24 hours.
', 'Step 19: Pour the salsa over the filled tortillas, and sprinkle them with the 1/2 cup grated cheese.
', 'Step 20: Cover the dish with foil, and bake the casserole for 15 minutes (25 minutes if it has been chilled).
', 'Step 21: Serve hot.
']

Title: Canned Green Tomatillo Sauce
Ingredients: ['5 pounds fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '2 pounds poblano peppers', '6 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '4 cups onion, chopped', '2 cups chicken broth', '8 cloves garlic, minced', '1 bunch chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ cup lime juice', '2 tablespoons dried oregano', '1 tablespoon seasoned salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Blend tomatillos, poblano peppers, jalapeno peppers, onion, chicken broth, and garlic in a food processor or an electric blender in batches.
', 'Step 2: n Pour blended mixture into a large stockpot and add cilantro, lime juice, oregano, and seasoned salt.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil over high heat; reduce heat and let simmer for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: n Meanwhile, inspect 10 to 12 pint-sized jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones.
', 'Step 5: Immerse in simmering water until blended mixture is ready.
', 'Step 6: Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water.
', 'Step 7: n Pack sauce into hot, sterilized jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top.
', 'Step 8: Run a clean knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars to remove any air bubbles.
', 'Step 9: Wipe rims with a moist paper towel to remove any residue.
', 'Step 10: Top with lids and screw rings on tightly.
', 'Step 11: n Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water.
', 'Step 12: Bring to a boil and lower jars 2 inches apart into the boiling water using a holder.
', 'Step 13: Pour in more boiling water to cover jars by at least 1 inch.
', 'Step 14: Bring to a rolling boil, cover, and process for 25 minutes.
', 'Step 15: n Remove the jars from the stockpot and let rest, several inches apart, for 12 to 24 hours.
', 'Step 16: Press the center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down.
', 'Step 17: Remove the rings for storage and store in a cool, dark area.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Fiesta Chicken Burrito Bowl
Ingredients: ['1 cup white rice', '1 ¼ cups water', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning', '1 tablespoon tomato powder', '2 (4 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed', '¾ teaspoon garlic salt', '¼ teaspoon black pepper', '1 tablespoon butter', '¼ cup salsa', '½ cup black beans, drained', '½ cup corn']

['Step 1: Combine rice, water, taco seasoning, and tomato powder in a 7x3-inch cake pan or oven-safe bowl.
', 'Step 2: Stir to ensure rice is covered.

', 'Step 5: Melt butter.
', 'Step 6: Add salsa and chicken; stir to combine.

', 'Step 8: Place bowls on opposite sides of the Instant Pot®, nestling the chicken between them.
', 'Step 9: Place elevated trivet into the Instant Pot®.
', 'Step 10: Set the container of rice on top of the trivet.

', "Step 12: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 4 minutes.

', 'Step 16: Remove rice from trivet.

Title: Al Pastor Barbeque Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 tomato', '10 dried New Mexico chiles - stemmed, seeded, and cut into strips', '2 dried chipotle chiles - stemmed, seeded, and cut into strips', '2 dried guajillo chiles - stemmed, seeded, and cut into strips', '2 dried ancho chiles - stemmed, seeded, and cut into strips', '1 ½ pounds chopped sweet onion', '½ head garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons dried mustard powder', '1 tablespoon sea salt', '1 ½ teaspoons ground black pepper', '1 ½ teaspoons ground coriander', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cloves', '2 cups pineapple juice', '1 ½ cups mango juice', '½ cup cider vinegar', '½ cup water']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 2: n Place the tomato on a baking dish, and broil, turning occasionally, until blackened on all sides.
', 'Step 3: Once done, remove, and let cool until.
', 'Step 4: n Meanwhile, pack the New Mexico chiles, chipotle chiles, guajillo chiles, ancho chiles, onion, and garlic into a half-gallon glass jar.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle with mustard powder, sea salt, black pepper, coriander, and cloves.
', 'Step 6: Remove the peel from the cooled tomato, cut in half, and squeeze out the seeds.
', 'Step 7: Roughly chop the tomato and place it into the jar.
', 'Step 8: Pour in half of the pineapple juice.
', 'Step 9: Refrigerate at least 2 hours to soften the peppers.
', 'Step 10: n Place the chile mixture into a food processor, and pulse several times to roughly chop the peppers.
', 'Step 11: Pour in the remaining pineapple juice, mango juice, and vinegar.
', 'Step 12: Blend well until finely chopped, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Pour the pepper mixture back into the glass jar, seal with a lid, and refrigerate at least 1 week.
', 'Step 14: n After 1 week, pour the pepper puree back into the food processor, and blend 2 minutes until smooth.
', 'Step 15: Pour into a large saucepan, and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
', 'Step 16: Reduce heat to low, and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Stir in 1/2 cup water, and return to the food processor.
', 'Step 18: Puree 1 minute.
', 'Step 19: n Place a large wire mesh strainer over a clean saucepan, and place 4 to 6 layers of cheesecloth into it to cover.
', 'Step 20: Pour in the pepper puree, and allow to drip into the saucepan for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Gather up the corners of the cheesecloth, and gently twist together to extract all of the liquid from the pepper pulp.
', 'Step 22: Be gentle to ensure that none of the solids are squeezed into the saucepan.
', 'Step 23: n Return the saucepan to a simmer over medium heat, then reduce heat to low, and cook 30 minutes until desired thickness has been reached.
', 'Step 24: Remember that it will thicken somewhat as it cools.
', 'Step 25: Let cool, and store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
']

Title: Black Bean and Butternut Squash Enchilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 butternut squash - peeled, halved lengthwise, and seeded', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 small onion, diced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '2 pinches cayenne pepper', '2 (15.5 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained', '12 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '2 (10 ounce) cans mild enchilada sauce', '8 flour tortillas, or more if needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Pierce butternut squash flesh several times with a fork and place face-down on a greased baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until tender, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Scoop squash flesh from skin.
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion and garlic until onions are soft, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Mix cumin, coriander, and cayenne into onion mixture.
', 'Step 7: Add squash, black beans, and 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese; cook and stir until heated through.
', 'Step 8: Pour a thin layer of enchilada sauce into an 11x7-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Pour the remaining enchilada sauce into a large dish with sides.
', 'Step 10: Dip both sides of each tortilla into enchilada sauce.
', 'Step 11: Fill tortillas with sweet potato mixture and roll tortilla around the filling.
', 'Step 12: Place rolled tortillas, seam-side down, in the baking dish.
', 'Step 13: Repeat with remaining tortillas and sweet potato mixture; top with remaining Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 14: Cover dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the oven until heated through and cheese is melted, about 40 minutes.
']

Title: Zucchini Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['4 medium zucchini', '1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', '1 medium onion, diced', '1 green bell pepper, diced', '4 cups cubed cooked chicken', '1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded extra-sharp Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Slice ends off zucchini and cut them lengthwise.
', 'Step 3: Scoop out centers, leaving a 1/4-inch wall around each.
', 'Step 4: Line up zucchini "boats" on a rimmed baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: Heat olive oil over medium-low heat in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 6: Add onion and bell pepper; cook and stir until onion is softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat; stir in cooked chicken, cream cheese, and taco seasoning until well combined and creamy.
', 'Step 8: Spoon chicken mixture evenly into zucchini boats.
', 'Step 9: Pour enchilada sauce over each, making sure to cover any exposed zucchini and barely cover the bottom of the baking sheet.
', 'Step 10: Top each with Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is just starting to brown, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Easy Mexican Quinoa
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, diced', '½ cup quinoa', '1 ounce taco seasoning mix', '1 cup water', '1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '¼ cup sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat; saute onion in hot oil until slightly softened, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Stir in quinoa and taco seasoning; saute until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 3: Pour water into quinoa mixture.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan with a lid, and simmer for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir beans and tomatoes into quinoa mixture, cover the saucepan again with the lid, and simmer until quinoa is tender and water is absorbed, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Stir Cheddar cheese into quinoa, spoon into bowls, and top each with a dollop of sour cream.
']

Title: Heinz® Classic Family Fajitas

Title: Texican Squash
Ingredients: ['2 ½ pounds yellow squash, sliced', '4 eggs', '½ cup milk', '1 pound Monterey Jack cheese, shredded', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '1 ¼ cups coarsely crushed corn chips']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9 x 13 inch casserole dish.
', 'Step 3: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 4: Add squash and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain and set aside to cool.
', 'Step 6: In a large bowl combine eggs, milk, cheese, salt, baking powder, flour and chiles; mix well.
', 'Step 7: Fold in squash.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle half of the crushed corn chips in the bottom of the prepared dish.
', 'Step 9: Spoon the squash mixture into the dish, and top with the remaining crushed chips.

Title: Mexican Summer Squash Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 serving cooking spray', '1 ¼ pounds unpeeled yellow squash, quartered lengthwise and sliced', '1 pound peeled zucchini, quartered lengthwise and sliced', '2 ½ cups shredded, reduced-fat sharp Cheddar cheese, divided', '2 (4 ounce) cans chopped green chile peppers, drained', '⅔ cup finely chopped onion', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ cup all-purpose flour', '¾ cup mild or medium salsa', '1 tablespoon finely sliced green onion, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Combine yellow squash, zucchini, 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese, chile peppers, onion, and salt in a large bowl.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle with flour and toss to coat.
', 'Step 5: Spread mixture into the prepared baking dish and cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until squash is tender and casserole is bubbly, 35 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from the oven and discard foil.
', 'Step 8: Spread salsa on top and sprinkle with remaining cheese.

', 'Step 10: Garnish with green onions just before serving.
']

Title: Mexican Green Spaghetti
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package spaghetti', '4 large green bell peppers, stemmed and seeded', '1 cup water, or more as needed', '2 cubes chicken bouillon', '1 clove garlic, peeled', '1 tablespoon butter, or more to taste', '1 (16 ounce) container sour cream', '1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Combine bell peppers, water, chicken bouillon, and garlic in a medium pot.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and cook until peppers are soft, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat and let cool for a few minutes.
', 'Step 7: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Coat the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish with butter.
', 'Step 9: Fill blender halfway with the pepper-broth mixture.
', 'Step 10: Cover and hold lid down with a potholder; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend.
', 'Step 11: Pour into a bowl.
', 'Step 12: Repeat with any remaining mixture.
', 'Step 13: Stir in sour cream.
', 'Step 14: Line the bottom of the baking dish with a layer of the spaghetti.
', 'Step 15: Spread a portion of the pepper puree on top and add a layer of mozzarella cheese.
', 'Step 16: Repeat layering spaghetti, pepper puree, and cheese until all ingredients are used up.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Smoky Avocado Fajitas (Meatless)
Ingredients: ['1 ⅓ cups water', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons liquid smoke flavoring', '2 (1 ounce) packages fajita seasoning', '4 large avocados - peeled, pitted, and sliced into 1/2-inch wedges', '4 large bell peppers - stemmed, seeded, and sliced into 1/2-inch wedges', '1 extra large onion, sliced into rings and rings separated', '12 (6 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk water, oil, liquid smoke, and fajita seasoning together in a bowl and pour into a resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 2: Add avocados, bell pepper, and onion, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag.
', 'Step 3: Marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour to overnight; turn occasionally.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 225 degrees F (110 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Stack tortillas; wrap in aluminum foil.
', 'Step 6: Place in oven to warm.
', 'Step 7: Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 8: Drain marinade from vegetable mixture; transfer to a plate.
', 'Step 9: Separate avocados from onions and bell peppers.
', 'Step 10: Place onions and peppers, in 1 layer, onto grill using tongs; cook until tender, 5 to 10 minutes, turning as needed.
', 'Step 11: Transfer to an oven-proof pan; cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 12: Place in the preheated oven to keep warm.
', 'Step 13: Place avocados in 1 layer onto grill; cook, turning once, until browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Fill tortillas with avocado and onion mixture; roll or fold tortilla around filling.
']

Title: Mexican Rice Salad
Ingredients: ['¼ cup diced carrot', '1 jicama, peeled and diced', '1 (10.5 ounce) can black beans', '½ cup lemon juice', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 (3.5 ounce) can sliced jalapeno peppers', '¼ cup white vinegar', '1 teaspoon sugar', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 cup white rice', '1 ¼ cups chicken broth', '1 (2.25 ounce) can sliced black olives', '2 green onions, minced', '¼ red bell pepper, seeded and diced', '¼ green bell pepper, seeded and diced', '½ cucumber, seeded and diced', '½ bunch chopped fresh parsley', '¼ bunch cilantro, chopped', '1 teaspoon seasoned salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring a small saucepan of water to a boil; cook diced carrot in boiling water briefly, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain immediately and plunge into a bowl of ice-cold water; drain.
', 'Step 3: Mix jicama, black beans, lemon juice, and cayenne pepper in a bowl; toss to coat.
', 'Step 4: Cover bowl with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 5: Stir blanched carrots, jalapeno peppers, vinegar, sugar, and salt together in a bowl; cover bowl with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 6: Store both bowls in refrigerator 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 7: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir rice in hot oil until opaque, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Pour chicken broth over rice; bring to a boil, cover the saucepan, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until the liquid is absorbed completely, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Spread cooked rice onto a large platter and cool completely in refrigerator.
', 'Step 10: Stir chilled rice with jicama mixture and carrot mixture in a bowl; add black olives, green onions, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, cucumber, parsley, cilantro, and seasoned salt to the rice mixture and toss to combine.
']

Title: Tilapia Soft Tacos with Chipotle Cream
Ingredients: ['4 each Mission® Low Carb Soft Taco Size Flour Tortillas', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '3 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped', '1 pound tilapia fillets', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '2 cups mixed greens', '2 peppers canned chipotle chiles in adobo (minced and seeded)', '1 cup non-fat sour cream', '¼ teaspoon salt']

', 'Step 2: In a skillet set at medium-high heat, add the seven ingredients from the olive oil through the cilantro.
', 'Step 3: Saute those ingredients for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: After the 5 minutes, add the tilapia and cover and cook for 3 minutes or until fish is fully cooked.
', 'Step 5: Then add in lime juice and let cook for 1 additional minute.
', 'Step 6: Heat the tortillas according to the package instructions.
', 'Step 7: Lay each of the warmed tortillas on a cutting board and place one-quarter of both the field greens and fish on the center of each tortilla.
', 'Step 8: Then top each with equal amounts of the Chipotle Cream Sauce.
', 'Step 9: Fold the tortillas over to form tacos and serve.
']

Title: Chipotle Pepper and Chicken Soup

', 'Step 5: Put chopped chipotle peppers in a bowl with about half the reserved adobo sauce; stir.

Title: Mexican-Style Beef Casserole
Ingredients: ['2 large ripe avocados, halved and pitted', '2 tomatoes, finely chopped', '1 small onion, chopped', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '1 clove garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons minced cilantro', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 pound ground beef', '¾ cup water', '1 package taco seasoning mix (such as Ortega®)', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '1 (16 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '½ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '6 scallions, chopped']

Title: Slow Cooker Shredded Chicken Chili
Ingredients: ['3 (15 ounce) cans great northern beans', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon garlic salt', '2 teaspoons minced garlic', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '3 teaspoons brown sugar', '2 (4 ounce) cans chopped green chile peppers', '½ medium onion, chopped, or more to taste', '1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans low-sodium chicken broth', '3 pounds shredded, cooked chicken breast']

', 'Step 2: Add onion and garlic and cook for 3 minutes.

Title: Carne Asada al Chipotle

['Step 1: Combine beef stock, soy sauce, and chipotle peppers in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 2: Pour into a resealable plastic bag and add flank steak.
', 'Step 3: Close bag and move steak around so it is well covered in marinade.

', 'Step 6: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 7: Remove steak from the marinade and shake off excess liquid.
', 'Step 8: Cook steak until firm and reddish-pink in the center, 4 to 5 minutes minutes per side, depending on the thickness.

', 'Step 10: Let rest for a few minutes before slicing.
']

Title: Double Tacos

', 'Step 8: Spoon seasoned ground beef into the taco shells.
']

Title: Drunken Roasted Salsa
Ingredients: ['½ green bell pepper', '½ red bell pepper', '2 fresh jalapeno peppers', '2 serrano peppers', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '¾ large white onion, cut into large chunks', '½ large fresh tomato, chopped', '3 cloves garlic', '¼ cup cilantro leaves', '1 (12 ounce) can canned diced tomatoes with their juice', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '3 fluid ounces Mexican beer']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to broil.
', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with foil.
', 'Step 3: Halve the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, jalapeno peppers, and serrano peppers lengthwise and discard stems and seeds.
', 'Step 4: Place on baking sheet and brush the peppers with olive oil.
', 'Step 5: Roast peppers under the broiler until the skin blackens and blisters, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Place peppers in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap; allow the peppers to steam until the skins loosen, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Peel skin off the peppers and discard.
', 'Step 8: Combine the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, jalapenos, serrano, onion, tomato, garlic, cilantro, diced tomato with juice, lime juice, salt, black pepper, and beer in a blender.
', 'Step 9: Blend to desired consistency.
', 'Step 10: Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Linda's Enchiladas (Revised)
Ingredients: ['4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', 'water to cover', '¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 small onion, chopped', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '1 clove garlic, chopped', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '6 corn tortillas, or as needed', '1 (28 ounce) can green enchilada sauce', '8 ounces sour cream', '2 tablespoons milk, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken in a large skillet and pour in enough water to cover; add Parmesan cheese and 2 chopped cloves of garlic.
', 'Step 2: Bring water to a boil and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 28 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove skillet from heat, reserving 1/2 cup water mixture from the skillet.
', 'Step 4: Transfer chicken to a work surface and shred using 2 forks.
', 'Step 5: Combine onion, green chile peppers, and 1 chopped clove of garlic in a pot; add cream cheese and 1 cup Mexican cheese blend.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir mixture over medium heat until cream cheese is melted, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Slowly pour the reserved 1/2 cup water mixture from chicken over cream cheese mixture, while continuously stirring until mixture is smooth.
', 'Step 8: Remove pot from heat and stir shredded chicken into cream cheese sauce.
', 'Step 9: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Heat oil in a skillet over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 11: Place tortillas in the hot oil, working in batches, until warmed, about 30 seconds per side.
', 'Step 12: Spoon 1 to 2 tablespoons cream cheese-chicken sauce down the center of each warmed tortilla; roll tortilla around filling.
', 'Step 13: Pour enough green enchilada sauce to cover the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 14: Arrange filled tortillas in the enchilada sauce.
', 'Step 15: Pour remaining enchilada sauce over filled tortillas.
', 'Step 16: Mix sour cream and milk together in a bowl until thin enough to pour.
', 'Step 17: Pour sour cream mixture over filled tortillas; top with remaining Mexican cheese blend.
', 'Step 18: Bake in the preheated oven until heated through and cheese is melted and bubbling, 20 to 25 minutes.
']

Title: Fried Fish Tacos with Chipotle-Lime Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 cup panko bread crumbs', '1 tablespoon seasoned salt', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon lemon pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon onion powder', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '2 eggs', '¼ cup oil', '1 pound tilapia fillets, cut into chunks', '24 corn tortillas', '½ (8 ounce) bottle ranch dressing, or to taste', '¼ cup hot chunky salsa', '½ lime, juiced', '1 canned chipotle chile, thinly sliced', '1 small head shredded cabbage, or to taste']

', 'Step 2: Combine remaining flour with panko bread crumbs, seasoned salt, garlic powder, lemon pepper, black pepper, onion powder, and cayenne pepper in a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 3: Whisk eggs in a separate small bowl.
', 'Step 4: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Roll tilapia in flour, dip in the egg mixture, roll in the panko-flour mixture, and place in the hot oil.
', 'Step 6: Fry until light brown, about 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 7: Place on a paper towel-lined plate.
', 'Step 8: Heat tortillas in a separate skillet over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 9: Combine ranch dressing, salsa, lime, and chipotle chile in a small bowl for the salsa.

Title: Baked Taco Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 small onion, diced', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '¾ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans stewed tomatoes with juice', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', 'nonstick cooking spray (such as Pam®)', '10 corn tortillas', '½ cup cottage cheese', '2 tablespoons cottage cheese', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained', '1 cup shredded pepper Jack cheese, divided', '1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir ground beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 4: Season beef mixture with cumin, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
', 'Step 5: Add stewed tomatoes with juice and enchilada sauce; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: While beef mixture is simmering, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 9: Layer 1/2 of the tortillas with damp paper towels on a microwave-safe plate.
', 'Step 10: Microwave on high until warm, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
', 'Step 11: Repeat with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 12: Mix cottage cheese and chiles together in a small bowl.
', 'Step 13: Place 1 tablespoon cottage cheese mixture in each tortilla and fold in half.
', 'Step 14: Place 1/2 of the beef mixture in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 15: Top with 1/2 cup pepper Jack cheese and 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 16: Place cheese-filled tacos over the cheese.
', 'Step 17: Pour remaining beef mixture over the tacos.
', 'Step 18: Cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 19: Bake in the preheated oven until thoroughly heated, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Remove and discard the foil, top with remaining pepper Jack and Cheddar, and bake until cheeses are melted, 4 to 5 minutes more.
']

Title: Grilled Chicken Nachos with Lime Crema
Ingredients: ['4 tablespoons tequila', '4 tablespoons olive oil', '1 lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin, or more to taste', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder, or more to taste', '¼ teaspoon salt, or to taste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '2 large skinless, boneless chicken breasts, thinly sliced into cutlets', '1 cup sour cream', '½ cup mayonnaise', '2 each limes, zested', '1 lime, juiced', '1 splash heavy cream, or as needed', '2 (13 ounce) packages restaurant-style tortilla chips', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded pepper Jack cheese', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']

['Step 1: Whisk tequila, oil, lime juice, cilantro, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and cayenne for marinade together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Place chicken slices into a plastic bag, add marinade, and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Mix sour cream, mayonnaise, lime zest and juice, and enough heavy cream to make crema thin enough together in a bowl and refrigerate.
', 'Step 4: Remove chicken from the refrigerator and let come to room temperature for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 7: Cook chicken on the preheated grill until caramelized and no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes on each side.
', 'Step 8: Lay tortilla chips out in a single layer over two cookie sheets.
', 'Step 9: Mix pepper Jack and Mexican cheese together and sprinkle half of the mixture over the chips.
', 'Step 10: Cut the grilled chicken into bite-sized pieces and distribute evenly over cheese.
', 'Step 11: Top chicken with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Drizzle lime crema over nachos and sprinkle with cilantro.
']

Title: Baked Avocado Tacos
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 teaspoons paprika', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 ½ teaspoons onion powder', '1 ½ teaspoons garlic salt', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '1 cup milk', '2 eggs', '½ teaspoon minced garlic', '2 avocados - peeled and cut into 8 pieces each', '16 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 ½ cups chopped cabbage, divided', '32 cherry tomatoes, halved', '½ cup shredded mild Cheddar cheese', '¼ cup taco sauce, divided', '¼ cup sour cream, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Whisk flour, chili powder, paprika, cumin, onion powder, garlic salt, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Beat milk, eggs, and garlic together in a separate bowl until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Dip each slice of avocado into flour mixture.

', 'Step 7: Repeat with remaining avocado slices.
', 'Step 8: Arrange coated avocado slices in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Spray the tops of the slices with more cooking spray.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until the coating is browned, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Check for doneness after 15 minutes; rotate the pan once during baking if slices are browning unevenly.
', 'Step 12: Stack corn tortillas on a microwave-safe dish with a piece of parchment paper between each tortilla.
', 'Step 13: Heat in the microwave until hot and pliable, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 14: Place a heated tortilla onto a work surface; top with chopped cabbage.
', 'Step 15: Place an avocado slice on the cabbage; top taco with cherry tomato halves and shredded Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 16: Repeat with remaining ingredients.
', 'Step 17: For extra flavor, top each taco with a dollop of taco sauce and sour cream.
']

Title: Creamy Taco Soup
Ingredients: ['2 pounds ground beef', '1 cup diced onion', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened and cut into pieces', '4 cups beef broth', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes, undrained', '1 (7 ounce) can chopped mild green chiles', '½ cup heavy cream', '1 teaspoon salt, or to taste']

Title: Vegan Tacos al Pastor
Ingredients: ['5 guajillo chile peppers, stemmed and seeded', '5 limes, juiced', '2 cloves garlic', '2 pinches ground cumin', '3 whole cloves', '2 cups water, divided', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '½ onion, halved and cut into thin slices', '1 ½ (12 ounce) packages textured vegetable protein', '4 tomatoes', '4 dried chile de arbol peppers, stemmed', '1 slice onion', '1 clove garlic', 'salt to taste', '1 (32 ounce) package corn tortillas', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 bunch cilantro, finely chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place guajillo peppers in a saucepan, cover with water, and boil until softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain.
', 'Step 3: Combine lime juice, 2 cloves garlic, cumin, and cloves in a small saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and cool for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour into a blender, add guajillo peppers, and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of the water if the sauce is too thick.
', 'Step 7: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat and cook onion slices until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir in vegetable protein; cook and stir for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Pour in guajillo sauce and remaining water; season with salt.
', 'Step 10: Bring to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low cook, covered, until flavors combine, about 10 minutes.
', "Step 11: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 12: Combine tomatoes and chile de arbol peppers in a baking dish.
', 'Step 13: Roast tomatoes and peppers until charred, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Cool tomatoes slightly.
', 'Step 15: Peel.
', 'Step 16: Combine peeled tomatoes, peppers, 1 slice onion, 1 clove garlic, and salt in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 17: Pour salsa into a small bowl.
', 'Step 18: Warm corn tortillas in a skillet.
', 'Step 19: Divide vegetable protein mixture amongst tortillas and top with salsa, chopped onion, and cilantro.
']

Title: South-of-the-Border Stuffed Peppers
Ingredients: ['4 large red bell peppers, tops and seeds removed', '1 poblano pepper', '1 ½ cups water', '1 cup uncooked white rice', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '½ cup chopped onion', '1 pound ground beef', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried oregano leaves', '1 (10 ounce) can red enchilada sauce', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 cup shredded Asadero cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Place the bell and poblano peppers in the prepared baking dish.
', "Step 4: Cook in preheated oven until poblano pepper's skin becomes wrinkled, about 20 minutes.
", 'Step 5: Remove the poblano pepper from the dish, and peel off the skin.
', 'Step 6: Chop the poblano pepper into 1/4 inch pieces, and set aside.
', 'Step 7: Combine the rice and water in a pan over medium heat, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until water is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from heat, and set aside.
', 'Step 10: Place the onion in a skillet over medium heat; cook until translucent and soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Stir in the ground beef; cook until crumbly and evenly browned.
', 'Step 12: Drain the meat, and stir in the garlic, cumin, and oregano.
', 'Step 13: Cook and stir until the garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 14: Season with salt and pepper to taste.
', 'Step 15: Stir the rice, enchilada sauce, and poblano pepper into the beef mixture, and mix thoroughly.
', 'Step 16: Adjust the seasoning if desired.
', 'Step 17: To make the cheese sauce, place the queso asadero in saucepan over medium heat and stir until melted and smooth.
', 'Step 18: Lower oven heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 19: Spoon the beef mixture into bell peppers until heaping full.
', 'Step 20: Place any extra beef mixture into the center of the baking dish between the peppers.
', 'Step 21: Drizzle cheese sauce over each pepper.
', 'Step 22: Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 23: Bake peppers in preheated oven until cheese sauce bubbles and filling is heated through, about 35 minutes.
']

Title: Baked Chicken Taquitos
Ingredients: ['olive oil cooking spray', '1 tablespoon olive oil, or more as needed', '1 ½ cups finely chopped tomatoes', '½ cup minced onion', '5 cloves garlic, minced', '3 jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced', '⅓ cup chicken broth', '¼ cup taco sauce', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 pound shredded, cooked rotisserie chicken', '24 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '3 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese', '1 cup shredded lettuce, or to taste', '½ cup sour cream', '½ cup guacamole, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a large baking pan with olive oil cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Add tomatoes, onion, garlic, and jalapeno peppers, then stir in chicken broth, taco sauce, flour, cumin, oregano, chili powder, and salt.
', 'Step 5: Cook until heated through, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add shredded chicken, mixing vigorously until ingredients are well blended; cook until hot, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Wrap 8 tortillas in damp paper towels and microwave on high until soft and flexible, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 8: Repeat twice more to heat remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 9: Spoon about 2 tablespoons chicken mixture down the center of a tortilla and sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 10: Roll tightly around the filling and place seam-side down in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 11: Repeat to form remaining taquitos.
', 'Step 12: Spray taquitos with cooking spray and sprinkle with remaining Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and taquitos are crispy, 20 to 22 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Place shredded lettuce on a serving platter and arrange taquitos on top.
', 'Step 15: Serve with sour cream and guacamole.
']

Title: Quesadillas de los Bajos
Ingredients: ['3 green chile peppers', '1 green bell pepper, halved, divided', '2 small tomatoes, diced', '1 small onion, divided', '3 fresh jalapeno peppers, diced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons tomato juice', '1 lime, juiced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon garlic salt', '3 tablespoons extra-light olive oil, divided', '2 cooked skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, diced', '7 mushrooms, sliced', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 pinch garlic salt', '1 pinch ground black pepper', '⅓ cup red enchilada sauce, or more to taste', '½ cup shredded pepperjack cheese', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '4 (10 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Arrange green chile peppers on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Roast peppers in the preheated oven, turning 1 or 2 times, until skins are charred and blackened, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Transfer chile peppers to a resealable plastic bag and seal; set aside until steam starts to peel away skins, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Carefully open bag and peel skins from peppers.
', 'Step 6: Dice peppers.
', 'Step 7: Dice 1/2 the bell pepper and 2/3 the onion and mix with tomatoes, jalapeno peppers, cilantro, tomato juice, lime juice, garlic, salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon garlic salt together in a bowl.
', 'Step 8: Cover pico de gallo and refrigerate.
', 'Step 9: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 10: Thinly slice the remaining 1/3 onion and 1/2 bell pepper; cook and stir with chicken and mushrooms in the hot oil until vegetables are just tender, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add roasted green chile peppers, chili powder, oregano, 1 pinch garlic salt, and 1 pinch black pepper; cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 12: Stir enough enchilada sauce into vegetable mixture just to coat.
', 'Step 13: Spread pepperjack cheese and Cheddar cheese onto 1/2 of each tortilla.
', 'Step 14: Spread a layer of vegetable mixture over cheese layer.
', 'Step 15: Fold each tortilla over vegetable-cheese layer.
', 'Step 16: Brush the outsides of tortillas with remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil.
', 'Step 17: Cook quesadillas, working in batches, in a sandwich press or in a skillet over medium heat until browned and cheeses are melted, about 2 minutes; cut into 4 wedges.
', 'Step 18: Serve quesadillas with the pico de gallo.
']

Title: Mexican Bride Cookies
Ingredients: ['2 cups all-purpose flour', "½ cup confectioners' sugar", '1 cup butter, softened', '1 pinch salt', '1 cup chopped pecans', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract']

', 'Step 2: Mix the flour, sugar, salt, and nuts together in a medium bowl.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the vanilla.

"]

Title: Adobo Lime Steak Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 pound flat iron steak, or to taste', '2 teaspoons adobo seasoning', '2 limes, cut into wedges, divided', '2 tablespoons minced garlic', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 (8 ounce) package small soft tortillas', '1 onion, chopped', '1 bunch cilantro, chopped', '1 (7 ounce) can salsa verde']

['Step 1: Season the steak all over with adobo seasoning.
', 'Step 2: Squeeze 1 lime half onto the steak and rub garlic all over it.
', 'Step 3: Place on a dish and refrigerate, at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in an ovenproof pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Add steak and cook until a crust forms, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Flip and cook until crusty on the other side, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 8: Bake steak in the preheated oven until tender, about 30 minutes.

', 'Step 15: Repeat with remaining tortillas, steak, onion, and cilantro.
']

Title: Spiced Street Corn Salad (Esquites)
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '4 cups fresh sweet corn kernels', '½ medium white onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 small jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '3 ½ cups crumbled cotija cheese, divided', '2 tablespoons mayonnaise', '2 medium limes, juiced', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', 'sea salt to taste', '2 tablespoons chopped cilantro']

Title: Sarah's Creamy Veggie Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 onion, cut into 1/2-inch dice', '1 green bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch dice', '2 medium zucchini, halved lengthwise and sliced into 1/2-inch slices', '1 serrano chile, minced', '1 ear fresh corn kernels', '½ pound fresh spinach, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 cup sour cream', '¾ cup diced cotija cheese, divided', '¼ cup chopped cilantro', '15 corn tortillas', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

', 'Step 3: Add onion and bell pepper; cook until edges are golden, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add zucchini, serrano chile, and corn kernels.
', 'Step 5: Cook until slightly browned, about 5 minutes more.

', 'Step 10: Remove vegetable mixture from heat and set aside.
', 'Step 11: Pour a thin layer of enchilada sauce into a 9x13-inch baking dish.

', 'Step 14: Spoon 1/3 cup vegetable mixture into 1 tortilla.
', 'Step 15: Fold sides in like a taco and place, seam-side down, into the enchilada sauce in the baking dish.
', 'Step 16: Repeat with remaining tortillas and vegetable mixture.
', 'Step 17: Pour remaining enchilada sauce over the enchiladas in the baking dish.
', 'Step 18: Sprinkle remaining cotija cheese on top.
', 'Step 19: Bake in the preheated oven until slightly bubbly and golden at the edges, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Remove from oven and cool at least 10 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Homemade Churros with Cardamom and Chocolate
Ingredients: ['½ cup water', '2 ½ tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '½ tablespoon salt', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '1 ½ cups grapeseed oil for frying, or as needed', '4 tablespoons heavy cream', '1 (2 ounce) bar dark chocolate (70%)', '2 tablespoons chocolate-hazelnut spread (such as Nutella®)', '1 tablespoon unsalted butter', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '½ teaspoon ground coffee beans', '8 cardamom pods, seeded and hulls discarded', '1 (2 inch) piece cinnamon stick', '1 star anise pod', '½ cup white sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring water to a boil in a medium-sized pot.
', 'Step 2: Add vegetable oil, sugar, and salt.
', 'Step 3: Stir to combine.
', 'Step 4: Add flour and turn off heat.
', 'Step 5: Stir continuously and vigorously with a wooden spoon until dough balls up and follows your spoon around the pan, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Set aside to cool when dough feels firm and supple.
', 'Step 7: Heat 3/4- to 1 inch of grapeseed oil in a medium-sized pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: While oil heats, combine heavy cream, dark chocolate, chocolate-hazelnut spread, butter, sugar, and ground coffee in a pan set over lowest heat.
', 'Step 9: Stir often to ensure even melting, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Grease the inside of a piping bag fitted with a star tip.
', 'Step 11: Insert dough and squeeze it all the way to the bottom of the bag.
', 'Step 12: Insert the handle of a wooden spoon into the oil heating in the pot; if it bubbles steadily, the oil is ready.
', 'Step 13: Carefully squeeze dough out of the bag directly into the hot oil, cutting it off at 6-inch lengths.
', 'Step 14: You can also pipe lengths of dough onto parchment paper and transfer them to the oil by hand.
', 'Step 15: Do not crowd the pot.
', 'Step 16: Fry churros, turning every minute, for 2 to 3 minutes total.
', 'Step 17: Transfer fried churros to a dish lined with paper towels.
', 'Step 18: Place cardamom seeds, cinnamon stick, and star anise in a spice grinder and blend to a fine powder.
', 'Step 19: Transfer to a wide dish and add sugar.
', 'Step 20: Mix well to combine.
', 'Step 21: Toss warm churros into the cinnamon-cardamom sugar.
', 'Step 22: Serve alongside a dipping cup of the chocolate sauce.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '527.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '58.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '28.7 mg', 'fatContent': '32.2 g', 'fiberContent': '2.4 g', 'proteinContent': '3.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '8.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '888.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '42.3 g'}

Title: Baked Chicken Fajitas
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '6 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, trimmed', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning mix', '4 medium potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced', '1 large onion, cut into wedges', '1 medium green bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '¼ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 dash hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chiles, undrained']

Title: Tex-Mex Pasta Salad
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 (16 ounce) package fusilli pasta', '2 pounds extra lean ground beef', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 (24 ounce) jar mild salsa', '1 (8 ounce) bottle ranch dressing', '1 ½ red bell peppers, chopped', '6 green onions, chopped', '¾ cup chopped pickled jalapeno peppers', '1 (2.25 ounce) can sliced black olives', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese']

', 'Step 11: Toss together the cooked pasta, cooled beef mixture, Cheddar cheese, and dressing mixture in a large bowl.
', 'Step 12: Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Mexican Chicken and Rice
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 small onion, diced', '1 small green bell pepper, diced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 ¼ cups long-grain white rice', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 ½ cups chicken broth', '1 cup salsa', '¾ cup frozen corn', '1 ½ cups grated Cheddar cheese, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 2: Pour oil into the pot and add onion, bell pepper, and garlic.
', 'Step 3: Saute for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add chicken and season with cumin, cayenne, and salt; stir to combine.
', 'Step 5: Continue cooking until onion is clear and chicken is slightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Pour in rice and saute, allowing oil and spices to coat grains.
', 'Step 7: Stir black beans, diced tomatoes, chicken broth, salsa, and corn into the pot.
', 'Step 8: Mix well.
', 'Step 9: Cancel Saute function.
', 'Step 10: Close and lock the lid with vent turned to Sealing.
', "Step 11: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 8 minutes.
", 'Step 12: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 13: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes.
", 'Step 14: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 15: Cover the top with Cheddar cheese and replace the lid.
', 'Step 16: Let steam melt the cheese before serving, about 3 minutes.
']

Title: Slow Cooker White Bean Chicken Chili
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 medium Spanish onions, chopped', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '2 teaspoons ground paprika', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '2 teaspoons black pepper', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon chopped garlic', '2 (4 ounce) cans chopped green chile peppers', '3 ½ cups tomatillo salsa', '6 cups chicken stock', '1 pound cubed skinless, boneless chicken', '3 (15 ounce) cans white beans, drained', '2 (15.25 ounce) cans sweet corn, drained', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer', '1 bunch cilantro, stemmed and roughly chopped']

Title: Mexican Spaghetti Squash Stir Fry
Ingredients: ['1 spaghetti squash, halved and seeded', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 small green bell peppers, diced', '1 onion, diced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pound lean ground turkey', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans', '¼ cup sun-dried tomatoes', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 cube chicken bouillon', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon seasoned salt', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon red pepper flakes']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place spaghetti squash halves, cut sides down, on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until flesh is tender and easily shreds when punctured with a fork, 20 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Carefully shred flesh with a fork until it resembles spaghetti.
', 'Step 5: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir bell peppers, onion, and garlic in the hot oil until slightly tender, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add ground turkey to vegetable mixture; cook and stir until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 7: Mix black beans, sun-dried tomatoes, tomato sauce, chicken bouillon, chili powder, garlic powder, seasoned salt, cumin, and red pepper flakes into ground turkey mixture; cook until heated through and flavors have blended, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Spoon spaghetti squash onto each plate; top with ground turkey mixture.
']

Title: Mini Taco Quiches
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 pound lean ground beef', '⅓ cup chopped onion', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '⅓ cup sliced black olives', '¼ cup water', '2 tablespoons hot sauce', '1 large egg, beaten', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '4 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '⅓ cup sour cream', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 12-cup muffin tin with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Cook beef and onion in a large, nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 5: Drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 6: Stir in tomato sauce, olives, water, hot sauce, egg, and taco seasoning; mix well.
', 'Step 7: Cut each flour tortilla into 3 rounds using a 4-inch round cookie cutter.
', 'Step 8: Fit a round into each of the prepared muffin cups and fill each with 1/4 cup meat mixture.

']

Title: Mexican Lasagna with Cactus
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '4 pounds ground beef', '2 envelopes taco seasoning mix', '1 (28 ounce) can enchilada sauce, divided', '4 (15 ounce) packages flour tortillas, cut in half - divided', '2 (16 ounce) cans fat-free refried beans', '2 (12 ounce) packages queso fresco (Mexican cheese), thinly sliced - divided', '2 (16 ounce) packages shredded reduced-fat Mexican cheese blend, divided', '1 (16 ounce) jar nopalitos (sliced cactus), drained - divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a large disposable aluminum roasting pan with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat, breaking the meat into crumbles as it browns, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Drain excess grease and stir in taco seasoning and half the enchilada sauce.
', 'Step 5: Reserve remaining enchilada sauce for later use.
', 'Step 6: Bring beef mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Set meat aside.
', 'Step 8: Layer one package of tortillas into the bottom of the prepared aluminum roasting pan and spread refried beans evenly in a layer over the tortillas.
', 'Step 9: Arrange 1 more package of halved tortillas over the beans, and top with slices of queso fresco.
', 'Step 10: Spread 1 package of reduced-fat Mexican cheese blend over queso fresco slices.
', 'Step 11: Lay half the sliced nopalitos in a criss-cross pattern over the shredded cheese.
', 'Step 12: Top nopalito layer with 1 more package of tortillas and spread beef mixture over the tortillas; top with remaining package of tortillas.
', 'Step 13: Finish casserole with remaining enchilada sauce and remaining 1 package cheese blend.
', 'Step 14: Top the cheese with remaining nopalito slices arranged in a criss-cross pattern.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is bubbling and the cheese topping is melted and starting to brown, 25 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Serve in squares.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '778.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '78.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '88.7 mg', 'fatContent': '25.4 g', 'fiberContent': '7.4 g', 'proteinContent': '53.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '9.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '1786.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.5 g'}

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Mole Tacos
Ingredients: ['¼ cup vegetable oil', '2 tomatillos, diced', '1 tomato, diced', '1 onion, finely diced', '5 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ¼ cups prepared mole sauce', '⅓ cup chicken broth', '2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '8 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '½ cup black beans - rinsed, drained, and warmed', '½ cup shredded lettuce, or to taste', '⅛ cup crumbled queso fresco, or to taste', '1 avocado, diced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 2: Heat vegetable oil in the inner pot.
', 'Step 3: Saute tomatillos, tomato, onion, and garlic in the hot oil, stirring occasionally, allowing tomatillo pieces and onion to brown, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Pour mole sauce and chicken broth into the pot and mix.
', 'Step 5: Place chicken breasts into sauce, allowing to sink slightly, but not mixing.
', 'Step 6: Turn Saute mode off.
', 'Step 7: Close and lock the Instant Pot® lid and seal the vent.
', "Step 8: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 10 minutes.
", 'Step 9: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 10: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 15 to 20 minutes.
", 'Step 11: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 12: Transfer cooked chicken breasts to a serving bowl and shred using 2 forks.
', 'Step 13: Pour sauce mixture over shredded chicken.
', 'Step 14: Serve with tortillas, black beans, lettuce, queso fresco, and avocado.
']

Title: Grilled Shrimp Fajitas
Ingredients: ['¼ cup vegetable oil', '2 tablespoons cider vinegar', '2 tablespoons water', "1 (1.06 oz) packet mojito lime marinade mix (such as McCormick's® Grill Mates)", '2 pounds raw jumbo shrimp, shelled and deveined', '1 serving cooking spray', '1 large onion, sliced into 1/2-inch rings', '2 each yellow bell peppers, quartered', '2 each red bell peppers, quartered', '1 (8 ounce) package fajita-size flour tortillas']

', 'Step 5: Add bell peppers.

', 'Step 7: Transfer to a cutting board and chop roughly.

', 'Step 9: Transfer shrimp to a bowl covered with aluminum foil to keep warm.

']

Title: Scottie's Chicken Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['1 (49.5 fluid ounce) can chicken broth', '1 (14 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (14 ounce) can black beans, drained', '1 cube beef bouillon', '¾ cup chopped broccoli', '1 (28 ounce) can stewed tomatoes (crushed)', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '8 corn tortillas, cut into 1-inch strips', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1/2 inch cubes', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '1 tablespoon tequila', '1 tablespoon onion powder', '1 tablespoon garlic salt', '1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', '2 tablespoons Cajun seasoning', '1 cup shredded white Cheddar cheese']

['Step 1: Combine the chicken broth, corn, black beans, beef bouillon, broccoli, and tomatoes in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: While the broth mixture simmers, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet.
', 'Step 3: Fry the tortilla strips in the hot oil until crisp.
', 'Step 4: Remove from skillet and drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 5: Pour 2 tablespoons olive oil into the skillet.
', 'Step 6: Once the oil is hot, add the chicken; cook and stir until cooked through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the lime juice, tequila, onion powder, garlic salt, cayenne pepper, and Cajun seasoning; cook another 2 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Transfer the chicken mixture to the pot with the broth mixture.

Title: My Cinco de Mayo Chili
Ingredients: ['2 pounds ground beef', '2 pounds ground pork', '2 large sweet onions, diced', '3 large green onions, chopped', '4 large garlic cloves, minced', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer', '½ cup chili powder', '¼ cup ground cumin', '2 ounces fire-roasted diced green chile peppers', '2 tablespoons corn meal', '1 large dried ancho chile pepper', '1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger tequila', '6 slices pickled jalapeno pepper, chopped', '1 teaspoon unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ cup frozen fire-roasted corn', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained']

Title: Southwest Chicken Pie

']

Title: Pollo en Pipian (Chicken in Pipian Sauce)
Ingredients: ['1 (3 pound) chicken, cut into parts', '3 cups water', '2 stalks celery', '1 bay leaf, crumbled', '1 onion, quartered', '2 cloves garlic', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons black pepper', '½ cup blanched almonds', '⅔ cup sesame seeds', '1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil', '2 teaspoons chicken bouillon', '3 guero chile peppers, chopped', '2 jalapeno peppers, chopped', '⅓ cup pitted black olives', '2 teaspoons capers']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large saucepan, combine chicken, water, celery, bay leaf, onion, and garlic.
', 'Step 2: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 3: Cook until chicken is cooked through and tender.
', 'Step 4: Strain, reserving the broth.
', 'Step 5: Skin and bone the chicken; set the meat aside.
', 'Step 6: Toast the sesame seeds lightly in a skillet, stirring constantly, until they are fragrant.
', 'Step 7: In a food processor or blender, puree the sesame seeds and almonds with1 cup of the reserved chicken broth.

', 'Step 9: Add the blended sesame seed and almond mixture, and cook for 5 to 8 minutes, or until thickened.
', 'Step 10: Stir in 1 to 2 cups reserved chicken broth and chicken bouillon.
', 'Step 11: Simmer for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Stir in the chopped peppers, olives, capers, and chicken.
', 'Step 13: Simmer for 10 minutes, and serve hot.
']

Title: Runza Burritos International
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds ground round', '½ medium head cabbage, chopped', '1 ½ onion, chopped', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 cup water', '8 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese']

', 'Step 2: Cook and stir until the beef is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink.

Title: Easy Chicken Tamale Pie
Ingredients: ['2 (8.5 ounce) boxes cornbread mix (such as Jiffy®)', '⅔ cup milk', '2 large eggs', '1 teaspoon olive oil', '1 cup chopped white onion', '2 pounds ground chicken', '1 cup chopped roasted poblano peppers', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 clove garlic, diced', '1 (15 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '2 cups canned pinto beans, drained and rinsed', '1 cup chopped black olives', '½ cup enchilada sauce']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Title: Carne Asada French Fries
Ingredients: ['1 pound beef skirt steak, thinly sliced', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle lager beer (such as Corona®)', '½ (1.41 ounce) package sazon seasoning with coriander and annatto (such as Goya®)', '1 (26 ounce) package frozen French fries', '1 cup queso blanco sauce', '¼ cup diced onion', '¼ cup chopped cilantro']

['Step 1: Place steak, beer, and sazon seasoning in a gallon-sized resealable bag.

', 'Step 5: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 6: Cook steak for 5 minutes, flipping halfway through.
', 'Step 7: Transfer to a plate and let rest for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Bake fries in the preheated oven until light golden in color, 11 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Divide among 4 serving plates and drizzle queso over the top.

', 'Step 11: Garnish with onion and cilantro.

', 'Step 2: When the cheese is melted whisk in half and half until smooth and creamy.
