Title: Pressure Cooker Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 large onions, chopped', '1 (12 ounce) jar roasted red peppers, drained and chopped', '1 (4 ounce) can roasted jalapeno peppers, diced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', 'salt to taste', '4 cups diced tomatoes', '1 (32 fluid ounce) container chicken stock', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 (14.5 ounce) package tortilla chips', '1 cup sour cream', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded queso quesadilla (white Mexican cheese)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat vegetable oil in pressure cooker over medium heat; cook and stir onions until slightly softened, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Add red peppers, jalapeno peppers, garlic, black pepper, and salt; cook until garlic is fragrant and onions are softened, about 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir tomatoes into onion mixture and cook until warmed, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Transfer tomato mixture to a blender.
', 'Step 5: Cover and hold lid down; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend.
', 'Step 6: Puree in batches until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Transfer tomato puree back to pressure cooker.
', 'Step 8: Stir chicken stock into tomato puree; cook and stir over high heat until just boiling, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Cover and lock pressure cooker.
', 'Step 10: Cook over high heat until steam begins to build and steadily escapes.
', 'Step 11: Lower heat to medium-low; cook for 20 more minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove from heat; allow all the steam to naturally release.
', 'Step 13: Remove lid.
', 'Step 14: Bring soup to a boil; stir in cream and cilantro.
', 'Step 15: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 16: Let cool for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Crush tortilla chips into serving bowls; pour soup over tortilla chips.
', 'Step 18: Top with sour cream and queso quesadilla.
']

Title: Papas con Chorizo
Ingredients: ['1 (9 ounce) package Mexican chorizo sausage, casings removed', '1 ½ tablespoons bacon drippings', '2 cups diced potatoes', '1 serrano pepper, chopped', '⅓ cup chopped onion', '½ teaspoon salt, or to taste', '¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or to taste']

['Step 1: Cook chorizo in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until sausage turns a dark red, 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove chorizo from the skillet and set aside.
', 'Step 3: Melt bacon grease in the same skillet over medium to medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Add diced potatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add diced onion and serrano pepper and continue cooking and stirring until potatoes are fork-tender, onion is translucent, and serrano pepper is soft, 2 to 6 more minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add chorizo back into skillet and stir until heated through.
', 'Step 7: Season with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Pork and Hominy Stew
Ingredients: ['1 (2 pound) pork roast, diced', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', 'salt and pepper', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 (15.5 ounce) cans white hominy', '20 dried chile de arbol peppers', 'water', '1 ¼ cups finely chopped onion', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '12 corn tortillas, warmed', '2 limes, quartered', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '1 ½ cups shredded cabbage']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat; add diced pork, cumin, and salt and pepper to taste.
', 'Step 2: Cook, stirring frequently, until evenly browned.
', 'Step 3: Transfer pork to a large pot.
', 'Step 4: Stir in hominy and 3 cups water.
', 'Step 5: Cook over medium heat for 1 hour.
', 'Step 6: While pork and hominy are cooking, place chiles in a small saucepan with 2 cups water.
', 'Step 7: Boil for 45 minutes, covered.
', 'Step 8: Drain, and remove stems.
', 'Step 9: Place chiles in a blender with 1/4 cup water, onion, and garlic.
', 'Step 10: Blend until smooth (you may still see seeds).
', 'Step 11: Set aside.
', 'Step 12: Serve pork and hominy soup in bowls, garnished with lime juice, cilantro, cabbage.
', 'Step 13: For spicy soup, stir one teaspoon of chile into each bowl of soup.
']

Title: Morelos Salsa Verde
Ingredients: ['2 pounds tomatillos, husked', '2 fresh jalapeno peppers', '3 cloves garlic, peeled', '1 dash cloves', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 dash black pepper', '1 teaspoon chicken bouillon granules, or salt']

['Step 1: Place tomatillos, jalapenos, and garlic in a large pot.
', 'Step 2: Pour in just enough water to cover the tomatillos; they will float, so press them down with your hand as you measure the water.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the color of the tomatillos lightens to a yellow color, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat, and allow to cool for about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Strain the tomatillos, reserving the water.
', 'Step 6: Place into the bowl of a blender; add the cloves, cumin, pepper, and chicken bouillon.
', 'Step 7: Puree until smooth, use the reserved water as needed to adjust the consistency.
']

Title: Lengua (Beef Tongue) Stir-Fry
Ingredients: ['1 beef tongue', '5 fresh green chile peppers', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 white onion, sliced thinly', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '4 small tomatoes, halved and sliced', '2 (15 ounce) cans whole kernel corn, drained', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Wash tongue and place in a large pot of water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Simmer until no longer pink, about 50 minutes per pound of tongue.
', 'Step 3: Remove from water and let rest until cool enough to handle.
', 'Step 4: Peel skin from tongue and trim gristle.
', 'Step 5: Cut into 1/4 inch slices.
', 'Step 6: Place whole peppers in a skillet over medium-high heat and roast, turning, until all sides are charred.
', 'Step 7: Let cool, rub off skins.
', 'Step 8: Remove stems and seeds.
', 'Step 9: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 10: Saute chile peppers, onion and garlic until onion is translucent.
', 'Step 11: Stir in tongue and continue to cook until tongue is brown, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Stir in tomatoes and cook until limp, 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Pour in corn and heat through, 2 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Season with salt.
', 'Step 15: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Taco Bowl
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 ½ (14.5 ounce) cans chicken broth, divided', '2 chicken breasts', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning', '1 (15 ounce) can ranch-style beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can corn, drained', '1 ½ cups salsa', '1 ¼ cups uncooked brown rice']

Title: Slow Cooker Mexican Shredded Chicken
Ingredients: ['½ cup chicken broth', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce', '1 tablespoon garlic salt', '1 tablespoon cider vinegar', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves']

Title: Kelly's Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 pound lean ground turkey', '2 large carrots, grated', '2 tablespoons dried minced onion', '1 diced fresh jalapeno pepper, or to taste', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '¼ cup water', 'hot garlic-pepper sauce (such as Tabasco® Garlic Pepper Sauce)', '1 cup plain Greek yogurt', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '2 cups shredded queso quesadilla (Mexican melting cheese)', '7 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '½ (14.5 ounce) can red enchilada sauce']

['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

', 'Step 3: Cook and stir until the turkey is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink.

', 'Step 5: Simmer until the water has evaporated.
', 'Step 6: Combine the yogurt, cream of chicken soup, and queso quesadilla cheese in a bowl.
', 'Step 7: Place a tortilla onto your work surface, then spoon some of the turkey mixture halfway between the bottom edge and the center of the tortilla.

', 'Step 9: Roll the tortilla up to the top edge, forming a tight cylinder.

']

Title: Shannon's Lower Fat Chile Relleno
Ingredients: ['4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '4 fresh green chile peppers', '4 slices lowfat Monterey Jack cheese', '1 egg white', '2 tablespoons water', '½ cup cornmeal']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Pound chicken breasts with a mallet until flat.
', 'Step 3: Cut green chile peppers in half and remove seeds.
', 'Step 4: Place one chile pepper on each chicken breast.
', 'Step 5: Insert a slice of cheese inside each chile pepper.
', 'Step 6: Roll up breasts and secure with toothpicks.
', 'Step 7: Dunk each chicken roll in a bowl filled with egg white and water, then roll in cornmeal.
', 'Step 8: Place coated chicken on a lightly greased cookie sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes or until tops are lightly browned and cheese is oozing out of the sides.
', 'Step 9: Remove toothpicks and serve.
', 'Step 10: To Freeze Ahead: Place each chicken breast roll in a separate resealable plastic bag and put in freezer.
', 'Step 11: To prepare for serving, remove from the freezer and thaw.
', 'Step 12: Preheat oven.

Title: Mighty Matt's Kick-Butt Chili
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large onion, finely chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '2 pounds lean ground beef', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '2 ½ cups water', '⅓ cup chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 teaspoons dried Mexican oregano', '2 teaspoons cayenne pepper', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '3 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans, drained']

['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over high heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir in the onion and garlic; cook and stir just until you start to smell the garlic, 2-3 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add the ground beef and cook, stirring frequently, until crumbly and no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and stir in the tomato sauce, tomatoes, and water.
', 'Step 5: Season with the chili powder, cumin, salt, black pepper, oregano, cayenne, and sugar.

', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for about 1 hour.

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Taco Soup
Ingredients: ['1 small onion, diced', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 clove garlic, minced', '3 cups chicken broth', '1 (4 ounce) boneless skinless chicken breast', '½ cup uncooked white rice', '1 (10 ounce) can roasted tomatoes with green chiles (such as Ro-Tel®)', '½ cup corn', '2 tablespoons taco seasoning', '½ teaspoon cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 2: Add onion and butter to the hot pot.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir until fragrant and onion has softened, about 3 minutes, adding garlic during the last 30 seconds.
', 'Step 4: Remove onion mixture to a small bowl.
', 'Step 5: Hit Cancel.
', 'Step 6: Add chicken broth, chicken breast, and rice.
', 'Step 7: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 8: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 10 minutes.
", 'Step 9: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 10: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 11: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 12: Remove chicken breast, and shred.
', 'Step 13: Add tomatoes and corn to the pot, along with shredded chicken.
', 'Step 14: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 15: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 3 minutes.
", 'Step 16: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 17: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 18: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 19: Stir in reserved onion mixture, taco seasoning, cumin, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 20: Add Cheddar cheese and stir until melted.
']

Title: Azteca Cocoa Rice Pudding

Title: Mashed Jalapeno-Cilantro Sweet Potatoes
Ingredients: ['2 sweet potatoes', '1 whole jalapeno pepper', '¼ cup softened butter', '¼ cup orange juice', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', 'sea salt and cracked black pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons melted butter', '¼ cup walnut pieces']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Bake the sweet potatoes in the preheated oven until tender, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
', 'Step 3: Once tender, peel, and place into a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 4: While the potatoes are baking, place the jalapeno pepper in the oven, and bake until the skin loosens, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Peel, mince, and place into the bowl with the potatoes.
', 'Step 6: Add the softened butter, orange juice, and cilantro; mix with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy.
', 'Step 7: Season to taste with salt and pepper, then transfer to a 1 quart baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Drizzle with the melted butter and sprinkle with the walnut pieces.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until hot in the center, about 20 minutes.

Title: Mexican Chicken Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['3 dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded', '1 dried ancho chile, stemmed and seeded', '1 pinch salt', '1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs, or more to taste', '3 cloves garlic, smashed', '1 (14 ounce) can no-salt-added diced tomatoes, drained', '3 tablespoons oil, divided', '1 white onion, chopped', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '1 (12 ounce) package fire-roasted frozen corn', '3 teaspoons chicken bouillon', '¼ cup chicken broth, or as needed', '½ cup crispy tortilla strips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place guajillo chile peppers, ancho chile pepper, and a pinch of salt in a small saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Cover with water and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Cook over medium-low heat until peppers have softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Turn off heat, drain peppers, and set aside to cool.
', 'Step 5: Combine chicken, garlic, and a generous pinch of salt in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 6: Cover with water and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Cook over medium-high heat until meat is tender and can be easily pulled apart with a fork, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Transfer chicken to a plate and shred with 2 forks when cool enough to handle.
', 'Step 9: Strain broth into a bowl and set aside to use in the soup.
', 'Step 10: Combine diced tomatoes and cooled chile peppers in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 11: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a cast iron soup pot over medium heat; stir in onion.
', 'Step 12: Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Add oregano and paprika; saute until onion starts to brown, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Make a well in the center of the onions and add remaining 2 tablespoons oil.
', 'Step 15: Add pureed tomato-chile pepper mixture to the hot oil; it should sizzle.
', 'Step 16: Stir sauce to combine with onions and cook until heated through, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Add shredded chicken to the pot and stir until completely coated in sauce; simmer for 3 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Stir in reserved chicken broth, corn, and chicken bouillon until combined and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 19: Reduce heat and simmer until flavors have blended, about 10 minutes, adding additional chicken broth if soup is too thick.
', 'Step 20: Ladle soup into bowls and top with tortilla strips.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '305.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '18.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '70.4 mg', 'fatContent': '16.3 g', 'fiberContent': '3.1 g', 'proteinContent': '22.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '441.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.9 g'}

Title: Chicken in Mole Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 (2 pound) bone-in chickens, giblets removed', '1 large onion, cut into chunks', '3 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (14 ounce) can chicken broth', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '20 blanched almonds', '¼ cup diced firm ripe banana', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 corn tortillas, torn into small pieces', '2 tablespoons sesame seeds', '1 tablespoon pine nuts', '6 tablespoons butter', '1 (1 ounce) square semisweet chocolate']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cut the chickens into pieces, reserving the breasts.
', 'Step 2: Place chicken pieces except the breasts in a deep saucepan over medium heat; add the onion, garlic, and chicken broth.
', 'Step 3: Cover the pan and simmer 25 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Cut the breasts into halves and add to the saucepan; simmer until the chicken breasts are no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes more.
', 'Step 5: An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Remove the chicken to a cutting board.
', 'Step 7: Remove the skin and bones from the chicken; cut the meat into bite sized pieces.
', 'Step 8: Strain the broth through a fine mesh strainer, reserving the liquid and discarding the onion, garlic, and skimmed fat.
', 'Step 9: If you have less than 3 cups of reserved liquid, add water to make 3 cups.
', 'Step 10: If you have more than 3 cups, return to the pan and bring to a boil; cook until volume of liquid reduces to 3 cups.
', 'Step 11: Combine the chili powder, almonds, banana, cinnamon, salt, tortilla pieces, sesame seeds, and pine nuts in a blender.
', 'Step 12: Blend on low, slowly adding the reserved liquid in a stream until the mixture is smooth.
', 'Step 13: Pour the mixture and remaining liquid into a large saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 14: Add the butter and chocolate; cook and stir until the butter and chocolate have melted.
', 'Step 15: Stir the chicken pieces into the sauce; continue cooking until the chicken is heated completely through, 5 to 10 minutes.
']

Title: Easy Steak and Shrimp Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 (20 ounce) package pre-seasoned fajita skirt steak (such as Eddy Carls)', '½ pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1 large onion', '1 medium red bell pepper, quartered', '1 medium green bell pepper, quartered', '1 (8 ounce) package fajita-sized flour tortillas']

Title: Mexican Chorizo Breakfast Pie
Ingredients: ['3 cups frozen shredded hash browns', '3 large eggs eggs, beaten, divided', '2 tablespoons minced onion', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 ½ tablespoons olive oil', '1 pound bulk Mexican chorizo sausage', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '¼ cup milk', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9-inch pie pan.
', 'Step 3: Combine hash browns, 1 egg, minced onion, flour, and salt in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Pour into the prepared pie pan and smooth down to form a crust.
', 'Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Brush the crust with olive oil and continue to bake until golden and set, about 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 7: Remove from the oven and reduce temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir chorizo in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add chopped onion and garlic and saute for another 3 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove any extra grease from the pan if desired.
', 'Step 12: Beat remaining eggs and milk together in a bowl until smooth; add cilantro and cumin.
', 'Step 13: Spread half of the Monterey Jack cheese onto the potato crust.
', 'Step 14: Spoon chorizo mixture over and top with remaining Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 15: Pour egg mixture over the top.
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set and the top of the pie is slightly browned, 35 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Serve warm.
']

Title: Easy Slow Cooker Chicken Mole
Ingredients: ['1 cup chopped onion', '⅓ cup golden raisins', '⅓ cup currants', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ½ teaspoons ancho chile powder', '2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds', '¾ teaspoon ground cumin', '¾ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '5 teaspoons cocoa powder', '¼ teaspoon hot pepper sauce, or to taste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 cup tomato sauce', '1 cup chicken broth', '3 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '¼ cup slivered almonds, for garnish']

Title: Salsa Ninety Nine (Mild)
Ingredients: ['24 pounds tomatoes', '1 (12 ounce) can tomato paste', '½ bunch cilantro', '16 jalapeno chile peppers', '2 medium heads garlic', '6 large green bell peppers, chopped', '6 large onions, chopped', '9 tablespoons salt', '1 cup distilled white vinegar', '½ cup brown sugar', '¾ cup cornstarch', '½ cup water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Core and peel the tomatoes.
', 'Step 2: Remove the tomato seeds and pulp.
', 'Step 3: Put seeds and pulp through a food mill.
', 'Step 4: Chop the outsides of the tomatoes In a large pot over low heat, boil the milled liquid and tomato paste for 1 hour, or until the liquid is reduced by 1/3.
', 'Step 5: In a blender or food processor, puree cilantro, jalapeno, garlic and 1/2 cup of the tomato liquid from the large pot.
', 'Step 6: Slowly stir this mixture into the pot.
', 'Step 7: Bring the contents of the pot to a boil while mixing in the green peppers, onions, chopped tomatoes, salt, vinegar and brown sugar.
', 'Step 8: In a small bowl, dissolve the cornstarch in water.
', 'Step 9: Add the cornstarch mixture to the pot.
', 'Step 10: Stirring continually, boil the mixture until all the vegetable are soft -- about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Allow the mixture to cool, and place it in sterile containers.
']

Title: Breakfast Migas
Ingredients: ['½ cup oil for frying', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into bite-sized pieces', 'salt to taste', '3 peppers dried guajillo chilies', '5 medium Roma tomatoes', '2 cloves garlic, peeled', '¼ cup chopped onion', '3 cups hot water', '2 teaspoons salt, divided', '¼ teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '⅛ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 pinch ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '5 large eggs, beaten', '3 medium green onions, chopped', '¼ cup fresh cilantro leaves', '1 ripe avocado, pitted and sliced', '2 tablespoons shredded Oaxaca cheese, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place skillet on the stove over medium heat and add enough oil to reach 1 inch.
', 'Step 2: Once oil is hot, add cut tortilla pieces without overcrowding the skillet.
', 'Step 3: Fry tortilla pieces in the hot oil, until they crisp up and achieve a golden color, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove tortilla chips with a slotted spoon and set on a plate covered with paper towels to drain.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle with salt to taste and continue working in batches until all tortilla pieces are fried and done.
', 'Step 6: Reserve frying oil.
', 'Step 7: Set a flat griddle or comal over medium-low heat and toast guajillo chiles until fragrant, about 20 seconds per side.
', 'Step 8: Combine toasted chiles, tomatoes, and garlic in a saucepan and cover with hot water.
', 'Step 9: Simmer over medium-low heat until guajillos are softened and tomatoes are cooked through, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Reserve 1/2 cup cooking liquid.
', 'Step 11: Combine chiles, tomatoes, garlic, onion, 1 teaspoon salt, oregano, cumin, pepper, and reserved liquid in a blender.
', 'Step 12: Blend on high until smooth.
', 'Step 13: Strain sauce.
', 'Step 14: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a saucepan set over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 15: Once oil is hot, pour in sauce, and simmer until salsa thickens, 12 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Adjust seasoning if desired.
', 'Step 17: Heat 1 tablespoon of reserved frying oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 18: Add all tortilla chips once oil is hot and reheat for 1 minute.
', 'Step 19: Pour in eggs and cook and stir until eggs are beginning to set.
', 'Step 20: Add salsa and gently fold into the egg mixture until everything is covered in salsa and the eggs are cooked, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Remove from the heat and serve immediately topped with green onions, cilantro, avocado, and cheese.
']

Title: Fiesta Corn Tortilla Pizzas
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) can refried beans', '6 (7 inch) corn tortillas', 'cooking spray', '1 ¾ cups shredded Mexican cheese blend', '3 roma (plum) tomatoes, seeded and diced', '2 green onions, sliced', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 (4 ounce) can sliced black olives, well drained']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat refried beans in a microwave-safe bowl in the microwave on high until warmed through, about 2 minutes, stirring after 1 minute.
', 'Step 2: Spray both sides of each corn tortilla with cooking spray and arrange them on a wire rack.
', 'Step 3: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Pan-fry one side of each tortilla until lightly browned, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Return tortillas to wire rack, browned sides up.
', 'Step 6: Spread a thin layer of refried beans onto the tortillas, stopping about 1/2 inch from the edge.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle Mexican cheese blend over refried beans.
', 'Step 8: Carefully transfer a tortilla pizza back to the skillet, bean side up.
', 'Step 9: Lightly fry until cheese begins to melt, about 1 minute more; return tortilla pizza to wire rack.
', 'Step 10: Repeat with remaining pizzas.
', 'Step 11: Scatter tomatoes, green onions, cilantro, and olives over melted cheese.
', 'Step 12: Slice pizzas to serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '153.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '13.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '21.7 mg', 'fatContent': '8.2 g', 'fiberContent': '3.3 g', 'proteinContent': '7.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '345.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.7 g'}

Title: Chipotle Burgers with Avocado Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '1 pound ground beef', '1 (7 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 cup chopped fresh mushrooms', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and diced', '1 onion, diced', '1 tomato, diced', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped', '1 lime, juiced', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '4 onion rolls, split']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Place half the chopped cilantro into a large bowl and mix with ground beef, chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, mushrooms, and Worcestershire sauce.
', 'Step 3: Set remaining cilantro aside.
', 'Step 4: Form the beef mixture into 4 patties.
', 'Step 5: Lightly toss remaining cilantro in a bowl with avocado, onion, tomato, jalapeno peppers, lime juice, salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 6: Grill burgers on the preheated grill until browned and no longer pink inside, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 7: Serve the burgers on onion rolls topped with avocado salsa.
']

Title: Vanilla and Chocolate Conchas
Ingredients: ['3 teaspoons active dry yeast', '½ cup warm water (110 to 115 degrees F/43 to 46 degrees C)', '4 cups all-purpose flour', '¾ cup white sugar', '½ cup lukewarm evaporated milk', '⅓ cup lard', '1 egg', '1 ¼ teaspoons ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon salt', '⅔ cup white sugar', '½ cup salted butter', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon unsweetened Dutch-processed cocoa powder', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Dissolve yeast in water in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Stir in 2 cups flour, sugar, evaporated milk, lard, egg, cinnamon, and salt.
', 'Step 3: Beat until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Stir in enough of the remaining flour to make dough easy to handle.
', 'Step 5: Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface.
', 'Step 6: Knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Place in a large greased bowl, then turn so greased side faces up.
', 'Step 8: Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 9: Meanwhile, make topping dough.
', 'Step 10: Beat sugar and butter together until light and fluffy.
', 'Step 11: Stir in flour until mixture is the consistency of coarse crumbs.
', 'Step 12: Divide into 2 equal parts.
', 'Step 13: Stir cocoa powder into 1 part and vanilla extract into the other.
', 'Step 14: Divide chocolate topping into 4 small balls; roll each piece into a flat circle.
', 'Step 15: Repeat for the vanilla topping.
', 'Step 16: Punch down concha dough and divide into 8 equal pieces.
', 'Step 17: Shape each piece into a ball; placed on a greased baking sheet.
', 'Step 18: Place a vanilla or chocolate circle on each ball of dough, smoothing it over the top.
', 'Step 19: Make 5 or 6 shallow cuts across the circle to form a shell pattern.
', 'Step 20: Cover and let rise until doubled, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 22: Bake conchas until lightly browned around the edges, 15 to 20 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '638.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '98 g', 'cholesterolContent': '66.4 mg', 'fatContent': '22.8 g', 'fiberContent': '2.8 g', 'proteinContent': '10.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '11.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '400.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '37.3 g'}

Title: Southwestern Bake
Ingredients: ['1 pound lean ground beef', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 onion, chopped', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained', '2 (8.75 ounce) cans whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (16 ounce) container sour cream', '2 cups fresh salsa', '5 cups crushed plain tortilla chips', '3 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 large fresh tomato, finely chopped', '3 green onions, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a medium skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef with the garlic and onion; drain.
', 'Step 3: In a large mixing bowl, combine the meat mixture, chili powder, black beans, corn, sour cream and salsa.
', 'Step 4: Stir until well blended.
', 'Step 5: Into a 9x13 inch baking dish, spoon enough of the beef mixture to cover the bottom.
', 'Step 6: Arrange half of the crushed tortilla chips on top of the meat mixture and layer with 1 cup of Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 7: Spoon another layer of the meat mixture on top of the cheese layer, cover with remaining chips and layer with 1 cup of cheese.
', 'Step 8: Spread final layer of meat mixture on top and sprinkle the remaining 1 cup of cheese on top.
', 'Step 9: Top with diced tomato and green onions.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Easy Crabmeat Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['12 ounces imitation crabmeat, flaked', '¼ cup low-fat sour cream', '½ onion, chopped', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '¼ cup skim milk', '6 (8 inch) low-fat flour tortilla']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a large microwave-safe bowl, combine the flaked imitation crab, sour cream, onion, and 1/2 of the enchilada sauce; Mix well.

', 'Step 4: Pour milk into an 8 inch pie plate.
', 'Step 5: Dip the tortillas, one at a time, in the milk.

', 'Step 7: Roll tortilla and place in a greased 9x9 inch glass baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Pour remaining enchilada sauce over the top of the enchiladas.
', 'Step 9: Bake uncovered in a preheated oven for 20 minutes.
']

Title: Shiner® Bock Shredded Chicken Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 whole chicken', '2 tablespoons chicken fajita seasoning', '1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', '2 cups water, or more as needed', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer (such as Shiner® Bock)', '1 (16 ounce) can enchilada sauce (such as El Paso® Hot Red Enchilada Sauce)', '3 fresh jalapeno peppers, diced', '1 white onion, chopped', '1 (10 ounce) package corn tortillas, or as needed', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken in a large pot and season with fajita seasoning and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 2: Pour water and beer over chicken.
', 'Step 3: Cook chicken over medium heat until meat falls off the bone and is no longer pink in the center, about 1 hour, adding more water if liquid reduces too much.
', 'Step 4: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Transfer chicken from broth mixture to a work surface to cool slightly, reserving broth mixture.
', 'Step 6: Combine enchilada sauce, jalapeno peppers, onion, and about 1/4 cup chicken broth mixture together in a large saucepan over medium-low heat; cook until onions are softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove meat from chicken and shred into enchilada sauce mixture; mix well.
', 'Step 8: Warm tortillas on a grill pan over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 9: Spoon chicken mixture into each corn tortilla and top with Mexican cheese blend.
']

Title: Fish Tacos al Pastor
Ingredients: ['2 pounds fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '10 dried chile de arbol peppers', '2 cloves garlic, unpeeled', 'salt to taste', '10 guajillo chile peppers - stems, seeds, and veins removed', '5 pasilla chile peppers - stems, seeds, and veins removed', '¼ cup white vinegar', '¼ cup orange juice', '1 clove garlic', '3 whole cloves', '1 pinch ground cumin', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper', '2 pounds skinless trout fillets', '¼ cup butter', '1 large onion, finely chopped, divided', '1 cup chopped fresh pineapple', '12 corn tortillas', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '4 limes, cut into wedges for garnish']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Wash tomatillos under cold running water.
', 'Step 2: Line a heavy cast iron grill pan or griddle with aluminum foil and place over high heat.
', 'Step 3: Arrange tomatillos, chiles de arbol, and 2 cloves garlic in a single layer on top.
', 'Step 4: Grill until chiles are blackened, turning as necessary, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Transfer to a bowl.
', 'Step 6: Continue grilling tomatillos and garlic until they are evenly blackened, 8 to 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 7: Peel garlic and place in a mortar and pestle.
', 'Step 8: Season with salt and pound into a thick paste.
', 'Step 9: Add chiles; pound until smooth.
', 'Step 10: Add as many tomatillos as you can fit in your mortar; pound until chunky.
', 'Step 11: Transfer salsa to a bowl.
', 'Step 12: Repeat with remaining tomatillos, mixing them into the bowl of salsa in batches.
', 'Step 13: Place guajillo and pasilla chile peppers in a saucepan, cover with water, and cook until softened, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Combine softened peppers, vinegar, orange juice, 1 clove garlic, cloves, cumin, salt, and pepper in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 15: Add some water if sauce is too thick.
', 'Step 16: Strain into a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Remove from heat and let cool, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Season trout fillets with pepper and put in a lidded container or a large resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 19: Cover with cooled sauce and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours.
', 'Step 20: Remove trout fillets from the refrigerator and let stand at room temperature for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Remove from sauce and cut into cubes.
', 'Step 22: Reserve marinade.
', 'Step 23: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat and cook 1/2 the onion until soft and translucent, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Add trout and reserved sauce; cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until trout is opaque and the sauce has been reduced, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 25: Remove from heat and fold in pineapple.
', 'Step 26: Warm corn tortillas in a skillet.
', 'Step 27: Divide trout mixture amongst tortillas and top with remaining 1/2 onion and cilantro.
', 'Step 28: Serve with lime wedges and charred tomatillo salsa.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '669.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '75.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '100.7 mg', 'fatContent': '20.5 g', 'fiberContent': '10.7 g', 'proteinContent': '41.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '211.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '11.9 g'}

Title: Yummy Chicken Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 whole chicken', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with habanero peppers (such as RO*TEL® Hot)', '1 green bell pepper, diced', '1 large onion, diced', '3 jalapeno chile peppers, seeded and diced', '2 (1 ounce) packets taco seasoning mix, divided', '2 tablespoons canola oil, or as needed', '1 (15 ounce) package flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken, tomatoes with habanero peppers, green bell pepper, onion, jalapeno chile peppers, and 1 packet taco seasoning in a large pot; pour in enough water to just cover chicken.
', 'Step 2: Bring chicken and vegetables to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until chicken is no longer pink inside, about 1 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 3: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone, should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Remove chicken from the pot and let cool.
', 'Step 5: Pull chicken meat off the bones and cut into bite-sized pieces; discard carcass.
', 'Step 6: Pour off about half the liquid from the pot, making sure all the vegetables stay.
', 'Step 7: Return chicken meat to pot; add the remaining 1 packet taco seasoning.
', 'Step 8: Simmer until flavors have blended, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat; fry tortillas, working in batches, in the hot oil until desired crispness is reached, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 10: Spoon chicken mixture into each tortilla to serve.
']

Title: Healthy Fish Tacos with Cilantro Slaw
Ingredients: ['1 pound tilapia fillets, cut into strips', '½ cup lime juice', '½ cup plain Greek yogurt', '2 peppers chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 tablespoon adobo sauce from chipotle peppers', '1 teaspoon chipotle-flavored hot sauce (such as Tabasco®)', '¼ teaspoon salt', '⅓ cup lime juice', '2 tablespoons honey powder', '1 tablespoon avocado oil', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '⅔ cup shredded green cabbage', '⅔ cup shredded red cabbage', '⅔ cup shredded carrots', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '4 (6 inch) corn tortillas, warmed', '4 (6 inch) flour tortillas, warmed', '1 cup diced fresh tomatoes']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine tilapia strips and 1/2 cup lime juice in a glass container.
', 'Step 2: Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 3 to 4 hours.
', 'Step 3: Combine yogurt, chipotle peppers, adobo sauce, hot sauce, and salt for spicy dressing in a blender or food processor; pulse until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 5: When ready to cook the tilapia, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Remove tilapia from the lime juice and shake off excess.
', 'Step 7: Place in a small baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Discard the remaining lime juice.
', 'Step 9: Whisk 1/3 cup lime juice, honey powder, avocado oil, cumin, and paprika for honey-cumin sauce together in a small bowl.
', 'Step 10: Pour over tilapia to cover.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 20 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Meanwhile, prepare slaw: Combine green and red cabbage, carrots, and cilantro in a bowl.
', 'Step 13: Remove spicy dressing from the refrigerator and pour all but 1/4 cup over the slaw; toss to combine.
', 'Step 14: Build tacos by putting 1 tablespoon remaining spicy dressing on each tortilla.
', 'Step 15: Top with tilapia strips, slaw, and tomatoes.
']

Title: Spicy Chicken Enchiladas with Tomatillo Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '8 fresh tomatillos, husked and chopped, or more to taste', '3 serrano peppers, chopped', '1 cup white vinegar', '1 cup water', '½ white onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pinch salt to taste', '½ cup fresh cilantro, stems removed', '1 lime, juiced', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided', '¾ cup sour cream', '1 tablespoon dried minced onion', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '6 flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Season chicken with cayenne, salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 3: Place chicken on the preheated grill and cook until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 5 to 7 minutes per side.
', 'Step 4: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Transfer to a plate and shred using 2 forks.
', 'Step 6: Combine tomatillos, serrano peppers, vinegar, water, onion, garlic, and salt in a large pot over high heat and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat and simmer until tomatillos are tender, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove from heat and chill in an ice bath until cool, 20 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add cilantro and lime juice.
', 'Step 10: Blend salsa thoroughly using an immersion blender.
', 'Step 11: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Mix shredded chicken, cream cheese, 4 ounces Mexican cheese, sour cream, 1/2 cup salsa, onion, and cayenne pepper together in a medium bowl.
', 'Step 13: Pour just enough salsa into a 9x13-inch baking pan to thinly cover the bottom.
', 'Step 14: Place a heaping spoonful of filling into each tortilla, roll, and place into the pan.
', 'Step 15: Try to keep them from touching.
', 'Step 16: Top with remaining salsa and Mexican cheese.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, 35 to 40 minutes.
']

Title: Tex-Mex Sheet Cake

Title: Tex-Mex Beef Bowl with Avocado Cilantro Dressing
Ingredients: ['½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '¼ teaspoon sweet paprika', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ pound flank steak', '1 cup cooked white rice', '1 cup halved cherry tomatoes', '1 cup chopped romaine lettuce', '1 cup tortilla chips', '½ cup canned black beans', '1 jalapeno pepper, thinly sliced', '1 lime, cut into wedges', '¼ cup crumbled cotija cheese', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', '2 avocados, peeled and pitted', '1 cup water', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons sour cream', '1 lime, juiced', '1 clove garlic', '1 pinch salt']

', 'Step 2: Combine garlic powder, chili powder, kosher salt, paprika, and cumin in a bowl; rub over all sides of flank steak.

Title: Appetizing Vegetarian Burritos
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 bunch celery, sliced', '1 large onion, chopped', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '2 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste', '1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (15 ounce) can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (15 ounce) can red kidney beans, drained and rinsed', '1 tablespoon lime juice, or to taste', 'hot sauce to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '8 (10 inch) warm flour tortillas']

', 'Step 2: Saute celery and onion in hot oil until onion starts to turn translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.

', 'Step 7: Season filling with lime juice, hot sauce, salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 8: Spoon filling in a line across the middle of a tortilla.
', 'Step 9: Fold opposing edges of the tortilla to overlap the filling.
', 'Step 10: Roll 1 of the opposing edges around the filling into a burrito.
', 'Step 11: Repeat with remaining filling and tortillas.

Title: Caldo Tlalpeño
Ingredients: ['4 ½ (6 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '½ onion', '1 stalk celery', '1 sprig fresh parsley', '2 quarts cold water', '2 tablespoons chicken bouillon granules', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '½ onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '4 tomatoes, diced', '1 cup canned chickpeas, drained', '2 carrots, peeled and chopped', '4 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', 'salt to taste', '2 avocados, peeled and cubed', '2 limes, quartered', '1 cup shredded Oaxaca cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chicken breasts, 1/2 an onion, celery, and parsley with cold water and chicken bouillon in a saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat and simmer the stock until chicken is no longer pink in the center, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove chicken from the stock and shred with a fork.
', 'Step 5: Strain stock and discard onion, celery, and parsley.
', 'Step 6: Return stock to the saucepan.
', 'Step 7: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add chopped onion and garlic; cook and stir until transparent, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add tomatoes and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Let cool slightly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Pour mixture into a blender; add 1 cup stock.
', 'Step 12: Cover and hold lid down with a potholder; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend.
', 'Step 13: Pour tomato mixture into the saucepan of stock; add chickpeas and carrots.
', 'Step 14: Let simmer until carrots are nearly softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Stir in the shredded chicken and chipotle peppers.
', 'Step 16: Let simmer until flavors blend and carrots are tender, about 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 17: Season with salt and serve with avocados, lime quarters, and Oaxaca cheese on the side.
']

Title: Twisted Air Fryer Shrimp Tacos

', 'Step 8: Top with crema con sal and cheese.

Title: Chicken Enchiladas Verdes
Ingredients: ['2 pounds tomatillos, husked and cut in half', '2 bunches green onions, ends trimmed', '5 jalapeno peppers, halved and seeded', '4 cloves garlic, or more to taste', '2 cups chopped fresh cilantro', '1 cup chicken stock', '1 lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon salt, or more to taste', '12 corn tortillas', '4 cups cubed cooked chicken', '4 cups shredded mozzarella cheese', '½ cup crumbled queso fresco']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine tomatillos, green onions, jalapeno peppers, and garlic together in a baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Roast vegetables in the preheated oven until softened and fragrant, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from oven and increase oven temperature to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) Pour roasted vegetables, cilantro, chicken stock, lime juice, and salt into a blender no more than half full.
', 'Step 5: Cover and hold lid down; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend.
', 'Step 6: Puree in batches until a smooth salsa consistency is reached.
', 'Step 7: Place 6 tortillas, overlapping, in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Cover tortillas with 1/2 the chicken.
', 'Step 9: Top chicken with 1/2 the mozzarella cheese and pour 1/2 the salsa over the cheese.
', 'Step 10: Repeat layering process with remaining tortillas, chicken, mozzarella cheese, and salsa.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle crumbled queso fresco over the top.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbling, about 25 minutes.
']

Title: Carnitas Eggs Benedict with Chipotle Hollandaise
Ingredients: ['¾ pound carnitas (cooked pulled pork)', '4 English muffins, split', '3 avocados, pitted and peeled', '½ lime, juiced', 'salt to taste', '½ cup salted butter', '1 (.9 ounce) package hollandaise sauce mix (such as Knorr®)', '1 cup milk', '½ teaspoon chipotle powder', '1 tablespoon white vinegar', '8 large eggs']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Set 1 oven rack in the middle and another rack about 6 inches from the top.
', "Step 2: Preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 3: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 4: Place carnitas in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: Place on the top rack under the preheated broiler and reheat until edges of carnitas are crispy, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, toast English muffin halves.
', 'Step 7: Remove from toaster and wrap in aluminum foil.
', 'Step 8: Remove carnitas from the oven and cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 9: Turn off the broiler and preheat oven to the lowest setting.
', 'Step 10: Return carnitas and English muffins to the oven to keep warm until needed.
', 'Step 11: Combine avocados, lime juice, and salt in a small bowl.
', 'Step 12: Roughly smash to combine and set aside.
', 'Step 13: Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 14: Whisk in hollandaise sauce mix until blended.
', 'Step 15: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 16: Gradually whisk in milk.
', 'Step 17: Return to the stove, add chipotle powder, and whisk constantly over medium-high heat until boiling.
', 'Step 18: Reduce heat and simmer, whisking frequently, for 1 minute.
', 'Step 19: Keep sauce warm while you prepare eggs.
', 'Step 20: Heat 2 to 3 inches water in a large, shallow saucepan until boiling.
', 'Step 21: Add vinegar and lower heat to a light simmer.
', 'Step 22: Crack 1 egg into a small ramekin.
', 'Step 23: Lower the ramekin to the surface of the water and ease the egg out into the pan.
', 'Step 24: Repeat with remaining eggs, poaching up to 4 at a time.
', 'Step 25: Poach eggs until whites are completely set and yolks are slightly soft, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 26: Remove eggs from the pan with a slotted spoon and place on a paper towel-lined plate.
', 'Step 27: Repeat with remaining eggs.
', 'Step 28: Place 2 English muffin halves on each plate.
', 'Step 29: Top each half with avocado, carnitas, and 1 egg, then drizzle with hollandaise sauce.
']

Title: Sweet Orange Tamales
Ingredients: ['corn husks', '5 large oranges, peeled and segmented', '2 ½ cups white sugar, divided', '2 cups lard', '2 ice cubes, or as needed', '3 ¼ pounds fresh corn masa dough', '2 tablespoons baking powder', '1 cup milk', '1 cup freshly squeezed orange juice', '⅔ cup raisins', '⅓ cup chopped blanched almonds']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place corn husks in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and soak for 30 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain, place on a work surface, and cover with a clean, damp towel.
', 'Step 3: Combine oranges and 1 1/4 cups sugar in a saucepan over low heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook, stirring occasionally, until mixture starts to turn into jam, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat and let cool completely.
', 'Step 6: While jam is cooling, place lard in a large bowl, add 2 or 3 ice cubes, and beat with an electric mixer until soft and creamy.
', 'Step 7: Beat in 1 1/4 cups sugar until well incorporated.
', 'Step 8: Combine masa dough and baking powder in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 9: Knead together for a few minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add masa to lard mixture.
', 'Step 11: Mix in milk alternately with orange juice, beating continuously with the electric mixer.
', 'Step 12: Mix in cooled jam, raisins, and almonds.
', 'Step 13: Select 1 wide corn husk or 2 small ones.
', 'Step 14: Spread about 2 tablespoons masa mixture onto the corn husk, filling it up to 2 inches from the bottom and 1/4 inch from the top.
', 'Step 15: Fold sides of husk together, one over the other.
', 'Step 16: Fold the bottom of the husk over the seam of the 2 folded sides.
', 'Step 17: Repeat with remaining husks.
', 'Step 18: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 19: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 20: Add tamales with the open side up and cook until filling is heated through and separates from the husk, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 21: Let tamales stand for 15 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Mexican Bean and Squash Soup

Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a deep pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir in the squash, and cook until it begins to soften, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add the onion, celery, and carrots.
', 'Step 4: Cook until the onion is transparent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the garlic, chipotle peppers, basil, parsley, and cumin; cook 2 minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Mix in the tomatoes and chicken broth.
', 'Step 7: Reduce the heat to medium, and simmer until the vegetables are tender, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the cannellini beans and the corn; cook just until heated through.
', 'Step 9: To serve, ladle the soup into bowls.

Title: Chiles en Nogada (Stuffed Poblano Chile Peppers)
Ingredients: ['1 (4 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces', '1 onion, halved', '2 carrots, peeled', '1 stalk celery', '1 clove garlic, peeled', '12 fresh poblano chile peppers - cleaned, roasted and peeled', '1 white onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, chopped', '4 ounces raisins', '4 ounces brown sugar', '4 ounces walnuts', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '4 bay leaves', '1 tablespoon distilled white vinegar', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '3 tablespoons tomato paste', '4 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese', '8 ounces soft goat cheese', '1 cup sour cream', '8 ounces walnuts', '½ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '¾ teaspoon white sugar', '½ bunch cilantro, finely chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken in a large pot with the halved onion, two carrots, one stalk celery, and 1 clove garlic, and cover with water.
', 'Step 2: Boil until done.
', 'Step 3: Slice meat into bite-sized pieces.
', 'Step 4: In a large skillet over medium heat, saute onion and garlic until soft, then add chicken, raisins, brown sugar, 4 ounces walnuts, pepper and bay leaves.
', 'Step 5: Mix together and saute for 3 to 5 minutes, then stir in vinegar, cilantro and tomato paste; reduce heat to low and let all simmer for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat and let cool.
', 'Step 7: Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Cut a slit in each chile pepper along one side, lengthwise, so that they can be reconstructed after they are stuffed.
', 'Step 9: Stuff each chile pepper with cooled chicken mixture and place in preheated oven to keep warm.
', 'Step 10: To Make Sauce: In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the cream cheese, goat cheese, sour cream, 8 ounces walnuts, nutmeg and granulated sugar.
', 'Step 11: Heat, stirring, for 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 12: When blended together, pour sauce over warm chile peppers and garnish with fresh chopped cilantro.
']

Title: Chihuahua-Style Salsa Verde
Ingredients: ['12 tomatillos, husked and chopped', '1 (7 ounce) can chopped jalapenos, drained', '½ head lettuce, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '⅓ cup dried cilantro', '3 tablespoons ground cumin', 'salt and pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons butter', '¼ onion, chopped', '¼ cup chicken broth']

Title: Mexican Fiesta Breakfast Casserole
Ingredients: ['nonstick cooking spray', '¼ pound chorizo sausage', '1 cup warm water', '¾ cup instant dry milk', '3 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into bite-size pieces', '2 cups beaten eggs', "1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans (such as Bush's®), rinsed and drained", '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®), drained', '1 cup frozen whole kernel corn', '½ cup chopped green chile pepper', '½ cup shredded pepper Jack cheese', '½ green bell pepper, chopped', '4 green onions, chopped', '2 tablespoons light sour cream, or to taste', '½ cup grated Mexican cheese blend']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray an 8-inch square glass baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Add chorizo; cook and stir until browned and crumbly, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from the skillet and drain on paper towels.

', 'Step 13: Let cool slightly before serving.
']

Title: Verde Chilaquiles with Eggs

Title: Mango Habanero Salsa

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

', 'Step 11: Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving for flavors to blend.

Title: Make-Ahead Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter or margarine', '2 large onions, thinly sliced', '2 cups diced cooked chicken', '½ cup chopped pimento peppers', '2 (3 ounce) packages cream cheese, diced', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil, or as needed', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '⅔ cup heavy cream', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese']

['Step 1: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat.

Title: Mexican Charred Tomatillo Salsa

Title: Rachel's Coconut Horchata

Title: Tasty Tomatillo Guacamole
Ingredients: ['6 fresh tomatillos, husks discarded and tomatillos rinsed', '1 white onion, quartered', '2 cloves garlic', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded if desired', '1 ½ cups water, or amount to cover', 'salt to taste', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, or to taste', '3 ripe avocados, halved lengthwise and pitted']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place tomatillos, onion, garlic, and jalapeno peppers into a saucepan over medium heat, and pour in enough water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until the tomatillos soften and change color from bright green to a yellow-green color, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 3: With a slotted spoon, transfer vegetables to a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full.
', 'Step 4: Hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, and carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulses to get the tomatillo mixture moving before leaving it on to puree.
', 'Step 5: Puree until smooth, about 1 minute; mix in salt, cilantro, and lime juice.
', 'Step 6: Blend again for a few seconds just to mix.
', 'Step 7: Scoop out the avocado flesh, and place into the blender; blend until well mixed.
', 'Step 8: Adjust salt, cilantro, and lime juice before serving.
']

Title: Verde Chilaquiles
Ingredients: ['10 tomatillos, husked and rinsed', '2 fresh jalapeno peppers, sliced', '⅓ cup chopped cilantro', '3 cloves garlic, crushed', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '¾ pound shredded cooked chicken breast, or more to taste', '½ red onion, thinly sliced', '⅓ cup sliced black olives, or more to taste', '2 tablespoons cilantro leaves', '1 (8 ounce) package tortilla chips, or as needed', '¼ cup crumbled cotija cheese, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place tomatillos in a saucepan with water to cover; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to low; simmer until color begins to lighten and fruit is soft to the touch, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer tomatillos to a food processor or blender.
', 'Step 4: Add jalapenos, 1/3 cup cilantro, garlic, salt, and pepper; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Cover with plastic wrap.

', 'Step 9: Cook and stir chicken and onion until onions begin to brown, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add olives; cook for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add cilantro; cook and stir until wilted, about 1 minute more.
', 'Step 12: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 13: Line the bottom of a 8-inch square casserole dish with 2 to 3 layers of tortilla chips, breaking chips slightly.
', 'Step 14: Add half of the sauce; toss with chips.
', 'Step 15: Top with chicken mixture and the remaining sauce.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle cotija cheese on top.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the preheated oven until tortilla chips are softened, 15 to 25 minutes.
']

Title: Hot Sweet Habanero Chile Sauce
Ingredients: ['10 habanero peppers, stemmed and seeded', '4 jalapeno peppers, stemmed and seeded', '4 Fresno chile peppers, stemmed and seeded', '1 cup water', '1 cup white vinegar', '¼ cup chopped sweet onion', '¼ cup brown sugar', '2 teaspoons garlic powder', '1 teaspoon liquid smoke flavoring', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Blend habanero peppers, jalapeno peppers, and Fresno peppers in a blender on 'liquefy' setting until smooth.
", 'Step 2: Add water, vinegar, onion, brown sugar, garlic powder, and liquid smoke to pureed peppers.
', 'Step 3: Blend until smooth and liquefied; season with salt.
', 'Step 4: Blend again.
', 'Step 5: Pour chile sauce into a sterilized glass container with a tight seal; refrigerate overnight.
']

Title: Raspados de Tamarindo (Tamarind Ices)
Ingredients: ['1 pound tamarind pods, peeled and thoroughly cleaned', '8 cups water, divided', '5 cups white sugar', '¼ cup water, or as desired', '10 cups shaved ice, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place tamarind pods, cleaned of all shells and peels, into a saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Pour in 3 cups water, or as needed to cover, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until water and pulp are reduced by 1/4, 30 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 4: n Strain tamarind pulp through a fine mesh strainer into another saucepan; discard seeds.
', 'Step 5: Pour remaining 5 cups water through strainer to wash as much pulp as possible into the mixture.
', 'Step 6: If desired, check pulp left in strainer for any hard pieces of peel and shell and add pulp back into tamarind mixture.
', 'Step 7: n Place tamarind mixture over low heat and cook until warm but not boiling, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir sugar into tamarind mixture until sugar has dissolved.
', 'Step 9: If mixture is too thick, add 1/4 cup water.
', 'Step 10: Divide shaved ice into 6 glasses and pour tamarind mixture over shaved ice to serve.
']

Title: Chicken Verde Sandwiches
Ingredients: ['2 pounds frozen boneless chicken breast', '10 ounces prepared pizza sauce', '1 cup salsa verde (such as Herdez®)', '½ cup sour cream', '6 kaiser rolls', '6 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese', '6 ounces sour cream', '12 dashes hot sauce, or to taste']

', 'Step 2: Cover the cooker, and cook on Low 8 to 10 hours.
', 'Step 3: Use 2 forks to pull the chicken meat apart until completely shredded.
', 'Step 4: Stir 1/2 cup sour cream into the chicken mixture.
', 'Step 5: Place the chicken mixture onto the rolls.
']

Title: Red Chile Pozole
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '1 small yellow onion, peeled and diced (about 1 cup diced)', '2 stalks celery, chopped (1/2 cup)', '4 cloves garlic, peeled and chopped', '1 medium zucchini, diced (about 2 cups diced, about 10 oz whole)', '1 pound Pure Farmland® Simply Seasoned Plant-Based Protein Starters', '1 ancho chile in adobo sauce', '3 tablespoons adobo sauce from can', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon mild chile powder', '6 cups low-sodium vegetable broth', '1 (15 ounce) can yellow hominy, drained', '2 leaf (blank)s bay leaves', '½ teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '1 pinch Kosher salt, as desired', '8 sprigs sprigs of cilantro, small stems only, or more as needed', '1 avocado, peeled and diced', '2 medium radishes, thinly sliced', '2 fruit (2" dia)s limes, each cut into 6 wedges', '2 cups Tortilla chips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a large Dutch oven or pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, then onion, celery and garlic.
', 'Step 3: Cook 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, then add the zucchini.
', 'Step 4: Cook 5 more minutes, until zucchini is slightly softened, then remove from heat.
', 'Step 5: Transfer vegetables to a plate and reserve.
', 'Step 6: Return pot to medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, then Protein Starter.

', 'Step 9: Cook 8 to 10 minutes or until Protein Starter is lightly golden.
', 'Step 10: Add ancho chile, adobo sauce, ground cumin, and chile powder.
', 'Step 11: Cook 2 more minutes, breaking up ancho chile with spoon.
', 'Step 12: Add vegetable broth, hominy, bay leaves, oregano, and reserved vegetable mixture.
', 'Step 13: Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, then reduce to medium-low heat and cook 10 to 12 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
', 'Step 14: Season with kosher salt, if desired.
', 'Step 15: To serve, top with cilantro leaves, diced avocado, and radishes.
', 'Step 16: Serve with lime wedges and tortilla chips, if desired.
']

Title: Salsa Costena

', 'Step 8: Blend until smooth.

Title: Cinnamon and Lime Chicken Fajitas
Ingredients: ['4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves', '1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', 'salt and pepper to taste', '2 large baking potatoes, peeled and cubed', '¼ cup canola oil', '1 large yellow onion, chopped', '1 large clove garlic, peeled and minced', '1 tablespoon chopped jalapeno peppers', '1 lime, juiced', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas, warmed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place potatoes in a shallow baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Drizzle with about 1/2 the oil, and season with salt.
', 'Step 4: Bake 30 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven, until tender.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, season chicken with cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 6: Arrange in a separate baking dish, and bake 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until no longer pink and juices run clear.
', 'Step 7: Cool and shred.
', 'Step 8: Heat remaining oil in a skillet over medium heat, and saute onion and garlic until tender.
', 'Step 9: Mix in shredded chicken, jalapeno, and lime juice.
', 'Step 10: Cook until heated through.
', 'Step 11: Serve the chicken and potatoes in warmed tortillas.
']

Title: Chicken Stuffed Peppers with Enchilada Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 cup water', '4 large Anaheim chile peppers', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 cup diced onion', '3 tablespoons chopped garlic', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '5 tablespoons hot chili powder', '4 cups chicken broth', '½ (1 ounce) square bittersweet chocolate, chopped', '8 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the chicken, taco seasoning mix, and water into a resealable plastic zipper bag, seal, and massage the bag with your fingers to mix.
', 'Step 2: Refrigerate for 30 minutes to marinate.
', 'Step 3: Cut the stem and top 1/2 inch from the top of each pepper, and carefully remove the seeds without cutting holes or breaking skin of the peppers.
', 'Step 4: Bring a large pot of water to boil, and immerse the peppers in the boiling water for 3 minutes; cool immediately in a bowl of cold water.
', 'Step 5: Drain the peppers and set aside.
', 'Step 6: Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir the onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in garlic, oregano, cumin, and cinnamon; cook for 3 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the flour and chili powder, and cook for about 1 minute.
', 'Step 9: Whisk in the chicken broth, and bring the mixture to a boil, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Reduce heat to low, and stir in the chocolate until it melts and blends into the sauce.
', 'Step 11: Allow the sauce to gently simmer, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 12: Drain the marinated chicken breasts, and place into a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Cook until the chicken is no longer pink inside, about 10 minutes; remove chicken to a bowl, and set aside to cool.
', 'Step 14: When cool enough to handle, shred the chicken meat, and lightly mix in a bowl with Monterey Jack cheese, cream cheese, and cilantro.
', 'Step 15: Stuff each pepper with 1/4 of the chicken mixture, and place on a baking sheet.
', "Step 16: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 17: Broil the stuffed peppers until blistered and hot, about 4 1/2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 18: Serve with sauce.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '785.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '33.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '206.1 mg', 'fatContent': '47.6 g', 'fiberContent': '6.1 g', 'proteinContent': '56.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '25.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '2466.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '10.7 g'}

Title: Ryann's Spicy Grilled Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 bunch cilantro, divided', '1 (8 ounce) container reduced-fat sour cream', '1 lime, juiced', '1 jalapeno pepper, chopped, or to taste', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '3 tilapia fillets, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon onion powder', '1 tablespoon herbes de Provence', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon dried chives', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '6 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 lime, halved', '1 ½ cups shredded cabbage', '½ cup red onion, chopped', '½ cup crumbled queso fresco']

['Step 1: Place most of the cilantro into a blender, reserving the rest for garnish.
', 'Step 2: Add sour cream, lime juice, jalapeno, and salt.
', 'Step 3: Blend until just liquefied.
', 'Step 4: Place sauce in refrigerator until ready to use.
', 'Step 5: Preheat the grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle tilapia fillets with onion powder, herbes de Provence, pepper, chives, and salt.
', 'Step 7: Grill tilapia until fish flakes easily with a fork, 4 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Place each tortilla between 2 damp paper towels.
', 'Step 9: Heat in the microwave, about 20 seconds.
', 'Step 10: Shred tilapia and arrange down the center of each tortilla.
', 'Step 11: Squeeze lime juice over tilapia and top with cabbage and red onion.
', 'Step 12: Spoon the cilantro sauce over the tacos and top with queso fresco.
', 'Step 13: Garnish with the reserved cilantro.
']

Title: Tilapia Fish Tacos with Red Pepper-Lime Slaw and Blue Cheese Aioli
Ingredients: ['1 lime, juiced', '1 cup roasted red pepper oil, divided', '⅓ cup blue cheese salad dressing', '¼ cup mayonnaise', '½ (8 ounce) container sour cream', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon chopped fresh dill', '½ (16 ounce) package coleslaw mix', '1 lime, juiced', '½ medium white onion, diced', '1 roasted red pepper, chopped', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided, or as needed', '4 cloves garlic, sliced', '4 (3 ounce) fillets tilapia, cut into cubes', '1 lime, juiced', '1 tablespoon sour cream', '1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', '1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning', '½ teaspoon chopped fresh dill', '1 (12 ounce) package soft corn tortillas']

', 'Step 2: Cover and place aioli sauce in freezer until ready to serve.
', 'Step 3: Place coleslaw mix in a medium bowl.

', 'Step 5: Toss together until slaw is thoroughly mixed.
', 'Step 6: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoon vegetable oil in a skillet over high heat.
', 'Step 7: Add garlic; cook until slightly browned, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 8: Add tilapia; saute until starting to brown, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add juice of 1 lime, sour cream, cayenne pepper, Cajun seasoning, and dill.
', 'Step 10: Cook and stir until tilapia is browned, about 4 minutes more.
', 'Step 11: Reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 12: Heat the remaining vegetable oil in a smaller skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Add tortillas 1 at a time.
', 'Step 14: Cook until bubbles form and tortillas are lightly browned, about 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 15: Place a portion of the tilapia on each tortilla.
', 'Step 16: Top with coleslaw mixture and chilled aioli sauce.
']

Title: Avocado Paletas
Ingredients: ['1 cup water', '½ cup white sugar', '3 avocados, peeled and pitted', '1 lime, juiced', '¼ teaspoon salt']

', 'Step 2: Set aside to cool.
', 'Step 3: Pour sugar-water mixture into a blender with avocados, lime juice, and salt; blend until smooth.

Title: Central American Tacos
Ingredients: ['5 large potatoes, cubed', '1 pound lean ground beef', '½ onion, chopped', 'salt and pepper to taste', '4 tomatillos, husked and quartered', '1 clove garlic, peeled', '1 jalapeno chile pepper, diced', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste', '3 avocados, halved with pits removed', '10 (6 inch) corn tortillas']

['Step 1: Place potatoes into a large saucepan, and fill with enough water to cover.

', 'Step 5: Cook for a few minutes, then stir in the onion.

Title: Low-Fat Mexican Turkey Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package whole wheat rotini pasta', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 pound ground turkey', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 (15 ounce) can yellow corn, drained', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles, undrained', '1 green bell pepper, diced', '1 onion, diced', '1 celery stalk, diced', '1 carrot, diced', '1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (8 ounce) package pepper Jack cheese, shredded']

Title: Maduros

Title: Potato Enchilada
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '6 potatoes, peeled and shredded', '1 (8 ounce) package processed cheese, melted', '2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, drained', '1 (8 ounce) can sweet peas, drained', '1 (8.75 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '12 (8 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook the shredded potatoes until golden brown on both sides.
', 'Step 3: In a small bowl combine the melted processed cheese with the diced tomatoes with chiles.
', 'Step 4: Stir in half of the peas and half of the corn, and mash them into the hash browns.
', 'Step 5: When well combined, add the remaining peas and corn; continue mashing to combine.
', 'Step 6: Stir in about 1 cup of the cheese and tomato mixture and mix well.
', 'Step 7: Cook for 10 minutes, or until heated through.
', 'Step 8: Spoon the potato mixture into the tortillas and roll like a burrito.
', 'Step 9: Smother with cheese/tomato mixture.
']

Title: Chicken Posole Verde Soup
Ingredients: ['4 large skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '1 tablespoon cumin', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon adobo seasoning', '½ lime, juiced', '6 tomatillos, husked and chopped, or to taste', '3 serrano chiles, stemmed, or to taste', '1 onion, chopped', '3 garlic cloves, peeled, or to taste', '1 bunch cilantro', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '1 (32 fluid ounce) container chicken stock', '1 (15.5 ounce) can white hominy, drained']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken breasts in a slow cooker; cook on Low until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 4 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 2: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 3: Shred chicken in a large pot; add cumin, black pepper, adobo seasoning, and lime juice and mix well.
', 'Step 4: Place tomatillos and serrano peppers in a clear microwave-safe bag.
', 'Step 5: Seal bag and pierce a few times with a knife to vent.
', 'Step 6: Microwave until soft, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Put softened tomatillos, serrano peppers, onion, garlic, cilantro, and salt in a blender and blend until salsa verde is smooth.
', 'Step 8: Mix chicken stock and hominy with shredded chicken in the large pot.
', 'Step 9: Add half of the salsa verde to the shredded chicken.
', 'Step 10: Simmer over medium heat until flavors are well-mixed, about 30 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '179.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '12.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '58.9 mg', 'fatContent': '3.4 g', 'fiberContent': '2.4 g', 'proteinContent': '23.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '1230.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.6 g'}

Title: Grandma's Easy Turkey Taco Salad
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground turkey', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 head iceberg lettuce, shredded', '2 tomatoes, diced', '1 (10 ounce) bag tortilla chips, coarsely crumbled', '1 (8 fluid ounce) bottle thousand island dressing']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat, and stir in the ground turkey.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir until the turkey is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink.
', 'Step 3: Mix in taco seasoning mix as directed on package.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 5: Combine the turkey, black beans, lettuce, tomatoes, and tortilla chips in a large bowl.
', 'Step 6: Toss with salad dressing.
', 'Step 7: Serve immediately, or refrigerate for an hour before serving.
']

Title: Bean and Honey Burrito Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups cooked yellow rice', '1 serving cooking spray', '8 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '¼ cup prepared yellow mustard', '¼ cup sour cream', '⅓ cup honey', '½ cup diced red bell pepper', '½ cup diced green bell pepper', '1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 cup corn kernels', '2 cups shredded cooked chicken', '½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 tablespoon honey']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Prepare yellow rice as directed on package; reserve 1 1/2 cups.
', 'Step 2: Refrigerate any remaining rice for another use.
', 'Step 3: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 5: Line bottom of baking dish with 4 tortillas.
', 'Step 6: To make the honey sauce, whisk together the mustard, sour cream, and 1/3 cup honey in a small bowl.
', 'Step 7: Combine the red pepper, green pepper, garbanzo beans, black beans, and corn in a large bowl.
', 'Step 8: Scoop out 1/2 cup of the bean mixture and reserve for topping.
', 'Step 9: Stir the chicken, 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese, 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese, cumin, yellow rice, and honey sauce into the bean mixture.
', 'Step 10: Mix well.
', 'Step 11: Pour mixture into the baking dish.
', 'Step 12: Top with 4 tortillas; sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese, 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese, and the reserved 1/2 cup bean mixture.
', 'Step 13: Bake in preheated oven until hot and bubbly, 30 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Cover with aluminum foil if top browns excessively.
', 'Step 15: Remove from oven, drizzle with the remaining 2 tablespoons of honey.
']

Title: Black Bean and Veggie Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 (10 ounce) can Old El Paso® green enchilada sauce', '1 (14.4 ounce) package frozen pepper stir-fry (with sliced green, red & yellow peppers & white onions)', '1 (16 ounce) can Old El Paso® refried black beans or traditional refried beans', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon garlic salt', '1 (8.2 ounce) package Old El Paso® flour tortillas for soft tacos & fajitas (6 inch)', '1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Spray 13x9-inch (3-quart) glass baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 2: Spread 1/4 cup of the enchilada sauce in bottom of dish.
', 'Step 3: Place frozen pepper stir-fry in pie plate.
', 'Step 4: Cover with plastic wrap and microwave on High 7 minutes, stirring halfway through cooking.
', 'Step 5: Drain veggies; pat dry with paper towels.
', 'Step 6: Return veggies to pie plate.
', 'Step 7: Place uncovered in freezer 5 minutes to cool them quickly.
', 'Step 8: Meanwhile, in small bowl; mix refried beans, cumin and garlic salt.
', 'Step 9: Spread each tortilla with slightly less than 3 tablespoons refried bean mixture to within 1/2 inch of edge.
', 'Step 10: Stir 1 cup of the cheese into the veggie mixture.
', 'Step 11: Spoon about 1/4 cup mixture on top of bean mixture on each tortilla.
', 'Step 12: Roll up tortillas; place seam side down in dish.
', 'Step 13: Drizzle with remaining enchilada sauce, entirely covering tortillas.
', 'Step 14: Bake uncovered about 30 minutes or until bubbly and heated through.
', 'Step 15: Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese; let stand 2 to 3 minutes to melt cheese.
']
