Title: Tomatillo Enchilada Sauce
Ingredients: ['6 pounds fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '6 small serrano peppers, stems removed', '1 ½ large onions, roughly chopped', '6 cloves garlic, peeled', '4 cups chicken broth', '½ cup packed brown sugar', '½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped, or to taste', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground cumin']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Put tomatillos and serrano peppers in a large stockpot, cover with water, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Boil until tomatillos are an army green color, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain.
', 'Step 4: Combine tomatillo-pepper mixture, onions, and garlic in a blender, working in batches if necessary.
', 'Step 5: Puree until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Transfer puree to a large pot.
', 'Step 7: Add chicken broth, brown sugar, cilantro, salt, and cumin; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Cook until reduced and thickened, about 45 minutes.
']

Title: Apple Cinnamon Brie Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['1 ½ teaspoons butter, divided', '2 (12 inch) flour tortillas', '6 ounces Brie cheese, rind removed and cheese thinly sliced', '1 sweet-tart apple, such as Fugi or Gala, thinly sliced', '1 tablespoon brown sugar', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon']

['Step 1: Melt 3/4 teaspoon butter in a large skillet over medium heat, tilting the skillet to evenly spread butter.

', 'Step 3: Cover tortilla with Brie cheese slices and apple slices; sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon.
', 'Step 4: Place the remaining tortilla over the filling.
', 'Step 5: Cook quesadilla until bottom tortilla is browned, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Spread the remaining 3/4 teaspoon butter on top tortilla; carefully flip quesadilla and cook until bottom tortilla is browned and cheese is melted, 3 to 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 7: Slice quesadilla into quarters.
']

Title: Quick Chiles Rellenos Bake
Ingredients: ['3 (4 ounce) cans mild whole green chiles, drained', '2 cups shredded Pepper Jack cheese', '9 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 (19 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '1 cup sour cream', 'chopped fresh cilantro']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Split each chile lengthwise into halves and remove the seeds.

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Burrito Bowl
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 pounds boneless chicken breasts, cubed', '1 small onion, diced', '2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, minced', '1 red bell pepper, chopped', '1 teaspoon cumin', '1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '1 ½ cups chicken broth', '1 ½ cups picante sauce', '1 cup long-grain rice, rinsed and drained', '1 (15.25 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (15.25 ounce) can corn, drained', '½ lime, juiced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 2: Add oil, chicken, and onion.
', 'Step 3: Cook until onion is soft and chicken is no longer pink, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add chipotle peppers, bell pepper, cumin, and oregano.
', 'Step 5: Cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
', 'Step 6: Turn pot off.
', 'Step 7: Add broth, picante sauce, rice, black beans, corn, and lime juice to the pot with the chicken.
', 'Step 8: Stir to combine.
', 'Step 9: Close and lock the lid.
', 'Step 10: Select Manual function and set timer for 4 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Allow 10 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 12: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 13: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 14: Let mixture stand until thickened, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Ladle into serving bowls and garnish with desired toppings.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '557 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '65.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '87.6 mg', 'fatContent': '17.3 g', 'fiberContent': '8.2 g', 'proteinContent': '35.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '1446.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.7 g'}

Title: Instant Pot® Vegan Tex-Mex Bowls
Ingredients: ['½ cup dried chickpeas', '½ cup dried black beans', '½ cup dried pinto beans', '½ cup dried kidney beans', '5 cups water', '2 cups reduced-sodium vegetable broth', '2 cups salsa, divided', '1 ½ cups uncooked brown rice', '1 tablespoon reduced-sodium taco seasoning mix', '1 ear corn, husked', '1 head iceberg lettuce, torn into bite-sized pieces', '1 avocado, cut into wedges', '1 cup shredded vegan Cheddar cheese', '5 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 lime, cut into wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Inspect dried beans, discarding any beans with impurities and any foreign objects.
', 'Step 2: Put beans in a 7-quart multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®).
', 'Step 3: Pour in water.
', 'Step 4: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 5: Select Bean function according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 20 minutes.
", 'Step 6: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', 'Step 7: Allow natural release for 8 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Manually release any remaining pressure, 5 to 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 9: Unlock lid, drain liquid, and return drained beans back to pot.
', 'Step 10: Add vegetable broth, 1 1/2 cups salsa, rice, and taco seasoning.
', 'Step 11: Stir to combine.
', 'Step 12: Cut the ear of corn into 5 pieces.
', 'Step 13: Nestle each piece into the rice mixture, with some space between each.
', 'Step 14: Close and lock the lid.
', 'Step 15: Cook on Rice function for 22 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Allow pressure to release naturally for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Manually release any remaining pressure, 5 to 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 18: Fluff with a rice paddle.
', 'Step 19: Divide lettuce between 5 bowls.
', 'Step 20: Top with equal amounts of rice.
', 'Step 21: Add equal amounts of avocado, vegan cheese, and cilantro.
', 'Step 22: Serve with remaining salsa and lime wedges.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '673.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '110.9 g', 'fatContent': '14.5 g', 'fiberContent': '20.6 g', 'proteinContent': '29.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '1060.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '10.4 g'}

Ingredients: ['2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chilies, drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can peeled and diced tomatoes, drained', '1 onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, crushed', '2 (9 inch) unbaked pie crusts', '1 (16 ounce) package Cheddar cheese', '10 (6 inch) flour tortillas']

Title: Funky Beans
Ingredients: ['1 pound dry pinto beans', '1 pound bulk pork sausage', '1 pound ground beef', '1 onion, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles, undrained', '½ cup ketchup', 'chili powder to taste']

['Step 1: Pick over and rinse the dried beans, and place them in a large saucepan of water with a lid.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil over high heat, cover, turn off the heat, and let the beans sit for 1 hour.
', 'Step 3: Drain and rinse the beans in a colander, return to the saucepan, cover with water, and simmer for 2 hours, until the beans are tender.

Title: One-Pan Tamale Pie
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package sweet cornbread mix (such as Martha White®)', '½ cup milk', '1 egg', '2 pounds extra-lean ground beef', '1 small onion, diced', '1 jalapeno pepper, minced, or more to taste', '1 (8 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '1 cup chunky salsa', '1 cup frozen corn', '¼ teaspoon ground chipotle pepper', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']

Title: Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs', '1 tablespoon garlic granules', '1 ½ teaspoons chili powder', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 ½ teaspoons mild paprika', '1 ½ teaspoons ground black pepper', '1 ½ teaspoons white sugar', '1 teaspoon mustard powder', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '1 pinch cumin seeds', 'sea salt to taste', 'cold water to cover', '2 cups tomato puree', '8 shallots, peeled and left whole', '1 large red onion, cut into small thin strips', '1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks', '1 yellow bell pepper, cut into chunks', '3 tablespoons honey']

', 'Step 4: Sprinkle 1/2 the spice mix over the chicken and pour in enough water to cover.

Title: Healthier Baked Chiles Rellenos
Ingredients: ['8 large poblano peppers', '4 extra large eggs', '4 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 cup 2% milk', '1 drizzle extra-virgin olive oil', '1 ¾ cups shredded mozzarella cheese', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '½ (8 ounce) jar salsa', '⅛ cup finely shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Cut poblano peppers in half and tear off stems and veins; discard seeds.
', 'Step 3: Roast peppers on the preheated grill, turning often, until soft and charred, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Cool until easily handled, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Wipe off or peel skins and discard.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Beat eggs, flour, and salt together vigorously in a medium mixing bowl.
', 'Step 8: Flour may still be a bit clumpy but it will eventually dissolve during cooking process.
', 'Step 9: Add milk and beat again.
', 'Step 10: Drizzle olive oil in a 9x13-inch baking dish then place poblanos in, cut sides-up.
', 'Step 11: Fill poblanos evenly with cheese.
', 'Step 12: Pour the egg mixture over the top.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until egg mixture is slightly firm, about 22 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Mix tomato sauce and salsa together in a bowl.
', 'Step 15: Pour on top of egg mixture; add Cheddar cheese on top.
', "Step 16: Turn the oven's broiler on.
", 'Step 17: Broil in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and browned, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Jackfruit Carnitas
Ingredients: ['1 (19 ounce) can young green jackfruit packed in water, drained', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle bitter orange soda', '⅛ cup vinegar', '¼ cup vegetable oil, divided', '1 lime, juiced', '1 onion, halved and thinly sliced', '1 tablespoon ground chili powder', '1 tablespoon grated panela', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 bay leaves', '8 corn tortillas', '1 cup sliced Mexican pickled carrots and jalapenos', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 lime, cut into 8 wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Rinse jackfruit, dry, and set aside.
', 'Step 2: Whisk together soda, vinegar, 1/8 cup vegetable oil, and lime juice in a large mixing bowl.
', 'Step 3: Add onion, chili powder, panela, pepper, salt, and bay leaves.
', 'Step 4: Add jackfruit pieces and mix to coat.
', 'Step 5: Allow to marinate for at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 6: Pour jackfruit and marinade into a nonstick skillet.
', 'Step 7: Bring to a boil and simmer until the liquid has reduced by 3/4, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Pour into a colander and drain; remove and discard bay leaves.
', 'Step 9: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Add drained jackfruit and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to tear jackfruit into small pieces.
', 'Step 11: Cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until each piece is as crispy as possible, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add remaining vegetable oil, if necessary.
', 'Step 13: Meanwhile, heat the corn tortillas on a griddle.
', 'Step 14: Ladle equal portions of jackfruit carnitas into each tortilla.
', 'Step 15: Top with pickled jalapenos and carrots.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle with cilantro and garnish each taco with a lime wedge.
', 'Step 17: Serve hot.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '207.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '29.3 g', 'fatContent': '9.4 g', 'fiberContent': '3.9 g', 'proteinContent': '2.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '624.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.3 g'}

Title: Mexican Rice Soup (Sopa Aguada de Arroz)
Ingredients: ['6 cups water', '1 cup rice, rinsed and drained', '2 tomatoes', '½ onion', '2 cloves garlic', '2 teaspoons chicken bouillon granules', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 pinch salt to taste', '5 tablespoons grated Mexican Cotija cheese', '2 sprigs parsley, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring water to a boil in a pot.
', 'Step 2: Add rice, reduce heat to low, and cover with a lid.
', 'Step 3: Simmer until rice is nearly tender, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Add tomatoes and roast until evenly charred, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove skin and transfer to a blender.
', 'Step 7: Add onion, garlic, and bouillon.
', 'Step 8: Process tomato mixture until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Heat oil in a small saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 10: Pour tomato mixture into hot oil; cook and stir until flavors incorporate, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add to the saucepan with the rice.
', 'Step 12: Season with salt and cover with a lid.
', 'Step 13: Continue cooking over low heat until rice is soft, 7 to 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 14: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 15: Sprinkle Cotija cheese and parsley on top, cover with a lid, and let sit 10 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Cyndi's Shrimp Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 medium zucchini, cubed', '1 red onion, chopped', '1 (10 ounce) box frozen corn', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '8 flour tortillas', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']

', 'Step 2: Add the shrimp and marinate 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook the zucchini, onion, and corn for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
', 'Step 5: Cover to keep warm and set aside.
', 'Step 6: In a separate skillet heat olive oil over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Add the shrimp and cook for 3 to 5 minutes, until the shrimp are pink.

', 'Step 9: Place shrimp and vegetable mixture in tortillas; sprinkle with the Monterey Jack cheese and cilantro.
']

Title: A Michelada for All (Vegan and Gluten Free)
Ingredients: ['Sriracha salt as needed', '½ cup ice cubes, or as needed', '1 cup chilled tomato juice', '1 medium lime, juiced', '½ teaspoon vegan Worcestershire sauce', '¼ teaspoon smoked salt', '⅛ teaspoon celery seed', '2 dashes aromatic bitters (such as Angostura®)', '⅛ teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper', '1 dash hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®), or to taste', '1 pinch habanero powder', '1 cup gluten-free beer']

']

Title: Pumpkin Pie Flan
Ingredients: ['½ cup white sugar', '1 (14 ounce) can pumpkin pie filling', '1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk', '1 (5 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '6 eggs', '½ cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon allspice']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Melt 1/2 cup sugar in an aluminum loaf pan and heat over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Continue to cook until it caramelizes, being careful to not burn the sugar.
', 'Step 4: Fill a large pot of water with about 1 inch of water and place over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Move the aluminum pan into the large pot and set into the water.
', 'Step 6: Combine the pumpkin pie filling, evaporated milk, condensed milk, eggs, 1/2 cup sugar, vanilla, and allspice in a blender, blend until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Pour the mixture into the loaf pan.
', 'Step 8: Bake in preheated oven until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 9: Refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or overnight.
', 'Step 10: Run a knife along the edge of the loaf pan to loosen the flan.
', 'Step 11: Invert the pan onto a serving plate and tap to release the dessert.
']

Title: Taco-Stuffed Zucchini Boats
Ingredients: ['4 zucchinis, halved lengthwise and seeded', '1 pound ground turkey', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning', '¾ cup water, or as needed', '2 red sweet pepper, finely chopped', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL® Mexican Lime & Cilantro)', '½ white onion, finely chopped', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 cup sour cream', '1 (1 ounce) packet sour cream seasoning mix (such as Old El Paso® Zesty Sour Cream Seasoning Mix)', '1 bunch green onions, diced', '½ cup shredded Muenster cheese', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
', 'Step 4: Cook zucchini halves in boiling water to just soften slightly, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 5: Remove zucchini halves from the water and arrange into the prepared baking dish with the cut sides facing upwards.
', 'Step 6: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 7: Cook and stir ground turkey in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 8: Return skillet to medium-high heat; pour water over the turkey and season with taco seasoning.
', 'Step 9: Cook until the water thickens and coats the turkey, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add red peppers, diced tomatoes and green chiles, onion, and cilantro; cook and stir until the peppers are softened, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 11: Stir sour cream and sour cream seasoning mix together in a bowl.
', 'Step 12: Using a slotted spoon, spoon the turkey mixture into the hollows of each zucchini half and press firmly.
', 'Step 13: Top the turkey mixture with about half the sour cream mixture.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle green onions, Muenster cheese, and Cheddar cheese over the sour cream mixture, respectively.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and the zucchini is cooked through, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Top with remaining sour cream mixture.
']

Title: Taco Bean Salad
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon olive oil', '1 large onion, chopped', '2 pounds ground beef', '½ cup chili powder', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '2 tablespoons ground cumin', '¾ cup sliced black olives', '2 (14 ounce) cans light red kidney beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (16 ounce) garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (16 ounce) can pinto beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (16 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '4 cups mayonnaise', '1 cup taco sauce', '2 teaspoons hot pepper sauce', '1 head iceberg lettuce, shredded', '1 tomato, chopped', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '2 cups crumbled tortilla chips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir onion until it has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium-low, and continue cooking and stirring until the onion is very tender and dark brown, 15 to 20 minutes more.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir ground beef into onion until the beef is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain and discard any excess grease.
', 'Step 6: Stir in chili powder, oregano, and cumin until incorporated, 1 minute.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 8: Stir in olives, kidney beans, garbanzo beans, pinto beans, and black beans; cool.
', 'Step 9: Mix together mayonnaise, taco sauce, and hot pepper sauce in a bowl.
', 'Step 10: Refrigerate until ready to serve.
', 'Step 11: Layer lettuce with tomatoes, Cheddar cheese, bean mixture, tortilla chips, and dressing to serve.
']

Title: Homemade Mexican Chorizo
Ingredients: ['15 dried red chile peppers, seeded', '2 ¼ pounds boneless, skinless pork butt, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '7 ounces pork fat, cut into 1/2-inc cubes', '5 whole allspice berries', '5 whole cloves', '¼ cup cider vinegar', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 hog casing']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chile peppers in a bowl and cover with hot water.
', 'Step 2: Soak until softened, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, place pork butt and pork fat in the freezer for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Chill meat grinder in the freezer to make grinding the meat easier.
', 'Step 5: Grind allspice berries and cloves using a mortar and pestle or a spice grinder.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Drain chile peppers and place in a food processor or blender.
', 'Step 8: Add vinegar and puree until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Fit the chilled meat grinder with a medium plate.
', 'Step 10: Pass the partially frozen pork and fat through the grinder.
', 'Step 11: Combine ground meat with pureed chile peppers, garlic, oregano, salt, pepper, and cumin in a bowl.
', 'Step 12: Mix well with your hands for 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Cover bowl with plastic wrap and chill for 1 hour, or overnight.
', 'Step 14: Meanwhile, soak casing in cold water for about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Place the wide end of a small sausage-stuffing funnel up against the sink tap and run cold water through the inside of the casing.
', 'Step 16: Use the medium sausage-stuffing funnel attachment and place casing on the outside of the tube.
', 'Step 17: Start passing meat mixture through the funnel, stopping just as it starts to come out the other end.
', 'Step 18: Tie the casing into a knot at the end, then continue passing the meat mixture through the funnel, supporting the sausage with your other hand.
', 'Step 19: Once the meat mixture is finished, tie the other end of the casing into a knot.
', 'Step 20: Twist the casing at regular intervals to create individual links, alternating between twisting in opposite directions.
', 'Step 21: Poke 2 to 3 small holes into each sausage with a metal skewer to allow air to escape during cooking.
', 'Step 22: Cook as desired or chill in the fridge for up to 3 days.
']

Title: Vegan Sweet Potato and Bean Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 cup sweet potato, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch cubes', '½ cup yellow onion, sliced', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning mix', '½ cup vegan refried beans', '4 large vegan tortillas', '1 cup cooked brown rice', '¼ cup salsa']

Title: Shrimp Tacodillas
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', '1 ¾ cups diced tomatoes', '1 cup chopped onion', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons ketchup', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 serrano chile pepper, chopped', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 pound large shrimp - peeled, deveined, and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', '9 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '2 cups shredded pepper Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) and place an oven rack on the lowest position.
', 'Step 2: Brush 2 baking sheets with 1 tablespoon vegetable oil each.
', 'Step 3: Heat extra-virgin olive oil in a skillet until shimmering.
', 'Step 4: Add tomatoes, onion, cilantro, ketchup, garlic, serrano chile, salt, and pepper; cook until the onions are translucent, 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add shrimp and cook until shrimp are opaque but not cooked all the way, about 2 minutes; they will continue to cook in the oven.
', 'Step 6: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 7: Place 5 tortillas on one prepared baking sheet and 4 on the other.
', 'Step 8: Brush tops of tortillas with remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil.
', 'Step 9: Divide pepper Jack cheese evenly amongst all 9 tortillas.
', 'Step 10: Evenly divide shrimp mixture on top of cheese.
', 'Step 11: Bake one sheet at a time in the preheated oven until tortillas start to turn golden brown and cheese has melted, 7 to 9 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Working as fast as possible, remove tacodillas to a serving platter, one at a time, folding in half like tacos.
']

Title: Leftover Turkey Tamales
Ingredients: ['1 5-ounce package cornhusks', '3 cups masa harina', '1 tablespoon paprika', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 cup corn oil', '1 quart turkey broth, divided', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '3 ½ cups finely chopped cooked turkey', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Soak corn husks in a bowl of warm water until softened, about 1 hour; drain.
', 'Step 2: Mix masa, 1 tablespoon paprika, 1 tablespoon chili powder, garlic powder, 1 teaspoon cumin, and 1 teaspoon salt together in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Stir corn oil into masa mixture.
', 'Step 4: Measure 1/2 cup turkey broth and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Add remaining broth, 1 cup at a time, to masa mixture until dough is smooth and the consistency of thick peanut butter.
', 'Step 6: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; saute onion and garlic until softened and translucent, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove skillet from heat and add turkey, 1 teaspoon paprika, oregano, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1 teaspoon chili powder, 1 teaspoon salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 8: Stir reserved 1/2 cup turkey broth into filling until moistened.
', 'Step 9: Spoon 1 heaping tablespoon dough in the center of each corn husk.
', 'Step 10: Top filling with 1 heaping tablespoon filling.
', 'Step 11: Roll husk around dough and filling, tucking bottom of husk into tamale.
', 'Step 12: Tie a corn husk strip or string around each tamale to secure.
', 'Step 13: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 14: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 15: Stand tamales upright in steamer, cover, and steam until cooked through, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 16: Add more water as needed.
']

Title: Vitamix® Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['1 (32 fluid ounce) container chicken broth', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with lime juice and cilantro (such as RO*TEL®)', '¼ cup shredded jalapeno Jack cheese', '2 Roma tomatoes', '1 carrot', '1 stalk celery', '1 slice onion', '1 slice red bell pepper', '1 avocado', '1 clove garlic', '1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 sprigs fresh cilantro, or more to taste', '¼ cup canned black beans, rinsed and drained', '¼ cup canned corn, drained', '1 ½ cups shredded cooked chicken']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chicken broth, diced tomatoes, jalapeno Jack cheese, Roma tomatoes, carrot, celery, bell pepper, avocado, garlic, taco mix, salt, and cilantro in a high-speed blender (such as Vitamix®).
', 'Step 2: Mix at level 10 for a few seconds, then at full speed until steaming, 6 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Pour black beans and corn into the blender and pulse two times.

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Title: Southwest Corn Chowder

['Step 1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat.

Title: Instant Pot® Mexican Chicken Soup
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil, or more as needed', '1 onion, diced', '5 cloves garlic, chopped', '6 cups chicken stock', '2 pounds whole skinless, boneless chicken thighs', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed, or more to taste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can fire-roasted tomatoes', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '1 cup diced carrots', '1 cup diced celery', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons cumin', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon adobo sauce from canned chipotles, or to taste', '2 limes, juiced', '1 (12 ounce) package tortilla strips', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste', '¼ cup sour cream, or as desired', '1 avocado, diced, or to taste', '1 fresh jalapeno pepper, sliced', '2 tablespoons hot sauce, or to taste']

['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.

', 'Step 4: Add stock, chicken, beans, tomatoes, chiles, carrots, celery, salt, cumin, chili powder, oregano, and adobo sauce.
', 'Step 5: Stir well.
', 'Step 6: Close and lock the lid.
', 'Step 7: Choose manual high pressure and set the timer for 17 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 9: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 10: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 11: Remove chicken and shred using 2 forks.
', 'Step 12: Return chicken to the pot.
', 'Step 13: Season with lime juice and adjust salt, if necessary.

Title: Sour Cream Chicken Enchilada Bake
Ingredients: ['¼ cup butter, melted', '1 ½ pounds bone-in chicken breasts', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 (16 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers, drained', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon dried basil', '½ teaspoon salt', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '2 ½ cups grated Monterey Jack cheese', '¾ cup sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Rub melted butter onto the chicken breasts and place in a baking pan.
', 'Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, 45 to 55 minutes.
', 'Step 4: An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: While the chicken is cooking, melt 2 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Add onion and garlic; cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, chile peppers, sugar, cumin, chili powder, oregano, basil, and salt; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 10: Remove chicken from the oven.
', 'Step 11: Remove and discard skin and bones.
', 'Step 12: Cut meat into 12 strips.
', 'Step 13: Keep oven on.
', 'Step 14: Dip a tortilla into the tomato sauce to soften.
', 'Step 15: Place 1 piece of chicken and about 2 tablespoons Monterey Jack cheese in the center of the tortilla.
', 'Step 16: Roll and place, seam-side down, in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 17: Repeat with remaining tortillas, chicken, and cheese.
', 'Step 18: Stir sour cream into the remaining tomato sauce; pour over enchiladas.
', 'Step 19: Sprinkle with remaining cheese and cover with aluminum foil or a lid.
', 'Step 20: Bake until heated through, about 45 minutes.
']

', 'Step 16: Serve with sour cream and salsa.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Birria
Ingredients: ['2 cups beef broth', '4 peppers dried guajillo chilies', '2 peppers dried ancho chiles', '1 (15 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '2 peppers chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '3 tablespoons apple cider vinegar', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '2 teaspoons ground coriander', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '3 pounds eye of round beef roast', 'kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ cup canola oil, divided', '1 medium yellow onion, chopped', '6 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (12 ounce) package corn tortillas, or as needed', '½ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese, or to taste', '½ cup chopped white onion, or to taste', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']

', 'Step 2: Seed and stem dried guajillo and ancho chiles; add to the broth.
', 'Step 3: Turn off the heat and let sit for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in tomatoes, chipotle peppers in adobo, vinegar, oregano, coriander, and cumin.
', 'Step 5: Transfer to a blender or blend with immersion blender until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Cut beef into 2-inch cubes and season with kosher salt and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 9: Heat 1/2 of the oil; add meat and saute until browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Remove meat; add onions and cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add garlic and remaining oil.
', 'Step 12: Cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 13: Return meat and any juices back to the pot.
', 'Step 14: Add blended sauce mixture.
', 'Step 15: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 16: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 60 minutes.
", 'Step 17: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 18: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions for 10 minutes.
", "Step 19: Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 20: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 21: Remove meat and shred with 2 forks.
', 'Step 22: Dip tortillas in the birria sauce.
', 'Step 23: Transfer to a pan and heat over medium to medium-low heat.
', 'Step 24: Add meat, some Monterey Jack cheese, onion, and cilantro.
', 'Step 25: Flip and cook as needed until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 26: Repeat with remaining tortillas and ingredients.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '317.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '18.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '60.6 mg', 'fatContent': '15.4 g', 'fiberContent': '3.5 g', 'proteinContent': '25.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '318.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.9 g'}

Title: Spicy Mexican Beef
Ingredients: ['4 pounds beef chuck roast, trimmed of fat and meat cut into chunks', '1 (24 ounce) jar salsa', '1 onion, chopped', '1 (7 ounce) can chopped mild green chiles', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '½ teaspoon dried oregano']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix chuck roast, salsa, onion, green chile peppers, garlic, chili powder, cumin, and oregano in a slow cooker.
', 'Step 2: Cook on Low for 10 to 12 hours.
', 'Step 3: Remove lid and cook on High for 1 more hour.
', 'Step 4: Remove chuck roast from slow cooker using a slotted spoon to a serving platter; shred meat with a fork.
', 'Step 5: Add liquid from slow cooker, 1 tablespoon at a time, to the chuck roast until desired consistency is reached.
']

Title: Tex-Mex Chicken Tamale Pie
Ingredients: ['6 pounds bone-in chicken breasts', 'water to cover', '1 (15 ounce) can crushed tomatoes', '1 onion, quartered', '4 tomatillos - stemmed, husked, and halved', '3 cloves garlic, peeled', '4 New Mexico dried red chile pods, stemmed and seeded', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ cup lard', '1 cup masa harina', '1 (12 ounce) bag shredded Cheddar and Monterey Jack cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place chicken breasts in baking pans and cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Bake chicken in the preheated oven until tender and cooked through, 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 hour.
', 'Step 4: An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Cool until easily handled.
', 'Step 6: Remove skin and discard.
', 'Step 7: Bone chicken and chop into 1/2-inch pieces.
', 'Step 8: Combine bones with drippings from baking pans in a large pot; add enough water to cover.
', 'Step 9: Bring to a boil and simmer for 1 hour.
', 'Step 10: Strain broth and discard bones.
', 'Step 11: Place tomatoes, onion, tomatillos, garlic, and red chile pods in a blender or food processor; puree until chile pods are reduced to small flecks.
', 'Step 12: Pour into a pot.
', 'Step 13: Mix 1 cup chicken broth, salt, cumin, and oregano into pureed mixture in the pot.
', 'Step 14: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Stir in chicken.
', 'Step 16: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 17: Microwave 1 cup chicken broth and lard together in a microwave-safe bowl until lard is just melted, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Mix in masa harina with your hands to make a smooth paste.
', 'Step 19: Press paste evenly into the bottom of a 10x13-inch baking pan.
', 'Step 20: Spread chicken mixture on top.
', 'Step 21: Cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 22: Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is heated through, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Sprinkle shredded Cheddar and Monterey Jack cheese blend on top.
', 'Step 24: Continue baking until cheese is melted and starting to bubble, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 25: Let stand before serving, about 5 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '592.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '15.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '197.8 mg', 'fatContent': '28.4 g', 'fiberContent': '2.9 g', 'proteinContent': '66.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '13.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '691.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '1 g'}

Title: Pueblo Stew
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons lard', '6 pounds boneless pork shoulder, cubed', '1 teaspoon whole coriander seeds', '2 onions, chopped', '2 potatoes, cubed', '2 carrots, chopped', '5 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (18.75 ounce) can tomatillos, coarsely chopped', '1 (16 ounce) can chopped green chiles', '1 (11 ounce) can jalapeno peppers, drained and diced', '1 (30 ounce) jar sliced nopalitos, drained and rinsed', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '1 (20 ounce) can hominy, drained', '4 teaspoons cumin seed', '2 cups crumbled queso fresco', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt lard in a large pot over high heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir in cubed pork and coriander seeds.
', 'Step 3: Cook until the pork has browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the onions, potatoes, carrots, garlic, tomatillos, green chiles, jalapeno peppers, nopalitos, and hominy.
', 'Step 5: Season with oregano and cumin seed.
', 'Step 6: Add water if the mixture seems too dry.
', 'Step 7: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the pork is tender, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 8: To serve, ladle the stew into serving bowls and sprinkle with crumbled cheese and chopped cilantro.
']

Title: Make-Ahead Breakfast Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 tablespoons canola oil or vegetable oil', '1 (1-pound) package Jimmy Dean Premium Pork Sausage', '6 large eggs, scrambled', '2 cups shredded Cheddar or Mexican-blend cheese, divided', '1 pinch salt', '1 pinch ground black pepper', '6 (6 inch) corn or flour tortillas', '4 (10 ounce) cans enchilada sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Spray a large (9x13) baking dish with cooking spray and set aside.
', 'Step 2: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 3: In a small frying pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat for about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 4: Add Jimmy Dean sausage and cook for 8 to 10 minutes until browned, stirring frequently to break up the sausage into small pieces, then drain.
', 'Step 5: Remove the sausage and set aside.
', 'Step 6: In a bowl, mix the cooked sausage, scrambled eggs, 1 cup of shredded cheese, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Add roughly 1/4 cup of the mixture to each tortilla, then gently roll them and place in the baking dish.
', "Step 8: The bottom edge of each roll should be on the bottom of the dish so that the tortilla won't unroll while baking.
", 'Step 9: Fill the baking dish with rolled tortillas.
', 'Step 10: Pour enchilada sauce evenly over the tortillas.
', 'Step 11: Add the remaining cup of cheese.
', 'Step 12: Place in the oven and bake for about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Allow the dish to cool for 5 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Chicken Enchiladas with Green Salsa Verde
Ingredients: ['3 (5 ounce) boneless chicken thighs', '1 medium onion, coarsely chopped, divided', '1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 bay leaf', 'cooking spray', '1 tablespoon oil', '2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '3 tablespoons crumbled cotija cheese', '1 (12 ounce) can tomatillos, drained', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '¾ cup heavy cream', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 small serrano pepper, seeded and deveined, or to taste', '1 large egg', '1 teaspoon salt', '6 (8 inch) flour tortillas, warmed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chicken, 1/2 of the onion, peppercorns, salt, and bay leaf in a small pot.
', 'Step 2: Cover with water and bring to a slow boil.
', 'Step 3: Cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Transfer chicken to a plate and shred meat with a fork.
', 'Step 6: Discard broth or reserve for another use.
', 'Step 7: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 9: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; stir in remaining onion.
', 'Step 10: Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Transfer onion to a bowl and mix in shredded chicken, 1 cup Monterey Jack cheese, and cotija cheese.
', 'Step 12: Combine tomatillos, green chiles, cream, cilantro, serrano pepper, egg, and salt for sauce in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 13: Stuff warmed tortillas with chicken mixture.
', 'Step 14: Roll and place seam-side down in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 15: Pour all sauce over top.
', 'Step 16: It may seem runny, but it will set up.
', 'Step 17: Sprinkle remaining Monterey Jack on top.
', 'Step 18: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Strawberry Horchata
Ingredients: ['3 cups hot water', '⅔ cup blanched almonds', '⅓ cup long grain rice', '1 (2 inch) stick cinnamon', '2 cups strawberries, sliced', '½ cup water', '¼ cup stevia powder, or to taste', '4 cups ice, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine 3 cups hot water, almonds, and rice in a powerful blender, such as a Vitamix®; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 2: Pour into a container, add cinnamon stick, and cover; let sit at room temperature for 24 hours.
', 'Step 3: Remove cinnamon stick from mixture break up into small pieces.
', 'Step 4: Pour mixture and cinnamon pieces into the Vitamix® and blend until cinnamon pieces are pulverized and blended.
', 'Step 5: Strain mixture over a sieve.
', 'Step 6: Pour back into Vitamix® and add strawberries, 1/2 cup water, and stevia.
', 'Step 7: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 8: Pour over ice and serve, or chill until ready to serve.
']

Title: Mexican Chorizo Breakfast Casserole
Ingredients: ['3 poblano peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded', 'cooking spray', '6 slices bread', '1 pound fresh Mexican chorizo', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 medium onion, sliced', '8 eggs', '2 cups milk', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Place peppers with cut sides down onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes.

', 'Step 6: Allow peppers to steam as they cool, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray and line the bottom with bread slices.
', 'Step 9: Cook chorizo over medium-high heat until starting to brown, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Transfer to a bowl.
', 'Step 11: Heat oil in the same pan.
', 'Step 12: Add onion; cook and stir until tender, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Peel poblanos and slice flesh.
', 'Step 14: Mix with the onion.
', 'Step 15: Beat eggs and milk together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 16: Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 17: Spread chorizo over the bread slices.
', 'Step 18: Cover with onion-poblano mixture.
', 'Step 19: Pour the beaten eggs on top.
', 'Step 20: Sprinkle cheese blend over the top.
', 'Step 21: Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set and top is starting to brown, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Cheesy Rotisserie Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons salted butter', '1 (8 ounce) package fresh sliced mushrooms', '½ cup chopped yellow onion', '½ cup chopped bell pepper', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed Cheddar cheese soup', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 cup sour cream', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '1 (10 ounce) can green chile enchilada sauce', '4 cups shredded rotisserie chicken', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided', '10 (10 inch) flour tortillas, warmed', '1 bunch green onions, sliced', '1 medium tomato, diced']

Title: Vegan Tres Leches Cake
Ingredients: ["4 tablespoons dry egg replacer (such as Bob's Red Mill®)", '¾ cup water, divided', '¾ cup white sugar', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ teaspoon coconut extract', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 (11.5 fl oz) can sweetened condensed coconut milk (such as A Taste of Thai® Sweetened Condensed Coconut Milk)', '1 cup dairy-free heavy whipping cream (such as Silk®)', '½ cup cream of coconut (such as Coco Lopez®)', '½ tablespoon vanilla extract', '½ tablespoon coconut extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease an 11x7-inch baking pan.
', 'Step 3: Mix egg replacer with 1/2 cup water in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Add sugar and beat with an electric mixer until well combined.
', 'Step 5: Beat in remaining 1/4 cup water, vanilla extract, and coconut extract.
', 'Step 6: Add flour, baking powder, and salt, beating until batter is smooth.

', 'Step 10: Combine sweetened condensed coconut milk, dairy-free heavy whipping cream, cream of coconut, vanilla, and coconut extract in a bowl for the tres leches sauce.
', 'Step 11: Poke holes into the top of the cooled cake with a skewer.
', 'Step 12: Pour sauce over the cake using a large spoon, allowing it to soak into the holes.
', 'Step 13: Cover and refrigerate until most of the sauce is absorbed, at least 4 hours.
']

Title: Shredded Chicken Enchiladas with Salsa Verde
Ingredients: ['¾ cup chopped onion', '¾ cup chicken stock', '½ cup green salsa (salsa verde)', '⅓ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons pickled jalapeno pepper slices', '5 teaspoons all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '8 ounces shredded cooked chicken', '¾ cup chopped tomato', '1 medium avocado, mashed', '3 tablespoons sour cream', '8 (8 inch) corn tortillas', '½ (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk onion, chicken stock, salsa, 1/3 cup cilantro, jalapeno slices, flour, cumin, and garlic together in a medium saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat and simmer for 4 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in chicken; cook until heated through, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and stir in tomato, avocado, and sour cream.
', 'Step 5: Place an oven rack in the lower third of the oven.
', 'Step 6: Preheat the broiler.
', 'Step 7: Microwave tortillas until warmed, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 8: Spoon 1/3 cup of the chicken mixture into the center of each tortilla and roll up.
', 'Step 9: Arrange tortillas, seam-side down, in the bottom of a 9x12-inch glass casserole dish.
', 'Step 10: Top with Cheddar cheese and sprinkle with remaining cilantro.
', 'Step 11: Broil in the preheated oven until properly melted and browned, about 3 minutes.
']

Title: Picante Marinated Chicken
Ingredients: ['½ cup picante sauce', '¼ cup Dijon-style prepared mustard', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '2 tablespoons olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large glass bowl combine the picante sauce, mustard and lemon juice.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken and toss to coat.
', 'Step 3: Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Heat olive oil in a large skillet.
', 'Step 5: Remove chicken from marinade and saute in hot oil until well browned on both sides.
', 'Step 6: Add remaining marinade and let simmer until chicken is glazed and tender and juices run clear.
', 'Step 7: Remove chicken to platter/serving dish.
', 'Step 8: Boil remaining marinade for 5 minutes to remove possibility of bacteria, then pour over chicken.
']

Title: Baked Nacho Lasagna
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '1 (16 ounce) jar salsa', '1 (10 ounce) bag nacho cheese-flavored corn chips (such as Doritos®), crushed', '1 (15.25 ounce) can corn kernels, drained', '1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine beef and taco seasoning in a large skillet.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir over medium heat until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Place refried beans in a small saucepan and heat over low heat, covered, until warmed through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Spread a thin layer of salsa on the bottom of a 9x13-inch casserole dish.
', 'Step 6: Layer half of the crushed chips, seasoned beef, beans, corn, olives, and cheese on top.
', 'Step 7: Repeat layers with remaining ingredients, starting with salsa and ending with cheese.
', 'Step 8: Bake nacho lasagna in the oven until bubbly and cheese is melted, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Chiliquilla
Ingredients: ['8 ounces ground beef', '4 tablespoons margarine, divided', '8 (6 inch) corn tortillas, torn into strips', '3 eggs, beaten', '¾ cup canned mild enchilada sauce', '½ cup sliced black olives', '¼ cup chopped green onions', '½ cup sour cream', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Drain, remove from pan and set aside.
', 'Step 3: Melt 2 tablespoons of margarine in the skillet.
', 'Step 4: Add torn tortillas and brown lightly.
', 'Step 5: Push the tortillas all the way to the outside edge of the pan.
', 'Step 6: Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of margarine to the center and melt.
', 'Step 7: Pour in the beaten eggs and scramble until soft set.
', 'Step 8: Push the eggs to the outside edge of the pan and add the browned ground beef to the center of the pan.
', 'Step 9: Pour the enchilada sauce over and mix lightly.
', 'Step 10: Reduce heat to a simmer.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle the black olives and green onions over the meat mixture; cover and simmer 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove cover and spoon several dollops of sour cream over the dish, then sprinkle evenly with shredded cheese.
', 'Step 13: Replace cover and simmer for an additional 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
']

Title: Beefy Naked Burrito Skillet
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 medium onion, diced', '1 bell pepper, diced', '1 teaspoon cumin', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 (5.5 ounce) package Knorr® Rice Sides™ - Beef flavor', '1 (15 ounce) can low-sodium pinto beans, rinsed and drained', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 tablespoon Sour cream for topping']

', 'Step 2: Cook and stir ground beef, onion and bell pepper until beef is browned and onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.

Title: Gerry's Margarita
Ingredients: ['1 lime, juiced', '½ lemon, juiced', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers reposado tequila (such as Jose Cuervo® Gold)', '1 cup ice cubes, or as needed', 'salt as needed', '1 teaspoon brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®), or to taste']

', 'Step 5: n Spread salt onto a plate.

']

Title: Fresh Salsa I
Ingredients: ['4 jalapeno chile peppers', '5 cloves garlic, finely chopped', '1 onion, finely chopped', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '1 (28 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place jalapeno chile peppers on a medium baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven 15 minutes, or until roasted.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and chop off stems.
', 'Step 5: Place jalapeno chile peppers, garlic, onion, white sugar, salt, ground cumin and diced tomatoes with green chile peppers in a blender or food processor.
', 'Step 6: Chop using the pulse setting for a few seconds.
', 'Step 7: Mix in whole peeled tomatoes.
', 'Step 8: Chop using the pulse setting to attain desired consistency.
', 'Step 9: Transfer to a medium bowl.
', 'Step 10: Cover and chill in the refrigerator until serving.
']

Title: Margarita Tube Cake
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 (18.25 ounce) package orange cake mix (such as Duncan Hines® Orange Supreme)', '1 (3.4 ounce) package instant lemon pudding mix', '4 eggs', '⅓ cup vegetable oil', '⅔ cup bottled margarita mix', '¼ cup lime juice', '¼ cup tequila', '2 tablespoons triple sec', '1 lime, zested', "2 ½ cups confectioners' sugar", '1 tablespoon tequila', '2 tablespoons triple sec', '2 limes, juiced', '1 lime, zested']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9-cup fluted tube pan with cooking spray that contains flour, and brush the spray into the grooves of the pan with a pastry brush.
', 'Step 3: Spray 1 more light coating of cooking spray, and invert the pan to let any excess spray drip out.
', 'Step 4: In a mixing bowl, beat together the orange cake mix, lemon pudding mix, eggs, vegetable oil, margarita mix, lime juice, tequila, and triple sec until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 5: Fold in the grated zest of 1 lime, and pour the batter into the prepared fluted tube pan.
', 'Step 6: Use a spatula to fill grooves of the pan with batter, and tap the filled cake pan to remove air pockets.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Cool the cake in the pan on a rack for 10 minutes, shake it a couple of times to help the sides release, and slide a thin silicone or nylon spatula between the cake and the pan.
', 'Step 9: Place a serving plate over the top of the cake pan and invert the pan to slide the cake onto the serving plate.
', 'Step 10: Allow the cake to finish cooling.
', "Step 11: Make a thin glaze by mixing together confectioners' sugar, 1 tablespoon of tequila, 2 tablespoons of triple sec, juice of 2 limes, and grated zest of 1 lime.
", 'Step 12: Drizzle the glaze decoratively over the cake, let the glaze set for a few minutes to harden, and slice.
']

Title: Peppers Stuffed with Grilled Chicken and Rice
Ingredients: ['4 medium green bell peppers, tops removed, seeded', '1 ¼ cups water, divided', '3 tablespoons taco seasoning, divided', '2 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '½ cup brown rice, rinsed well', '1 medium red bell pepper, cut into thick slices', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '¼ cup chopped onion', '2 teaspoons minced garlic', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 cup shredded Mexican-blend cheese, divided', '½ teaspoon garlic salt, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place green peppers in a baking dish with 1/8 cup water in the bottom.
', 'Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until peppers are slightly browned around the edges, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 4: While the peppers are baking, whisk 1/4 cup water and 2 tablespoons taco seasoning together in a small bowl.
', 'Step 5: Add chicken and toss to coat.
', 'Step 6: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Combine remaining 1 cup water and rice in a pot over high heat; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Cover, reduce heat to low, and cook for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 10: Stir in remaining taco seasoning and let sit, covered, until tender, about 15 minutes more.
', 'Step 11: Remove the lid, drain any remaining liquid, and set aside.
', 'Step 12: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 13: Remove chicken from the refrigerator and place on the preheated grill with the pepper slices.
', 'Step 14: Cook chicken until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 5 to 7 minutes per side.
', 'Step 15: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the chicken should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 16: Grill peppers until tender, about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 17: Remove chicken and peppers from the grill and allow to cool.
', 'Step 18: Shred chicken and dice peppers.
', 'Step 19: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 20: Add onions and garlic; saute until soft, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Add cooked rice, shredded chicken, diced peppers, diced tomatoes and green chiles, 1/2 of the cheese, and garlic salt; stir until well blended.
', 'Step 22: Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until hot, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Spoon rice mixture into the green peppers.
', 'Step 24: Top with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 25: Return to the oven until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '366.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '35 g', 'cholesterolContent': '65.2 mg', 'fatContent': '14.1 g', 'fiberContent': '4.3 g', 'proteinContent': '24.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '1212.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.8 g'}

Title: Spicy Pan-Fried Squash
Ingredients: ['1 acorn squash, halved and seeded', '½ onion, cut into chunks', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 eggs, lightly beaten', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', 'salt to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste', 'ground red pepper to taste', '¼ cup olive oil']

['Step 1: Cut squash into chunks and remove rind.
', 'Step 2: Shred squash and onion in a food processor.
', 'Step 3: Place in a colander and press with a potato masher to drain any excess liquid.
', 'Step 4: Transfer to a bowl and mix with flour and egg.
', 'Step 5: Season with cumin, salt, pepper, and red pepper.
', 'Step 6: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Place walnut-sized scoops of the squash mixture into the hot oil.
', 'Step 8: Press flat with a spatula.
', 'Step 9: Cook 3 to 5 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
', 'Step 10: Drain on paper towels.
']

Title: Mexican Shrimp Soup (Caldo de Camaron)
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 small onion, chopped', '3 potatoes, peeled and cubed', '2 carrots, peeled and cubed', '2 quarts fish broth', '1 cube shrimp bouillon', '1 ⅔ pounds uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1 pinch salt to taste', '1 lime, cut into 8 wedges', '2 jalapeno peppers, chopped']

', 'Step 9: Serve hot with lime wedges and jalapenos.

Title: Mexican-Inspired Spaghetti Squash
Ingredients: ['1 spaghetti squash', '½ teaspoon olive oil, or as needed', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ sweet yellow onion, chopped', '½ yellow bell pepper, chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced, or more to taste', 'nonstick cooking spray', '1 (14 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '¾ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided', '¼ cup fresh cilantro, chopped', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 Roma tomatoes, chopped', '1 avocado, diced, or more to taste', '1 (4 ounce) can sliced black olives']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a baking pan with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Cut squash in 1/2 lengthwise.
', 'Step 4: Remove and discard seeds.
', 'Step 5: Add a few drops of oil to each 1/2 and spread using a pastry brush.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Place cut-side down in the prepared baking pan.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until tender, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 10: Saute onion, bell pepper, and garlic in the hot oil until tender, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 12: Remove cooked squash from the oven and reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Spray a 2-quart casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray.
', 'Step 14: Remove strands from squash using a fork or spoon and place them into a large bowl.
', 'Step 15: Add black beans, sauteed veggies, 1/2 cup Mexican cheese, cilantro, cumin, salt, and pepper; mix well.
', 'Step 16: Spoon mixture into the prepared casserole dish.
', 'Step 17: Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup Mexican cheese.

', 'Step 19: Remove from the oven and top with tomatoes, avocado, and olives.
', 'Step 20: Serve immediately.

Title: Natillas (Mexican Custard)
Ingredients: ['¾ cup white sugar', '3 tablespoons cornstarch', '2 ¼ cups milk, divided', '3 large eggs, separated', '1 tablespoon ground nutmeg', '1 pinch salt', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '½ teaspoon ground nutmeg, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Dissolve 3/4 cup sugar and cornstarch in 1 cup of milk.
', 'Step 2: Beat egg yolks.
', 'Step 3: Add beaten egg yolks, 1 tablespoon nutmeg, and salt.
', 'Step 4: This makes a thick paste.
', 'Step 5: Put the rest of the milk in a heavy pan over low heat.
', 'Step 6: Add the paste mixture and stir constantly.
', 'Step 7: Cook until mixture comes to a boil and thickens or coats a spoon.
', 'Step 8: Beat egg whites until stiff and then add 1 tablespoon sugar as you continue beating.
', 'Step 9: Fold this mixture into hot custard.
', 'Step 10: Pour into individual ramekin serving dishes (sometimes I use thick martini glasses if I want to get fancy).
', 'Step 11: Chill for a minimum of 5 hours and sprinkle remaining nutmeg over chilled dessert for presentation.
']

Title: Easiest Layer Dip

Title: Cherry Wood-Smoked Chicken Breast Quesadillas with Pico de Gallo
Ingredients: ['5 Roma tomatoes, diced', '½ white onion, diced', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '½ jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon garlic salt, or to taste', '1 cup cherry wood chips, soaked in water', '3 skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '6 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '1 pound shredded pepper Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine tomatoes, onion, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, chili powder, and garlic salt in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Mix together and refrigerate until ready to use.
', 'Step 3: Preheat a charcoal grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 4: Spread the soaked cherry wood chips evenly on top of the lit charcoal.
', 'Step 5: Place chicken on grill, cover, and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 10 minutes per side.
', 'Step 6: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Remove chicken from grill and allow chicken to cool until safe to handle.
', 'Step 8: Cut each chicken breast into small cubes.
', 'Step 9: Preheat an electric griddle to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Place one tortilla on the griddle to warm and quickly flip it.
', 'Step 11: Spread enough pepper Jack cheese to lightly cover the entire tortilla and let it melt, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 13: Spread 3 tablespoons of pico de gallo on one half of the tortilla and top with 1/6 of the diced chicken.
', 'Step 14: Fold cheese side of the tortilla on top of the pico de gallo-chicken mixture, slice into 3 wedges, and serve.
', 'Step 15: Repeat with remaining ingredients.
']

Title: Super-Simple Dorito® Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 envelope taco seasoning mix', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '1 (15 ounce) can ranch-style beans', '1 (14.5 ounce) package nacho-flavor tortilla chips', '¾ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cook ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until browned and crumbly, breaking the meat up as it cooks, about 10 minutes.

Title: Vegetarian Tortilla Soup with Avocado

Title: Funky Enchilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast meat - cubed', '1 tablespoon ground cumin, or to taste', '1 tablespoon dry Mexican or taco seasoning', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '1 medium onion, chopped', '5 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 orange bell pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (10 ounce) package frozen corn kernels', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '2 cups shredded pepperjack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add the chicken and season with cumin, Mexican seasoning and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the onion and garlic and cook until chicken is browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add red, yellow and orange peppers; cook and stir for another 5 minutes, then mix in the black beans, kidney beans and corn.
', 'Step 6: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 7: Line the bottom and sides of a 9x13 inch baking dish with corn tortillas.
', 'Step 8: Pour in the skillet mixture then top with cilantro and pepperjack cheese.

', 'Step 10: Let stand for 10 minutes, then serve with your favorite Mexican food toppings.
']

Title: Cilantro-Lime Marinated Grilled Chicken
Ingredients: ['1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '½ cup canola oil', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 limes, zested and juiced', '2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', '½ jalapeno pepper, ribs and seeds removed, finely minced', '1 tablespoon honey', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breasts']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chiles, canola oil, cilantro, lime zest and juice, garlic, jalapeno, honey, salt, and pepper in a 1-gallon freezer bag and seal completely.
', 'Step 2: Gently massage the bag to combine ingredients well.
', 'Step 3: Add chicken and turn to completely coat with marinade.
', 'Step 4: Place in the refrigerator and allow to marinate for at least 4 hours for best flavor, turning bag occasionally.
', 'Step 5: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 6: Remove chicken from the marinade and shake off excess.
', 'Step 7: Discard the remaining marinade.
', 'Step 8: Grill chicken, covered, on the preheated grill until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear, 4 to 6 minutes per side.
', 'Step 9: Remove chicken from the grill and let rest under aluminum foil to redistribute juices back into the meat, 4 to 5 minutes.
']

Title: Baja-Style Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['½ cup tequila', '½ cup fresh lime juice', '½ cup water', '2 tablespoons kosher salt', '2 tablespoons turbinado sugar', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 pounds cod fillet, cut into 3- by 1-inch strips', '1 cup canned black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '½ cup mayonnaise', '½ cup sour cream', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon cider vinegar', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 teaspoon sugar', '1 (12 ounce) package coleslaw mix', '1 tablespoon chopped green onions', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon baking soda', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 cup oil for deep frying', '9 corn or flour tortilla']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Make a marinade by whisking together the tequila, lime juice, water, 2 tablespoons salt, turbinado sugar, and 1 tablespoon chili powder in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Set aside 1/4 cup of the marinade.
', 'Step 3: Add the cod to the remaining marinade; cover and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Stir together the reserved 1/4 cup marinade, black beans, and jalapeno; set aside.
', 'Step 5: Mix together the mayonnaise, sour cream, 1 tablespoon chili powder, cider vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, sugar, and green onions in a large bowl.
', 'Step 6: Add the coleslaw mix and green onion and mix until coated; set aside.
', 'Step 7: Mix together the flour, 1 tablespoon chili powder, baking soda, and 2 teaspoons salt in a shallow dish.
', 'Step 8: Remove pieces of cod from the marinade, shake off the marinade, and coat in the flour mixture.
', 'Step 9: Heat the oil in a heavy skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Gently lie the coated fish in the skillet without crowding the pieces.
', 'Step 11: Cook in the hot oil, turning once, until browned on all sides, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 12: While frying the cod, heat the black bean mixture in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Heat the reserved marinade in a separate small saucepan over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 14: Assemble tacos by placing fish in the center of tortilla; top with coleslaw, black beans, and any other desired toppings.
', 'Step 15: Drizzle some of the heated marinade over the fillings and fold the tortilla to close.
']

Title: Soft Cheese Tacos
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped, or more to taste', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth', '2 tablespoons cornstarch', '4 cups shredded American cheese', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '12 corn tortillas, warmed', '3 cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat butter in a pot over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir onion and jalapeno pepper in the hot butter until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add garlic to onion mixture and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 5: Whisk chicken broth and cornstarch together in a bowl until smooth; pour into the onion mixture.

', 'Step 10: Sprinkle about 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese down the center of 1 tortilla and roll tortilla around cheese.
', 'Step 11: Place rolled tortilla, seam-side down, in a baking dish.
', 'Step 12: Repeat with remaining tortillas and Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 13: Cover dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Remove foil and pour the reserved 1/2 of the cheese sauce over tacos.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Steak Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 (1.1 oz) package dry mesquite marinade mix (such as McCormick® Grill Mates®)', '¼ cup water', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '2 pounds beef top sirloin, thinly sliced', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '¼ cup taco seasoning', '1 lime, halved', 'water as needed', '1 green bell pepper, thinly sliced', '1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced', '1 onion, thinly sliced']

['Step 1: Combine marinade mix, 1/4 cup water, and 1/4 cup oil in a bowl with an airtight lid.
', 'Step 2: Add steak, seal the lid, and shake until coated with marinade.
', 'Step 3: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 4: Add 1 tablespoon oil to lightly coat the bottom of the pot and add garlic.
', 'Step 5: Transfer steak from marinade to the hot oil.
', 'Step 6: Add taco seasoning, squeeze in lime juice, and saute until meat is no longer pink, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Transfer cooked steak to a bowl.
', 'Step 8: Add water to the Instant Pot® and scrape steak bits from the bottom.
', 'Step 9: Add bell peppers and onion.
', 'Step 10: Close and lock the lid, select high pressure, and set the timer for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Allow 5 to 10 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 12: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes, making sure to cover with a towel to prevent splatter.
", 'Step 13: Unlock and remove the lid.
']

Title: My Grandma's Guacamole
Ingredients: ['2 fresh chile de arbol peppers, or to taste', '3 medium avocados - peeled, pitted, and mashed (one pit reserved)', '2 tablespoons finely chopped onion', '¼ cup chopped roma tomatoes', '1 (14.5 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes', '1 ½ cups chopped fresh cilantro', '2 pinches garlic powder, or to taste', 'salt to taste', '1 lime, juiced']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Arrange chile peppers on a baking sheet.

', 'Step 4: Remove stems.
', 'Step 5: Mix avocados, onion, and roma tomatoes together in a bowl.
', 'Step 6: Blend canned tomatoes, cilantro, toasted chile peppers, garlic powder, and salt in a blender until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Pour about half the blended tomato mixture into avocado mixture.
', 'Step 8: Reserve remaining tomato mixture for another use or for dipping.
', 'Step 9: Squeeze lime juice into avocado mixture and gently stir until evenly combined.
', 'Step 10: Transfer guacamole to a smaller serving bowl; place reserved avocado pit in the middle to prevent browning.
']

Title: Tomatoed Pork
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons canola oil', '2 pounds pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch chunks', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '2 large fresh jalapeno peppers, stems removed', '¼ cup sliced onion', '1 clove garlic, crushed', '1 (6 ounce) can mushroom stems and pieces, drained', '1 (12 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '½ teaspoon ground cumin']

['Step 1: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Season the pork with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 3: Add the pork to skillet and stir to coat with oil.
', 'Step 4: Place the jalapeno peppers into the pan and cover; allow to simmer 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Uncover and remove the jalapenos from the pan; chop roughly and set aside.
', 'Step 6: Continue cooking the pork, uncovered, until it browns completely and the liquid evaporates, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Mix in the onion and garlic; cook and stir about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add the mushrooms and cook 1 minute more.
', 'Step 9: Pour the tomatoes and chopped jalapenos into the pan and stir through the pork.
', 'Step 10: Season with the cumin.
', 'Step 11: Stir, cover, and reduce heat to low; simmer another 10 minutes.
']

Title: Big Game Salsa Dip

', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to low.

Title: Mango Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '½ onion, chopped', '1 red bell pepper, chopped', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '1 pinch dried oregano', '1 pinch dried basil', '1 mango - peeled, seeded and diced', '1 (6 ounce) package seasoned chicken-style vegetarian strips (such as Lightlife Smart Strips®)', '6 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 cup arugula leaves', '1 (4 ounce) jar jalapeno pepper rings', '1 (8 ounce) jar salsa']

Title: Vegetarian Mexican Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '6 tomatillos, husked and chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can no-salt-added black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (14.5 ounce) can no-salt-added fire roasted tomatoes', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ancho chile powder', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', "1 (8.8 ounce) package UNCLE BEN'S® INSTANT Whole Grain Brown Rice", "1 (8.8 ounce) package UNCLE BEN'S® READY RICE® Spanish Style", '2 ½ cups crushed tortilla chips', '½ cup Monterey Jack cheese, shredded', '¼ cup thinly sliced radishes', '2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped']

', 'Step 2: Add garlic and cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 3: Add tomatillos and cook, stirring often, until tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in black beans, tomatoes, cumin, ancho powder, salt, and cook, smashing beans and tomatoes with a spoon, until warmed through, 5 minutes.

', 'Step 13: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Mike's Baked Haddock Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed', '2 pounds haddock fillets', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '2 tablespoons ground black pepper', '1 (12 ounce) package flour tortillas', '1 (6 ounce) container guacamole', '1 (8 ounce) carton sour cream', '1 head lettuce, shredded', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (8 ounce) jar pico de gallo or fresh salsa']

', 'Step 2: Coat the bottom of the glass baking pan with a thin coat of olive or canola oil.

', 'Step 5: Sprinkle with chili powder and black pepper.
', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until fish is cooked through and slightly browned on the outside, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: While the fish is cooking, slightly brown the tortillas in a lightly greased frying pan.
', 'Step 8: Once the fish is done, take a tortilla and put one or two pieces of fish in the middle.
', 'Step 9: Spread about 2 teaspoons of guacamole and a thin layer of sour cream on the fish.
', 'Step 10: Cover with shredded lettuce, garnish with Cheddar cheese, and top with pico de gallo.
', 'Step 11: Serve.

Title: Cheesy Chicken Enchilada Soup
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil, or more to taste', '1 medium white onion, diced', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '½ cup masa harina', '3 cups chicken stock', '3 cups shredded cooked chicken', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes, undrained', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, minced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin, or more to taste', '1 teaspoon garlic powder, or more to taste', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '½ teaspoon salt, or more to taste']

Title: Mexican Bean Stew
Ingredients: ['1 cup dried pinto beans', '1 cup dry black beans', '1 cup dry garbanzo beans', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, diced', '4 cloves garlic, crushed', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 (14.5 ounce) can crushed tomatoes', '2 cups fresh corn kernels', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', 'salt and pepper to taste', 'cayenne pepper to taste']

Title: Andouille and Poblano Quesadillas
