Title: Cheesy Pork Taco Rice
Ingredients: ['3 poblano peppers, halved lengthwise', '1 pound ground pork', '1 ½ cups low-sodium chicken broth', '1 cup long-grain rice', '1 large onion, chopped, divided', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon onion powder', '2 tomatoes, cored and chopped', '½ lime, zested and juiced', '3 tablespoons chopped cilantro, divided', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', "½ cup frozen roasted corn (such as Trader Joe's®), thawed", '¾ cup shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Place poblano peppers, cut sides down, onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, about 6 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Wrap peppers in the aluminum foil from the baking sheet.
', 'Step 6: Allow peppers to steam as they cool, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove and discard skins and seeds.
', 'Step 8: Chop into bite-size pieces.
', 'Step 9: Reduce oven temperature to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Heat a large oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 11: Stir in ground pork, chicken broth, rice, 1/2 the onion, taco seasoning, garlic powder, and onion powder.
', 'Step 12: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 13: Bake, covered, in the preheated oven until pork is no longer pink and rice is tender, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Combine the remaining onion, tomatoes, lime zest, lime juice, and 1 tablespoon cilantro in a small bowl.
', 'Step 15: Season salsa with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 16: Stir the roasted poblano peppers, remaining cilantro, and corn into the baked pork-rice dish.
', 'Step 17: Sprinkle cheese blend on top; let stand until melted, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Sprinkle the salsa on top.
']

Title: Honey-Lime Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 cooked chicken breast halves, shredded', '⅓ cup honey', '¼ cup freshly squeezed lime juice', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '2 teaspoons minced garlic', '1 (14 ounce) can green enchilada sauce', '½ cup heavy whipping cream', '12 corn tortillas', '2 cups shredded queso asadero (white Mexican cheese)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place shredded chicken in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Whisk honey, lime juice, chili powder, and garlic together in a bowl; pour over chicken and toss to coat.
', 'Step 3: Marinate chicken in refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Mix enchilada sauce and cream together in a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 6: Dip 1 tortilla in enchilada sauce mixture and place in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Repeat dipping tortillas and arranging in the dish until bottom of dish is covered.
', 'Step 8: Spread 1/2 the chicken mixture over dipped-tortilla layer.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle 1/3 the queso asadero over chicken layer.
', 'Step 10: Dip more tortillas in enchilada sauce mixture and arrange over queso asadero layer.
', 'Step 11: Spoon 2 to 3 spoonful enchilada sauce mixture over tortilla layer.
', 'Step 12: Repeat layering with remaining chicken, 1/3 queso asadero, ending with a layer of dipped tortillas.
', 'Step 13: Pour any remaining enchilada sauce mixture over tortillas.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle remaining 1/3 queso asadero over enchiladas.

Title: Suegra's Tomatillo Chicken
Ingredients: ['1 (3 1/2) pound whole chicken, cut into 6 pieces', '1 pound fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '2 dried California chile pods', '3 dried red chile peppers', '2 tablespoons olive oil', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place the tomatillos, California chilies, and red chile peppers into a small roasting pan or a rimmed baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Roast for about 20 minutes, turning frequently.
', 'Step 4: If the chilies start to get too dark, remove them and place into a food processor or blender.
', 'Step 5: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Add chicken pieces and cook, turning to sear evenly on all sides.
', 'Step 7: Combine the tomatillos and chilies in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 8: Season with salt to taste.
', 'Step 9: Pour this mixture in with the chicken.
', 'Step 10: Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover and simmer until chicken is tender, 20 to 25 minutes.
']

Title: Almost White Slow-Cooker Chicken Chili
Ingredients: ['2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '4 cups chicken broth', '2 cups water, or as needed', '1 (15.8 ounce) can great northern beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (12 ounce) jar medium salsa', '1 cup tomato puree', '1 onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 ½ teaspoons dried oregano', '1 teaspoon molasses', '1 teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 bay leaves', 'salt to taste', '4 ounces pepper jack cheese, cubed', '4 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, cubed', '1 green bell pepper, diced', '¼ cup sour cream, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chicken, chicken broth, water, beans, salsa, tomato puree, onion, garlic, chili powder, cumin, oregano, molasses, paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, black pepper, bay leaves, and salt in a 6-quart slow cooker.
', 'Step 2: Stir gently to combine.
', 'Step 3: Cover and cook on Low until chicken is falling apart, 4 to 6 hours.
', 'Step 4: Remove chicken from slow cooker, shred, and return to the cooker.
', 'Step 5: Stir in pepper jack cheese, Monterey jack cheese, and bell pepper.
', 'Step 6: Cover and cook until bell pepper is softened and cheeses have completely melted into the chili, 30 to 45 minutes more.
', 'Step 7: Adjust salt, black pepper, and chili powder to taste.
', 'Step 8: Remove bay leaves.
', 'Step 9: Serve warm, topped with sour cream and extra cheese, if desired.
']

Title: Overnight Mexican Breakfast Strata
Ingredients: ['8 ounces chorizo sausage', '2 medium onions, thinly sliced', '2 medium poblano peppers, seeded and thinly sliced', '1 medium red bell pepper, chopped', '8 cups cubed Mexican bolillo rolls', '6 large eggs, lightly beaten', '2 ½ cups 2% milk', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground paprika', '½ cup crumbled queso fresco', '1 tablespoon snipped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cook and stir chorizo in a large skillet over medium heat until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Transfer to a bowl using a slotted spoon, reserving 1 tablespoon of drippings in the pan.
', 'Step 3: Add onions to the skillet and cook, stirring frequently, until tender, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in poblano peppers and bell pepper; cook until just tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat and return chorizo to the skillet.
', 'Step 6: Lightly grease a 3-quart rectangle or oval casserole dish.
', 'Step 7: Spread 1/2 of the bread into the prepared dish and top with 1/2 of the chorizo mixture.
', 'Step 8: Repeat with remaining bread and chorizo.
', 'Step 9: Whisk eggs, milk, oregano, and paprika together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 10: Pour egg mixture evenly over bread and sausage.
', 'Step 11: Cover and chill, 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 12: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven, covered, for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Uncover and bake until an instant-read thermometer pressed into the center reads 170 degrees F (degrees C), 30 to 45 minutes more.
', 'Step 15: Sprinkle with queso fresco during the last 5 minutes of baking.
', 'Step 16: Let stand for 10 minutes and sprinkle with cilantro.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '237.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '21.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '113.7 mg', 'fatContent': '11.2 g', 'fiberContent': '1.6 g', 'proteinContent': '12.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '462.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.2 g'}

Title: Pork Tamales
Ingredients: ['15 corn husks, or as needed', '2 peppers dried guajillo chile peppers, seeded', '1 cup beef broth', '1 cup tomato sauce', '¼ medium onion, minced', '5 cloves garlic, minced', '2 peppers chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', '1 tablespoon ground cloves', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground allspice', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 (4 pound) boneless pork butt (shoulder)', '2 cups masa harina', '2 tablespoons baking powder', '2 tablespoons garlic powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 cups beef broth', '⅔ cup lard, at room temperature']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Soak corn husks in water for 24 hours prior to cooking, using something heavy to keep them submerged.
', 'Step 2: Prepare pork filling: Place guajillo chile peppers in a dry skillet over medium heat; dry roast until fragrant, 20 to 30 seconds per side.
', 'Step 3: Pour some water over top and simmer until tender, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove chiles from the skillet and transfer to a blender.
', 'Step 5: Add beef broth, tomato sauce, onion, garlic, chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, vinegar, cloves, salt, cumin, allspice, and pepper to the blender and process until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Place pork butt in a slow cooker and pour marinade over top.
', 'Step 7: Cook on Low until pork is tender and can be easily pulled apart with a fork, 4 to 5 hours.
', 'Step 8: Shred pork and return to the slow cooker.
', 'Step 9: Mix with the sauce until combined.
', 'Step 10: Combine masa, baking powder, garlic powder, and salt for dough in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment; whisk to combine.
', 'Step 11: Add beef broth and lard and whisk well; the resulting mixture should have an almost fluffy consistency and be relatively tacky.
', 'Step 12: Roll out a corn husk and pat it dry.
', 'Step 13: Spread the dough evenly in the center of the corn husk, leaving room around the edges.
', 'Step 14: Dollop a line of pork filling down the center.
', 'Step 15: Fold the bottom of the husk up, then fold one edge over the filling.
', 'Step 16: Tuck that edge under the filling and dough, and roll toward the other edge to seal around the filling.
', 'Step 17: Fold the top down and tie with kitchen string, wrapping twice to secure.
', 'Step 18: Repeat to make remaining tamales.
', 'Step 19: Place a steamer insert into a large saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 20: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 21: Place tamales vertically into the steamer basket, with the sealed edges down.
', 'Step 22: Cover the pan and steam for 1 hour.
', 'Step 23: Serve hot.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '411.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '15.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '77.9 mg', 'fatContent': '31.3 g', 'fiberContent': '2.7 g', 'proteinContent': '18.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '11.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '2474.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.3 g'}

Title: Monterey Chicken with Potatoes
Ingredients: ['6 medium red potatoes, cubed', '½ cup butter, melted and divided', '4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican blend cheese', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '½ cup salsa', '1 lime, cut into wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a 9x13 inch baking dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Toss potatoes with about 1 tablespoon of melted butter until coated.
', 'Step 4: Arrange in a single layer in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 5: Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 6: Remove pan from oven, and push potatoes out to the sides of the dish.
', 'Step 7: Place the chicken breast halves in the dish.
', 'Step 8: Stir together the remaining butter and lime juice.
', 'Step 9: Brush onto chicken.
', 'Step 10: Return to the oven.
', 'Step 11: Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the chicken is no longer pink and the juices run clear.
', 'Step 12: In a small bowl, toss together the cheese, cilantro and salsa.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle over the chicken and potatoes.
', 'Step 14: Return to the oven for a few minutes, until the cheese is melted.
', 'Step 15: Serve with lime wedges.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Green Chile Stew

Title: Tinga
Ingredients: ['4 chicken breast halves', '1 tablespoon canola oil', '2 medium tomatoes, chopped', '3 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped', '¼ medium onion, chopped', '8 corn tortillas, warmed', '1 cup canola oil for frying']

Title: Bacon, Tomato, and Avocado Flatbread
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 flour tortillas', '1 cup grated Cheddar cheese', '1 small tomato, seeded and diced', '½ cup onion, diced', '3 slices cooked bacon, crumbled, or more to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and sliced', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', '1 teaspoon ranch dressing, or to taste', '1 teaspoon buffalo ranch dressing, or to taste']

Title: Carne Asada Sandwich
Ingredients: ['Chipotle Mayonnaise:', '1 ½ cups mayonnaise', '½ cup sour cream', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ cup diced green onions', '1 ½ tablespoons ground chipotle chile powder', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '1 tablespoon garlic basil spread (see footnote for recipe link)', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper', 'Filling:', '2 pounds beef tri-tip steak, thinly sliced', '2 Anaheim chile peppers, diced', '1 onion, diced', '1 red bell pepper, diced', '1 green bell pepper, diced', '1 lime, juiced', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground chipotle chile powder', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon Mexican oregano', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 jalapeno peppers, sliced', 'Assembly:', '4 Italian-style hoagie buns, split lengthwise', '½ pound sliced Asiago cheese, divided', '1 avocado, sliced - divided', '1 cup halved cherry tomatoes, divided', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro, divided']

['Step 1: Combine mayonnaise, sour cream, 1/2 cup cilantro, green onions, 1 1/2 tablespoon ground chipotle peppers, 1 tablespoon lime juice, garlic basil spread, 1 teaspoon cumin, salt, and black pepper in a bowl.

', 'Step 4: Combine beef tri-tip, Anaheim chile peppers, onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, juice of 1 lime, olive oil, garlic, red pepper flakes, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1 teaspoon ground chipotle pepper, smoked paprika, and Mexican oregano in a large bowl; season with salt and black pepper and toss to combine.
', 'Step 5: Cover and refrigerate beef mixture for at least 4 hours.
', 'Step 6: Preheat oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Heat a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 8: Add beef mixture and cook, stirring constantly, until onions soften and become golden and beef browns, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir in 1 cup chopped cilantro and jalapeno peppers.
', 'Step 10: Spread each hoagie bun with 2 tablespoons chipotle mayonnaise.
', 'Step 11: Spoon beef mixture into buns and top each sandwich with 2 ounces Asiago cheese.
', 'Step 12: Place sandwiches on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bread is toasted and warm, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Divide fresh avocado, cherry tomatoes, and 1/2 cup cilantro over the 4 sandwiches.
']

Title: Air Fryer Turkey Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '½ tablespoon paprika', '½ tablespoon dried Mexican oregano', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '2 limes, divided', '1 pound skinless, boneless turkey breast, cut into 1/2-inch thick slices', '1 ½ tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '1 large red bell pepper, sliced into strips', '1 medium yellow bell pepper, sliced into strips', '1 large red onion, halved and sliced into strips', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped, or more to taste', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro']

Title: Creamy Elote Dip
Ingredients: ['8 ears corn, shucked', '2 medium green onions, chopped', '1 medium jalapeno pepper, diced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ cup mayonnaise', '¼ cup sour cream', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '1 tablespoon Mexican-style hot sauce (such as Valentina®)', '3 tablespoons chopped cilantro', '1 ½ teaspoons ground ancho chile powder', '⅓ cup crumbled cotija cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Grill corn for 10 minutes, turning every 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer corn to a cutting board and let cool for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Cut kernels off the cobs.
', 'Step 5: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Add onions and jalapeno and cook for 4 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to low and stir in mayonnaise, sour cream, lime juice, and hot sauce.
', 'Step 9: Cook for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir in corn and cook until heated through, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 11: Remove from heat and stir in cilantro.
', 'Step 12: Transfer the dip to a serving dish.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle chile powder over the top and garnish with cotija cheese.
']

Title: Cheesy Salsa Mac
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef (80% lean)', '2 cups fresh salsa', '1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix', '⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 ½ cups hot water', '1 ½ cups elbow macaroni', '1 cup milk', '1 (8 ounce) package processed cheese food (such as Velveeta®), cut into cubes', '4 ounces shredded sharp Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 3: Return skillet to heat.
', 'Step 4: Stir salsa, taco seasoning mix, and black pepper into the beef; simmer the mixture until hot, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir water, macaroni, and milk into the beef mixture; bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, place a cover on the skillet, and simmer the mixture until the pasta is tender, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir cheese food and Cheddar cheese into the pasta mixture; cook until the cheese melts completely, 5 to 7 minutes.
']

Title: Korean Fusion Chicken Burrito
Ingredients: ['6 cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons Korean chile paste (gochujang)', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '2 teaspoons white sugar', '1 teaspoon sesame oil', '2 (10 ounce) cans chicken chunks, drained', '4 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 teaspoons butter, softened', '1 cup fresh cilantro leaves', '½ cup chopped kimchi, squeezed dry', '2 tablespoons shredded sharp Cheddar cheese', '1 tablespoon salsa']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 360 degrees F (182 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Stir garlic, chile paste, soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil together in a bowl until the sugar dissolves into the liquid; add chicken and stir to coat.

', 'Step 6: Spread 1/2 teaspoon butter over one side of each warm tortilla.
', 'Step 7: Divide chicken between the tortillas.

Title: One-Pan Mexican Quinoa

', 'Step 5: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer, covered, until the liquid is fully absorbed into the quinoa, 20 to 25 minutes.

Title: Mexican Noodle Soup (Sopa de Fideo)

', 'Step 2: Blend until smooth.

', 'Step 5: Add pasta; cook, stirring constantly, until lightly browned, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Pour tomato sauce into the saucepan over the noodles; add parsley and remaining chicken stock.

Title: Sweet Pork Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 (3 pound) boneless pork loin roast', 'water as needed', '1 pinch garlic salt', 'ground black pepper to taste', '2 (14 ounce) cans green enchilada sauce, divided', '½ cup brown sugar', '1 (15 ounce) package flour tortillas', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained', '¼ cup chopped cilantro, or to taste', '½ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place pork in a slow cooker with enough water to cover bottom by 2 inches.
', 'Step 2: Season pork with garlic salt and pepper.
', 'Step 3: Cook on High for 4 hours.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Transfer pork to a bowl and shred meat with 2 forks.
', 'Step 6: Mix 1 can enchilada sauce and brown sugar into pork.
', 'Step 7: Pour half the remaining can of sauce into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Spread about 1/4 cup pork mixture down the center of each tortilla; top with black beans and cilantro.
', 'Step 9: Roll tortillas around filling and arrange in prepared baking dish, seam sides down.
', 'Step 10: Pour remaining half can enchilada sauce over tortillas and cover with Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 11: Cover baking dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbly, 25 minutes.
']

Title: Carnitas with Pico De Gallo
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '6 pounds boneless pork shoulder', '1 cup ground cumin', '4 dried New Mexico chiles, seeded and cut into 1/2 inch pieces', '1 onion, quartered', '6 cloves garlic, halved', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '6 cups water', '6 tomatoes, chopped', '1 onion, chopped', '2 tomatillos, husked and chopped', '2 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '⅓ cup lime juice', '1 tablespoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Sear the pork in the hot oil until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Place into a slow cooker along with the cumin, New Mexico chiles, quartered onion, garlic, and 1 minced jalapeno pepper.
', 'Step 4: Pour in the water, cover, and cook on High for 6 to 8 hours, then reduce heat to Low and cook until the pork is tender and easily shredded, 12 to 16 hours more.
', 'Step 5: Once cooked, remove the pork and vegetables to a large bowl and shred finely with two forks.
', 'Step 6: Mix in enough cooking liquid to moisten the meat to your taste.
', 'Step 7: Prepare the pico de gallo 2 to 6 hours before the carnitas will be ready.
', 'Step 8: Combine the tomatoes, onion, tomatillos, and 2 minced jalapeno peppers in a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 9: Season with lime juice, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 10: Mix well, and refrigerate until ready to serve.
']

Title: Spicy Lentil Nachos
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon coconut oil', '1 cup finely chopped onion', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 cup dried lentils', '2 ½ cups chicken broth', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 cup cooked black beans', '1 cup corn kernels', '1 cup salsa', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 (13.5 ounce) package tortilla chips']

Title: Butternut Squash Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['8 (5 inch) corn tortillas', '½ unpeeled butternut squash, seeded', '½ cup water', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ onion, chopped', '2 cups chopped fresh spinach', '4 sun-dried tomatoes, chopped', '1 cup enchilada sauce', '¼ cup crumbled goat cheese', '¼ cup crumbled cotija cheese', '2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves, for garnish', '¼ cup sour cream, for topping']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lay the tortillas flat onto a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until crispy, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove and allow to cool.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, place the butternut squash half into a microwave-safe dish cut-side-down, and pour in the water.
', 'Step 6: Cook in the microwave until tender, 12 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Once cool enough to handle, scoop out the flesh and dice; place into a mixing bowl and set aside.
', 'Step 8: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 9: Stir in the garlic and onion; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add the spinach and sun-dried tomatoes.
', 'Step 11: Continue cooking until the spinach wilts.
', 'Step 12: Gently fold the spinach mixture into the diced butternut squash.
', 'Step 13: Arrange four crispy tortillas on the baking sheet.
', 'Step 14: Divide the squash mixture among the tortillas.
', 'Step 15: Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of goat cheese over each tortilla, then top with the remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 16: Pour the enchilada sauce over top, and sprinkle each with 1 tablespoon of cotija cheese.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the preheated oven until hot, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Garnish each enchilada with chopped cilantro leaves and a dollop of sour cream to serve.
']

Title: Ceviche de Soya

Title: Easy Air Fryer Chicken Taquitos

', 'Step 2: Working with one tortilla at a time, place 2 tablespoons of shredded chicken on one end of the tortilla.

', 'Step 5: Use 2 toothpicks to secure the taquito along the seam.

', "Step 8: Place 4 taquitos (toothpicks will be facing up) into the basket, making sure they're not touching, and spray the tops with more cooking spray.
", 'Step 9: Air-fry until the taquitos are brown and crispy to your liking, 5 to 6 minutes.

', 'Step 11: Remove toothpicks before serving.
']

Title: Chicken and Red Bean Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken', '1 (15.5 ounce) can small red or pinto beans, drained', '2 cups grated pepper Jack cheese', '1 medium-large onion', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth', '3 tablespoons sour cream', '12 corn tortillas (about 5 1/2 inches in diameter)', 'chopped fresh cilantro', 'hot red pepper sauce']

Title: Rosca de Reyes
Ingredients: ['4 cups all-purpose flour', '3 eggs', '3 eggs, separated', '⅔ cup white sugar', '1 tablespoon warm water', '2 (.25 ounce) packages dry yeast', '1 orange, zested', '1 lime, zested', '1 pinch salt', '½ cup butter, softened', '1 tablespoon butter, softened', '½ cup white sugar', '¼ cup butter', '¼ cup all-purpose flour', '20 candied citrus peels']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix 4 cups flour, eggs, egg yolks, 2/3 cup white sugar, water, dry yeast, orange zest, lime zest, and salt in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a dough hook.
', 'Step 2: Add 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon butter; mix until dough is elastic and shiny, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Form dough into a ball.
', 'Step 4: Cover and let rise in a warm place for 45 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Punch down dough gently; roll into a long cylinder.
', 'Step 6: Join the ends of the cylinder together in the shape of an oval ring.
', 'Step 7: Place ring on a greased baking sheet; cover and let rise in a warm place for 45 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Whisk eggs whites in a small bowl.
', 'Step 10: Brush egg whites evenly over dough.
', 'Step 11: Mix 1/2 cup white sugar and 1/4 cup butter in a small bowl with your fingers to form a paste.
', 'Step 12: Add enough flour to give paste the consistency of Play-Doh®; divide into 5 or 6 balls.
', 'Step 13: Place each ball between two 3-inch squares of parchment paper.
', 'Step 14: Press with the bottom of a 1-cup measuring cup to make a circle about 1/8 inch thick.
', 'Step 15: Space circles evenly around the dough ring.
', 'Step 16: Arrange candied citrus peels on top of the dough.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Cool for 20 minutes before slicing.
']

Title: Cheesy Chilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 onion, diced', '1 green bell pepper, diced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pound ground beef', '1 (16 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 cup picante sauce', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon dried cilantro', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '12 corn tortillas, divided', '2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '2 cups shredded lettuce', '1 large tomato, diced']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Saute onion and bell pepper in hot oil until softening, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add garlic and continue to saute until fragrant, about 1 minute more.
', 'Step 5: Break ground beef into small chunks and add to the pot; cook, stirring frequently, until the beef is completely browned, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Drain grease from the pot and return to heat.
', 'Step 7: Stir pinto beans, tomato sauce, picante sauce, cumin, chili powder, cilantro, salt, red pepper flakes, and black pepper into the beef mixture; bring to a simmer, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer until the flavors blend, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Spoon enough of the beef mixture into the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking dish to cover.
', 'Step 9: Arrange 6 tortillas atop the beef mixture.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle 1 cup Monterey Jack cheese and 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese in a layer to cover the tortillas.
', 'Step 11: Arrange remaining 6 tortillas atop the cheese layer; top with remaining meat mixture.
', 'Step 12: Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 13: Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Remove the aluminum foil and sprinkle the remaining Monterey Jack cheese and Cheddar cheese over the top.
', 'Step 15: Continue baking until the cheese is melted, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Let cool for 10 minutes before cutting; top with lettuce and tomato.
']

Title: Mexican-Style Hot Chocolate

Title: Buffalo Chicken Nacho Bowl

', 'Step 2: Combine chicken and Buffalo wing sauce in a bowl.

Title: Jollyrogers' Chilaquiles
Ingredients: ['1 onion, chopped', '1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives', '½ cup white vinegar, divided', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '½ pound chorizo or bulk spicy pork sausage', '12 (7 inch) corn tortillas, cut into 1-inch pieces', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '1 ½ tablespoons all-purpose flour', '3 (8 ounce) cans tomato sauce', '1 (7.75 ounce) can Mexican style hot tomato sauce (such as El Pato Salsa de Chile Fresco®)', '1 cup water', '1 ½ teaspoons unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '1 tablespoon white vinegar', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning mix', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles, drained', '¾ cup crumbled cotija or feta cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Put chopped onion and sliced olives in separate small bowls and combine each with 1/4 cup of vinegar.
', 'Step 2: Set aside to marinate.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the chorizo, breaking it apart into crumbles as it cooks, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove the chorizo from the skillet and set aside.
', 'Step 6: Heat 1/4 cup of oil in the skillet and add the tortilla pieces, cooking and stirring over medium-low heat until just beginning to get crisp and golden at the edges, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove skillet from heat and drain the tortillas; pour 1 tablespoon of the oil into a saucepan.
', 'Step 8: Heat the saucepan over medium-low heat until hot but not smoking.
', 'Step 9: Add the flour, and cook and stir until smooth, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 10: Pour in the regular and hot tomato sauces, water, browned chorizo, cocoa powder, sugar, 1 tablespoon of vinegar, oregano, and taco seasoning.
', 'Step 11: Simmer the sauce about 5 minutes to blend the flavors.
', 'Step 12: Stir in diced chiles and tortillas.
', 'Step 13: Simmer about 10 minutes more, stirring occasionally, until tortillas have softened and the mixture is thick.
', 'Step 14: Drain the onion and olives.
', 'Step 15: Spoon a layer of tortilla mixture evenly into a 2 quart baking dish or serving dish, and follow with a layer of about 2 tablespoons marinated onion, then a layer of 2 tablespoons olives, followed by a layer of 1/4 cup cheese.
', 'Step 16: Repeat layers twice more.
', 'Step 17: Serve hot.
']

Title: Easy Green Chile Chicken Enchiladas

['Step 1: Place the chicken breasts in a slow cooker along with one can of enchilada sauce.
', 'Step 2: Cook on High until tender and no longer pink, about 3 hours.
', 'Step 3: Shred using two forks and return to the slow cooker.
', 'Step 4: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 6: Pour the remaining can of enchilada sauce into a shallow dish.
', 'Step 7: Dip tortillas in the sauce; fill each with 1/3 cup shredded chicken, a sprinkle of Mexican style cheese, and a bit of grated zucchini.
', 'Step 8: Roll up and place in the prepared baking dish, seam side down.
', 'Step 9: Top enchiladas with any leftover sauce and remaining cheese.
', 'Step 10: Cover dish and bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove cover; continue to bake until the cheese has melted, and enchiladas are hot, about 10 additional minutes.
']

Title: Green Rice III

', 'Step 4: Pour in the broth and water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Cover, reduce heat to low, and cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.

', 'Step 7: Transfer to a warm serving dish and serve immediately.
']

Title: Tortilla Chicken Vegetable Soup
Ingredients: ['1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces', '4 quarts water', '3 stalks celery, chopped', '2 cloves garlic', '1 onion, finely diced', '2 (14 ounce) cans peeled and diced tomatoes with juice', '2 cubes chicken bouillon', '1 red bell pepper, chopped', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground white pepper', '1 (10 ounce) package frozen corn kernels', '1 bunch green onions, thinly sliced', '2 bunches chopped fresh cilantro', '2 cups cooked white rice', 'salt to taste']

', 'Step 3: Reduce heat, and simmer until chicken is tender, about 45 minutes.

', 'Step 6: Smash cooked garlic cloves against side of pot.
', 'Step 7: Add undrained tomatoes, cumin, cayenne pepper, white pepper, and bouillon cube to the broth.

', 'Step 10: Simmer 10 minutes longer.
', 'Step 11: Skin and bone chicken, then dice or shred into bite-size pieces.
', 'Step 12: Add chicken to soup along with cooked rice.

Title: Green Chile Stacked Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed', '16 (6 inch) corn tortillas, or more to taste', '4 boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into chunks', '½ onion, diced', '½ cup diced mild green chiles', '1 (28 ounce) can green chile enchilada sauce', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '4 ounces shredded mozzarella cheese, or more to taste']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

', 'Step 10: Repeat layering until all ingredients are used, ending with sauce and cheese.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is golden brown, 35 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Cool until set, 5 to 10 minutes.
']

Title: Ajiaco (Beef and Pepper Stew)

Title: Chocolate Pralines, Mexican Style
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups white sugar', '½ cup packed light brown sugar', '½ cup evaporated whole milk', '3 tablespoons light corn syrup', '1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder', '4 large marshmallows', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 teaspoons butter', '2 cups chopped pecans']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 2: Stir white sugar, light brown sugar, evaporated milk, corn syrup, and cocoa powder in a saucepan and bring the mixture to a full rolling boil over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium low and cook, stirring constantly, until the syrup reaches 220 degrees F (104 degrees C) when measured with a candy thermometer.
', 'Step 4: A small amount of syrup dropped into cold water should form a soft ball that flattens when removed from the water and placed on a flat surface.
', 'Step 5: Remove pan from heat and stir in marshmallows, vanilla extract, butter, and pecans, beating the candy by hand until creamy and the candy begins to to set up slightly at the edges of the pan, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Drop the warm candy by teaspoons onto the parchment paper; allow room for pralines to spread slightly.
', 'Step 7: Cool the candy thoroughly before serving.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Chilorio
Ingredients: ['2 ½ pounds pork shoulder, trimmed and cut into 1-inch cubes', '4 oranges, juiced', '1 (14.25 ounce) can low-sodium chicken broth', '1 onion, sliced and separated into rings', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '3 dried ancho chiles (poblanos), stemmed and torn into small pieces', '2 cups boiling water', '¼ cup apple cider vinegar', '1 jalapeno, seeded and chopped', '2 garlic cloves', '2 tablespoons chopped cilantro', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine pork, orange juice, broth, onion, and oregano in the inner pot of an electric pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®).
', 'Step 2: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 3: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 20 minutes.
", 'Step 4: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 5: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes.
", 'Step 6: Unlock and remove lid.
', 'Step 7: Remove pork from the pot and drain.
', 'Step 8: Transfer to a serving dish.
', 'Step 9: Place ancho chiles in a heat-proof bowl.
', 'Step 10: Pour boiling water over chiles and soak for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Drain chiles, reserving soaking water.
', 'Step 12: Combine 1/2 cup chile soaking water, soaked ancho chiles, apple cider vinegar, jalapeno pepper, garlic, cilantro, and cumin in a blender.
', 'Step 13: Blend to form a thick sauce.
', 'Step 14: Pour sauce over pork and mix well.
']

Title: Chilaquiles Breakfast Casserole
Ingredients: ['⅔ cup rice vinegar', '2 tablespoons water', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon white sugar', '1 cup thinly sliced red onion', '1 pound mild breakfast sausage', '1 (4 ounce) can Ortega® Diced Green Chiles, drained', '2 (8 ounce) bottles Ortega® Mild Taco Sauce', '½ cup water', '2 (5.8 ounce) packages Ortega® Yellow Corn Taco Shells (about 24 taco shells total), broken into pieces', '6 large eggs', '¾ cup shredded white Cheddar cheese', '2 tomatoes, diced', '¼ cup thinly sliced radishes']

Title: Cilantro-Lime Quinoa Bowl with Blackened Tilapia
Ingredients: ['1 ½ tablespoons paprika', '½ tablespoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '2 tilapia fillets', '1 cup water', '½ cup quinoa', '⅛ teaspoon salt', '1 large lime, zested and juiced', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', 'salt to taste', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 cups chopped romaine lettuce, or to taste', '1 cup fresh spinach leaves, or to taste', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 Roma tomato, chopped', '1 avocado, chopped', '2 tablespoons roasted pepitas, or to taste', '2 wedges lime']

', 'Step 11: Cook tilapia fillets until fish flakes easily with a fork, 2 to 3 minutes per side.

', 'Step 5: Cover and cook on Low until flavors have melded, about 6 hours.
']

Title: Pie Iron Tacos

['Step 1: Cook the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring to crumble, until browned.

', 'Step 4: Place a scoop of ground beef on top of the tortilla, sprinkle with Monterey Jack cheese, and chopped onion.
', 'Step 5: Finally, place another tortilla on top, and close the pie iron.
', 'Step 6: Cook the taco over the moderate coals of a campfire until the tortillas have crisped and browned, and the taco is hot in the center.

Title: Slow Cooker Green Chile Chicken
Ingredients: ['1 bunch fresh cilantro, stems removed', '1 ½ pounds boneless chicken thighs', '4 cups water', '1 onion, quartered', '2 cloves garlic, peeled', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon salt', 'cooking spray', '1 pound fresh tomatillos, husks removed, halved', '½ jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '1 tablespoon canola oil', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '2 tablespoons white vinegar', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon honey', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 cup great Northern beans, rinsed and drained']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Remove stems from cilantro and tie together; save leaves for sauce.
', 'Step 2: Place cilantro stems, chicken thighs, water, onion, and garlic into a slow cooker.
', 'Step 3: Season with 1 tablespoon cumin, 1 tablespoon chili powder, 1 tablespoon pepper, and 1 teaspoon salt.
', 'Step 4: Cook on Low until chicken is no longer pink in the centers and juices run clear, 8 to 10 hours.
', 'Step 5: Transfer chicken to a plate and shred using 2 forks.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Reserve 1 to 1 1/2 cups cooking liquid.
', 'Step 8: Let onion and garlic cool slightly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Dice and set aside.
', 'Step 10: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray.
', 'Step 12: Place tomatillos cut-side down and jalapeno onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 13: Drizzle with canola oil.
', 'Step 14: Roast in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
', "Step 15: Remove from the oven and wrap jalapeno pepper in aluminum foil to let 'sweat' for about 10 minutes.
", 'Step 16: Remove skin from jalapeno.
', 'Step 17: Transfer tomatillos, jalapeno, reserved cilantro leaves, green chiles, vinegar, cumin, chili powder, honey, pepper, and salt to a food processor or blender.
', 'Step 18: Mix sauce until well combined.
', 'Step 19: Pour tomatillo sauce into a large pot and add shredded chicken, diced onion and garlic, and beans.
', 'Step 20: Add reserved cooking liquid.
', 'Step 21: Let simmer over medium-low heat for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Serve.
']

Title: Butternut Squash Tacos

Title: Camarones a la Mexicana
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground allspice', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 ½ pounds uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1 tablespoon salted butter, or as needed', '⅓ medium white onion, diced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '5 medium Tomatoes, red, ripe, raw', '2 cups chicken stock', '½ medium white onion, sliced', '1 large green bell pepper, seeded and sliced', '2 small jalapeno peppers, seeded and sliced', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 ½ cups uncooked white rice', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 medium lime, zested', '3 cups water', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '1 teaspoon salt', '⅓ bunch chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons salted butter, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, cumin, allspice, salt, and cayenne pepper in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add shrimp and toss to combine with the spices.
', 'Step 3: Set aside for at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 4: Meanwhile, make the sauce.
', 'Step 5: Melt butter in a pot over medium heat and cook diced onion until soft and translucent, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add garlic and cook until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
', 'Step 7: Add 3 tomatoes and cook until beginning to break down, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Pour in chicken stock and puree using an immersion blender.
', 'Step 9: Add remaining tomatoes, sliced onion, bell pepper, jalapenos, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 10: Simmer sauce on medium-low for 45 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Meanwhile, rinse rice in a mesh strainer.
', 'Step 12: Run strainer under a faucet until the water runs clear.
', 'Step 13: Shake the water off and let rice dry for 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Pour a thin layer of vegetable oil in another pot and heat over medium heat.
', 'Step 15: Add rice and lightly fry for 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Add garlic and lime zest and cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 17: Strain oil out of the rice and return to the pot.
', 'Step 18: Add water, 1 tablespoon lime juice, and salt to the pot.
', 'Step 19: Bring to a boil over medium-high heat; reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until rice has absorbed most of the liquid, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Toss with remaining lime juice and cilantro.
', 'Step 21: Melt butter in a separate pot and add shrimp.
', 'Step 22: Saute shrimp until cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 24: Scoop some rice on a plate, ladle tomato sauce over it, and top with shrimp.
', 'Step 25: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Easy Tex-Mex Chicken Tacos
Ingredients: ['4 cups water', '1 (16 ounce) package yellow rice', '5 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '1 pound boneless chicken, cut into 3/4-inch cubes', '1 (1 ounce) package chicken taco seasoning mix', '1 (16 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 (4 ounce) can sliced olives', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '12 corn tortillas', '1 tablespoon bacon grease']

['Step 1: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan; add rice and 1/4 cup olive oil.
', 'Step 2: Bring liquid back to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, cover saucepan, and simmer until rice is tender, 20 to 25 minutes.

Title: Paleo Mexican Pulled Pork
Ingredients: ['2 Anaheim chile peppers', '3 pounds boneless pork shoulder', '1 teaspoon sea salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons bacon fat', '1 cup beef broth', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '1 onion, halved and sliced', '1 red bell pepper, seeded and sliced', '1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and sliced', '1 lime, juiced', '4 cloves garlic, crushed', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '1 bay leaf', '2 ripe avocados, sliced', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '2 limes, quartered']

["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

', 'Step 10: Heat bacon fat in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 11: Add pork; cook until browned, about 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 12: Transfer pork to a slow cooker.
', 'Step 13: Pour in beef broth and coat pork with tomato paste.
', 'Step 14: Add roasted chile pepper, onion, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, lime juice, garlic, cumin, oregano, chili powder, cayenne pepper, and bay leaf.
', 'Step 15: Cook on Low until pork is tender, about 8 hours.
', 'Step 16: Shred pork using 2 forks.
', 'Step 17: Serve with avocados, cilantro, and lime wedges.
']

Title: BJ's Hot Corn Dip
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 (14 ounce) can whole yellow corn, drained', '1 (14 ounce) can whole mixed yellow and white corn, drained', '1 (14 ounce) can white shoepeg corn, drained', '2 (14 ounce) cans Mexican-style diced tomatoes and green chilies with cilantro and lime juice (such as RO*TEL®), drained', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '1 cup real mayonnaise', '1 cup sour cream', '2 tablespoons chile-garlic sauce (such as Sriracha®), or to taste', '2 (1 ounce) packages taco seasoning mix (such as Old El Paso®)', '1 lime, juiced', '½ cup chopped red onion, or to taste', '1 bunch thin green onions, chopped', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste', '1 jalapeno pepper, minced (more if you want is spicier)', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican-style cheese blend', '1 teaspoon kosher salt']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes, stir and continue baking until the dip is hot and bubbling and the top is lightly browned, 20 to 25 more minutes.
', 'Step 9: Cool for 15 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Mexican Chocolate Cupcakes
Ingredients: ['½ cup white sugar', '½ cup brown sugar', '¼ cup butter, at room temperature', '1 egg', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 ⅓ cups all-purpose flour', '⅔ cup unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '½ teaspoon instant coffee granules', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon baking soda', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 cup milk', '1 cup butter, softened', "5 cups confectioners' sugar", '2 tablespoons milk', '½ cup unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

', 'Step 15: Fit a piping bag with a coupler and tip.
', 'Step 16: Drop piping bag into a tall glass and fold edges down around the glass.

', 'Step 18: Gather edges and twist together.
', 'Step 19: Pipe frosting onto the cupcakes.

Title: Mexican Chili Soup
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons olive oil', '1 pound rump roast, cut into small cubes', '2 onions, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, crushed', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '2 bay leaves', '3 ½ cups beef stock', '½ (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers', '3 ounces tomato paste', '2 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans, drained']

Title: Sous Vide Crispy Carnitas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons kosher salt', '2 tablespoons dark brown sugar', '2 tablespoons garlic powder', '2 tablespoons paprika', '2 tablespoons onion powder', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '4 pounds boneless pork shoulder, cut into 2-inch-thick slabs', '1 onion, roughly chopped', '8 cloves fresh garlic', '1 cinnamon stick', '4 bay leaves', '1 orange, quartered', 'kosher salt to taste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '1 ½ cups chicken stock', '1 ½ cups uncooked white rice', '1 tablespoon butter', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon onion powder']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine 2 tablespoons salt, brown sugar, garlic powder, paprika, onion powder, oregano, and black pepper in a small bowl and mix well.
', 'Step 2: Place pork pieces into a large bowl.
', 'Step 3: Rub spice mixture evenly over the pork, pressing until it adheres.
', 'Step 4: Add in onion, garlic, cinnamon stick, and bay leaves.
', 'Step 5: Squeeze orange juice into the bowl with the pork and toss in the juiced orange pieces as well; toss to combine.
', 'Step 6: Place pork mixture into a sous vide-safe vacuum sealer bag.
', 'Step 7: Seal bag and immerse in a heat-proof container of water with a sous vide cooker.
', 'Step 8: Set temperature to 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) and add the ping pong balls on top.
', 'Step 9: Cook, occasionally re-adding water as it evaporates, 12 to 24 hours.
', 'Step 10: Remove pork carefully from the water bath and transfer contents into a large bowl.
', 'Step 11: Pick out the chunks of meat with tongs and transfer to a rimmed baking sheet.
', 'Step 12: Discard everything else left in the bowl.
', 'Step 13: Let pork cool briefly.
', 'Step 14: Shred using 2 forks or your fingers and spread evenly over the baking sheet.
', 'Step 15: Season with salt.
', "Step 16: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 17: Place pork under the broiler and cook, flipping halfway through, until fork-tender, about 10 minutes.
', "Step 18: Watch carefully so it doesn't burn.
", 'Step 19: Place tomatoes and green chiles in a food processor and blend until pureed.
', 'Step 20: Pour into a saucepan; add chicken stock, rice, butter, chili powder, cumin, oregano, 1/2 teaspoon salt, garlic powder, and onion powder.
', 'Step 21: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 22: Cover and reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 23: Simmer until Spanish rice is tender, about 25 minutes.
']

Title: Vegan Mexican Quinoa Bowl with Green Chile Cilantro Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 cup unsalted raw cashews', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '¼ cup hemp milk', '½ jalapeno pepper with seeds, or more to taste', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 ¼ cups chopped fresh cilantro', '3 cups water', '1 ½ cups quinoa', '2 romaine hearts, chopped', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained', '3 cups chopped red bell pepper', '½ cup chopped red onion', '2 avocados, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine cashews, green chile peppers, hemp milk, jalapeno pepper, and salt in a blender; process until smooth.
', 'Step 2: Pour cashew mixture into a small bowl; stir in 1 cup cilantro.
', 'Step 3: Bring water and quinoa to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until quinoa is tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Divide romaine lettuce among 4 bowls.
', 'Step 6: Top with quinoa, black beans, red bell pepper, and onion.
', 'Step 7: Drizzle cilantro sauce on top.
', 'Step 8: Garnish with remaining 1/4 cup cilantro and chopped avocados.
']

Title: Mango-Lime Shredded Chicken Tacos
Ingredients: ['4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '2 teaspoons canola oil', '1 large white onion, chopped', '1 large Anaheim pepper, diced', '1 jalapeno pepper, diced', '2 tablespoons minced garlic', '1 cup chicken stock', '1 (8 ounce) can peeled whole plum tomatoes', '1 (5 ounce) can tomato sauce', '¼ cup diced mango', '1 large lime, zested and juiced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon Pasilla chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoons sea salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '16 corn tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken into a large pot and cover with water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer chicken to a work surface to cool; shred.
', 'Step 4: Heat canola oil in a large pot over medium heat; cook and stir onion, Anaheim pepper, jalapeno pepper, and garlic until slightly softened and fragrant, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add shredded chicken, chicken stock, tomatoes, tomato sauce, mango, lime juice, lime zest, cilantro, chili powder, cumin, sea salt, black pepper, sugar, and cinnamon; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat to low and simmer until chicken filling is reduced, at least 45 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Fill corn tortillas with chicken filling.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '222.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '32.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '29.4 mg', 'fatContent': '4.4 g', 'fiberContent': '5.4 g', 'proteinContent': '15.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '718.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.8 g'}

Title: Hatch Chile Relleno Casserole with Ranchero Sauce
Ingredients: ['4 egg whites', '1 cup evaporated milk', '⅓ cup all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 pound Oaxaca cheese, shredded', '27 ounces canned Hatch chile peppers, sliced open', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 medium white onion, diced', '2 cloves garlic', '3 tablespoons New Mexico chile powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon cumin', '1 red bell pepper, sliced', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Place egg whites in a bowl and beat until stiff.
', 'Step 4: Gently fold in evaporated milk, flour, and salt.
', 'Step 5: Cover bottom of baking dish with 1/2 the egg white mixture.
', 'Step 6: Place chiles flat over egg whites.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle Oaxaca cheese over chiles.
', 'Step 8: Top with remaining chiles and egg white mixture.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 10: While casserole bakes, heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 11: Saute onion and garlic for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add chile powder, salt, and cumin.
', 'Step 13: Cook and stir for another minute.
', 'Step 14: Add bell peppers and cook until soft, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Add flour and stir for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Slowly add broth, stirring to avoid lumps.
', 'Step 17: Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer until casserole is ready.
', 'Step 18: Serve the sauce with slices of the chile relleno casserole.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '360.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '21.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '69.8 mg', 'fatContent': '22.1 g', 'fiberContent': '3.1 g', 'proteinContent': '20.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '12.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '1240.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '9 g'}

Title: JR's Salsa
Ingredients: ['8 roma (plum) tomatoes, seeded and diced', '6 serrano chile peppers, diced', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and diced', '½ small white onion, diced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon grated lime zest', '1 lime, juiced', 'coarse salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions: ['Step 1: Toss tomatoes, serrano peppers, jalapeno peppers, white onion, garlic, cilantro, chili powder, lime zest, and lime juice in a bowl; season with salt and black pepper.\n', 'Step 2: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate 1 hour to overnight before serving.\n']

Title: Cilantro-Chili Pepper Sauce
Ingredients: ['3 fresh red chile peppers', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pinch kosher salt', '½ cup malt vinegar', '2 tablespoons fish sauce', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '3 tablespoons soy sauce', '1 teaspoon lime juice', '1 bunch cilantro, chopped', '1 green onion, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cut the stem end off of the chile peppers, and remove the seeds using a thin knife, otherwise leaving the peppers whole.
', 'Step 2: Place the peppers into a skillet, and toast over medium-high heat, turning frequently, until the skins of the peppers have blackened and loosened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: The peppers are ready when 1/4 of the skin has blackened.
', 'Step 4: Remove the peppers, place into a small bowl, and cover with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 5: Allow to cool and steam for about 15 minutes, then remove and discard the skins.
', 'Step 6: Chop the peppers, and set aside.
', 'Step 7: Heat the sesame oil in the skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the garlic, and cook for 2 minutes to soften, then increase heat to medium-high, and stir in the chopped peppers and salt.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir until the mixture is hot and sizzling, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 10: Pour in the vinegar, brown sugar, and fish sauce.
', 'Step 11: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and allow to simmer for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Scrape the mixture into a blender, and add the soy sauce, lime juice, cilantro, and green onion.
', 'Step 13: Puree until smooth.
', 'Step 14: Serve immediately.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '48.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '7.7 g', 'fatContent': '1.8 g', 'fiberContent': '0.6 g', 'proteinContent': '1.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '672.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '5 g'}

Title: Zesty Chicken Meatloaf
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground chicken', '2 eggs', '1 ½ cups bread crumbs', '3 tablespoons salsa', '2 tablespoons Ranch-style salad dressing', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '¼ cup sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease an 8x4 inch loaf pan.
', 'Step 3: In a large bowl, mix together the ground chicken, eggs, bread crumbs, salsa, salad dressing, and taco seasoning mix.
', 'Step 4: Pack into the prepared loaf pan.
', 'Step 5: Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 6: Top with cheese, and serve with sour cream.
']

Title: Vegetarian Spinach and Mushroom Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons butter', '1 pound mushrooms, cleaned and sliced', '1 cup coarsely chopped onion', '8 ounces fresh spinach - washed, stemmed, and coarsely chopped', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (10 ounce) can Mexican-style diced tomatoes with lime and cilantro (such as Rotel®), half drained', '1 (8 ounce) package neufchatel cheese', '1 (16 ounce) container sour cream, divided', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '20 corn tortillas', '1 pound shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 (8 ounce) jar salsa, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Heat a skillet over high heat.
', 'Step 4: Add butter, mushrooms, and onion and cook until onions are translucent, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add spinach and toss until wilted, about 3 minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat and set aside.
', 'Step 8: Heat a small saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 9: Add diced tomatoes, neufchatel cheese, 8 ounces sour cream, and cumin.
', 'Step 10: Stir until thoroughly mixed, about 1 minute, and remove from heat.
', 'Step 11: Place tortillas between 2 paper towels and heat in a microwave oven until warm, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
', 'Step 12: Scoop about 2 tablespoons spinach mixture, 1 tablespoon cream mixture, and 1 to 2 tablespoons shredded Monterey Jack cheese into a tortilla.
', 'Step 13: Roll up and place seam-side down in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 14: Repeat with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 15: Spread any remaining cream mixture on top of enchiladas.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle any remaining Monterey Jack cheese on top.
', 'Step 17: Cover.
', 'Step 18: Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Garnish individual servings with remaining sour cream and salsa.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '500.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '32.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '86.6 mg', 'fatContent': '33.8 g', 'fiberContent': '5.1 g', 'proteinContent': '20.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '20.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '687.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.2 g'}

Title: Mexican Salsa II
Ingredients: ['5 roma (plum) tomatoes', '3 serrano peppers', '½ cup chopped onion', '⅔ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 clove garlic, peeled and crushed', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place roma (plum) tomatoes and serrano peppers in a medium saucepan over medium high heat with enough water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Boil 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and drain.
', 'Step 5: Place roma tomatoes, serrano peppers, onion, cilantro and garlic in a blender or food processor.
', 'Step 6: Puree about 30 seconds, or to desired consistency.
', 'Step 7: Transfer to a medium serving bowl, and salt to taste.
']

Title: Pablito's Chicken Tacos
Ingredients: ['½ cup sour cream', '½ bunch fresh sorrel, chopped', '1 lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '2 cups masa harina', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 ¾ cups water', '2 ounces butter, melted', '½ teaspoon vegetable oil', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '1 cup cubed skinless, boneless chicken breast meat', '½ bunch kale, stems removed and leaves coarsely chopped', '½ onion, sliced', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Stir sour cream, sorrel, lime juice, 1 teaspoon salt, and sugar in a bowl until well combined.
', 'Step 2: Refrigerate until ready to use.
', 'Step 3: Mix flour, masa harina, baking powder, and 2 teaspoons salt in the bowl of a stand mixer.
', 'Step 4: Gradually pour butter and water into flour mixture while mixing at lowest speed; mix until a dough just starts to come together.
', 'Step 5: Turn dough out onto a clean, flat surface and knead 3 to 4 times.
', 'Step 6: Separate dough into 1 1/2 ounce balls, cover, and let rest for 1 hour.
', 'Step 7: Press each dough ball in a tortilla press lined with parchment paper or plastic wrap; transfer each tortilla to a baking sheet.
', 'Step 8: Lightly coat a cast-iron pan with 1/2 teaspoon vegetable oil and heat over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 9: Place a tortilla in the pan and cook until lightly golden, about 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 10: Repeat with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 11: Heat 1/4 cup vegetable oil in a skillet over high heat.
', 'Step 12: Stir in chicken; cook until browned around the edges, 4 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Stir in onion, kale, 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper; reduce heat to medium-high.
', 'Step 14: Cook, stirring often, until kale is wilted, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 16: Spoon chicken-kale mixture into each tortilla, top with sorrel sour cream, and serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '536.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '68.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '47.8 mg', 'fatContent': '23.6 g', 'fiberContent': '7.1 g', 'proteinContent': '17 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '9.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '1814 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.6 g'}

Title: Mexicali Pork Chops
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '1 onion, thinly sliced', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '1 red bell pepper, chopped', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '1 cup whole kernel corn', '4 thick cut butterflied pork chops']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter or margarine in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add the onion, green bell pepper and red bell pepper and saute for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add the tomatoes and corn and saute for 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour this mixture into a 9x9 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 6: Melt the remaining butter or margarine in the same skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Add the pork chops and saute for 2 minutes per side, then place the chops in the baking dish over the vegetable mixture and cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 8: Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 12 to 15 minutes, or until internal pork temperature reaches 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '226 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '17.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '48.9 mg', 'fatContent': '12.6 g', 'fiberContent': '3.4 g', 'proteinContent': '13.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6 g', 'sodiumContent': '594.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.3 g'}

Title: Sea Bass Veracruz
Ingredients: ['2 cups Roma tomatoes, seeded and diced', '½ cup chopped pimento-stuffed olives', '½ cup cilantro', '¼ cup jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced', '3 tablespoons lime juice', '2 tablespoons capers', '¼ cup all-purpose flour', '4 (6 ounce) fillets sea bass', 'salt to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste', '6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '¼ cup chicken broth', '2 cups sliced onion', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '2 bay leaves', '1 teaspoon dried thyme']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine tomatoes, olives, cilantro, jalapeno, lime juice, and capers together in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Place flour in a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 4: Place fish on a flat work surface and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Dredge one side of each fillet in flour.
', 'Step 6: Heat oil in a large, ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 7: Add fish, flour-side down, and saute for 3 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Transfer to a plate.
', 'Step 9: Stir broth into skillet and scrape the bottom to deglaze.
', 'Step 10: Add 1/2 the tomato mixture.
', 'Step 11: Add onion, garlic, bay leaves, and thyme.
', 'Step 12: Saute 3 minutes more.
', 'Step 13: Nestle fillets into the skillet.
', 'Step 14: Place skillet in the preheated oven and roast until fish flakes easily with a fork, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Remove and discard bay leaves.
', 'Step 16: Add remaining tomato mixture to the skillet.
', 'Step 17: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 18: Serve fillets topped with tomato mixture.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '340.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '20.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '69.8 mg', 'fatContent': '13.4 g', 'fiberContent': '3.4 g', 'proteinContent': '34.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '604.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.3 g'}

Title: Turkey Cream Cheese Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons butter', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '1 yellow bell pepper, chopped', '1 orange bell pepper, chopped', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon ground chipotle chile pepper', '½ teaspoon ground ancho chile pepper', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 ½ teaspoons paprika', '1 cup sour cream', '⅓ cup heavy cream', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, cut into pieces', '5 cups shredded cooked turkey', '2 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce, or to taste', '22 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 cup vegetable oil for frying', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease 2 9x12 inch baking pans.
', 'Step 3: Heat the butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the onion and chopped green, yellow, and orange bell peppers; cook and stir until the peppers have softened and onion has turned translucent, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add the kosher salt, black pepper, chipotle pepper, ancho pepper, cumin, and paprika.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir until seasonings start to become fragrant, about 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 7: Pour in the sour cream and heavy cream, and add the cream cheese.
', 'Step 8: Stir well to combine, and cook over low heat until mixture is heated through and creamy, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove pan from heat and allow mixture to cool about 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Divide mixture, and reserve half for topping.
', 'Step 11: Combine shredded turkey with 2 1/2 cups of shredded Cheddar cheese in a large bowl.
', 'Step 12: Add in half of the cooled cream and pepper mixture, and stir lightly to mix.
', 'Step 13: Set aside.
', 'Step 14: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat until the oil is hot but not smoking, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Slide one tortilla at a time into the oil and allow to heat through, about 20 to 30 seconds, until the tortilla is hot and pliable.
', 'Step 16: Stack the warmed tortillas and cover to retain heat.
', 'Step 17: To assemble the enchiladas, place 1/4 cup of creamy turkey filling in a line down the center of each tortilla, roll the tortillas, and lay 11 enchiladas, seam sides down, into each prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 18: Top each dish with half of the reserved cream and pepper mixture.
', 'Step 19: Bake the pans in the oven for 20 to 25 minutes, until enchiladas are heated through and sauce begins to brown and bubble.
', 'Step 20: Remove the pans from the oven, sprinkle each with about 3/4 cup of shredded Cheddar cheese, and return to the oven to finish baking, about 15 more minutes, until topping is melted, browned, and bubbling.
', 'Step 21: Let stand about 10 minutes to rest before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '571.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '26.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '129.5 mg', 'fatContent': '38 g', 'fiberContent': '3.8 g', 'proteinContent': '32 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '19.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '717 mg', 'sugarContent': '2 g'}

Title: Scrambled Eggs, Cheese, and Avocado Tortilla Bowl
Ingredients: ['1 (10 inch) soft flour tortilla', '2 eggs', '½ teaspoon milk', '½ teaspoon butter', '¼ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend, or more to taste', '½ avocado - peeled, pitted, and diced', '¼ cup salsa, or to taste', '1 pinch paprika, or to taste', '1 pinch sea salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Press tortilla into a tortilla shell mold or oven-proof bowl.
', 'Step 3: Whisk eggs, milk, and butter together in a microwave-safe bowl.
', 'Step 4: Stir in Mexican cheese blend.
', 'Step 5: Bake tortilla in the preheated oven until crispy and brown, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Cool slightly before transferring from mold to serving dish, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Cook egg mixture in the microwave until set, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
', 'Step 8: Remove egg mixture from the microwave and stir gently with a fork.
', 'Step 9: Cook in the microwave until fully set, about 30 seconds more.
', 'Step 10: Place cooked eggs in tortilla bowl; top with avocado, salsa, paprika, and salt.
']

Title: Shrimp and Jalapeno Nachos
Ingredients: ['½ cup sour cream', '½ avocado, peeled and pitted', '½ lemon, juiced', '1 pound small Gulf shrimp (50 to 60 per pound), thawed and drained', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '¼ teaspoon ground dried chipotle pepper', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '50 large (restaurant-style) tortilla chips, or as needed', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and very thinly sliced', '3 ½ cups shredded pepperjack cheese, or as needed', '15 cherry tomatoes, sliced - or as needed', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine sour cream, avocado, and lemon juice in a blender or food processor; blend until smooth and creamy.
', 'Step 2: Transfer into a plastic decorating bottle with a long tip.
', 'Step 3: Refrigerate avocado-cream sauce until needed.
', 'Step 4: Place shrimp into a bowl; combine with vegetable oil, ground chipotle pepper, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 5: Place a large nonstick pan over high heat.
', 'Step 6: Cook shrimp in the hot pan in a single layer until barely cooked through and pink, about 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 7: Transfer to a plate and let shrimp cool.
', "Step 8: Preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 9: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and lightly grease the foil.
', 'Step 10: Lay tortilla chips onto the prepared baking sheet in a single layer.
', 'Step 11: Place 1 shrimp onto each chip.
', 'Step 12: Add 1 slice jalapeno and 1 large pinch pepperjack cheese on top of each shrimp.
', 'Step 13: Broil under preheated broiler until cheese is melted and chips are lightly toasted, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 14: Watch carefully; chips will burn quickly.
', 'Step 15: Remove nachos from baking sheet and arrange onto a serving platter; drizzle with avocado-cream sauce and sprinkle with cherry tomatoes and cilantro before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '208.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '6.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '82.4 mg', 'fatContent': '14.9 g', 'fiberContent': '1 g', 'proteinContent': '12.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7 g', 'sodiumContent': '277.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.2 g'}

Title: Fantastic Chicken Burgers
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground chicken', '½ (1 ounce) package guacamole seasoning mix', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '½ lime, juiced', '¼ cup minced onion', '8 slices ciabatta bread', '¼ cup prepared salsa, divided', '4 slices Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: In a bowl, mix together the ground chicken, guacamole seasoning, half the cilantro, lime juice, and minced onion until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 3: Form the chicken mixture into 4 patties.
', 'Step 4: Reserve the other half of the cilantro for garnish.
', 'Step 5: Grill the chicken burgers on the preheated grill until the meat is no longer pink inside, the juices run clear, and the burgers show browned grill marks, 5 to 8 minutes per side.
', 'Step 6: About 2 minutes before burgers are done, place slices of ciabatta bread onto the grill to toast, about 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 7: About 1 minute before the burgers are done, top each burger with a slice of Cheddar cheese, and let melt.
', 'Step 8: Serve chicken burgers on the toasted ciabatta bread, topped with about 1 tablespoon of salsa and about 1 tablespoon of the reserved chopped cilantro.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '576.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '60.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '98.9 mg', 'fatContent': '17 g', 'fiberContent': '3.7 g', 'proteinContent': '43 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '1293.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.1 g'}

Title: Chipotle Cream Chicken
Ingredients: ['¼ cup all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into bite-size pieces', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ cup diced onion', '½ cup chopped green bell pepper', '1 tablespoon butter', '¾ cup low-sodium chicken broth', '2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '½ cup sour cream', '¼ cup chopped cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the flour, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper into a large plastic bag.
', 'Step 2: Close the bag and shake a few times to mix the seasonings, and drop in the chicken pieces, a few at a time.
', 'Step 3: Shake the bag to coat the chicken with seasoned flour.
', 'Step 4: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat, and cook and stir the onion and green pepper in the oil until the onion is translucent, about 6 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in butter, and allow to melt.
', 'Step 6: Add the seasoned chicken to the skillet, and cook and stir until the chicken pieces are browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Increase heat to medium-high, and pour in chicken broth; stir in the chipotle peppers with adobo sauce.
', 'Step 8: Bring to a boil, and reduce the chicken broth by half, stirring often, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from heat, stir in the sour cream to make a smooth sauce, and sprinkle with cilantro to serve.
']

Title: Roasted Salsa
Ingredients: ['olive oil cooking spray', '7 roma tomatoes, halved and cored, or more to taste', '2 Anaheim chile peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded', '2 jalapeno peppers', '1 poblano chile pepper, halved lengthwise and seeded', '2 onions, quartered', '2 garlic cloves, peeled', '1 lime, juiced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or more to taste', '2 tablespoons cider vinegar, or more to taste', '¾ teaspoon dried oregano, or more to taste', '¾ teaspoon ground cumin, or more to taste', '¾ teaspoon kosher salt, or more to taste', '¾ teaspoon ground black pepper, or more to taste', '½ teaspoon celery salt, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a roasting pan or baking sheet with aluminum foil and coat with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Arrange tomatoes, cut-side down, in the roasting pan; add Anaheim chile peppers, jalapeno peppers, and poblano peppers, all skin-side up.
', 'Step 4: Add onions and garlic to roasting pan.
', 'Step 5: Spray the vegetable mixture with cooking spray.
', 'Step 6: Roast in the preheated oven until tomato and chile pepper skins are blistered and charred, 40 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from oven and cool for 10 to 15 minutes, keeping skins on tomatoes and chile peppers.
', 'Step 8: Blend tomato-chile pepper mixture, lime juice, cilantro, cider vinegar, oregano, cumin, kosher salt, black pepper, and celery salt in a food processor using quick pulses until desired consistency is reached.
', 'Step 9: Refrigerate salsa in an air-tight container.
']
