Title: Melt-in-Your-Mouth Beef Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 flank steak', '¼ cup shichimi togarashi', '¼ cup orange juice', '¼ cup low-sodium soy sauce', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '½ orange, zested', '½ lime, zested', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '1 tablespoon chili powder, or more to taste', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon brown sugar', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, cut into slices and separated', '1 red bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '¾ cup water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Flatten flank steak slightly with a meat mallet.
', 'Step 2: Rub shichimi togarashi into both sides of steak, wrap the steak in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight.
', 'Step 3: Combine orange juice, soy sauce, lime juice, orange zest, and lime zest together in a resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 4: Remove flank steak from plastic wrap and place the steak in the resealable plastic bag, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag.
', 'Step 5: Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
', 'Step 6: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 7: Remove steak from marinade and pour marinade into a small bowl.
', 'Step 8: Cook steak on the preheated grill, basting with the marinade every 5 minutes, until it starts to firm and is seared on the outside and reddish-pink and juicy in the center, 8 to 10 minutes per side.
', 'Step 9: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 135 degrees F (57 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Cut steak in half lengthwise and cut across the grain into thin slices.
', 'Step 11: Whisk cornstarch, chili powder, salt, paprika, brown sugar, cayenne pepper, red pepper flakes, onion powder, garlic powder, and ground cumin together in a bowl.
', 'Step 12: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 13: Saute onion and red bell pepper in hot oil until soft, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Add sliced steak, chili powder mixture, and water to the skillet.
', 'Step 15: Cook until sauce thickens and meat is glossy, 3 to 5 minutes.
']

Title: Slow-Cooker Barbacoa
Ingredients: ['⅓ cup apple cider vinegar', '3 tablespoons lime juice', '4 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '4 teaspoons minced garlic', '4 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground cloves', '1 (4 pound) chuck roast', '¾ cup chicken broth', '3 bay leaves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine vinegar, lime juice, chipotle peppers, garlic, cumin, oregano, black pepper, salt, and cloves in a blender or food processor.
', 'Step 2: Blend the sauce well.
', 'Step 3: Place meat in a slow cooker and pour sauce on top.
', 'Step 4: Add broth and bay leaves.
', 'Step 5: Cover and cook on High for 4 to 6 hours without removing the lid.
']

Title: Taqueria-Style Spicy Pickled Carrots
Ingredients: ['1 cup white vinegar', '1 cup water', '1 teaspoon coarse sea salt', '¾ pound carrots', '1 small yellow onion', '6 medium fresh jalapenos', '2 cloves garlic', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 large bay leaves', '1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns', '1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk vinegar, water, and sea salt together in a small saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a low boil over medium-high heat, reduce heat, and simmer until salt is completely dissolved, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Set aside.
', 'Step 4: Peel carrots and cut them into 1/2-inch diagonal slices.
', 'Step 5: Cut onion into quarters.
', 'Step 6: Cut each quarter into 3 strips.
', 'Step 7: Cut stems off jalapenos and cut each jalapeno into 6 strips.
', 'Step 8: Slightly crush each garlic clove.
', 'Step 9: Warm oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat, add carrots, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 6 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add bay leaves, peppercorns, oregano, and cumin seeds.
', 'Step 11: Cook and stir for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add onion, jalapenos, and garlic.
', 'Step 13: Cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender and fragrant but not soft, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Place vegetables in a 24-ounce wide-mouth canning jar.
', 'Step 15: Pour in the cooled vinegar mixture until liquid reaches 1 inch from the top.
', 'Step 16: Pour olive oil on top and secure the lid.
', 'Step 17: Allow to cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 18: The carrots are ready to serve after 1 hour but best after sitting for 24 hours.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '64.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '8.2 g', 'fatContent': '3.4 g', 'fiberContent': '2.4 g', 'proteinContent': '1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '335.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.7 g'}

Title: Vegetarian Taco-Stuffed Peppers
Ingredients: ['1 medium red bell pepper', '1 medium yellow bell pepper', '1 medium orange bell pepper', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 (12 ounce) package Impossible Burger', '1 small onion, minced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (1 ounce) envelope taco seasoning mix', '1 (14.5 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican blend cheese, divided', '¼ cup minced fresh cilantro', '¾ cup sour cream', '¾ cup prepared guacamole']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cut bell peppers in half vertically through the stem and remove the seeds.
', 'Step 3: Place cut-sides down in a baking dish to allow excess moisture to drain.
', 'Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from the oven, flip peppers over, cut-sides up, and set aside.
', 'Step 6: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 7: Cook meatless ground beef and onion in the hot pan, breaking up any large pieces, until browned, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add garlic and stir until cooked through, about 2 minutes more.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle with taco seasoning and stir in diced tomatoes until combined.
', 'Step 10: Stir in 3/4 cup Mexican cheese.
', 'Step 11: Stuff peppers with mixture and cover dish with foil.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until peppers are tender, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove foil and top peppers with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 14: Return to the oven and bake until cheese is melted, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Sprinkle with cilantro and serve each pepper with a dollop of sour cream and guacamole.
']

Title: Quesadillas de Flor de Calabaza (Zucchini Blossom Quesadillas)
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon bacon drippings', '2 corn tortillas', '2 slices Manchego cheese', '6 zucchini blossoms']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt bacon grease in a cast iron skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Place tortillas in the skillet.
', 'Step 3: Top each tortilla with 1 slice of Manchego cheese and 3 zucchini blossoms.
', 'Step 4: Fold tortillas in half.
', 'Step 5: Cook until tortillas are lightly browned and cheese starts to melt, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Turn and cook until the other side is crispy, lightly browned, and the cheese has melted, 1 more minute.
']

Title: Grandma's Gorditas
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ cups instant corn masa flour (such as Maseca®)', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '1 pinch salt', '½ cup water, or as needed', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine corn masa flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add a little water at a time until a firm dough forms.
', 'Step 3: Divide dough into equal pieces and roll between your hands to form small balls.
', 'Step 4: Press dough into 1/4-inch circles.
', 'Step 5: Heat a griddle or comal over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Add dough circles to the hot griddle and cook until light brown, slightly inflated, and cooked on the outsides, about 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 7: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Pan-fry gorditas in batches, if necessary, until golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 9: Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
']

Title: Squash and Zucchini Burritos
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '½ onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, pressed', '2 zucchini, shredded', '1 large yellow squash, shredded', '½ red bell pepper, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 cup green salsa', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '1 (8 ounce) package Mexican style shredded cheese blend, divided', '6 burrito-size flour tortillas', '1 (8 ounce) package Mexican style shredded cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9x12-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat, and cook the onion and garlic until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the zucchini, yellow squash, and red bell pepper.
', 'Step 5: Cook, stirring frequently, until the zucchini and squash are tender, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in the black beans, green salsa, cumin, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 7: Cook and stir the filling until it thickens, 5 to 8 more minutes.
', 'Step 8: Divide one of the packages of Mexican-style cheese among the tortillas.
', 'Step 9: Spoon zucchini-squash filling into each tortilla, over the cheese, in a line down the center.
', 'Step 10: Roll up the tortillas, and place them into the prepared baking dish with the seam sides down.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and the tortillas are heated through, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Sprinkle the other package of shredded cheese over the tortillas before serving.
']

Title: Vegan Spicy Cashew Crema
Ingredients: ['1 cup raw cashews', 'filtered water as needed', '½ cup water', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar', '½ teaspoon garlic salt', '¼ teaspoon ground red chile pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground paprika', '¼ cup water']

Title: Mexican-Style Pinto Beans
Ingredients: ['1 pound dried pinto beans, rinsed', 'water to cover', '1 (32 ounce) container whole peeled tomatoes with juice', '1 red onion, chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, chopped', '1 tablespoon chili powder, or to taste', '1 tablespoon ground cumin, or to taste', '1 ½ teaspoons garlic powder, or to taste', '½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']

Title: Taco Nachos
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '¾ cup water', '¾ pound processed cheese, cubed', '1 tablespoon milk', '1 (12 ounce) package tortilla chips', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '½ cup chopped fresh tomato', '⅓ cup chopped green onions']

', 'Step 2: Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown.
', 'Step 3: Drain and mix in taco seasoning mix and water.
', 'Step 4: Continue cooking 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 6: Place processed cheese and milk in a small, microwave safe bowl.
', 'Step 7: Microwave on high until melted, 1 to 2 minutes.

', 'Step 11: Top with beef and cheese and mixtures.

', 'Step 14: Serve warm.
']

Title: Corn Truffle (Huitlacoche) Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '½ onion, chopped', '1 garlic clove, minced', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped', '5 fresh epazote leaves', '1 pound fresh corn truffles (huitlacoche)', 'sea salt to taste', '10 (6 inch) yellow corn tortillas', '1 pound Oaxaca cheese, separated into strings']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat; stir in onion, garlic, jalapeno pepper, and epazote and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Stir corn truffles into onion mixture; cook and stir until truffle liquid has evaporated, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Season with salt and keep warm.
', 'Step 4: Heat a large griddle or skillet over medium heat until hot.
', 'Step 5: Moisten both sides of two tortillas with water and place them, stacked together, onto the hot griddle; cook until the bottom tortilla is crisp, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Flip the stacked tortillas and cook the other tortilla until crisp, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Separate the two tortillas; place them separately, uncooked side down, onto the hot griddle.
', 'Step 8: Cover the crisp side of one tortilla with 1/5 of the Oaxaca cheese; place 1/5 of the corn truffle mixture over the cheese, then lay the crisp side of the second tortilla on top to cover the truffle mix.
', 'Step 9: Cook, turning once, until both tortillas are crisp and cheese is melted, about 3 minutes; repeat with remaining tortillas, cheese, and corn truffle mixture.
', 'Step 10: Cut each quesadilla into four wedges to serve.
']

Title: Pinto Bean and Chicken Casserole
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 (15.5 ounce) cans pinto beans, drained', '1 ½ cups chopped, cooked chicken', '1 (11 ounce) can Mexican-style corn (such as Green Giant®), drained', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®), undrained', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 teaspoon dried minced onion', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon salt', 'ground black pepper to taste', '1 ½ cups corn chips (such as Fritos®)', '2 cups shredded Colby-Jack cheese']

Title: Chuck Roast Chili
Ingredients: ['1 (2 pound) chuck roast, or more to taste', '2 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar', '1 large onion, diced', '2 green bell peppers, diced', '2 cups chicken stock', '1 cup water', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans', '1 (15 ounce) can light red kidney beans', '1 (15 ounce) can dark red kidney beans', '3 tablespoons brown sugar', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 tablespoon barbecue sauce', '1 tablespoon ketchup', '2 teaspoons minced garlic', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ tablespoon hot sauce (such as Valentina®)', '2 teaspoons mustard', '2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Remove fat and ligaments from chuck roast and cut into 1/2-inch cubes.
', 'Step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add cubed roast.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir until browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 6: Transfer meat to a bowl and set aside.
', 'Step 7: Return pot to medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add remaining oil and vinegar, scraping up any bits at the bottom of the pot.
', 'Step 9: Add onion and bell peppers and cook until onion is translucent, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add stock and water.
', 'Step 11: Add diced tomatoes, light kidney beans, dark kidney beans, brown sugar, tomato paste, chili powder, barbecue sauce, ketchup, garlic, cumin, hot sauce, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and salt.
', 'Step 12: Bring chili to a simmer, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Cover pot and simmer 2 to 4 hours.
']

Title: Chicken Fajita and Cilantro-Lime Cauliflower Rice Bowls
Ingredients: ['⅝ cup finely chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '¼ cup orange juice', '¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil, divided', '1 ½ medium limes, juiced, divided', '¼ teaspoon ground chipotle chile, or to taste', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground coriander', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast', '1 medium red pepper, cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices', '1 medium green bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch slices', '1 medium onion, cut into 1-inch pieces', '1 teaspoon olive oil', '1 pound frozen riced cauliflower', '2 tablespoons water', '1 tablespoon melted ghee', '1 teaspoon lime zest', '¼ cup fresh tomato salsa, sugar and preservative free, or as needed', '¼ cup guacamole, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine 1/8 cup chopped cilantro, orange juice, 1/8 cup olive oil, juice of 1/2 lime, chipotle chili powder, cumin, coriander, garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper in a resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 2: Gently squeeze the bag several times to combine the ingredients.
', 'Step 3: Cut chicken into 1-inch slices, cutting across the chicken breast, and add to the marinade.
', 'Step 4: Carefully squeeze out most of the air, seal the bag, and move chicken pieces around in the marinade to coat.
', 'Step 5: Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, or up to 1 hour.
', 'Step 6: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Combine red bell pepper slices, green bell pepper slices, and onion pieces in a large bowl.
', 'Step 8: Add remaining 1/8 cup olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
', 'Step 9: Stir until all the vegetable pieces are coated in oil and seasonings.
', 'Step 10: Line a 12 x 18-inch sheet pan with foil or parchment paper and spread chicken slices and vegetables out on the pan in a single layer.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until the chicken is done and the vegetables are lightly charred, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Near the end of the baking time, prepare the cauliflower rice.
', 'Step 13: Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 14: Add cauliflower rice and water.
', 'Step 15: Cook, stirring frequently, until cauliflower is softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Drain cauliflower rice and place in a serving bowl.
', 'Step 17: Stir in melted ghee, reserved 1/2 cup chopped cilantro, juice of 1 lime, and lime zest.
', 'Step 18: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 19: Assemble bowls by making a layer of cilantro-lime cauliflower rice, and a layer of fajita chicken and vegetables.
', 'Step 20: Top with tomato salsa and guacamole.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '269 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '18.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '13.9 mg', 'fatContent': '20.5 g', 'fiberContent': '6.2 g', 'proteinContent': '6.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '138.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.5 g'}

Title: Melissa's Green Chile Stew
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 pound ground beef', '5 medium potatoes - peeled and cubed', '1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes', '1 cup chopped green chile peppers', '½ cup chopped onion', '2 cups water', 'salt and pepper to taste']

', 'Step 2: Crumble beef into pot and cook, stirring frequently, until well-browned.

', 'Step 6: Season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve.
']

Title: Strawberry Beer Margaritas

', 'Step 2: Pour tequila over strawberries.

Title: Sweet Mexican Corn Cake
Ingredients: ['2 cups all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 ¼ cups unsalted butter, softened', '1 cup white sugar', '8 eggs', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk', '4 cups fresh corn kernels']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease and flour a 10x15-inch baking pan.
', 'Step 3: Sift the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt together into a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Set aside.
', 'Step 5: Beat the butter and sugar together with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy.
', 'Step 6: Blend the eggs into the mixture one at a time.
', 'Step 7: Stir the condensed milk and evaporated milk into the mixture.
', 'Step 8: Add the flour mixture and mix until just incorporated.
', 'Step 9: Fold the corn kernels into the batter, mixing just enough to evenly combine.
', 'Step 10: Pour the batter into prepared pan.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.
']

Title: Mexican Lasagna Rollups
Ingredients: ['10 uncooked lasagna noodles', '1 (16 ounce) jar salsa', '1 pound ground beef', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '1 (16 ounce) package cottage cheese', '½ cup grated Parmesan cheese', '1 (15.5 ounce) jar prepared salsa con queso sauce', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil.
', 'Step 2: Once the water is boiling, stir in the lasagna noodles, about 3 or 4 at a time, and return to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Cook the noodles uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pasta has cooked through but is still firm to the bite, about 10 minutes per batch.
', 'Step 4: Drain well in a colander set in the sink, and lay the cooked noodles flat on waxed paper or aluminum foil while you finish cooking the rest of the noodles.
', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish, and spread the salsa evenly over the bottom of the dish.
', 'Step 7: Place the ground beef in a skillet over medium heat, sprinkle with taco seasoning, and cook and stir the meat, breaking it up as it cooks, until the meat is browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Drain the fat, and place the meat in a large bowl.
', 'Step 9: Mix cottage cheese and Parmesan cheese into the meat.
', 'Step 10: Place a cooked lasagna noodle out flat, and spread about 1/3 cup of the cheese and meat mixture along the length of the noodle.
', 'Step 11: Roll up the noodle, and place the filled rolls, seam sides down, into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 12: Spoon about 1 1/2 tablespoons of the queso sauce over each roll.
', 'Step 13: Cover the dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until the sauce is hot and bubbling, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Uncover the dish, and spread the Mexican cheese blend over the rolls.
', 'Step 16: Return to the oven, and bake until the cheese is melted, 8 to 10 more minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '395.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '30.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '61.3 mg', 'fatContent': '20.5 g', 'fiberContent': '2.2 g', 'proteinContent': '24.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '10.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '1258.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.1 g'}

Title: Flan I
Ingredients: ['8 eggs', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract', '1 ½ cups white sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Have ready 9 inch round cake pan.
', 'Step 3: In blender or food processor, or using electric mixer, combine eggs, condensed milk and vanilla and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 4: In medium sauce pan, cook sugar, stirring constantly, until it liquefies.
', 'Step 5: When it starts to turn light brown, remove from heat and pour into waiting pan.
', 'Step 6: Pour egg mixture over liquid sugar.
', 'Step 7: Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel.
', 'Step 8: Place baking dish on towel, inside roasting pan, and place roasting pan on oven rack.
', 'Step 9: Fill roasting pan with water to reach halfway up the sides of the baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Bake 70 minutes in the preheated oven, or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
', 'Step 11: Remove pan from water bath and let cool completely, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 12: Run a knife along the edge of the pan, place a serving plate on top and invert.
', 'Step 13: Serve.
']

Title: Sweet Pineapple Tamales
Ingredients: ['corn husks', '2 pounds fresh corn masa dough', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '2 tablespoons warm water, or as needed', '1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature', '1 cup vegetable shortening, at room temperature', '1 cup white sugar', '1 (20 ounce) can pineapple, drained and finely chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place corn husks in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and soak for 30 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain, place on a work surface, and cover with a clean, damp towel.
', 'Step 3: While corn husks are soaking, combine masa dough, baking soda, and water in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Knead until dough has a smooth and even consistency, adding more water, 1 teaspoon at a time, as needed.
', 'Step 5: Take care not to add too much water.
', 'Step 6: Beat butter, vegetable shortening, and sugar together in a second bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy.
', 'Step 7: Slowly add masa dough and knead until mixture has a uniform consistency.
', 'Step 8: Mix in chopped pineapple.
', 'Step 9: Spread about 1 tablespoon masa mixture onto a corn husk.
', 'Step 10: Fold the bottom of the husk over the filling, then fold sides of husk together, one over the other.
', 'Step 11: Finally fold the top of the husk into the tamale, making a little package.
', 'Step 12: Repeat with remaining husks.
', 'Step 13: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 14: Bring water to a boil, then reduce heat to medium low.
', 'Step 15: Add tamales with the open side up and cook covered until filling is heated through and separates from the husk, about 1 hour.
']

', 'Step 4: Cook on Medium-Low, 4 to 6 hours.
', 'Step 5: Season with salt and black pepper.
']

Title: Sloppy Joe Sandwich Filling
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '¼ cup minced onion', '¼ cup chopped poblano chile pepper', '8 ounces extra-lean ground beef', '4 ounces chorizo sausage', '1 ½ tablespoons red enchilada dry seasoning (such as Savory Spice Shop® Canyon Road)', '1 tablespoon tomato powder (such as Savory Spice Shop®)', '½ cup water', '⅓ cup ketchup', '2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce', '1 avocado, sliced', '½ cup shredded Oaxaca cheese, or to taste', '4 hamburger bun, split and toasted']

', 'Step 2: Cook onion and poblano pepper until softened, about 5 minutes.

', 'Step 5: Cook, stirring often to break up meat, until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add enchilada seasoning and tomato powder.
', 'Step 7: Add water, ketchup, and Worcestershire sauce.
', 'Step 8: Return cooked onion mixture to the skillet.

', 'Step 10: Serve meat mixture on toasted buns topped with Oaxaca cheese and avocado.
']

Title: Not-So-Corny Tamale Pie
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons vegetable oil, or as needed', '1 small onion, chopped', '1 ½ pounds ground beef', '1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '½ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®)', '2 (8.5 ounce) packages corn bread mix (such as Jiffy®)', '⅔ cup milk', '2 eggs']

Title: Fresas con Crema
Ingredients: ['1 pint fresh strawberries', '¾ cup sweetened condensed milk, divided', '4 ounces cold heavy cream', '2 cups granola, large chunks crumbled', '½ cup whipped cream (such as Reddi Wip®)']

', 'Step 2: Mix 1/2 can condensed milk and heavy cream with an electric mixer until thickened.
', 'Step 3: Dip a fork into the remaining condensed milk and drizzle it on the inside of serving glasses or cups.
', 'Step 4: Spoon some thickened cream mixture into each cup, then top with some strawberries and granola.
', 'Step 5: Repeat the layer process until glasses are full, leaving some granola leftover.

', 'Step 7: Serve immediately.

Title: Mexican-Style Spaghetti and Meatballs
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground turkey', '1 ½ teaspoons Mexican-style chili Powder', '1 teaspoon guajillo chile powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese', '1 egg', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ onion, finely chopped', '1 small jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '½ Anaheim (New Mexico) chile pepper, seeded and minced', '2 tostada shells, crushed into fine crumbs', '¼ cup bread crumbs', '1 (16 ounce) package spaghetti', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '½ onion, diced', '1 chipotle chile in adobo sauce, finely chopped', '1 (24 ounce) jar spaghetti sauce', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning mix']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place a sheet of aluminum foil onto a baking sheet, and lightly grease with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Place the ground turkey into a large mixing bowl and sprinkle with the Mexican chili powder, guajillo chile powder, salt, black pepper, and Parmesan cheese.
', 'Step 4: Add the egg, olive oil, chopped onion, jalapeno pepper, and Anaheim pepper.
', 'Step 5: Mix well with your hands until evenly blended, then sprinkle with the tostada crumbs and bread crumbs.
', 'Step 6: Mix again until the bread crumbs are incorporated.
', 'Step 7: Form the meatball mixture into 1-inch balls and place onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until the meatballs have lightly browned and are no longer pink in the center, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Turn the meatballs over after 20 minutes to ensure even cooking.
', 'Step 10: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat.
', 'Step 11: Once the water is boiling, stir in the spaghetti and return to a boil.
', 'Step 12: Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pasta has cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, about 12 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Drain well in a colander set in the sink.
', 'Step 14: After you have flipped the meatballs, stir together the diced tomatoes, diced onion, chipotle chile, spaghetti sauce, and taco seasoning in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 15: Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer 10 to 15 minutes until the onion is tender.
', 'Step 16: Once the meatballs are ready, stir them into the sauce, and cook 5 minutes longer.
', 'Step 17: Spoon the meatballs and sauce over the spaghetti to serve.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Caldillo

"]

Title: Rice Flour Mexican Chocolate Cupcakes (Gluten Free)
Ingredients: ['½ cup unsalted butter, softened', '½ cup white sugar', '2 eggs', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '1 ½ cups rice flour', '¼ cup dark cocoa powder', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon baking soda', '¼ cup milk']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners.
', 'Step 3: Beat butter and sugar together in the bowl of a stand mixer or using an electric hand mixer on high speed until creamy and fluffy.
', 'Step 4: Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
', 'Step 5: Add vanilla extract and mix well.
', 'Step 6: Mix rice flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, and baking soda into creamed butter mixture and mix on low speed until flour is moistened; increase speed to medium and mix until there are no longer lumps.
', 'Step 7: Reduce mixer speed to low and add milk; mix until batter is well blended.
', 'Step 8: Fill each prepared muffin cup with about 3 tablespoons batter.

Title: Green Chili Chicken Burgers
Ingredients: ['1 avocado, peeled and pitted', '½ cup fresh cilantro leaves', '2 tablespoons reduced-fat sour cream', '½ teaspoon chili powder', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 pound ground chicken breast', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers, drained', '1 fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded if desired and finely diced', '3 green onions, finely chopped', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', 'ground black pepper to taste', '4 slices Cheddar cheese', '4 hamburger buns, split', '1 cup shredded lettuce', '⅓ cup salsa']

', 'Step 5: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Lightly oil the grill grate.

', 'Step 8: Move the patties to a cooler area of the grill to keep warm, and top each patty with a slice of Cheddar cheese.

Title: Mexican Enchilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 ½ cups canned tomato sauce', '⅓ cup chili powder (such as Gebhardt®)', '½ cup water, or as needed', '1 ½ pounds ground turkey', '1 ½ cups chopped onion', '2 (1 ounce) packages taco seasoning mix, divided', '⅔ cup water', '16 (5 inch) corn tortillas, cut in half', '3 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese', '3 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 ½ (10 ounce) bags shredded iceberg lettuce', '2 cups chopped fresh tomatoes']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 3-quart casserole dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Combine tomato sauce with chili powder and 1/2 cup water or as desired in a small saucepan over medium heat; bring to a simmer and stir to make a pourable sauce.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and set enchilada sauce aside.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir ground turkey, onion, and 1 envelope of taco seasoning mix in a large skillet over medium heat, chopping turkey as you cook, until meat is crumbly and no longer pink, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in 2/3 cup water and remaining envelope of taco seasoning mix and cook, stirring often, until moisture has evaporated from turkey mixture.
', 'Step 7: Mix 1 cup of enchilada sauce into turkey mixture and remove skillet from heat.
', 'Step 8: To layer the casserole, spread 8 tortilla halves into the bottom of the prepared baking dish, overlapping as necessary to fit.
', 'Step 9: Toss sharp Cheddar cheese and Monterey Jack cheese together in a bowl and spread 1/4 of the cheese mixture over the tortillas in an even layer.
', 'Step 10: Top with 1/3 the turkey mixture, 1/3 the lettuce, 1/3 the chopped tomatoes, and about 1/3 cup of the remaining sauce.
', 'Step 11: Repeat layers twice more.
', 'Step 12: Place 8 tortilla halves on top of the casserole and spread with remaining 1 1/4 cup shredded cheese mixture.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese on top of casserole is melted and browned, 20 to 30 minutes.
']

Title: Mexican Mostaccioli
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package mostaccioli pasta', '1 pound ground beef', '1 (24 ounce) jar picante sauce', '1 (15 ounce) can stewed tomatoes with juice', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican-style cheese']

['Step 1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Cook mostaccioli at a boil until cooked through yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes; drain.

', 'Step 7: Add Mexican-style cheese; cook and stir until the cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
']

Title: Anaheim Fish Tacos

Title: Bean Tamales (Tameles de Frijoles)
Ingredients: ['dried corn husks', '6 dried ancho chile peppers, seeded', '3 cloves garlic', '1 pinch ground cumin', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon water, or as needed', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 (17 ounce) can refried beans', '1 cup lard', '2 pounds fresh corn masa dough', '1 (4 ounce) can canned jalapenos, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place corn husks in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and soak for a few hours.
', 'Step 2: Drain, place on a work surface, and cover with a clean, damp towel.
', 'Step 3: Place ancho chiles in a saucepan and cover with water.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook until soft, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain.
', 'Step 6: Combine ancho chiles, garlic, cumin, salt, pepper, and a little water in a blender; blend salsa until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Strain through a sieve.
', 'Step 8: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 9: Add 1/2 the salsa and cook, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add refried beans, stir well, and cook until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Set aside.
', 'Step 12: Beat lard with an electric mixer until fluffy.
', 'Step 13: Add masa and beat until well combined.
', 'Step 14: Add remaining salsa and continue beating until dough has a uniform red color.
', 'Step 15: Select 1 wide corn husk.
', 'Step 16: Spread about 2 tablespoons masa mixture onto the the corn husk, filling it up to 2 inches from the bottom and 1/4 inch from the top.
', 'Step 17: Place 1 tablespoon of beans and 1 jalapeno slice in the center of the masa mixture.
', 'Step 18: Fold sides of husk together, one over the other.
', 'Step 19: Fold the bottom of the husk over the seam of the 2 folded sides.
', 'Step 20: Repeat with remaining husks.
', 'Step 21: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 22: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 23: Add tamales with the open side up and cook until filling is heated through and separates from the husk, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 24: Let tamales rest for 15 minutes before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '164.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '16.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '9.7 mg', 'fatContent': '10.1 g', 'fiberContent': '2.8 g', 'proteinContent': '2.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '191.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.3 g'}

Title: Ali's Green Sauce
Ingredients: ['3 avocados, peeled and pitted', '3 green tomatoes', '4 fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '3 cloves garlic, peeled', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and halved', '5 sprigs fresh cilantro', '1 ½ cups sour cream', 'salt to taste']

['Step 1: Place tomatoes, tomatillos, garlic, and jalapenos in a saucepan, and add enough water to cover.

', 'Step 5: Season to taste with salt.
', 'Step 6: Cover, and refrigerate until ready to serve.
']

Title: Sweet Tamales with Pineapple and Coconut

Title: Christopholofigus's Infamous Jalapeno Relish

Title: Citrus-Braised Pork
Ingredients: ['2 cups orange juice', '1 yellow onion, sliced', '½ cup freshly squeezed lime juice', '½ cup extra-virgin olive oil', '10 cloves garlic, smashed', '2 tablespoons dark brown sugar', '1 ½ tablespoons kosher salt', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoons freshly grated lime zest', '2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', '2 dried bay leaves', '3 ½ pounds bone-in pork shoulder roast']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix orange juice, onion, lime juice, olive oil, garlic, brown sugar, salt, oregano, cumin, lime zest, pepper, and bay leaves in a heavy Dutch oven.
', 'Step 2: Add pork shoulder; turn to coat.
', 'Step 3: Cover and marinate in the refrigerator, 4 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Remove Dutch oven from the refrigerator and cover tightly with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 6: Bake pork in the preheated oven until heated through, about 1 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 7: Flip pork carefully.
', 'Step 8: Replace foil and bake for 1 hour more.
', 'Step 9: Remove aluminum foil.
', 'Step 10: Continue baking uncovered, turning once halfway through, until pork falls apart and marinade is reduced, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
', 'Step 11: Remove pork from oven and let rest for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Shred pork in the Dutch oven using 2 forks; mix shredded pork with the reduced marinade.
', 'Step 13: Discard bay leaves.
']

Title: Rotisserie Chicken Chili With Hominy and Chiles
Ingredients: ['2 store-bought roast chickens, meat picked from bones and', '2 quarts chicken broth', '6 tablespoons vegetable oil', '¼ cup ground cumin', '4 teaspoons dried oregano', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '2 large onions, cut into medium dice', '2 (4 ounce) jars diced mild green chiles', '2 (20 ounce) cans hominy, or equal quantity of canned white beans, such as cannellini or great Northern', '6 medium garlic cloves, minced', '2 cups frozen corn, preferably shoepeg', 'sour cream', 'cilantro or scallions', 'lime wedges', 'green hot sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring skin and bones, chicken broth and 1 quart of water to boil over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to low and simmer about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Strain and discard skin and bones.
', 'Step 4: Heat oil over medium-low heat in a soup kettle.
', 'Step 5: Add cumin, oregano and cayenne and cook until spices are fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 6: Add onion; increase heat to medium; saute until soft, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in chicken and chiles.
', 'Step 8: Add 4 cups hominy and all but 1 cup of the broth and bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, 25 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Process remaining 2 cups hominy and 1 cup broth until silky smooth; add to soup.
', 'Step 11: Stir garlic and corn into soup.
', 'Step 12: Simmer for a minute or so longer, then cover and let stand for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Ladle into bowls and top with sour cream, cilantro or scallions.
', 'Step 14: Pass separately the lime wedges and green hot pepper sauce.
']

Title: Roasted Spicy Salsa Verde
Ingredients: ['2 fresh poblano chile peppers', '2 serrano chile peppers', '6 fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '1 1/2-inch slice of white onion', '2 cloves garlic', 'salt to taste', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro']

['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Lay the poblano peppers, serrano peppers, and tomatillos on the hot grill, and cook, turning every 2 minutes, until the pepper skins are evenly charred and blackened, and the tomatillos have turned pale yellow and started to ooze juice, about 10 minutes.

', 'Step 4: Scrape off most of the burned pepper skin, cut the stems off, cut the peppers in half the long way, and remove the seeds.
', 'Step 5: Place the onion and garlic in the work bowl of a food processor, and pulse about 4 times to chop.
', 'Step 6: Drop in the peppers, pulse 4 times to roughly chop, and add the tomatillos and salt.
', 'Step 7: Pulse 4 or more times to the desired smoothness, and stir in the cilantro.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Cilantro-Lime Chicken Tacos
Ingredients: ['3 sheets aluminum foil, rolled into balls', '1 (5 pound) whole chicken', "1 teaspoon seasoned salt (such as Pappy's Choice®), or more to taste", '8 cloves garlic, or more to taste, crushed', '8 limes, quartered', '½ cup white wine', '20 corn tortillas, warmed', '1 bunch cilantro, chopped']

', 'Step 2: Season chicken with seasoned salt.
', "Step 3: Rub half the garlic on the inside surfaces of the chicken's cavity and leave them inside.
", 'Step 4: Squeeze 8 lime quarters into the cavity; drop the squeezed quarters into the cavity.
', 'Step 5: Place the chicken atop the foil balls.
', 'Step 6: Squeeze 8 more lime quarters over the outside of the chicken; drop squeezed lime quarters into the bottom of the crock.
', 'Step 7: Rub remaining garlic over the outside of the chicken and put garlic in the bottom of the crock.

', 'Step 12: Serve chicken on warmed tortillas with cilantro for topping and lime wedge.
']

Title: Tajin® Michelada

Title: Chicken Mole with Four Chiles
Ingredients: ['4 dried mulato chiles', '4 dried ancho chiles', '4 dried guajillo chiles', '4 dried pasilla chilies', '2 teaspoons lard, or more as needed', '1 large onion, peeled and chopped', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (7 inch) flour tortilla', '2 (5 inch) corn tortillas', '1 plantain, peeled and chopped', '½ cup almonds', '½ cup peanuts', '⅛ cup sesame seeds', '1 (14 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes', '1 tablet of Mexican chocolate, such as Abuelita or Ibarra', '1 whole chicken']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Remove the stems, veins and seeds from the chiles (you might want to wear gloves when you do this).
', 'Step 2: Heat the lard in a heavy skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add the chiles, and cook and stir until the chiles are fragrant, about 1 minute, being careful not to burn them.
', 'Step 4: Remove the chiles and place them in a large bowl.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the onion and garlic, and cook until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove and add to the bowl with the chiles.
', 'Step 7: Break the flour and corn tortillas into pieces, and add them to the skillet.
', 'Step 8: Toast on both sides, turning often, until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove; add to the bowl.
', 'Step 10: If needed, melt a small amount of additional lard in the skillet.
', 'Step 11: Add the plantain pieces to the skillet, and cook and stir until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove plantain; add to the bowl.
', 'Step 13: Stir the almonds and peanuts into the skillet, and cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle in the sesame seeds and continue cooking until sesame seeds are lightly browned, 15-30 seconds.
', 'Step 15: Remove; add to the bowl.
', 'Step 16: Warm the tomatoes over medium heat in the skillet until heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 18: Break the chocolate into chunks and stir into the tomatoes until melted.
', 'Step 19: Pour the chocolate and tomato mixture into the bowl with the chile mixture; stir to combine.
', 'Step 20: Working in small batches, puree the mixture in a blender until smooth, adding a small amount of water if needed to make a smooth sauce.
', 'Step 21: Place the chicken into a large Dutch oven; pour the sauce over the chicken.
', 'Step 22: Cover and simmer over medium low heat until the chicken falls off the bone, 2-3 hours.
']

Title: Mexican Street Corn Dip
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons salted butter', '4 cups frozen corn, thawed', '1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '6 tablespoons crumbled cotija cheese', '3 tablespoons mayonnaise', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 medium lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon chili powder']

Title: Mexican Oatmeal Cookies
Ingredients: ['3 cups rolled oats', '1 block of Mexican chocolate', '1 cup butter, softened', '1 cup brown sugar', '½ cup white sugar', '2 eggs', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, or more to taste', '½ teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place the oatmeal in a blender and pulse the blender on high for 2 seconds, 5 or 6 times; transfer to a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Break the chocolate along the scores and pulse until it reaches a powdered form.
', "Step 4: Make sure to stir with a spoon between pulses so the heat from the blender doesn't melt the chocolate.
", 'Step 5: Add the chocolate to the oatmeal; set aside.
', 'Step 6: Beat the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar together with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Beat one egg into the mixture until completely incorporated.
', 'Step 8: Add the second egg along with the vanilla extract and continue beating.
', 'Step 9: Stir the flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt together in a separate bowl; add to the butter mixture and stir until combined.
', 'Step 10: Mix the oatmeal and chocolate into the mixture.
', 'Step 11: Drop teaspoonfuls of the dough 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until golden-brown on the edges and set in the middle, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Allow the cookies to cool briefly on the baking sheets before being moved to cooking racks to cool completely.
']

Title: Pork, Black Bean, and Rice Casserole
Ingredients: ['2 pounds pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes', '¾ cup water, divided', '1 teaspoon salt, divided', '½ cup diced onion', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (10.75 ounce) can cream of chicken soup', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®)', '2 (4 ounce) cans chopped Hatch chile peppers, drained', '1 cup instant white rice (such as Minute®)', '½ cup frozen corn', '¼ cup salsa', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine pork cubes, 1/2 cup water, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a Dutch oven.
', 'Step 2: Cover and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Uncover, raise heat to medium-high, and cook, stirring constantly, until the water evaporates.
', 'Step 4: Cook until pork starts to brown in its rendered fat, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add onion and cook for 5 to 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 7: Add black beans, cream of chicken soup, tomatoes, Hatch chiles, instant rice, corn, salsa, 1/4 cup water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, chili powder, cumin, black pepper, and 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 8: Stir to combine.
', 'Step 9: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 11: Pour pork mixture into the prepared baking dish and bake until thoroughly warmed, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove from oven and top with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 13: Let sit until cheese has melted.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Mexican Lentil Soup
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 large carrot, peeled and sliced', '1 small onion, chopped', '1 yellow bell pepper, chopped', '1 fresh jalapeño chile pepper, seeded and chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '5 cups low-sodium chicken broth', '1 (16 ounce) jar picante sauce', '1 ¼ cups dry lentils', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning', '1 teaspoon cumin', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon lime juice']

Title: Taco Rice Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 cup chopped celery', '½ cup chopped onion', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 ¼ cups water', '1 cup uncooked long-grain rice', '1 cup salsa', '1 (4.5 ounce) can diced green chilies, drained', '¼ cup sliced black olives', '1 ½ teaspoons beef bouillon granules', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']

Title: Blackened Tilapia Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['½ small head red cabbage, shredded', '¼ red onion, grated', '3 tablespoons chopped cilantro', '½ cup sour cream', '1 lime, juiced, divided', '1 tablespoon honey', '1 chipotle chili pepper', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', 'kosher salt to taste', 'freshly ground black pepper to taste', '3 avocados', '1 jalapeno pepper, minced', '¼ onion, minced', '½ teaspoon sriracha sauce, or to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 ½ teaspoons brown sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons paprika', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '¾ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground red chile pepper', '4 (6 ounce) tilapia fillets', '1 tablespoon canola oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place cabbage and red onion in large bowl with cilantro.
', 'Step 2: Mix sour cream, 1/2 the lime juice, honey, chipotle pepper, cayenne pepper, kosher salt, and freshly ground black pepper together in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 3: Pour dressing over the cabbage mixture.
', 'Step 4: Let marinate, 30 minutes to overnight.
', 'Step 5: Combine avocados, jalapeno pepper, minced onion, and sriracha sauce in a bowl.
', 'Step 6: Season with salt and pepper; mash to make the guacamole.
', 'Step 7: Combine the remaining lime juice, brown sugar, paprika, oregano, garlic powder, salt, cumin, and ground red chile in another bowl.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle evenly over tilapia fillets.
', 'Step 9: Heat oil in a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Add tilapia; cook until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 3 minutes per side.

Title: Chicken Tortilla Soup in the Instant Pot®

Title: Instant Pot® Tamales
Ingredients: ['1 (8 ounce) package dried corn husks', '2 cups water, or more as needed', '2 cups coarsely chopped onion', '3 cloves garlic, smashed', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 teaspoon chipotle chile powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 (3 pound) boneless pork shoulder', '8 peppers Anaheim chile peppers', '2 peppers de arbol chile peppers', '3 cups chicken stock, divided', '2 medium Roma tomatoes, quartered', '4 cloves garlic', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 ½ teaspoons kosher salt', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '4 cups instant corn masa', '2 ½ teaspoons kosher salt, divided', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 cup Lard', '2 cups warm water, or more as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place 20 dried husks in a large Dutch oven and cover with water.
', 'Step 2: Place a plate or bowl filled with water on top of husks to keep submerged.
', 'Step 3: Let soak for at least 3 hours (or up to 24 hours), flipping occasionally until husks are softened.
', 'Step 4: Meanwhile, prepare the filling: Combine 2 cups water, onion, garlic, chili powder, salt, chipotle powder, and cumin in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®).
', 'Step 5: Cut pork shoulder into 4 equal pieces and add to the pot.
', 'Step 6: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 7: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 60 minutes.
", 'Step 8: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', 'Step 9: While the filling is cooking, prepare the sauce: Split chile peppers and remove seeds and membranes.
', 'Step 10: Cut into 1- to 2-inch pieces (there is no need to cut the de arbol chiles.
', 'Step 11: ) Place chiles, 2 cups chicken stock, tomatoes, and garlic cloves in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 12: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes are fully softened, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Carefully pour the sauce mixture into a blender.
', 'Step 14: Secure the lid and remove the center piece to allow steam to escape.
', 'Step 15: Place a clean towel over the opening and process on high speed until completely smooth, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Carefully transfer blended hot mixture back to the saucepan.
', 'Step 17: Stir in remaining 1 cup chicken stock, cumin, salt, and onion powder.
', 'Step 18: Return mixture to a simmer over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 19: Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce has thickened and color is a deeper red, about 30 minutes.
', "Step 20: When the filling has finished cooking, release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions for 10 minutes, then use the quick-release method to release remaining pressure, 1 to 2 minutes.
", 'Step 21: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 22: Remove pork to a shallow baking dish.
', 'Step 23: Discard any fat and shred meat using 2 forks.
', 'Step 24: Place shredded meat in a bowl.
', 'Step 25: Strain cooking liquid through a fine mesh strainer and discard solids.
', 'Step 26: Skim as much grease as possible from the liquid.
', 'Step 27: Reserve 1 cup strained cooking liquid for cooking the masa and discard any remaining.
', 'Step 28: Combine masa, 2 teaspoons salt, and baking powder for masa mixture in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment; mix on low speed until completely combined, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 29: Increase speed to medium and gradually add melted, warm lard alternately with 1 cup reserved, warm cooking liquid and 2 cups warm water; beat until dough is completely combined.
', 'Step 30: Increase speed to medium-high and beat until dough is light and fluffy, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 31: The dough should resemble a loose cookie dough; adjust by adding 1 tablespoon warm water at a time, if needed.
', 'Step 32: Stir 1 cup sauce and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt into the shredded meat; set filling aside.
', 'Step 33: Set remaining sauce aside for serving.
', 'Step 34: Drain husks and cover with a damp paper towel.
', 'Step 35: As you prepare the tamales, make sure they are not longer than 4 to 5 inches in order to fit in the pressure cooker with the lid closed.
', 'Step 36: Place one damp husk on a work surface with the pointed end facing you (it will make a capital "V" shape.
', 'Step 37: ) Spoon 1/4 cup masa mixture onto the husk.
', 'Step 38: Using damp fingers and starting near the top of the husk, press mixture into a 4-inch square; leave 1 inch clear at the top of the husk, and 3 to 4 inches clear at the bottom.
', 'Step 39: Place 1 heaping tablespoon of filling in a vertical line down the center of the masa.
', 'Step 40: Grab both sides of the husk and bring them together until they meet and are touching.
', 'Step 41: Pull the left side of the husk away, and wrap the right side over the masa mixture.
', 'Step 42: Take the left side and wrap it tightly over the right side, completely enclosing the filling.
', 'Step 43: Fold the bottom of the husk over the seam and tie with a strip of corn husk, if desired.
', 'Step 44: Repeat to make remaining tamales.
', 'Step 45: Stand tamales up vertically with the open side up in the steamer basket of the Instant Pot®.
', 'Step 46: Place the trivet in the cooker and add 2 cups tap water.
', 'Step 47: Place steamer basket on the trivet, and close and lock the lid.
', 'Step 48: Select high pressure and set timer for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 49: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 50: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions for 10 minutes, then use the quick-release method to release remaining pressure, 1 to 2 minutes.
", 'Step 51: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 52: Let tamales rest in the cooker for 10 minutes before serving.
', 'Step 53: Meanwhile, warm the remaining sauce to serve with tamales.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '683 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '44.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '97.6 mg', 'fatContent': '46.9 g', 'fiberContent': '7.9 g', 'proteinContent': '23.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '16.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '3007.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.2 g'}

Title: Grilled Fish Tacos with Avocado Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 pounds mahi mahi fillets', '4 ½ teaspoons ground chipotle pepper, divided', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 large avocado - peeled, pitted, and cubed', '½ cup sour cream', '¼ cup chopped cilantro', 'nonstick cooking spray', '8 (8 inch) flour tortillas, warmed', '3 cups shredded cabbage', '3 medium limes, quartered']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Rinse fish and pat dry; cut into four equal portions.
', 'Step 2: Mix 4 teaspoons chipotle powder, cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl.

', 'Step 4: Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, mash avocado in another bowl.
', 'Step 6: Add sour cream, cilantro, and remaining chili powder, and mix until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 8: Coat the inside of a grill basket with nonstick spray and place fish inside the basket.
', 'Step 9: Place the basket on the preheated grill and cook until fish flakes easily with a fork, 3 to 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 10: Remove from the grill and transfer fish to a plate.
', 'Step 11: Break into bite-sized pieces.
', 'Step 12: Serve fish on warmed tortillas topped with shredded cabbage and a dollop of the avocado sauce.
', 'Step 13: Plate with lime wedges.
']

Title: Grilled Corn with Cilantro Lime Butter
Ingredients: ['1 cup butter', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 ½ tablespoons fresh lime juice', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '8 ears corn on the cob, unhusked', '3 quarts cold water, or as needed to cover']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cream butter in a bowl until smooth; mix in cilantro, lime juice, and cayenne pepper until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 2: Cover and refrigerate 1 hour to blend flavors.
', 'Step 3: Peel husks back from ears of corn starting at the top, leaving the husks attached at the bottom of the ears.
', 'Step 4: Remove all the corn silk and close husks over the ears again.
', 'Step 5: Cover corn ears with cold water in a large bowl until husks are thoroughly soaked, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 7: Place the corn in husks onto the hot grate and grill covered until husks are charred and the corn kernels are tender, 20 to 25 minutes, turning often.
', 'Step 8: Strip off husks and serve corn with cilantro lime butter.
']

Title: Mama's Fab-u-lous Fajitas
Ingredients: ['¼ cup lime juice', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '½ jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 ½ pounds beef skirt steak, cut across the grain into 1/2-inch strips', '1 yellow onion, cut into 1/2-inch strips', '3 red bell peppers, cut into 1/2-inch strips', '2 teaspoons vegetable oil, divided, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk lime juice, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, olive oil, garlic, and cumin together in a large glass or ceramic bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add skirt steak, onion, and red bell peppers; toss to evenly coat.
', 'Step 3: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and marinate in the refrigerator, 30 minutes to 2 hours.
', 'Step 4: Remove steak, onion, and peppers from marinade and shake off excess.
', 'Step 5: Discard remaining marinade.
', 'Step 6: Heat 1 teaspoon vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat until oil shimmers.
', 'Step 7: Cook and stir steak in hot oil until browned on all sides and still pink in the center, about 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 8: Transfer meat to a plate, tent with aluminum foil, and let rest for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Heat remaining oil in the same skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Saute onion and peppers in hot oil until just tender but still crisp to the bite, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Return meat to skillet; cook and stir until heated through.
']

Title: Mexican Casserole with Leftover Turkey
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 onion, chopped', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed', '3 cups shredded cooked turkey', '2 cups salsa, divided', '1 (15 ounce) can sweet corn, drained', '1 cup water', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '2 cups cooked rice', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided', '3 cups crushed tortilla chips']

', 'Step 2: Add onion, cumin, salt, and pepper.

', 'Step 6: Cover and simmer until flavors meld, about 5 minutes.

Title: Pescado en Achiote (Mexican Fish in Annatto Sauce)
Ingredients: ['¾ cup water', '¼ cup achiote paste', '¼ onion', '2 limes, juiced', '1 orange, juiced', '2 tablespoons white vinegar', '1 clove garlic, peeled', '1 teaspoon oregano', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '6 (4 ounce) fillets white fish fillets', '½ cup butter, melted', '12 ounces uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1 red onion, sliced', '2 habanero chiles, sliced', '1 cup water', '½ orange, juiced', '1 lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon peppercorns', '1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine 3/4 cup water, achiote paste, onion, juice of 2 limes, juice of 1 orange, vinegar, garlic, 1 teaspoon oregano, salt, and pepper in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Season both sides of the fish fillets with salt and pepper, then brush the top with melted butter.

', 'Step 9: Add 1 cup water, juice of 1/2 orange, and juice of 1 lime; stir well and season with salt, peppercorns, and Mexican oregano.

Title: Zesty Taco Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 cup uncooked white rice', '2 cups water', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 large green bell pepper, chopped', '1 large red bell pepper, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (7 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '1 cup salsa', '3 tablespoons chili powder', '2 tablespoons ground cumin', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '2 cups cottage cheese', '1 (8.75 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (15.25 ounce) can vegetarian chili', '2 cups coarsely crushed corn chips', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']

Title: Flannery's Bacon Avocado Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter, divided', '1 cup diced red potatoes', '1 ½ cups chopped onion', '6 eggs, beaten', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '8 (7 inch) whole wheat tortillas', '1 pound cooked and crumbled turkey bacon', '1 ½ cups shredded low-fat Cheddar cheese', '1 large avocado, thinly sliced', '½ cup salsa, or as needed', '½ cup reduced-fat sour cream, or as needed']

', 'Step 2: Cook and stir potatoes in hot butter until tender, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer potatoes to a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Melt remaining butter in the same skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Saute onion in hot butter until onion is soft and translucent, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Transfer onion to a bowl.
', 'Step 7: Beat eggs, salt, and pepper together in a bowl.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat under skillet to medium.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir eggs in hot skillet until set, 3 to 5 minutes; transfer to a plate.
', 'Step 10: Spread tortillas out onto a work surface.
', 'Step 11: Spoon potatoes, onion, eggs, bacon, Cheddar cheese, avocado, salsa, and sour cream in a line across the middle of a tortilla.

']

', 'Step 8: Place 1 tortilla in the skillet and cook until heated through, about 30 seconds per side.

', 'Step 10: Top warm tortillas with luncheon meat, lettuce, Cheddar cheese, olives, tomato, and onion.
']

Title: Tepache
Ingredients: ['1 whole pineapple', '1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger', '1 cup brown sugar', '2 habanero peppers, halved', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '8 cups water at room temperature']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Chop pineapple into small segments, including the rind.
', 'Step 2: You can remove the woody core from the segments if you wish.
', 'Step 3: Add to a large container, e.g. a Mason jar with only a flat lid.
', 'Step 4: The container needs to be able to expel the gas that will build up during fermentation, but also needs to be somewhat airtight to prevent the formation of vinegar.
', 'Step 5: n Crush ginger slightly with the side of a knife to open it up.
', 'Step 6: Add ginger, brown sugar, habanero peppers, cinnamon, and water to the container.
', 'Step 7: Stir to combine, cover, and let stand for 2 days in a warm place until mixture slightly fizzy and warm to the touch.
', 'Step 8: n Strain mixture through a fine-meshed sieve into fermentation-grade bottles.
', 'Step 9: Cover and store in your refrigerator.
', 'Step 10: Enjoy for up to 1 week.
', 'Step 11: Tepache may continue to carbonate in the bottles while stored and explode if left too long.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '156 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '40.6 g', 'fatContent': '0.2 g', 'fiberContent': '2.6 g', 'proteinContent': '1 g', 'sodiumContent': '14.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '34.5 g'}

Title: Slow Cooker Pork Chile Verde
Ingredients: ['1 (3 1/2) pound boneless pork shoulder roast, cut into 5 or 6 pieces', 'salt to taste', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', '3 tablespoons olive oil, divided, or more as needed', '1 large sweet onion, chopped', '1 large Anaheim chile pepper, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, chopped, or more to taste', '2 (15 ounce) cans chicken broth', '12 large whole Anaheim chile peppers', '1 (15 ounce) can green enchilada sauce', '¾ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon chili powder']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Season pork with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Brown pork pieces in the hot oil, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Place pork into the bottom of a slow cooker.
', 'Step 5: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in the same pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Saute onion, chopped Anaheim chile, and garlic for 5 minutes, adding more oil if needed.
', 'Step 7: Add mixture to the slow cooker; pour in chicken broth.
', 'Step 8: Cover and cook on High until pork is tender and easily shredded with a fork, about 4 hours.
', "Step 9: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 10: Brush the whole chile peppers with oil and place on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 11: Broil in the preheated oven for 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 12: Remove from the oven and let cool slightly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove pulp and seeds from chiles and cut into pieces.
', 'Step 14: Place into the bowl of a food processor with enchilada sauce, cilantro, cumin, and chili powder.
', 'Step 15: Puree until smooth.
', 'Step 16: Refrigerate until ready to use.
', 'Step 17: Remove pork from the slow cooker and shred using 2 forks; return to the slow cooker.
', 'Step 18: Add pureed chile pepper mixture and stir well.
', 'Step 19: Cook on Low, 3 to 4 hours more.
']

Title: Tater Tot Taco Casserole with Queso
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package frozen bite-size potato nuggets (such as Tater Tots®)', '1 pound ground beef', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning', '1 cup water', '1 (15 ounce) jar nacho cheese dip', '1 (10 ounce) can canned diced tomatoes and green chiles, drained', '¼ cup sliced black olives', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '2 tablespoons taco sauce', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (10 ounce) bag shredded lettuce', '¼ cup sour cream']

', 'Step 2: Place potato nuggets in the bottom of a glass baking dish.

Title: Green Chile Stew with Pork
Ingredients: ['3 pounds boneless pork loin, cubed', '3 tablespoons peanut oil', '3 stalks celery, chopped', '2 tomatoes, chopped', '7 green chile peppers, chopped', '4 cloves crushed garlic', '4 cups chicken broth', '1 (10 ounce) jar prepared green chile salsa', 'salt to taste']

['Step 1: In a large skillet over medium high heat, brown the pork in oil, doing so in 2 to 3 batches.
', 'Step 2: Place the meat in 3 to 4-quart covered casserole and add celery, tomatoes, chilies, and garlic.

', 'Step 5: Cover and simmer until stew is thick and meat very tender, about 1 1/2 hours.

Title: QOB Veggie Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) can fat-free refried beans', '1 (10 ounce) can red enchilada sauce', '1 tablespoon cocoa powder', '1 tablespoon molasses', 'cooking spray', '2 heads broccoli, chopped', '1 white onion, diced', '1 red bell pepper, seeded and diced', '1 poblano pepper, seeded and diced', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 cups shredded pepperjack cheese, divided', '8 whole-wheat tortillas', '½ cup shredded reduced-fat Cheddar cheese']

Title: Bean Potato Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 medium baking potatoes, peeled and cubed', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '3 tablespoons milk', '1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '24 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '8 ounces thinly sliced Monterey Jack cheese', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '¼ cup salsa', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Title: Mexican Pork and Green Chile Stew
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '2 ½ pounds lean boneless pork, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 ½ cups diced onion', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can no-salt-added diced tomatoes', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '2 tablespoons minced fresh cilantro', '¼ cup cold water', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']

['Step 1: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven or large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Spread flour into a wide, shallow dish; add pork and turn to coat, shaking off excess.

', 'Step 4: Stir onion and garlic in with the pork; continue cooking and stirring until the onion softens, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour diced tomatoes, green chilies, and 2 tablespoons cilantro over the pork mixture; stir.
', 'Step 6: Place a cover on the Dutch oven and simmer the mixture until pork is tender and no longer pink in the center, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Whisk cold water and cornstarch together in a small bowl; stir into the liquid in the Dutch oven and continue cooking until the sauce thickens, 5 to 10 minutes.

', 'Step 9: Ladle into bowls and top with cheese and desired amount of cilantro to serve.
']

Title: Green Chili Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into chunks', '2 teaspoons taco seasoning mix, or to taste', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ medium onion, chopped', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '8 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, or to taste']

Title: Colorado Mexican Rice

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a medium baking sheet.

Title: Lengua (Beef Tongue) Stew
Ingredients: ['1 (2 pound) beef tongue', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 large onion, thinly sliced', '1 small leek, thinly sliced', '2 stalks celery, thinly sliced', '2 large carrots, shredded', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '2 (1 ounce) packets taco seasoning mix (such as Goya®)', 'salt and black pepper to taste']

['Step 1: Place the beef tongue into a tight-fitting pot and cover with water by 1 inch.
', 'Step 2: Add the salt and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the meat is tender, about 2 hours.
', 'Step 4: Strain and reserve the cooking liquid.
', 'Step 5: Remove and discard the skin from the tongue.
', 'Step 6: Shred the meat using two forks; set aside.

', 'Step 13: Season to taste with salt and pepper before serving.
']

Ingredients: ['5 Hatch chile peppers, stems removed', '1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with roasted garlic', '½ onion, roughly chopped', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 pinch garlic powder, or to taste']

", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil; add Hatch chile peppers.

', 'Step 5: Allow peppers to steam as they cool, about 20 minutes.

Title: Mexican Turkey Burgers
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 medium onion, finely chopped', '1 medium green bell pepper, finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 cup salsa', '1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 pound ground turkey', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '⅓ cup dry bread crumbs', '6 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '6 tablespoons sour cream', '2 cups shredded lettuce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Coat a medium baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, and saute the onion, green pepper, and garlic 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat, and cool slightly.
', 'Step 5: In a small bowl, mix the salsa and 1/2 the corn.
', 'Step 6: In a large bowl, mix the onion mixture with the turkey, taco seasoning, and 2 tablespoons of the salsa mixture.
', 'Step 7: Divide into 6 patties, and press into the breadcrumbs to lightly coat on all sides.
', 'Step 8: Arrange coated patties in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Bake the patties 10 minutes in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 10: Drain any liquid from the dish, turn patties, and spread with the remaining salsa mixture.
', 'Step 11: Continue baking 10 minutes, to an internal temperature of 165 degrees F (75 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Warm the tortillas in the microwave, about 30 seconds on High.

', 'Step 14: Sprinkle with remaining corn to serve.
']

Title: Atole de Elote
Ingredients: ['6 ears white corn', '1 cup water', '3 cups milk', '1 cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 pinch salt', '3 tablespoons cornstarch']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Fill a large bowl with ice and cold water.
', 'Step 2: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Add corn and cook uncovered until kernels are slightly softened, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Drain in a colander and immediately immerse in ice water for several minutes to stop the cooking process.
', 'Step 5: Drain.
', 'Step 6: n Remove kernels from the cob using a knife and transfer to a blender.
', 'Step 7: Add 1 cup water, or 1/2 cup if blending in two batches, and blend until pureed.
', 'Step 8: Strain mixture into a bowl using a fine sieve; discard the solids.
', 'Step 9: Run liquid once more through a clean sieve.
', 'Step 10: n Stir in milk; transfer mixture to a medium nonstick skillet.
', 'Step 11: Cook over medium heat until milk is heated through.
', 'Step 12: Stir in sugar, vanilla extract, and salt; bring to a gentle simmer.
', 'Step 13: n Reduce heat to low and combine 1/4 cup of the hot liquid with cornstarch.
', 'Step 14: Pour mixture into the skillet and stir constantly until atole begins to thicken to desired consistency, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Immediately remove from heat.
', 'Step 16: Pour into pudding bowls, soup bowls, or cups.
']

Title: Chilaquiles Scramble
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil, divided, or to taste', '1 small onion, finely chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, finely chopped', '1 small tomato, diced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '½ cup salsa verde (green salsa)', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 cups tortilla chips', '5 eggs', '½ cup crumbled Cotija cheese', '1 avocado, sliced', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons sour cream, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a saute pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onion and jalapeno.
', 'Step 3: Cook, stirring occasionally, until onion appears translucent, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add tomato and garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute.
', 'Step 5: Add salsa and scrape any browned bits off the bottom of the pan.
', 'Step 6: Season with cumin, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add tortilla chips to the pan and stir until coated with sauce.
', 'Step 9: Heat remaining oil in a separate pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Whisk eggs together and pour into the hot pan; cook until starting to set, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Scrape cooked egg off the edges and fold into the center.
', 'Step 12: Cook until eggs are halfway cooked but still runny, 2 to 3 minutes more.
', 'Step 13: Fold into the tortilla chip mixture.
', 'Step 14: Keep stirring to finish scrambling the eggs, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Add Cotija cheese and turn off heat.
', 'Step 16: Divide egg mixture onto plates.
', 'Step 17: Garnish with avocado, cilantro, and sour cream.
']
