Title: Monkey Meat
Ingredients: ['4 pounds tri tip roast', '3 teaspoons salt, divided', '¾ teaspoon ground black pepper, divided', '3 tablespoons chili powder, divided', '3 tablespoons ground cumin, divided', '⅓ cup olive oil, divided', '2 large onions, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '2 Anaheim chile peppers, chopped', '1 poblano chile pepper, chopped', '2 jalapeno chile peppers, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 carrot, chopped', '2 stalks celery, chopped', '4 roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '1 whole dried red chile pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 (14 ounce) can beef broth']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Trim the beef roast of excess fat and tissue, and cut into 4 or 5 large chunks.
', 'Step 2: In a cup or small bowl, mix together 2 teaspoons of salt, 1/2 teaspoon of pepper, 1 tablespoon of chili powder, and 1 tablespoon of ground cumin.
', 'Step 3: Rub this mixture into the meat, and let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Heat 3 tablespoon of olive oil in a large deep skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Sear the meat on all sides.
', 'Step 6: Remove meat from the pan, and pour in the remaining olive oil.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to medium, and add onions, garlic, Anaheim peppers, poblano peppers, jalapeno peppers, green pepper, carrot and celery.
', 'Step 8: Cook, stirring frequently, for about 5 minutes to release the flavors.
', 'Step 9: Add roma tomatoes to the pan, and season with remaining chili powder, cumin, salt and pepper, as well as the dried chile pepper.
', 'Step 10: Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Return the meat to the pan, and stir in the beef broth.
', 'Step 12: Bring to a boil, then simmer over low heat for 3 to 3 1/2 hours, until meat is very tender.
', 'Step 13: Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary.
', 'Step 14: Remove meat from the pot, shred, and return to the pot.
', 'Step 15: Reheat if necessary before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '423.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '7.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '124 mg', 'fatContent': '24.1 g', 'fiberContent': '2.3 g', 'proteinContent': '43.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '819.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.9 g'}

Title: Authentic Mexican Torta - Tortas Ahogadas
Ingredients: ['16 cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons minced fresh oregano', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '9 pounds boneless pork butt', '4 dried chipotle chili peppers', '6 tablespoons vegetable oil', '8 cloves garlic, minced', '4 onions, chopped', '20 Roma tomatoes, chopped', '1 cup water', '5 teaspoons minced fresh oregano', '¼ teaspoon white sugar', 'salt, to taste', '12 Mexican bolillo rolls, lightly toasted, cut in half lengthwise', '2 pickled jalapeno peppers, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Mix the 16 cloves of minced garlic, 2 tablespoons of minced oregano, 2 teaspoons of salt, and pepper in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Rub garlic mixture over the pork butt, and place pork in a shallow roasting pan.
', 'Step 4: Roast in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, then reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Continue roasting until pork is tender and no longer pink in the center, about 2 hours and 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Cover the meat with two layers of aluminum foil, and allow to rest in a warm area for 20 minutes before rough chopping or shredding it.
', 'Step 8: Reserve pan drippings.
', 'Step 9: Place the chipotle peppers in a bowl, and cover with hot water.
', 'Step 10: Allow peppers to soak until softened, about 3 minutes; drain.
', 'Step 11: Set aside.
', 'Step 12: Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Stir in 8 cloves of minced garlic and the chopped onions; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Stir in the Roma tomatoes, 1 cup of water, chipotle chili peppers, 5 teaspoons of oregano, sugar, and salt to taste.
', 'Step 15: Add the reserved pan drippings.
', 'Step 16: Simmer, uncovered, over low heat for 15 to 20 minutes, stirring frequently.
', 'Step 17: Pour the chipotle sauce into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full.
', 'Step 18: Hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, and carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulses to get the sauce moving before leaving it on to puree.
', 'Step 19: Puree in batches until smooth and pour into a clean pot.
', 'Step 20: Alternately, you can use a stick blender and puree the sauce right in the skillet.
', 'Step 21: Strain the sauce through a sieve.
', 'Step 22: To serve: Hollow out the bottom half of each bolillo to make a shallow bowl for the chopped pork.
', 'Step 23: Scoop about 2 tablespoons of the chipotle sauce over the bottom of each roll, then arrange the chopped pork over the sauce.
', 'Step 24: Top each sandwich with a couple slices of pickled jalapeno, followed by the top half of the roll.
', 'Step 25: Pour about 1/4 cup of additional chipotle sauce over the entire sandwich.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '866.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '75.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '135 mg', 'fatContent': '41 g', 'fiberContent': '5.6 g', 'proteinContent': '47.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '13.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '571.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '9 g'}

Title: Cinco de Mayo Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil, or as needed', '1 onion, diced', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®), drained', '1 cup salsa, drained', '1 (7 ounce) can Mexican-style corn, drained', '1 cup sour cream', '3 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 4: Transfer ground beef to a 9x13-inch casserole dish.
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion and garlic in the hot oil until onion is translucent, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Spoon onion mixture over ground beef.
', 'Step 7: Mix tomatoes with green chile peppers, salsa, corn, sour cream, 1 cup Cheddar cheese, salt, and black pepper into ground beef mixture; top with remaining 2 cups Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through and cheese is melted, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Chorizo
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons ground New Mexico chile', '2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', '1 tablespoon dried Mexican oregano', '1 tablespoon water', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ¾ teaspoons salt', '1 ½ teaspoons red pepper flakes', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds, crushed', '¾ teaspoon white sugar', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 pound ground pork, well chilled']

', 'Step 5: Use immediately or refrigerate to let flavors meld, 8 hours to overnight.

']

Title: Air Fryer Roasted Salsa Verde
Ingredients: ['1 pound tomatillos', '1 serrano pepper, halved and seeded', '1 jalapeno pepper, halved and seeded', '½ large white onion, cut into 2 wedges', '1 serving cooking spray', '4 cloves garlic, peeled', '½ cup chopped cilantro', '½ lime, juiced, or more to taste', '1 pinch salt to taste']

']

Title: Crispy Tilapia Fish Tacos with Slaw
Ingredients: ['1 cup mayonnaise', '1 tablespoon diced onion', '1 tablespoon finely chopped pickles', '1 teaspoon lemon juice', '2 cups chopped cabbage', '½ cup shredded carrots', '¼ cup chopped green onions', '¼ cup chopped cilantro', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 ½ teaspoons minced fresh ginger', '1 tablespoon rice vinegar', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 teaspoon honey', '1 teaspoon sesame oil', '1 quart vegetable oil for frying, or as needed', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '¾ cup diet ginger ale', '1 pound tilapia (bream), raw', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '8 (6 inch) corn tortillas, warmed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix mayonnaise, onion, pickles, and lemon juice for tartar sauce in a bowl until well combined.
', 'Step 2: Refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 3: Combine cabbage, carrots, green onions, and cilantro in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Mix garlic and ginger with rice vinegar, soy sauce, honey, and sesame oil in a small bowl; pour over slaw and toss to coat.
', 'Step 5: Refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 6: Heat 1 1/2 inches oil in a deep pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: While oil is heating, mix flour and baking powder together in a bowl.
', 'Step 8: Slowly add ginger ale and mix to combine.
', "Step 9: You don't want the batter to be overly thick; excess batter should be able to coat the fish entirely, but still be able to drip off.
", 'Step 10: Pat tilapia chunks dry and dredge in the batter until thoroughly coated.
', 'Step 11: Test the oil by adding a few drops of batter in it; when the batter begins to bubble and float, the oil is ready.
', "Step 12: Working in batches so you don't overcrowd the pot, carefully lower some tilapia into the hot oil.
", 'Step 13: Fry until golden brown, 2 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 15: Repeat with remaining tilapia.
', 'Step 16: To serve, place slaw on warm tortillas.
', 'Step 17: Top with tilapia and tartar sauce.
']

Title: Easy Fish Tacos with Slaw
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package coleslaw mix', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '¾ cup Greek yogurt', '2 peppers chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, chopped', '1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', '2 teaspoons adobo sauce from chipotle peppers', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 pound white fish fillets', '1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', '1 teaspoon dried cilantro', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '½ cup cornstarch', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 quart oil for frying, or as needed', '8 (6 inch) fajita-sized flour tortillas', '1 avocado, diced, or to taste', '1 medium tomato, chopped, or to taste']

['Step 1: Mix coleslaw mix, cilantro, yogurt, peppers, vinegar, adobo sauce, and salt for slaw together and set aside in the refrigerator.
', 'Step 2: Cut fillets into 2-ounce portions.
', 'Step 3: Season fish with 1 teaspoon salt, dried cilantro, cumin, and oregano.
', 'Step 4: Allow to rest while combining flour, cornstarch, 1 teaspoon salt, and cayenne in a shallow dish.

', 'Step 8: Fry fish in the hot oil until golden and it flakes easily with a fork, about 3 minutes on each side.

', 'Step 10: To assemble, top a tortilla with one fillet, 1/4 cup slaw, and slices of avocado and tomato if desired.
']

Title: Court's Creamy and Quick Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '½ yellow onion, chopped', '1 (14 ounce) can refried beans', '1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning', '6 (9 inch) flour tortillas', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup', '8 ounces sour cream', '½ cup salsa, or to taste', '1 ½ cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese']

Title: Sweet Potato-Black Bean Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['5 cups 1/2-inch cubed, peeled sweet potatoes', '2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon onion powder', 'sea salt and freshly cracked black pepper to taste', '4 (12 inch) flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded old Cheddar cheese', '1 (19 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '½ cup salsa', '2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '¼ cup sour cream, for topping', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro for garnish']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine cubed sweet potatoes, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, oregano, garlic powder, onion powder, and a generous amount of salt and cracked pepper in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Spread cubes out in a single layer on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes, stir, flip, and return to the oven to bake until tender, 10 to 12 more minutes.
', 'Step 5: Taste and season with additional salt if required.
', 'Step 6: Lay out one tortilla on a flat surface and place 1/2 cup Cheddar on one half of the tortilla.
', 'Step 7: Top with a few scoops of roasted sweet potatoes and a generous scoop of black beans.
', 'Step 8: Spoon over 2 tablespoons salsa and top with 1/2 cup Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 9: Fold tortilla over the filling and gently press it down.
', 'Step 10: Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Place quesadilla onto hot skillet without any oil and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Carefully flip quesadilla and continue cooking for 2 more minutes.
', 'Step 13: Repeat with remaining ingredients until all 4 quesadillas are fried up.
', 'Step 14: Slice them in half and serve each quesadilla with a couple dollops of sour cream, fresh cilantro, and additional salsa if desired.
']

Title: Turkey Nacho Bake
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground turkey', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', 'freshly ground black pepper to taste', '2 teaspoons crushed red pepper flakes', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives', '2 tablespoons hot sauce', '1 (1 ounce) package dry taco seasoning mix', '1 (14 ounce) can refried beans', '1 (14.5 ounce) package tortilla chips', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (4 ounce) can sliced black olives', '1 ripe tomato, diced', '1 bunch green onions, sliced']

Title: White Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['3 (7 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '2 teaspoons Old El Paso Fajita Seasoning Mix-Dry PLB', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '⅔ cup Nacho Cheese Sauce', '½ cup diced onion', '2 (8 ounce) cans diced green chile peppers, divided', '5 ounces cream cheese, softened', '1 small jalapeno pepper - stemmed, seeded, and diced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '5 ounces milk', '½ cup shredded white Cheddar cheese', '7 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '12 ounces shredded Mexican-blend cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Rub chicken breasts on both sides with olive oil, then sprinkle with fajita seasoning, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 4: Place on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 35 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 6: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Remove from the oven and allow to cool.
', 'Step 8: Keep oven on.
', 'Step 9: Shred chicken, discarding any extra fat or tough bits.
', 'Step 10: Place in a large bowl with nacho dip, onion, 1 can chile peppers, cream cheese, jalapeno, cumin, garlic powder, chili powder, oregano, and salt to taste; mix to combine.
', 'Step 11: Combine condensed soup, remaining can of green chile peppers, milk, and Cheddar cheese in a pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 12: Stir to combine and cook until sauce is heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Transfer 1/4 cup sauce to the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 14: Leave remaining sauce in the pan.
', 'Step 15: Distribute filling evenly amongst tortillas, then sprinkle 2 tablespoons Mexican cheese on each.
', 'Step 16: Transfer enchiladas to the baking dish and pour remaining sauce over top.
', 'Step 17: Sprinkle with remaining Mexican cheese.
', 'Step 18: Return to the oven and bake until cheese is hot and bubbly, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Serve hot.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '703.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '42 g', 'cholesterolContent': '132.3 mg', 'fatContent': '41.6 g', 'fiberContent': '3.3 g', 'proteinContent': '39.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '21.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '1989.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.7 g'}

Title: Chile Relleno Pancakes
Ingredients: ['4 medium poblano chile peppers', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ cup diced onions', '3 cloves garlic, minced', 'salt to taste', '2 cups marinara sauce', '1 ¼ cups chicken broth, or more as needed', '4 teaspoons chili powder, or to taste', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', 'freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '5 large eggs', '6 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, cubed', '4 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon olive oil, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Char peppers over an open flame, turning often, until skin is black and they are almost soft.
', 'Step 2: Wrap peppers in a few paper towels and then in a kitchen towel.
', 'Step 3: Let steam in the towel for at least 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: While peppers rest, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Add onions, garlic, and a big pinch of salt; saute until onions turn translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in marinara sauce, 1 1/4 cup chicken broth, chili powder, oregano, pepper, more salt, cayenne, cumin, and cinnamon; bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add more chicken broth for a thinner sauce if desired.
', 'Step 9: Taste and adjust seasonings if needed.
', 'Step 10: Keep warm until needed.
', 'Step 11: Remove the charred skin and seedpods from the peppers and rinse out the loose seeds.
', 'Step 12: Slice the pepper into 1/4-inch strips.
', 'Step 13: Crack 2 whole eggs into one bowl, and then separate 3 more eggs, with the whites going into another bowl, and the yolks going into the first bowl with the whole eggs.
', 'Step 14: Whisk until the bowl of whole eggs and yolks with a pinch of salt until light and airy.
', 'Step 15: Gradually whisk in flour and set aside.
', 'Step 16: Whisk the whites into soft peaks and use a spatula to fold the whites into the yolk mixture.
', "Step 17: You don't have to be too gentle, but the batter should end up light and foamy.
", 'Step 18: Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil over medium heat, and place down a pepper-shaped or round-shaped layer of the batter, about 1/4-thick, using about 1/8 of the batter for each pancake.
', 'Step 19: Cover the surface with sliced pepper and cheese cubes and spoon and spread another 1/8 of the batter over the top, covering up as much of the peppers and cheese as possible, going all the way to the edges.
', 'Step 20: Cover and cook until the bottom is golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes, before flipping over.
', 'Step 21: Cover and cook the second side until golden brown, or until the batter is cooked though, and the cheese inside has melted, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Ladle sauce onto a plate or into a shallow bowl and top with a chile relleno pancake.
']

Title: Tomalito - Sweet Corn Pudding or Cake
Ingredients: ['½ cup butter, softened', '⅓ cup masa harina', '¼ cup water', '2 cups frozen corn, thawed, divided', '¼ cup cornmeal', '⅓ cup white sugar', '2 tablespoons heavy whipping cream', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Beat butter in a medium bowl with an electric mixer until creamy.
', 'Step 3: Beat masa harina and water into creamed butter until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Place 1 cup corn in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Stir blended corn, remaining 1 cup corn, and cornmeal into masa harina mixture.
', 'Step 6: Mix sugar, cream, baking powder, and salt together in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 7: Pour sugar mixture into corn mixture; stir to combine.
', 'Step 8: Spoon corn batter into an ungreased 8-inch square baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Smooth the top of the batter with a spatula.
', 'Step 10: Cover dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 11: Fill a 9x13-inch casserole dish 1/3 full of hot water.
', 'Step 12: Place the covered 8-inch square dish into the water.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean, 50 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Remove 8x8-inch dish from water bath and let cool for 10 minutes.
']

Title: Fiesta Salsa
Ingredients: ['4 ½ cups finely diced fresh tomatoes', '3 tablespoons white vinegar (5% acidity)', '¼ cup Ball® Fiesta Salsa Mix - MIX WELL BEFORE MEASURING', '2 each Ball® or Kerr® Pint (16 oz) Jars with lids and bands']

["Step 1: Prepare canner, jars, and lids according to manufacturer's instructions.
", 'Step 2: Combine tomatoes, vinegar, and Ball® Fiesta Salsa Mix in large saucepan.

', 'Step 5: Ladle hot salsa into jars leaving 1/2 inch headspace.
', 'Step 6: Remove air bubbles.
', 'Step 7: Wipe rims.

Title: Mexican Chocolate Chile Cake
Ingredients: ['2 dried red chile peppers, seeded, or to taste', '1 ½ cups chopped dark chocolate', '1 cup butter', '2 tablespoons butter, divided', '1 cup blanched almonds', '1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '2 tablespoons Greek yogurt', '6 eggs, separated', '¾ cup white sugar', '6 tablespoons white sugar', '1 ½ cups chopped dark chocolate', '2 (1.2 ounce) packages milk chocolate bars, chopped', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '1 tablespoon heavy whipping cream', '2 tablespoons white sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chiles in a bowl with water to cover; let soak until slightly softened, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Place 1 1/2 cups dark chocolate and 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons butter in top of a double boiler over simmering water.
', 'Step 3: Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Line a 10-inch springform pan with parchment paper.
', 'Step 7: Place chiles in a food processor; process until finely chopped.
', 'Step 8: Add almonds, cocoa powder, flour, and cinnamon; process until almonds are chopped.
', 'Step 9: Add Greek yogurt.
', 'Step 10: Mix chile mixture thoroughly into the bowl of melted chocolate to make the batter.
', 'Step 11: Place egg yolks and egg whites into 2 different bowls.
', 'Step 12: Place 3/4 cup sugar into the bowl of egg yolks; mix until fluffy and creamy.
', 'Step 13: Stir carefully into the batter.
', 'Step 14: Beat egg whites until foamy using an electric mixer.
', 'Step 15: Add 6 tablespoons sugar gradually, continuing to beat until medium peaks form.
', 'Step 16: Blend meringue carefully into the batter; pour batter into the prepared pan.
', 'Step 17: Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out mostly clean, 25 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Let cake cool, at least 20 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Combine 1 1/2 cups dark chocolate, milk chocolate, and 2 tablespoons butter in a bowl.
', 'Step 20: Combine 1 cup plus 1 tablespoon heavy cream and 2 tablespoons sugar in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 21: Pour over the bowl of chocolate; mix thoroughly.
', 'Step 22: Let ganache cool, at least 15 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Spread over the cake.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Tinga

['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.

", 'Step 9: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 10: Transfer chicken to a cutting board to cool for 10 minutes.

']

Title: Swanny's Killer Fajitas
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into 1/4-inch wide strips', '1 lime, juiced', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon paprika', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', '⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 red bell pepper, cut into 1/4 inch strips', '½ large red onion, sliced 1/4-inch thick', '4 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '¼ cup sour cream, divided', '½ cup shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend, divided', '1 cup shredded lettuce, divided', '½ cup diced tomato, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken strips in a bowl and stir in lime juice, cumin, paprika, chili powder, cayenne pepper, and black pepper; marinate chicken for 15 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Heat a large skillet or wok over medium heat and pour in olive oil.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir red bell pepper and onion in the hot oil until softened, about 5 minutes; move vegetables to the outer edge of the skillet.
', 'Step 4: Place chicken strips with marinade in the center of the skillet and cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, about 3 minutes; cook and stir chicken and vegetables together until liquid in skillet has evaporated, about 2 more minutes.
', 'Step 5: Set chicken and vegetables aside.
', 'Step 6: Place corn tortillas on a microwave-safe plate with damp paper towels separating each tortilla.
', 'Step 7: Cook in microwave until tortillas are hot and flexible, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 8: Place corn tortillas onto 4 serving plates; spread each tortilla with 1 tablespoon sour cream.
', 'Step 9: Top each tortilla with 1/4 of the chicken and vegetable mixture; sprinkle with 2 tablespoons shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle each tortilla with 1/4 cup lettuce and 2 tablespoons diced tomato.
', 'Step 11: Top with any other desired toppings; repeat with remaining tortillas and ingredients.
']

Title: Veggie Pizzadillas
Ingredients: ['4 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '2 tablespoons olive oil, divided, or as needed', '1 onion, thinly sliced', '1 poblano chile, diced', '1 red bell pepper, diced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 cup frozen corn, thawed', '¼ teaspoon dried oregano', 'salt to taste', '¼ cup mild enchilada sauce', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '¼ cup sour cream', '½ cup crumbled queso fresco', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 dash hot pepper sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place tortillas on baking sheet covered with foil; lightly brush each with olive oil, and prick all over with fork.
', 'Step 3: Bake tortillas in the preheated oven until they are puffed and golden, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from oven and allow to cool on cooling rack.
', 'Step 5: Heat remaining olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Add onion, poblano chile, and red bell pepper; cook and stir until onions are translucent and lightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in black beans, corn, garlic, oregano, and salt; cook and stir until mixture is heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Return tortillas to the foil-lined baking sheet in a single layer; spoon 1 tablespoon enchilada sauce over each tortilla.
', 'Step 9: Top with 1/4 of the black bean and corn mixture and 1/4 of the shredded Mexican cheese.
', 'Step 10: Bake pizzadillas in the preheated oven until cheese has melted, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove pizzadillas from oven; top each with sour cream, queso fresco, and cilantro.
', 'Step 12: Add a dash of hot pepper sauce to each slice.
']

']

Title: Shrimp and Octopus Soup (Caldo de Camaron y Pulpo)

Title: Cuban Tamales
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil, divided', '1 ½ pounds boneless country-style pork ribs, cut into small pieces', '1 cup dry white wine, divided', '2 cups water', '10 cloves garlic, minced, divided', '2 tablespoons tomato paste, divided', '2 cubes beef bouillon (such as Knorr®)', '2 bay leaves', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 links Spanish chorizo sausage (such as Goya®), thinly sliced', '1 yellow onion, diced', '1 small green bell pepper, chopped', '½ cup pimento-stuffed green olives', '4 cups frozen corn, thawed', '1 ½ cups masa harina', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '1 tablespoon white vinegar', '1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', '1 (8 ounce) package dried corn husks, soaked in warm water', 'kitchen twine, cut into 12-inch lengths']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir pork in hot oil until lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Pour 1/2 cup white wine into saucepan and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 4: Stir 2 cups water, 5 cloves garlic, 1 tablespoon tomato paste, 1 beef bouillon cube, bay leaves, cumin, oregano, and black pepper to pork mixture.
', 'Step 5: Bring mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low, partially cover the saucepan with a lid, and simmer until pork is very tender, 1 to 2 hours.
', 'Step 6: Transfer pork to a bowl and reserve cooking liquid.
', 'Step 7: Heat remaining olive oil in a deep pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 8: Cook and stir chorizo and cooked pork in hot oil until lightly browned, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir onion, green pepper, and remaining minced garlic into chorizo mixture; saute until vegetables soften and onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add remaining white wine, olives, 1 tablespoon tomato paste, and remaining bouillon cube; cook, stirring frequently, until flavors combine, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 11: Pulse corn and 1 1/2 cups reserved pork broth together in a blender or food processor until mixture has a thick and chunky consistency.
', 'Step 12: Stir corn mixture into pork-chorizo mixture.
', 'Step 13: Reduce heat to medium and stir masa harina, sugar, vinegar, and salt into pork mixture; cook, stirring occasionally, until mixture has a hearty cornmeal porridge-consistency.
', 'Step 14: Season with salt and remove from heat.
', 'Step 15: Make a pocket out of one corn husk and fill 3/4 full with pork mixture, leaving a top flap.
', 'Step 16: Wrap another husk around the filled pocket.
', 'Step 17: Fold top flap over the pocket.
', 'Step 18: Tie twine length- and width-wise around the tamale several times so that packet is secure, but has room for filling to expand during cooking.
', 'Step 19: Repeat with remaining husks and filling.
', 'Step 20: Fill a pot with 2-inches of water; bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 21: Place tamales upright in simmering water, cover the pot, and cook, adding water as necessary, until filling is hot and set, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Cool tamales until completely set, at least 3 hours.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '284.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '24 g', 'cholesterolContent': '33.2 mg', 'fatContent': '15.4 g', 'fiberContent': '3.3 g', 'proteinContent': '11.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '603.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.4 g'}

Title: Turkey Posole

['Step 1: In a large Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook onions and poblano chiles in oil until soft.

Title: Lighter Mexican Meatloaf
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 pound lean ground turkey', '1 pound ground chicken', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained and rinsed', '½ (4 ounce) can fire-roasted diced green chiles', '1 cup mild chunky salsa', '1 (1 ounce) package dry taco seasoning mix', '¾ cup plain dried breadcrumbs', '3 egg whites', '1 (28 ounce) can enchilada sauce, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: In a large bowl, mix together the ground turkey, ground chicken, black beans, corn, green chiles, salsa, taco seasoning, bread crumbs, and egg whites until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 4: Form the mixture into a loaf shape and place into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 5: Pour half the enchilada sauce over the meatloaf.
', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from oven and pour the remaining sauce over the loaf.
', 'Step 8: Return to oven and cook until the meatloaf is no longer pink inside and the juices run clear, another 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: An instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the center of the meat loaf should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Slice and serve with pan sauce spooned over the slices.
']

Title: Tequila-Lime Chicken
Ingredients: ['3 skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '½ cup tequila', '1 lime, zested and juiced', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder, divided', '¼ teaspoon chili powder, divided', '3 ounces shredded Mexican-style cheese blend']

['Step 1: Arrange chicken breasts in a baking dish; add tequila and juice of 1/2 a lime.
', 'Step 2: Sprinkle 1/2 of the lime zest, 1/2 of the garlic powder, and 1/2 of the chili powder over the chicken.
', 'Step 3: Cover dish with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Turn chicken breasts; sprinkle remaining lime juice, lime zest, garlic powder, and chili powder on top.
', 'Step 5: Cover again and marinate in the refrigerator for another 30 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Uncover baking dish and discard tequila-lime marinade.
', 'Step 8: Bake chicken in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle Mexican-style cheese over the chicken and continue to bake until the chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 10: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
']

Title: Albondigas (Meatballs) en Chipotle
Ingredients: ['5 tomatoes, chopped', '1 small onion', '1 clove garlic', '1 tablespoon adobo sauce from chipotle peppers', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '3 cups chicken stock', '4 fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '2 eggs', '1 small onion', '2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '2 cloves garlic', '1 tablespoon chicken bouillon granules', '5 sprigs fresh cilantro, chopped', '1 pound ground beef', '1 pound ground pork', '1 cup cooked rice']

', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir tomato mixture in hot oil until fragrant, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in chicken stock and continue to cook for 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 4: Meanwhile, blend tomatillos, eggs, 1 small onion, chipotle peppers, 2 cloves garlic, chicken bouillon, and cilantro in a blender or food processor until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Transfer mixture to a large bowl and add beef, pork, and rice; stir to combine.

Title: Savory Halibut Enchiladas

Title: Air Fryer Vegetarian Cauliflower and Chickpea Tacos

Title: Huevos Rancheros Frittata

Title: Green Enchilada Pork Chili
Ingredients: ['4 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '1 pound ground pork', '2 fresh jalapeno peppers, stems removed', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 medium white onion, diced', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon sweet paprika', '¼ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '1 (28 ounce) can green enchilada sauce', '1 (7 ounce) can green salsa', '1 quart water', '½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '½ lime, juiced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a 4 quart pot, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add the jalapenos and saute for 1 minute.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the ground pork and cook until evenly brown.
', 'Step 4: Remove the browned pork and jalapenos from the pot and set aside.
', 'Step 5: In the same pot used to cook the meat, add the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, butter, and onion.
', 'Step 6: Cook for 2 minutes or until the onion starts to soften.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the salt, cumin, paprika, cayenne, and black pepper and cook until the onion is soft.
', 'Step 8: Mix in the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 9: Reduce the heat to low.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle the flour over the onion and garlic.
', 'Step 11: Cook, stirring for three minutes.
', 'Step 12: Slowly pour the enchilada sauce into the onion mixture, whisking constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
', 'Step 13: Mix in the green salsa and water.
', 'Step 14: Return the cooked pork and jalapenos to the pot.
', 'Step 15: Increase the heat to medium and slowly bring the soup to a boil.
', 'Step 16: When the soup boils, reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Before serving remove from heat and stir in chopped cilantro and lime juice.
']

Title: Beef Enchilada Soup
Ingredients: ['4 pounds browned ground beef', '1 (28 ounce) can crushed tomatoes', '1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can sweet corn', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '1 (14.5 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '2 (14 ounce) cans beef broth', '2 (1.25 ounce) packages taco seasoning']
Cooking Instructions: ['Step 1: Combine drained browned ground beef, tomatoes, kidney beans, black beans, corn, chiles, enchilada sauce, beef broth, and taco seasoning in a slow cooker.\n', 'Step 2: Cover and cook on Low for about 8 hours or High for about 4 hours.\n']

Title: Garden Tomato Salsa
Ingredients: ['½ sweet onion, chopped', '½ green bell pepper, coarsely chopped', '¼ cup fresh cilantro', '5 slices pickled jalapeno peppers, or to taste', '6 fresh tomatoes, quartered', '2 teaspoons olive oil', '2 teaspoons red wine vinegar', '½ lime, juiced', '⅛ teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place onion, bell pepper, cilantro, and jalapeno peppers into a food processor.
', 'Step 2: Pulse until finely chopped.
', 'Step 3: Add tomatoes, and pulse just a few times until the tomatoes are coarsely chopped.
', 'Step 4: Transfer to a bowl with a tight-fitting lid.
', 'Step 5: In a separate bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, lime juice, and salt.
', 'Step 6: Pour dressing over tomatoes, and stir well.
', 'Step 7: Cover, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
']

Title: Corn and Black Bean Guacamole
Ingredients: ['½ red bell pepper, minced', '½ red onion, minced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '½ (15.25 ounce) can sweet corn, drained', '½ (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '3 medium (blank)s ripe avocados, peeled, pitted and sliced', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 pinch ground black pepper, or to taste', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions: ['Step 1: Stir red bell pepper, red onion, garlic, sweet corn, black beans, and avocado slices together in a large bowl.\n', 'Step 2: Mix lime juice, salt, black pepper, and cilantro into avocado mixture until desired texture is achieved.\n']

Title: Chicken Tostadas
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, diced', '½ (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '6 corn tostada shells', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 tomato, diced', '¾ red onion, diced', '¾ green bell pepper, diced', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ cup salsa, or to taste', '¼ cup sour cream, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place chicken into a frying pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Sprinkle with taco seasoning and cook until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Spread a thin layer of refried beans onto each tostada shell; sprinkle each with Mexican cheese.
', 'Step 6: Divide cooked chicken on top of cheese layer.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle tomato, red onion, and bell pepper evenly on top of each tostada.
', 'Step 8: Place tostadas on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until crispy, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Remove tostadas from the oven.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle with cilantro and spread salsa and sour cream on top.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '311.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '26.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '54.8 mg', 'fatContent': '14.5 g', 'fiberContent': '6 g', 'proteinContent': '19.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '711.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.5 g'}

Title: Mexican Chicken Soup with Rice (Caldo de Pollo con Arroz)
Ingredients: ['2 cups water', '1 cup uncooked white rice', '5 tomatoes', '½ onion, roughly chopped', '2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 clove garlic', '1 pinch ground black pepper', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '2 carrots, peeled and diced', '1 cup chopped celery', '1 quart chicken broth', '1 cube chicken bouillon', '½ pound fresh green peas', '1 cooked chicken breast, shredded', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and sliced', '½ (8 ounce) package Monterey Jack cheese, diced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Place tomatoes in a pot with water to cover.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil and cook until soft but not falling apart, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain and let cool briefly.
', 'Step 6: Peel and place in a blender; add onion, chipotle peppers, garlic, and black pepper.
', 'Step 7: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 8: Strain mixture, discarding solids, for the sauce.
', 'Step 9: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Add carrots and celery; saute until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Pour in blended tomato sauce.
', 'Step 12: Add chicken broth and bouillon.
', 'Step 13: Cook and stir until carrot and celery are soft, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Add peas and chicken breast; cook until heated through, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Serve soup over a spoonful of rice; top with avocado slices and Monterey Jack cheese.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '424.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '42 g', 'cholesterolContent': '31.9 mg', 'fatContent': '21.9 g', 'fiberContent': '7 g', 'proteinContent': '16 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '1006.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.4 g'}

Title: Best Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 (10 inch) flour tortilla', '¼ cup vegetarian refried beans', '1 slice American cheese', '1 pinch ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon low-fat sour cream', '1 dash hot pepper sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a small pot heat the refried beans until they are heated through, approximately 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Warm the tortilla in a dry frying pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Lay the burrito on a flat surface.
', 'Step 4: Place the refried bean in the center of the burrito, layer the cheese, pepper, sour cream and hot sauce over the beans.
', 'Step 5: Roll the tortilla so that the mixture is wrapped in the center.
', 'Step 6: Serve warm.
']

Title: Super Easy Chilaquiles
Ingredients: ['5 tablespoons corn oil', '8 (8 inch) corn tortillas, cut into triangles', '6 eggs', '1 cup chipotle salsa', '1 cup shredded pepper Jack cheese', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat and pan-fry tortilla triangles until they are just starting to turn golden brown and crisp, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Add salsa, reduce heat to medium-low, and carefully mix tortillas and salsa with a spatula.
', 'Step 3: Cook for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Beat eggs, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
', 'Step 5: Add eggs to tortillas and increase heat to medium-high.
', 'Step 6: Scramble eggs gently until just set.
', 'Step 7: Top with pepper Jack cheese, cover, and turn off the heat.
', 'Step 8: Let sit for 3 minutes until cheese is melted.
']

Title: Tostones Rellenos (Stuffed Plantain Cups)
Ingredients: ['3 cups canola oil for frying', '2 green plantains, peeled and sliced crosswise into fourths', '2 teaspoons garlic salt', '1 pound lean ground beef', '¾ teaspoon salt', '½ cup sofrito', '½ cup tomato sauce', '¼ cup water', '1 (1.41 ounce) package sazon seasoning', '5 pitted green olives, chopped', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat canola oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Fry the plantains in the preheated oil until golden, but not brown, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Smash each piece of plantain in a tostonero or with the bottom of a small dish to make a small disk, then shape the disk into a small cup.
', 'Step 4: Return the plantain cups to the hot oil, and fry until golden and crisp, 5 to 7 minutes more.
', 'Step 5: Season with garlic salt.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and stir in the ground beef.
', 'Step 9: Season with salt.
', 'Step 10: Cook and stir until the beef is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink.
', 'Step 11: Drain and discard any excess grease.
', 'Step 12: Stir in the sofrito, tomato sauce, water, sazon seasoning, and olives.
', 'Step 13: Reduce heat to medium-low, then simmer until liquid is reduced, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Fill the plantain cups with the beef mixture and top with Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 15: Arrange the cups on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted, 5 to 8 minutes.
']

Title: Cinnamon Tortilla Surprise
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 cup white sugar', '1 ½ tablespoons ground cinnamon', '10 large flour tortillas, cut into quarters', '¼ cup melted butter, or as needed', '1 cup milk', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '2 (3 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix', '1 (16 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed', '2 tablespoons chocolate syrup, or as needed', '40 maraschino cherries']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray 40 muffin cups with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Combine sugar and cinnamon together in a small bowl.
', 'Step 4: Brush both sides of flour tortilla pieces with melted butter; sprinkle each with cinnamon-sugar mixture.
', 'Step 5: Gently fit each tortilla piece into a prepared muffin cup, shaping the tortilla to make a shell.
', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until tortilla shells are golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Beat milk, cream cheese, and pudding mix in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth; fold in whipped topping.
', 'Step 8: Fill each tortilla shell with about 1 tablespoon cream cheese mixture.
', 'Step 9: Drizzle with chocolate syrup and top each with a maraschino cherry.
']

Title: Enchilada Casserole II
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds lean ground beef', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoons chili powder', 'salt to taste', '4 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a deep dish pie plate; set aside.
', 'Step 3: In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef and onion until beef is no longer pink; drain fat.
', 'Step 4: Return to the heat and push the meat and onion to the sides of the pan.
', 'Step 5: Add the garlic to the center of the pan and cook briefly.
', 'Step 6: Stir the beef and onion together with the garlic.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the tomato sauce, tomato paste, cumin, chili powder and salt to taste.
', 'Step 8: Mix well and allow to thicken slightly.
', 'Step 9: Spoon a thin layer of the beef mixture onto the bottom of the pie plate.
', 'Step 10: Begin layering the tortilla, beef mixture, then cheese, ending with a final layer of cheese on the top.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until cheese is melted and lightly browned.
']

Title: Thick-Style Flour Tortillas
Ingredients: ['4 cups all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 ¼ cups warm water, or more as needed', '¼ cup canola oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix flour, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Combine water and canola oil in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 3: Mix into the flour mixture with a fork until dough forms a ball, adding 1/4 cup water if dough is too dry.
', 'Step 4: Knead dough until smooth, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Divide into 14 egg-size balls.
', 'Step 6: Cover bowl with a cotton towel.
', 'Step 7: Let dough rest for 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Roll 1 ball dough into an 8-inch tortilla on a floured work surface.
', 'Step 9: Repeat with remaining dough.
', 'Step 10: Preheat an ungreased cast iron griddle on medium-high heat.
', 'Step 11: Place 1 tortilla on the hot griddle; cook until browned spots form, about 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 12: Transfer to a plate; cover with a cotton towel to keep warm.
', 'Step 13: Repeat with remaining tortillas, stacking them under the towel.
']

Ingredients: ['3 limes, juiced', '2 green onions, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '½ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '¼ teaspoon ground coriander', '¼ teaspoon ground anise seed']

Title: Salsa Borracha (Drunk Salsa)
Ingredients: ['4 fresh tomatoes', '10 fresh jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded', '1 (12 fluid ounce) bottle Mexican beer', '½ cup water, or as needed', '1 clove garlic', '1 slice onion', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:

', 'Step 2: Add enough water so that the tomatoes and jalapenos are covered.
', 'Step 3: Simmer over medium heat until soft.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat, and let cool slightly.
', 'Step 5: Transfer the tomatoes and jalapenos to a blender, and add the garlic and onion.
', 'Step 6: Pulse until well blended.
', 'Step 7: Add some of the cooking liquid to help with blending if necessary.
', 'Step 8: Taste, and season with salt.
']

Title: Bacon, Potato, and Egg Taco Ole
Ingredients: ['8 bacon strips', '8 eggs', '⅓ cup milk', '3 tablespoons water', 'salt and pepper to taste', '⅓ cup diced onion', '2 large potatoes, peeled and chopped', '1 tablespoon butter', '4 corn or flour tortilla']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place bacon in a skillet.
', 'Step 2: Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown.
', 'Step 3: Keeping drippings in the skillet, remove the bacon and drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 4: Crumble the bacon.
', 'Step 5: While the bacon is cooking, mix the eggs, milk, water, salt, and pepper in a bowl until combined.
', 'Step 6: Add potatoes to the bacon drippings and cook until semi-soft.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the onions.
', 'Step 8: Cook and stir for 1 minute.
', 'Step 9: Pour the egg mixture into the skillet.
', 'Step 10: Stir in the crumbled bacon and the butter.
', 'Step 11: Cook until the eggs set to your desired firmness.
', 'Step 12: Spoon mixture into tortillas and serve.
']

Title: Easy One-Skillet Ground Beef Burrito
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, partially drained', '1 cup salsa', '⅔ cup water', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning', '4 (8 inch) flour tortillas, cut into strips', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (8 ounce) carton sour cream, or to taste']

']

Title: Camarones al Mojo de Ajo (Mexican Shrimp in Garlic Mojo Sauce)
Ingredients: ['½ cup olive oil, divided', '½ cup butter, divided', '1 head garlic, cloves peeled', '2 limes, juiced', '2 tablespoons white vinegar', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 pounds cleaned baby squid, bodies sliced crosswise into 1/2 rings, large tentacles halved', '12 large jumbo prawns, cleaned', '2 dried pasilla chile, seeded and sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine 1/4 olive oil, 1/4 cup of butter, garlic, lime juice, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a blender; blend until marinade is smooth.
', 'Step 2: Place squid and prawns into a bowl, pour in marinade, and stir until well coated.
', 'Step 3: Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Heat remaining 1/4 cup olive oil and 1/4 cup butter in a skillet over medium heat and cook chile until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add squid and shrimp; cook and stir until evenly browned, 10 to 15 minutes per side.
']

Title: Tacos de Alambre
Ingredients: ['8 slices bacon', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, diced', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '4 jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped', '1 ½ pounds ground beef', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '32 corn tortillas', '4 roma (plum) tomatoes, diced', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the bacon in a large, deep skillet, and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain the bacon slices on a paper towel-lined plate, reserving grease in the skillet.
', 'Step 3: Crumble the bacon strips once cool.
', 'Step 4: Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the onion, garlic, and jalapeno peppers; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Increase the heat to medium-high, and stir in the ground beef; season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Cook and stir until the ground beef is crumbly and no longer pink, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Drain off any excess liquid.
', 'Step 9: Scrape the beef mixture into the skillet of bacon grease.
', 'Step 10: Crumble the bacon into the beef, and stir until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 11: Keep warm over low heat.
', 'Step 12: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a clean skillet over medium-high heat until hot.
', 'Step 13: Place a tortilla into the pan, and place a generous spoonful of the meat filling onto the lower half of the tortilla.
', 'Step 14: Cook until bubbles begin to form in the tortilla, then fold over the meat.
', 'Step 15: Continue cooking until the taco is crisp and lightly browned on each side, 1 to 2 minutes total.
', 'Step 16: Repeat with the remaining tortillas and meat mixture.
', 'Step 17: Top the tacos with diced tomatoes and shredded Monterey Jack cheese to serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '664 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '51.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '97.2 mg', 'fatContent': '37.8 g', 'fiberContent': '7.6 g', 'proteinContent': '31.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '14.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '627.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.3 g'}

Title: Easy Chicken Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '6 chicken breast tenders', '1 (.18 ounce) packet sazon seasoning', '1 teaspoon garlic salt', '1 cup instant rice', '1 cup water', '1 (14 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (.18 ounce) packet sazon seasoning', '1 teaspoon garlic salt', '8 extra-large flour tortillas', '1 (16 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 tablespoon softened butter, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir chicken, 1 packet sazon seasoning, and 1 teaspoon garlic salt, shredding chicken as it cooks until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Bring rice and water to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir black beans, 1 packet sazon seasoning, and teaspoon garlic salt together in a microwave-safe bowl.
', 'Step 5: Cook in microwave until heated through, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add black bean mixture to rice.
', 'Step 7: Place each tortilla on a work surface; layer half of each tortilla with bean-rice mixture, Mexican cheese, shredded chicken, and more Mexican cheese.
', 'Step 8: Fold each tortilla in half.
', 'Step 9: Spread a thin layer of softened butter atop each quesadilla.
', 'Step 10: Heat a large skillet over medium heat; cook each quesadilla, butter-side down, until cheese is melted and outside is crisp and brown, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 11: Cut into wedges.
']

Title: Tilapia Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '¼ teaspoon fajita seasoning', '4 (4 ounce) tilapia fillets', '¾ cup frozen white corn', '¾ cup canned black beans', '⅛ teaspoon fajita seasoning', '2 pineapple rings, cut into chunks', '½ small red onion, chopped', '1 tablespoon olive oil, divided', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 avocado, sliced', '⅛ head cabbage, chopped', '¼ cup sour cream', '½ lime, cut into wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon fajita seasoning over tilapia fillets and arrange on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Bake tilapia in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove fish from oven and cut each fillet into 3 pieces.
', 'Step 6: Spray a skillet with cooking spray and add corn, black beans, and 1/8 teaspoon fajita seasoning; cook and stir over medium-high heat until heated through, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove skillet from heat.
', 'Step 8: Spray a separate skillet with cooking spray and add pineapple; cook and stir over medium-high heat until lightly browned, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add onion to pineapple; cook and stir until heated through, about 1 minute more.
', 'Step 10: Remove skillet from heat.
', 'Step 11: Pour 1 teaspoon olive oil in a large skillet over high heat; add 4 tortillas and cook until heated through, about 30 seconds per side.
', 'Step 12: Remove tortillas from skillet and repeat cooking the remaining tortillas in the remaining oil.
', 'Step 13: Place a piece of tilapia onto each tortilla and top with corn mixture, pineapple mixture, cilantro, avocado, cabbage, sour cream and a squeeze of lime.
']

Title: Chicken Fajita Bowl

Title: Watermelon-Cucumber Agua Fresca
Ingredients: ['4 cups cubed seeded watermelon', '2 ½ cups water, divided', '1 cup peeled, chopped cucumber', '¼ cup freshly squeezed lime juice', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®)', '1 wedge fresh lime', 'ice as needed', '4 slices watermelon', '4 slices lime']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place watermelon and 1 1/2 cups water in a blender, and process at high speed until combined, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 2: Add cucumber, lime juice, and sugar; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Pour mixture through a fine mesh strainer and using a spatula, press to remove the pulp.
', "Step 4: Don't skip this step, it's important.
", 'Step 5: Pour the strained mixture into a large pitcher, add remaining 1 cup water, and stir well.
', 'Step 6: Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or longer.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle some Tajin® (chili lime seasoning) onto a small plate.
', 'Step 8: Run the lime wedge around the top of the glass, invert the glass, and dip the rim into the seasoning.
', 'Step 9: Fill the glass with ice, pour in the agua fresca, garnish with watermelon slices or wedges, and lime slices.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Mexican Quinoa
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 small onion, chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, minced, or to taste', '3 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (14.5 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '¾ cup corn kernels', '¾ teaspoon salt, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '⅛ teaspoon black pepper', '1 cup dry quinoa', '1 cup vegetable broth, or as needed', '2 tablespoons chopped cilantro, or to taste', '1 lime, juiced', '1 avocado, diced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 2: Add oil, onion, jalapeno pepper, and garlic.
', 'Step 3: Saute until onion is softened, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add black beans, tomatoes, and corn; mix well.
', 'Step 5: Season with salt, cumin, paprika, chili powder, and black pepper.
', 'Step 6: Add quinoa and toss until well combined.
', 'Step 7: Pour in broth and mix.
', 'Step 8: Close and lock the lid; set valve to the sealing position.
', "Step 9: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 1 minute.
", 'Step 10: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 11: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes.
", 'Step 12: Open the pot and fluff quinoa using a fork.
', 'Step 13: Add cilantro and lime juice.
', 'Step 14: Stir in avocado.
']

Title: Honey-Lime Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['⅓ cup honey', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '⅓ cup lime juice', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pound shredded, cooked chicken', '2 cups green enchilada sauce, divided', '6 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '10 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 cup fat free half-and-half']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk together the honey, chili powder, lime juice, and minced garlic in a large glass or ceramic bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add the shredded cooked chicken and toss to evenly coat.
', 'Step 3: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least a half hour.
', 'Step 4: Remove the shredded chicken from the marinade, and shake off excess.
', 'Step 5: Save the used marinade.
', 'Step 6: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish, and spread 1/2 cup of enchilada sauce over the bottom.
', 'Step 8: Combine marinated shredded chicken with 5 cups of shredded Monterey Jack cheese in a bowl.
', 'Step 9: Mix lightly.
', 'Step 10: Spoon about 3/4 cup of the chicken-cheese mixture down the center of each tortilla.
', 'Step 11: Roll tortillas and place seam-side down in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 12: In a bowl, whisk together remaining enchilada sauce, fat-free half-and-half, and remaining marinade.
', 'Step 13: Pour sauce over enchiladas and sprinkle top with 1 cup of shredded Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 14: Bake in preheated oven until the cheese has melted and the top is brown, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Easy Money Breakfast Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 pound bulk pork sausage', '½ small onion, chopped', '2 teaspoons butter', '12 eggs, beaten', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chilies, drained', '¾ cup process cheese food (such as Velveeta®), divided', '¾ cup salsa', '1 (10 ounce) package burrito-size flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the pork sausage and onion into a skillet over medium heat, and cook until the sausage is browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Break the meat apart into crumbles as it cooks.
', 'Step 3: Drain the excess grease.
', 'Step 4: In a separate skillet over medium heat, melt the butter until the foam subsides, and cook and stir the beaten eggs with the chilies until softly scrambled but not wet, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Transfer the scrambled eggs into a large bowl, and stir in the cooked sausage mixture.
', 'Step 6: Place a tortilla onto a microwave-safe plate, and cook in the microwave on High setting for 10 to 20 seconds.
', 'Step 7: The tortilla should be warm and pliable.
', 'Step 8: Spoon about 1/2 cup of the sausage and egg mixture in a line down the the tortilla, slightly off center.
', 'Step 9: Top with about 1 tablespoon of shredded cheese, and 1 tablespoon of salsa.
', 'Step 10: Fold 2 opposite ends of the tortilla over the filling.
', 'Step 11: Press the 2 ends down so they stay folded.
', 'Step 12: Carefully roll the shorter unfolded edge over the burrito, pushing the filling to the back of the roll as you go, to snugly enclose the filling.
', 'Step 13: Keep the 2 ends folded as you roll.
', 'Step 14: Wrap in foil if desired.
', 'Step 15: Repeat with the rest of the tortillas.
']

Title: Green Chicken Tamales
Ingredients: ['corn husks', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', 'salt to taste', 'water to cover', '¾ pound fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '2 serrano peppers, or more to taste', '1 onion, chopped', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 cup unsalted butter, softened, divided', '3 cups chicken broth', '1 pound masa harina', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 ½ teaspoons salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place corn husks in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and soak for 30 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain, place on a work surface, and cover with a clean, damp towel.
', 'Step 3: Place chicken in a pot, season with salt, and cover with water.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, reduce heat, cover, and simmer until chicken is cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain chicken and shred with 2 forks.
', 'Step 6: Place tomatillo and serrano peppers in a pot while chicken is cooking, cover with water, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Cook until tomatillos are soft and have changed color, but are not falling apart, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Combine tomatillos, serrano peppers, onion, cilantro, and garlic in a blender; blend into a smooth sauce.
', 'Step 9: Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a saucepan over medium heat and add tomatillo sauce.
', 'Step 10: Cook until sauce has slightly thickened, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add shredded chicken and season filling with salt.
', 'Step 12: Beat remaining butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until creamy.
', 'Step 13: Add chicken broth, masa harina, baking powder, and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and beat well until combined and the consistency of cookie dough.
', "Step 14: Test if the masa is ready by dropping a small ball of masa into a glass of cold water; if it floats, it's ready, if not, keep beating for a little longer.
", 'Step 15: Select 1 wide corn husk or 2 small ones.
', 'Step 16: Spread about 2 tablespoons masa mixture onto the the corn husk, filling it up to 2 inches from the bottom and 1/4 inch from the top.
', 'Step 17: Add 1 tablespoon of filling down the center of the masa mixture.
', 'Step 18: Fold sides of husk together, one over the other.
', 'Step 19: Fold the bottom of the husk over the seam of the 2 folded sides.
', 'Step 20: Repeat with remaining husks.
', 'Step 21: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 22: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 23: Add tamales with the open side up and cook until filling is heated through and separates from the husk, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 24: Let tamales stand for 15 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Torta de Milanesa de Pollo
Ingredients: ['½ pound skinless, boneless chicken breast', '1 ½ tablespoons cornstarch', '1 egg', '⅓ cup bread crumbs', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 teaspoon ground chipotle pepper', '1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper', '2 bolillo rolls, sliced in half lengthwise', '3 tablespoons mayonnaise', '1 tablespoon hot sauce (such as Valentina®)', '2 tablespoons sunflower seed oil', '½ avocado, sliced', '3 slices tomato', '2 lettuce leaves', '1 tablespoon pickled carrots', '1 tablespoon pickled jalapeno peppers']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Seal chicken breast in a resealable zip-top plastic bag.
', 'Step 3: Pound flat to 1/4-inch thickness.
', 'Step 4: Add cornstarch and shake to coat.
', 'Step 5: Whisk egg in a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 6: Dredge the chicken breast through the egg; leave it in the bowl.
', 'Step 7: Add bread crumbs, cilantro, chipotle, oregano, cumin, and pepper to the bag; shake well.
', 'Step 8: Lift chicken from the bowl, letting any excess egg drip off.
', 'Step 9: Add to the bread crumb mixture.
', 'Step 10: Shake and press the seasoned bread crumbs over the chicken breast.
', 'Step 11: Place bolillo buns in the preheated oven until warmed through and toasted, about 12 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Meanwhile, mix mayonnaise and hot sauce together in a small mixing bowl.
', 'Step 13: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 14: Cook chicken until browned, about 6 minutes per side.
', 'Step 15: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 16: Cut the chicken in half lengthwise.
', 'Step 17: Assemble the sandwiches.
', 'Step 18: Spread the spicy mayonnaise over both sides of the rolls.
', 'Step 19: Add equal amounts of avocado, tomato, lettuce, carrots, and jalapenos to 2 halves.
', 'Step 20: Add chicken and the tops of the rolls.
', 'Step 21: Serve with the remaining spicy mayonnaise for dipping.
']

Title: Capirotada (Mexican Dessert)
Ingredients: ['3 cups water', '16 ounces piloncillo (Mexican brown sugar cone), chopped', '3 cinnamon sticks', '2 tablespoons raw sugar', '2 tablespoons vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '¼ cup butter', '1 (18 ounce) loaf French bread, sliced', '1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 ½ cups chopped walnuts', '½ cup raisins', '½ cup chopped dried apricots']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine water, piloncillo, cinnamon sticks, sugar, vanilla extract, and cloves in a pot.

', 'Step 4: Reduce heat and cook until slightly thickened and reduced to a syrup, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove cinnamon sticks.
', 'Step 6: Lightly butter each slice of bread.
', 'Step 7: Place slices in a large, flat baking pan.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until toasted, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Let butter dry.
', 'Step 10: Grease a 9x13-inch cake pan and add 1/2 of the toasted bread.

', 'Step 14: Cover with aluminum foil.

', 'Step 16: Remove foil and continue baking until lightly browned and heated through, about 15 minutes more.
', 'Step 17: Serve warm.
']

Title: Jericallas (Mexican Baked Custards)

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and cinnamon sticks in a small saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Simmer for 3 minutes, then turn off and allow to cool until lukewarm.

', 'Step 10: Check the water level every so often so it does not cook dry, adding more water if needed.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Guisado Verde
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 pounds boneless pork shoulder', '1 large onion, coarsely chopped', '3 cloves garlic, chopped', '2 (12 ounce) cans tomatillos, drained and chopped', '1 (7 ounce) can diced green chile peppers', '2 fresh jalapeno peppers, sliced', '½ cup fresh chopped cilantro', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 quart water', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '¼ cup sour cream', '4 sprigs fresh cilantro, for garnish']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat, and brown the pork on all sides.
', 'Step 2: Reserving the juices in the skillet, transfer the pork to a slow cooker.
', 'Step 3: In the skillet with the pork juices over medium heat, saute the onion and garlic about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Transfer to the slow cooker, along with skillet juices.
', 'Step 5: Mix the tomatillos, green chile peppers, jalapeno peppers, and cilantro into the slow cooker.
', 'Step 6: Season with oregano, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Pour in 1 quart water, or enough to cover all ingredients.
', 'Step 8: Cover, and cook on High for 6 to 7 hours.
', 'Step 9: Shred the cooked pork with a fork.
', 'Step 10: Spoon the slow cooker mixture into bowls, and top with Monterey Jack cheese, sour cream, and fresh cilantro sprigs to serve.
']

Title: Mexican Pork Chili (Chile Verde)
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds fresh tomatillos, or more to taste, husks removed', '3 serrano peppers', '4 cloves garlic, peeled', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '3 tablespoons lard', '3 pounds pork shoulder, or more to taste, trimmed and cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes', '2 teaspoons garlic salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 medium yellow onion, coarsely chopped', '1 green bell pepper, coarsely chopped', '½ cup red wine', '1 cup low-sodium chicken stock', '⅓ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon kosher salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine tomatillos, serrano peppers, and garlic in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Drizzle with olive oil and toss to coat.
', 'Step 4: Transfer to a baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: Place in the preheated oven and roast until tender, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove vegetables from oven, cool slightly, and transfer to the bowl of a food processor.
', 'Step 7: Puree until smooth.
', 'Step 8: Reduce oven temperature to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: While vegetables are roasting, heat lard in a Dutch oven or heavy oven-safe pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle pork with garlic salt and pepper and add to the pot in batches.
', 'Step 11: Cook each batch until browned, about 7 minutes, removing to a plate with a slotted spoon.
', 'Step 12: Drain and discard all but 2 tablespoons pan drippings.
', 'Step 13: Add onion and bell pepper to the pot.
', 'Step 14: Saute, stirring occasionally, until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Pour wine into the pan and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 16: Stir in browned pork, tomatillo puree, chicken stock, cilantro, oregano, cumin, and salt.
', 'Step 17: Cover and cook in the oven until pork is tender, 3 1/2 to 4 hours.
', 'Step 18: Allow to stand for 15 minutes, covered, before serving.
']

Title: Baked Chiles Rellenos
Ingredients: ['8 medium poblano peppers', '4 large eggs', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '⅓ cup milk', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 (12 ounce) package queso fresco', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Roast peppers on the top rack of the preheated oven until the skins are charred, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 3: Remove from the oven and allow to cool enough to handle, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Set the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: While peppers are cooling, whisk eggs, flour, milk, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Slice the queso fresco into eight even rectangles, just shorter than the length of the peppers.
', 'Step 7: Carefully peel off the waxy skin of the cooled peppers.
', 'Step 8: Gently cut a slit down the length of the peppers and use a spoon to remove the seeds and membranes.
', 'Step 9: Spread about 1/4 cup of the milk mixture on the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Wrap each pepper around a queso fresco rectangle.
', 'Step 11: Place each chile/cheese wrap seam-side down in a single layer in the baking dish.
', 'Step 12: Cover with remaining egg mixture.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle Cheddar cheese over the top.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until the egg mixture has risen and the cheese is golden brown, about 30 minutes.
']

Ingredients: ['8 Mission® Soft Taco Flour Tortillas', 'Cooking spray', '¼ cup chicken broth', '1 (16 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast', '1 medium onion, diced', '1 red pepper, stemmed, seeded, and diced', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed, drained', '1 cup corn kernels', '¼ cup packed chopped fresh cilantro', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '2 ¼ cups grated low-fat sharp Cheddar cheese, divided', '⅔ cup fat-free sour cream', '⅔ cup enchilada sauce', 'Hot pepper sauce such as Tabasco®', 'Salt and pepper to taste']

Title: Poblano Chicken Cheese Soup

Title: Guacamole Cilantro Lime Cheeseburger

Title: Cochinita Pibil (Mexican Pulled Pork in Annatto Sauce)
Ingredients: ['3 ounces achiote paste', '1 white onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic', '2 cups orange juice', '½ cup lemon juice', '¼ cup white vinegar', '2 tablespoons salt', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon dried Mexican oregano', '5 pounds pork shoulder roast', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon lard', '1 red onion, chopped', '3 habanero chiles, seeded and sliced', '¼ cup lemon juice', '¼ cup white vinegar', '1 cup lukewarm water', 'sea salt and ground black pepper to taste', 'dried oregano']

['Step 1: Combine achiote paste, white onion, garlic, orange juice, lemon juice, 1/4 cup vinegar, 2 tablespoons salt, 1 tablespoon black pepper, and 1 tablespoon Mexican oregano in a blender; blend marinade until smooth.

', 'Step 3: Add lard and pour marinade over pork.
', 'Step 4: Add 2 cups water.
', "Step 5: Close cooker securely and place pressure regulator over vent according to manufacturer's instructions.
", 'Step 6: Heat to High heat until steam escapes in a steady flow and makes a whistling sound, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to medium-low or low.
', 'Step 8: Cook for 45 minutes from the start of the whistling sound.
', "Step 9: Let pressure release naturally according to manufacturer's instructions, 5 to 10 minutes.
", 'Step 10: Unlock lid and transfer pork to a large platter.
', 'Step 11: Prepare the habanero sauce while the meat is cooking.
', 'Step 12: Combine red onion and habanero chiles in a gravy boat.
', 'Step 13: Add 1/2 cup lemon juice, 1/4 cup white vinegar, and warm water.
', 'Step 14: Season with salt, pepper, and dried oregano and mix until everything is well combined.
', 'Step 15: Shred meat with 2 forks and return to the pressure cooker with the cooking juices.
', 'Step 16: Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook uncovered until cooking juices have reduced, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Serve with habanero sauce.
']

Title: Mexican Orzo Salad

Title: Vegan Air Fryer Taquitos
Ingredients: ['1 large russet potato, peeled', '1 teaspoon plant-based butter (such as Country Crock®)', '2 tablespoons diced onions', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ cup plant-based butter (such as Country Crock®)', '2 tablespoons unsweetened, plain almond milk', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '6 corn tortillas', 'avocado oil cooking spray']

['Step 1: Place potato into a saucepan and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.

', 'Step 4: Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

', 'Step 6: Pour in 1/4 cup plant-based butter and almond milk, season with salt and pepper, and mash.
', 'Step 7: Mix in onion and garlic until well combined.
', 'Step 8: Heat tortillas in a skillet or directly on the grates of a gas stove until soft and pliable.
', 'Step 9: Place 3 tablespoons of potato mixture down the center of each tortilla, fold over, and roll up.
', 'Step 10: Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Place taquitos in the air fryer basket, making sure they are not touching, and mist with avocado oil.

', 'Step 13: Air fry until taquitos are golden brown and crispy, 6 to 9 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Turn taquitos over, mist with avocado oil, and air fry for 3 to 5 minutes more.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Mexican Pork Carnitas
Ingredients: ['1 (32 fluid ounce) container chicken stock', '1 (3 pound) pork loin, or more to taste', '3 tablespoons adobo seasoning', '2 tablespoons ground cumin', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon ground paprika', '1 large white onion, diced', '2 tablespoons chipotle paste', '2 bay leaves', '1 (14 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '6 cloves garlic, minced', '2 limes, halved', '3 tablespoons ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground cloves', '1 cup fresh cilantro']
