Title: Dana's Taco Salad
Ingredients: ['½ cup dry lentils', '1 cup water', '½ pound ground turkey', '1 cup water', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 head iceberg lettuce, chopped', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted and diced', '1 tomato, diced', '1 (15 ounce) can pitted black olives, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed', '⅓ cup Catalina salad dressing']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place lentils and water in a pot.
', 'Step 2: Bring water to boil, reduce to simmer.
', 'Step 3: Cook for 30 minutes or until tender.
', 'Step 4: Cook the turkey in a skillet over medium heat until no longer pink, 8 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir the cooked lentils, 1 cup of water, and the taco seasoning mix into the turkey.
', 'Step 6: Bring mixture to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer until liquid is nearly gone, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Combine the lettuce, avocado, tomatoes, olives, kidney beans, lentil-and-turkey mixture, and Catalina dressing in a large bowl and toss until combined.

Title: Cheesy Green Chile Chicken Enchilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons salted butter', '4 each jalapeno peppers, divided, or to taste', '3 each poblano peppers, divided, or to taste', '3 breast half, bone and skin removed (blank)s skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into large chunks', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '½ lime', '1 (28 ounce) can green enchilada sauce (such as El Paso®)', '10 each corn tortillas', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Roughly chop 1 jalapeno pepper and 1 poblano pepper; add to the skillet with chicken and garlic.
', 'Step 3: Squeeze lime over mixture and add lime rind to the skillet.
', 'Step 4: Cook, covered, until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear, stirring occasionally, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat and let cool.
', "Step 6: Meanwhile, set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 7: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 8: Place remaining jalapeno and poblano peppers onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 9: Cook peppers under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Lower oven temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Chop cooked chicken into small pieces and place into a bowl.
', 'Step 12: Add hot peppers to the bowl, cover, and let steam for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Peel skin from peppers, remove seeds, and slice.
', 'Step 14: Place small amount of enchilada sauce on the bottom of a 9x13-inch pan, just enough to cover the bottom.
', 'Step 15: Place 5 tortillas on on top.
', 'Step 16: Place 1/2 of the sliced poblano and jalapeno peppers on top of tortillas.
', 'Step 17: Lay out 1/2 of the chicken and 1/2 of the Mexican cheese on top of the peppers.
', 'Step 18: Spoon 1/2 of the remaining enchilada sauce on top of cheese layer.
', 'Step 19: Repeat layering steps.
', 'Step 20: Top with chopped cilantro.
', 'Step 21: Bake in the preheated oven until cheesy is melted and browning, about 25 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '449.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '33.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '86.8 mg', 'fatContent': '23.7 g', 'fiberContent': '5.9 g', 'proteinContent': '27.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '13.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '763.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.4 g'}

Title: Avocado Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '2 ½ cups grated sharp Cheddar cheese, divided', '2 large avocados, diced', '1 small red bell pepper, diced', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '2 (12 fluid ounce) cans red enchilada sauce', '10 corn tortillas', '1 cup sour cream', '¼ cup pico de gallo, or to taste', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']

', 'Step 2: Combine black beans, 3/4 cup Cheddar cheese, avocados, bell pepper, salt, cumin, garlic powder, and onion powder in a medium bowl; gently toss everything together.
', 'Step 3: Pour half of the enchilada sauce into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.

', 'Step 5: Roll up and place seam side-down into the baking dish.

Title: Easy Taco Rolls
Ingredients: ['½ cup uncooked instant rice', '½ cup water', '1 ½ pounds ground beef', '¾ (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '½ (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '½ (8.75 ounce) can no-salt-added whole-kernel corn, drained', '½ cup water', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '8 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '1 (16 ounce) jar salsa', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Stir the rice and 1/2 cup water together in a microwave-safe bowl.
', 'Step 3: Cover, and cook in the microwave on High for 6 minutes until the water is fully absorbed; set aside.
', 'Step 4: While the rice is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and stir in the ground beef.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir until the beef is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink.
', 'Step 6: Drain and discard any excess grease.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to medium, and stir in the taco seasoning, corn, 1/2 cup water, 1 1/2 cups Cheddar cheese, and the cooked rice.
', 'Step 8: Cook and stir until the cheese has melted and the corn is hot.
', 'Step 9: Spoon the mixture into the flour tortillas.
', 'Step 10: Roll into a tight cylinder, and pack into an 8x11-inch baking dish (it will be a tight squeeze).
', 'Step 11: Pour the salsa over top, and sprinkle evenly with 1 1/2 cups Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese topping has melted and is beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.
']

Title: Air Fryer Chile Verde Burritos

Title: Mexican Pickled Jalapenos
Ingredients: ['2 pounds fresh jalapeno peppers', '½ cup thinly sliced white onion', '1 large carrot, peeled and thinly sliced', '2 cups distilled white vinegar (5% acidity)', '2 cups water', '4 teaspoons pickling salt', '2 teaspoons white sugar', '4 cloves garlic, crushed', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '4 bay leaves', '2 teaspoons black peppercorns, crushed', '2 teaspoons cumin seeds', '1/2 teaspoon calcium chloride (such as Pickle Crisp®)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Remove the stems from jalapenos and slice into 1/4-inch thick slices.
', 'Step 2: Remove some or all of the seeds, as desired, by rinsing jalapenos several times in a bowl with cold water and swirling until the seeds break off.
', 'Step 3: Inspect four 8-ounce jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones.
', 'Step 4: Immerse in simmering water until jalapenos are ready.
', 'Step 5: Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water.
', 'Step 6: Toss jalapenos, onion, and carrots together in a bowl.
', 'Step 7: Combine vinegar, water, pickling salt, and sugar in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Stir until sugar has dissolved.
', 'Step 9: Place 1 garlic clove, 1/2 teaspoon oregano, 1 bay leaf, 1/2 teaspoon crushed peppercorns, and 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds in each jar.
', 'Step 10: Distribute jalapeno mixture among the jars, packing jars tightly without crushing the vegetables.
', 'Step 11: Pour boiling pickling liquid over the vegetables, leaving 1/2 inch headspace.
', 'Step 12: Remove any air bubbles and add 1/8 teaspoon calcium chloride to each jar.
', 'Step 13: Wipe jar rims clean and place lids on jars.
', 'Step 14: Put on bands and close tightly.
', 'Step 15: Process jars in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Turn off the heat and remove the lid of the canning pot.
', 'Step 17: Let the jars sit in the hot liquid for 5 minutes, then remove and let them cool for 24 hours.
', 'Step 18: Wait at least 2 days before serving, or up to 1 to 2 weeks.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '105.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '21.2 g', 'fatContent': '1.9 g', 'fiberContent': '7.5 g', 'proteinContent': '3.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '2347.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '11 g'}

Title: Amazing Southwest Cilantro Lime Mango Grilled Chicken Sandwiches
Ingredients: ['¼ cup finely chopped fresh cilantro', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ jalapeno chile pepper, seeded and minced', '2 tablespoons finely grated fresh lime zest', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon chipotle chile powder', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 pound chicken breast tenderloins or strips', '1 medium tomato, chopped', '1 small sweet onion, finely chopped', '2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', '½ jalapeno chile pepper, seeded and minced', '1 clove garlic, finely chopped', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon sea salt', '⅛ teaspoon chipotle chile powder', '1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', '1 sweet onion cut into 1/2-inch slices', '1 red bell pepper, quartered', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon minced garlic', '½ cup mayonnaise', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '16 thick slices French bread', '2 mangos - peeled, seeded, and sliced', '8 slices Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: For the marinade: Place 1/4 cup cilantro, 1 clove minced garlic, 1/4 jalapeno, lime zest, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, onion powder, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1/4 teaspoon chipotle chile powder, and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a small bowl and stir until well combined.
', 'Step 2: Place the chicken breast tenderloins in a large resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 3: Pour the marinade into the bag with the chicken, seal, and shake the bag to coat.
', 'Step 4: Refrigerate for 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: For the salsa: Combine the tomato, 1 small onion, 2 tablespoons cilantro, 1/2 jalapeno, 1 clove garlic, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, sea salt, 1/8 teaspoon chipotle pepper, and 1 tablespoon lime juice in a bowl.
', 'Step 6: Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate.
', 'Step 7: To prepare the grilled vegetables, toss the onions and red peppers with 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1 clove garlic in a bowl; set aside.
', 'Step 8: For the lime mayonnaise: Whisk together the mayonnaise and 2 tablespoons of lime juice; cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate.
', 'Step 9: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Grill the marinated chicken on the prepared grill until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Grill the red pepper and onions until tender and golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove the chicken and vegetables from the grill.
', 'Step 13: Slice the grilled pepper into thin strips.
', 'Step 14: Spread each slice of bread with 1 1/2 teaspoons of prepared lime mayonnaise.
', 'Step 15: Layer half of the pieces of bread with sliced mango, 1 tablespoon prepared salsa, grilled chicken tenderloins, grilled peppers, grilled onions, and a slice of Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 16: Top off the sandwiches with the remaining slices of bread.
', 'Step 17: Return the sandwiches to the grill, turning when the bottom is golden brown Return the sandwiches to the grill and grill them until the bread is toasted and the cheese melts, about 2 minutes per side.
']

Title: Tortas
Ingredients: ['4 (3 ounce) thin-cut beef round steaks', '4 Mexican-style sandwich rolls (bolillos)', '¼ cup sour cream, divided', '1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans - drained, rinsed, and mashed - divided', '2 avocados - peeled, pitted and sliced', '2 large tomatoes, sliced', '2 pickled jalapeno peppers, sliced into quarters lengthwise', '2 cups shredded romaine lettuce, divided', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '1 cup crumbled queso fresco (Mexican fresh cheese), divided', '1 lime, quartered']

', 'Step 3: Spread about 1 tablespoon of sour cream onto one side of each roll, and top with about 1/3 cup of mashed pinto beans per sandwich.
', 'Step 4: Place a cooked round steak per sandwich on top of the pinto beans, and then layer each sandwich with one-fourth of the avocado slices, tomato slices, and sliced pickled jalapenos, about 1/2 cup of shredded lettuce, 1/4 cup of cilantro, and 1/4 cup of crumbled queso fresco cheese.
', 'Step 5: Squeeze a lime wedge over each sandwich, close, and serve.
']

Title: Zucchini Breakfast Quesadilla
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '1 medium zucchini, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', '2 medium scallions, thinly sliced', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '⅛ teaspoon dried oregano', '⅛ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', '2 large eggs', '1 tablespoon water', '¼ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '½ teaspoon salt', '4 (6 inch) flour tortillas']

['Step 1: Heat a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add oil, then add zucchini, scallions, black pepper, oregano, and pepper flakes.
', 'Step 3: Sauté until vegetables are tender, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 2 more minutes.

', 'Step 6: Add water and whisk until well combined.
', 'Step 7: Stir in Cheddar cheese and salt.
', 'Step 8: Add egg mixture to the skillet and increase the heat to medium.
', 'Step 9: Stir and scramble until eggs are soft-set, 3 to 5 minutes.

', 'Step 11: Spread 1/4 of the egg mixture onto half of each tortilla.
', 'Step 12: Fold tortillas in half.
', 'Step 13: Place the clean skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 14: Add tortillas, two at a time, to the hot skillet and cook until crisp, about 1 minute per side.
']

Title: Tasty Breakfast Burritos
Ingredients: ['2 pounds ground pork sausage', '12 eggs, beaten', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers, drained', '8 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '8 ounces Cheddar cheese, shredded', '1 teaspoon all-purpose flour', '1 cup milk']

['Step 1: Place sausage in a large, deep skillet.
', 'Step 2: Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown.
', 'Step 3: Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings; set sausage aside.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Add the eggs and green chiles to the skillet; cook, stirring occasionally, until eggs are scrambled and set.

', 'Step 7: Place the tortillas on a counter top or other clean surface.
', 'Step 8: Cover each tortillas with portions on sausage, cheese and eggs.
', 'Step 9: Roll up the tortillas and place them seam side down in the baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Heat reserved sausage drippings in the skillet.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle on the flour and stir.
', 'Step 12: Add milk, stirring constantly, until the gravy begins to thicken.
', 'Step 13: Pour the gravy on top of the tortilla rolls.
', 'Step 14: Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes, until gravy is bubbly.
']

Title: Make-Ahead Air Fryer Breakfast Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 pound mild country bulk sausage', '12 large eggs, beaten', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '15 (8 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Crumble sausage into a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook until no longer pink, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer to a large bowl using a slotted spoon.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to medium.
', 'Step 5: Pour beaten eggs into the skillet and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 6: Cook for 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir and cook for 2 minutes more.
', 'Step 8: Turn heat off.
', 'Step 9: Stir one last time, breaking up larger pieces.
', 'Step 10: Pour into the bowl with the sausage, add cheese, and stir to combine.
', 'Step 11: Lay out 1 tortilla on a clean work surface.
', 'Step 12: Place 1/4 cup of the sausage-egg mixture on the bottom third of the tortilla, closest to you.
', 'Step 13: Fold the end of the tortilla over the mixture.
', 'Step 14: Fold in both sides of the tortilla over the filling, making an envelope shape.
', 'Step 15: Tuck, roll, and place on a baking sheet seam side down.
', 'Step 16: Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.
', 'Step 17: Place baking sheet into the freezer for 2 hours.
', 'Step 18: Transfer burritos to a covered freezer-safe container until ready to serve.
', 'Step 19: When ready to cook, preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 20: Place burrito, seam-side down, in the preheated air fryer, and cook for 5 minutes.
']

Title: Coconut Cheese Flan (Flan de Coco y Queso)
Ingredients: ['1 cup white sugar', '8 large eggs', '12 ounces cream cheese at room temperature', '1 (10 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (15 ounce) can cream of coconut (such as Coco Lopez®)', '1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk', '1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk', '1 tablespoon coconut-flavored rum (such as Bacardi® Coconut™)', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a heavy skillet over medium-low heat, cook and stir sugar with a wooden spoon until melted and golden, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Caramel is very hot.
', 'Step 4: Very carefully pour the caramel into a 9-inch round, 3-inch deep baking dish.
', 'Step 5: Swirl dish to cover bottom and sides.
', 'Step 6: The caramel will harden as it cools.
', 'Step 7: Combine the eggs, cream cheese, and sweetened condensed milk in a blender.
', 'Step 8: Cover, and blend on High until well combined; transfer to a large bowl.
', 'Step 9: Pour the cream of coconut, coconut milk, evaporated milk, coconut-flavored rum, and vanilla extract into the blender; cover and blend on High until well combined.
', 'Step 10: Pour into the bowl with the cream cheese mixture.
', 'Step 11: Whisk until incorporated.
', 'Step 12: Pour the flan mixture into the caramel-coated baking dish.
', 'Step 13: Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel.
', 'Step 14: Place the filled baking dish on the towel, and place roasting pan in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 15: Fill roasting pan with boiling water to reach halfway up the sides of the baking dish.
', 'Step 16: Bake until the flan is set and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 17: Transfer to a wire rack; cool.
', 'Step 18: Refrigerate flan until ready to serve.
', 'Step 19: To serve, run a knife around the edges of the pan and flip the flan out onto a serving platter.
', 'Step 20: Spoon any caramel remaining in the baking dish over the flan.
']

Title: Buffalo Chicken and Ranch Wraps

Title: Mexican Chicken Meatball Soup (Sopa de Albondigas de Pollo)
Ingredients: ['4 Roma tomatoes, quartered', '½ onion', '3 cloves garlic', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 ½ quarts chicken stock', '2 pounds ground chicken breast', '3 Roma tomatoes, seeded and finely chopped', '½ onion, finely chopped', '1 egg', '¼ cup basmati rice', '1 tablespoon finely chopped mint leaves', '¼ teaspoon dried oregano', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 large zucchini, cubed', '2 chayote squash - peeled, cored, and cubed', '2 carrots, peeled and cubed', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine 4 tomatoes, 1/2 an onion, and garlic in a blender.
', 'Step 2: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Heat oil in a soup pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Add the blended tomato mixture; cook until mixture changes color, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add chicken stock, reduce heat, and simmer while you prepare the meatballs.
', 'Step 6: Place ground chicken in a bowl.
', 'Step 7: Add 3 chopped tomatoes, chopped onion, egg, rice, mint, oregano, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Mix well with your hands until mixture is uniform.
', 'Step 9: Take about 1/4 cup of mixture and form into round meatballs using wet hands.
', 'Step 10: Place on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 11: Repeat with remaining chicken mixture.
', 'Step 12: Bring stock mixture to a boil.
', 'Step 13: Place a meatball into a ladle and submerge into the boiling stock.
', 'Step 14: Remove ladle and repeat with remaining meatballs.
', 'Step 15: Place zucchini, chayote, and carrots into the stock.
', 'Step 16: Bring to a boil again.
', 'Step 17: Lower heat, season with salt, and cover.
', 'Step 18: Simmer until meatballs are no longer pink in the center and vegetables are soft, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Chicken Tacos with Pineapple Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 cup tomatoes, seeded and diced', '1 medium red onion, diced, divided', '1 cup diced fresh pineapple', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon white sugar', '1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch strips', '1 lime, juiced', '8 (7 inch) tortillas, or more as needed', '1 cup shredded lettuce', '8 dashes Sriracha sauce, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine tomatoes, 1/2 cup diced red onion, pineapple, and cilantro in a medium bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add 1 tablespoon lime juice, salt, and sugar; toss to combine.
', 'Step 3: Cover salsa with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for at least 2 hours.
', 'Step 4: Place the remaining red onion in the bowl of a small food processor.
', 'Step 5: Add juice of one lime and process until finely ground, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Place chicken strips into a shallow dish.
', 'Step 7: Slather onion mixture over the chicken, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
', 'Step 8: Preheat an outdoor grill to high heat, about 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Lightly oil the grill.
', 'Step 10: Cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
', 'Step 11: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Remove to a plate.
', 'Step 13: Lightly brown the tortillas on the grill for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
', 'Step 14: Drain the salsa.
', 'Step 15: Thinly slice the chicken, against the grain.
', 'Step 16: Lay tortillas out on plates, top with lettuce, chicken, pineapple salsa, and Sriracha sauce.
']

Title: White Tres Leches Cake
Ingredients: ['cooking spray with flour', '1 (18.25 ounce) package white cake mix', '1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '5 large eggs', '1 cup white sugar', '⅔ cup canola oil', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 cup milk', '2 (5 ounce) cans evaporated milk', '1 (10 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '6 tablespoons heavy whipping cream', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '⅛ teaspoon coconut extract', '2 cups heavy whipping cream', '1 (3.5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray 2 9-inch round cake pans with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Mix white cake mix, flour, eggs, sugar, canola oil, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, baking powder, and milk in a large bowl until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 4: Pour batter into prepared cake pans.
', 'Step 5: Bake in preheated oven until the cakes are lightly browned and a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Let cakes cool about 10 minutes in pans before removing to finish cooling on racks.
', 'Step 7: Whisk evaporated milk, sweetened condensed milk, 6 tablespoons cream, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, and coconut extract in a bowl until smooth.
', 'Step 8: Refrigerate the tres leches mixture.
', 'Step 9: Beat 2 cups cream with instant vanilla pudding mix in a separate mixing bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Refrigerate mousse filling.
', 'Step 11: With a long serrated knife, lightly cut off a thin layer of each cake top to level the cake.
', 'Step 12: Place cakes, leveled sides up, on pieces of waxed paper.
', 'Step 13: Poke holes all over the cakes with a skewer.
', 'Step 14: Slowly pour the tres leches mixture over the cakes, about 1/2 cup at a time, waiting until the mixture has soaked in before continuing to pour on more milk mixture.
', 'Step 15: Wrap cake layers in plastic wrap; refrigerate until chilled, at least 4 hours.
', 'Step 16: Unwrap a cake layer and place onto a serving platter with leveled side up.
', 'Step 17: Top the cake with mousse filling; gently place second cake layer over the filling with leveled side down.
', 'Step 18: Refrigerate leftovers.
']

Title: Pozole Rojo (Mexican Pork and Hominy Stew)
Ingredients: ['2 (16 ounce) cans white hominy, drained', 'water to cover', '1 head garlic, cloves peeled', 'salt to taste', '1 pound boneless pork shoulder, cubed', '1 pound boneless pork loin, cubed', '½ pound pork neck bones', '1 large plum tomato', '4 ounces dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded', '1 clove garlic', '¼ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 pinch ground cumin', '2 cups water', '1 head iceberg lettuce, finely shredded', '1 small onion, diced', '4 limes, quartered']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place hominy in a large pot; cover with water.
', 'Step 2: Add 1 head garlic and salt to taste.
', 'Step 3: Cook over medium heat for 2 hours.
', 'Step 4: Place pork shoulder, pork loin, and pork neck bones in the hominy mixture and cook until meat is tender and cooked through, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Place tomato and guajillo chiles in a pot and add enough water to cover; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Cook until chiles have softened, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Drain.
', 'Step 8: Place tomato and chiles with salt, 1 clove garlic, oregano, and cumin in a blender; add 2 cups water.
', 'Step 9: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 10: Strain mixture through a fine-mesh sieve and set chile sauce aside.
', 'Step 11: Transfer pork to a work surface and shred with 2 forks.
', 'Step 12: Discard the pork bones.
', 'Step 13: Pour chile sauce into hominy mixture; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 14: Return shredded pork to pot.
', 'Step 15: Simmer pozole until flavors have blended, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Ladle pozole into serving bowls and top with lettuce and onion and serve lime wedge on the side.
']

Title: Authentic Enchilada Sauce
Ingredients: ['3 ancho chile peppers', '3 pasilla chile peppers', 'Water to cover', '2 cloves crushed garlic', '1 onion, chopped', '4 tablespoons butter', '4 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '3 cups chicken stock', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', 'Salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: n Place chile peppers on a cookie sheet and roast in the oven until slightly toasted.
', "Step 3: (Note: When you can smell them, they're done.
", 'Step 4: )n Remove from the oven and slit them open.
', 'Step 5: Remove the seeds and veins, then put them in a bowl with boiling water to cover.
', 'Step 6: Allow them to sit for 30 minutes, then remove them from the water, reserving the water.
', 'Step 7: Scrape the pulp from the insides of the chile peppers and discard the skins.
', 'Step 8: (Note: The skins will give the mixture a bitter flavor.
', 'Step 9: ) Return the pulp to the water and set aside for later.
', 'Step 10: n In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute the garlic and onion in the butter or margarine for 5 minutes, or until onion is tender.
', 'Step 11: Add the flour and mix well.
', 'Step 12: Add the stock, stirring until thickened, and then add the reserved chile pulp mixture.
', 'Step 13: Finally, add the oregano and the cumin.
', 'Step 14: n In a blender or food processor, puree the mixture until smooth.
', 'Step 15: Season with salt to taste.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Pork Green Chili
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons oil, divided, or as needed', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon paprika', '2 teaspoons cumin, divided', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '2 pounds pork shoulder roast, or more to taste', '5 tablespoons cornstarch', '4 cups beef stock', '1 (16 ounce) jar green salsa (such as Herdez®)', '2 cups roasted Hatch green chile peppers, diced', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '2 white potatoes, diced', '4 medium tomatillos, husked and quartered', '1 bunch cilantro, chopped, divided', '1 jalapeno pepper', '1 Anaheim chile pepper, cored', '1 serrano chile pepper, cored, or more to taste', '1 teaspoon liquid smoke flavoring', '½ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend, or to taste', '6 tablespoons sour cream, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Rub the inside of a slow cooker with about 1 tablespoon oil and turn on Low heat.
', 'Step 2: Mix salt, black pepper, garlic powder, paprika, 1 teaspoon cumin, onion powder, chili powder, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Rub spice mixture all over pork.
', 'Step 4: Top pork with cornstarch and pat in to coat completely.
', 'Step 5: Heat remaining oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Sear pork in the hot oil on all sides until almost black, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Transfer seared pork to the slow cooker.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to medium and pour beef stock into the skillet.
', 'Step 9: Whisk until boiling, scraping up browned bits, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Boil gently for 3 to 4 minutes more.
', 'Step 11: Strain stock into the slow cooker.
', 'Step 12: Add salsa, Hatch chiles, diced tomatoes, and potatoes.
', 'Step 13: Combine tomatillos, 1/2 the cilantro, jalapeno pepper, Anaheim pepper, serrano pepper, remaining cumin, and liquid smoke in a blender.
', 'Step 14: Blend on high power and add to slow cooker.
', 'Step 15: Cover and cook on Low for 8 hours.
', 'Step 16: Remove pork from slow cooker and shred using 2 forks.
', 'Step 17: Return meat to slow cooker.
', 'Step 18: Season with additional salt and pepper.
', 'Step 19: Serve chili in bowls with Mexican cheese, sour cream, and remaining cilantro.
']

Title: Mexican Pork Chop Casserole

Title: Banana-Dulce de Leche Pie (Banana-Caramel Pie)
Ingredients: ['1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 cup graham cracker crumbs', '½ cup butter, melted', '4 bananas', '1 ½ cups whipping cream', "2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar", '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: To make dulce de leche, place the unopened can of sweetened condensed milk in a saucepan, and add enough water to cover half-way up the can.
', 'Step 2: Place the saucepan over medium-high heat and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Cook for 3 hours, adding more water as necessary.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and cool.
', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Combine the graham cracker crumbs with the butter in a mixing bowl until evenly blended.
', 'Step 7: Press the crumb mixture evenly into a 9 inch pie plate.
', 'Step 8: Bake pie crust in preheated oven until lightly browned, 10-15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from oven, and cool on a wire rack.
', 'Step 10: Open the can of dulce de leche, and pour half, or about 3/4 cup, over the pie crust.
', 'Step 11: Slice the bananas and arrange half in a layer over the dulce de leche filling.
', 'Step 12: Pour the remaining dulce de leche over the bananas.
', 'Step 13: Top with remaining banana slices.
', 'Step 14: Pour the whipping cream into a mixing bowl, and beat until soft peaks form.
', 'Step 15: Add the sugar and vanilla extract; continue beating until stiff peaks form.
', 'Step 16: Spoon the whipped cream over the bananas.
', 'Step 17: Chill at least 1 hour before serving.
']

Title: Chicken Chile Verde
Ingredients: ['1 whole chicken, cut into 6 pieces', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '8 tomatillos, husked and quartered', '2 fresh jalapeno peppers, chopped', '6 cloves garlic', '½ bunch cilantro', '3 cups chicken stock', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 onion, diced', '2 tablespoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '1 bay leaf', '1 ½ pounds potatoes, peeled and cubed', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '½ cup sour cream, for garnish']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Season chicken pieces with salt and black pepper on all sides.
', 'Step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook chicken, 2 to 3 pieces at a time, until browned on all sides, about 15 minutes total.
', 'Step 4: Set aside.
', 'Step 5: Place tomatillos, jalepeno peppers, garlic, cilantro, and chicken stock in a blender and puree until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil over medium-low heat in a Dutch oven.
', 'Step 8: Stir in onion, cook and stir until onion is soft and translucent, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir in cumin, oregano, and bay leaf; cook 1 minute.
', 'Step 10: Place chicken over onion mixture in the Dutch oven.
', 'Step 11: Pour in tomatillo mixture.
', 'Step 12: Bring to a boil, decrease heat to low and simmer, covered, until the meat is tender and falling off the bone, about 1 hour 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Stir in potatoes and cook, uncovered, until they are easily pierced with a fork, about 35 minutes.

Title: Vegetarian Mexican Breakfast Casserole

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.

', 'Step 5: Place cream cheese into the bottom of a large bowl.

Title: Chicken Tortilla Soup in the Slow Cooker

Title: Hatch Chile Verde
Ingredients: ['8 each Hatch chile peppers, or more as needed', '2 pounds pork butt, cut into 1-inch chunks', '½ cup water', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon oil, or as needed', '1 onion, diced', '6 cloves garlic, pressed', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '¼ cup all-purpose flour', '4 cups chicken broth, or more as needed', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place Hatch chiles directly on the grates of a gas stove.
', 'Step 2: Cook over medium heat, flipping with tongs occasionally, until blackened and charred, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Place in a sealed plastic bag and allow to cool, 7 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Peel off charred skins, remove seeds, and cut 1/2 of the chiles into 1-inch squares.
', 'Step 5: Set aside.
', 'Step 6: Place remaining chiles in a food processor and process until finely chopped.
', 'Step 7: Add processed chiles to chopped chiles.
', 'Step 8: Set aside.
', 'Step 9: Combine pork cubes, water, and salt in a Dutch oven.
', 'Step 10: Cover and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Uncover, raise heat to medium-high, and cook, stirring constantly until the water evaporates and the pork browns in its rendered fat, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove pork and set aside.
', 'Step 13: Heat oil in the Dutch oven.
', 'Step 14: Add onion; cook and stir until soft and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Add garlic and cumin and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 16: Stir in flour and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Add chiles, pork, chicken broth, canned tomatoes, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 18: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 19: Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until pork cubes are fork-tender, about 1 1/2 hours.
']

Title: Bunuelos
Ingredients: ['4 eggs', '¼ cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 cup vegetable oil for frying']

['Step 1: In a large bowl combine eggs with 1/4 cup sugar and beat until thick and lemon-colored.

', 'Step 4: Gradually add this to the egg mixture and beat well.
', 'Step 5: Turn dough out onto a floured board (use remaining 1/2 cup flour) and knead thoroughly until dough is smooth.
', 'Step 6: Shape dough into sixteen balls.
', 'Step 7: Roll each one into a circle about 5 inches in diameter.
', 'Step 8: Let stand uncovered on waxed paper for about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Heat oil in a deep fry pan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

', 'Step 13: Store airtight.

Title: Easy Chile Relleno Egg Rolls
Ingredients: ['2 (12 ounce) packages egg roll wrappers', '1 (27 ounce) can whole green chiles - seeded, drained well, and patted dry', '1 pound Monterey Jack cheese, cut into 3x1/2-inch thick strips', 'vegetable oil for frying']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Lay a wrapper on a work surface diagonally so it resembles a diamond.
', 'Step 2: Place a slice of green chile horizontally across the wrapper, 1 inch above the bottom point.
', 'Step 3: Place a strip of Monterey Jack cheese on top of the chile.
', 'Step 4: Fill a small bowl with water.
', 'Step 5: Dip an index finger into the water and moisten the edges of the wrapper.
', 'Step 6: Roll the wrapper up and over the chile and cheese, starting from the point closest to you.
', 'Step 7: Bring in both sides, making sure to press firmly to seal the filling.
', 'Step 8: Roll away from you and to enclose the yumminess inside.
', 'Step 9: Repeat with remaining wrappers, chiles, and Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 10: Heat approximately 1/2 inch of oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Carefully lay a few egg rolls into the hot oil.
', 'Step 12: Fry, turning once, until golden brown on both sides, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Watch carefully to prevent burning.
', 'Step 14: Repeat with remaining egg rolls.
', 'Step 15: Transfer fried egg rolls to a plate lined with paper towels and let cool for a few minutes before serving.
']

Title: Latin-Inspired Spicy Cream Chicken Stew
Ingredients: ['6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '3 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes', '1 (16 ounce) jar green salsa', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', '2 teaspoons ground red chile pepper, or to taste', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ cup cream cheese, softened']

Title: Breakfast Stuffed Poblano Peppers

', 'Step 8: Bake in the oven until cheese is melted, 3 to 5 minutes.
']

Title: Chicken and Mushroom Chimichangas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil, divided', '½ cup diced onion', '½ cup diced poblano peppers', '½ cup sliced mushrooms', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '12 ounces skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground chipotle', '1 pinch dried Mexican oregano', '1 tablespoon water, or as needed', '4 ounces shredded pepperjack cheese', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '4 large flour tortillas', '1 egg white, beaten', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '¼ cup guacamole', '¼ cup sour cream', '¼ cup salsa', '¼ cup cilantro leaves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a heavy baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
', 'Step 3: Heat 1 1/2 teaspoons vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Saute onion, poblano peppers, and mushrooms in the hot oil, sprinkling with salt, until they soften and release their juices, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Continue to cook until vegetables begin to brown, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Move vegetables to the edges of the skillet, leaving a space in the center.
', 'Step 7: Drizzle 1 1/2 teaspoons vegetable oil into the center.
', 'Step 8: Add chicken breast pieces to the center of the skillet and sprinkle with salt, cumin, ground chipotle, and dried Mexican oregano.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir until chicken pieces are browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir chicken and vegetable mixture together in skillet; remove from heat.
', 'Step 11: Drizzle water over chicken mixture and scrape the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 12: Transfer mixture to a bowl and set aside to cool to a warm temperature.
', 'Step 13: Mix pepperjack cheese into chicken mixture; stir until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 14: Season with salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 15: Place a heavy skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 16: When pan is hot, heat a tortilla in the skillet until warmed and flexible, about 30 seconds per side.
', 'Step 17: Place tortilla onto a work surface and spoon 1/4 the filling into the center of the tortilla.
', 'Step 18: Fold bottom of tortilla just over filling.
', 'Step 19: Brush top and the exposed parts of the inside of the tortilla with egg white.
', 'Step 20: Fold right and left sides towards the center like an envelope, enclosing the filling.
', 'Step 21: Roll tortilla over to fully enclose filling in a rectangular packet.
', 'Step 22: Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.
', 'Step 23: Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in heavy skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 24: Brown chimichangas on both sides in the hot oil until golden, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 25: Transfer to prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 26: Bake in the preheated oven until puffed up, golden brown, and the outside is crisp, 12 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 27: Spoon 1 tablespoon guacamole, 1 tablespoon sour cream, 1 tablespoon salsa, and 1 tablespoon cilantro onto each chimichanga.
']

Title: Tortillas I
Ingredients: ['5 cups all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons shortening', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 ½ cups boiling water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix together the flour, baking powder, and salt in large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Cut in shortening to resemble cornmeal.
', 'Step 3: Add water slowly, mixing with your hands to make a soft dough.
', 'Step 4: You may not need all the water.
', 'Step 5: Knead a few minutes on floured surface until smooth and elastic.
', 'Step 6: Lubricate top with oil, put back in bowl and let rest, covered for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Divide into small balls the size of golf balls and proceed to roll out into size and thickness you prefer.
', 'Step 8: Cook on top of stove over medium heat using a cast iron grill or heavy skillet until top is slightly bubbly then turning on opposite side for a minute or two.
', 'Step 9: Keep stacked and warm inside a clean dish towel.
']

Title: Easy Taco Bake
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 package taco seasoning mix', 'cooking spray', '2 (8 ounce) packages refrigerated crescent rolls', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (10 ounce) bag shredded lettuce']

', 'Step 2: Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.

', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Title: Air Fryer Shrimp Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 red bell pepper, sliced into thin strips', '1 green bell pepper, sliced into thin strips', '1 red onion, sliced into thin strips', '1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1 (1.12 ounce) package fajita seasoning mix, divided', '3 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '4 (10 inch) flour tortillas, toasted']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place bell peppers and onion in a large bowl.
', 'Step 3: Place shrimp in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle 2 teaspoons of the fajita seasoning over the shrimp.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle the rest of the seasoning over the vegetables.
', 'Step 6: Drizzle 2 tablespoons olive oil over the vegetables and stir until evenly combined.
', 'Step 7: Add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to the shrimp and stir until combined.
', 'Step 8: Place vegetables in the basket of the preheated air fryer and cook for 12 minutes, shaking halfway through cook time.
', 'Step 9: Transfer mixture to a large bowl.
', 'Step 10: Place shrimp in the basket of the air fryer and cook for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Flip and cook for 3 minutes more.
', 'Step 12: Divide vegetables among tortillas and top with shrimp.
']

Title: Best King Ranch Ever
Ingredients: ['6 cooked chicken breasts, shredded', '1 (10.75 ounce) can cream of chicken soup', '1 (10.75 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®)', '½ cup chicken broth', '½ cup chopped onion', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles', '6 corn tortillas, torn into strips - or more as needed', '2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, or more to taste']

', 'Step 2: Mix chicken, cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, diced tomatoes with green chiles and juice, chicken broth, onion, and canned green chiles together in a bowl, stirring until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 3: Place 1/3 of the tortilla strips in a layer into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish; top with 1/3 of the chicken mixture.

Title: Sopa de Mariscos (Seafood Soup)
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '3 medium carrots, diced', '1 ear fresh corn, kernels cut from cob', '1 stalk celery, halved and diced', '6 cups chicken stock (such as Swanson®)', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, lime, and cilantro (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 ancho chile pepper, diced', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 pound fresh littleneck clams', '1 pound fresh mussels', '1 pound fresh cod, cut into bite-sized pieces', '¾ pound fresh shrimp, peeled and deveined', '¼ cup fresh cilantro, chopped, or to taste', '1 avocado, peeled and sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a stockpot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onion and cook until translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Add carrots, corn, and celery and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add chicken stock, tomatoes, ancho chili, chili powder, and cumin and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, place clams and mussels in a bowl of cold water to filter out sand.
', 'Step 8: Drain clams and mussels; add to the soup.
', 'Step 9: Stir in cod and shrimp.
', 'Step 10: Cover and boil until cod is white and flaky, mussels and clams are open, and shrimp is pink, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Serve immediately, topped with cilantro and avocado.
']

Title: Creamy Chicken Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '2 (14 ounce) cans chicken broth', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed Cheddar cheese soup', '1 cup picante sauce', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried cilantro', '¼ teaspoon ground white pepper', '1 bay leaf', '1 pound cooked chicken, shredded', '⅔ cup drained and rinsed canned corn', '½ cup half-and-half', '¼ cup tortilla strips']

', 'Step 2: Saute until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.

Title: Authentic Cochinita Pibil (Spicy Mexican Pulled Pork)
Ingredients: ['1 red onion, sliced thin', '3 habanero peppers, sliced', '10 limes, juiced', 'salt to taste', '3 ounces dried guajillo chile peppers, seeded and deveined', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', 'salt and pepper to taste', '3 pounds boneless pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes', '3 cups fresh orange juice', '1 cup white vinegar', '1 bulb garlic, peeled', '7 ½ ounces achiote paste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine the onion, habanero peppers, lime juice, and salt in a bowl; cover and refrigerate while preparing and cooking the pork.
', 'Step 2: Use rubber gloves when preparing the habanero peppers and avoid touching your eyes, nose, or skin while slicing peppers.
', 'Step 3: Place the guajillo peppers in a bowl; pour enough hot water over the peppers to cover.
', 'Step 4: Allow to soak until the peppers are softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Heat the oil in a large skillet at medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Season pork with salt and pepper; cook in the hot oil until completely browned, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Transfer the pork to a slow cooker.
', 'Step 8: Combine the guajillo peppers, orange juice, vinegar, garlic, and achiote paste in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Pour the sauce over the pork cubes in the slow cooker.
', 'Step 10: Cook on High until the pork easily falls apart, 6 to 8 hours.
', 'Step 11: Remove the pork to a serving dish and shred with 2 forks.
', 'Step 12: Pour the achiote sauce over the shredded pork.
', 'Step 13: To serve, top with the onion-habanero salsa.
']

Title: G's Tres Leches Cake
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups white sugar', '¾ cup unsalted butter at room temperature', '6 eggs at room temperature, separated', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 ½ cups whole milk at room temperature', '1 teaspoon almond extract', '¾ teaspoon cream of tartar', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk', '2 tablespoons whole milk', '1 pint heavy whipping cream', '¼ cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking pan.
', 'Step 3: Cream 1 1/2 cup sugar and unsalted butter in a large bowl until mixture is fluffy and pale yellow, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Mix 6 egg yolks into the butter mixture, stirring in each one before adding the next.
', 'Step 5: Whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl; gradually stir the flour mixture into the egg yolk mixture, alternating with 1 1/2 cup milk, to make a smooth batter.
', 'Step 6: Stir in almond extract.
', 'Step 7: Beat 6 egg whites with cream of tartar in a bowl with an electric mixer until frothy; gradually beat in 2 tablespoons sugar until the egg whites form stiff peaks.
', 'Step 8: Gently fold the egg white mixture into the batter, retaining as much volume as possible.
', 'Step 9: Pour the cake batter into prepared baking pan.
', 'Step 10: Bake in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the middle of the cake comes out clean, 35 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Cool cake completely in pan on a rack.
', 'Step 12: Whisk sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, and 2 tablespoons whole milk in a bowl.
', 'Step 13: Use a large fork or skewer to poke holes all over the cake; pour the three-milk mixture over the cake.
', 'Step 14: Beat cream with 1/4 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until the whipped cream holds stiff peaks.
', 'Step 15: Top the cake with whipped cream; refrigerate until cold, at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 16: Refrigerate leftovers.
', 'Step 17: Cake is better a day or two after making.
']

Title: Pickled Jalapenos and Carrots
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups distilled white vinegar', '¼ cup white sugar', '10 jalapeno peppers, thinly sliced', '2 cups sliced carrots (1/4-inch thick slices)', '½ red onion, cut into 1/4 inch-thick rings']

['Step 1: Bring the vinegar and sugar to a boil in a saucepan over high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir until the sugar has dissolved, then stir in the jalapeno peppers, carrots, and onion.

', 'Step 4: Cool to room temperature before serving.
']

Title: Shredded Beef Tacos with Lime
Ingredients: ['¼ cup vegetable oil', '2 tablespoons vinegar', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 ½ teaspoons chili powder', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ½ pounds beef chuck roast, trimmed and cut into 1-inch thick slices', '1 cup beef stock', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk together vegetable oil, vinegar, lime juice, cumin, chili powder, and garlic in a bowl and pour into a resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 2: Add the sliced beef, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag.
', 'Step 3: Marinate in the refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight.
', 'Step 4: Bring beef to room temperature, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Transfer beef and lime juice marinade to a large baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Add beef stock and cover baking dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 8: Bake in preheated oven until beef is very tender, about 2 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 9: Allow meat to rest for 10 minutes before shredding with 2 forks.
', 'Step 10: Drain and discard about 80% of liquid from meat and season with salt before serving.
']

Title: Capidotada (Mexican Bread Pudding)
Ingredients: ['2 cups water', '3 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks', '2 cups white sugar', '2 cups vegetable oil for frying', '1 (1 pound) loaf French bread, cut into 1/2 inch thick slices', '1 cup raisins', '1 cup chopped pecans', '1 small onion, finely chopped', '6 ounces sliced mild Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 2 quart casserole dish.
', 'Step 3: Combine the water, cinnamon sticks, and sugar in a large saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 4: Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the cinnamon turns the water dark brown, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove cinnamon sticks and reserve the water.
', 'Step 6: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Fry the slices of French bread in oil until light brown, turning if necessary, about 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 8: Remove toasted bread from the oil and place on paper towels to drain.
', 'Step 9: Arrange half of the toasted bread in a single layer in the greased casserole dish.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle bread with half of the raisins, pecans, and onion.
', 'Step 11: Arrange a layer of Cheddar cheese on top.
', 'Step 12: Repeat with another layer of bread, raisins, pecans, onions, and cheese.
', 'Step 13: Slowly pour the reserved cinnamon water over the casserole, allowing the bread to absorb as much of the liquid as possible.
', 'Step 14: Do not allow the dish to overflow.
', 'Step 15: Cover dish with aluminum foil and place in the center of the preheated oven.
', 'Step 16: Bake until lightly browned and puffed, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Remove from oven and allow to rest for 15 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Air Fryer Roasted Salsa
Ingredients: ['4 Roma tomatoes, halved lengthwise', '1 jalapeno pepper, halved and seeded', '½ red onion, cut into 2 wedges', 'cooking spray', '4 cloves garlic, peeled', '½ cup chopped cilantro', '1 lime, juiced', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the air fryer to 390 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place tomatoes and jalapeno skin-side down into the air fryer basket, along with red onion.
', 'Step 3: Lightly spray vegetables with cooking spray to help the roasting process.
', 'Step 4: Air fry vegetables for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Open basket and add garlic cloves.
', 'Step 6: Spray lightly with cooking spray and air fry for an additional 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Transfer vegetables to a cutting board and allow to cool for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove skins from tomatoes and jalapeno, if desired; they should slip right off.
', 'Step 9: Chop tomatoes, jalapeno, and onion into large chunks and add to the bowl of a food processor.
', 'Step 10: Add garlic, cilantro, lime juice, and salt.
', 'Step 11: Pulse several times until vegetables are finely chopped; do not over-process.
', 'Step 12: Serve at room temperature or refrigerate to let flavors meld.
']

Title: Chicken Tortilla Casserole

Title: Rolled Tacos
Ingredients: ['5 boneless, skinless chicken breasts', '2 (6 ounce) cans black olives, drained', '1 (16 ounce) jar salsa', '24 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '¼ cup vegetable oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Boil chicken breasts for 20 minutes or until they are thoroughly cooked.
', 'Step 2: Drain breasts well and let cool.
', 'Step 3: Use an electric food processor or manually shred the chicken and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Use an electric food processor or blender to puree the olives.
', 'Step 5: In a mixing bowl, combine salsa, olives, and chicken.
', 'Step 6: Heat tortillas in microwave for about 20 to 30 seconds.
', 'Step 7: Place 1 to 2 tablespoons of the chicken mixture into the center of each warmed tortilla and roll the tortillas tightly, using toothpicks to keep them closed.
', 'Step 8: Heat oil in skillet over a high heat.
', 'Step 9: When the oil is hot, place the rolled taco into the oil and deep fry until lightly browned.
', 'Step 10: Drain on paper towels and serve.
']

Title: Sweet Tamale Pie
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 onion, chopped', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 pound lean ground beef', '2 (7 ounce) cans Mexican-style corn (such as Green Giant®)', '1 (8 ounce) jar chunky salsa', '1 (7.75 ounce) can Mexican-style hot tomato sauce (such as El Pato®)', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '1 (15 ounce) package corn bread mix (such as Krusteaz® Honey Corn Bread Mix)', '⅔ cup milk', '⅓ cup vegetable oil', '1 egg', '2 (7 ounce) cans Mexican-style corn (such as Green Giant®), drained', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Pour 2 tablespoons olive oil into a cold skillet; sprinkle in garlic.
', 'Step 3: Cook garlic over medium heat until sizzling and fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir onion, salt, and pepper into the garlic and olive oil; cook until onion is translucent, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir ground beef into onion mixture until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Mix 2 cans Mexican-style corn, salsa, hot tomato sauce, 1 can chopped green chiles, and taco seasoning into ground beef mixture; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat, cover skillet, and simmer until liquid has reduced, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Transfer meat mixture to a 10x14-inch casserole dish.
', 'Step 9: Stir corn bread mix, milk, vegetable oil, and egg together in a bowl; fold in 2 cans drained Mexican-style corn, 1 can drained green chiles, Mexican cheese blend, and 1 tablespoon olive oil.
', 'Step 10: Spoon cornbread mixture over meat mixture.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the corn bread comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Caramelized Onion and Jalapeno Quesadillas

Title: Fire-Roasted Tomato Soup
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 large onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', "2 cups vegetable broth (such as Penzy's®)", '2 (14.5 ounce) cans fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '½ cup heavy whipping cream']

['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir onion and garlic in hot oil until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Pour vegetable broth over the onion mixture; add tomatoes, 1 tablespoon cilantro, sugar, and red pepper flakes.

Title: Easy Slow Cooker Chicken Tacos

Title: Healthier Chicken Enchiladas I
Ingredients: ['4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 onion, chopped', '1 cup light sour cream', '1 cup shredded reduced-fat Cheddar cheese', '1 tablespoon dried parsley', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce', '½ cup water', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '⅓ cup chopped green bell pepper', '⅓ cup chopped red bell pepper', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '8 (10 inch) whole wheat flour tortillas', '1 (12 ounce) jar taco sauce', '¾ cup shredded reduced-fat Cheddar cheese']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cook chicken in a nonstick skillet over medium heat, until no longer pink and juices run clear, about 10 minutes per side.
', 'Step 3: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Drain excess fat.
', 'Step 5: Cube chicken and return to skillet.
', 'Step 6: Add onion, sour cream, 1 cup Cheddar cheese, parsley, oregano, and ground black pepper.
', 'Step 7: Heat until cheese melts, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir in salt, tomato sauce, water, chili powder, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, garlic, and black beans.
', 'Step 9: Roll even amounts of mixture into tortillas.
', 'Step 10: Arrange in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 11: Cover with taco sauce and 3/4 cup Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 12: Bake uncovered in preheated oven until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbling, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Cool 10 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Tomato Salsa without Onions

Title: Tres Leches Cake with Dulce de Leche
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '6 eggs, separated', '½ cup white sugar, divided', '½ cup all-purpose flour, sifted', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 lime, zested', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '½ cup dulce de leche']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan and dust with flour.
', 'Step 3: Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until foamy.
', 'Step 4: Add 1/4 cup sugar gradually, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form and sugar is completely dissolved.
', 'Step 5: Beat egg yolks in a separate bowl until creamy.
', 'Step 6: Add remaining 1/4 cup sugar and continue beating until pale yellow and creamy.
', 'Step 7: Fold into egg whites.
', 'Step 8: Mix flour and baking powder in a bowl.
', 'Step 9: Fold in egg mixture; add lime zest.
', 'Step 10: Pour mixture into the prepared baking pan.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until lightly golden, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Turn off oven and keep the cake in the oven for another 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Mix condensed milk, evaporated milk, and heavy cream in a bowl until well combined.
', 'Step 14: Poke cake several times across the top with a fork.
', 'Step 15: Pour three-milks mixture over cake.
', 'Step 16: Refrigerate for 1 hour to allow milk mixture to soak in.
', 'Step 17: Spread dulce de leche on top.
']

Title: Tex-Mex Beef and Cheese Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 pounds ground beef', '3 tablespoons chili powder', '2 tablespoons paprika', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '4 cups water', '½ cup all-purpose flour, divided', '1 ½ teaspoons sugar', '2 tablespoons cooking oil', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '4 cups shredded American cheese']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat the ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook, stirring to crumble, until no longer pink.
', 'Step 4: Drain off grease and season with chili powder, paprika, cumin, garlic powder, and salt.
', 'Step 5: Mix in the tomato sauce and 2 cups of the water.

', 'Step 12: Pour the meat sauce evenly over the rolled tortillas.
', 'Step 13: Top with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 14: Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until cheese is melted and lightly browned.
']

Title: Green Chile Chicken Stew
Ingredients: ['1 (4 pound) whole chicken', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '1 teaspoon dried marjoram', '1 tablespoon dried basil', '1 (4 ounce) can canned green chile peppers, chopped', '4 habanero peppers, seeded and minced', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '5 carrots, chopped', '5 stalks celery, chopped', '1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes', '3 potatoes, peeled and cubed', '3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', 'salt and pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Put the chicken in a large pot over medium heat and add water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Add the cumin, thyme, marjoram and basil.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 2 1/2 hours (or pressure cook for 45 minutes).
', 'Step 4: Remove the chicken from the pot and allow it to cool.
', 'Step 5: Discard the bones and the skin and chop the chicken meat into bite-size pieces.
', 'Step 6: Return the chicken to the pot and add the green chile peppers, habanero chile peppers, onion, garlic, carrots, celery, tomatoes and potatoes.
', 'Step 7: Simmer for 30 minutes, or until the potatoes and carrots are tender (or pressure cook for 10 minutes).
', 'Step 8: In a separate small bowl, mix the flour with some water and add to the soup, stirring well so the flour does not clump.
', 'Step 9: Raise heat, bring just to a boil and remove from heat.
', 'Step 10: Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.
']

Title: Papas con Chorizo (Mexican Chorizo and Potatoes)

Title: Buffy's Refried Beans

Title: Jalapeno Salsa
Ingredients: ['10 fresh jalapeno peppers', '2 tomatoes', '1 white onion, quartered', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or more to taste', '2 cloves garlic, smashed', '1 lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place jalapenos in a saucepan with enough water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Simmer until jalapenos soften and begin to lose their shine, about 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove the jalapenos with a slotted spoon, chop off the stem, and place them in a blender.
', 'Step 5: Add the tomatoes and boil for 2 to 3 minutes to loosen the skin.
', 'Step 6: Peel the skin from the tomatoes and add tomatoes to the blender.

', 'Step 8: Blend to desired consistency.
']

Title: Rich Mexican Corn

', 'Step 2: In a saucepan over medium-low heat, melt the cream cheese and butter, and mix with the milk until smooth and bubbly.
', 'Step 3: In a medium casserole dish, mix the frozen corn, red bell pepper, and jalapeno peppers.
', 'Step 4: Pour in the cream cheese mixture, and toss to coat.

Title: Margarita Balls I

', 'Step 2: Melt four 1 oz squares white chocolate according to package directions.
', 'Step 3: In blender, process tequila, orange marmalade, and light corn syrup until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Stir, along with melted chocolate, into crumb mixture.
', 'Step 5: Shape into 1-inch balls and coat with sugar.
', 'Step 6: Store in refrigerator.
']

Title: Pork Empanadas
Ingredients: ['2 pounds pork butt roast', '1 onion, quartered', '2 cloves garlic', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '2 bay leaves', '1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '¾ cup masa harina', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ cup lard', '1 egg, beaten', '½ cup milk', '1 cup chipotle salsa']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: To make the filling: Place pork in a large pot and cover with water.
', 'Step 2: Add onion, garlic, salt, oregano, cumin and bay leaves.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 1 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 4: While pork is cooking, prepare dough.
', 'Step 5: To make the dough: Sift together the flour, masa harina, baking powder and salt.
', 'Step 6: Add the shortening to the dry ingredients and mix well.
', 'Step 7: In a separate bowl, beat together the egg and 1/2 cup milk.
', 'Step 8: Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients.
', 'Step 9: Add the egg mixture and stir with a fork until the dough comes together in a ball.
', 'Step 10: Divide the dough into 16 even pieces and roll each piece into a ball.
', 'Step 11: Place in a container, cover, and refrigerate.
', 'Step 12: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: After the pork has simmered for 1 1/2 hours, remove from liquid.
', 'Step 14: Place pork in a baking dish and bake for 1 hour or until meat shreds easily with fork.
', 'Step 15: Remove from oven (keep oven turned on) and shred into small pieces.
', 'Step 16: Add salsa to shredded pork.
', 'Step 17: Lightly grease a baking sheet.
', 'Step 18: On lightly floured surface, flatten a piece of dough with the palm of your hand.
', 'Step 19: With a rolling pin, roll out the dough to make a 5-inch circle about 1/8-inch thick.
', 'Step 20: Place 2 to 3 tablespoons of filling in the center of the dough circle.
', 'Step 21: Brush edges of dough with milk.
', 'Step 22: Fold dough over filling.
', 'Step 23: Pinch edges together.
', 'Step 24: Crimp with fork to seal.
', 'Step 25: Place on prepared baking sheet and repeat with remaining empanada dough.
', 'Step 26: Leftover filling can be frozen or used in tacos, tamales, or burritos.
', 'Step 27: Bake in preheated oven until golden, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 28: Remove to rack and cool for about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 29: Serve warm.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '209.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '15.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '40.6 mg', 'fatContent': '12.6 g', 'fiberContent': '1.5 g', 'proteinContent': '8.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '270.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.2 g'}

Title: Ken's Kickin' Posole
Ingredients: ['2 fresh poblano chile peppers', '8 ounces bacon, chopped', '1 tablespoon bacon drippings', '2 pounds pork loin, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 onion, diced', '10 cloves garlic, minced', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and diced', '1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon New Mexico chile powder', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 bunch cilantro, chopped', '8 cups chicken stock', '1 (14.5 ounce) can mild red enchilada sauce', '2 (29 ounce) cans white hominy, rinsed and drained']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack at about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Place the poblano chiles cut-side-down onto the baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Place the blackened peppers into a bowl, and tightly seal with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 6: Allow the peppers to steam as they cool, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Once cool, remove the skins and discard.
', 'Step 8: Dice the chiles.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir the bacon in a large pot over medium heat until it has released its fat and is beginning to crisp, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Drain the bacon on a paper towel-lined plate, and discard all but 1 tablespoon of bacon grease from the pot.
', 'Step 11: Increase the heat to medium-high, and add the pork loin cubes.
', 'Step 12: Cook, stirring occasionally until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove the pork from the pot, and reduce the heat to medium.
', 'Step 14: Stir in the onion and garlic; cook and stir until the onion has softened and is beginning to turn brown, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Stir the roasted poblano chiles, jalapeno peppers, oregano, cumin, New Mexico chile powder, cloves, salt, and cilantro into the onions; cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 16: Pour in the chicken stock and enchilada sauce.
', 'Step 17: Stir in the bacon and pork cubes, and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 18: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 1 hour.
', 'Step 19: Stir in the hominy, recover, and continue cooking 1 hour more until the pork is very tender.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '325.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '26.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '54.9 mg', 'fatContent': '14.6 g', 'fiberContent': '5 g', 'proteinContent': '21 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '1101.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.3 g'}

Title: Vegetarian Mexican Rice
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '⅔ cup diced onion', '1 ½ cups uncooked white rice', '1 cup chopped green bell pepper', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 ½ (8 ounce) cans tomato sauce', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 clove garlic, minced', '⅛ teaspoon powdered saffron', '3 cups water']

', 'Step 2: Place the onions in the pan, and saute until golden.
', 'Step 3: Add rice to pan, and stir to coat grains with oil.
', 'Step 4: Mix in green bell pepper, cumin, chili powder, tomato sauce, salt, garlic, saffron, and water.
', 'Step 5: Cover, bring to a boil, and then reduce heat to simmer.
', 'Step 6: Cook for 30 to 40 minutes, or until rice is tender.
', 'Step 7: Stir occasionally.
']

Title: Easy Tacos

Title: Chef John's Watermelon Agua Fresca
Ingredients: ['½ seedless watermelon', '2 cups cold water', '½ cup white sugar, or to taste', '½ cup water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Scoop flesh from watermelon half and transfer watermelon to a blender.
', 'Step 2: Add 2 cups cold water.
', 'Step 3: Place a folded towel on blender lid and blend until liquefied, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Strain through a fine mesh strainer into a large bowl to remove fibers.
', 'Step 5: Discard fibers left in strainer.
', 'Step 6: Skim and discard excess foam from juice if desired.
', 'Step 7: Place sugar and 1/2 cup water into a saucepan over medium heat and stir until water is hot and sugar has dissolved.
', 'Step 8: Turn off heat and let simple syrup cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 9: Stir simple syrup into watermelon juice to taste.
', 'Step 10: Pour drink into a 2-quart pitcher and refrigerate until cold, at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 11: To serve, fill tall glasses with ice cubes and pour agua fresca drink over ice.
', 'Step 12: Serve with straws.
']

Title: Easy Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon adobo seasoning', '4 (3 ounce) fillets mahi mahi', '1 dash lime juice', '1 medium tomato, diced', '½ red onion, chopped', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 scallions, thinly sliced', '2 tablespoons lime juice', 'cooking spray', '8 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 avocado, sliced']

', 'Step 4: Cook mahi mahi until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.

', 'Step 7: Place 1/2 of each mahi mahi fillet on a tortilla.
', 'Step 8: Top each with 2 slices avocado and 1 scoop of pico de gallo.
']

Title: Camarones con Crema (Mexican Shrimp in Cream)
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '½ red bell pepper, diced', '½ green bell pepper, diced', '½ sweet onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, diced, or more to taste', '1 cup chicken broth', '1 (7 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '3 tablespoons Mexican crema', '2 teaspoons ground dried chile de arbol peppers, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '1 ½ pounds uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Place bell peppers, onion, and garlic in the butter and saute until tender and onion is translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Save pan and juices and keep warm.
', 'Step 5: Combine broth and green chiles in a separate pan and bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 6: Turn off heat and add cream cheese, stirring slowly until incorporated.
', 'Step 7: Add Mexican crema, chile de arbol, cumin, and oregano.
', 'Step 8: Stir again.
', 'Step 9: Add peppers, onion, and garlic; stir to incorporate.
', 'Step 10: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 11: Heat reserved pan with juices over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 12: Cook shrimp until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 13: Stir shrimp into cream mixture and serve.
']

Title: Champurrado
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups water', '1 cinnamon stick', '1 whole clove', '1 pod star anise', '4 ¼ cups milk', '2 tablets Mexican chocolate (such as Chocolate Ibarra®)', '¾ cup pinole (coarse ground maize flour)', '1 pinch crushed piloncillo (Mexican brown sugar cone), or more to taste']

', 'Step 2: Strain.
', 'Step 3: n Heat milk, chocolate, and pinole in another saucepan over medium heat, whisking until chocolate is dissolved and liquid is thickened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and add piloncillo; let rest until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 5: Pour cinnamon water into chocolate mixture and stir to combine.
']

Title: Frijoles III
Ingredients: ['1 pound dried pinto beans, washed', '1 white onion, chopped', '½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '1 fresh jalapeno pepper, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons lard', 'water to cover', 'salt to taste']

['Step 1: Place beans in a large pot with onion, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, garlic, and lard; add enough water to cover with 4 to 5 inches of water.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and cook for 2 to 3 hours.
', 'Step 3: Depending on the beans, it may take up to 5 hours.
', 'Step 4: Add more water if necessary.
', 'Step 5: When beans are soft, season to taste with salt.
']
