Title: Tamales de Puerco (Red Pork Tamales)
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds boneless pork shoulder, trimmed', '½ onion', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '2 bay leaves', 'salt to taste', 'water to cover', 'corn husks', '1 pound Roma tomatoes', '4 dried chile de arbol peppers', '4 small guajillo chile peppers, stemmed and seeded', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '1 ¼ cups lard', '4 ½ cups fresh corn masa dough', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 tablespoon baking powder']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cut pork into 3 chunks and place in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Add onion, garlic, bay leaves, and salt and cover with water.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil; skim foam from surface.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Remove pork and let cool.
', 'Step 6: Strain broth and reserve.
', 'Step 7: Bring a pot of water to a boil while pork is cooking.
', 'Step 8: Add tomatoes, arbol chiles, and guajillo chiles, and boil until chiles are soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove with a slotted spoon, reserving cooking water, and allow to cool.
', 'Step 10: Place corn husks in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and soak for 30 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Drain, place on a work surface, and cover with a clean, damp towel.
', 'Step 12: Combine tomatoes, 1/2 cup cooking water, chiles de arbol, guajillo chiles, and cornstarch in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 13: Strain tomato sauce through a fine-mesh sieve.
', 'Step 14: Beat lard with an electric mixer in a large bowl until fluffy.
', 'Step 15: Combine masa, 1 cup reserved pork broth, 1 tablespoon salt, and baking powder in a separate bowl and mix until smooth.
', 'Step 16: Add masa mixture to lard and mix until it has a smooth cookie dough consistency.
', "Step 17: Test if the masa is ready by dropping a small ball of masa into a glass of cold water; if it floats, it's ready, if not, keep beating for a little longer.
", 'Step 18: Shred cooled pork with 2 forks.
', 'Step 19: Select 1 wide corn husk or 2 small ones.
', 'Step 20: Spread about 2 tablespoons masa mixture onto the the corn husk, filling it up to 2 inches from the bottom and 1/4 inch from the top.
', 'Step 21: Add 1 tablespoon of the tomato sauce and pork down the center of the masa mixture.
', 'Step 22: Fold sides of husk together, 1 over the other.
', 'Step 23: Fold the bottom of the husk over the seam of the 2 folded sides.
', 'Step 24: Repeat with remaining husks.
', 'Step 25: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 26: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 27: Add tamales with the open side up and cook until filling is heated through and separates from the husk, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 28: Let tamales rest for 15 minutes before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '343.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '30 g', 'cholesterolContent': '33.3 mg', 'fatContent': '20.3 g', 'fiberContent': '2.9 g', 'proteinContent': '9.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '643.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.2 g'}

Title: Chorizo Breakfast Bowls
Ingredients: ['4 Roma tomatoes, diced', '½ cup diced sweet onion', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '1 lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '⅛ teaspoon garlic salt', '1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '3 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '2 (10 ounce) bags frozen sweet potatoes', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (1 pound) ground chorizo sausage', '4 eggs', '4 avocados, peeled and sliced', '¼ cup crumbled Cotija cheese', '1 teaspoon Mexican-style hot sauce (such as Valentina®)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine tomatoes, onion, cilantro, jalapeno, lime juice, minced garlic, and garlic salt in a bowl; stir to combine.
', 'Step 2: Transfer 1/2 cup pico de gallo to a second bowl and stir in black beans.
', 'Step 3: Cover both bowls and set in the refrigerator.
', 'Step 4: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Add sweet potatoes and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir until browned and crispy, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, cook and stir chorizo in a second skillet over medium heat until browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Distribute cooked chorizo, sweet potatoes, black bean mixture, and avocado amongst 4 bowls.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle with Cojita cheese.
', 'Step 10: Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil.
', 'Step 12: Crack eggs into the pan and cook until outer edges become opaque, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 13: Cover the skillet and reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 14: Cook until whites are set and yolks are set to your desired firmness, 4 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Place an egg on top of each bowl.
', 'Step 16: Serve with more pico de gallo and hot sauce.
']

Title: D's Taco Pizza
Ingredients: ['½ pound ground beef', '½ cup chopped onion', '1 clove garlic', '½ (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '⅓ cup water', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with garlic and onion', '1 cup salsa', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 cup refried beans', '1 12-inch prepared pizza crust', '1 ½ cups Mexican-style shredded four-cheese blend', '2 cups shredded lettuce', '2 tomatoes, chopped', '1 (2.25 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained', '¼ cup chopped green onion', '½ cup Mexican-style shredded four-cheese blend', '1 cup sour cream, or as desired', '1 cup salsa, or as desired']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cook and stir the ground beef, onion, and garlic together in a large skillet over medium-high heat until the beef is completely browned; drain fat from the skillet.
', 'Step 2: Stir the taco seasoning mix and water into the beef mixture; bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Place the prepared pizza curst on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: Blend the diced tomatoes with garlic and onion, salsa, and cilantro in a blender until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Spread the refried beans in an even layer on the prepared pizza crust, leaving a border of about 1/2-inch uncovered around the outside.
', 'Step 7: Spread about 1 cup of the diced tomato mixture over the refried beans in an even layer; reserve the remaining sauce.
', 'Step 8: Scatter the ground beef mixture over the layer of sauce.
', 'Step 9: Cover the beef with 1 1/2 cups Mexican-style shredded cheese blend.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is bubbly and the edges of the crust are golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes; set aside to cool 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Top the pizza with shredded lettuce, chopped tomatoes, black olives, green onions, and 1/2 cup Mexican-style shredded cheese blend.
', 'Step 12: Serve with the reserved sauce, sour cream, and 1 cup salsa.
']

Title: Tacos al Pastor
Ingredients: ['8 dried pasilla chiles, seeded and torn to pieces', '8 dried guajillo chiles, seeded and torn to pieces', '8 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 teaspoon achiote powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '5 whole cloves', '1 cup white vinegar', 'salt to taste', '2 pounds pork tenderloin, thinly sliced', '½ cup chopped pineapple', '32 (5 inch) corn tortillas', '1 small onion, chopped', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '4 limes, cut in wedges']

['Step 1: Soak pasilla chiles and guajillo chiles in a bowl with hot water until chiles are softened, about 10 minutes; drain.

', 'Step 4: Season with salt.
', 'Step 5: Rub chile paste over sliced pork, stacking meat on a plate.
', 'Step 6: Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 7: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir marinated pork and pineapple until pork is browned, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Divide pork over stacks of two corn tortillas and serve with onion, cilantro, and lime wedges.
']

Title: Make-Ahead Cheesy Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 cups diced cooked chicken', '3 cups shredded Mexican-blend cheese, divided', '½ cup sliced roasted red peppers', '1 (4.5 ounce) can diced green chile peppers', '1 cup sour cream', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '8 (10 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 2: Mix chicken, 1 1/2 cup Mexican cheese, roasted peppers, chile peppers, and sour cream in a bowl until well combined.
', 'Step 3: Heat enchilada sauce in a 12-inch frying pan.
', 'Step 4: Dip a tortilla in the sauce until well coated and slightly softened.
', 'Step 5: Top with 1/2 cup chicken mixture.
', 'Step 6: Roll up tortilla and place seam side-down in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Repeat with remaining tortillas and chicken mixture.
', 'Step 8: Top enchiladas with remaining sauce and sprinkle with remaining cheese.

', 'Step 10: Refrigerate until ready to cook, up to 2 days.
', 'Step 11: When ready to bake, remove enchiladas from the refrigerator and let sit for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Keep foil cover on.
', 'Step 13: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, about 1 hour.
']

Title: Easy Dorito® Taco Salad
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 envelope taco seasoning mix', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '2 cups ranch dressing', '½ cup Italian-style salad dressing', '1 red onion, diced', '1 head lettuce, shredded', '1 (17 ounce) package nacho-flavor tortilla chips, crushed into bite-size pieces']

Title: Slow Cooker Charro Beans
Ingredients: ['1 pound dry pinto beans, sorted', 'water as needed', '6 slices bacon, chopped', '4 medium Roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '2 medium onions, chopped', '1 medium green bell pepper, chopped', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped', '½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer (such as Shiner® Bock)', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place pinto beans into a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let soak, 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 2: Rinse and drain.
', 'Step 3: Place beans in a slow cooker with just enough water to cover.
', 'Step 4: Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until almost browned and crispy, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add tomatoes, onions, bell pepper, jalapenos, cilantro, and garlic.
', 'Step 6: Saute in bacon drippings for 2 minutes, then slowly pour in the beer.
', 'Step 7: Add salt, pepper, chili powder, and cumin.
', 'Step 8: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Add this mixture to the beans and water in the slow cooker.
', 'Step 10: Cook on Low for 8 hours.
', 'Step 11: Serve.
']

Title: Enchiladas Verdes (Green Enchiladas)
Ingredients: ['12 Anaheim chile peppers', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '4 cups buttermilk, divided', '2 teaspoons salt, or as needed', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '½ cup canola oil for frying', '12 (6 inch) white corn tortillas, or more as needed', '1 white onion, diced', '1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '¼ cup crumbled queso fresco', '½ cup Mexican crema (cream)']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Arrange peppers on prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Broil peppers in the preheated oven until skins begin to blister and turn black, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Turn peppers and repeat until other side is evenly blistered and blackened.
', 'Step 6: Place peppers in a plastic resealable bag, seal, and cover with a kitchen towel.
', 'Step 7: Let peppers sit so the steam loosens the outer skin, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove peppers from bag and rub off blackened skin.
', 'Step 9: Break open and remove seeds and stem.
', 'Step 10: Blend peppers, flour, and 2 cups buttermilk in a blender until creamy.
', 'Step 11: Transfer to a medium skillet over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 12: Add remaining 2 cups buttermilk and stir.
', 'Step 13: Season with salt.
', 'Step 14: Simmer until sauce is thickened, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Set aside.
', 'Step 16: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil; add chicken.
', 'Step 17: Boil until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Drain, cool, and shred chicken.
', 'Step 19: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 20: Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 21: Fry corn tortillas in hot oil, working in batches, until just softened, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
', 'Step 23: Pour about 1 cup of pepper enchilada sauce into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 24: Fill each tortilla with shredded chicken, diced onion, and 1 to 2 tablespoons Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 25: Roll tortilla around the filling and place seam-side down into the pepper enchilada sauce in the baking dish.
', 'Step 26: Top enchiladas with remaining pepper sauce, remaining Monterey Jack cheese, and queso fresco.
', 'Step 27: Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbling and cheese is melted, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 28: Top with Mexican crema to serve.
']

Title: Anise Seed Borrachio Cookies
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons anise seed', '3 tablespoons rum', '1 ¼ cups butter', '¾ cup white sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract', '2 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '1 egg', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cloves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the anise seeds in a small bowl with the rum.
', 'Step 2: Set aside to marinate overnight.
', 'Step 3: In a medium bowl, cream together the butter, sugar and vanilla until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the anise seed and rum.
', 'Step 5: Mix in the egg.
', 'Step 6: Combine the flour, salt, baking powder and cloves; stir into the butter mixture until well blended.
', 'Step 7: Cover and refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 8: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to 1/8 inch thickness.
', 'Step 10: Cut into desired shapes using cookie cutters.
', 'Step 11: Place cookies on a greased cookie sheet.
', 'Step 12: Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown at the edges.
', 'Step 13: Cool for a few minutes on baking sheets before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
']

Title: Top Shelf Margaritas on the Rocks
Ingredients: ['⅔ cup sugar', '⅓ cup water', '2 ¼ cups water', '1 ½ cups fresh lemon juice', '¼ cup sugar', '1 egg white', '2 cups ice cubes', '2 cups premium tequila', '1 cup Cointreau', '½ cup lime juice', '16 lime wedges', 'coarse kosher salt']

', 'Step 5: Spread the kosher salt onto a plate and dip the glass rims in the salt to coat; add ice if desired.
', 'Step 6: Strain the mixture from the cocktail shaker into the glass to serve.
']

Title: Pollo Adobado
Ingredients: ['2 Roma tomatoes', '4 guajillo chile peppers, stemmed and seeded', '⅓ large onion', '1 stalk celery', '1 carrot, peeled', '1 clove garlic', '1 cup chicken stock', '2 tablespoons chicken bouillon granules', '2 pounds chicken breasts', '3 bay leaves']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place tomatoes, 2 guajillo peppers, onion, celery, carrot, and garlic into a large pot and cover with water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium and simmer until vegetables are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.

', 'Step 9: An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
']

Title: Cassava Flour Tortillas
Ingredients: ['½ cup lukewarm water', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 cup cassava flour', '2 ½ tablespoons vegetable oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Prepare a tortilla press with 2 pieces of parchment paper.
', 'Step 2: Set aside.
', 'Step 3: Pour warm water into a bowl and stir in salt until it dissolves.
', 'Step 4: Combine flour, salt water, and oil in a bowl and mix with your hands until a smooth dough forms.
', 'Step 5: Move dough to a smooth surface and lightly knead until dough feels compact and does not crumble.
', 'Step 6: Separate into 4 equal pieces and roll them into balls.
', 'Step 7: Heat a griddle over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 8: Press one dough ball between 2 pieces of parchment paper in the tortilla press.
', 'Step 9: Press down.
', 'Step 10: Open press and carefully peel off the top piece of parchment paper.
', 'Step 11: Flip tortilla onto your hand and carefully peel off the 2nd piece of paper.
', 'Step 12: Return paper back onto tortilla press.
', 'Step 13: Immediately cook the pressed tortilla on the hot griddle.
', 'Step 14: Cook until bubbles form, flip over, and cook on the other side until browned.
', 'Step 15: Do not flip the tortilla before bubbles form or the tortilla will break.
', 'Step 16: Repeat with remaining dough balls.
', 'Step 17: Serve immediately or cover with a cloth and reheat in the microwave for 30 seconds at 600W.
']

Title: Chicken Tortilla Soup III
Ingredients: ['3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 onion, chopped', '3 tablespoons margarine', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '3 (14 ounce) cans chicken broth', '4 cups half-and-half', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '1 cup fresh salsa', '1 (15 ounce) can creamed corn', '6 boneless, chicken breast halves - cooked, skinned', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 (1.27 ounce) packet dry fajita seasoning', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '16 ounces tortilla chips', '8 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large pot over medium heat, saute the garlic and onion in the butter or margarine for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Add flour and stir well, cooking for 1 minute more.
', 'Step 3: Add the broth and half-and-half.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 5: Add the soup, salsa, corn, chicken, cumin, fajita seasoning and 2 tablespoons cilantro.
', 'Step 6: Stir and continue to heat for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Crumble tortilla chips into individual bowls, add 1/2 ounce shredded cheese to each bowl and ladle in soup.
', 'Step 8: Top each bowl with more crumbled chips, remaining 1/2 ounce cheese and remaining 1 tablespoon cilantro, and serve.
']

Title: Tres Leches 'Three Milks'
Ingredients: ['5 eggs', '1 cup white sugar', '1 cup self-rising flour', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk', '1 cup milk', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '3 egg whites', '1 cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Grease and flour a 8 x 12 inch pan.
', 'Step 2: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 3: Separate 5 eggs, and beat the egg whites in a large mixing bowl.
', 'Step 4: Add 1 cup sugar slowly to the egg whites, beating constantly.
', 'Step 5: Add the yolks one by one, beating well after each addition.
', 'Step 6: Stir in the 1 teaspoon vanilla.
', 'Step 7: Sift the flour, and stir it into the egg mixture.
', 'Step 8: Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
', 'Step 9: Bake the cake for 20 minutes, or until done.
', 'Step 10: Cool.
', 'Step 11: Blend the sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, milk, and 1 tablespoon vanilla.
', 'Step 12: Pour this syrup over the cooled cake.
', 'Step 13: To make Meringue Frosting: Beat 3 egg whites to soft peaks.
', 'Step 14: Gradually add 1 cup sugar, and beat until stiff peaks form.
', 'Step 15: Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla.
', 'Step 16: Frost the cake.
']

Title: Spicy Chicken and Black Bean Bake
Ingredients: ['2 cups shredded cooked chicken', '1 large red bell pepper, diced', '½ red onion, diced', '½ cup sour cream', '½ cup jalapeno-flavored cream cheese', '1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 (14 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '¼ cup hot water', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '6 flour tortillas', '1 (16 ounce) jar salsa, or to taste', '½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Mix chicken, red bell pepper, red onion, sour cream, cream cheese, taco seasoning, and salt together in a large bowl.

', 'Step 4: Layer 3 tortillas into the bottom of a 9x9-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 5: Top tortillas with 1/2 the salsa, 1/2 the black bean mixture, and 1/2 the chicken mixture.
', 'Step 6: Repeat layering with remaining ingredients, ending with chicken mixture.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle casserole with mozzarella cheese.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden, 30 to 35 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Quick and Easy Huevos Rancheros
Ingredients: ['8 corn tostada shells', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '1 (7 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '½ (8 ounce) jar salsa', '2 cups chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained', '1 tablespoon butter, or as needed', '8 eggs']

['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Arrange tostada shells on a baking sheet.

', 'Step 4: Combine chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, salsa, and 1 cup cilantro in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until warm, about 5 minutes.

', 'Step 8: Bake tostadas in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes.

']

Title: Apple Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 (21 ounce) can apple pie filling', '6 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ cup butter', '½ cup white sugar', '½ cup brown sugar', '½ cup water']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 2 quart baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Spoon about one heaping quarter cup of pie filling evenly down the center of each tortilla.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle with cinnamon; roll up, tucking in edges; and place seam side down in prepared dish.

Title: Air Fryer Tostones
Ingredients: ['2 green (unripe) plantains', 'olive oil cooking spray', '3 cups water, or as needed', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Slice tips off the plantain.
', 'Step 3: Make a vertical cut in the skin from end to end, making sure to cut only through the thick skin and not into the plantain flesh.
', 'Step 4: Cut plantain, still with the peel, into 1-inch chunks.
', 'Step 5: Peel the skin off each chunk starting at the slit you made.
', 'Step 6: Place the plantain chunks in your air fryer basket and spray them with olive oil spray.
', 'Step 7: Air fry for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Meanwhile, prepare a bowl of salted water.
', 'Step 9: Remove the plantain pieces from the air fryer with tongs.
', 'Step 10: Smash to about 1/2-inch thickness using a tostonera (plantain smasher).
', 'Step 11: Soak the smashed tostones in the bowl of salted water while smashing the rest.
', 'Step 12: Remove the tostones from the salted water and pat dry with a paper towel.
', 'Step 13: Return tostones to the air fryer in batches, filling the basket with a single layer each time.
', 'Step 14: Spray the tops with olive oil spray and season with salt; air fry for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Flip with tongs and spray the other side with olive oil spray.
', 'Step 16: Season with salt.
', 'Step 17: Air fry until golden brown and crisp, 4 to 5 minutes more.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '109.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '28.5 g', 'fatContent': '0.4 g', 'fiberContent': '2.1 g', 'proteinContent': '1.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '47.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '13.4 g'}

Title: Sizzlin' Fajitas
Ingredients: ['4 cloves garlic', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '3 tablespoons lime juice', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '3 tablespoons minced fresh cilantro, or more to taste', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon white sugar', '½ teaspoon paprika', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 ½ pounds beef skirt steak, cut across the grain into 1/4-inch strips', '6 whole wheat tortillas, or as needed', '1 tablespoon canola oil, divided', '1 large onion, cut into slices', '1 red bell pepper, cut into strips', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Grind garlic with kosher salt with a mortar and pestle until a paste forms.
', 'Step 2: Whisk garlic paste, lime juice, olive oil, cilantro, chili powder, sugar, paprika, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl; pour marinade into a resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 3: Add skirt steak strips, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag.
', 'Step 4: Marinate in the refrigerator, 2 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 5: Remove steak from marinade and shake off excess; discard remaining marinade.
', 'Step 6: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Wrap tortillas tightly in aluminum foil to form a packet and place packet on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until warmed through, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Keep warm.
', 'Step 10: Heat 1 teaspoon canola oil in a large skillet over high heat until oil begins to smoke.
', 'Step 11: Saute onion and bell pepper in hot oil until browned and almost tender, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Transfer onion and pepper to a plate.
', 'Step 13: Heat 1 teaspoon canola oil in the same skillet over high heat until oil starts to smoke.
', 'Step 14: Cook 1/2 of the steak in hot oil until browned on all sides but still pink in the center, 4 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Transfer cooked steak to the plate with onion and pepper.
', 'Step 16: Heat remaining canola oil in the same skillet.
', 'Step 17: Cook remaining steak in hot oil until browned on all sides but still pink in the center, 4 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Stir cooked steak, onion, bell pepper, and any accumulated juices back into the skillet.
', 'Step 19: Add minced garlic and salt; cook and stir until fragrant and heated through.
', 'Step 20: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 21: Divide steak mixture between warm tortillas.
']

Title: Pineapple Pulled Pork Al Pastor
Ingredients: ['9 pounds bone-in pork shoulder roast', '1 cup kosher salt', '1 quart pineapple juice', '3 quarts cold water', '2 tablespoons kosher salt', '¼ cup ancho chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground chipotle pepper', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', '1 tablespoon dried Mexican oregano', '½ pineapple, cut into rings, or to taste', '1 serrano pepper, finely chopped', '2 tablespoons diced roasted red peppers', '¼ cup chopped cilantro', '¼ cup rice vinegar', 'salt to taste', '12 hamburger buns, split']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place pork in a large brining vessel.
', 'Step 2: Cut a few slashes into the fat side of the pork.
', 'Step 3: Whisk salt, pineapple juice, and water together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 4: Pour brine over the pork.
', 'Step 5: Refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours.
', 'Step 6: Combine salt, ancho powder, chipotle powder, garlic powder, cumin, cinnamon, and oregano together for the rub.
', 'Step 7: Remove pork from the brine and place on a deep baking pan lined with foil.
', 'Step 8: Season generously with the spice rub.
', 'Step 9: Reserve remaining spice rub for another use.
', 'Step 10: Preheat a charcoal grill for 300 to 325 degrees F (150 to 175 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Place 2 bricks on the grate, if you like, and place the baking pan on top.
', 'Step 12: Grill, occasionally spooning rendered juices over the meat, until very tender, about 7 hours.
', 'Step 13: Make sure to maintain the same 25-degree range in temperature by adjusting the vents under, and on top of the grill, or smoker.
', 'Step 14: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the pork should read 195 degrees F (91 degrees C).
', 'Step 15: Remove pan from the grill, wrap top in foil, and let rest for 1 hour.
', 'Step 16: Meanwhile, cook pineapple over the last of the coals until nicely charred, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Dice the grilled pineapple to get about 2 cups.
', 'Step 18: Combine in a bowl with serrano pepper, red peppers, cilantro, and rice vinegar.
', 'Step 19: Season with salt and a pinch of the leftover spice rub.
', 'Step 20: Remove pork bone and pull the meat apart.
', 'Step 21: Add to a bowl with some of the rendered fat; pull apart with 2 forks.
', 'Step 22: Place some pork over each bottom bun, top with pineapple salsa, and cover with the other bun half.
']

Title: Drowned Beef Sandwich with Chipotle Sauce (Torta Ahogada)

Title: Beef Barbacoa (Barbacoa de Res)
Ingredients: ['3 ½ pounds beef brisket', '1 white onion, halved', '3 cloves garlic', '3 bay leaves', 'salt to taste', 'water to cover', '6 small guajillo chile peppers, seeded and deveined', '2 small ancho chile peppers, seeded and deveined', '3 tablespoons white vinegar', '2 cloves garlic', '4 whole cloves', '3 whole allspice berries', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon dried thyme', '¼ teaspoon cumin seeds', '¼ teaspoon ground ginger', '1 pinch ground cinnamon', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place brisket in a stovetop pressure cooker.
', 'Step 2: Add onion, garlic, bay leaves, and salt; cover with water.
', "Step 3: Close cooker securely and place pressure regulator over vent according to manufacturer's instructions.
", 'Step 4: Heat until steam escapes in a steady flow and makes a whistling sound, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Adjust temperature until regulator is gently rocking.
', 'Step 6: Cook for 60 minutes.
', "Step 7: Let pressure release naturally according to manufacturer's instructions, 5 to 10 minutes.
", 'Step 8: Unlock lid and remove.
', 'Step 9: Remove brisket from the pressure cooker and shred with 2 forks.
', 'Step 10: Strain the cooking liquid, discarding solids.
', 'Step 11: Measure 2 cups for the barbacoa sauce and save the rest for another use.
', 'Step 12: Combine guajillo chile peppers and ancho chile peppers in a saucepan.
', 'Step 13: Cover with water, bring to a boil, and cook for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Remove from heat and let stand in the hot water until softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Drain.
', 'Step 16: Combine softened chile peppers, vinegar, garlic, cloves, allspice, black pepper, oregano, thyme, cumin, ginger, cinnamon and reserved 2 cups cooking liquid; blend until thick and very smooth.
', 'Step 17: Pour sauce into a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat and season with salt.
', 'Step 18: Bring to a soft boil; reduce the heat to low.
', 'Step 19: Stir in shredded beef, coating completely with sauce.
', 'Step 20: Cover pot and cook until flavors combine, at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '173.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '6.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '53.2 mg', 'fatContent': '5.4 g', 'fiberContent': '1.2 g', 'proteinContent': '24.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '1517.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.1 g'}

Title: Becky's Easy Cilantro Lime Rice

', 'Step 4: Simmer until the rice has absorbed the liquid entirely, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Manda's Seven Layer Taco Dip
Ingredients: ['1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese at room temperature', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '1 (1 ounce) packet dry taco seasoning mix', '1 pint cherry tomatoes, halved', '2 avocados - peeled, pitted, and diced', '¼ cup red onion, minced', '1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 (15 ounce) can refried black beans', '1 ¼ cups salsa', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican blend cheese', '1 ½ cups shredded iceberg lettuce', '⅓ cup pickled jalapeno pepper slices']
Cooking Instructions:

Title: Mexican Chorizo and Potato Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ pound lean ground beef', '½ pound Mexican chorizo, casing removed and meat crumbled', '½ cup chopped onion', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 cup frozen corn', '½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 (2 pound) package hash brown potatoes', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', 'shredded lettuce', '1 cup guacamole']

', 'Step 11: Serve with shredded lettuce and guacamole.

Title: Pozole in a Slow Cooker
Ingredients: ['2 pasilla chile peppers - stems, seeds, and veins removed', '2 ancho chile peppers - stems, seeds, and veins removed', '2 guajillo chile peppers - stems, seeds, and veins removed', 'water, to cover', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds', '2 cloves garlic', '½ white onion, chopped', '5 Roma tomatoes, chopped', '1 (3 1/2) pound pork shoulder, cut into several large pieces', 'salt to taste', '2 bay leaves', '4 cups chicken stock', '2 (15.5 ounce) cans white hominy, rinsed and drained']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Toast the cumin in a small pot over medium-high heat until fragrant, being careful not to burn, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Add the pasilla chile peppers, ancho chile peppers, and guajillo chile peppers to the pot.
', 'Step 3: Pour enough water into the pot to cover the peppers completely.
', 'Step 4: Place the garlic cloves, onion, and tomatoes atop the chiles.
', 'Step 5: Cover the pot with a lid, reduce heat to low, and simmer the mixture for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat and allow the mixture to cool.
', 'Step 7: Pour the cooled mixture into a blender; puree until smooth.
', 'Step 8: Put the pork in the bottom of a slow cooker; season generously with salt.
', 'Step 9: Add the bay leaves to the slow cooker and pour the pureed chile pepper mixture over the pork.
', 'Step 10: Cook on Low for 8 to 9 hours or overnight.
', 'Step 11: Skim as much fat from the surface as possible.
', 'Step 12: Remove the pork to a cutting board or bowl and shred with two forks.
', 'Step 13: Return the shredded pork to the slow cooker and mix with the sauce.
', 'Step 14: Combine the shredded pork with sauce, chicken stock, and hominy in a large pot over medium heat; cook until the stock is hot, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Serve hot.
']

Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 head lettuce, chopped', '5 cups crushed nacho cheese-flavored tortilla chips', '2 cups shredded Colby-Jack cheese', '1 (15 ounce) can dark red kidney beans, drained and rinsed', '1 tomato, diced', '⅓ cup chopped onion', '¼ cup pickled jalapeno peppers, chopped', '1 cup vegetable oil', '½ cup white sugar', '½ cup ketchup', '1 envelope taco seasoning mix', '2 tablespoons cider vinegar', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cook ground beef, garlic powder, chili powder, and black pepper together in a skillet over medium heat until meat is brown and crumbly, about 10 minutes, breaking the meat up into chunks as it cooks.
', 'Step 2: Drain excess grease, remove from heat, and let the meat cool.
', 'Step 3: Toss lettuce, tortilla chips, Colby-Jack cheese, kidney beans, tomato, onion, and pickled jalapeno peppers in a large salad bowl; mix in the beef.
', 'Step 4: Whisk vegetable oil, sugar, ketchup, taco seasoning, cider vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce together in a bowl until sugar has dissolved; pour dressing over the salad and toss again.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '560.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '34.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '54.1 mg', 'fatContent': '39.8 g', 'fiberContent': '4.2 g', 'proteinContent': '18 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '11.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '844.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '15.9 g'}

Title: Easy Taco Pie
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning', '1 (8 ounce) package refrigerated crescent roll dough', '1 (14 ounce) can refried beans', '1 cup sour cream', '1 cup salsa, drained slightly', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Prepare a large deep-dish pie pan with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Break ground beef into small pieces and add to hot skillet; cook and stir until the beef is crumbly and no longer pink, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain and discard any excess grease.
', 'Step 6: Season drained beef with taco seasoning.
', 'Step 7: Press refrigerated dough into the bottom of the prepared pan.
', 'Step 8: Spread refried beans in an even layer onto the dough.
', 'Step 9: Spread sour cream into a layer atop the refried beans.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle ground beef evenly over the sour cream; top with salsa and Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbly and crust has browned, 25 to 30 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '569.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '33.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '97.7 mg', 'fatContent': '35.1 g', 'fiberContent': '4.2 g', 'proteinContent': '27.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '16.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '1418.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.3 g'}

Title: Shredded Tri-Tip for Tacos in the Slow Cooker
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 (3 pound) beef tri-tip roast, fat layer left untrimmed', "2 teaspoons garlic pepper seasoning (such as SuzyQ's Santa Maria Valley Style Seasoning®), or to taste", '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons minced garlic', '2 onions, chopped', '2 teaspoons ground ancho chile pepper', '2 teaspoons cayenne pepper', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '1 ½ cups white wine', '1 (28 ounce) can crushed tomatoes', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Spray the inside of a slow cooker with cooking spray.
', 'Step 2: Season the tri-tip roast with garlic pepper seasoning on both sides.
', 'Step 3: Heat olive oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat, and sear the roast on all sides until well browned, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 4: Place the tri-tip roast into the slow cooker, fatty side up.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir the garlic and onions in the hot skillet until golden brown, about 10 minutes, and season with the ancho chile pepper, cayenne pepper, and black pepper.
', 'Step 6: Place seasoned garlic and onions over the roast in the cooker, and pour in the white wine and crushed tomatoes.
', 'Step 7: Cover the cooker, set to Low, and cook until tender, about 8 hours.
', 'Step 8: Remove roast from the cooker, and cut off the fatty layer with a sharp knife (tender meat should cut easily).
', 'Step 9: Place the roast back into the cooker, and shred meat with two forks.
', 'Step 10: If desired, remove some of the liquid from the meat.
', 'Step 11: Stir in cilantro and serve.
']

Title: Creamy Cilantro Salad Dressing
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups mayonnaise', '¾ cup canola oil', '⅓ cup toasted pumpkin seeds', '¼ cup distilled water', '¼ cup red wine vinegar', '¼ cup crumbled Cotija cheese', '2 roasted Anaheim chile peppers', '2 cloves garlic, crushed', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '2 bunches fresh cilantro, rinsed and stemmed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Blend mayonnaise, canola oil, pumpkin seeds, water, vinegar, Cotija cheese, roasted chile peppers, garlic, salt, and pepper in a blender until smooth, about 1 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Add cilantro in batches, blending each to incorporate completely before adding the next, 30 to 60 seconds per batch.
', 'Step 3: n Pour dressing into an air-tight container and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.
']

Title: Black Bean Lasagna
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 onions, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '½ green bell pepper, diced', '½ red bell pepper, diced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chopped tomatoes', '1 cup salsa', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed', 'salt and black pepper to taste', '2 avocados - peeled, pitted, and mashed', '1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas, quartered', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Warm oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Stir in onions, 3 cloves of chopped garlic, and green and red bell peppers.
', 'Step 5: Cook until the onions are soft and translucent.
', 'Step 6: Stir in tomatoes with juice, salsa, and black beans.
', 'Step 7: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Bring to a simmer, and cook about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 9: In a bowl, mash the avocados with 1 clove chopped garlic and lemon juice.
', 'Step 10: Place a layer of tortillas on the bottom of the baking dish.
', 'Step 11: Spread 1/3 of the tomato and bean mixture on top.
', 'Step 12: Spread 1/2 of guacamole on top, then sprinkle with 1/3 of cheese.
', 'Step 13: Lay out another layer of tortillas.
', 'Step 14: Top with half of the remaining tomato and bean mixture.
', 'Step 15: Then spread remaining guacamole on top.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle with half the cheese.
', 'Step 17: Repeat with remaining ingredients.
', 'Step 18: Bake in preheated oven for 35 minutes, or until sauce is bubbly.
']

Title: Low-Fat Sour Cream Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) container fat-free sour cream', '1 (10.75 ounce) can reduced-fat cream of chicken soup', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', 'cooking spray (such as Pam®)', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 cup shredded cooked chicken, or more to taste', '1 cup chopped onion', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '8 flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Colby-pepperjack cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix sour cream, cream of chicken soup, and cilantro in a saucepan over medium heat; cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 3: Spray a large skillet with cooking spray; add tomatoes with green chile peppers, chicken, onion, and green chiles.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir mixture over medium heat until onion is transparent, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Place tortillas on a microwave-safe plate; heat in the microwave until warm and flexible, about 10 seconds.
', 'Step 6: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Spray an 8x11-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 8: Spoon 2 to 3 tablespoons chicken mixture down the center of each tortilla; sprinkle filling with about 1 tablespoon Colby-pepperjack cheese.
', 'Step 9: Roll each tortilla around the filling and place seam side down into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Top tortillas with sour cream sauce; sprinkle remaining cheese over sour cream layer.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbling and cheese is melted, 25 to 30 minutes.
']

Title: Cast Iron Chicken Fajitas
Ingredients: ['2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chipotle chile powder', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '2 medium bell peppers, sliced', '1 medium onion, sliced', '3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided', '1 medium lime, juiced', '16 (8 inch) flour tortillas, warmed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Dry chicken with paper towels and pound to a uniform thickness of 1/2 to 3/4-inch thickness.
', 'Step 2: Combine cumin, chipotle chili powder, chili powder, smoked paprika, salt, coriander, garlic, Mexican oregano, and pepper in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Divide spice mixture in half.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle chicken with 1/2 of the spice mixture and rub on both sides of the chicken.
', 'Step 5: Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to 8 hours.
', 'Step 6: Combine bell pepper slices, onion slices, and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a bowl.
', 'Step 7: Stir vegetables until coated in oil, then sprinkle reserved spice mix over the vegetables.
', 'Step 8: Stir until evenly coated; set aside.
', 'Step 9: Heat a dry 12-inch cast iron skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Pour remaining 2 tablespoons oil into the hot skillet.
', 'Step 11: Add chicken breasts to the skillet and cook until the chicken is nicely browned, 4 to 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 12: Transfer chicken to a cutting board.
', 'Step 13: Add seasoned vegetables to the same skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: While vegetables are cooking, slice the chicken breasts into 1/2-inch slices, and add back to the skillet to continue cooking.
', 'Step 15: Continue stirring and cooking until the chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear.
', 'Step 16: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 17: Remove skillet from heat and drizzle lime juice over all.
', 'Step 18: Give one final stir and serve in warm flour tortillas.
']

Title: Taco Pies
Ingredients: ['2 (9 inch) deep dish frozen pie crusts, thawed', '1 pound ground beef', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '1 onion, chopped', '1 cup crushed tortilla chips', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '2 cups shredded lettuce', '1 large tomato, diced', 'sour cream', 'black olives']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Bake pie crusts following package directions, but cutting the bake time in half.
', 'Step 3: In a large, heavy skillet over medium-high heat, cook the ground beef until evenly brown; drain excess fat.
', 'Step 4: Place half the refried beans in each pie shell, smearing over the bottom and the sides of the partially baked shells.
', 'Step 5: Spread a layer of ground meat over the beans, and top with the onion, crushed tortilla chips, and cheese.
', 'Step 6: Bake 15 to 20 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown, and the cheese is bubbly.
', 'Step 7: Top with lettuce, tomato, sour cream, and black olives.
']

Title: Sweet Pork for Burritos
Ingredients: ['3 pounds pork shoulder roast', '2 cups salsa', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle cola-flavored carbonated beverage', '2 cups brown sugar', '½ (1.27 ounce) packet fajita seasoning', '2 tablespoons taco seasoning mix', '1 (7 ounce) can chopped green chilies']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place pork roast in the crock of a slow cooker, and add 4 cups water.
', 'Step 2: Cook on High for 5 hours.
', 'Step 3: Remove pork from the slow cooker and drain liquid.
', 'Step 4: Cut the pork into 4 pieces, and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Puree salsa in blender.
', 'Step 6: Combine the pureed salsa, cola, brown sugar, fajita seasoning, taco seasoning, and green chilies in the crock of the slow cooker.
', 'Step 7: Add the pork, and cook on High for an additional 3 hours.
', 'Step 8: Remove the pork, and shred with 2 forks.
', 'Step 9: Serve.
']

Title: The World's Best Tortilla Soup
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 white onion, diced', '2 cloves garlic, diced', '1 (32 ounce) can chicken broth', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth', '1 (15 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '4 large fresh tomatoes, diced', '2 Anaheim chile peppers, stemmed and seeded', '1 jalapeno pepper, stemmed and seeded', '2 tablespoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 whole rotisserie chicken, torn into bite-sized pieces', '1 lime, sliced into wedges', '3 cups crushed corn chips', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 avocado - peeled, seeded, and sliced', '3 sprigs cilantro, diced']

', 'Step 2: Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until brown and tender, about 5 minutes.

', 'Step 4: Add fresh tomatoes.
', 'Step 5: Mix Anaheim chile peppers, jalapeno pepper, cumin, chili powder, and pepper into the pot.
', 'Step 6: Stir in chicken.
', 'Step 7: Bring to a boil; reduce heat to medium and simmer soup until flavors combine, about 20 minutes.

Title: Birria Quesa Tacos
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons sesame seeds', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns', '1 teaspoon coriander seeds', '½ (1 inch) piece cinnamon stick', '2 whole cloves', '3 bay leaves', '2 cups beef broth', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '4 peppers guajillo chile peppers', '2 small ancho chile pepper', '1 chile de arbol chile peppers', '1 large white onion', '7 cloves garlic, minced', '2 pounds goat stew meat, cut into 1-inch cubes', '¼ cup distilled white vinegar', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons dried Mexican oregano', '¼ teaspoon ground thyme', '1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '16 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '1 cup grated Cheddar cheese', '1 lime, cut into wedges', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat sesame seeds, cumin, peppercorns, coriander seeds, cinnamon stick, cloves, and bay leaves in a dry pan over medium heat until fragrant and the sesame seeds begin to brown.
', 'Step 2: Remove from the pan and set aside.
', 'Step 3: Heat beef broth in a medium-sized pot and turn to a low simmer.
', 'Step 4: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Add guajillo, ancho, and chile de arbol peppers, turning occasionally.
', 'Step 6: Remove the peppers once they have started to blister a bit, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Place the peppers in the pot of simmering broth.
', 'Step 8: Cover and allow to simmer until the peppers are rehydrated and tender, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Slice 3/4 of the onion into thick slices and finely dice the rest.
', 'Step 10: Put the diced onion aside.
', 'Step 11: Add the thick slices to the pot, along with the garlic, and cook until the onion is browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove and set aside.
', 'Step 13: Heat remaining oil in the pot over medium-high heat, and add goat meat.
', 'Step 14: Allow to brown on all sides, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Add the warmed spices, peppers and broth, onions, garlic, vinegar, salt, Oregano, and thyme into a blender.
', 'Step 16: Allow to cool slightly before blending to prevent scalding yourself, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Blend until very smooth.
', 'Step 18: Add the blended sauce into the pot, and stir, scraping all the browned bits off the bottom of the pot.
', 'Step 19: Cover and simmer over medium-low heat until the meat is very tender, about 2 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 20: Remove the meat from the sauce and allow to cool enough to shred.
', 'Step 21: Shred the meat with your hands or with 2 forks.
', 'Step 22: Stir in about 1/4 cup of the sauce.
', 'Step 23: Blend the diced tomatoes until very smooth and add to the sauce.
', 'Step 24: Working in batches, dip each tortilla in the pot of sauce and place in a hot pan.
', 'Step 25: Add a bit of the meat mixture and a bit of cheese.
', 'Step 26: Fold in half and brown on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 27: Pour the remaining sauce into 4 small bowls.
', 'Step 28: Serve the tacos and sauce with the reserved diced onion, lime wedges, and cilantro.
', 'Step 29: Pour the remaining sauce into 4 small bowls.
', 'Step 30: Serve the tacos and sauce with the reserved diced onion, lime wedges, and cilantro.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '452.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '42.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '71.3 mg', 'fatContent': '17.2 g', 'fiberContent': '4.3 g', 'proteinContent': '31.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '1438.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.9 g'}

Title: Traditional Chilaquiles
Ingredients: ['8 fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '1 white onion, coarsely chopped', '1 poblano pepper, peeled and seeded', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded', '¾ cup chopped cilantro', '4 cloves garlic', '2 leaves fresh mint', 'salt to taste', '3 cups shredded cooked chicken', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '12 (6 inch) white corn tortillas, cut into 3 strips', '¾ cup shredded pepperjack cheese', '¾ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Blend tomatillos, onion, poblano pepper, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, garlic, mint, and salt in a blender until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Transfer mixture to a saucepan and bring to a gentle boil.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until thickened, stirring often, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add chicken to tomatillo sauce and continue to simmer until chicken is heated through, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Fry tortilla strips in batches until crisp and lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
', 'Step 9: Layer about half the fried tortillas in a 2-quart baking dish; spread half the tomatillo sauce over tortillas.
', 'Step 10: Mix pepperjack cheese and Monterey Jack cheese in a bowl; sprinkle half over tomatillo sauce.
', 'Step 11: Repeat layers.
', 'Step 12: Bake in preheated oven until cheese is golden and bubbly, 30 to 35 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Allow to cool 5 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Poblano Chile Enchiladas a la Gringa
Ingredients: ['2 (8 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '2 tablespoons minced garlic', '1 medium onion, chopped', '3 cups water', '1 tablespoon chicken bouillon granules', '4 fresh poblano chilies', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '10 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the chicken breasts, garlic, onion, water, and chicken bouillon into a saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 40 minutes.
', 'Step 3: When finished, remove the chicken to a plate to cool.
', 'Step 4: Measure out 1 cup of the chicken broth and discard the rest.
', 'Step 5: Roast the poblano chiles over an open flame, or underneath a broiler until the skin has blackened on all sides.
', 'Step 6: Place the chiles into a plastic bag, or a bowl covered with plastic wrap, and allow to steam as they cool, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: When cool, peel the blackened skin off of the pepper, and remove the seeds and membrane.
', 'Step 8: Place the reserved chicken broth into a blender along with the roasted poblanos and sour cream.
', 'Step 9: Puree until smooth and set aside.
', 'Step 10: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Fry the tortillas one at a time until softened and beginning to crisp.
', 'Step 12: Place onto a plate and set aside.
', 'Step 13: Pour the pureed poblano mixture into the skillet and simmer for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: While the sauce is cooking, slice the cooled chicken breasts into 1/4 inch strips.
', 'Step 15: Using tongs, dip a tortilla into the sauce, coating both sides.
', 'Step 16: Place some of the chicken in the center of the tortilla, roll tightly, then place on a serving dish with the seam side down.
', 'Step 17: Repeat with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 18: Spoon any remaining sauce over top of the enchiladas, then sprinkle with the shredded mozzarella cheese.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '442.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '31.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '87.3 mg', 'fatContent': '21.5 g', 'fiberContent': '5 g', 'proteinContent': '32.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '9.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '477.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.7 g'}

Title: Mexican Oxtail Beef Soup
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 pounds beef oxtail, cut into pieces', '1 pound cubed beef stew meat', '1 cube beef bouillon', '1 onion, chopped', '2 stalks celery, chopped', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '¾ teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and pepper to taste', '4 ears corn on the cob, broken in half', '3 carrots, coarsely chopped', '2 russet potatoes, cut into bite-sized pieces', '⅓ cup lentils, picked over and rinsed', '⅓ cup long grain rice', '1 cup frozen mixed vegetables', '1 head cabbage, cored and cut into 8 wedges', '8 corn tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a large soup pot over medium heat, and brown the oxtails and beef stew meat on all sides.
', 'Step 2: Add water to cover the meat, bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, and cook for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Skim off and discard any foam that collects at the top.
', 'Step 4: Drop in the bouillon cube, onion, celery, chili powder, cumin, salt, pepper, and corn ears, stir to combine, and simmer the soup until the meat is very tender, about 2 hours.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the carrots and potatoes, simmer for 30 more minutes, then stir in the lentils, rice, mixed vegetables, and cabbage.
', 'Step 6: Simmer until the rice, lentils, and cabbage are tender, about 30 more minutes.
', 'Step 7: Serve with a half ear of corn in each bowl, with hot steamed tortillas for dipping in the broth.
']

Title: Posole Soup
Ingredients: ['2 pounds pork loin', '2 teaspoons salt', 'water to cover', '4 cups hominy', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '½ cup shredded cabbage for garnish', '1 small head cabbage, shredded', '1 tablespoon onion', '1 lime, cut into wedges']

['Step 1: In a large pot over high heat, combine the pork, salt and water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil and reduce heat to medium low.
', 'Step 3: Allow to simmer for two hours, skimming foam as necessary.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and take the bones out of the stock.
', 'Step 5: Cool and de-fat the stock.
', 'Step 6: Remove pork from bones and return meat to stock.
', 'Step 7: Add the hominy and chili powder and simmer over low heat for 30 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Serve by placing soup in bowls.
', 'Step 9: Each diner then adds their own cabbage, radishes, onion and lime juice to taste.
', 'Step 10: Eat by dipping spoon deep down to bottom of bowl, lifting to bring up the meat, hominy, soup and layered vegetables.
']

Title: Shari's Shredded Chicken Enchiladas

Title: Biscochitos Traditional Cookies

Title: Shrimp Enchiladas Suizas
Ingredients: ['3 fresh jalapeno peppers, stems removed', '1 ½ pounds fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '3 green onions', '1 small onion, quartered', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, stems trimmed', '1 cup heavy cream', '1 cup chicken broth', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 pound frozen fully cooked salad shrimp, thawed', '1 (9 ounce) bag baby spinach leaves', '2 teaspoons vegetable oil, divided', '10 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '8 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '½ cup sour cream', '1 tablespoon green pepper sauce (e.g., Tabasco®)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly oil a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Place jalapeno peppers, tomatillos, green onions, quartered onion, and cilantro in a food processor.
', 'Step 4: Pulse until mixture is coarsely chopped, about 8 pulses.
', 'Step 5: Pour mixture into a saucepan over medium heat and bring to a simmer; cook about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in cream and chicken broth; season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Return to a simmer and cook until slightly thickened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Set aside.
', 'Step 9: Place shrimp and spinach in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 10: Cover tightly and cook until spinach wilts and shrimp are heated through, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 12: Wipe skillet dry and pour in 1 teaspoon of the oil; heat oil over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Place a tortilla in skillet about 10 seconds; turn and heat on second side about 5 seconds to soften for easier handling.
', 'Step 14: Fill tortilla with a tablespoon of the shrimp and spinach mixture and about a tablespoon of shredded cheese.
', 'Step 15: Repeat with each tortilla adding more oil to the skillet as needed.
', 'Step 16: Place filled tortillas snugly in prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 17: Pour sauce over tortillas and sprinkle with remaining grated cheese and any remaining filling.
', 'Step 18: Top with dollops of sour cream and some green pepper sauce, if desired.
', 'Step 19: Bake in preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
']

Title: Beef Enchiladas with Homemade Sauce

', 'Step 4: Stir in chicken stock, tomato paste, oregano, cumin, and salt; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat and simmer enchilada sauce until thickened and smooth, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Coat the inside of a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 8: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 10: Heat olive oil in a separate skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion, green chiles, and green bell pepper until softened, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Mix in ground beef and black beans.
', 'Step 12: Stir in 1/2 of the enchilada sauce; cook and stir 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Spoon beef mixture evenly onto the center of each tortilla and roll tortilla around filling.
', 'Step 14: Place tortillas, seam-side down, in the baking dish.
', 'Step 15: Cover tortillas with remaining enchilada sauce and Mexican cheese blend.
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Crispy Chicken Carnitas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '5 cloves garlic, pressed', '1 yellow onion, quartered', '¼ cup lime juice', '¼ cup chicken broth', '½ bunch cilantro', '1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, or more to taste', '1 orange, zested and juiced', '1 bay leaf', '½ cup mayonnaise', '1 tablespoon milk', '1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, or more to taste', '1 pinch salt', '1 pinch garlic powder']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine cumin, chili powder, oregano, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Sprinkle over chicken breasts on both sides.
', 'Step 3: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 4: Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and sear chicken breasts, 1 to 2 minutes per side, working in batches so chicken sears rather than steams.
', 'Step 5: Transfer chicken to a plate.
', 'Step 6: Add garlic and onion to the hot cooker; cook and stir until browned evenly on all sides, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Return chicken to the pressure cooker along with lime juice, chicken broth, cilantro, chipotle pepper with 1 tablespoon adobo sauce, orange zest and juice, and bay leaf.
', 'Step 8: Close and lock the lid.
', 'Step 9: Set timer for 8 to 10 minutes, depending on size of chicken breasts.
', 'Step 10: Meanwhile, combine mayonnaise, milk, chipotle pepper and 1 tablespoon adobo sauce, salt, and garlic powder to an electric blender.
', 'Step 11: Blend chipotle sauce until smooth.
', "Step 12: Release pressure from the cooker using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes.
", 'Step 13: Unlock and remove the lid.
', "Step 14: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 15: Transfer chicken breasts to a clean surface and reserve cooking liquid.
', 'Step 16: Shred chicken meat using 2 forks.
', 'Step 17: Place in a large bowl and drizzle 1/4 cup cooking liquid over chicken; toss to coat.
', 'Step 18: Drizzle 1 tablespoon oil over the surface of a baking sheet.
', 'Step 19: Add chicken to the sheet and drizzle remaining 1 tablespoon oil on top.
', 'Step 20: Stir to coat evenly.
', 'Step 21: Broil chicken in the preheated oven for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Toss chicken with 1 to 2 tablespoons reserved cooking liquid and rotate the pan for even broiling.
', 'Step 23: Continue broiling until crispy, 5 to 7 minutes more.
', 'Step 24: Serve with chipotle sauce.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '235.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '4.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '56.1 mg', 'fatContent': '15.3 g', 'fiberContent': '0.8 g', 'proteinContent': '19.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '185.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.6 g'}

Title: Red Chicken Tamales (Tamales Rojos de Pollo)
Ingredients: ['corn husks', '1 ¼ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 pinch salt to taste', '⅓ cup ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded', '1 cup mulato chiles, stemmed and seeded', '1 clove garlic', '8 cumin seeds', 'boiling water as needed', '½ pound lard', '1 pound masa harina', '3 cups chicken broth', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 ½ teaspoons salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place corn husks in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and soak for a few hours.
', 'Step 2: Drain, place on a work surface, and cover with a clean, damp towel.
', 'Step 3: Place chicken in a pot, season with salt, and cover with water.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, reduce heat, cover, and simmer until chicken is cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain chicken and shred with 2 forks.
', 'Step 6: Heat a griddle over medium heat and toast ancho and mulato chiles until fragrant, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Place in a bowl and cover with boiling water.
', 'Step 8: Soak until soft, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Combine ancho and mulato chiles, garlic, cumin seeds, and about 1/2 cup of the soaking water in a blender; blend until a thick, smooth, mole-like sauce forms, adding more water if necessary.
', 'Step 10: Heat 1 tablespoon lard in a saucepan over medium heat and add the sauce; cook for 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add shredded chicken and cook until flavors are combined and chicken is heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Place remaining lard in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until creamy.
', 'Step 13: Add masa harina, chicken broth, baking powder, and 1 1/2 teaspoon salt, and beat until all ingredients are well combined.
', "Step 14: Test if the masa is ready by dropping a small ball of masa into a glass of cold water; if it floats, it's ready, if not, keep working the dough a little longer.
", 'Step 15: Select 1 wide corn husk.
', 'Step 16: Spread about 2 tablespoons masa mixture onto the the corn husk, filling it up to 2 inches from the bottom and 1/4 inch from the top.
', 'Step 17: Add 1 tablespoon of the chicken filling in the center of the masa mixture.
', 'Step 18: Fold sides of husk together, one over the other.
', 'Step 19: Fold the bottom of the husk over the seam of the 2 folded sides.
', 'Step 20: Repeat with remaining husks.
', 'Step 21: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 22: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 23: Add tamales with the open side up and cook until filling is heated through and separates from the husk, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 24: Let tamales rest for 15 minutes before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '131 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '11.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '15 mg', 'fatContent': '7.5 g', 'fiberContent': '2.3 g', 'proteinContent': '4.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '228.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.1 g'}

Title: Tacos Gobernador
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons salted butter', '⅓ cup diced onion', '1 serrano pepper, diced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 medium (blank)s Roma tomatoes, diced', '1 pound raw shrimp - peeled, deveined, and cut into small pieces', '1 lime, juiced', '4 teaspoons bacon drippings, divided', '8 (8 inch) corn tortillas', '1 ½ cups shredded Oaxaca cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onions and serrano and cook until onions are soft and translucent, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Add tomatoes to the skillet and cook until they have softened, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add shrimp and lime juice.
', 'Step 7: Cook until shrimp turns pink, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Season with more salt and pepper.
', 'Step 9: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 10: Divide shrimp mixture into 8 equal portions.
', 'Step 11: Set aside.
', 'Step 12: Melt 1/2 teaspoon bacon drippings in a cast iron skillet over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 13: Place 1 tortilla on bacon drippings.
', 'Step 14: Add 1 1/2 tablespoons cheese and 1 portion shrimp mixture to one side of the tortilla.
', 'Step 15: Fold over and cook until tortilla is semi-crisp and cheese has started to melt, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Flip taco onto other side and cook to desired crispiness, 2 to 3 minutes more.
', 'Step 17: Repeat with remaining tortillas.
']

Title: Nopalitos Con Papas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '3 potatoes, peeled and cut into strips', '1 (16 ounce) jar sliced nopalitos, drained and rinsed', '1 onion, diced', '1 small tomato, diced', '1 minced jalapeno pepper', 'salt to taste']

Title: Mexican Egg Rolls
Ingredients: ['1 (14 ounce) package egg roll wrappers', '1 pound lean ground beef', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chilies, drained', '2 cups shredded pepperjack cheese', '4 cups oil for frying, or as needed']

['Step 1: Crumble ground beef into a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook until evenly browned, and drain off grease.
', 'Step 3: Add taco seasoning, and cook according to package directions.
', 'Step 4: Set aside.
', 'Step 5: Heat 1 inch of oil in a large skillet, or preheat a deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Lay out one egg roll wrapper at a time, and place a little more than a tablespoon of the ground beef in the center.
', 'Step 7: Top with a small spoonful of green chilies, and a little bit of shredded cheese.

', 'Step 11: Remove from the oil to drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 12: Serve hot and fresh.
']

Title: Poblano Chile Pepper Soup
Ingredients: ['6 poblano peppers', '2 cups chicken broth', 'salt and pepper to taste', '½ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '2 cups milk', '3 tablespoons margarine', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to broil.
', 'Step 2: Place poblano chile peppers on a cookie sheet and place in oven.
', 'Step 3: Allow skin to blacken and blister, turning the chile peppers until all sides are done.
', 'Step 4: (Note: Do not overcook.
', 'Step 5: ) When they are done, place them in a paper bag and seal.
', 'Step 6: In about 15 to 20 minutes, take them out of the bag and peel the skin off each one under running water.
', 'Step 7: Remove the stems and seeds.
', 'Step 8: In a blender, combine the chile peppers, broth, salt and pepper to taste and nutmeg.
', 'Step 9: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 10: In a small saucepan over medium heat, warm the milk and set aside.
', 'Step 11: In another saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter or margarine, add the flour and stir well.
', 'Step 12: Add the warmed milk and stir until well blended.
', 'Step 13: Add the chile pepper mixture and mix well.
', 'Step 14: Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes.
']

Title: Air Fryer Corn on The Cob
Ingredients: ['¼ cup mayonnaise', '2 teaspoons crumbled cotija cheese', '1 teaspoon lime juice', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '2 ears corn, shucked and halved', '4 sprigs fresh cilantro, or to taste']

Title: Chili Lime Chicken
Ingredients: ['¼ cup ancho chile powder', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 tablespoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon chipotle chile powder', '⅔ cup canola oil, or more as needed', '1 large lime, juiced', '8 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves']

['Step 1: Combine ancho chile powder, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, and chipotle powder in a medium glass or ceramic bowl.
', 'Step 2: Whisk in canola oil and lime juice until well combined; thin with additional canola oil if mixture seems too thick.
', 'Step 3: Arrange chicken in a glass or ceramic baking dish and pour the marinade over the chicken, covering it completely.

', 'Step 7: Arrange the chicken on the baking sheet; do not crowd.
', 'Step 8: Discard any excess marinade.

', 'Step 10: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Remove from the oven and let stand for 5 to 6 minutes.
']

Title: Grilled Mexican Steak
Ingredients: ['½ cup cumin seeds', '5 jalapeno peppers, seeds and ribs removed, chopped', '3 cloves garlic', '1 tablespoon cracked black pepper', '⅓ cup fresh lime juice', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '1 ½ cups olive oil', '2 bunches cilantro (leaves and stems)', '1 (3 pound) skirt or flank steak']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Toast the cumin seeds in a medium saute pan over medium-low heat for 5 minutes, or until fragrant.
', 'Step 2: In a blender, combine the cumin seeds, jalapenos, garlic, pepper, lime juice, and salt.
', 'Step 3: Pulse the blender to finely chop ingredients.
', 'Step 4: Add the oil and cilantro and puree until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Lightly score both sides of the meat with a knife so that the marinade will penetrate.
', 'Step 6: Place the meat in a large plastic bag or bowl, pour in the marinade, and coat well.
', 'Step 7: Marinate in the refrigerator for 24 to 48 hours.
', 'Step 8: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil grate.
', 'Step 9: Remove the meat from the marinade and discard the remaining marinade.
', 'Step 10: Cook on high, 1 to 2 minutes per side, to sear the meat.
', 'Step 11: Turn the heat down to low and cook for an additional 3 to 4 minutes per side, or until the it has reached the desired doneness.
']

Title: Easy 'Charro' Beans

Title: Mexican Hot Carrots
Ingredients: ['6 carrots, peeled and sliced', '1 (16 ounce) jar sliced jalapeno peppers, with liquid', '2 onions, thinly sliced', '1 cup vinegar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the carrots in a saucepan with enough water to cover and cook over medium heat until nearly boiling, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Immediately drain the carrots and set aside to cool.
', 'Step 3: Divide the cooled carrots into two 1-quart glass jars.
', 'Step 4: Alternate layers of onion and jalapeno peppers atop the carrots until the jars are full.
', 'Step 5: Mix the liquid from the jalapeno peppers and the vinegar in a saucepan; bring the mixture to a rolling boil.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat and pour the liquid into the jars until full.
', 'Step 7: Seal the jars with lids.
', 'Step 8: Place the jars in the refrigerator until cold, at least 8 hours.
']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9x13-inch cake pan.

Title: The Original Camarones a la Diabla
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '¾ cup sliced white onion', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '6 dried guajillo chiles - stems removed, seeded, and cut into large pieces', '2 dried ancho chile peppers - stems removed, seeded, and cut into large pieces', '2 large tomatoes, cut into chunks', '1 ½ cups water', '½ cup orange juice', '1 tablespoon chicken bouillon granules', '2 pounds raw shrimp (31-35 count), peeled and deveined', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon olive oil', '1 tablespoon butter', '¾ cup sliced white onion', '2 cloves garlic, minced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a large skillet over low heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onion and garlic; cook until onion is tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add dried chiles; cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add tomatoes; cook until slightly softened, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in water and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat and simmer until peppers are softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Blend chile mixture, orange juice, and bouillon in a blender until smooth.
', 'Step 8: Strain through a sieve set over a bowl; discard solids.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle shrimp with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 10: Rinse and dry the skillet.
', 'Step 11: Heat butter and oil in skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 12: Add onion and garlic; cook, stirring, until tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Add shrimp; cook just until browned on both sides, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Transfer shrimp to a bowl.
', 'Step 15: Add sauce to the skillet; simmer over medium heat until slightly thickened, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Add shrimp; simmer until cooked through, about 5 minutes.
']

Title: Green Chile Chicken Enchilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon oil, or to taste', '½ cup chopped hot green chile peppers', '½ cup chopped white onion', '½ cup chopped bell pepper', '½ cup frozen corn', '½ cup drained canned black beans', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ¼ cups cooked shredded chicken breast', '1 (28 ounce) can Hatch green chile enchilada sauce, divided', 'fresh cracked black pepper to taste', '11 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into quarters, divided', '2 tablespoons sour cream, divided', '⅓ cup New Mexican hot green chile salsa', '1 ½ cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

', 'Step 3: Remove skillet from heat.

', 'Step 8: Stir green chile salsa into the remaining chicken mixture.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle 1/2 cup Mexican cheese blend over chicken mixture layer in the casserole dish; top with 10 tortilla quarters.
', 'Step 10: Pour 1/4 cup enchilada sauce over tortilla layer and cover with chicken-salsa mixture; add 1/2 cup Mexican cheese blend.
', 'Step 11: Lightly coat 14 tortilla quarters with sour cream and arrange, sour cream-side down, over the cheese layer.

Title: Sopapillas

', 'Step 2: Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
', 'Step 3: Using hands, mix in water to make a smooth dough.
', 'Step 4: Knead lightly on a floured surface.
', 'Step 5: Cut dough into 12 pieces, and shape into round balls.
', 'Step 6: Cover, and set aside.

Title: Chicken Enchilada Pasta
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package penne pasta, or to taste', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 onion, diced', '1 red bell pepper, diced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 cooked chicken breasts, shredded, or more to taste', '2 (10 ounce) cans green enchilada sauce', '⅔ cup red enchilada sauce', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 cups shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese', '1 cup sour cream']

', 'Step 3: Heat oil in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat.

Title: Black Bean and Quinoa Enchilada Bake

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Bring water and quinoa to a boil in a saucepan.
