Title: Ground Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['olive oil cooking spray', '1 pound ground chicken', '1 medium onion, minced', '1 (1 ounce) envelope taco seasoning mix', '½ cup water', '1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '⅓ (8 ounce) package cream cheese, cut into chunks', '½ cup sour cream', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 (10 ounce) cans enchilada sauce', '8 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 cup shredded Mexican-blend cheese', '1 bunch green onions, sliced', '1 (4 ounce) can sliced black olives']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir ground chicken and onion in the hot skillet until chicken is no longer pink, crumbly, and onion is soft, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle taco seasoning over top and add 1/2 cup water.
', 'Step 6: Stir and cook until water is evaporated, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add cream of chicken soup, cream cheese chunks, and sour cream.
', 'Step 8: Stir until melted and fully incorporated.
', 'Step 9: Stir in black pepper.
', 'Step 10: Pour one can of enchilada sauce into the prepared baking dish and spread to cover the bottom.
', 'Step 11: Divide chicken mixture between the 8 tortillas and roll up tightly.
', 'Step 12: Place filled tortillas in the prepared baking dish, seam-side down.
', 'Step 13: Five should fit lengthwise and the remaining three should fit widthwise to fill the dish.
', 'Step 14: Pour second can of enchilada sauce on top of rolled tortillas.
', 'Step 15: Cover the dish tightly with foil.
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Remove from oven and remove foil.
', 'Step 18: Sprinkle with both shredded cheeses, then green onions and black olives.
', 'Step 19: Return to the oven and bake, uncovered, until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 20: Remove from the oven and allow to sit, 8 to 10 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Hatch Chile Enchilada Pie
Ingredients: ['6 Hatch chile peppers, sliced in half lengthwise and seeded', '3 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken thighs', '2 ½ cups chicken broth, divided', '1 onion, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '¼ teaspoon dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Arrange Hatch chiles, skin-side up, on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Brush with 1 tablespoon olive oil.
', 'Step 5: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Cool; remove and discard skins.
', 'Step 7: Roughly chop chiles.
', 'Step 8: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 9: Cook chicken thighs until browned, about 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 10: Pour 1 cup chicken broth over thighs and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 11: Cover skillet and reduce heat to medium.
', 'Step 12: Cook the chicken thighs until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 14: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 15: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
', 'Step 16: Cook and stir onion, garlic, oregano, cumin, salt, and pepper in hot oil until onion is soft, about 6 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Stir chopped chiles, tomatoes, and 1 1/2 cups chicken broth into onion mixture.
', 'Step 18: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until chiles and onion are tender, 20 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Mash chile-onion mixture to a sauce consistency.
', 'Step 20: Remove chicken thighs from chicken broth, reserving 1/2 cup broth.
', 'Step 21: Stir thighs into chile sauce; cook until chicken is heated through, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 23: Spread a thin layer of chile chicken sauce on the bottom of an 8-inch pie dish.
', 'Step 24: Arrange a layer of corn tortillas over sauce, spread another layer of chile chicken sauce over the tortillas, and sprinkle Mexican cheese blend over sauce.
', 'Step 25: Repeat layering process until all tortillas, sauce, and cheese are used, ending with a layer of cheese.
', 'Step 26: Pour 1/2 cup reserved chicken broth over the top.
', 'Step 27: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbling, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Mexican Botana Platter

Title: Creamy Beef Enchiladas

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.

', 'Step 4: Stir taco seasoning mix into the beef; transfer to a large bowl, reserving drippings in the skillet.

Title: Great Chicken Taquitos
Ingredients: ['1 cup water', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '3 ½ cups vegetable oil (such as Crisco®), divided', '1 cup finely chopped tomatoes', '½ cup minced green onions', '6 tablespoons chicken broth', '2 teaspoons all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '12 wooden picks', '1 cup shredded lettuce, or to taste', '¼ cup guacamole, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring water to a simmer in a skillet over medium heat; add chicken.
', 'Step 2: Cover skillet and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 3: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Remove chicken from water and cool; shred with a fork.
', 'Step 5: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir chicken, tomatoes, green onions, chicken broth, flour, garlic, cumin, oregano, chili powder, and salt until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Heat remaining vegetable oil in a heavy 10-inch skillet over medium heat; carefully dip tortillas in the hot oil to soften, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 7: Remove tortillas with tongs and drain on paper towels, reserving oil.
', 'Step 8: Heat oil to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Spoon about 2 tablespoons chicken mixture down the center of each tortilla.
', 'Step 10: Tightly roll each tortilla around the filling and secure with a wooden toothpick.
', 'Step 11: Fry rolled-up tortillas, working in batches, in hot oil until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove taquitos with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 13: Serve taquitos on a bed of shredded lettuce with guacamole on the side.
']

Title: Take-Out Fake-Out Pollo Con Crema
Ingredients: ['4 large skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cubed', 'salt and pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided', '1 (8 ounce) package sliced fresh mushrooms', '2 large red bell peppers, cut into chunks', '1 large yellow onion, sliced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '¼ cup butter', '¼ cup all-purpose flour', '1 ½ cups low-sodium chicken broth', '1 ½ cups heavy cream', '¼ cup sour cream', '3 tablespoons ketchup, or to taste', "2 dashes hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®), or to taste", '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground dried Anaheim or California chiles', '12 (6 inch) flour tortillas']

', 'Step 4: Cook and stir the mushrooms, bell peppers, onion, and garlic until the vegetables are beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.

', 'Step 8: Whisk in the broth, bring to a simmer, and whisk until thickened.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to low, and whisk in the cream, sour cream, ketchup, hot sauce, cumin, and ground dried chiles.
', 'Step 10: Cover the skillet, and simmer until thick and the flavors have blended, about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 11: Gently stir in the chicken and vegetables.
', 'Step 12: Serve rolled in flour tortillas.
']

', 'Step 2: In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the beef and onion for 5 to 10 minutes, or until meat is browned and onion is tender; drain fat.
', 'Step 3: Add the celery, chili, tomatoes, taco sauce and corn.
', 'Step 4: Heat thoroughly, reduce heat to low and allow to simmer.

', 'Step 7: Pour the meat mixture over the noodles, stirring well.
', 'Step 8: Top with the cheese.

Title: Pork Chalupas
Ingredients: ['1 (4 pound) pork shoulder roast', '1 pound dried pinto beans', '3 (4 ounce) cans diced green chile peppers', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '2 tablespoons ground cumin', '2 tablespoons salt', '2 tablespoons dried oregano', '2 tablespoons garlic powder', '16 flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the roast inside a slow cooker coated with cooking spray.
', 'Step 2: In a separate bowl, stir together the beans, 2 cans of the chile peppers, chili powder, cumin, salt, oregano, and garlic powder.
', 'Step 3: Pour the whole mixture over the roast, and add enough water so that the roast is mostly covered.
', 'Step 4: Jiggle the roast a little to get some of the liquid underneath.
', 'Step 5: Cover, and cook on Low for 8 to 9 hours.
', 'Step 6: Check after about 5 hours to make sure the beans have not absorbed all of the liquid.
', 'Step 7: Add more water if necessary 1 cup at a time.
', 'Step 8: Use just enough to keep the beans from drying out.
', 'Step 9: When the roast is fork-tender, remove it from the slow cooker, and place on a cutting board.
', 'Step 10: Remove any bone and fat, then shred with forks.
', 'Step 11: Return to the slow cooker, and stir in the remaining can of green chilies.
', 'Step 12: Heat through, and serve with flour tortillas and your favorite toppings.
']

Title: Cilantro Shrimp Tacos
Ingredients: ['2 ½ tablespoons olive oil, divided', '1 clove garlic, finely chopped, or more to taste', '1 (16 ounce) package frozen uncooked small shrimp - thawed, peeled. and deveined', '1 small bunch cilantro, chopped, divided', '¼ teaspoon seasoned salt', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '4 (6 inch) corn tortillas, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add garlic; cook until golden, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add shrimp, about 1/3 of the cilantro, seasoned salt, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 4: Mix well and cook until mixture is heated through and shrimp is opaque, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Heat remaining olive oil in a separate skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Add 1 corn tortilla at a time and cook until warm and slightly crispy, about 90 seconds each.
', 'Step 7: Spoon shrimp mixture onto tortillas and serve with remaining cilantro.
']

Title: Jicama Tortillas
Ingredients: ['1 large jicama']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Wash jicama thoroughly with cool water and remove all dirt using a vegetable brush.
', 'Step 2: Trim both ends of the jicama and peel with a vegetable peeler, removing all skin and tough flesh.
', 'Step 3: Cut jicama first in half crosswise, then cut each half into paper thin slices using a sharp knife or the thinnest blade of a mandoline.
', 'Step 4: Use them immediately as crisp tortillas, or store for up to a week in a resealable plastic bag in the fridge.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken and Rice
Ingredients: ['3 cups chicken broth', '1 ½ cups converted long-grain white rice', '½ large white onion, sliced', '1 (24 ounce) jar salsa', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '1 (1 ounce) packet dry taco seasoning mix, divided', '2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Pour the chicken stock into a slow cooker, and stir in the rice, onion, salsa, green chilies, and half the taco seasoning.
', 'Step 2: Rub the remaining taco seasoning over the chicken breasts, and place into the cooker.
', 'Step 3: Place the lid on the cooker, and set to high setting.
', 'Step 4: Cook until the rice is thickened and most of the liquid has been absorbed, about 3 hours.
', 'Step 5: About 20 minutes before serving time, turn the cooker to warm setting.
', 'Step 6: Remove the chicken breasts, and slice them.
', 'Step 7: Stir the chicken and the black beans into the slow cooker.
', 'Step 8: Return lid to cooker, allow the beans to heat, and serve.
']

Title: Chicken Tinga Tostados
Ingredients: ['6 bone-in chicken breast halves', '7 medium onions, thinly sliced', '1 clove garlic, chopped', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '6 medium tomatoes', '1 (7 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 tablespoon chicken bouillon granules', '16 tostada shells', '1 cup sour cream', 'salt and pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the chicken into a large pot along with 1/4 cup of sliced onion, garlic, and enough water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, and cook until no longer pink, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove chicken, cool, and shred meat.
', 'Step 4: Discard skin and bones.
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Add the remaining onion slices, and fry until transparent.
', 'Step 7: Place tomatoes into a pan of boiling water (you could use the leftover chicken water), and boil until they split open.
', 'Step 8: Place the tomatoes, the whole can of chipotle peppers, chicken bouillon into a blender or large food processor.
', 'Step 9: Process until smooth.
', 'Step 10: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 11: Pour this mixture into a large pan, and add the shredded chicken and cooked onions.
', 'Step 12: Heat through.
', 'Step 13: To serve, each person spreads some sour cream on their tostada shell, and tops with a spoonful of the chicken.
']

Title: Shredded Pork Fajita Tacos
Ingredients: ['¼ cup butter', '1 onion, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '1 (16 ounce) package shredded pork', '¼ cup water', '1 (1 ounce) package fajita seasoning', '6 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 cup shredded lettuce', '1 cup tomatoes, chopped', '1 cup Shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (8 ounce) jar salsa', '1 (8 ounce) carton sour cream']

Title: Vegetarian Burrito Casserole
Ingredients: ['¾ cup white rice', '1 ½ cups water', '1 (12 ounce) package frozen soy burger-style crumbles', '1 (28 ounce) can whole tomatoes, drained, 1/4 cup juice reserved', '2 ½ teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon cumin', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '2 (10 inch) burrito-size flour tortillas', '1 (14.25 ounce) can vegetarian refried beans, divided', '2 fresh jalapeno peppers - seeded, sliced, and divided', '1 ½ cups salsa, divided', '2 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided']

['Step 1: In a saucepan bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Add rice and stir.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Place soy crumbles, tomatoes, reserved tomato juice, chili powder, cumin, and taco seasoning in a medium frying pan over medium high heat.

', 'Step 7: Lay 1 flour tortilla in a lightly greased 8x8 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Layer with one half of the beans, jalapeno slices, rice, salsa, soy mixture, and 1 cup Cheddar cheese.

Title: Achiote Paste

Title: Over the Top Nachos

', 'Step 3: After the meat is thoroughly cooked, drain off the grease.
', 'Step 4: Arrange chips on a microwavable platter.
', 'Step 5: Spread beans over the chips.
', 'Step 6: Layer with 1/2 of the cheese, the ground beef mixture, and remaining cheese.

Title: Hot Baked Taco Dip
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 pound ground beef', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '1 package taco seasoning mix', '1 tomato, chopped', '1 bunch green onions, chopped', '2 tablespoons hot taco sauce, or more to taste', '1 (16 ounce) container sour cream', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded sharp Cheddar cheese', '1 (14.5 ounce) package tortilla chips, or more as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch casserole dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 5: Stir bell pepper and taco seasoning into ground beef.
', 'Step 6: Spread ground beef mixture into prepared casserole dish.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle tomato and green onions over ground beef mixture; top with taco sauce.
', 'Step 8: Spread sour cream over taco sauce layer and top with Cheddar cheese.

', 'Step 10: Serve with tortilla chips.

Title: Mexican Shredded Chuck Roast
Ingredients: ['1 (3 pound) beef chuck roast', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons grapeseed oil', '1 large onion, diced', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (14 ounce) can beef broth, divided', '1 (12 ounce) bottle Mexican guajillo red chile cooking sauce (such as Herdez®)', '3 bay leaves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cut chuck roast into 3-inch cubes, removing excess fat and connective tissue.
', 'Step 3: Season beef with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 4: Heat grapeseed oil in a large Dutch oven over high heat.
', 'Step 5: Sear cubes of beef a few at a time, until well browned on all sides, about 4 minutes per batch.
', 'Step 6: Reserve browned beef in a bowl.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to medium and add onion and garlic.
', 'Step 8: Cook until soft and just beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add 1 cup beef broth to onion mixture and stir well; simmer for 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add beef and pour in guajillo sauce.
', 'Step 11: Add a little beef broth to the empty jar, seal, and shake to release remaining sauce; pour over the beef.
', 'Step 12: Pour in enough of the remaining broth to just cover the beef.
', 'Step 13: Add bay leaves and bring to a gentle simmer.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven, covered, until beef is fork-tender, about 2 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 15: Remove beef from sauce and set aside; discard bay leaves.
', 'Step 16: Skim off excess fat from the top of the cooking liquid and bring to a boil to reduce slightly.
', 'Step 17: Shred beef with two forks and return to cooking sauce.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '207.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '51.7 mg', 'fatContent': '14.3 g', 'fiberContent': '0.2 g', 'proteinContent': '14.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5 g', 'sodiumContent': '153.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.5 g'}

Title: Poblano and Cheese Tamales (Tamales de Rajas con Queso)
Ingredients: ['corn husks', '10 ounces poblano peppers', '1 ¼ pounds fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '11 ounces lard, divided', '1 onion, chopped', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '4 ½ cups masa harina', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 ¾ cups chicken broth, or as needed', '2 ½ cups sliced Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place corn husks in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and soak for 30 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain, place on a work surface, and cover with a clean, damp towel.
', 'Step 3: Line a heavy cast iron grill pan or griddle with aluminum foil and place over high heat.
', 'Step 4: Arrange poblano peppers in a single layer on top.
', 'Step 5: Grill until chiles are blackened, turning as necessary, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Transfer into a resealable plastic bag and let them steam, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Peel off skin, seed, and cut them into strips.
', 'Step 8: Place tomatillos in a pot and cover them with water.
', 'Step 9: Bring to a boil and cook until they change color, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Drain and place in a blender.
', 'Step 11: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 12: Heat 1 tablespoon lard in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Add onion and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Add blended tomatillos and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 15: Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until flavors are well combined, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Add poblano peppers and cilantro and boil for an additional 5 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Remove from heat and allow to cool, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Beat remaining lard in a large bowl with an electric mixer until creamy.
', 'Step 19: Add salt and continue beating for a few minutes.
', 'Step 20: Add masa harina and baking powder and beat well until combined.
', 'Step 21: Add chicken broth, 1/4 cup at a time, until the dough has a smooth and workable consistency that is not too wet, similar to cookie dough.
', "Step 22: Test if the masa is ready by dropping a small ball of masa into a glass of cold water; if it floats, it's ready, if not, keep working the dough a little longer.
", 'Step 23: Select 1 wide corn husk or 2 small ones.
', 'Step 24: Spread about 2 tablespoons masa mixture onto the corn husk, filling it up to 2 inches from the bottom and 1/4 inch from the top.
', 'Step 25: Add 1 tablespoon of the tomatillo sauce and a piece of Monterey Jack cheese in the center of the masa mixture.
', 'Step 26: Fold sides of husk together, one over the other.
', 'Step 27: Fold the bottom of the husk over the seam of the 2 folded sides.
', 'Step 28: Repeat with remaining husks.
', 'Step 29: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 30: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 31: Add tamales with the open side up and cook until filling is heated through and separates from the husk, about 1 hour 15 minutes.
', 'Step 32: Let tamales rest for 15 minutes before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '251.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '19 g', 'cholesterolContent': '23.1 mg', 'fatContent': '17.5 g', 'fiberContent': '3.8 g', 'proteinContent': '5.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '198.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.5 g'}

Title: Rush Hour Refried Beans
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons bacon grease', '2 tablespoons chopped onion', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, undrained', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin']

', 'Step 2: Cook and stir onion and garlic in the hot bacon grease until onions are softened, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Mash pinto beans and cumin into onion mixture using a potato masher until reaching your desired consistency.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir bean mixture until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.
']

Title: Absolutely the Best Nacho Dip Ever
Ingredients: ['1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '½ cup sour cream', '½ cup mayonnaise', '¼ cup cocktail sauce', '1 cup mild salsa', '¾ cup diced green onion', '¾ cup diced red bell pepper', '¾ cup diced green bell pepper', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '2 cups shredded lettuce', '1 cucumber, thinly sliced']

']

Title: Simple Carnitas
Ingredients: ['1 (3 1/2) pound boneless pork shoulder, trimmed and cut into 2 inch chunks', '2 oranges, quartered', '1 large white onion, quartered', '6 cloves garlic, peeled and crushed', '¼ cup kosher salt', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon whole black peppercorns', '2 bay leaves']

', 'Step 5: Cover loosely, and simmer until the meat is tender, about 1 1/2 hours.

', 'Step 7: Shred the meat with two forks.
']

Title: Sheet Pan Beef Fajitas
Ingredients: ['2 medium bell peppers, sliced', '1 medium onion, sliced', '1 tablespoon olive oil, divided', '1 ½ teaspoons salt, divided', '1 teaspoon chili powder, divided', '¾ teaspoon garlic powder', '¾ teaspoon ground black pepper, divided', '½ teaspoon ground cumin, divided', '1 (1 1/2-pound) flank steak', '2 medium limes, quartered', '6 (6 inch) flour tortillas, warmed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a sheet pan with foil.
', 'Step 3: Combine bell peppers, onion, 2 teaspoons oil, 3/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder, garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon cumin on the prepared pan; toss to coat.
', 'Step 4: Spread veggie mixture around the sides of the pan creating a space in the center.
', 'Step 5: Place flank steak in center of pan and brush with remaining 1 teaspoon oil.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle steak with remaining salt, chili powder, pepper, and cumin and rub to evenly coat.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until veggies are tender and browned around the edges and steak is beginning to firm and is hot and slightly pink in the center, 12 to 14 minutes, or to desired degree of doneness.
', 'Step 8: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the steak should read 140 degrees F (60 degrees C) for medium.
', 'Step 9: Transfer steak to a cutting board and rest, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Thinly slice steak and return to the sheet pan.
', 'Step 11: Add lime wedges and serve with tortillas.
']

Title: Mexican-Style Chicken Taco Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', 'nonstick cooking spray', '½ cup water', '1 cube chicken bouillon', '1 cup milk', '1 ½ tablespoons unsalted butter', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '2 cups chopped cooked chicken', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®), drained', '1 ½ cups coarsely crumbled tortilla chips', '1 cup finely chopped tomatoes, drained', '3 tablespoons sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chili powder, ground cumin, onion powder, paprika, pepper, and garlic in a small bowl and set aside.
', 'Step 2: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and spray an 11x7-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Place water and bouillon cube in a microwave-safe container and microwave on high for 2 minutes; stir until bouillon cube is dissolved.
', 'Step 4: Cool slightly, add milk, and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat until bubbly, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in flour and cook, stirring constantly, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 7: When flour and butter are bubbly and thickened, gradually stir in milk-bouillon mixture.
', 'Step 8: Cook, stirring, until the mixture boils and thickens, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from heat and stir in 1 1/2 cups Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 10: Combine chicken, black beans, corn, tomatoes, and spice mixture in a bowl; mix well.
', 'Step 11: Pour in cheese sauce and stir again.
', 'Step 12: Pour casserole ingredients into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle crumbled tortilla chips over the casserole, return to the oven, and bake until casserole is bubbly and set, about 10 more minutes.
', 'Step 15: Remove from the oven and allow to cool, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle reserved Cheddar cheese and chopped tomatoes evenly on top of the casserole, then add dollops of sour cream.
']

Title: Texas Coleslaw

Title: Spinach Whole Wheat Quesadillas

Title: Mexican Fiesta Pasta Salad
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package dried rotini pasta', '1 ½ cups medium chunky salsa', '1 cup mayonnaise', '½ cup sour cream', '1 (16 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (11 ounce) can Mexican-style corn with red and green peppers, drained', '½ cup chopped red bell pepper', '2 green onions, sliced thin', '1 (4.25 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin, or to taste', '½ teaspoon dried cilantro, or to taste', '1 teaspoon salt', 'ground black pepper to taste']

', 'Step 5: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate 2 hours to overnight before serving.

Title: Instant Pot® Yardbird Chili with White Beans
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 ½ chicken breasts, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '1 medium onion, diced', '4 cloves garlic, crushed', '1 (28 ounce) can green enchilada sauce', '2 cups dry great northern beans, sorted and rinsed', '2 cups chicken broth', '2 (4 ounce) cans chopped green chiles (such as Hatch®), undrained', '1 tablespoon oregano', '1 teaspoon cumin', '1 cup shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend, or to taste', '½ cup chopped cilantro, or to taste']

['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 2: Pour in oil.
', 'Step 3: Add chicken pieces to the hot oil and saute until lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add onion and garlic and saute until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 5: Add enchilada sauce, dry beans, broth, green chiles, oregano, and cumin to the pot.
', 'Step 6: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 7: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 45 minutes.
", 'Step 8: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 9: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, at least 25 minutes to allow beans to fully cook.
", 'Step 10: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 11: Garnish chili with shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend and cilantro.
']

Title: Vegan Tofu Tacos

Title: Authentic Mexican Hot Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 dried guajillo chile', '1 dried chile negro (pasilla) pepper', '2 dried New Mexico chile pods', '1 ½ cups warm water', '2 cloves garlic, pressed', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon packed brown sugar', '1 teaspoon white vinegar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Remove stems and seeds from the guajillo chile, pasilla chile, and the New Mexico chile pods.
', 'Step 2: n Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Toast the chile pods in the skillet until lightly brown, about 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Transfer the chile pods to a small bowl and pour the warm water over them.
', 'Step 5: Allow chiles to soak about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 6: n Remove the guajillo and New Mexico chiles from the water.
', 'Step 7: Use a spoon to scrape the pulp from the skin.
', 'Step 8: Discard the skin.
', 'Step 9: Place the pulp of the guajillo chile and the New Mexico chiles in a food processor with the pasilla chile and the water in which the peppers soaked.
', 'Step 10: Puree in the food processor until all ingredients are combined.
', 'Step 11: Add the garlic, cumin, salt, brown sugar, salt, and vinegar.
', 'Step 12: Puree the mixture until smooth.
']

Title: Smothered Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '½ cup chopped onion', '2 tablespoons chopped green chiles', '½ cup water', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '1 (10.75 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup', '½ pint sour cream', '4 large flour tortillas, or more as needed', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend']

', 'Step 2: Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.

', 'Step 5: Add water, chili powder, salt, red pepper flakes, cumin, and garlic powder; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer.
', 'Step 7: Stir refried beans into beef mixture and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Mix cream of mushroom soup and sour cream together in a bowl.
', 'Step 9: Fill each tortilla with beef mixture and roll tortilla around filling.
', 'Step 10: Arrange burritos in the prepared baking dish; top with sour cream mixture.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Cover burritos with Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend.
', 'Step 13: Bake until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes more.
']

Title: Easy Flank Steak Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 pound beef flank steak, trimmed of fat', '¼ cup lime juice', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', 'Reynolds Wrap® Heavy Duty Aluminum Foil', '2 red, yellow or green sweet peppers (or combination), thinly sliced', '1 medium onion, thinly sliced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '8 (6- to 7-inch) flour tortillas', '⅓ tablespoon Guacamole, salsa, and/or sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place steak in a large resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 2: Add lime juice, vegetable oil, chili powder, salt, and cayenne pepper to the steak in bag.
', 'Step 3: Seal bag; turn to coat steak.
', 'Step 4: Marinate in the refrigerator 30 minutes to 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Drain meat; discard marinade.
', 'Step 6: Center meat on a sheet (12x18 inches) of Reynolds Wrap® Heavy Duty Aluminum Foil.
', 'Step 7: Bring up foil sides.
', 'Step 8: Double fold top and ends to seal packet, leaving room for heat circulation inside.
', 'Step 9: Center sweet peppers, onion, and garlic on another sheet (12x18 inches) of heavy duty aluminum foil.
', 'Step 10: Repeat steps above to make another foil packet.
', 'Step 11: Wrap tortillas tightly in heavy duty aluminum foil.
', 'Step 12: Bake meat and vegetable foil packets 30 to 35 minutes or until meat is desired doneness (145 degrees F for medium rare) and vegetables are tender, adding tortillas to the oven for the last 10 minutes of baking or until heated through.
', 'Step 13: Open packets carefully by cutting along top fold with a sharp knife, allowing steam to escape; then open top of foil packet.
', 'Step 14: Thinly slice the meat.
', 'Step 15: Fill warm tortillas with meat and pepper mixture to serve.
', 'Step 16: If desired, top with guacamole, salsa, and/or sour cream.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '403.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '42 g', 'cholesterolContent': '35.6 mg', 'fatContent': '17.2 g', 'fiberContent': '4.5 g', 'proteinContent': '20 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '756.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.2 g'}

Title: Carne Asada Tacos or Al Pastor Tacos
Ingredients: ['½ onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic', '2 teaspoons chopped fresh parsley', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon anise seed', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon dried sage', '¼ teaspoon ground thyme', '2 bay leaves', '5 whole cloves', '½ cup soy sauce', '1 cup cider vinegar', '1 orange, juiced', '1 lime, juiced', '2 pounds flank steak', '1 onion, chopped', '2 tomatoes, chopped', '¼ (7 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, or to taste', '3 cloves garlic', '1 tablespoon water, or as needed', '24 (5 inch) corn tortillas', '½ onion, chopped', '½ bunch cilantro, chopped', '1 bunch radishes, halved']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place 1/2 chopped onion, 2 cloves garlic, parsley, oregano, paprika, anise seed, black pepper, cumin, sage, thyme, bay leaves, cloves, soy sauce, vinegar, orange juice, and lime juice in a blender; pulse until a very well-blended paste is achieved, scraping down sides as needed, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Spread paste on both sides of the flank steak.
', 'Step 3: Wrap steak in plastic and refrigerate at least 6 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 4: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 5: Remove excess marinade from flank steak.
', 'Step 6: Grill steak until it begins to firm and is hot and slightly pink in the center, about 8 minutes per side.
', 'Step 7: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 140 degrees F (60 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Chop steak into small pieces and transfer to a platter; cover and keep warm until ready to serve.
', 'Step 9: Place 1 chopped onion, tomatoes, chipotle peppers, and 3 cloves garlic in a blend; pulse until desired consistency.
', 'Step 10: Add water if the salsa becomes too thick.
', 'Step 11: Transfer salsa to a bowl.
', 'Step 12: Heat tortillas in a microwave safe plate until warm, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 13: Serve beef over stacks of two corn tortillas with salsa and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 chopped onion, radishes, and cilantro.
']

Title: Birria
Ingredients: ['2 dried California chile peppers, stemmed and seeded', '2 dried pasilla chiles, stemmed and seeded', '2 dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded', '2 dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded', '2 New Mexico dried red chile pods, stemmed and seeded', 'water to cover', '6 cloves garlic', '1 slice onion, or to taste', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '2 ½ onions, chopped', '3 ½ pounds boneless beef chuck roast, cut into chunks', '6 bay leaves', 'salt to taste']

', 'Step 12: Add beef back in and season with salt.

Title: Andy's Spicy Green Chile Pork
Ingredients: ['1 white onion, chopped', 'salt and pepper to taste', '2 ½ pounds pork shoulder roast', '1 (16 ounce) jar green salsa (such as Frontera®)', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 serrano chile peppers, or to taste']

', 'Step 9: Discard the onions, peppers, and cilantro if desired.

Title: Tamales Oaxaqueños (Oaxacan-Style Tamales)
Ingredients: ['11 ounces lard, divided', 'salt to taste', '9 cups masa harina', '1 cup warm chicken broth, divided', '3 fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '1 ancho chile pepper - stems, seeds, and veins removed', '1 mulato chile pepper - stems, seeds, and veins removed', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, or to taste', '1 pinch crushed dried oregano', '1 pound shredded cooked chicken', '36 banana leaves, softened']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Beat 9 ounces lard in a large bowl with an electric mixer until creamy.
', 'Step 2: Add salt and continue beating for a few minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add masa harina and beat well until combined.
', 'Step 4: Add chicken broth, 1/4 cup at a time, beating until masa has a smooth and workable consistency similar to cookie dough, about 3/4 cup total.
', "Step 5: Test if the masa is ready by dropping a small ball of masa into a glass of cold water; if it floats, it's ready, if not, beat the dough a little longer.
", 'Step 6: Combine tomatillos, ancho chile pepper, mulato chile pepper, garlic, salt, pepper, and oregano in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Heat remaining 2 ounces lard in a skillet and cook tomatillo sauce until lightly thickened, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add shredded chicken and a little of the remaining chicken broth.
', 'Step 9: Cook over low heat until chicken filling has thickened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Spread 2 to 3 tablespoons masa mixture onto 1 banana leaf, filling it up to 2 inches from the bottom and 1/4 inch from the top.
', 'Step 11: Add 1 tablespoon of the chicken filling in the center of the masa mixture.
', 'Step 12: Fold sides of banana leaf together, one over the other.
', 'Step 13: Fold the bottom of the banana leaf over the seam of the 2 folded sides and tie together with kitchen string.
', 'Step 14: Repeat with remaining banana leaves.
', 'Step 15: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 16: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 17: Add tamales with the open side up and cook until filling is heated through and separates from the leaf, 1 hour 30 minutes to 2 hours.
', 'Step 18: Let tamales rest for 15 minutes before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '209.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '21.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '18.1 mg', 'fatContent': '11.2 g', 'fiberContent': '3.9 g', 'proteinContent': '5.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '46.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.1 g'}

Title: Baked Beef Chiles Rellenos Casserole
Ingredients: ['6 large poblano peppers, halved and seeded', '1 ½ pounds ground beef, or to taste', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground paprika', '¼ teaspoon ground dried chipotle pepper', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 large onion, chopped', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', 'cooking spray', '3 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Place poblano peppers with cut sides down onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Cook under the preheated broiler until poblano pepper skins have blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Place blackened peppers into a bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 6: Allow peppers to steam as they cool, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 8: Add beef, chili powder, garlic, cumin, oregano, cayenne pepper, paprika, chipotle pepper, salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir until beef is no longer pink, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add onion; cook until slightly softened, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add tomatoes with green chiles; cook until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 12: Let beef mixture cool.
', 'Step 13: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 14: Spray a casserole dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 15: Run water over the poblano peppers to remove skins and discard them.
', 'Step 16: Drain peppers on paper towels.
', 'Step 17: Place a layer of peppers on the bottom of the prepared dish; place 1/3 of the beef mixture on top.
', 'Step 18: Cover with 1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend.
', 'Step 19: Repeat layers twice more in the same order.
', 'Step 20: Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven until golden brown on top, about 35 minutes.
']

Title: Grilled Spicy Shrimp Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups lime juice', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon mayonnaise', '3 pounds uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', '½ cup enchilada sauce', '½ (4 ounce) jar diced jalapeno peppers', '5 teaspoons honey', '3 teaspoons lime juice', 'salt to taste', '½ head red cabbage, shredded, or more to taste', '2 bunches scallions, chopped', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '3 tablespoons white vinegar', '1 small bunch cilantro, chopped', '20 (8 inch) corn tortillas']

['Step 1: Mix lime juice, olive oil, chili powder, and mayonnaise together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add shrimp and marinade for at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 3: Mix enchilada sauce, jalapenos, honey, lime juice, and salt together in a separate bowl for the sauce.

', 'Step 5: Heat tortillas in a frying pan over medium-high heat, about 30 seconds per side.
', 'Step 6: Keep warm.
', 'Step 7: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 8: Remove shrimp from marinade.
', 'Step 9: Grill until opaque, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add shrimp to each tortilla; top with the sauce and slaw.
']

Title: Amazing Mexican Quinoa Salad

', 'Step 3: Cover bowl with a lid and refrigerate until flavors blend, at least 2 hours.
', 'Step 4: Stir again before serving.
']

Title: Salsa De Tomatillo

', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil.

', 'Step 5: Blend to desired consistency.
']

Title: Cheesy Mexi-Rice Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 quart water', '2 cups uncooked long-grain white rice', '2 tablespoons chicken broth', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '1 small yellow onion, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can cream-style corn', '1 (11 ounce) can Mexican-style corn, drained', '1 (11 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, with liquid', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers, drained', '1 (8 ounce) package Mexican-style processed cheese food, cubed', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon black pepper', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '¾ cup shredded reduced-fat Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 3 1/2 quart casserole dish.
', 'Step 3: In a saucepan, bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 4: Stir in rice, reduce heat, and cover.
', 'Step 5: Simmer for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: In a wok or large skillet, heat the broth and saute the garlic, bell pepper and onion until tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in cooked rice, cream-style corn, Mexican-style corn, whole kernel corn, diced tomatoes with chiles, green chiles, Mexican-style processed cheese, salt, pepper and chili powder.
', 'Step 8: Spoon into prepared casserole dish.
', 'Step 9: Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until bubbly.
', 'Step 10: Top with shredded Cheddar, cover and bake 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 11: Remove from oven, uncover and let stand 10 minutes.
']

Title: How to Make Dulce de Leche
Ingredients: ['1 small finishing nail', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '3 cups water, or more as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Wash the nail and pound it into the top of can of sweetened condensed milk to make 2 small holes on opposite sides of the top.
', 'Step 2: Remove nail.
', 'Step 3: n Place the can of condensed milk into a small saucepan and pour in water to reach high up the side of the can.
', 'Step 4: Bring water to a boil; reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 5: Simmer milk in the can for 3 to 4 hours.
', 'Step 6: Milk will slowly turn light to medium brown and become thicker as it cooks.
', 'Step 7: Add more water as it boils down.
', 'Step 8: n Remove lid from can and pour dulce de leche into a bowl.
', 'Step 9: Whisk to break up any lumps and mix thicker caramel from the bottom into the rest of the syrup.
']

Title: Salsa Chicken Meatloaf
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ cups herb-seasoned croutons', '1 (12 ounce) jar salsa', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '1 cup finely chopped onion', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pound ground chicken', '½ pound ground pork', '1 egg', '1 ½ tablespoons taco seasoning mix', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 cup shredded pepperjack cheese', '¼ cup cilantro, minced', '2 tablespoons barbecue sauce', '2 tablespoons brown sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 5x9-inch loaf pan.
', 'Step 3: Mix the croutons with salsa in a large bowl, and set aside to soften, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, and cook the jalapeno pepper, onion, and garlic until the onion is translucent, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Mix the ground chicken, ground pork, egg, taco seasoning, Worcestershire sauce, pepperjack cheese, and cilantro into the crouton mixture, and mash any unbroken croutons.
', 'Step 6: Mix in the cooked onion mixture.
', 'Step 7: Transfer the meatloaf into the prepared loaf pan.
', 'Step 8: Mix the barbecue sauce and brown sugar together in a bowl, stirring until the sugar has dissolved, and brush the barbecue sauce mixture over the loaf.
', 'Step 9: Fold a 12-inch long piece of aluminum foil into a tent, and place the foil tent over the loaf.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until the juices run clear and the loaf is no longer pink in the center, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 11: Remove foil tent for last 10 minutes of baking.
', 'Step 12: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the loaf should read at least 160 degrees F (72 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Remove from oven, cover the loaf with foil, and let stand for 15 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Pastel de Elote (Mexican Corn Cake)
Ingredients: ['8 ears sweet white corn, husked', '1 ¾ cups softened butter, plus more for baking dish', '5 eggs', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '½ cup milk', '2 cups all-purpose flour, plus additional for dusting', '1 tablespoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease and flour a 9-inch cake pan.
', 'Step 3: Chill in freezer.
', 'Step 4: Cut kernels from ears of corn with a sharp knife.
', 'Step 5: Beat butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy.
', 'Step 6: Combine eggs, condensed milk, whole milk, and corn kernels in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Transfer egg mixture to a bowl with butter and mix well.
', 'Step 8: Sift flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt into a large bowl.
', 'Step 9: Add egg mixture and mix well to combine.
', 'Step 10: Remove cake pan from freezer.
', 'Step 11: Grease and flour again.
', 'Step 12: Pour batter into prepared pan.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until cake is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Cool in the pan for 15 minutes, then remove from tin and cool on a wire rack.
']

Title: Sopapilla Cupcakes
Ingredients: ['1 (16.5 ounce) package white cake mix', '1 cup water', '3 large egg whites', '¼ cup oil', '2 tablespoons ground cinnamon, divided', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ teaspoon lemon extract', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '½ cup butter, room temperature', "3 cups confectioners' sugar, or more as needed", '3 tablespoons honey', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '2 tablespoons milk, or as needed', '1 tablespoon honey, for drizzling']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line 18 muffin cups with paper liners.
', 'Step 3: Mix cake mix, water, egg whites, oil, 1 tablespoon cinnamon, vanilla extract, and lemon extract together in the bowl of a stand mixer; mix on low for 30 seconds.
', 'Step 4: Increase speed to medium and mix batter for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Fill muffin cups 2/3-full with batter.
', 'Step 6: Combine white sugar and 1 tablespoon cinnamon together in a small bowl; sprinkle over batter.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in a cupcake comes out clean, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Cool cupcakes to room temperature.
', 'Step 9: Beat butter in a bowl using an electric mixer until creamy and fluffy, 1 to 2 minutes.
', "Step 10: Add confectioners' sugar, 3 tablespoons honey, and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon; beat until just combined.
", 'Step 11: Mix milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, into creamed butter mixture until desired consistency of frosting is reached.
', 'Step 12: Spoon frosting into a piping bag or a plastic bag with a snipped corner; pipe onto each cupcake.
', 'Step 13: Drizzle honey over each frosted cupcake.
']

', 'Step 4: Pour the cooked vegetables into a blender, and blend until smooth.
']

Title: Mexican Chicken Tortilla Lasagna
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 small onion, diced', '1 pound ground chicken', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chiles (such as RO*TEL®), halfway drained', '½ (1.25 ounce) package reduced-sodium taco seasoning mix', '1 (10 ounce) can mild enchilada sauce, divided', '5 ounces crumbled queso fresco, divided', '¼ cup Mexican crema', '1 tablespoon Mexican crema', '1 egg', '6 each corn tortillas', '3 ounces grated Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Add onion; cook and stir until fragrant, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add ground chicken, stirring and breaking into crumbles until browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour diced tomatoes with chiles and their liquid into the skillet and add taco seasoning.
', 'Step 6: Stir to incorporate.
', 'Step 7: Combine 8 ounces enchilada sauce, 4 ounces queso fresco, Mexican crema, and egg in a bowl.
', 'Step 8: Pour remaining enchilada sauce into the bottom of an 8x6-inch glass casserole dish.
', 'Step 9: Trim tortillas to have a straight edge if desired.
', 'Step 10: Lay two tortillas in the enchilada sauce in the dish.
', 'Step 11: Place some chicken mixture on top and ladle some enchilada sauce mixture over.
', 'Step 12: Repeat layers.
', 'Step 13: Top with remaining queso fresco and Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 14: Bake, covered, in the preheated oven for 35 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Uncover and bake for 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 16: Let rest for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Baked Puffy Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['¼ cup sour cream', '¼ cup mayonnaise', '¼ teaspoon ground chipotle pepper', '1 pinch salt', '1 dash hot sauce, or to taste', '1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, or to taste', '¾ pound rockfish', '2 teaspoons olive oil', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '⅛ teaspoon cumin', '⅛ teaspoon ground chipotle pepper', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '2 cups very thinly sliced green cabbage', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '2 teaspoons fresh lime juice', '1 pinch dried Mexican oregano', '4 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '2 teaspoons olive oil, divided', '2 tablespoons thinly sliced radishes', '1 tablespoon thinly sliced jalapeno pepper', '2 tablespoons torn cilantro leaves', '1 medium lime, cut into wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk sour cream, mayonnaise, chipotle powder, salt, hot sauce, and lime juice for sauce in a bowl until smooth.
', 'Step 2: Taste and adjust as needed.
', 'Step 3: Refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 4: Cut fish into eight 1 ½-inch pieces.
', 'Step 5: Transfer fish to a bowl; add olive oil, salt, cumin, chipotle pepper, and chili powder.
', 'Step 6: Toss with tongs, thoroughly but gently, until coated.
', 'Step 7: Let fish marinate in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 10: Toss cabbage, salt, lime juice, and dried oregano together in a bowl with your hands until coated.
', 'Step 11: Place 2 tortillas on the prepared baking sheet and coat lightly on both sides with some olive oil.
', 'Step 12: Place 3 ounces of sliced fish on each tortilla, on only one side so that you can fold the tacos after baking.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the center of the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork and tortillas are browned and puffy, 7 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Fold tacos in the center of each tortilla to crease.
', 'Step 15: Top with cabbage, followed by jalapenos, radishes, and sauce.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle with cilantro and serve with lime wedges to squeeze over.
', 'Step 17: Repeat for remaining 2 tacos.
']

Title: Mexican Tres Leches Cake (Pastel de 3 Leches)
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '6 eggs, separated', '½ cup white sugar, divided', '1 cup self-rising flour', '1 lime, zested', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '1 teaspoon amaretto liqueur', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '1 (4 ounce) container sliced peaches, drained', '1 teaspoon grated lime zest']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Butter and flour a 9-inch springform pan.
', 'Step 3: Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until foamy.
', 'Step 4: Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form.
', 'Step 5: Clean beaters.
', 'Step 6: Beat egg yolks in a separate bowl until creamy.
', 'Step 7: Add remaining 1/4 cup sugar and continue beating until pale yellow.
', 'Step 8: Fold egg yolks into egg white mixture using a spatula.
', 'Step 9: Sift in flour and carefully fold into the batter; mix in zest of 1 lime.
', 'Step 10: Pour batter into the prepared springform pan.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until edges pull away from the sides of the pan, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Turn off oven but keep cake in the closed oven for an additional 20 minutes.
', "Step 13: Prepare the '3 milks' while cake is resting in the oven.
", 'Step 14: Combine condensed milk, evaporated milk, 1 cup heavy cream, and amaretto liqueur in a blender; blend until well combined.
', 'Step 15: Remove the cake from the springform pan and and place on a serving plate.
', 'Step 16: Pierce the cake several times across the top with a fork.
', "Step 17: Pour the '3 milks' mixture over the cake.
", 'Step 18: Refrigerate cake until cool and milk mixture has soaked in, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 19: Beat 1 cup heavy cream in a chilled glass or metal bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form.
', 'Step 20: Garnish the top of the cake with whipped cream, peach slices, and 1 teaspoon lime zest.
']

Title: Mexican Lasagna - No Lasagna Noodles!
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds ground beef', '¼ cup water', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '12 (8 inch) flour tortillas, or more if needed', '1 (14 ounce) can refried beans', '3 cups shredded Colby-Jack cheese', '1 (8 ounce) jar taco sauce', '1 cup shredded Colby-Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9x13-inch casserole dish.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and stir in ground beef.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir until beef is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain and discard any excess grease.
', 'Step 6: Add water and taco seasoning; cook and stir until mixture has thickened, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Arrange 3 tortillas in the bottom of the casserole dish; spread about half the can of refried beans and half the ground beef atop the tortilla layer.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle 1 cup Colby-Jack cheese over ground beef layer.
', 'Step 9: Arrange 3 more tortillas over the cheese.
', 'Step 10: Spread in the remaining 1/2 can refried beans and half the jar of taco sauce; sprinkle with 1 cup Colby-Jack cheese.
', 'Step 11: Arrange 3 more tortillas and top with remaining ground beef and 1 cup Colby-Jack cheese.
', 'Step 12: Top with last 3 tortillas and remaining 1/2 jar taco sauce.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until top tortilla layer begins to brown, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle 1 cup Colby-Jack cheese over lasagna.
', "Step 15: Turn on oven's broiler.
", 'Step 16: Place lasagna under the broiler until Colby-Jack cheese is melted and bubbling, 3 to 5 minutes.
']

Title: Weeknight Mexican Chicken Lasagna

', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray.

', 'Step 6: Top beans with corn kernels, 1 cup of salsa, and 1 cup of Mexican cheese.
', 'Step 7: Add a layer of corn tortillas.
', 'Step 8: Cover tortilla layer with remaining refried beans, chicken, 1 cup of salsa, and 1 cup of Mexican cheese.

Title: Cheese and Beef Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['¾ pound lean ground sirloin or turkey', '1 ½ cups diced red or green bell pepper', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning', '8 (7 inch) flour or corn tortillas', '2 cups SARGENTO® Fine Cut OR Traditional Cut Shredded 4 Cheese Mexican', '1 ½ cups salsa or picante sauce', '1 cup shredded lettuce', '1 cup chopped tomato', '½ cup light sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat large skillet over medium-high heat; add meat and bell pepper.
', 'Step 2: Cook 5 minutes, stirring until meat crumbles and is no longer pink; drain.
', 'Step 3: Add taco seasoning mix and 1/2 cup water.
', 'Step 4: Simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes or until sauce thickens, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 5: Spoon 1/3 cup meat mixture down center of each tortilla; sprinkle with 2 tablespoons cheese.
', 'Step 6: Roll up; place seam-side down in greased 13x9-inch baking pan.
', 'Step 7: Spoon salsa over enchiladas.
', 'Step 8: Cover with foil; bake in preheated 375 degrees F oven 18 minutes or until heated through.
', 'Step 9: Uncover; sprinkle with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 10: Bake 2 minutes more or until cheese is melted.
', 'Step 11: Serve with lettuce, tomato, if desired, sour cream.
']

Title: Easy Mexican Chicken Spaghetti
Ingredients: ['1 pound spaghetti', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 small yellow onion, diced', '3 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite-size pieces, or more to taste', '1 (10.75 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '½ cup shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese']

['Step 1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Heat olive oil in an oven-proof skillet over medium heat; cook and stir garlic until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 6: Add onion; cook and stir until onion begins to soften, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add chicken; cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Mix cream of mushroom soup and diced tomatoes with green chile peppers into chicken mixture.
', 'Step 9: Mix spaghetti into chicken mixture and top with Colby-Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 10: Place the skillet in the preheated oven and bake until cheese is melted and slightly brown, 15 to 20 minutes.
']

', 'Step 2: Mix cream cheese, sour cream, refried beans, and taco seasoning in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Fold jalapeno pepper into the dip; spread into a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Title: Mexican Quinoa
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 cup quinoa, rinsed', '1 small onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 envelope gluten-free taco seasoning mix', '2 cups low-sodium chicken broth', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro']

', 'Step 2: Add garlic and jalapeno pepper to quinoa mixture and cook until garlic is fragrant and slightly softened, 1 or 2 more minutes.
', 'Step 3: Mix undrained can of diced tomatoes with green chiles, taco seasoning mix, and chicken broth into quinoa mixture.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until liquid has been absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in cilantro.
']

Title: Chicken Tortilla Soup IV
Ingredients: ['2 ½ teaspoons vegetable oil', '6 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into 1/2 inch strips', '3 cups chicken broth', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite size pieces', '½ cup salsa', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro']

['Step 1: Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add half of the tortilla strips, stirring often, until crisp.
', 'Step 3: Drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 4: Repeat with remaining 1/2 teaspoon of oil and remaining tortilla strips and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Add the broth, cumin, chili powder and oregano to the pot.
', 'Step 6: Raise heat to high and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Add the beans, corn, chicken and salsa.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to low, stir and simmer for about 2 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink inside.
', 'Step 9: Add the cilantro and half of the reserved tortilla strips.
', 'Step 10: Ladle into individual bowls and garnish each bowl with some of the remaining strips.
']

Title: Lengua (Beef Tongue)
Ingredients: ['1 beef tongue', '1 large onion, chopped, divided', '2 cloves garlic', '3 tablespoons salt', '1 whole jalapeno pepper, stemmed', '3 whole tomatoes', '2 whole jalapeno peppers, stemmed', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the tongue, half of the chopped onion, garlic cloves, 3 tablespoons salt, and 1 jalapeno pepper into a large pot.
', 'Step 2: Fill with water to cover the tongue by several inches, then bring to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium-low; cover and simmer until very tender, 3 to 4 hours.
', 'Step 4: Remove the tongue from the water and allow to cool.
', 'Step 5: Reserve the liquid.
', 'Step 6: Once the tongue has cooled, peel off the tough outer skin, then shred the meat using two forks.
', 'Step 7: Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 8: Add the whole tomatoes and 2 jalapeno peppers; boil until the vegetables are tender.
', 'Step 9: Place the vegetables into a blender, and puree until smooth.
', 'Step 10: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Stir in the onion, and cook until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Once the onion has softened, stir in the shredded beef tongue and tomato salsa.
', 'Step 13: Bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally, then pour in 2 cups of the reserved cooking liquid.
', 'Step 14: Cook and stir until the liquid has evaporated, leaving moist, flavorful meat, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Black Bean and Sweet Potato Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['1 large sweet potato, peeled and diced', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ cup frozen corn', '1 (19 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '8 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', 'cooking spray']

', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until very tender, about 15 minutes.

', 'Step 7: Sprinkle 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese atop corn; cover with a tortilla.
', 'Step 8: Repeat with remaining tortillas and fillings.
', 'Step 9: Spray a frying pan with cooking spray and place over medium heat; cook 1 quesadilla in the hot pan until cheese is melted and beans are heated through, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
', 'Step 10: Repeat with remaining quesadillas; slice into quarters.
']

Title: Creamy White Chicken Chili with Salsa Verde
Ingredients: ['1 (2 pound) rotisserie chicken, skinned and boned, meat pulled into large chunks', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '½ cup half-and-half', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 medium green bell peppers, chopped', '2 medium jalapeno peppers, diced', '3 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 tablespoon dried minced shallots', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '8 cups chicken stock', '1 (16 ounce) jar salsa verde', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoons dried oregano']

Title: Tex-Mex Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 (11.25 ounce) cans chili without beans', '1 cup enchilada sauce', '½ cup vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '15 corn tortillas', '1 pound shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 onion, chopped']

Title: Orange and Milk-Braised Pork Carnitas
Ingredients: ['3 ½ pounds boneless pork shoulder, cut into large pieces', '1 tablespoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon kosher salt, or more to taste', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 bay leaves', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 orange, juiced and zested', '2 cups whole milk']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Season pork with pepper and salt.
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in large pot over high heat.
', 'Step 3: Working in batches, cook pork in the hot oil until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Return all cooked pork and accumulated juice to pot.
', 'Step 5: Season pork with bay leaves, cumin, dried oregano, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 6: Stir in fresh orange juice, orange zest, and milk.
', 'Step 7: Bring mixture to a boil over high heat; reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 8: Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, until meat is fork tender but not falling apart, about 2 hours.
', 'Step 9: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Remove pork from liquid.
', 'Step 11: Skim some fat from the pot to grease a baking dish.
', 'Step 12: Transfer the pieces of pork to the baking dish.
', 'Step 13: Drizzle about 2 more tablespoons of the floating fat over the meat.
', 'Step 14: Season with more salt, if needed.
', 'Step 15: Bake in preheated oven until pork is browned, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Stir pork.
', "Step 17: Turn on oven's broiler.
", 'Step 18: Cook pork under broiler until crisp, 2 to 3 minutes.
']

Title: Churros II
Ingredients: ['2 quarts vegetable oil for frying', '1 cup water', '½ cup margarine', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '¼ teaspoon salt', '3 eggs', '¼ cup white sugar', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a heavy deep skillet or deep-fryer, heat oil to 360 degrees F (180 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Oil should be about 1 1/2 inches deep.
', 'Step 3: In a medium saucepan, heat water and margarine to a rolling boil.
', 'Step 4: Combine the flour and salt; stir into the boiling mixture.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to low and stir vigorously until the mixture forms a ball, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat and beat in the eggs one at a time.
', 'Step 7: Spoon the mixture into a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip.
', 'Step 8: Carefully squeeze out 4 inch long strips of dough directly into the hot oil.
', 'Step 9: Fry 3 or 4 strips at once, until golden brown, about 2 minutes on each side.
', 'Step 10: Remove from hot oil to drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 11: Stir together the sugar and cinnamon; roll churros in the mixture while still hot.
']

Title: Gerry's Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 onion, chopped', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes', '12 small chile peppers, diced', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth', '1 bunch green onions, chopped', '½ pint heavy cream', '6 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '3 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch strips.
', 'Step 2: Place in a medium bowl with desired marinade, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Saute chicken and onions until chicken is evenly brown.
', 'Step 6: Stir in diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, stewed tomatoes, chile peppers, soup and broth.
', 'Step 7: Bring mixture to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat, cover skillet, and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear.
', 'Step 9: Remove chicken from skillet, and shred when cool enough to handle.
', 'Step 10: Meanwhile, allow skillet mixture to simmer and reduce to about 2 1/4 cups.
', 'Step 11: In a medium bowl, combine shredded chicken and about 1/4 cup skillet mixture (just enough to make a paste like mixture).
', 'Step 12: Mix together with half the chopped green onions.
', 'Step 13: Pour remaining 2 cups of skillet mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 14: In a second skillet, heat cream over low heat, being careful not to boil.
', 'Step 15: Dip tortillas in the warm cream to soften and coat.
', 'Step 16: Spoon about 1/3 cup chicken mixture onto each tortilla.
', 'Step 17: Top chicken mixture with half the shredded cheese, and roll up tortillas.
', 'Step 18: Place rolled tortillas in baking dish, seam side down, and drizzle with enchilada sauce.
', 'Step 19: Cover with remaining shredded cheese, and sprinkle remaining chopped green onion over cheese.
', 'Step 20: Bake uncovered in preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbling.
']

Title: Spicy Southwest Chicken Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '½ cup water, or as needed', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 red bell pepper, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, partially drained', '1 (14 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '¾ cup picante sauce', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '4 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed fiesta-style nacho cheese soup', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Bring chicken breasts and water to a boil in a large skillet; cook over medium heat until chicken juices run clear and meat is no longer pink inside, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Transfer chicken breasts to a large plate, reserving pan juices in skillet, and shred chicken with 2 forks.
', 'Step 5: Cook onion and red bell pepper in reserved drippings over medium heat until onion is translucent, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Return shredded chicken to skillet.
', 'Step 7: Stir black beans, corn, picante sauce, chopped green chiles, chili powder, and cumin into chicken mixture until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 8: Bring mixture to a simmer and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Pour chicken mixture into prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Arrange flour tortillas in a single layer over chicken mixture.
', 'Step 11: Stir fiesta soup with diced tomatoes and green chiles in a bowl until thoroughly combined; spread soup mixture over tortillas.
', 'Step 12: Top casserole with Mexican cheese blend.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese topping has melted and casserole is hot, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Cool 5 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Breakfast Enchiladas

Title: Tacos de Jamaica (Vegan Hibiscus Tacos)
Ingredients: ['8 ounces dried hibiscus flowers', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '10 fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and diced', '¼ onion, chopped', '2 serrano peppers', '1 clove garlic', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', 'salt to taste', '18 corn tortillas', '2 slices fresh pineapple, chopped', '1 small onion, finely chopped', '½ bunch cilantro, chopped', '2 limes, cut into wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Rinse hibiscus very well to make sure all dust is removed.
', 'Step 2: Place clean hibiscus in a pot over medium heat, cover with water, and boil for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove hibiscus from heat and allow to steep for at least 2 hours, until hibiscus is very soft.
', 'Step 4: Drain well.
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat and cook 1 onion and 2 cloves garlic until soft and translucent, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in drained hibiscus and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly, until hibiscus turns a deep red color.
', 'Step 8: Combine tomatillos, avocado, 1/4 onion, serrano peppers, 1 clove garlic, and 2 tablespoons cilantro; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Season salsa verde with salt.
', 'Step 10: Warm corn tortillas in a skillet.
', 'Step 11: Divide hibiscus mixture amongst tortillas and top with pineapple, onion, and cilantro.
', 'Step 12: Serve with salsa verde and lime.
']
