Title: Birria de Chivo Estilo Jalisco (Mexican Braised Goat)
Ingredients: ['3 ancho chile peppers', '1 cup white vinegar', '15 whole black peppercorns', '1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger root', '2 garlic cloves, peeled', '3 whole cloves', '1 pinch dried marjoram', '1 pinch ground cumin', '1 pinch dried thyme', '4 ½ pounds goat leg', '2 pounds plum tomatoes', '2 cups water', '3 whole black peppercorns', '2 garlic cloves, peeled', '2 whole cloves', '1 pinch dried marjoram', '1 pinch dried thyme', '1 pinch ground cumin', 'salt to taste', '30 chiles de arbol', '¼ cup white vinegar', '10 whole black peppercorns', '1 clove garlic, peeled', '2 white onions, minced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring a pot of water to a boil; add ancho chile peppers and cook for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove from heat and let chiles soak in the hot water until soft, about 10 minutes; drain.
', 'Step 3: Blend softened chiles, 1 cup vinegar, 15 peppercorns, ginger, 2 garlic cloves, 3 cloves, 1 pinch marjoram, 1 pinch cumin, and 1 pinch thyme in a blender until marinade is smooth.
', 'Step 4: Strain marinade into a bowl.
', 'Step 5: Place goat in a bowl and pour in marinade, coating goat completely.
', 'Step 6: Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours.
', 'Step 7: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Transfer goat and marinade to a baking dish; cover with a lid or aluminum foil.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until goat is very tender, about 3 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 10: Remove lid or foil and cook until goat is browned, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Pour meat juices into a container and reserve.
', 'Step 12: Cover the goat to keep warm.
', 'Step 13: Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add tomatoes and boil until soft, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Drain and let tomatoes cool until easily handled.
', 'Step 15: Peel tomatoes and place in blender with reserved goat juices, 2 cups water, 3 peppercorns, 2 garlic cloves, 2 cloves, 1 pinch marjoram, 1 pinch thyme, and 1 pinch cumin.
', 'Step 16: Blend until meat sauce is smooth.
', 'Step 17: Pour meat sauce into a small saucepan and season with salt; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 18: Reduce heat and simmer over low heat.
', 'Step 19: Bring a pot of water to a boil; add chiles de arbol and boil until soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Drain.
', 'Step 21: Blend softened chiles with 1/4 cup vinegar, 10 peppercorns, 1 garlic clove, and salt until hot sauce is smooth.
', 'Step 22: Strain into a glass.
', 'Step 23: Cut goat into bite-sized pieces and serve with a generous amount of meat sauce and hot sauce on the side.
', 'Step 24: Sprinkle onion over goat.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '340.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '38.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '59.8 mg', 'fatContent': '2.9 g', 'fiberContent': '2.6 g', 'proteinContent': '30.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '105.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.7 g'}

Title: Wet Burrito
Ingredients: ['1 pound lean ground beef', '½ cup chopped onion', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice, divided', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 ½ teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '¾ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 cups refried beans', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 (18 ounce) jar beef gravy', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '4 large flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '1 cup sour cream, divided', '¼ cup chopped onion, divided', '¼ cup chopped tomatoes, divided', '1 cup chopped lettuce, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir ground beef, 1/2 cup chopped onion, and garlic in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, breaking it apart as it cooks, about 8 minutes; drain excess grease.
', 'Step 4: Mix in half the can of diced tomatoes, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, paprika, oregano, 3/4 teaspoon of cumin, and black pepper.
', 'Step 5: Bring meat mixture to a boil over medium-high heat and cook for 5 minutes, stirring often.
', 'Step 6: Heat refried beans and 1/4 teaspoon cumin in a saucepan over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 7: Keep beans warm.
', 'Step 8: Mix remaining half of diced tomatoes, beef gravy, and enchilada sauce in a separate saucepan; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Place tortillas onto a microwave-safe plate and cover with a damp paper towel; microwave tortillas until they are soft and warm, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 10: Place a warmed tortilla onto a work surface and spoon 1/4 the beef mixture in a line down the center of the tortilla.
', 'Step 11: Layer 1/4 the bean mixture on top of beef layer and spread 1/4 cup of Cheddar cheese over the bean layer.
', 'Step 12: Fold right and left edges of the tortilla over the ends of the filling and roll up tortilla to make a burrito.
', 'Step 13: Place burrito seam side down into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 14: Repeat with remaining tortillas to make 4 burritos.
', 'Step 15: Pour gravy sauce over the burritos in the baking dish; top with remaining 1 cup Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 16: Bake burritos in the preheated oven until the cheese has melted, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 17: To serve, place each burrito on a serving plate and spoon sauce from baking dish over the burritos.
', 'Step 18: Top each burrito with 1/4 cup sour cream, 1 tablespoon chopped onion and chopped tomato, and 1/4 cup of chopped lettuce.
']

Title: Mexican Corn Casserole

Title: Frozen Margarita Pie
Ingredients: ['1 cup finely crushed pretzels', '¼ cup white sugar', '⅓ cup margarine, melted', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '⅓ cup frozen limeade concentrate, thawed', '2 tablespoons tequila', '1 tablespoon orange liqueur', '3 drops green food coloring, or as needed', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '1 lime, sliced']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Mix pretzels and sugar together in a bowl; stir in margarine until evenly incorporated.
', 'Step 3: Spoon mixture into a 9-inch pie plate; press into bottom and up sides of plate to form a firm, even crust.
', 'Step 4: Bake crust in the preheated oven until edges are lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Cool on a wire rack.
', 'Step 6: Mix sweetened condensed milk, limeade concentrate, tequila, orange liqueur, and green food coloring in a large bowl.
', 'Step 7: Beat cream in a glass or metal bowl until soft peaks form.
', 'Step 8: Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the whipped cream will form soft mounds rather than a sharp peak.
', 'Step 9: Fold whipped cream into sweetened condensed milk mixture.
', 'Step 10: Spoon filling into cooled crust.
', 'Step 11: Cover pie with plastic wrap and freeze until firm, about 4 hours.

']

Title: Elote Salad
Ingredients: ['6 ears corn in the husk', '½ cup mayonnaise', '1 lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon hot sauce', '½ teaspoon mild chile powder', '¼ teaspoon smoked paprika', '½ cup crumbled Cotija cheese', '½ cup coarsely chopped cilantro', '3 scallions, sliced']

', 'Step 11: Fold in chile-lime mayonnaise.
']

Title: Mangonada
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon chamoy (Mexican chili fruit condiment)', '1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®)', '1 cup Mango chunks, frozen', '¾ cup water', '½ medium lime, juiced', '1 tablespoon chamoy (Mexican chili fruit condiment)', '1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®)', '2 tablespoons diced fresh mango']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place 1 teaspoon chamoy on a plate.
', 'Step 2: Place 1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning on another plate.
', 'Step 3: Dip rim of glass first in chamoy, then in chili-lime seasoning.
', 'Step 4: Set aside.
', 'Step 5: Combine frozen mango, water, and lime juice in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Place 1/2 tablespoon chamoy in the bottom of the glass.
', 'Step 7: Add 1/2 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning and 1/2 of the blended mangoes.
', 'Step 8: Repeat layers and top with diced fresh mango.
']

Title: Avocado, Tomato and Mango Salsa

', 'Step 2: Stir in the salt, lime juice, red onion, and olive oil.

']

Title: Pan Dulces
Ingredients: ['1 cup milk', '6 tablespoons butter', '1 (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast', '⅓ cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 eggs', '5 cups all-purpose flour', '½ cup white sugar', '.666 cup all-purpose flour', '4 tablespoons butter, softened', '2 egg yolks']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the milk in a small saucepan until it bubbles, then remove from heat.
', 'Step 2: Add the butter, stir until melted and pour into a large bowl to cool.
', 'Step 3: Dissolve yeast in the milk mixture.
', 'Step 4: Mix in 1/3 cup sugar, salt, eggs and 2 cups flour.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, beating well after each addition.
', 'Step 6: When the dough has pulled together, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and supple, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl and turn to coat with oil.
', 'Step 8: Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 9: Divide the dough into 16 equal pieces and form into rounds.
', 'Step 10: With a rolling pin, roll the rounds into oval buns.
', 'Step 11: Place them onto two lightly greased baking sheets.
', 'Step 12: Cover the rolls with a damp cloth and let rise until doubled in volume, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 14: While the bread rises, make the topping: In a small bowl, stir together 1/2 cup sugar, 2/3 cup flour, butter until a crumb mixture forms.
', 'Step 15: Stir in the egg yolks until well blended.
', 'Step 16: Crumble the topping over the rolls so the entire surface is covered.
', 'Step 17: Bake in preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes, or until sugar topping is lightly browned.
']

Title: Spicy Pork Tenderloin
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon dried thyme', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 (1 pound) pork tenderloins']

['Step 1: In a small bowl, mix together chili powder, salt, ginger, thyme, and black pepper.
', 'Step 2: Rub spice mix into pork tenderloins.
', 'Step 3: Place meat in a baking dish, cover, and refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours.
', 'Step 4: Preheat grill for medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Brush oil onto grill grate, and arrange meat on grill.
', 'Step 6: Cook for 30 minutes, or to desired doneness, turning to cook evenly.
']

Title: Zucchini Nachos
Ingredients: ['2 medium zucchini', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ medium onion, finely chopped', '1 pound lean ground chicken', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon cumin', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon oregano', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '½ cup low-fat sour cream', '½ cup pico de gallo', '1 jalapeno pepper, thinly sliced', '3 green onions, green parts chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cut zucchini into 1/4-inch slices using a mandoline slicer.
', 'Step 2: Place slices in a colander, sprinkle with salt, and toss to coat.
', 'Step 3: Let drain for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Place slices on a clean kitchen towel and pat dry.
', 'Step 5: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Line a 12x18-inch baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 7: Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 8: Add onion and saute until translucent, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add chicken and cook until lightly browned, breaking meat up into small crumbles, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Drain and discard any accumulated liquid.
', 'Step 11: Return skillet to low heat and stir in chili powder, paprika, cumin, garlic powder, salt, oregano, and black pepper.
', 'Step 12: Keep warm.
', 'Step 13: Place zucchini slices on the prepared baking pan in a single layer.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Remove zucchini from oven and top with chicken mixture and shredded Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 16: Return to the hot oven and bake until cheese is melted, 2 to 3 minutes more.
', 'Step 17: Top nachos with dollops of sour cream, pico de gallo, jalapeno, and green onions.
', 'Step 18: Serve immediately.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '310.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '6.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '91.3 mg', 'fatContent': '18.4 g', 'fiberContent': '1.4 g', 'proteinContent': '28.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '10.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '796 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.9 g'}

Title: Vegan Cilantro-Lime, Sweet Potato, and Black Bean Tacos
Ingredients: ['2 sweet potatoes, quartered lengthwise', '3 ¼ tablespoons olive oil, divided', '1 ¼ teaspoons cayenne pepper, divided', '½ teaspoon salt', '¾ teaspoon smoked paprika, divided', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ cup pumpkin seeds', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 (16 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed', '½ tablespoon ground cumin, or to taste', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '¾ lime, juiced, divided', '6 ounces vegan sour cream', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, finely chopped, divided', '1 teaspoon paprika', '12 (6 inch) white corn tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cut sweet potatoes into 25 to 40 smaller "French fry"-shaped pieces.
', 'Step 3: Place sweet potato pieces in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Coat with 2 tablespoons olive oil.
', 'Step 5: Add 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper.
', 'Step 6: Mix until sweet potatoes are evenly coated; transfer to a large baking sheet.
', 'Step 7: Place pumpkin seeds into the same bowl.
', 'Step 8: Add 1/4 tablespoon olive oil; season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 9: Spread pumpkin seeds onto a small baking sheet.
', 'Step 10: Place sweet potatoes and pumpkin seeds in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 11: Bake pumpkin seeds for 2 minutes; remove and let cool.
', 'Step 12: Bake potatoes, flipping halfway through, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 14: Add black beans, cumin, chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika, a small squeeze of lime juice, and salt and pepper to taste.
', 'Step 15: Stir to combine.
', 'Step 16: Cook until heated through, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Combine vegan sour cream, remaining lime juice, 2 tablespoons cilantro, regular paprika, 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, and salt to taste.
', 'Step 18: Whisk until sour cream flavor is mostly gone and lime-cilantro taste is dominant but not overpowering.
', 'Step 19: Warm tortillas in pairs in the microwave, 15 to 20 seconds.
', 'Step 20: Place 2 spoonfuls of beans onto each pair of warmed tortillas.
', 'Step 21: Add 4 sweet potato pieces, a spoonful or two of sour cream mixture, some pumpkin seeds, and some cilantro.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '511.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '70.4 g', 'fatContent': '19.9 g', 'fiberContent': '16.5 g', 'proteinContent': '17.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '1020.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.8 g'}

Title: Creamy Shrimp Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 tablespoons butter', '½ cup finely diced red bell pepper', '½ cup finely diced white onion', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pound medium shrimp - peeled, deveined, and cut into 1-inch pieces', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '4 tablespoons butter', '4 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 ½ cups chicken broth', '1 ¾ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '1 cup sour cream', '½ cup fresh green salsa (salsa verde)', '8 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch pan with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Saute bell pepper and onion until slightly soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
', 'Step 6: Transfer mixture to a bowl.
', 'Step 7: Add shrimp to the skillet and cook until starting to turn pink, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add to vegetable mixture and stir in cilantro, lime juice, chili powder, and salt.
', 'Step 9: Melt butter in the same skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 10: Stir in flour and cook, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Slowly add chicken broth and cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Reduce heat to low and stir in 1 1/2 cups Monterey Jack cheese until melted, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove from heat and stir in sour cream and salsa.
', 'Step 14: Stir 1 cup of cheese sauce into the shrimp mixture.
', 'Step 15: Fill 1 tortilla with 1/3 cup of the shrimp mixture.
', 'Step 16: Roll tightly and place seam-side down into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 17: Repeat with remaining tortillas; pour remaining sauce over the top.
', 'Step 18: Bake in the preheated oven, uncovered, until the tops are golden brown, about 35 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Sprinkle jalapeno over the top, followed by remaining Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 20: Return to the oven and continue baking until melted, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 21: Remove from the oven and let sit for 10 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Corn and Avocado Salsa
Ingredients: ['3 ears fresh corn, husks and silks removed', '2 avocados - peeled, pitted, and cubed', '1 red onion, finely diced', '1 red bell pepper, seeded and diced', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '⅓ cup red wine vinegar', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '¼ cup fresh lime juice', 'salt and black pepper to taste']

', 'Step 2: Cook until kernels are tender but crisp, about 5 minutes.

', 'Step 4: Use a knife to scrape kernels from the cobs.
', 'Step 5: Place kernels in a medium bowl.
', 'Step 6: Stir in avocados, red onion, bell pepper, and garlic.
', 'Step 7: Add cumin, red pepper flakes, and cilantro.
', 'Step 8: Mix in vinegar, olive oil, and lime juice.
', 'Step 9: Season with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Pressure Cooker Carnitas
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons canola oil', '3 pounds boneless pork shoulder, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes', '2 fresh poblano peppers, roughly chopped, or more to taste', '3 jalapeno peppers, roughly chopped, or more to taste', '1 serrano pepper, roughly chopped, or more to taste', '1 large onion, roughly chopped', '4 cloves garlic, roughly chopped', '2 teaspoons ground coriander', '3 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 ½ cups beef broth']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the oil into a pressure cooker over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Brown the pork cubes on all sides in the hot oil, and stir in the poblano, jalapeno, and serrano peppers, onion, garlic, coriander, cumin, and beef broth.
', 'Step 3: Lock the lid onto the pressure cooker, bring the cooker up to pressure, and reduce heat to keep the pressure steady.
', 'Step 4: Cook under medium steady pressure for 1 hour, remove the cooker from the heat, place in the sink, and run cold water over the lid of the cooker until the pressure has been released.
', 'Step 5: Carefully remove the lid, and serve.
']

Title: Vegan Black Bean Quesadillas

Title: Easy Fish Tacos with Mango-Pineapple Slaw
Ingredients: ['1 pound cod fillets', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ cup red wine vinegar', '¼ cup reduced-fat mayonnaise', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '3 cups shredded cabbage', '½ cup chopped fresh mango', '½ cup chopped fresh pineapple', '½ cup chopped red onion', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 fresh jalapeno pepper, chopped', '8 (8 inch) flour tortillas']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place cod fillets on a large sheet of aluminum foil; pour lemon juice over fish and season with salt and black pepper to taste.
', 'Step 3: Fold the foil around the fish and seal to create a pouch; place pouch in a baking dish.
', 'Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, whisk vinegar, mayonnaise, sugar, 1 tablespoon salt, 1 tablespoon black pepper, and garlic powder in a bowl until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Combine cabbage, mango, pineapple, red onion, cilantro, and jalapeno in large bowl.
', 'Step 7: Pour dressing over vegetables and fruit; toss to combine.
', 'Step 8: Cover and refrigerate slaw until ready to serve.
', 'Step 9: Divide fish evenly among flour tortillas.
', 'Step 10: Spoon slaw over fish to serve.
']

Title: Habanero Salsa
Ingredients: ['3 fresh jalapeno peppers', '2 onions, finely chopped', '2 tablespoons garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 (7 ounce) can diced green chile pepper', '½ cup minced fresh cilantro', '2 limes, juiced', '7 (15 ounce) cans canned tomatoes', '1 habanero pepper, seeded']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Roast jalapenos over a grill or gas burner until completely blackened.
', 'Step 2: Seal in a plastic bag or a bowl covered with plastic wrap, and allow to steam until skins are loosened.
', 'Step 3: When cool, remove skin, stem, and seeds.
', 'Step 4: Place jalapenos, onions, garlic, sugar, salt, and pepper into the bowl of a blender or food processor.
', 'Step 5: Pulse to chop and blend, then pour into a large bowl, and mix with the can of green chiles, cilantro, and lime juice.
', 'Step 6: Pulse the tomatoes in batches to desired size, and add to green chile mixture.
', 'Step 7: Return one cup of chopped tomatoes to the blender along with the habanero, and puree well.
', 'Step 8: Strain the puree to remove any large pieces of habanero, and add to the tomatoes.
', 'Step 9: Mix well, cover, and chill in the refrigerator at least one hour to allow flavors to blend.
']

Title: Big Ben's Beef Machaca
Ingredients: ['1 (4 pound) boneless beef chuck roast, trimmed and cut into 8 portions', '½ cup olive oil', '¼ cup Worcestershire sauce', '2 limes, juiced', '1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained', '1 large sweet onion, diced', '½ green bell pepper, diced', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '½ cup beef broth', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon salt, or more to taste', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper']

', 'Step 2: Mix olive oil, Worcestershire sauce, lime juice together in a bowl; pour over the beef.

', 'Step 4: Cook on High for 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Change setting to Low and continue cooking until the beef is tender, about 6 1/2 hours.

', 'Step 7: Shred with a pair of forks and return to the slow cooker.
', 'Step 8: Continue cooking another 20 to 30 minutes.
']

Title: Chicken Nachos
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - chopped', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 (12 ounce) package corn tortilla chips, or as needed', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican-style cheese blend', '1 (7 ounce) can diced green chilies, drained']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a medium bowl, stir together the chicken, vegetable oil, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 2: Let stand for 15 minutes, or longer if desired.
', 'Step 3: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Add the chicken mixture, and fry until chicken is no longer pink.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat, and set aside.
', 'Step 6: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Spread a thin layer of tortilla chips in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle 1/4 of the chicken, 1/4 of the chilies, and 1/4 of the cheese over the chips.
', 'Step 9: Repeat layers ending with cheese on the top.
', 'Step 10: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until the cheese is melted and everything is heated through.
', 'Step 11: Serve with your favorite nacho toppings.
']

Title: Home-style Tacos al Pastor (Chile and Pineapple Pork Tacos)
Ingredients: ['5 Goya Guajillo Chiles', '5 Goya Pasilla Chiles or Goya Ancho Chiles', '1 chipotle pepper from a can of Goya Chipotle Chile in Adobo Sauce', '1 medium white onion, halved', '1 (20 ounce) can Goya Pineapple Chunks', '¼ cup Goya White Vinegar', '2 tablespoons Goya Minced Garlic', '1 teaspoon Goya Cumin', 'Goya Adobo with Pepper, to taste', '1 (2 1/2 pound) boneless, skinless pork butt, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '2 tablespoons Goya Vegetable Oil', '1 (10 ounce) package Goya Corn Tortillas, warmed', '2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', '1 lime, cut into wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring 2 cups water to boil in medium saucepan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add guajillo and pasilla chiles.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until chiles soften, about 10 minutes; transfer to plate.
', 'Step 4: Remove and discard stem and seeds.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, coarsely chop one onion half; reserve remaining half.
', 'Step 6: Strain pineapples; reserve juice and fruit separately.
', 'Step 7: Transfer guajillo, pasilla and chipotle chiles, chopped onion half, reserved pineapple juice, vinegar, garlic and cumin to bowl of food processor.
', 'Step 8: Puree until smooth, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Transfer chile mixture to saucepan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Bring chile mixture to a boil; cook until paste loses raw onion taste, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Season with Adobo; cool.
', 'Step 12: In large container with lid, or in large ziptop bag, combine pork cubes, cooled chile marinade and reserved pineapple chunks; transfer to refrigerator.
', 'Step 13: Marinate at least 2 hours, or up to 24 hours.
', 'Step 14: Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 15: Strain pork and pineapples, discarding marinade.
', 'Step 16: Add pork and pineapples to skillet.
', 'Step 17: Cook in batches until dark golden brown on all sides and cooked through, about 15 minutes; transfer to large serving plate.
', 'Step 18: Meanwhile, finely slice remaining onion half.
', 'Step 19: Transfer sliced onion to bowl with cilantro.
', 'Step 20: Serve pork and pineapple mixture in warm tortillas.
', 'Step 21: Garnish pork tacos with cilantro, onions and limes.
']

Title: Caldo De Pollo (Mexican Chicken Soup)
Ingredients: ['6 cups chicken broth', '1 cup water', '1 ¼ pounds chicken tenders', '3 extra large chicken bouillon cubes (such as Knorr®)', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 teaspoons granulated garlic', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ large white onion, chopped, or to taste', '2 cups chicken broth', '1 cup white rice', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and thinly sliced', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine 6 cups chicken broth, water, chicken tenders, chicken bouillon cubes, olive oil, granulated garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper in a large pot; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat, cover pot, and simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Gently shred chicken using 2 forks.
', 'Step 4: Add onion to broth and simmer for about 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 5: Bring 2 cups chicken broth, rice, and chili powder to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Spoon rice into each serving bowl and pour soup over rice.
', 'Step 8: Garnish with avocado slices and cilantro.
']

Title: Chicken Enchiladas With Mole Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons lard', '½ onion, sliced', '2 cloves garlic, sliced', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon cumin seeds', '2 poblano peppers, seeded and thinly sliced', '2 Anaheim peppers, seeded and thinly sliced', '4 skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into chunks', '4 cups chicken broth', '2 cups chicken broth', '4 dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded', '2 dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded', '1 corn tortilla, cut into 1-inch strips', '4 tomatoes, cut in half crosswise', '3 tomatillos, cut in half crosswise', '2 tablespoons lard', '½ onion, sliced', '5 cloves garlic, sliced', '2 teaspoons cumin seeds', '2 cups chicken broth', 'salt to taste', '1 teaspoon white sugar, or more to taste', '3 ounces dark chocolate, coarsely chopped', '12 corn tortillas', '½ bunch fresh cilantro, coarsely chopped', '½ cup crumbled queso fresco']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt 2 tablespoons lard in a stockpot.
', 'Step 2: Stir in 1/2 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 tablespoon cumin seeds, poblano peppers, and Anaheim peppers; cook and stir until onions are soft, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add chicken thighs and 4 cups chicken broth, cover, and simmer until reduced, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Heat 2 cups chicken broth in a saucepan until it begins to simmer, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour broth into a blender.
', 'Step 6: Toast guajillo chiles and ancho chiles in a dry skillet on medium-high heat until hot and aromatic, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Place toasted chiles and tortilla strips in the blender with the hot broth.
', 'Step 8: Press them down so they are fully submerged and soak until softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Blend the chile and tortilla mixture until smooth.
', 'Step 10: Cook tomatoes and tomatillos in a dry skillet on medium-high heat until soft and blackened, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
', 'Step 11: Melt 2 tablespoons lard in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 12: Stir in 1/2 sliced onion, 5 garlic cloves, 2 teaspoons cumin seeds; cook and stir until onions are soft and golden, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Add onion mixture to the blender with the chile mixture and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 14: Pour chile puree into a large saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 15: Stir in 2 cups chicken broth, salt, sugar, and chocolate.
', 'Step 16: Bring mixture to a simmer; cook and stir until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Toast tortillas in a dry skillet over medium heat until golden and soft, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 18: Fill each tortilla with 1/3 cup chicken mixture.
', 'Step 19: Roll and place seam side down on a plate.
', 'Step 20: Continue with remaining tortillas, 3 per plate.
', 'Step 21: Top each trio of tortillas with 1/3 cup mole sauce, 1 to 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro, and 1 to 2 tablespoons queso fresco.
']

Title: Mexican Beans
Ingredients: ['2 pounds dried pinto beans', '2 ½ quarts water', '1 pound bacon, coarsely chopped', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 medium ripe tomato, chopped', '1 fresh jalapeno pepper, chopped', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine beans and water in a large pot.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 3 hours.
', 'Step 3: Add more water if necessary while beans are cooking.
', 'Step 4: In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until it is beginning to brown.
', 'Step 5: Stir in onion, and continue cooking until onion is tender.
', 'Step 6: Stir in tomato, and jalapeno, and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat, and stir in cilantro.
', 'Step 8: Stir bacon and onion mixture into the beans, and continue cooking for 1 hour, or until beans are soft.
']

Title: Authentic Baja-Mexican Street Tacos (Carne Asada)
Ingredients: ['3 cups fresh orange juice, or more as needed', '2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '3 pounds trimmed skirt steaks', '16 (6 inch) white corn tortillas, or as needed', '1 white onion, chopped, or to taste', '1 small bunch fresh cilantro, chopped, or to taste']

['Step 1: Combine orange juice, 2 tablespoons cilantro, lime juice, garlic, salt, pepper, cumin, and cayenne in a large freezer bag.
', 'Step 2: Submerge skirt steaks in the marinade.
', 'Step 3: Seal the bag, squeezing out as much air as possible.
', 'Step 4: Refrigerate, 1 to 8 hours.
', 'Step 5: Preheat a grill to medium-high.
', 'Step 6: Grill the steaks until hot and firm in the center or to your preferred doneness, 6 to 8 minutes per side.
', 'Step 7: Transfer steaks to a flat work surface and slice as thinly as possible against the grain.
', 'Step 8: Heat corn tortillas on the grill or in a microwave.
', 'Step 9: Keep tortillas warm in a folded sheet of aluminum foil covered by a thick towel.
', 'Step 10: Add steak to each tortilla and top with white onion and cilantro.
']

Title: Vegetarian Refried Beans
Ingredients: ['1 pound dry pinto beans, rinsed', '2 tablespoons minced garlic, divided', '1 medium tomato, diced', '2 tablespoons ground cumin', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 tablespoons olive oil', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the beans in a large saucepan, and cover with an inch of water.
', 'Step 2: Place over high heat, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: When the beans have come to a boil, drain, and return them to the same pot.
', 'Step 4: Cover the beans with 2 inches of water, and stir in 1 tablespoon of garlic, the tomato, cumin, and chili powder.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low, and simmer until the beans are very soft, about 3 hours and 45 minutes, adding water as needed.
', 'Step 6: Once the beans have cooked, mash them with the remaining tablespoon of garlic, the oil, and salt to taste; use additional water as needed to achieve desired consistency.
', 'Step 7: Place over low heat for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 8: Serve.
']

Title: Chicken Mole
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 (3 pound) chicken, cut into pieces', '1 bay leaf', '¼ teaspoon black pepper', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon ground cloves', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '2 teaspoons brown sugar', '1 cup chicken broth', '¼ cup semisweet chocolate chips', '¼ cup raisins', '2 tablespoons sesame seeds']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the vegetable oil in a Dutch oven or large pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook the chicken pieces in the hot oil until golden brown on all sides, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from the pan and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to medium, and stir in the bay leaf, black pepper, cayenne pepper, paprika, cloves, and cinnamon until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 5: Add the onion and garlic; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in the tomatoes, brown sugar, and chicken broth, and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 7: Once simmering, stir in the chocolate chips until melted, then return the chicken pieces to the pot.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the chicken is tender and no longer pink at the bone, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir in the raisins, and cook 3 minutes longer.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle with sesame seeds to serve.
']

Title: Soft Mahi Mahi Tacos with Ginger-Lime Dressing
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', 'salt and pepper to taste', '6 (3 ounce) fillets mahi mahi fillets', '⅓ cup sour cream', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger root', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 dash cayenne pepper', '1 large mango - peeled, seeded and diced', '1 cup diced fresh pineapple', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted and diced', '1 jalapeno pepper, minced', '6 (6 inch) flour tortillas, warmed', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro']

Title: Black Bean Huevos Rancheros
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups fresh tomatoes, seeded and finely chopped', '¼ cup sliced green onions', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '1 fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', 'salt, to taste', '2 teaspoons canola oil', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (19 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '½ cup chicken broth', '1 teaspoon chopped chipotle chiles in adobo sauce', '8 (7 inch) corn tortillas', '½ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '4 eggs']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: To make the salsa, stir the tomatoes, green onions, cilantro, lime juice, jalapeno pepper, 1 clove minced garlic, and salt to taste, together in a bowl until well blended.
', 'Step 2: Cover, and refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 3: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Lightly grease a baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: Place 1 teaspoon canola oil in a skillet, and heat over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Stir in the garlic, and cook 1 minute until light brown.
', 'Step 7: Mix in the black beans, chicken broth, and chiles; simmer until beans are heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Turn off heat, and keep warm.
', 'Step 9: Place four tortillas on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the tortillas.
', 'Step 11: Top with the remaining four tortillas.
', 'Step 12: Cover the baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 13: Bake tortillas in preheated oven until cheese melts, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Place the remaining 1 teaspoon canola oil in a skillet, and heat over medium heat.
', 'Step 15: Crack eggs into skillet, and cook to desired firmness.
', 'Step 16: To assemble huevos rancheros, place filled tortillas on four serving plates.
', 'Step 17: Top each tortilla with black bean mixture, a layer of salsa, and an egg.
', 'Step 18: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Roasted Tomatillo and Garlic Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 pound fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '1 head garlic cloves, separated and peeled', '3 fresh jalapeno peppers', '1 bunch fresh cilantro', '½ cup water, or as needed', 'salt and pepper to taste']

Title: Traditional Pork Posole
Ingredients: ['½ pound green chile peppers, sliced in half lengthwise and seeded', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '½ onion, chopped', '2 tablespoons minced garlic', '1 pound boneless pork loin, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 (29 ounce) can white hominy, drained', '1 (29 ounce) can yellow hominy, drained', '3 cups chicken broth', '1 ½ cups water', '¼ cup ground cumin', '¼ cup chili powder', '3 tablespoons salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Place the peppers with cut sides down onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Place the blackened peppers into a bowl and tightly seal with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 6: Allow the peppers to steam as they cool, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove plastic wrap and carefully remove and discard pepper skins.
', 'Step 8: Dice peppers.
', 'Step 9: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Cook and stir onion and garlic in hot oil until tender and fragrant, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Stir pork into onion and garlic; cook and stir until pork is browned, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add diced green chiles to pork; cook and stir until fragrant, 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Pour white hominy, yellow hominy, chicken broth, water, cumin, chili powder, salt, and black pepper into pork mixture.
', 'Step 14: Bring mixture to a boil and cook for 15 minutes; reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until flavors blend and pork is tender, at least 1 hour.
']

Title: Skillet Mexican Street Corn

Title: Chicken Fajita Melts

', 'Step 5: In a separate bowl, whisk together the water, corn syrup, 1 tablespoon of canola oil, lime juice, lemon juice, cilantro, white vinegar, and onion powder; pour dressing over barley mixture, and toss to combine.
', 'Step 6: Refrigerate salad until cold.
']

Title: Anne's Chicken Chilaquiles Rojas
Ingredients: ['1 (28 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, drained', '2 peppers chipotle chiles in adobo sauce, or more to taste', '1 ½ tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 large white onion, thinly sliced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ½ cups chicken broth', '1 dash roasted ground cumin', '1 dash dried oregano', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (16 ounce) package tortilla chips', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend', '5 ounces crumbled cotija cheese', '1 whole cooked chicken, deboned and shredded', '⅔ cup chopped green onions, divided', '1 cup chopped cilantro, divided', '1 (8 ounce) carton sour cream, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a large (10x15-inch) casserole dish.
', 'Step 3: Combine drained tomatoes and chipotle chiles in adobo in a blender and puree until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Saute onion in hot oil until brown, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add garlic and saute 1 minute more.
', 'Step 7: Add pureed tomato-chile sauce and simmer until mixture starts to thicken.
', 'Step 8: Pour in chicken broth and stir in cumin, oregano, and salt; let simmer until mixture thickens.
', 'Step 9: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 10: Mix tortilla chips and tomato-chile sauce, folding carefully to cover chips completely.
', 'Step 11: You may have to do this in 2 batches.
', 'Step 12: Cover the bottom of the casserole dish with half of the chip/sauce mixture.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle a layer of Mexican cheese and cotija cheese over top.
', 'Step 14: Add shredded chicken to cover all of the chips and cheese.
', 'Step 15: Season chicken with salt and pepper, then sprinkle with 1/2 of the green onions and 1/2 of the cilantro.
', 'Step 16: Spoon 3/4 of the sour cream evenly over top.
', 'Step 17: Spread with the remaining tortilla mixture then top with remaining Mexican and cotija cheeses.
', 'Step 18: Cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 19: Bake in the preheated oven until mixture is bubbly and cheese is melted, 35 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Remove from the oven and let sit for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Serve with sour cream, green onions, and cilantro.
']

Title: Green Sauce Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '1 cup white rice', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth', '3 boneless chicken breast halves, boiled and cubed', '1 pound Monterey Jack cheese', '1 (11 ounce) can sweet corn, drained', '1 (24 ounce) jar green enchilada sauce', '24 (6 inch) corn tortillas']

['Step 1: In a large skillet, saute rice with butter or margarine.

', 'Step 8: Warm tortillas in the microwave for 2 minutes and spread another 1/4 cup sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Place a little of the chicken mixture on each tortilla and roll up.

Title: Frijoles a la Charra

Title: Mexican Chicken Corn Chowder

Title: Spicy Chicken Jerky in the Air Fryer
Ingredients: ['2 (5 ounce) boneless chicken breasts, cut into strips', '½ cup mojo criollo marinade (such as Goya®)', '2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning', '6 each wooden skewers']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chicken strips, marinade, and Cajun seasoning in a resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 2: Refrigerate for 8 hours, or up to overnight.
', 'Step 3: Measure skewers to fit across the air fryer basket, slightly overlapping the edge.
', 'Step 4: Trim off excess length.
', 'Step 5: Preheat the air fryer to 180 degrees F (80 degrees C) for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Thread chicken strips onto skewers, leaving room in between each strip, while the air fryer is preheating.
', 'Step 7: Air fry for 1 hour 15 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Adjust cooking time as most air fryers have a maximum setting of 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Rearrange the skewers during the reset time.
', 'Step 10: Increase temperature to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C) and air fry for an additional 15 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove strips to a paper towel-lined storage container.
', 'Step 12: Seal.
', 'Step 13: Allow to rest overnight before serving.
']

']

Title: New Mexico Green Chile Breakfast Burritos
Ingredients: ['4 potatoes, shredded', '1 small onion, finely chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 (8 ounce) container frozen Hatch, New Mexico green chile peppers', '½ cup chicken broth', '12 strips bacon', '⅓ cup vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon onion powder', 'salt and pepper to taste', '6 (10 inch) flour tortillas', 'butter flavored cooking spray', '12 extra large eggs, beaten', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the shredded potatoes in a bowl, cover with water, and set aside.
', 'Step 2: Bring the onion, garlic, green chiles, and chicken broth to a boil in a saucepan over high heat.
', 'Step 3: Reduce the heat to low, and simmer until the sauce thickens; turn off the heat.
', 'Step 4: Meanwhile, place the strips of bacon on paper towels on a microwave-safe plate, and cook on High until crisp, about 1 minute per strip; set aside.
', 'Step 5: Heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet.
', 'Step 6: Drain the potatoes, and add to the skillet.
', 'Step 7: Spoon hot oil over the potatoes; sprinkle with the onion powder, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Flip the potatoes occasionally, but let them fry until crispy bits form and the potatoes are cooked through, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Place the tortillas between two damp paper towels.
', 'Step 10: Microwave on High until warm, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 11: Spray a separate skillet with butter flavored cooking spray and cook the eggs over medium heat, whisking them continuously until the eggs are completely set; turn off the heat.
', 'Step 12: Lay a tortilla flat in front of you.
', 'Step 13: Place some potatoes, scrambled egg, and a strip of bacon on the lower third, leaving about an inch of room from the bottom, and about 1-1/2 inches on the left and right clear for folding the burrito.
', 'Step 14: Spoon on a little of the green chile sauce, and sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 15: Fold the left and right edges into the middle about 1-1/2 to 2 inches.
', 'Step 16: Take the bottom edge closest to you with the stuffing and pick it up, pulling it OVER the filling, while keeping the sides in place until that edge now touches the tortilla about 7/8 of the way up to the top edge.
', 'Step 17: Check to see that the sides are still tucked well.
', "Step 18: If they aren't slide them in a bit now that you have the filling covered.
", 'Step 19: Finish by tucking the bottom flap that you pulled over the filling UNDER the filling a bit to seal it, then continue rolling the burrito up to the top edge, forming a tight cylinder.
', 'Step 20: Let it rest seam-side down, and it will stay nice and tight.
', 'Step 21: Repeat with remaining ingredients.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Taco Soup with Ranch Dressing Mix
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 (1 ounce) package ranch dressing mix', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles, undrained', '1 (15.5 ounce) can corn, undrained', '1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, undrained', '1 (15 ounce) can sliced black olives', '1 onion, diced', '1 green bell pepper, diced', '1 cup tomato juice']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir beef until crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink.
', 'Step 2: Drain and discard any excess grease.
', 'Step 3: Transfer beef to a slow cooker and sprinkle with the taco seasoning mix and ranch dressing mix.
', 'Step 4: Add the diced tomatoes and green chiles, corn, and black beans, all with their liquid, to the slow cooker.
', 'Step 5: Stir the black olives, onion, bell pepper, and tomato juice into the ground beef mixture.
', 'Step 6: Cook on Low until the vegetables are completely tender, about 5 hours.
']

Title: Carlota de Limon (Mexican Lemon Icebox Cake)
Ingredients: ['2 (14.5 ounce) cans evaporated milk', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans sweetened condensed milk', '¾ cup lemon juice, or more to taste', '⅔ (20 ounce) package Mexican Maria cookies (galletas Maria)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine evaporated milk, condensed milk, and lemon juice in a bowl; whisk until mixture is thick and smooth.
', 'Step 2: Line a glass bowl or trifle dish with Maria cookies and cover them with a generous layer of the milk mixture.
', 'Step 3: Add another layer of biscuits and milk.
', 'Step 4: Continue the layering, ending with a layer of the milk mixture.
', 'Step 5: Refrigerate for at least 6 hours, but better if overnight.
', 'Step 6: Remove from the fridge just before serving.
']

Title: Poblano Chicken Enchilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['6 tablespoons butter, divided', '6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '2 fresh poblano peppers, seeded and sliced into strips', '4 fresh jalapeno peppers, seeded and diced', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 lime, halved', '¼ cup all-purpose flour', '1 pint half-and-half', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '1 (8 ounce) package fresh mushrooms, sliced', '2 ounces sour cream', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '4 cups shredded mozzarella cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Place the chicken breasts in the skillet.
', 'Step 3: Mix in the poblano peppers, jalapeno peppers, and garlic.
', 'Step 4: Squeeze the juice from one lime half over the chicken, and place the lime peel and pulp into the skillet.
', 'Step 5: Cover, and simmer 25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until chicken juices run clear.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat, cool, and cut chicken into cubes.
', 'Step 7: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Melt 1/4 cup butter in a medium saucepan over low heat.
', 'Step 9: Gradually stir in the flour and half-and-half.
', 'Step 10: Mix in the cilantro, mushrooms, sour cream, and juice of remaining lime half.
', 'Step 11: Cook and stir 10 minutes, until mushrooms are tender.
', 'Step 12: Line the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish with 6 tortillas.
', 'Step 13: Arrange 1/2 the chicken and pepper mixture over the tortillas.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle with 1 cup cheese, and cover with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 15: Layer with remaining chicken and pepper mixture, and pour the cilantro sauce evenly over the casserole.
', 'Step 16: Top with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 17: Bake 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until cheese is melted and lightly browned.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '541.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '29 g', 'cholesterolContent': '138.4 mg', 'fatContent': '30.7 g', 'fiberContent': '4.1 g', 'proteinContent': '38.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '17.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '512.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.4 g'}

Title: Shrimp and Crab Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['12 (12 inch) flour tortillas', '8 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, shredded', '1 (6 ounce) can crab meat, drained', '1 pound cooked medium shrimp, shelled and deveined', '1 (20 ounce) can green enchilada sauce', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '1 bunch green onions, chopped']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lay tortillas on a flat surface.
', 'Step 3: In the middle of each tortilla place equal amounts of cheese, crab, and shrimp.
', 'Step 4: Set aside some cheese to sprinkle on top of the tortillas.
', 'Step 5: Roll the tortillas to form enchiladas.
', 'Step 6: Arrange side by side in a 9x13 inch baking pan.
', 'Step 7: Pour green enchilada sauce over all of the enchiladas; the green sauce should cover the enchiladas completely.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the enchiladas.
', 'Step 9: Cover, and bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 10: Remove cover, and continue baking 15 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Top enchiladas with sour cream and green onions to serve.
']

Title: Taco Lettuce Wraps
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground turkey', '1 (16 ounce) package frozen corn', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', 'romaine leaves, rinsed and dried']

', 'Step 2: Cook and stir ground turkey in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.

Title: Mexican Corn Bread Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 small onion, diced', '½ red bell pepper, chopped', '1 pound ground beef', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ cup frozen corn', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided, or more to taste', '1 cup salsa', '1 cup cornmeal', '¾ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '1 cup milk', '2 eggs, beaten']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Add onion and red bell pepper; saute until softened, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add ground beef, garlic, chili powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Mix corn into the beef mixture and toss to defrost, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Drain and discard fat.
', 'Step 8: Add about 1/4 of the shredded Mexican cheese blend and mix well.
', 'Step 9: Pour meat sauce into a 9x13-inch casserole dish.
', 'Step 10: Cover meat with a thin layer of salsa.
', 'Step 11: Combine cornmeal, salt, and baking soda in a large bowl.
', 'Step 12: Add milk and eggs; stir until well blended.
', 'Step 13: Pour cornmeal mixture on top of salsa layer and top with remaining shredded Mexican cheese blend.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until browned on top, about 30 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '304.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '21.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '100.6 mg', 'fatContent': '16.3 g', 'fiberContent': '1.9 g', 'proteinContent': '18.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '707.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.8 g'}

Title: Mexican Whole Wheat Flour Tortillas
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '4 cups whole wheat bread flour', '½ cup shortening', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 ½ cups boiling water', 'all-purpose flour for rolling']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large bowl, stir together 1 cup all-purpose flour, the whole wheat flour, and salt.
', 'Step 2: Rub in the shortening by hand until the mixture is the texture of oatmeal.
', 'Step 3: Make a well in the center, and pour in the boiling water.
', 'Step 4: Mix with a fork until all of the water is evenly incorporated.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle with a bit of additional flour, and knead until the dough does not stick to your fingers.
', 'Step 6: The dough should be smooth.
', 'Step 7: Make balls the size of golf balls, about 2 ounces each.
', 'Step 8: Place them on a tray, and cover with a cloth.
', 'Step 9: Let stand for at least 1 hour, or up to 8 hours.
', 'Step 10: Heat a griddle or large frying pan over high heat.
', 'Step 11: On a lightly floured surface, roll out a tortilla to your preferred thinness.
', 'Step 12: Fry one at a time.
', 'Step 13: Place on the griddle for 10 seconds, as soon as you see a bubble on the top, flip the tortilla over.
', 'Step 14: Let it cook for about 30 seconds, then flip and cook the other side for another 30 seconds.
', 'Step 15: Roll out the next tortilla while you wait for that one to cook.
', 'Step 16: Repeat until all of the balls have been cooked.
', 'Step 17: Tortillas can be refrigerated or frozen.
']

Title: Cilantro-Lime Rice
Ingredients: ['1 cup long grain white rice', '2 cups water', '1 teaspoon chicken bouillon granules', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', 'salt to taste']

['Step 1: Bring the rice, water, and chicken bouillon to a boil in a saucepan over high heat.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from the heat, add the lime juice, cilantro, and salt; fluff with a fork and serve.
']

Title: Chicken Pineapple Fajitas
Ingredients: ['8 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into strips', '2 small red bell peppers, cut into strips', '2 teaspoons Jamaican jerk seasoning', '⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper', '4 slices canned pineapple, chopped', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', 'chopped fresh cilantro', 'lime wedges']

['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Wrap the tortillas in aluminum foil and heat in the oven.
', 'Step 3: Combine the chicken, bell pepper, jerk seasoning, and pepper in a large bowl, set aside.
', 'Step 4: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat, and coat with cooking spray.
', 'Step 5: Add the pineapple and cook until brown, about 4 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove the pineapple from the pan and set aside.
', 'Step 7: Return the skillet to the stove and heat the vegetable oil.
', 'Step 8: Add the chicken and peppers; cook and stir until the chicken is no longer pink, about 6 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir in the cooked pineapple.
', 'Step 10: Serve in the warmed tortillas and garnish with cilantro and a squeeze of lime.
']

Title: Fish Tacos with Honey-Cumin Cilantro Slaw and Chipotle Mayo
Ingredients: ['1 pound tilapia fillets, cut into chunks', '½ cup fresh lime juice', '⅓ cup fresh lime juice', '2 tablespoons honey', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ cup mayonnaise', '2 chipotle chilies in adobo sauce', '1 tablespoon adobo sauce from chipotle peppers', '¼ teaspoon salt', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '⅓ cup all-purpose flour', '2 eggs, lightly beaten', '2 cups panko crumbs', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 cup vegetable oil for frying', '2 cups 3 color coleslaw blend', '1 cup minced fresh cilantro leaves', '8 (7 inch) flour tortillas, warmed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the tilapia chunks in a flat dish and pour 1/2 cup lime juice over the fish.
', 'Step 2: Cover, and refrigerate at least 4 hours.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, make the honey-cumin sauce by whisking together 1/3 cup lime juice, honey, vegetable oil, and ground cumin a small bowl.
', 'Step 4: Set aside until needed.
', 'Step 5: To make the chipotle mayonnaise dressing, place the mayonnaise, chilies, adobo sauce, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and cayenne pepper together in the bowl of a food processor.
', 'Step 6: Pulse until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Cover, and refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 8: To bread the fish, place the flour, eggs, and panko crumbs in three separate shallow dishes.
', 'Step 9: Season the fish with salt and pepper to taste.
', 'Step 10: Dip the fish pieces first in the four, coating evenly, and shaking off any excess.
', 'Step 11: Dip next in the eggs, and last in the panko crumbs, patting the pieces to help the breadcrumbs hold.
', 'Step 12: Set the fish aside on a plate.
', 'Step 13: To cook the breaded fish, pour 1 cup vegetable oil into a skillet to 1/4 inch deep.
', 'Step 14: Heat the oil to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C) over medium heat.
', 'Step 15: Cook the fish, turning until all sides are golden brown, and flesh is easily flaked with a fork.
', 'Step 16: Drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 17: Brush the fish with the honey-cumin sauce.
', 'Step 18: Mix the coleslaw and cilantro together in a bowl.
', 'Step 19: Reserve 1/4 cup of the chipotle mayonnaise dressing, and pour the remaining dressing over the coleslaw mixture.
', 'Step 20: Toss to coat evenly with the dressing.
', 'Step 21: Place the tortillas on a flat surface, and spread each with 1 tablespoon reserved chipotle mayonnaise dressing.
', 'Step 22: Divide the fish between the tortillas.
', 'Step 23: Top with the cilantro coleslaw.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '984.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '117.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '137.4 mg', 'fatContent': '44.4 g', 'fiberContent': '5 g', 'proteinContent': '42.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '1153.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '10.1 g'}

Title: Margarita Grilled Shrimp
Ingredients: ['1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 teaspoons tequila', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon salt', '4 bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 20 minutes']

']

Title: No Fuss Shredded Beef Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 large yellow onion, sliced into thin rings', '1 (3 pound) boneless beef chuck roast, trimmed', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans chili-seasoned diced tomatoes', '1 (14 ounce) can beef broth', '1 cup cold coffee', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '2 jalapeno peppers, sliced', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper']

', 'Step 3: Pour diced tomatoes, beef broth, and coffee into the cooker over the roast; stir in diced green chiles, jalapeno peppers, garlic, chili powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 4: Spread remaining onion rings over the mixture.
', 'Step 5: Cover the cooker and cook on Low until beef is very tender, 6 to 10 hours.
', 'Step 6: Transfer chuck roast to a bowl and shred meat.
', 'Step 7: Return meat to sauce.
', 'Step 8: Remove onions and serve with meat.
']

Title: Calabaza Con Pollo (Calabaza Squash and Chicken)
Ingredients: ['3 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 calabaza squash, peeled and cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes', '1 medium zucchini, cubed', '1 medium yellow squash, cubed', '1 medium tomato, chopped', '1 medium yellow onion, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add chicken thighs.
', 'Step 2: Continue to boil until no longer pink in the centers and juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Drain, reserving 2 cups broth.
', 'Step 5: Shred or chop chicken and set aside.
', 'Step 6: Mix salt, garlic powder, cumin, and black pepper together in a bowl and set aside.
', 'Step 7: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 8: Add calabaza squash, zucchini, yellow squash, tomato, and onion.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir until tender, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add corn, followed by tomato sauce, dry spice mixture, and chicken.
', 'Step 11: Pour in reserved 2 cups chicken broth.
', 'Step 12: Mix well.
', 'Step 13: Cover the pan and let simmer over medium heat, 20 to 30 minutes.
']

Title: Tomatillo Soup
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded thin', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '1 onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pound chopped tomatillos', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced', '4 cups chicken stock', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon hot pepper sauce', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ cup sour cream', 'salt to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil over high heat in a large saucepan or Dutch oven.
', 'Step 2: Saute chicken in oil until both sides are browned, approximately 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 3: Remove the chicken, and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Add onions and garlic to saucepan, and saute until golden.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the tomatillos, jalapeno peppers, and broth.
', 'Step 6: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat, cover the pot, and simmer for about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Puree vegetables in batches in a blender or food processor.
', 'Step 9: Return to pot, and reheat.
', 'Step 10: At this point taste the soup; if not piquant enough, add cayenne pepper or pepper sauce.
', 'Step 11: Slice the chicken into thin slices, and then shred.
', 'Step 12: Stir into soup.
', 'Step 13: Season to taste with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 14: When ready to serve, stir in the minced cilantro and ladle into bowls.
', 'Step 15: Put a dollop of sour cream on top of each portion, and let it melt a bit.
', 'Step 16: Top each dollop with a single cilantro leaf, and serve immediately.
']

Title: Mexican Steak Torta
Ingredients: ['1 pound sirloin steak', '1 tablespoon garlic salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', 'ground cayenne pepper to taste', '4 kaiser rolls, split', '¼ cup mayonnaise', '½ cup refried beans', '1 large avocado, thinly sliced', '1 large tomato, sliced', '2 cups shredded lettuce', '1 ounce crumbled cotija cheese']

', 'Step 4: Remove from heat to a cutting board and cover with foil.
', 'Step 5: Set a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Spread both halves of each roll with mayonnaise.

', 'Step 8: Warm the refried bean in a bowl in the microwave, about 1 minute on High, and slice the sirloin steak into thin strips.
', 'Step 9: Spread a thin layer of beans on the bottom half of each roll, layer with steak, avocado, tomato, and lettuce.
', 'Step 10: Top with cheese, if desired, and close the sandwich with the top of the roll.

Title: Grilled Pork Tacos al Pastor
Ingredients: ['3 dried guajillo chilies, seeds discarded', '2 dried pasilla chiles, seeds discarded', '1 cup boiling water, or as needed to cover', '2 pork tenderloins, membranes (silver skin) removed', '¾ cup pineapple juice', '1 tablespoon white vinegar', '4 cloves garlic', '1 teaspoon ground dried chipotle pepper', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 pinch ground cumin, or to taste', '1 pinch dried oregano, or to taste', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed', '½ teaspoon salt, or to taste', '16 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '16 slices Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '2 cups shredded cabbage, divided', '½ cup roasted tomato salsa, divided', '1 large jalapeno pepper, thinly sliced - or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place dried guajillo and pasilla chiles into a bowl and pour in boiling water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Let chiles stand 30 minutes to soften.
', 'Step 3: Cut pork tenderloins in half crosswise and in half again lengthwise again to make 8 long strips.
', 'Step 4: Drain water from chiles and pour in pineapple juice and vinegar.
', 'Step 5: Add garlic cloves, chipotle pepper, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, cumin, and oregano.
', 'Step 6: Transfer chile mixture to a blender and blend to make a smooth marinade.
', 'Step 7: Place pork into a resealable plastic bag and pour marinade over pork; knead bag several times to coat pork.
', 'Step 8: Squeeze out excess air and seal the bag.
', 'Step 9: Refrigerate overnight.
', 'Step 10: Preheat outdoor grill (preferably charcoal) for high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 11: Remove pork from bag and drain and discard marinade; transfer pork to a platter.
', 'Step 12: Drizzle meat with 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and season with salt.
', 'Step 13: Use tongs to gently stir pork pieces to coat lightly with oil.
', 'Step 14: Cook pork strips on preheated grill until meat shows good grill marks and is lightly pink in the center, 7 to 8 minutes per side.
', 'Step 15: An instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the center of the largest piece should read at least 145 degrees F (65 degrees C).
', 'Step 16: Transfer pork to a fresh platter.
', 'Step 17: Drizzle a nonstick skillet with 1 teaspoon vegetable oil and place over medium heat.
', 'Step 18: Lay a tortilla into the hot oil and place 1 slice of Monterey Jack cheese into center of the tortilla.
', 'Step 19: Cook until tortilla is hot, lightly browned on the bottom, and cheese has melted, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Repeat with remaining tortillas and cheese slices.
', 'Step 21: Transfer each tortilla to a plate.
', 'Step 22: Slice pork strips across the grain into pieces about 1/4 inch thick.
', 'Step 23: Divide shredded cabbage onto each tortilla and top each with about 6 slices of pork, 1 tablespoon roasted tomato salsa, and a few slices of jalapeno pepper.
', 'Step 24: Fold taco over fillings to eat.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '256.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '15.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '56.8 mg', 'fatContent': '13.4 g', 'fiberContent': '2.4 g', 'proteinContent': '18.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '309.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.1 g'}

Title: Chicken Enchiladas Suizas
Ingredients: ['6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 cup chopped onion', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '1 red bell pepper, chopped', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers', '1 cup green salsa', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '4 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, chopped', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '12 (7 inch) flour tortillas', '10 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 cup whipping cream', '½ cup chicken broth']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a rapid boil over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add the chicken to the boiling water; cover.
', 'Step 3: Cook 15 to 20 minutes; drain and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Lightly grease a 10x15 baking dish.
', 'Step 6: Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Cook the onion, green bell pepper, and red bell pepper in the melted butter until just soft, 5 to 8 minutes; transfer to a large bowl.
', 'Step 8: Add the chicken, Cheddar cheese, green chile peppers, salsa, cilantro, cumin, and chipotle peppers to the bowl.
', 'Step 9: Season with salt and pepper; mix.
', 'Step 10: Place about 1/3 cup of the chicken mixture along the edge of a tortilla; roll tightly into a tube.
', 'Step 11: Place the enchilada, seam-side down, into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 12: Repeat until all the chicken mixture is used.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle Monterrey Jack cheese over the enchiladas.
', 'Step 14: Whisk together the whipping cream and chicken broth in a small bowl; pour over the enchiladas.
', 'Step 15: Cover the dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 16: Bake in preheated oven 30 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Remove foil and continue baking until cheese is completely melted, about 10 minutes.
']

Title: Easy Spanish Rice
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 ½ cups long-grain rice', '3 cups water', '2 roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '1 cup chopped onion', '¾ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon tomato bouillon with chicken flavoring (such as Knorr®), or more to taste']

['Step 1: Place a pot over medium-heat heat; add oil and heat until oil shimmers slightly.
', 'Step 2: Pour rice into the hot oil, stirring constantly, until rice is golden to dark brown, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Mix water, tomatoes, onion, cilantro, and bouillon into rice.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Turn off heat and cover pot tightly with a lid.
', 'Step 6: Leave pot covered on hot burner until rice has absorbed all the liquid, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Adjust seasonings as needed.
']

Title: Enchilada Baked Chicken Thighs
Ingredients: ['2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs', '1 (10 ounce) can red enchilada sauce, divided', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (2.25 ounce) can sliced black olives', '2 green onions, chopped', '2 tablespoons sour cream', '2 sprigs chopped fresh cilantro']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine chicken and 4 ounces enchilada sauce in a bowl; toss to combine.
', 'Step 3: Transfer onto a baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove baking sheet from the oven and drain liquid.
', 'Step 6: Baste remaining enchilada sauce over chicken thighs and return to the oven.
', 'Step 7: Continue baking until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 10 more minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove from oven and divide Cheddar cheese and olives evenly on top of the chicken.
', "Step 9: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.

Title: Air Fryer Corn Ribs
Ingredients: ['2 ears fresh corn, husked', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ cup mayonnaise', '2 teaspoons lime juice', '1 teaspoon Mexican-style hot sauce (such as Valentina®)', '2 tablespoons crumbled cotija cheese', '1 tablespoon chopped cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place an ear of corn on a cutting board and cut in half lengthwise.
', 'Step 3: Cut each half in half lengthwise.
', 'Step 4: Repeat with remaining ear of corn.
', 'Step 5: You should have 8 "ribs" total.
', 'Step 6: Whisk olive oil, chili powder, garlic powder, and black pepper together in a bowl until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Brush onto both sides of each rib and place in the air fryer basket.
', 'Step 8: Air fry for 12 minutes, flipping halfway through the cook time.
', 'Step 9: Meanwhile whisk mayonnaise, lime juice, and hot sauce together until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 10: Transfer corn ribs to a serving plate.
', 'Step 11: Drizzle sauce over the ribs and top with cotija cheese and cilantro.
']

Title: Deep Fried Jalapeno Slices
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '2 eggs', '1 cup beer', '½ quart vegetable oil', '2 cups sliced jalapeno peppers']

['Step 1: Mix flour, salt, pepper, red chili powder, garlic powder, eggs, and beer together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: In a deep fryer, or large pot heat oil to 365 degrees F (180 degrees C).
', 'Step 3: Dip the sliced jalapenos in the batter.
', 'Step 4: Place battered jalapenos in deep fryer.

Title: Healthy Mexican Chicken Bake
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '4 ounces shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 cup salsa']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Season one side of chicken breasts with half the cumin, half the garlic powder, salt, and black pepper; arrange chicken breasts with seasoned sides down in the hot oil.
', 'Step 4: Fry until chicken is lightly browned on the bottom, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Season the top of each chicken breast with the remaining cumin, remaining garlic powder, salt, and black pepper; flip chicken and cook until other side is lightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: If the skillet gets dry, pour in just enough juice from the salsa to keep it from burning.
', 'Step 7: Transfer chicken breasts to a 9x9-inch baking dish; sprinkle with Mexican cheese blend.
', 'Step 8: Loosen all the drippings from the skillet with a little more juice from the salsa and pour on top of chicken breasts.
', 'Step 9: Spoon salsa over cheese layer.
', 'Step 10: Bake chicken breasts until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 11: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
']

Title: Karen's Slow Cooker Chicken Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 Reynolds® Slow Cooker Liner', '2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast tenders', '1 medium onion, thinly sliced', '1 large red bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '1 large green bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '¾ cup chunky salsa', '2 (1.4 ounce) packages fajita seasoning mix', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '16 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '½ cup Shredded cheese', '½ cup Chopped tomatoes', '¼ cup Guacamole', '¼ cup Sour cream']

['Step 1: Open Reynolds® Slow Cooker Liner and place it inside a 5- to 6 1/2-quart slow cooker bowl.
', 'Step 2: Fit liner snugly against the bottom and sides of bowl; pull top of liner over rim of bowl.
', 'Step 3: Place chicken in Reynolds® Slow Cooker Liner.
', 'Step 4: Place onions and bell peppers on top of chicken.
', 'Step 5: Mix salsa, fajita seasoning mix and cayenne pepper in a medium bowl.
', 'Step 6: Pour over chicken.
', 'Step 7: Place lid on slow cooker.
', 'Step 8: Cook on LOW for 6 to 7 hours OR on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours until chicken is done.

', 'Step 10: Gently stir chicken and sauce with a plastic or wooden slotted spoon.
', 'Step 11: Spoon 1/2 cup of chicken mixture into center of each tortilla; add desired toppings and fold tortilla over filling.
', 'Step 12: Do not lift or transport liner with food inside.
', 'Step 13: Cool slow cooker completely; remove Reynolds® Slow Cooker Liner and toss.
']

Title: Creamy Chicken Tortilla Bake

Title: Jalapeno Hot Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '20 fresh jalapeno peppers, sliced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '½ cup minced onion', '¾ teaspoon salt', '2 cups water', '1 cup distilled white vinegar']

', 'Step 2: Add the water and cook for 20 minutes, stirring often.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat and allow mixture to cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 4: n Transfer the mixture to a food processor and puree until smooth.

', 'Step 6: n Pour into a sterilized jar with a tight lid.
', 'Step 7: This sauce will keep for 6 months when stored in the refrigerator.
']

Title: Shredded Beef Chimichangas
Ingredients: ['2 pounds boneless beef chuck roast, trimmed of fat', '¼ cup water', '1 ½ cups beef broth', '3 tablespoons red wine vinegar', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '4 (8 inch) flour tortilla', '3 tablespoons butter, melted', '1 cup salsa', '½ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '½ cup sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place beef in a Dutch oven over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Pour in water.
', 'Step 3: Cover, and cook for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove cover, and cook until liquid has evaporated, and beef is well browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: In a medium bowl, combine beef broth, red wine vinegar, chili powder and cumin.
', 'Step 6: Pour over beef.
', 'Step 7: Cover, and cook until meat is very tender, and pulls apart easily, about 2 hours.
', 'Step 8: Allow to cool, then shred and mix with pan juices.

', 'Step 10: Brush both sides of each tortilla with melted butter.
', 'Step 11: Spoon shredded beef filling down center of each tortilla.
', 'Step 12: Fold ends over filling, then fold sides to center to make a packet.
', 'Step 13: Place chimichangas, seam side down, in a 9- by 13-inch baking pan.
', 'Step 14: Bake in preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or until golden brown.
', 'Step 15: Serve with shredded cheese, sour cream and salsa.
']

Title: Spanish Rice
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 cups uncooked long-grain white rice', '¼ onion, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes', '4 cups water']

', 'Step 2: Remove skillet from stove.
', 'Step 3: Mix tomatoes into the mixture.

', 'Step 6: When the mixture begins to boil, cover the skillet, and reduce heat to a simmer.
', 'Step 7: Cook 12 to 15 minutes and never, I mean NEVER, remove the cover.

', 'Step 9: DO NOT remove cover until the final 15 minutes has elapsed!

Title: Chicken Kabobs Mexicana
