Title: Mexican-Style Shrimp Cocktail
Ingredients: ['1 cup clam juice', '¼ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1 ¼ cups peeled, seeded, diced ripe tomatoes', '1 cup diced English cucumber', '½ cup diced celery', '½ cup finely diced red onion', '2 tablespoons seeded and diced jalapeno peppers', '½ cup ketchup', '2 limes, juiced', '2 tablespoons freshly chopped cilantro, plus more for garnish', 'Mexican-style hot sauce, to taste', '1 large Hass avocado, cubed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place clam juice and oregano in a saucepan; bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add shrimp and stir just until shrimp turn pink and are not quite cooked through, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer shrimp to a bowl with a slotted spoon.
', 'Step 4: Reserve liquid.
', 'Step 5: Let shrimp cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 6: Place chopped tomatoes, cucumbers, celery, red onion, and jalapenos is a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 7: Add ketchup, cooking liquid from the shrimp, lime juice, cilantro, and hot sauce.
', 'Step 8: Gently mix until ingredients are well blended.
', 'Step 9: Chop shrimp into bite-size pieces, leaving a few whole for garnishes.
', 'Step 10: Stir chopped pieces into the vegetable mixture.
', 'Step 11: Wrap mixing bowl with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 12: Place reserved shrimp in a bowl; wrap with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 13: Refrigerate shrimp cocktail and reserved shrimp until thoroughly chilled, 2 to 3 hours.
', 'Step 14: If mixture seems a bit thick, add a little tomato juice or pickle juice.
', 'Step 15: Stir in avocado cubes.
', 'Step 16: Serve, if possible, in clear glass bowls.
', 'Step 17: Top with reserved whole shrimp and some cilantro leaves.
']

Title: Cochinita Pibil
Ingredients: ['2 pounds pork butt roast with bone', '2 tablespoons achiote paste', '⅓ cup orange juice', '⅔ cup fresh-squeezed lemon juice', '2 habanero peppers, seeded and chopped', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', 'salt and pepper to taste', '½ cup red wine vinegar', '2 red onions, sliced into rings']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Poke holes all over the pork with a fork.
', 'Step 2: Rub achiote paste all over the pork, and set aside.
', 'Step 3: In a large bowl, mix together the orange juice, lemon juice, and habanero peppers.
', 'Step 4: Mix in the cumin, paprika, chili powder, coriander, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Place pork in the mixture, cover, and refrigerate overnight, turning two or three times.
', 'Step 6: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Wrap the pork and marinade in aluminum foil or banana leaves that have been soaked in water for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Place into a casserole dish, and cover.
', 'Step 9: Bake for about 2 hours, until the meat falls off the bone.
', 'Step 10: The slower you cook it, the better it is.
', 'Step 11: You could also bake it in a 200 degrees F (95 degrees C) oven for 4 or 5 hours, or in a slow cooker without the foil or leaves.
', 'Step 12: While the pork is cooking, make the sauce.
', 'Step 13: Bring the red wine vinegar to a boil in a small saucepan.
', 'Step 14: Add onions, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until tender.
', 'Step 15: Pour sauce over pork, and serve with white rice and corn tortillas.
', 'Step 16: Each person can make tacos or fajitas with the pork, the rice and the sauce.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '221.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '10 g', 'cholesterolContent': '60.2 mg', 'fatContent': '11.7 g', 'fiberContent': '1.3 g', 'proteinContent': '19.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '58.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.5 g'}

Title: Lime Cilantro Cauliflower "Rice"

Title: Spicy Bean Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) can black-eyed peas', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '½ cup chopped onion', '½ cup chopped green bell pepper', '1 (4 ounce) can diced jalapeno peppers', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained', '1 cup Italian-style salad dressing', '½ teaspoon garlic salt']

Title: Instant Pot® Refried Beans
Ingredients: ['¼ cup vegetable oil', '1 medium white onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic', '1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '1 pound dried pinto beans', '8 cups water', '2 teaspoons salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 2: Add oil, onion, garlic, and oregano; cook for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add beans and water; stir.
', 'Step 4: Close and lock the lid.
', 'Step 5: Choose high pressure and set timer for 35 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 7: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes.
", 'Step 8: Remove the lid and check a bean; if not yet tender, close and lock the lid and cook another 5 minutes at high pressure.
', 'Step 9: Drain beans, reserving 2 cups of liquid.
', 'Step 10: Return beans to pot and add salt and 1 cup reserved liquid.
', 'Step 11: Puree using a stick blender, adding additional cooking liquid as needed.
', 'Step 12: Keep warm using the slow cooker function.
']

Title: Restaurant-Style Tequila Lime Chicken
Ingredients: ['1 cup water', '⅓ cup teriyaki sauce', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '2 teaspoons minced garlic', '1 teaspoon liquid smoke flavoring', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon tequila', '4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '¼ cup mayonnaise', '¼ cup sour cream', '1 tablespoon milk', '2 teaspoons minced tomato', '1 ½ teaspoons chopped green chile peppers', '1 teaspoon minced onion', '¼ teaspoon dried parsley', '¼ teaspoon hot pepper sauce', '1 pinch salt', '1 pinch dried dill weed', '1 pinch paprika', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '1 pinch ground cumin', '1 pinch chili powder', '1 pinch ground black pepper', '1 cup shredded Cheddar/Monterey Jack cheese blend', '2 cups crumbled corn chips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine water, teriyaki sauce, lime juice, garlic, liquid smoke, salt, ginger, and tequila in a medium nonporous glass bowl and mix all together.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken and turn to coat; cover bowl and refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, make the Mexi-Ranch Dressing: mix mayonnaise, sour cream, milk, tomato, peppers, onion, parsley, hot pepper sauce, salt, dill weed, paprika, cayenne pepper, cumin, chili powder, and ground black pepper in a medium bowl and mix well until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Cover bowl and chill until needed.
', "Step 5: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler, or preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
", 'Step 6: Remove chicken from marinade, discarding any remaining marinade.
', 'Step 7: Grill or broil chicken for 3 to 5 minutes per side, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.
', 'Step 8: Arrange cooked chicken in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Spread a layer of Mexi-Ranch dressing over each piece of chicken, followed by 1/4 cup of cheese blend.
', 'Step 10: Broil in preheated oven for 2 to 3 minutes, or just until cheese has melted.
', 'Step 11: Spread a bed of about 1/2 cup crumbled corn chips or tortilla strips on each of 4 plates.
', 'Step 12: Slide a chicken breast onto the chips on each plate and serve.
']

']

Title: Margarita Cake

Title: Make Ahead Lunch Wraps

Title: Sopapilla Cheesecake
Ingredients: ['1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '1 cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 (8 ounce) packages refrigerated crescent rolls', '½ cup melted butter', '½ cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Prepare a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Beat the cream cheese with 1 cup of sugar and the vanilla extract in a bowl until smooth; set aside.
', 'Step 4: Unroll the cans of crescent roll dough, and use a rolling pin to shape each sheet into 9x13 inch rectangles.
', 'Step 5: Press one sheet into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 6: Evenly spread the cream cheese mixture into the baking dish, then cover with the remaining piece of crescent dough, and brush with melted butter.
', 'Step 7: Stir together 1/2 cup of sugar with the cinnamon in a small bowl, and sprinkle evenly over the top of the cheesecake.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until the crescent dough has puffed and turned golden brown, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Allow to cool 10 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Chef John's Chili Chocolate Cookies
Ingredients: ['½ cup dried currants', '2 tablespoons coffee flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®)', '4 ounces unsweetened chocolate', '2 ounces bittersweet chocolate', '3 tablespoons unsalted butter', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '⅛ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¾ cup sugar', '2 eggs', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '1 cup dark chocolate chips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line two baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.
', 'Step 3: Heat currants and coffee liqueur in a saucepan over low heat until it begins to simmer, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Combine unsweetened chocolate, bittersweet chocolate, and butter in bowl.
', 'Step 6: Place bowl on top of a saucepan filled with 1-inch of water set over low heat.
', 'Step 7: Stir chocolate mixture occasionally until melted, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove from heat and set aside.
', 'Step 9: Mix flour, black pepper, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper in large bowl and set aside.
', 'Step 10: Whisk sugar and eggs in a small bowl until light, fluffy, and pale yellow, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Slowly whisk in vanilla and melted chocolate mixture.
', 'Step 12: Fold flour mixture into sugar and chocolate mixture until combined.
', 'Step 13: Stir in dark chocolate chips and liqueur-soaked currants.
', 'Step 14: Drop spoonfuls of cookie dough 2 inches apart onto prepared baking sheets.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven until cookies are almost set, about 12 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Remove from the oven and leave on baking sheets to cool, 5 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Transfer to cooling rack and allow to finish cooling, 5 minutes.
']

Title: Mexican Brownies
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups unsalted butter', '3 cups white sugar', '6 eggs', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '1 ¼ cups unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '1 ¾ teaspoons ground Mexican cinnamon (canela)', '½ teaspoon ground pequin chile pepper', '¾ teaspoon kosher salt', '¾ teaspoon baking powder']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a 12x15-inch baking pan with parchment paper, leaving about 3 inches of paper overhanging 2 sides to use as handles.
', 'Step 3: Place the butter in a microwave-safe bowl, and cook on Medium until the butter is about half melted, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Mash the butter with sugar until well combined, and stir in eggs one at a time, incorporating each one before adding the next.
', 'Step 5: Mix in vanilla extract.
', 'Step 6: Sift the cocoa, flour, cinnamon, pequin pepper, salt, and baking powder into a bowl.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle in any salt caught in the sifter.
', 'Step 8: Mix the flour mixture into the butter mixture, stirring to blend well, and pour the batter into the prepared baking pan.

', 'Step 10: Let cool in the pan, and use parchment paper handles to remove the brownies for slicing.

Title: Original Mexican Flan Napolitano
Ingredients: ['¼ cup white sugar', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (14 ounce) can evaporated milk', '5 eggs', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place sugar into a 9-inch ring mold and cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until sugar melts and turns golden, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Watch carefully for syrup to start to change color as it burns easily.
', 'Step 3: Let caramel cool and harden, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Combine sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, eggs, cream cheese, and vanilla extract in a blender; blend until smooth, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 5: Pour mixture over the hard caramel syrup in the tin and cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 6: Pierce foil in the center hole of the ring with a knife; peel back foil, leaving hole uncovered for steam to circulate.
', 'Step 7: Place a metal rack inside a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add water to almost reach the rack; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Place the mold on the rack, cover the pot, and steam until flan is set and firm, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Unmold flan onto a serving plate and let cool before serving.
']

Title: 3 Milk Cake or Tres Leches
Ingredients: ['6 eggs, separated', '2 cups white sugar', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '6 tablespoons milk', '¼ cup butter, melted', '4 teaspoons vanilla extract', '4 teaspoons baking powder', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk', '1 cup half-and-half', '1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 cups heavy whipping cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking pan.
', 'Step 3: Beat 6 egg whites in a large bowl with an electric mixer until fluffy; set yolks aside.
', 'Step 4: Gradually beat in sugar until mixture holds soft peaks.
', 'Step 5: Beat in flour gradually, then beat in milk, reserved egg yolks, melted butter, 4 teaspoons vanilla extract, and baking powder, beating in each ingredient thoroughly before adding the next.
', 'Step 6: Pour batter into prepared baking pan.
', 'Step 7: Bake in preheated oven until cake is browned and crusty on top, no more than 30 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Let cake cool in pan for about 10 minutes before gently removing cake to finish cooling.
', 'Step 9: Whisk sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, and half-and-half in a bowl.
', 'Step 10: Pour half the 3-milk mixture into a pan deeper and longer than the cake.
', 'Step 11: Lay the cake into the milk mixture.
', 'Step 12: Use a fork to score deep lines into the top of the cake and pour remaining 3-milk mixture over cake, allowing the mixture to soak in.
', 'Step 13: Beat cream cheese with 1 teaspoon vanilla extract in a bowl with electric mixer until soft and fluffy; gradually beat in cream until frosting is thick and spreadable.
', 'Step 14: Spread over the cake.
']

Title: Double Decker Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix, divided', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '⅔ cup water', '12 prepared crisp taco shells', '2 avocados', '1 tablespoon sour cream', '1 fresh lime, juiced', 'salt and black pepper to taste', '12 (7 inch) flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 cup shredded lettuce', '1 large tomato, chopped', '¼ red onion, chopped', '½ cup sour cream']

['Step 1: Place the ground beef in a skillet over medium heat, and sprinkle about 3/4 of the packet of taco seasoning over the meat.

', 'Step 5: Heat the refried beans over low heat until simmering.

', 'Step 12: Top the cheese with shredded lettuce, a sprinkle of chopped tomato and onion, and a dollop of sour cream and guacamole.
']

Title: Mexican Chicken and Rice Soup (Sopa de Pollo y Arroz)

Title: Tacos in Pasta Shells
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ pounds lean ground beef', '1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '18 jumbo pasta shells', '2 tablespoons butter, melted', '1 cup taco sauce', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 ½ cups crushed tortilla chips', '1 cup sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large skillet, brown beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
', 'Step 2: Add cream cheese, salt and chili powder; mix and simmer for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 4: Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
', 'Step 5: Toss cooked shells in butter.
', 'Step 6: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Fill shells with beef mixture and arrange in a 9x13 inch baking dish; pour taco sauce over shells.
', 'Step 8: Cover with foil and bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove dish from oven and top with Cheddar cheese, Monterey Jack cheese and tortilla chips; return dish to oven to cook for 15 minutes more.

Title: Slow Cooker Tacos al Pastor
Ingredients: ['⅔ large pineapple - peeled, cored, and chopped into small chunks', '1 small white onion, quartered', '1 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, or more to taste', '2 dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded, or more to taste', '1 dried chile de arbol pepper, stemmed and seeded, or more to taste', '3 cloves garlic, halved', '1 tablespoon minced fresh oregano', '½ cup orange juice', '2 tablespoons white vinegar', '2 tablespoons achiote powder', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon lime zest, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground ancho chile powder', '¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 (3 pound) boneless pork loin, cubed', '1 tablespoon canola oil, or more as needed', '20 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '½ cup diced fresh pineapple', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '⅔ white onion, diced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place pineapple, onion, chipotle peppers plus 1 1/2 teaspoons adobo sauce, guajillo chiles, chile de arbol, garlic, and oregano in a food processor.
', 'Step 2: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Transfer to a bowl and add orange juice, vinegar, achiote powder, salt, cumin, lime zest, chile powder, and black pepper.
', 'Step 4: Mix sauce well.
', 'Step 5: Place pork in a slow cooker and cover with the sauce.
', 'Step 6: Cover and cook on Low until pork is very tender, 7 to 9 hours.
', 'Step 7: Begin heating tortillas 35 to 40 minutes before pork is done.
', 'Step 8: Heat oil in a saucepan over high heat.
', 'Step 9: Cook tortillas one at a time until brown spots appear, 30 seconds to 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 10: Plate tortillas in stacks of two for each taco.
', 'Step 11: Shred pork using 2 forks; mix to coat with the sauce.
', 'Step 12: Scoop pork onto tacos using a slotted spoon.
', 'Step 13: Top each with a portion of pineapple, cilantro, and onion.
']

Title: Eggplant Tacos
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil, divided', '1 small onion, chopped', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 cloves fresh garlic, minced', '¼ jalapeno pepper, minced', '1 eggplant, cut into cubes', '2 tablespoons ground cumin', '1 tablespoon paprika', '1 ½ teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', "½ teaspoon seasoned salt (such as Johnny's Seasoning Salt®)", '4 taco shells']

['Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir onion, lemon juice, garlic, and jalapeno pepper into skillet; bring to a simmer and cook until onions soften, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir eggplant, cumin, paprika, chili powder, black pepper, and seasoned salt into onion mixture; drizzle remaining olive oil over the top.
', 'Step 4: Cook, stirring occasionally, until eggplant reduces in size and softens, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Spoon eggplant mixture into tortilla shells.
']

Title: "Skinny" Chicken Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 pound thinly sliced chicken breasts, cut into thin strips', '3 limes, juiced, divided', '2 teaspoons ground cumin, divided', '2 teaspoons garlic powder, divided', '2 teaspoons ground chipotle pepper, divided', '2 red bell peppers, cut into thin strips', '1 red onion, thinly sliced', '2 jalapeno peppers - stemmed, seeded, and thinly sliced', '4 multi-grain tortillas, or more to taste', '1 bunch cilantro, chopped']

', 'Step 2: Saute red bell peppers, onion, jalapeno peppers, juice of 1 lime, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, and 1 teaspoon chipotle pepper in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat until vegetables are tender yet crisp, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer chicken mixture to a separate non-stick skillet over medium-high heat; saute until chicken is no longer pink in the center, 5 to 10 minutes.

Title: Pico de Gallo Chicken Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['2 tomatoes, diced', '1 onion, finely chopped', '2 limes, juiced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', 'salt and pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into strips', '½ onion, thinly sliced', '1 green bell pepper, thinly sliced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '4 (12 inch) flour tortillas', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '¼ cup sour cream, for topping']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a small bowl, combine tomatoes, onion, lime juice, cilantro, jalapeno, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 2: Set pico de gallo aside.
', 'Step 3: In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil.
', 'Step 4: Add chicken and saute until cooked through and juices run clear.
', 'Step 5: Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
', 'Step 6: Put the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in the hot skillet and saute the sliced onion and green pepper until tender.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the minced garlic and saute until the aroma is strong.
', 'Step 8: Mix in half of the pico de gallo and chicken breast meat.
', 'Step 9: Set aside; keep warm.
', 'Step 10: In a heavy skillet, heat one flour tortilla.
', 'Step 11: Spread 1/4 cup shredded cheese on the tortilla and top with 1/2 the chicken mixture.
', 'Step 12: Sprinkle another 1/4 cup cheese over the chicken and top with another tortilla.
', 'Step 13: When bottom tortilla is lightly brown and cheese has started to melt, flip quesadilla and cook on the opposite side.
', 'Step 14: Remove quesadilla from skillet and cut into quarters.
', 'Step 15: Repeat with remaining ingredients.
', 'Step 16: Serve quesadillas with sour cream and remaining pico de gallo.
']

Title: Chicken Taquitos
Ingredients: ['4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cooked and shredded', '1 ½ cups shredded smoked Cheddar and Swiss cheese blend', '1 (7 ounce) can green salsa', '1 cup chopped onion', '20 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 quart peanut oil for frying, or as needed', '1 cup sour cream', '1 cup chunky salsa', '1 cup guacamole']

['Step 1: Heat oil in a deep-fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a medium bowl, mix together the shredded chicken, cheese, green salsa, and onion.

', 'Step 4: Filling should not come to close to the ends, or it will fall out.
', 'Step 5: Secure rolls with toothpicks.
', 'Step 6: Fry rolls 4 or 5 at a time so there is enough room between them for even cooking.
', 'Step 7: Cook for 3 to 5 minutes, or until golden brown.
', 'Step 8: Once they float, I leave them in for about another minute.
', "Step 9: If the taquitos are not crisp when cool, you haven't cooked them long enough.
", 'Step 10: Drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 11: Serve with sour cream, salsa and guacamole for dipping.

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil, then spray with cooking spray.

Title: Delicious Beef Tongue Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 beef tongue', '½ white onion, sliced', '5 cloves garlic, crushed', '1 bay leaf', 'salt to taste', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '5 Roma tomatoes', '5 serrano peppers', 'salt to taste', '½ onion, diced', '2 (10 ounce) packages corn tortillas']

['Step 1: Place the beef tongue in a slow cooker and cover with water.
', 'Step 2: Add the onion slices, garlic, and bay leaf.
', 'Step 3: Season with salt.
', 'Step 4: Cover and cook on Low overnight or 8 hours.
', 'Step 5: Remove the tongue and shred the meat into strands.
', 'Step 6: Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Cook the tomatoes and peppers in the hot oil until softened on all sides.
', 'Step 8: Remove the tomatoes and peppers in a blender, keeping the oil on the heat; season with salt.

', 'Step 10: Cook the diced onion in the skillet until translucent; stir in the tomato mixture.
', 'Step 11: Cook another 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Build the tacos by placing shredded tongue meat into a tortilla and spooning salsa over the meat.
']

Title: Easy Frozen Margaritas
Ingredients: ['2 quarts ice cubes', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate', '12 fluid ounces tequila (measure with empty limeade can)', '¼ cup Cointreau', 'margarita or kosher salt for the rims', 'lime slices cut in half']

', 'Step 2: Add 1/2 can limeade, 6 ounces tequila and 2 tablespoons Cointreau.
', 'Step 3: Blend at highest speed until drink is almost smooth.
', 'Step 4: Pour into a pitcher and repeat with remaining ingredients.
', 'Step 5: Store in the freezer.

', 'Step 7: Moisten each glass rim with lime; dip each rim in the salt.

', 'Step 9: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Street-Market Fried Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['1 ½ teaspoons olive oil', '¼ cup chopped onion', '½ red bell pepper, finely chopped', '¼ cup frozen corn kernels, thawed', '1 serrano chile pepper, seeded and diced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 (15 ounce) can HORMEL® Mary Kitchen® Roast Beef Hash', '1 canned chipotle chile in adobo sauce, minced, or more to taste', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil for frying, or as needed', '8 corn tortillas', '1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese', '¼ cup chopped onion', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 cup salsa', '½ cup sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add olive oil.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir onions and red bell pepper until starting to soften, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add corn and serrano pepper; cook 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add garlic and cook 1 minute more.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat to medium-low.
', 'Step 7: Add HORMEL® MARY KITCHEN® Roast Beef Hash and chipotle pepper.
', 'Step 8: Cook until the hash is heated and well mixed with the rest of the ingredients, about 2 or 3 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Heat tortillas in a skillet, turning once, until they are soft and can be folded without breaking.
', 'Step 10: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Spoon 2 tablespoons of the hash filling and 1 1/2 tablespoons of mozzarella cheese on each tortilla.
', 'Step 12: Fold tortillas in half.
', 'Step 13: Fry in vegetable oil until quesadillas are golden and crispy, about 3 minutes on each side.
', 'Step 14: Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
', 'Step 15: Mix cilantro and onions together in a small bowl.
', 'Step 16: Serve the quesadillas with salsa, sour cream, onions, and cilantro.
', 'Step 17: Enjoy!
']

Title: Super Easy Slow Cooker Chicken Enchilada Meat
Ingredients: ['2 cups chicken broth', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '⅓ cup chili powder', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '1 clove garlic', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon oregano', '1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or more to taste', '4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves']

Title: Carne con Chile
Ingredients: ['20 fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '2 large tomatoes, chopped', '7 serrano chile peppers, chopped (wear gloves)', '10 fresh chile de arbol peppers, chopped (wear gloves)', '5 cloves garlic, divided', 'salt to taste', '2 pounds pork stew meat, coarsely chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the tomatillos, tomatoes, serrano peppers, chile de arbol peppers, and 3 whole garlic cloves into a saucepan over medium-low heat, and cool until the mixture is juicy and the peppers are tender, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove and discard the garlic cloves.
', 'Step 3: Pour the mixture into a blender, and blend until smooth, about 1 minute; set sauce aside.
', 'Step 4: Mince 1 clove of garlic, or amount to taste, and mix into the sauce; season to taste with salt.
', 'Step 5: Mince 1 more clove of garlic, and place into a skillet with the pork over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Cook covered until the pork is no longer pink and the juices run clear, stirring often, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Pour the blended sauce over the meat, and reduce heat to a simmer; cook, stirring often, until the pork is tender, 5 to 10 more minutes.
']

Title: Mexican Grilled Corn
Ingredients: ['½ cup mayonnaise', '1 lime, juiced', '1 tablespoon ground ancho chile pepper', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '8 ears corn on the cob, husked', '¼ cup butter, melted, or as needed', '½ cup freshly grated Cotija cheese', '1 pinch salt to taste', '1 lime, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Combine mayonnaise, lime juice, ancho chile powder, and smoked paprika in a bowl; whisk until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 4: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Boil corn in the salted water for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Drain the corn.
', 'Step 7: Place ears of corn on hot grill and cook until the kernels begin to brown and caramelize, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Turn the corn and continue to cook, turning ears after 1 to 2 minutes, until they are browned with slightly charred, caramelized spots.
', 'Step 9: Generously brush corn with melted butter and ancho-lime mayonnaise until kernels are coated.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle ears with Cotija cheese and salt.
', 'Step 11: Garnish with slices of lime.
']

Title: Mexican-Inspired Chicken Thigh and Rice Skillet
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', '1 teaspoon granulated garlic', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '¼ teaspoon ground coriander', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '1 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs', '1 tablespoon unsalted butter', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 cup chopped onion', '1 medium red bell pepper, chopped', '½ medium green bell pepper, chopped', '1 ½ cups long grain white rice, uncooked', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®), liquid drained and reserved', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can low-sodium chicken broth', '½ cup water', '1 ½ cups frozen green peas, thawed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine salt, granulated garlic, cumin, paprika, coriander, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper in a small bowl.
', 'Step 2: Pat chicken thighs dry with paper towels.
', 'Step 3: Sprinkle seasoning mix evenly over both sides of chicken thighs.
', 'Step 4: Combine butter and olive oil in a deep-sided, 11-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat; cook until butter is melted and foamy.
', 'Step 5: Swirl the butter and oil together and place chicken thighs in the skillet in a single layer.
', 'Step 6: Cook until just brown, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
', 'Step 7: Remove from the pan with tongs and set aside.
', 'Step 8: Keep warm.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to medium and add onion and bell peppers to the skillet.
', 'Step 10: Cook, stirring often, until the onion starts to turn translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Stir in rice and chili powder; cook and stir until rice begins to pick up some color, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Stir in drained tomatoes and garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute.
', 'Step 13: Add reserved tomato liquid, chicken broth, and water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 14: Adjust salt and pepper if necessary.
', 'Step 15: Place browned chicken thighs on top of the rice mixture; do not submerge.
', 'Step 16: Cover, reduce heat to low, and cook for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Remove cover, increase heat to medium, and gently stir in thawed peas.
', 'Step 18: Cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 19: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 20: Serve warm.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '425.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '49.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '76.2 mg', 'fatContent': '13 g', 'fiberContent': '4 g', 'proteinContent': '26.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4 g', 'sodiumContent': '722 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.5 g'}

Title: Impossible™ Burger Street Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 (12 ounce) package meatless vegetarian ground beef', '1 small yellow onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ½ tablespoons salt', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', 'nonstick canola oil spray', '6 medium soft flour tortillas', '1 large tomato, diced', '½ cup crumbled queso fresco', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste', '2 medium limes, cut into wedges']

['Step 1: Heat a skillet over medium heat.

Title: Mexican Style Corn
Ingredients: ['4 ears corn on the cob, husks and silk removed', "¼ cup mayonnaise (such as Hellmann's®/Best Foods®), or to taste - divided", '¼ cup margarine in a squeezable container, or to taste - divided', '¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese, or to taste - divided', '1 teaspoon chili powder, or to taste - divided']

', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to low and simmer until corn is very tender, 20 to 25 minutes.

Title: Spicy Albondigas
Ingredients: ['2 pounds ground beef', '1 egg', '¼ cup bread crumbs', '½ cup uncooked white rice', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '10 cups chicken broth', '4 carrots, sliced', '½ large onion, chopped', '4 stalks celery, sliced', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (7 ounce) can diced green chiles, drained', '1 bunch cilantro leaves, chopped', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '2 teaspoons ground cumin']

['Step 1: Combine ground beef, egg, bread crumbs, rice, cumin, garlic powder, and salt in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Mix well.
', 'Step 3: Bring chicken broth to a boil over medium heat in a large kettle.
', 'Step 4: Form the beef mixture into 1 inch meatballs, using about 1 1/2 tablespoons of meat for each.
', 'Step 5: Turn the heat down under the chicken broth to a simmer and drop the meatballs into the broth.

Title: Creamy Cheddar Beef Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 cup white rice', '1 ½ cups water', '1 pound ground beef', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning', '1 cup water', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '1 cup cottage cheese', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '10 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 (7.75 ounce) can red enchilada sauce', '1 cup sour cream', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring rice and 1 1/2 cup water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is almost tender and the liquid has been absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Grease 2 9x13-inch baking dishes.
', 'Step 5: Cook beef in a large skillet over medium heat, breaking it up as it cooks, until crumbly and browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Drain excess grease and stir in onion and garlic until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 7: Stir taco seasoning and 1 cup water into the mixture, bring to a boil, and reduce heat to low; simmer 5 minutes to thicken.
', 'Step 8: Gently stir in rice.
', 'Step 9: Cook, stirring often, until liquid is absorbed.
', 'Step 10: Mix refried beans, cottage cheese, and 1 cup Cheddar cheese into the filling and stir until fully combined.
', 'Step 11: Spread about 1/2 cup of filling in a line down the center of each tortilla and roll tortillas; place 5 tortillas with seam sides down into bottom of each prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 12: Mix enchilada sauce with sour cream in a bowl and pour half the sauce down the center of each pan of enchiladas; sprinkle tops with 1 cup Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese topping is melted and the filling is hot, 20 to 25 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '550.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '57.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '68.3 mg', 'fatContent': '23.3 g', 'fiberContent': '4.8 g', 'proteinContent': '25.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '11.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '956.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '2 g'}

Title: Old-School Tamale Pie
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds lean ground beef', '1 cup chopped onion', '½ cup chopped green bell pepper', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 cup frozen corn', '1 (2.25 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes, or to taste', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 ½ cups milk', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ cup cornmeal', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '2 eggs, lightly beaten', '1 tablespoon sour cream, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir ground beef, onion, and bell pepper in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 6: Stir tomatoes, tomato sauce, corn, olives, chili powder, garlic, cumin, salt, red pepper flakes, and black pepper into the skillet.
', 'Step 7: Bring to a low boil, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to medium-low and let simmer for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir in 1 cup Cheddar cheese and continue to simmer until melted, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Remove from heat and transfer mixture to the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 11: Heat milk, butter, sugar, and salt for topping in a large saucepan over medium heat until butter has melted, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Reduce heat to low and stir in cornmeal a little at a time, stirring vigorously with each addition, until smooth and thickened.
', 'Step 13: Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 14: Drizzle in beaten eggs slowly, stirring vigorously until combined.
', 'Step 15: Pour mixture over filling in the prepared dish, smoothing evenly over the surface.
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown and filling is bubbly, 30 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Allow pie to rest for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Spicy Beef and Bean Enchilada Pie
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '½ cup diced onion', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (15 ounce) can Tex Mex-style diced tomatoes', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '1 (20 ounce) can refried black beans', '2 (10 ounce) cans red enchilada sauce (such as Old El Paso®)', '2 cups shredded pepperjack cheese', '2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '6 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '½ cup sour cream, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir ground beef and onions in a large skillet over medium-high heat until meat is browned and crumbly, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 4: Stir in diced tomatoes, green chiles, cilantro, and taco seasoning mix.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 6: Mix black beans and 1 can red enchilada sauce in a bowl until creamy.
', 'Step 7: Mix pepperjack cheese and Monterey Jack cheese together in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 8: Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 9: Cook tortillas, one at a time, until slightly crisp, about 15 seconds per side.
', 'Step 10: Place one tortilla on the bottom of an 8-inch springform pan.
', 'Step 11: Spread a generous layer of black bean mixture on top of tortilla, then spread a layer of ground beef mixture on top.
', 'Step 12: Sprinkle 1 cup of cheese mixture on top of meat mixture and pour 1/4 cup red enchilada sauce over the top.
', 'Step 13: Repeat the tortilla, bean, meat, cheese, and sauce layering process, finishing with cheese and enchilada sauce on top.
', 'Step 14: Cover pan with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven until cheese is bubbling and enchiladas are cooked through, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Cool for 15 minutes and serve with sour cream.
']

Title: Tacos De Matamoros
Ingredients: ['2 pounds ground chuck', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '2 tablespoons paprika', '1 ½ teaspoons cumin', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '½ medium green bell pepper, chopped', '½ medium onion, chopped', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '12 ounces queso asadero (white Mexican cheese)', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '1 large tomato, diced', '2 cups shredded lettuce']

['Step 1: Place the ground chuck in a large skillet, and season with chili powder, paprika, cumin, salt, garlic powder, and garlic.

', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to low, and simmer 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Add more water as necessary during cook time, and break the meat into small pieces.
', 'Step 6: Mix the bell pepper and onion into the skillet, and continue to simmer 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Drain and reserve juices.
', 'Step 8: Skim the fat off the juices(or, if not preparing the tacos right away, place juices in the freezer until fat may be easily removed from the top).
', 'Step 9: Mix 5 tablespoons of the remaining juices back into the skillet with the beef, and cook until heated through.

Title: Stuffed Poblano Peppers
Ingredients: ['4 medium fresh poblano peppers', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 medium onion, diced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 pound lean ground beef', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '4 thin slices Cheddar cheese, cut into strips', '4 thin slices Monterey Jack cheese, cut into strips', '1 (15 ounce) can enchilada sauce (such as Hatch®)', '¼ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Turn a gas stove burner to high.
', 'Step 2: Hold poblano peppers directly on the flame with a pair of tongs and turn until skins are charred.
', 'Step 3: Let peppers cool.
', 'Step 4: Leaving peppers as close to whole as possible, remove skins, seeds, membranes, and stems.
', 'Step 5: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat; stir in onion and garlic.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add ground beef; cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Mix in chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 9: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Place peppers in a nonstick casserole dish.
', 'Step 11: Insert a slice of Cheddar cheese and a slice of Monterey Jack cheese into each pepper.
', 'Step 12: Spoon some ground beef mixture into each pepper.
', 'Step 13: Place the remaining beef on top of the peppers, and cover with enchilada sauce.
', 'Step 14: Cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Remove the foil and sprinkle shredded Cheddar cheese on top of the peppers.
', 'Step 17: Bake until peppers are bubbly and fragrant, another 45 minutes.
']

Title: Marranitos (Mexican Pig-Shaped Cookies)
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ cups packed brown sugar', '¼ cup shortening', '1 egg', '¼ cup milk', '1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract', '1 ½ teaspoons baking soda', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon', '1 cup unsulfured molasses', '6 cups all-purpose flour', '1 egg, beaten']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line cookie sheets with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: In a large bowl, cream together brown sugar and shortening until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Mix in 1 egg, milk, and vanilla until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the baking soda, cinnamon, and molasses.
', 'Step 6: Mix in flour until the dough is stiff enough to roll out.
', 'Step 7: Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness.
', 'Step 8: Cut into cookies using a pig shaped cookie cutter.
', 'Step 9: Place cookies 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets.
', 'Step 10: Brush the remaining beaten egg over the tops of the cookies.
', 'Step 11: Bake for 15 to 17 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the centers of the cookies appear dry and edges are lightly browned.
']

Title: Chiles en Nogada (Mexican Stuffed Poblano Peppers in Walnut Sauce)
Ingredients: ['8 poblano peppers', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', '1 ¾ pounds ground pork', '2 cups peeled, seeded, and chopped tomatoes', '1 ripe plantain, chopped', '1 apple, chopped', '1 fresh peach, chopped', '1 bunch fresh parsley, chopped', '2 tablespoons chopped candied orange peel', '2 tablespoons pine nuts', '2 tablespoons raisins', '2 tablespoons blanched almonds, chopped', '4 whole cloves, ground', 'salt and pepper to taste', '2 ½ cups chopped walnuts', '1 ¾ cups milk', '¾ cup soft goat cheese', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 (1 inch) piece cinnamon stick', '1 ½ cups pomegranate seeds', '½ cup chopped fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Roast poblano chiles over an open flame on a gas stove or grill until the skin is black and charred on all sides, turning often, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Place the charred chiles in a plastic bag or in a large bowl covered with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 3: Allow to sit for 5 to 10 minutes, then open and peel off the skin.
', 'Step 4: Cut a slit in each chile lengthwise and remove the seeds.
', 'Step 5: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Add onion and garlic and cook until soft and translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add ground pork and cook until browned, breaking up with a spoon while cooking, about 7 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Mix in tomatoes, plantain, apple, peach, parsley, candied orange peel, pine nuts, raisins, almonds, cloves, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 9: Simmer until filling is cooked through and flavors are well combined, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Combine walnuts, milk, goat cheese, sugar, and cinnamon stick in a blender; blend until walnut sauce is smooth and creamy.
', 'Step 11: Fill each poblano chile with the pork filling and place on a plate.
', 'Step 12: Spoon walnut sauce over chile and sprinkle with pomegranate seeds and parsley.
']

Title: Mom's Mexican Cornbread
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 cup cornmeal', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 cup milk', '1 egg', '1 onion, chopped', '1 (14.5 ounce) can cream-style corn', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '2 jalapeno peppers, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Coat a 9X12 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large skillet over medium heat; cook the ground beef in the skillet until no longer pink.
', 'Step 4: Set aside.
', 'Step 5: In a large bowl, stir together the cornmeal, salt, and baking soda.
', 'Step 6: Mix in milk, egg, onion, corn, Cheddar cheese, and jalapeno pepper.
', 'Step 7: Stir in browned beef.
', 'Step 8: Pour into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 1 hour.
']

Title: Taco Pizza
Ingredients: ['10 fluid ounces warm water', '¾ teaspoon salt', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '4 cups all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons active dry yeast', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '¾ cup water', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix, divided', '1 teaspoon chili powder, or to taste', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 (16 ounce) can fat-free refried beans', '⅓ cup salsa', '¼ cup chopped onion', '½ pound ground beef', '4 cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Add the water, salt, oil, flour and yeast to your bread machine in the order listed.
', 'Step 2: Select the dough cycle.
', 'Step 3: Check your dough after it has been mixing a few minutes.
', 'Step 4: If it is too dry and not mixing, add water 1 tablespoon at a time, until it is mixing and has a nice dough consistency.
', 'Step 5: You want the dough to be pliable but not sticky.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine tomato paste, water, and 3/4 of the package of taco seasoning mix.
', 'Step 7: Stir in chili powder and cayenne pepper; set aside.
', 'Step 8: In another bowl, mix refried beans, salsa, and onion; set aside.
', 'Step 9: In a large skillet, cook ground beef until evenly brown; drain excess fat.
', 'Step 10: Season with the remaining 1/4 package of taco seasoning and a small amount of water.
', 'Step 11: Simmer a few minutes, then remove from heat.
', 'Step 12: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: When the dough cycle is finished, remove the dough from the machine.
', 'Step 14: Divide the dough in half, and pat into two 12 inch pans.
', 'Step 15: Spread a layer of the bean mixture on, then a layer of the tomato mixture.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle with seasoned beef and top with cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 17: Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted.
', 'Step 18: Turn pizzas halfway through baking.
']

Title: Pork Stew in Green Salsa (Guisado de Puerco con Tomatillos)
Ingredients: ['½ cup all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 (3 pound) boneless pork shoulder roast, trimmed of excess fat and cut into 1-inch cubes', '2 tablespoons olive oil, or more if needed', '1 large onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '2 cups chopped fresh tomatillos', '1 (7 ounce) can diced green chiles, drained', '2 fresh jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped', '2 teaspoons dried marjoram', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 cup water', '1 pinch salt, or to taste', '2 tablespoons sour cream, divided', '6 sprigs cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Stir together the flour, 1 teaspoon salt, pepper, and cumin in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Place the cubed pork into the mixture, and stir well to coat the meat with the seasonings.
', 'Step 3: Heat the olive oil in a large, heavy pan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat until the oil shimmers.
', 'Step 4: Working in batches if necessary, place the meat into the hot pan in a single layer.
', 'Step 5: Pan-fry the pork until brown on all sides, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove the pork to a bowl, and cover to keep warm.
', 'Step 7: Cook and stir the onion in the hot pan over medium heat, adding more olive oil if necessary, until the onion is translucent and beginning to brown, about 7 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Return the meat to the pan and stir in the garlic, tomatillos, chiles, marjoram, chopped cilantro, and water.
', 'Step 9: Check seasoning and add 1 pinch of salt to taste, if needed.
', 'Step 10: Cover and simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the meat is tender, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 11: Skim excess fat off the stew before serving in bowls, garnished with a dollop of sour cream and a cilantro sprig on each bowl.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '346.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '18 g', 'cholesterolContent': '87.5 mg', 'fatContent': '16.1 g', 'fiberContent': '3.1 g', 'proteinContent': '32 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '839.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '5 g'}

Title: "Pantry Raid" Chicken Enchilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce', '¼ cup water', '1 envelope taco seasoning mix', '1 ½ tablespoons chili powder', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 pound chicken breast tenderloins', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained', '¼ cup cream cheese', '1 cup shredded Mexican-style cheese blend, or more to taste', '1 (7.5 ounce) package corn bread mix', '1 egg', '⅓ cup milk']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9x9-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Mix tomato sauce, water, taco seasoning mix, and chili powder together in a saucepan; bring to a simmer over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat and brown chicken tenderloins on both sides, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 5: Pour tomato sauce mixture over the chicken, bring to a simmer, and cook over medium-low heat until chicken tenderloins are no longer pink inside, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Transfer chicken to a bowl and shred; return shredded chicken to the sauce.
', 'Step 7: Mix in black beans and cream cheese until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 8: Pour chicken mixture into prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Top with shredded Mexican cheese.
', 'Step 10: Whisk corn bread mix, egg, and milk in a bowl, and spoon the batter over the chicken mix.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until the casserole is bubbling and the corn bread topping is browned and set, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Shredded Chicken Tacos
Ingredients: ['2 (8 ounce) cans Goya Tomato Sauce', '2 teaspoons Goya White Distilled Vinegar', '2 teaspoons Goya Minced Garlic', '3 ½ teaspoons ancho chile powder', '1 teaspoon Goya Ground Cumin', '2 teaspoons Goya Oregano Leaf', '½ teaspoon sugar', '2 tablespoons Goya Extra Virgin Olive Oil', '2 pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken breasts', '1 pinch Goya Adobo with Pepper, to taste', '1 (10 ounce) package Goya Corn Tortillas, warmed', '¼ cup finely chopped white onion', '1 lime, cut into wedges', '2 tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh cilantro', '1 dash Goya Hot Sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In medium bowl, mix together tomato sauce, vinegar, garlic, chili powder, cumin, oregano, and sugar.
', 'Step 2: Season with Adobo; set aside.
', 'Step 3: Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Season chicken with Adobo.
', 'Step 5: Cook chicken, turning once, until light golden brown on both sides, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add reserved tomato sauce mixture to pan; bring to a boil (be careful, the tomato sauce can splatter).
', 'Step 7: Lower heat to medium low.
', 'Step 8: Simmer, covered, until cooked through (thermometer will register 170 degrees F when inserted into thickest part of breast), flipping once, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Transfer chicken to cutting board; reserve sauce in pan.
', 'Step 10: Remove and discard bones and skin.
', 'Step 11: Using two forks, shred chicken breast.
', 'Step 12: Transfer chicken to skillet with sauce, mixing to combine; continue to cook until sauce reduces and blends into chicken, and mixture begins to caramelize, about 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 13: Transfer chicken mixture to serving bowl.
', 'Step 14: Spoon into warmed corn tortillas.
', 'Step 15: Garnish with lettuce, tomatoes, avocados and/or onions, if desired.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle with hot sauce, if desired.
']

Title: Jalapeno Popper Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['6 jalapeno peppers - stemmed, seeded, and halved lengthwise', '1 tablespoon butter, softened', '2 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '2 tablespoons cream cheese, softened', '½ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '3 tortilla chips, crushed, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Arrange jalapeno peppers, cut-side down, on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Broil jalapeno peppers in the preheated oven until skins are bubbling and blackened, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Immediately place peppers in a resealable plastic bag; seal.
', 'Step 6: Allow peppers to steam in bag to help loosen skins, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Carefully open bag, pull skins off peppers, and chop peppers.
', 'Step 8: Spread half the butter onto 1 side of each tortilla.
', 'Step 9: Spread half the cream cheese onto the other side of each tortilla.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle half the jalapeno peppers, half the Mexican cheese blend, and half the tortilla chips over the cream cheese-side of each tortilla.
', 'Step 11: Fold each tortilla in half over the fillings with butter-side on the outside.
', 'Step 12: Heat a skillet over medium-low heat; cook 1 quesadilla in the hot skillet until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 13: Repeat with second quesadilla.
']

Title: Big Ray's Mexican Monkey Bread
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 tablespoons butter, melted', '1 (16.3 ounce) package refrigerated buttermilk biscuit dough, separated and each portion cut into quarters', '1 ¼ cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '¾ cup jalapeno pepper slices, divided', '¾ teaspoon dried parsley flakes, divided', '¼ cup shredded mozzarella cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Prepare a 9x5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Pour melted butter into a small bowl.
', 'Step 4: Dip each piece of biscuit dough in melted butter to coat.
', 'Step 5: Arrange enough of the biscuit dough pieces in the bottom of the loaf pan to form a single layer; top with 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese, 1/4 cup pepper slices, and 1/4 teaspoon parsley.
', 'Step 6: Repeat layering once and top with remaining biscuit dough pieces, pepper slices, and parsley flakes.
', 'Step 7: Mix remaining 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese and mozzarella cheese together in a bowl; spread over the top of the ingredients to cover.
', 'Step 8: Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Cool bread in pan for 5 minutes before inverting onto a plate to serve.
']

Title: Enchilada Casserole III
Ingredients: ['1 (1.5 ounce) package dry enchilada sauce mix', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '¾ cup water', '1 ½ pounds ground beef', '1 teaspoon garlic salt', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '1 (12 ounce) package corn tortillas', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese']

Title: Taco Salad with Lime Vinegar Dressing
Ingredients: ['1 pound lean ground beef', '¾ cup water', '1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix', '1 head romaine lettuce, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (10 ounce) basket grape tomatoes, chopped', '1 avocado, pitted and sliced', '½ cup chopped carrots, or to taste', '½ cup chopped green bell pepper, or to taste', '½ cup chopped celery, or to taste', '¼ cup shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste', '¼ cup lime juice', '3 tablespoons honey', '2 tablespoons champagne vinegar', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste', '2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', '3 cloves garlic, minced', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']

Title: Paella
Ingredients: ['5 (4 ounce) links hot Italian sausage, cut into 1 inch pieces', '5 (4 ounce) links mild Italian sausage, cut into 1 inch pieces', '15 raw chicken tenders or strips', '2 pounds large shrimp - peeled and deveined', '1 onion, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, seeded and cut into strips', '1 large stalk celery, with leaves, finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 cups uncooked long grain rice', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans peeled and diced tomatoes, juice reserved', '2 bay leaves', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '¾ teaspoon ground turmeric', '3 ½ cups chicken broth']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a wok over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Fry hot and mild Italian sausage pieces in the wok until brown on all sides.
', 'Step 3: Remove sausage, and fry the chicken strips in the sausage drippings until browned.
', 'Step 4: Remove chicken and saute onions, green pepper, celery, and garlic for 5 minutes, or until tender.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the uncooked rice, tomatoes, bay leaves, salt, oregano and turmeric.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir for 1 minute, then mix in the reserved tomato juice and chicken broth.
', 'Step 7: Add chicken pieces, cover and simmer for about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add sausage to the mixture, and continue to simmer for 15 minutes, then stir in the shrimp; cover and cook for 5 to 10 more minutes, or until shrimp is cooked through.
']

Title: Chilaquiles II

', 'Step 2: Carefully stir in the onion and tortilla strips.

Title: Whit's Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['4 bone-in chicken breast halves', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers, drained', '1 jalapeno pepper, chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese', '2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '½ cup water', '8 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '1 cup heavy cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the chicken breast halves into a saucepan, and fill with enough water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, and cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from the water, and set aside to cool.

', 'Step 5: Remove the chicken meat from the breasts, and discard the skin and bones.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add the green chilies, jalapeno and garlic.

', 'Step 10: As the cheese begins to melt, gradually stir in the water.
', 'Step 11: Chop the chicken meat, and stir into the skillet.
', 'Step 12: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 13: Spoon the chicken mixture into tortillas, and roll up.
', 'Step 14: Place the rolls seam side down in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 15: Sprinkle the remaining Monterey Jack cheese over the top, then pour cream over all.
', 'Step 16: Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the enchiladas are golden brown on the top.
']

Title: Real Texas Chili
Ingredients: ['3 pounds boneless beef chuck roast - cut into 1 inch cubes', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '3 tablespoons chili powder', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '2 (14 ounce) cans beef broth, divided', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper']

', 'Step 2: Saute the beef cubes in the oil for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium and stir in the garlic.
', 'Step 4: In a small bowl, combine the chili powder, cumin and flour.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle over the meat and stir until evenly coated.
', 'Step 6: Crumble the oregano over the meat and pour in 1 1/2 cans of the broth.
', 'Step 7: Add the salt and ground black pepper, stir together well, bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and let simmer, partially covered for about 90 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Pour in remaining broth and simmer 30 minutes more, until meat begins to fall apart.
', 'Step 9: Cool, cover and refrigerate to allow the flavors to blend.
']

Title: Chicken Taco Filling

', 'Step 4: Shred chicken to serve.

Title: Menudo Rojo (Red Menudo)
Ingredients: ['3 gallons water, divided', '2 ½ pounds beef tripe, cut into 1-inch pieces', '6 cloves garlic, finely chopped', '1 large white onion, finely chopped', '1 ½ tablespoons salt', '1 tablespoon ground black pepper', '1 ½ tablespoons dried oregano', '2 tablespoons ground red pepper', '5 de arbol chile peppers', '6 japones chile peppers, seeds removed', '6 cups canned white or yellow hominy, drained', '½ white onion, chopped', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 limes, juiced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large pot, bring 1 gallon water to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Place tripe in the pot, reduce heat, and simmer 2 hours.
', 'Step 3: Periodically skim off fat with a spoon.
', 'Step 4: Drain water, reduce heat, and pour in a fresh gallon of water.
', 'Step 5: Continue to simmer tripe for 2 hours; drain.
', 'Step 6: Pour remaining 1 gallon water into the pot with tripe, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Stir in garlic and 1 white onion.
', 'Step 8: Season with salt, pepper, oregano, and red pepper.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat, and simmer 1 hour.
', 'Step 10: Preheat the broiler.
', 'Step 11: Arrange the de arbol chile peppers on a baking sheet, and broil about 2 minutes, just until they begin to scorch.
', 'Step 12: Remove from heat, slit lengthwise, and remove seeds.
', 'Step 13: In a blender or food processor, blend the de arbol chile peppers and japones chile peppers until very finely chopped.
', 'Step 14: Mix into the pot, and continue cooking 2 hours over low heat.
', 'Step 15: Mix the hominy into the pot.
', 'Step 16: Continue cooking 1 hour.
', 'Step 17: Serve with remaining onion, cilantro, and lime juice.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '225.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '31.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '139.2 mg', 'fatContent': '5.3 g', 'fiberContent': '6 g', 'proteinContent': '14.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '1679.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.6 g'}

Title: Mexican Shepherd's Pie
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds ground beef', '1 onion, finely chopped', 'garlic powder to taste', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '¾ cup hot water', '1 (11 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (8.5 ounce) package corn muffin mix', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (2.25 ounce) can sliced black olives']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Place the beef and onion in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook until beef is evenly brown and onion is tender.
', 'Step 5: Drain grease.
', 'Step 6: Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Mix in the tomatoes, and cook 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the taco seasoning and water.
', 'Step 9: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and continue cooking 5 minutes, until thickened.
', 'Step 10: Transfer to the prepared baking dish, and top evenly with corn.
', 'Step 11: Prepare the corn muffin mix according to package directions.
', 'Step 12: Spread evenly over the corn layer in the baking dish.
', 'Step 13: Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until puffed and golden.
', 'Step 14: Garnish with olives and cheese.
']

Title: Baked Taco Dip
Ingredients: ['1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, at room temperature', '1 pound lean ground beef', '1 cup water', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 ½ cups salsa', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spread cream cheese in an even layer in the bottom of an 8x8-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir beef in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned and cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add water and taco seasoning mix; stir.
', 'Step 5: Simmer until most of the liquid evaporates, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Spread meat mixture over the cream cheese in the baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Pour salsa over meat mixture.
', 'Step 8: Top with Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 9: Bake taco dip in preheated oven until bubbling and cheese is melted, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Mexican Chicken Taco Casserole
Ingredients: ['nonstick cooking spray', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 pound ground chicken', '1 medium onion, diced', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '2 teaspoons cumin', '2 teaspoons garlic powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained', '1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (15 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 (14 ounce) can tomato sauce', '7 (6 inch) flour tortillas, or as needed', '2 cups shredded Mexican blend cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray and set aside.
', 'Step 3: Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium to medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Add ground chicken and onion.
', 'Step 5: Cook, stirring occasionally to break up the meat, until onion is mostly tender and meat is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Season with chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, and salt.
', 'Step 7: Add black beans, corn, tomatoes, and tomato sauce; stir until well combined.
', 'Step 8: Bring mixture to a low simmer and cook for about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Taste mixture and adjust the seasonings as desired.
', 'Step 10: Spoon a couple of good-sized scoops of meat mixture onto the bottom of the prepared casserole dish, and spread into a thin layer.
', 'Step 11: Lay about half of the tortillas over the sauce, breaking them in half as needed to make a fairly even layer without too much overlap.
', 'Step 12: Add remaining meat mixture over the tortilla layer.
', 'Step 13: Top with remaining tortillas, again breaking into pieces as necessary to evenly cover the surface.
', 'Step 14: Cover with shredded cheese.
', 'Step 15: Spray a piece of foil with nonstick cooking spray, and set the sprayed side against the cheese to cover the casserole dish (this helps prevent "cheese loss" when you remove the foil).
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is bubbly and cheese is nicely melted, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Allow to cool for 10 to 15 minutes before cutting into wedges or scooping out to serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '416.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '41.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '65.2 mg', 'fatContent': '16.4 g', 'fiberContent': '7.3 g', 'proteinContent': '29 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '8.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '1461.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.9 g'}

Title: Vegetarian Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '4 ears fresh corn, shucked and kernels scraped from cob', '1 teaspoon ground oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper', '2 ½ cups chopped baby spinach', '3 tablespoons chopped flat-leaf parsley', '1 (14 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican-style cheese blend, divided', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce, divided', '8 (10 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; stir in onion and garlic.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add corn kernels, oregano, cumin, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 4: Saute, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add spinach and parsley, cover, and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Place drained pinto beans into a separate bowl and mash with a potato masher or fork until they are almost paste-like.
', 'Step 8: Place 1/2 of the shredded cheese in a bowl for easy enchilada assembly.
', 'Step 9: Pour 1/2 of the enchilada sauce into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Assemble enchiladas: take 1 flour tortilla, smear some mashed beans vertically along the right side of the tortilla.
', 'Step 11: Place 2 to 3 tablespoons corn mixture on top of the beans, and then some shredded cheese on top of the corn mixture.
', 'Step 12: Starting at the right edge, roll tortilla to the left and place seam-side down in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 13: Repeat with remaining tortillas and fillings.
', 'Step 14: Pour remaining enchilada sauce evenly on top of rolled tortillas.
', 'Step 15: Sprinkle with remaining cheese and any remaining corn mixture.
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbly and cheese is melted, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Mexican Tamarind Candy
Ingredients: ['1 pound tamarind pods, peeled', '1 cup water', '1 orange, peeled and segmented', '4 cups white sugar', '4 tablespoons chile-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®), or more to taste', '1 tablespoon butter']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring tamarind pulp, water, and orange to a boil in a pot; continue to boil for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove from heat and let cool for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Pour tamarind mixture into a colander placed over a large bowl.
', 'Step 4: Mash and scrape against the side of the colander until all the juice and pulp drips into the bowl.
', 'Step 5: Dump remaining seeds into a strainer and repeat the process; remove the outer casing around the seeds by hand and toss out the seeds.
', 'Step 6: Blend outer casings with juicy pulp in an electric blender.
', 'Step 7: Return mixture to the large pot and add sugar, Tajin®, and butter.
', 'Step 8: Bring to a soft boil, stirring constantly.
', 'Step 9: Heat to 240 degrees F (115 degrees C) or until a small amount of syrup dropped into cold water forms a soft ball that flattens when removed from water and placed on a flat surface.
', 'Step 10: Remove from heat and let cool, about 2 hours.
', 'Step 11: Fill a pastry or plastic sandwich bag with the candy mixture and squeeze onto plastic spoons.
', 'Step 12: Place plastic spoons onto a cookie sheet and chill until firm, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 13: Coat with more Tajin® if desired, wrap with plastic, and close with a twist tie.
']

Title: Easy Chicken Fajita Soup
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into strips', '1 (1.27 ounce) packet fajita seasoning', '1 red bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '1 green bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '1 poblano pepper, cut into thin strips', '1 large onion, cut into thin strips', '1 (14.5 ounce) can fire roasted diced tomatoes', '1 (15 ounce) can seasoned black beans', '1 (14 ounce) can chicken broth', '1 dash hot sauce', 'salt and pepper to taste']

', 'Step 6: Pour the fire roasted tomatoes, black beans, and chicken broth into the pot with the chicken and vegetables.
', 'Step 7: Bring the soup to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

']

Title: Vegetarian Black Bean Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 onion, chopped', '1 small red bell pepper, chopped', '1 (14.25 ounce) can vegetarian refried black beans', '1 cup corn kernels, thawed', '1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 cup loosely packed and chopped fresh cilantro', '1 (4 ounce) can canned green chiles, undrained', '½ cup tomato salsa', '½ cup tomato sauce', '½ cup vegetable broth', '½ lime, juiced', '2 cloves garlic, peeled', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '6 flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '1 cup chopped avocado', '1 cup chopped tomatoes', '½ cup sour cream, or to taste']

['Step 1: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat.

Title: Chicken Flautas
Ingredients: ['4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cooked and shredded', '1 (8 ounce) jar picante sauce', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '8 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '8 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese', '36 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a medium bowl combine the shredded chicken, picante sauce and ground cumin.
', 'Step 3: Mix together.

Title: Enchilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 onion, chopped', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '1 (8 ounce) package tempeh, crumbled', '6 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 (19 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives', '8 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly oil a 9x13 inch baking dish.

', 'Step 4: Pour enchilada sauce into a shallow bowl.

Title: Chocolate Tres Leches Cake
Ingredients: ['1 (18.25 ounce) package Swiss chocolate cake mix (such as Duncan Hines®)', '1 ¼ cups chocolate milk', '½ cup canola oil', '3 eggs', '1 teaspoon instant espresso powder', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '¾ cup half-and-half', '¾ cup evaporated milk', '3 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder', "1 cup confectioners' sugar", '½ cup unsweetened cocoa powder', '3 cups heavy whipping cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Prepare a 9x13-inch pan with butter and flour.
', 'Step 3: Beat cake mix, chocolate milk, canola oil, eggs, and espresso powder together in a large bowl with an electric hand mixer on a low speed until dry ingredients are moistened.
', 'Step 4: Increase speed to medium and continue beating another 2 minutes; pour into prepared pan.
', 'Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 35 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove cake from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan until it is no longer hot to the touch.
', 'Step 7: While the cake is still warm, poke lots of holes all over the cake with a small skewer or a fork.
', 'Step 8: Whisk sweetened condensed milk, half-and-half, evaporated milk, and 3 tablespoons cocoa powder together in a bowl until cocoa is mostly incorporated into the liquid; slowly pour the milk mixture evenly over the cake.
', 'Step 9: Allow the cake to cool completely as the liquid soaks into it.
', "Step 10: Sift confectioners' sugar and cocoa powder together in a bowl.
", 'Step 11: Beat heavy whipping cream in a stand mixer on medium speed for about 1 minute.
', 'Step 12: While continuing to mix, add sugar-and-cocoa mixture to the cream in 2 batches, allowing the first to incorporate before adding the second.
', 'Step 13: Increase mixer speed to medium-high; beat until soft peaks form and the cream is thickened and spreadable.
', 'Step 14: Spread chocolate whipped cream on the cake to serve.
']

Title: Baja Style Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['6 tomatoes, diced', '1 small onion, diced', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons canned diced jalapeno peppers, or more to taste (juice reserved)', '½ teaspoon garlic salt', '½ lime, juiced', '3 cups coleslaw mix', '3 tablespoons ranch dressing', '2 cups vegetable oil for frying', '1 (9 ounce) box batter mix (such as Shore Lunch®)', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle Mexican beer', '24 corn tortillas', '1 pound cod fillets, cut into 2-inch chunks', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend', '2 limes, sliced into wedges', '1 dash chile-garlic sauce (such as Sriracha®)']

['Step 1: Mix tomatoes, onion, cilantro, jalapeno peppers, 1 tablespoon juice from jalapeno peppers, and garlic salt in a bowl; squeeze 1/2 lime over salsa fresca.
', 'Step 2: Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate while preparing fish.
', 'Step 3: Toss coleslaw mix with ranch dressing in a bowl; set aside for flavors to blend.
', 'Step 4: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Title: Chef John's Refried Beans
Ingredients: ['1 pound dry pinto beans, soaked overnight', '4 whole garlic cloves, peeled', '½ teaspoon dried epazote', '9 cups cold water', '½ cup lard', '1 ½ cups diced onions', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '2 tablespoons minced serrano chili pepper', '1 teaspoon ground dried chipotle pepper']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Drain soaked beans and transfer them to a stock pot.
', 'Step 2: Add garlic, epazote, and cold water.
', 'Step 3: Place pot over high heat and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 4: Stir.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 6: Simmer uncovered until beans are soft, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
', 'Step 7: Drain the beans and reserve all the liquid.
', 'Step 8: Melt lard in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 9: Add onions and salt; cook until onions start to brown, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir in serrano pepper and chipotle powder; cook 1 minute.
', 'Step 11: Transfer drained beans into skillet.
', 'Step 12: Mash about half the beans with a potato masher or back of a spoon.
', 'Step 13: Ladle some bean cooking liquid to skillet.
', 'Step 14: Continue to mash and stir beans as you gradually add more liquid.
', 'Step 15: Mash until the beans have reached your preferred consistency and texture.
', 'Step 16: Taste and add more salt, if desired.
']
