Title: Authentic Tacos al Pastor
Ingredients: ['1 tomato', '3 dried guajillo chile peppers, seeded', '2 dried ancho chile peppers, seeded', '1 pineapple, sliced 3/4-inch thick', '½ cup orange juice', '1 onion, quartered', '¼ cup white vinegar', '2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 tablespoon salt, or to taste', '2 cloves garlic, crushed', '3 cloves', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '2 pounds boneless pork loin, thinly sliced', '½ cup chopped onion', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cook tomato on a ridged grill pan over medium-high heat until slightly blackened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove from heat and cool until easily handled.
', 'Step 3: Peel off skin and remove seeds.
', 'Step 4: Bring a small pot of water to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Add guajillo and ancho chile peppers; cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Drain.
', 'Step 7: Combine tomato flesh, softened chile peppers, 2 slices pineapple, orange juice, quartered onion, vinegar, chipotle peppers, salt, garlic, cloves, cumin seeds, and oregano in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 8: Arrange pork slices in a glass or ceramic baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Pour blended mixture over pork, ensuring all sides are evenly coated.
', 'Step 10: Cover baking dish with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 11: Marinate pork in the refrigerator, 4 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 12: Cook remaining pineapple slices on a ridged grill pan over medium-high heat until slightly blackened and soft, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 13: Chop into small pieces.
', 'Step 14: Wipe out grill pan and preheat over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 15: Cook marinated pork in the hot pan, turning once, until browned, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Chop pork coarsely into small pieces against the grain.
', 'Step 17: Serve with pineapple, chopped onion, and cilantro.
']

Title: Mexican Black Beans and Rice

Title: Calabacitas con Elote (Zucchini with Corn)

Title: Instant Pot® Red Posole
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 pounds pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 medium onion, diced', '3 cloves garlic, pressed', '1 teaspoon New Mexico chili powder', '1 teaspoon garlic salt', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon chipotle chile powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', '1 (14.5 ounce) can red enchilada sauce', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '⅓ cup chopped cilantro', '1 (15 ounce) can golden hominy, drained']

['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.

", 'Step 10: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 11: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes.
", 'Step 12: Unlock the lid and add hominy, stirring to blend.
']

Title: Sopa de Tortilla (Real Mexican Tortilla Soup)
Ingredients: ['vegetable oil, or as needed', '12 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into strips', '3 dried pasilla chile peppers, seeded', '2 tomatoes, seeded and chopped', '½ large onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic', '¼ teaspoon dried oregano', '4 cups water', '4 teaspoons chicken bouillon granules', '1 sprig fresh parsley', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and diced', '¾ cup diced cotija cheese', '2 tablespoons crema fresca (fresh cream)']

['Step 1: Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add tortilla strips in batches and fry until brown and crispy, 2 to 3 minutes per batch.

', 'Step 5: Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 6: Combine 1 fried pasilla pepper, tomatoes, onion, garlic, and oregano in a blender; blend until smooth.

', 'Step 11: Stir in chicken granules and parsley.
', 'Step 12: Cover and simmer over low heat until flavors are well combined, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove from heat and discard parsley.
', 'Step 14: Divide fried tortilla strips among 4 bowls.
', 'Step 15: Pour soup on top of tortilla strips and garnish with diced avocado and cotija cheese.
', 'Step 16: Cut remaining fried pasilla peppers into thin strips and sprinkle over soup.
', 'Step 17: Add Mexican crema to each bowl.
']

', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and add poblano peppers.
', 'Step 3: Brush peppers with 1 tablespoon vegetable oil.
', 'Step 4: Roast poblano peppers in the preheated oven for 20 minutes; flip and continue roasting until skin is charred and flesh is soft, about 20 minutes more.
', 'Step 5: Place roasted peppers in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap; let steam for 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Carefully remove plastic wrap and peel the skins from the peppers and remove seeds and stems.
', 'Step 7: Cut peppers into strips.
', 'Step 8: Bring a pot of water to a boil; cook corn kernels until soft, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Drain.
', 'Step 10: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and butter in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion until soft, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add poblano pepper strips and corn; season with chicken bouillon granules and cook for 3 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in cream and manchego cheese; simmer until cheese melts, about 5 minutes.
']

Title: Naked Chicken Burrito Bowl
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '½ teaspoon garlic powder, or to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (15.25 ounce) can white corn kernels, drained', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained', '1 ½ cups cooked long-grain white rice', '½ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '¾ cup chopped lettuce', '⅓ (8 ounce) jar salsa', '½ cup sour cream']

['Step 1: Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Season chicken breasts with garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 3: Grill chicken until no longer pink in the center and cooked through, about 6 minutes per side.
', 'Step 4: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Cut chicken into strips or bite-sized pieces.
', 'Step 6: Warm corn and black beans in separate saucepans over medium-low heat, covered, until heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Layer cooked rice, corn, black beans, and chicken on 2 serving plates.
', 'Step 8: Top with Monterey Jack cheese, lettuce, salsa, and sour cream.
']

Title: Beef Brisket with Chipotle Tomatillo Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 (11 ounce) cans whole tomatillos, drained', '1 (7 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 cup water', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon brown sugar', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 yellow onion, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (3 pound) beef brisket']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the tomatillos, chipotle peppers, tomato sauce, water, salt, and brown sugar in the work bowl of a food processor, and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 2: Set the mixture aside.
', 'Step 3: Heat the olive oil in a pressure cooker with the lid off over medium heat, and cook and stir the onion and garlic until the onions are translucent, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Drop the brisket into the pressure cooker, and sear it on both sides.
', 'Step 5: Pour the tomatillo mixture over the brisket, bring to a boil, and place the lid on the cooker.
', 'Step 6: When the pressure comes up, set the heat so the cooker develops medium pressure, and cook for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Allow the cooker to release pressure on its own (without using the quick-release), and remove the brisket.
', 'Step 8: Serve hot, with tomatillo sauce on the side.
']

Title: Chicken Enchiladas with Green Chile Sauce (Salsa Verde)
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 medium yellow onion, finely chopped', '4 garlic cloves, minced', '1 whole roasted chicken, bones and skin removed, meat shredded', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '¼ cup salsa verde', '1 (2.5 ounce) can sliced olives, drained and diced', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '½ (4 ounce) can diced jalapeno peppers', '¼ cup butter', '¼ cup all-purpose flour', '2 cups chicken broth', '1 cup sour cream', '½ cup salsa verde', '16 corn tortillas', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat olive oil in a saute pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add garlic and heat until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat and let cool.
', 'Step 6: Combine chicken, onion mixture, cheese blend, cream cheese, salsa verde, olives, cilantro, and jalapenos in a large bowl for the filling.
', 'Step 7: Mix well.
', 'Step 8: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 9: Stir in flour, then chicken broth.
', 'Step 10: Cook until sauce starts to thicken, 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Stir in sour cream and salsa verde; cook until heated through.
', 'Step 12: Spread a spoonful of sauce over the bottoms of two 9x11-inch casserole dishes.
', 'Step 13: Wrap a tortilla in a damp paper towel and microwave for about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 14: Fill with the chicken mixture, roll up, and place seam-side down into a baking dish.
', 'Step 15: Repeat with remaining tortillas until each dish holds 8 enchiladas.
', 'Step 16: Spoon remaining sauce over the enchiladas.
', 'Step 17: Sprinkle cheese on top.
', 'Step 18: Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Mexican Beef Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 pound lean ground beef', '1 (15 ounce) can ranch-style beans', '1 (14.5 ounce) can peeled and diced tomatoes', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup', '1 (12 ounce) package corn tortillas', '4 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '2 tablespoons chili powder']

', 'Step 2: Brown the ground beef in a large skillet over medium high heat.
', 'Step 3: Add chili powder, beans, tomatoes and soup; mix well and heat thoroughly.
', 'Step 4: Line a 13x9 inch dish with tortillas.
', 'Step 5: Then make a layer with the meat mixture.
', 'Step 6: Make another row of tortillas, then finish off with rest of meat mixture.
', 'Step 7: Top with grated cheese.
', 'Step 8: Bake in a preheated oven for 30 minutes.
']

Title: Carne Asada Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 pounds beef chuck steaks', 'chili powder', '¼ teaspoon onion powder', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', 'salt to taste', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 ½ tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '4 green onions, chopped, divided', '4 cloves garlic, peeled', '½ cup tequila', '¼ cup lime juice', '¼ cup lemon juice', '¼ cup orange juice', '1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', '1 kiwi, peeled', '3 tablespoons chipotle cooking sauce (such as Herdez®)', '6 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 (12 ounce) bottle pasilla chile cooking sauce (such as Herdez®)', '1 (12 ounce) package shredded mozzarella cheese', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Season chuck steaks on both sides with chili powder, onion powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 2: Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook chuck steaks in the hot oil in batches until browned, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 4: Transfer to a slow cooker.
', 'Step 5: Heat remaining 1 1/2 teaspoon vegetable oil in the same skillet.
', 'Step 6: Add 2 green onions and garlic; cook and stir until browned but not burnt, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat; chop garlic coarsely and return to the skillet.
', 'Step 8: Whisk tequila, lime juice, lemon juice, orange juice, and ginger together in a bowl.
', 'Step 9: Mash in kiwi using a fork.
', 'Step 10: Stir in green onion-garlic mixture and chipotle sauce.
', 'Step 11: Pour over chuck steaks in the slow cooker.
', 'Step 12: Cook on Low until steaks are fork-tender, 6 to 8 hours.
', 'Step 13: Transfer chuck steaks to a cutting board; shred with 2 forks.
', 'Step 14: Mix in 2 raw green onions.
', 'Step 15: Pour cooking liquid from the slow cooker into the skillet.
', 'Step 16: Simmer over medium heat until reduced and thickened into a sauce, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Stir in shredded steak; simmer until most of the sauce is absorbed, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 19: Coat the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish with 1/4 of the pasilla chile sauce.
', 'Step 20: Spoon shredded steak mixture into tortillas.
', 'Step 21: Wrap up and place seam-side down, close together, in the baking dish.
', 'Step 22: Pour remaining pasilla chile sauce over tortillas.
', 'Step 23: Sprinkle mozzarella cheese and chives on top.
', 'Step 24: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbly, 20 to 30 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '514.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '30.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '78.7 mg', 'fatContent': '26.9 g', 'fiberContent': '1.9 g', 'proteinContent': '28.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '10.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '631.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.5 g'}

Title: Keto Tex-Mex Ground Beef Casserole
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 ½ pounds ground beef', '2 ½ teaspoons chili powder, divided', '2 teaspoons onion powder, divided', '2 teaspoons garlic powder, divided', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 eggs', '2 tablespoons heavy cream', '1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil', '½ cup chopped onion', 'salt and pepper to taste', '3 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 pound frozen riced cauliflower, thawed and drained', '1 ½ cups grated Cheddar cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray an 11x7-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons chili powder, 1 teaspoon onion powder, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper until spiced are distributed evenly.
', 'Step 6: Cook until fragrant, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 8: Whisk together eggs and cream in a bowl; add to meat mixture.
', 'Step 9: Spread mixture into the prepared baking dish and pat down evenly.
', 'Step 10: Wipe the skillet clean, add olive oil, and heat over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Add onion and cook until soft and translucent, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add remaining 1 teaspoon each chili powder, garlic powder, and onion powder.
', 'Step 13: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 14: Stir in tomato paste and cook, stirring often, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Add cauliflower rice and continue cooking for 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Remove from heat, stir in 1 cup Cheddar cheese, and spread on top of meat in the baking dish, smoothing with a spatula to flatten the top.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup Cheddar over the top and bake until cheese has melted, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Remove from oven and allow to cool about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Serve warm.
']

Title: Baked Corn Tortilla Strips for Mexican Soups
Ingredients: ['8 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '2 tablespoons avocado oil, or more as needed']

', 'Step 4: Arrange tortilla strips in a single layer on a baking sheet.

Title: Colorado Green Chili (Chile Verde)
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 ½ pounds cubed pork stew meat', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 large yellow onion, diced', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '2 cups chopped, roasted green chiles', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice', '1 ½ cups tomatillo salsa', '5 cups chicken broth', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 pinch ground cloves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a Dutch oven or large pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Season the pork with salt and pepper to taste, then place into the hot oil.
', 'Step 3: Cook until golden brown on all sides, about 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Once browned, remove the pork and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to medium, and stir in the onion and garlic.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Return the pork to the pot, and stir in the green chiles, diced tomatoes with juice, tomatillo salsa, and chicken broth.
', 'Step 8: Season with oregano and clove.
', 'Step 9: Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 20 minutes.
', 'Step 10: After 20 minutes, remove 2 cups of the soup (ensure there are no pork cubes in it), and pour into a blender.
', 'Step 11: Hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, and carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulses to get the soup moving before leaving it on to puree.
', 'Step 12: Puree until smooth, then pour back into the cooking pot.
', 'Step 13: This will create a thicker texture for your chili and will eliminate some of the chunky bits of chiles.
', 'Step 14: Continue to simmer, stirring occasionally until the pork is very tender, at least 35 minutes more.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '323 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '12 g', 'cholesterolContent': '67.9 mg', 'fatContent': '19.2 g', 'fiberContent': '1.7 g', 'proteinContent': '23.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '887.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.3 g'}

Title: Slow Cooker Beef Barbacoa
Ingredients: ['3 pounds boneless beef chuck roast', '1 onion, chopped', '3 bay leaves', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '2 tablespoons garlic powder', '¼ cup distilled white vinegar', '1 (14 ounce) can tomato sauce', '¼ cup chili powder', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the roast, onion, bay leaves, black pepper, garlic powder, and vinegar in slow cooker; cover ingredients completely with water.
', 'Step 2: Cover and cook on High setting until meat is very tender and falling apart, about 4 hours.
', 'Step 3: Remove meat from slow cooker and discard liquids.
', 'Step 4: Return meat to slow cooker; shred with fork and knife.
', 'Step 5: Stir tomato sauce, chili powder, and salt into the shredded meat.
', 'Step 6: Cover the cooker, and cook meat and sauce on High for an additional 2 hours.
']

Title: Sopa De Lima (Mexican Lime Soup)
Ingredients: ['9 cups chicken broth', '5 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 large red onion, quartered', '5 cloves garlic, chopped', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon dried thyme', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '4 green onions, chopped', '1 large green chile pepper, seeded and chopped', '2 large tomatoes, peeled and chopped', '6 limes, juiced', '½ lime', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', 'tortilla chips, for topping']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring the chicken broth, chicken breasts, red onion, garlic, oregano, salt, pepper, and thyme to a boil in a large pot; reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 2: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 3: Remove the cooked chicken to a cutting board and shred into bite-sized strips; return to the simmering pot.
', 'Step 4: Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook the green onions and green chile pepper in the hot oil until tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir the tomatoes into the mixture and continue cooking until soft, about 5 minute more; pour the mixture into the pot with the chicken soup.
', 'Step 6: Season with the salt; return the soup to a simmer.
', 'Step 7: Add the lime juice and 1/2 a lime; cook another 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove the pot from the heat and remove the lime half; stir in the cilantro to serve.
']

Title: Easy Spicy Mexican-American Chicken

Title: Barbacoa
Ingredients: ['4 dried guajillo chilies', '2 teaspoons cumin seeds', '⅛ whole cloves', '1 cup boiling water', '½ teaspoon ground ancho chile powder', '1 large onion, quartered', '6 cloves garlic', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground thyme', '⅓ cup apple cider vinegar', '2 teaspoons lime juice', '1 (6 pound) boneless beef chuck roast', '2 bay leaves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a heavy skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Place the dried guajillo chiles into the skillet and cook, turning occasionally, until the color changes and the chiles have puffed, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Set the chiles aside to cool for a moment.
', 'Step 4: Meanwhile, toast the cumin and cloves in the hot skillet until the cumin seeds begin to pop; remove from the pan and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Remove and discard the stems, seeds, and veins of the chiles, and place into a small bowl.
', 'Step 6: Pour the boiling water over top, and cover.
', 'Step 7: Let the chiles soak for 1 hour.
', 'Step 8: Grind the toasted cumin and cloves into a powder, and place into a blender.
', 'Step 9: Add the ancho chile powder, onion, garlic, oregano, thyme, vinegar, and lime juice.
', 'Step 10: Remove the chiles from the soaking water, and place into the blender along with 1/3 cup of the soaking liquid.
', 'Step 11: Cover, and blend until a smooth paste forms.
', 'Step 12: Place the beef roast into a mixing bowl, and pour the guajillo chile past over top.
', 'Step 13: Coat the roast on all sides with the paste, then cover the bowl with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 14: Marinate in the refrigerator overnight.
', 'Step 15: Preheat an oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 16: Transfer the roast and marinade to a roasting pan, and arrange the bay leaves over top.
', 'Step 17: Cover tightly with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 18: Bake in the preheated oven until the meat is very tender and is easily pulled apart with a fork, about 6 hours.
', 'Step 19: Let stand, covered, at room temperature for 1 hour before discarding the bay leaves and shredding with two forks.
']

Title: Mexican Pizza I
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '1 pound ground beef', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '4 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '8 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese', '8 tablespoons sour cream', '2 roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '2 green onion, chopped', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles, drained', '½ avocado, diced', '1 tablespoon black olives, sliced']

['Step 1: Heat the refried beans.
', 'Step 2: In a large skillet, brown the ground beef.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the seasoning packet.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Place a small amount of vegetable oil in a large skillet.
', 'Step 6: Let the oil heat, then place one corn tortilla in the skillet.
', 'Step 7: After 15 seconds, flip the tortilla over and let it fry another 15 seconds.

', 'Step 9: When the tortillas have drained, arrange them on a cookie sheet.

Title: Fish Tacos Ultimo
Ingredients: ['2 pounds tilapia fillets', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon paprika', 'cooking spray', '½ cup plain fat-free yogurt', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '1 ½ tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 ½ teaspoons canned chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '16 (5 inch) corn tortillas', '2 cups shredded cabbage', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 tomato, chopped', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and sliced', '½ cup salsa', '2 green onions, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Rub tilapia fillets with 2 tablespoons lime juice and season with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
', 'Step 2: Spray both sides of each fillet with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 4: Combine yogurt, 2 tablespoons lime juice, cilantro, and chipotle pepper in a blender; pulse until sauce is well blended.
', 'Step 5: Set aside.

Title: Flan II

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

', 'Step 6: Stir in sugar.

', 'Step 8: Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel.
', 'Step 9: Place ramekins on towel, inside roasting pan, and place roasting pan on oven rack.
', 'Step 10: Fill roasting pan with boiling water to reach halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
', 'Step 11: Bake in preheated oven 40 minutes, until set.
', 'Step 12: Let cool, invert and serve.
']

Title: Mama's Old-Fashioned Albondigas (Meatball Soup)
Ingredients: ['1 gallon water', '3 cups tomato sauce', '1 yellow onion, quartered', '4 tablespoons chicken bouillon (such as Knorr®)', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '3 pounds lean ground beef', '3 eggs', '½ cup tomato sauce', '¼ cup uncooked white rice', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon seasoned salt (such as Season-All®)', '1 tablespoon dried oregano leaves', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '10 small baby potatoes', '5 large carrots, sliced diagonally', '5 stalks celery, sliced diagonally', '2 zucchini, chopped', '2 cups thickly shredded green cabbage', '1 lemon, sliced into wedges', '2 avocados, chopped', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro']

Title: Cinco de Chili Chocolate Cupcakes with Chili Cream Cheese Frosting
Ingredients: ["1 (18.25 ounce) box devil's food chocolate cake mix", '1 ½ teaspoons ground ancho chile pepper', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 ¼ cups water', '⅓ cup vegetable oil', '3 eggs', '1 teaspoon ground ancho chile pepper', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', "4 cups confectioners' sugar, or more as needed", '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '½ cup butter, softened', '½ teaspoon clear vanilla extract, or to taste', '24 small dried red chiles']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line 24 cupcake cups with paper liners.

', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean, 18 to 22 minutes.

", 'Step 9: Beat in the cream cheese and butter with an electric mixer on medium speed until the frosting is smooth; mix in the vanilla extract.

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 ½ teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, or more to taste', '½ cup chicken broth', '3 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '2 (10 ounce) cans green enchilada sauce, divided', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies', '½ cup chopped onion', '2 jalapeno peppers, chopped, or more to taste', 'olive oil', '16 corn tortillas, or more to taste', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix chili powder, salt, and cumin together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Rub mixture over the chicken.
', 'Step 3: Pour chicken broth into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®).
', 'Step 4: Add a rack to the bottom of the pot and place seasoned chicken on top.
', 'Step 5: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 6: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 5 minutes.
", 'Step 7: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', 'Step 8: Combine 2 cups Monterey Jack cheese, 1 can green enchilada sauce, green chiles, onions, and jalapenos in a large mixing bowl.
', 'Step 9: Stir to thoroughly blend.
', 'Step 10: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Lightly grease a baking dish.
', "Step 12: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions for 5 minutes.
", "Step 13: Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 14: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 15: Transfer cooked chicken to a cutting board and shred or chop into small pieces.
', 'Step 16: Add to the mixing bowl with the cheese mixture.
', 'Step 17: Stir until chicken mixture is blended.
', 'Step 18: Heat olive oil in a skillet.
', 'Step 19: Soften tortillas 1 at a time by dipping into the hot oil for 2 to 3 seconds per side.
', 'Step 20: Drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 21: Spoon 2 to 3 tablespoons chicken mixture onto a tortilla, roll up, and place seam-side down into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 22: Repeat with remaining tortillas and mixture.
', 'Step 23: Combine 1 can green enchilada sauce and red enchilada sauce in a bowl and pour over enchiladas in the baking dish.
', 'Step 24: Sprinkle remaining 1 cup Monterey Jack cheese on top.
', 'Step 25: Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes.
']

Title: Black Bean and Rice Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 cup white rice', '2 cups water', '1 tablespoon butter', '½ sweet yellow onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 tablespoon chili powder, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon paprika', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '¼ teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '8 large flour tortillas, warmed', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']

Title: Steak, Onion, and Pepper Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds beef round steak', '¼ cup tequila', '½ cup fresh lime juice', '½ cup cooking oil', '2 tablespoons liquid smoke', '1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon salt', '¾ teaspoon paprika', '½ cup sliced onion', '¾ cup bell peppers, sliced into thin strips']

', 'Step 8: Add the liquid smoke, Worcestershire sauce, pepper, salt, and paprika to the oil and stir.

Title: Crispy Flautas
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '½ green bell pepper, chopped', '½ onion, finely diced', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch pieces', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '¾ cup water', '1 (10 ounce) package corn tortillas (such as Ortega®)', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 cup salsa', '24 toothpicks', '2 cups vegetable oil for frying']

Title: Instant Pot® Mexican Chicken and Rice Bowls
Ingredients: ['olive oil', '1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces', '½ cup chicken broth', '1 (15 ounce) can corn, drained', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chilies, undrained', '1 cup rice, rinsed until the water runs clear', '½ teaspoon seasoning salt', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '4 tablespoons shredded Mexican cheese blend, or to taste', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste']

Title: Asado de Puerco (Mexican Pork Stew)
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes', '½ cup water', '½ teaspoon salt, or more to taste', '4 dried guajillo chile peppers', '4 dried ancho chile peppers', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon chicken bouillon granules', '10 whole black peppercorns', '2 garlic cloves', '½ inch stick Mexican cinnamon', '½ teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', '½ teaspoon dried thyme', '½ teaspoon cumin seeds', '2 bay leaves', '2 whole cloves', '1 tablespoon lard']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine pork cubes, 1/2 cup water, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a Dutch oven.
', 'Step 2: Cover and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Uncover, increase heat to medium-high and cook, stirring constantly, until water evaporates.
', 'Step 4: Continue cooking until the pork browns in its rendered fat, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, cut tops off the dried chiles and remove seeds.
', 'Step 6: Heat chiles in a large skillet over low heat until they start to soften.
', 'Step 7: Do not toast.
', 'Step 8: Place chiles in a bowl of hot water and soak for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove pork and set aside.
', 'Step 10: Do not wash, wipe out, or clean the Dutch oven.
', 'Step 11: Transfer chiles to a blender, reserving soaking water.
', 'Step 12: Add cilantro, chicken bouillon, peppercorns, garlic, cinnamon stick, Mexican oregano, thyme, cumin seeds, bay leaves, and cloves.
', 'Step 13: Pour in 1 cup soaking water and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 14: Add 1 more cup soaking water, season with salt, and blend until completely smooth.
', 'Step 15: Melt lard in the Dutch oven.
', 'Step 16: Carefully add blended chile mixture and scrape up all browned bits.
', 'Step 17: Bring to a boil and add pork.
', 'Step 18: Reduce heat and cover partially, leaving about 1 inch open.
', 'Step 19: Simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce has thickened and reaches the desired consistency, 15 to 20 minutes.
']

Title: Easy Shredded Chicken Tacos

Title: Bacon-Ranch Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '¼ cup chopped yellow onion', '½ leftover rotisserie chicken, chopped', '¼ cup crumbled cooked bacon', '2 tablespoons roasted garlic', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 bunch green onions, chopped', '2 tablespoons ranch dressing', '2 tablespoons sour cream', '15 (6 inch) corn tortillas, or more to taste', '2 cups shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend', '1 cup mild enchilada sauce']

Title: Carne Asada Tacos

Title: Rajas Poblanas (Poblano Strips)
Ingredients: ['½ cup Mexican crema, crema fresca', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '1 tablespoon chicken bouillon granules', '5 poblano peppers', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 onions, thickly sliced', '1 cup drained canned corn kernels']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Blend the crema, cream cheese, and chicken bouillon in a blender until smooth; set aside.
', 'Step 2: Place the peppers on a large griddle over medium-high heat.

', 'Step 5: Transfer to a plate to cool.
', 'Step 6: Peel and discard the outer skin of the peppers; halve length-wise and remove the seeds and veins.
', 'Step 7: Slice into thick strips.
', 'Step 8: Set aside.
', 'Step 9: Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat; cook the onion in the hot oil until tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir the corn into the onions, reduce the heat to medium, and cook another 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add the poblano strips to the saucepan.
', 'Step 12: Pour the cream mixture over the vegetables and bring to a simmer; cook at a simmer until hot, about 5 minutes more.
']

Title: Pan de Muertos (Mexican Bread of the Dead)
Ingredients: ['¼ cup margarine', '¼ cup milk', '¼ cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)', '3 cups all-purpose flour', '1 ¼ teaspoons active dry yeast', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 teaspoons anise seed', '¼ cup white sugar', '2 eggs, beaten', '2 teaspoons orange zest', '¼ cup white sugar', '¼ cup orange juice', '1 tablespoon orange zest', '2 tablespoons white sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the milk and the butter together in a medium saucepan, until the butter melts.
', 'Step 2: Remove from the heat and add them warm water.
', 'Step 3: The mixture should be around 110 degrees F (43 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: In a large bowl combine 1 cup of the flour, yeast, salt, anise seed and 1/4 cup of the sugar.
', 'Step 5: Beat in the warm milk mixture then add the eggs and orange zest and beat until well combined.
', 'Step 6: Stir in 1/2 cup of flour and continue adding more flour until the dough is soft.
', 'Step 7: Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic.
', 'Step 8: Place the dough into a lightly greased bowl cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size.
', 'Step 9: This will take about 1 to 2 hours.
', 'Step 10: Punch the dough down and shape it into a large round loaf with a round knob on top.
', 'Step 11: Place dough onto a baking sheet, loosely cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for about 1 hour or until just about doubled in size.
', 'Step 12: Bake in a preheated 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven for about 35 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove from oven let cool slightly then brush with glaze.
', 'Step 14: To make glaze: In a small saucepan combine the 1/4 cup sugar, orange juice and orange zest.
', 'Step 15: Bring to a boil over medium heat and boil for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Brush over top of bread while still warm.
', 'Step 17: Sprinkle glazed bread with white sugar.
']

Title: Avocado Lime Cheesecake

['Step 1: Heat cream in a small saucepan until small bubbles appear around edges.
', 'Step 2: Remove from heat and stir sugar into cream until it dissolves.

Title: Shrimp Tacos

Title: Easy and Delicious Mexican Pork Chops
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '6 boneless pork chops', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 cups water', '1 ½ cups uncooked long-grain white rice', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '½ cup picante sauce', '¼ cup taco seasoning mix', '1 green bell pepper, sliced', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle pork chops with salt and black pepper, and brown them on both sides, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 5: Set chops aside.
', 'Step 6: Mix the water, rice, tomato sauce, picante sauce, and taco seasoning in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Lay the chops into the rice mixture, and top with the green bell pepper slices.
', 'Step 8: Cover the dish.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until the chops are no longer pink inside and the rice is tender, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 10: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a chop should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Uncover the dish, and sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 12: Return to the oven, and bake uncovered until the cheese is melted and bubbly, 5 to 10 more minutes.
']

Title: Southwest Breakfast Burritos
Ingredients: ['12 eggs', '⅔ cup milk', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 pound bulk pork sausage', '2 tablespoons minced garlic', '½ red onion, diced', '1 tomato, diced', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 (3.5 ounce) can diced jalapenos', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '20 (6 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk together the eggs, milk, and salt in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Heat butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Pour in the egg mixture; cook and stir until eggs are completely set, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Chop the cooked eggs and place in a large bowl.
', 'Step 5: Set aside.
', 'Step 6: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and stir in the sausage and garlic.
', 'Step 7: Cook and stir for 5 minutes, then add the onion.
', 'Step 8: Continue cooking and stirring until the sausage is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink.
', 'Step 9: Drain and discard any excess grease.
', 'Step 10: Combine the sausage with the eggs, tomato, cilantro, jalapeno, and taco seasoning.
', 'Step 11: Allow mixture to cool to room temperature, then stir in the Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 12: Place a tortilla onto your work surface, then spoon some of the filling halfway between the bottom edge and the center of the tortilla.
', 'Step 13: Flatten the filling into rectangle shape with the back of a spoon.
', 'Step 14: Fold the bottom of the tortilla snugly over the filling, then fold in the left and right edges.
', 'Step 15: Roll the burrito up to the top edge, forming a tight cylinder.
', 'Step 16: Repeat with the remaining ingredients.
', 'Step 17: Tightly wrap individual burritos with plastic wrap and freeze until ready to serve.
', 'Step 18: Heat in the microwave until hot, 3 to 4 minutes, before serving.
']

Title: How to Make Tres Leches Cake
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable shortening, or as needed', '1 (15.25 ounce) package yellow cake mix', '3 eggs', '1 cup cold water', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 cup half-and-half', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Generously grease a 10x15-inch baking pan with vegetable shortening.
', 'Step 3: Combine yellow cake mix, eggs, water, vegetable oil, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract in a large mixing bowl.
', 'Step 4: Beat with electric mixer until very smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.
', 'Step 5: Scrape batter into the prepared baking pan.
', 'Step 6: Smooth the top of the batter, shake pan, and tap lightly on counter 2 or 3 times to eliminate air bubbles.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the middle of the cake comes out clean, about 22 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Let cake cool in the pan at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Poke holes all over the cake with a bamboo skewer or the handle of a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 10: Combine evaporated milk, sweetened condensed milk, and half-and-half in a large bowl; slowly pour milk syrup all over the cake.
', 'Step 11: Syrup will soak into cake.
', 'Step 12: Wrap cake with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 3 hours (or preferably overnight).
', 'Step 13: Whip cream with sugar and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer until cream is fluffy; spoon whipped cream over cake.
']

Title: Arroz Rojo (Mexican Red Rice)
Ingredients: ['2 Roma (plum tomatoes), cored', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 cup minced onion', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 cup uncooked long-grain white rice', '1 ¾ cups low-sodium chicken broth', '¼ cup canned tomato sauce', '1 jalapeno pepper, chopped', '2 sprigs fresh cilantro', 'salt to taste']

['Step 1: Grate tomatoes into a bowl using a box grater; discard tomato skins.
', 'Step 2: Heat vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat and cook onion until translucent, stirring often, about 5 minutes.

', 'Step 5: Stir grated tomato, chicken broth, and tomato sauce into the rice.
', 'Step 6: Bring mixture to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Mix in jalapeno pepper, cilantro, and salt; reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 8: Cover skillet and simmer until rice has absorbed the liquid, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Do not lift the cover while the rice is cooking.
', 'Step 10: Turn off heat and let rice stand covered for 8 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Fluff with a fork before transferring rice to a serving dish.
']

Title: Chicken Enchilada Slow Cooker Soup

Title: Ultimate Creamy Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided', '2 teaspoons chili powder, divided', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin, divided', '12 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 small onion, finely chopped', '1 medium poblano pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 small yellow bell pepper, finely chopped', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese', '4 ounces sour cream', '4 cups shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend, divided', '1 cup refried beans', '1 (15 ounce) can red enchilada sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place chicken on a large sheet of foil and season with 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder, and 1/2 teaspoon cumin.
', 'Step 3: Seal the foil around the chicken and place the packet on a rimmed baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until tender and no longer pink in the center, about 50 minutes.
', 'Step 5: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Shred cooked chicken and set aside.
', 'Step 7: Increase the oven temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: While chicken cooks, prepare tortillas.
', 'Step 9: Spread both sides of each tortilla lightly with butter.
', 'Step 10: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Toast each tortilla, about 10 seconds on each side, and set aside.
', 'Step 12: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 13: Add onion, poblano pepper, and bell pepper and cook, stirring often, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Add remaining salt, chili powder, and cumin and cook, stirring frequently, until veggies are very tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in tomatoes and cream cheese.
', 'Step 16: Cook, stirring constantly, until cheese has melted.
', 'Step 17: Remove from heat and stir in sour cream and 2 cups Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend.
', 'Step 18: Fold in shredded chicken.
', 'Step 19: Spread about 1 tablespoon refried beans, if using, in the center of a tortilla.
', 'Step 20: Add about 1/4 cup chicken filling and roll up to seal.
', 'Step 21: Repeat with remaining beans and filling.
', 'Step 22: Pour 1/4 cup sauce in the bottom of 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 23: Arrange enchiladas in a single layer over the sauce.
', 'Step 24: Pour remaining enchilada sauce over the top and spread to evenly coat.
', 'Step 25: Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 26: Bake in the preheated oven until golden and bubbly, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 27: Let stand for 10 minutes before serving with desired toppings.
']

['Step 1: Place 6 cups of water in a large saucepan; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Stir in the hibiscus petals, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and allspice.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium-low, and gently simmer until the water has turned a deep red, 30 to 45 minutes.

Title: Sheet Pan Shrimp Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 (1 ounce) package fajita seasoning', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 ½ pounds raw shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1 red bell pepper, sliced into strips', '1 yellow bell pepper, sliced into strips', '1 red onion, sliced into strips', '1 jalapeno pepper, sliced into rings']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Mix fajita seasoning and olive oil together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 3: Add shrimp; toss to coat.
', 'Step 4: Lay out seasoned shrimp in a single layer on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: Add red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, red onion, and jalapeno pepper; mix with shrimp and spread out evenly.
', 'Step 6: Roast in the preheated oven until shrimp are opaque, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Transfer shrimp to a serving plate.
', 'Step 8: Broil pepper mixture until lightly blackened, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Transfer to the serving plate with shrimp.

Title: Chiles Rellenos (Stuffed Peppers)
Ingredients: ['4 fresh poblano chile peppers', '½ pound lean ground beef', '1 onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, chopped', 'salt and pepper to taste', '3 eggs, separated', '1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese', '2 roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '1 cup corn oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place whole peppers over an open flame (gas burner) or under the broiler.
', 'Step 2: Roast, turning frequently until evenly black and blistered.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat, place in a plastic bag, and let them sweat for a while.
', 'Step 4: This will allow the skins to peel of easily.
', 'Step 5: While the peppers are sweating, place the ground beef in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Cook, stirring to crumble, until evenly browned.
', 'Step 7: When beef is fully cooked, add the onion, garlic and tomato, and cook for a few more minutes.
', 'Step 8: Season to taste with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 9: Remove the peppers from the bag, and peel off the burnt skin.
', 'Step 10: You may wish to wear protective gloves.
', 'Step 11: Run peppers under cool running water to rinse away any burnt pieces.
', 'Step 12: Make a small vertical slit in the side of the peppers, and remove the seeds and veins.
', 'Step 13: Stuff each pepper halfway with the ground beef mixture, then fill the rest of the way with shredded cheese.
', 'Step 14: Close the slits, and secure with toothpicks.
', 'Step 15: Whip egg whites in a large glass or metal bowl until thick and fluffy.
', 'Step 16: Add the egg yolks, and whip for a minute to blend in.
', 'Step 17: Meanwhile, heat 1/4 inch of oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 18: Coat the stuffed peppers with a light dusting of flour, then dip them in the egg so they are fully covered.
', 'Step 19: Carefully place in the hot oil, and fry on both sides until golden.
', 'Step 20: Drain on paper towels, then serve on a large platter.
']

Title: Pollo Asado
Ingredients: ['½ cup chopped onion', '¼ cup olive oil', '¼ cup lime juice', '2 teaspoons white vinegar', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 cloves garlic, smashed', '2 small dried red peppers', '1 teaspoon sea salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place onion, olive oil, lime juice, vinegar, cumin, garlic, red peppers, sea salt, and black pepper in a blender.
', 'Step 2: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Place chicken in a container or resealable plastic bag and pour marinade on top; toss to coat.
', 'Step 4: Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 24 hours.
', 'Step 5: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 6: Grill chicken until no longer pink in the centers, 6 to 7 minutes per side, depending on thickness.
', 'Step 7: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the centers should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
']

Title: Seven Layer Dip I
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds ground beef', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '4 cups shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '1 cup guacamole', '1 cup salsa', '1 (2.25 ounce) can black olives, chopped', '½ cup chopped tomatoes', '½ cup chopped green onions']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large skillet, brown ground beef.
', 'Step 2: Set aside to drain and cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 3: Spread the beans into the bottom of a 9x13 inch serving tray that is about 1 1/2 inches deep.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle 2 cups of shredded cheese on top of beans.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle beef on top of cheese.
', 'Step 6: Spread sour cream very slowly on top of beef.
', 'Step 7: Spread guacamole on top of sour cream.

', 'Step 10: Sprinkle black olives, tomatoes, and green onions on top.

', 'Step 12: I think it tastes better at room temperature.
']

Title: Chef John's Chicken Tinga
Ingredients: ['3 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs', '3 peeled whole garlic cloves', '1 large yellow onion, halved', '2 teaspoons kosher salt, plus more to taste', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '4 cups chicken stock', '1 cup water', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large onion, diced', '1 (7 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '1 (28 ounce) can peeled plum tomatoes (preferably San Marzano)', '2 tablespoons crumbled cotija cheese, or to taste', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken thighs, garlic cloves, halved onion, salt, oregano, water, and chicken stock, and water in a large pot.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a simmer over high heat; reduce to medium-low.
', 'Step 3: Simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 5: Transfer onion halves to a bowl with a slotted spoon; transfer chicken thighs to a separate bowl.
', 'Step 6: Pour broth through a strainer into a large bowl.
', 'Step 7: Heat olive oil in the same pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add diced onions and cook until beginning to soften, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Transfer strained liquid to onions.
', 'Step 10: Bring mixture to a boil over high heat; turn heat to medium-low; reduce broth by about half, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Transfer reserved boiled onions to a blender.
', 'Step 12: Add chipotle peppers and the adobo sauce.
', 'Step 13: Swirl a bit of water in the can and add to the blender.
', 'Step 14: Add tomatoes.
', 'Step 15: Cover blender with the lid.
', 'Step 16: Pulse on and off until mixture is partially blended.
', 'Step 17: Blend on medium speed until smooth, 1 or 2 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Transfer to pot with broth and onions.
', 'Step 19: Increase heat to medium-high.
', 'Step 20: Simmer 15 minutes or so, depending on how thick you want the sauce.
', 'Step 21: Reduce heat to medium-low.
', 'Step 22: Tear chicken into bite-size pieces and add to the pot.
', 'Step 23: Cook another 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Transfer to a serving dish; garnish with crumbled cotija cheese and cilantro.
']

Title: Mexican Fiestada for School Lunch
Ingredients: ['1 (1.25 ounce) package dry taco seasoning mix', '1 cup ground beef', '1 (14 ounce) package prepared pizza dough, or as needed', '½ cup pizza sauce', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 pinch salt', '1 ¼ cups shredded mild Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Sprinkle taco seasoning on ground beef.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 6: Divide pizza dough in half and flatten each half into a thin crust over a nonstick baking sheet.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven for 3 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove but leave oven on.
', 'Step 9: Mix pizza sauce, cumin, and salt together in a bowl.
', 'Step 10: Spread 1/2 of the mixture over each pizza crust.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle beef and Cheddar cheese evenly on top.
', 'Step 12: Bake until crusts are crunchy and cheese is melted, 10 to 12 minutes.
']

Title: Mexican Pumpkin Empanadas
Ingredients: ['3 cups all-purpose flour', '⅓ cup white sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '¼ teaspoon baking powder', '1 cup vegetable shortening', '1 cup warm water', '4 cups canned pure pumpkin', '2 eggs', '1 cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '½ teaspoon ground cloves', '1 beaten egg']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: In a large bowl, whisk the flour, 1/3 cup of sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt, and baking powder together.
', 'Step 4: Cut the shortening into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs; stir the water in, about 2 tablespoons at a time, just until you can gather the dough together.
', 'Step 5: Knead the dough a few times in the bowl, then scrape it out onto a floured surface.
', 'Step 6: Cut the dough in quarters, and cut each quarter into thirds to make 12 equal portions.
', 'Step 7: Roll the portions into balls.
', 'Step 8: Cover the dough balls with a cloth, and allow to rest while you make the filling.
', 'Step 9: Mix the pumpkin, 2 eggs, 1 cup of sugar, 1 teaspoon of salt, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves together until smooth.
', 'Step 10: On a floured surface, roll each dough ball out into a thin circle about 6 inches across; spoon about 1/3 cup of filling into the center of the dough circle.
', 'Step 11: Fold the dough over the filling to make a half-moon shaped pie, and crimp the edges of the crust together with a fork, leaving little fork lines in the dough.
', 'Step 12: Gently lay the empanadas onto the prepared baking sheets.
', 'Step 13: Brush the top of each pie with beaten egg.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until the filling is hot and the crusts are shiny and browned, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Beef Birria
Ingredients: ['3 (8 ounce) beef short ribs', '1 (2 1/2 pound) beef chuck', '4 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '2 teaspoons dried Mexican oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '7 peppers dried guajillo chilies', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large onion, roughly chopped', '6 cloves garlic, peeled', '1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger, thinly sliced', '3 large tomatoes, cored and chopped', '2 cups water', '3 bay leaves', '1 tablespoon honey', '¼ cup white vinegar', '4 cups chicken broth', '2 tablespoons finely diced white onion', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', '1 medium lime, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cut each beef short rib through the middle, all the way down to the bone.
', 'Step 2: Cut beef chuck in half; cut each half into 3- to 4-inch pieces.
', 'Step 3: Place beef chuck and short ribs into a soup pot and season with salt, black pepper, oregano, cumin, cinnamon, and cloves.
', 'Step 4: Toss very thoroughly until the meat is evenly coated with the spices, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Cover and transfer into the refrigerator for at least 6 hours, or overnight.
', 'Step 6: Prep guajillo chiles by snipping off stems with scissors; slice open and scrape or shake out the seeds onto a plate to discard.
', 'Step 7: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add dried guajillo chiles and toss in the hot oil, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 9: Add chopped onion, garlic, and ginger; toss to combine.
', 'Step 10: Add tomatoes and water, raise heat to high, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
', 'Step 11: Reduce heat to medium-low and let simmer for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Turn off heat and use an immersion blender to blend the mixture as smooth as possible, or transfer to a regular blender, working in batches as needed.
', 'Step 13: Remove the soup pot with meat from the refrigerator.
', 'Step 14: Strain the reserved chili mixture into the pot using a large mesh strainer.
', 'Step 15: Add bay leaves, honey, vinegar, and chicken broth.
', 'Step 16: Bring to a boil over high heat, and then lower to medium-low.
', 'Step 17: Simmer gently, stirring occasionally, until the meat is falling-apart tender, 3 to 4 hours.
', 'Step 18: Skim fat off of the top and reserve for future birria queso tacos.
', 'Step 19: Place some chunks of beef into a soup bowl and ladle some of the cooking liquid over top.
', 'Step 20: Top with white onion and chopped cilantro and squeeze lime juice over top.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '374.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '8.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '82 mg', 'fatContent': '28.4 g', 'fiberContent': '1.5 g', 'proteinContent': '21.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '10.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '1286.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.5 g'}

Title: Beef Tamales
Ingredients: ['4 pounds boneless chuck roast', '4 cloves garlic', '3 (8 ounce) packages dried corn husks', '4 dried ancho chiles', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 cup beef broth', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 teaspoons chopped fresh oregano', '1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', '1 teaspoon white vinegar', 'salt to taste', '3 cups lard', '1 tablespoon salt', '9 cups masa harina']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place beef and garlic in a large pot.
', 'Step 2: Cover with cold water and bring to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 3: As soon as water boils, reduce heat to a simmer and cover pot.
', 'Step 4: Let simmer for 3 1/2 hours, until beef is tender and shreds easily.
', 'Step 5: When beef is done, remove from pot, reserving 5 cups cooking liquid and discarding garlic.
', 'Step 6: Allow meat to cool slightly, and shred finely with forks.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, place corn husks in a large container and cover with warm water.
', 'Step 8: Allow to soak for 3 hours, until soft and pliable.
', 'Step 9: May need to weight down with an inverted plate and a heavy can.
', 'Step 10: Toast ancho chiles in a cast iron skillet, making sure not to burn them.
', 'Step 11: Allow to cool and then remove stems and seeds.
', 'Step 12: Crumble and grind in a clean coffee grinder or with a mortar and pestle.
', 'Step 13: Heat oil in a large skillet.
', 'Step 14: Mix in flour and allow to brown slightly.
', 'Step 15: Pour in 1 cup beef broth and stir until smooth.
', 'Step 16: Mix in ground chiles, cumin seeds, ground cumin, minced garlic, oregano, red pepper flakes, vinegar and salt.
', 'Step 17: Stir shredded beef into skillet and cover.
', 'Step 18: Let simmer 45 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Place lard and salt in a large mixing bowl.
', 'Step 20: Whip with an electric mixer on high speed until fluffy.
', 'Step 21: Add masa harina and beat at low speed until well mixed.
', 'Step 22: Pour in reserved cooking liquid a little at a time until mixture is the consistency of soft cookie dough.
', 'Step 23: Drain water from corn husks.
', 'Step 24: One at a time, flatten out each husk, with the narrow end facing you, and spread approximately 2 tablespoons masa mixture onto the top 2/3 of the husk.
', 'Step 25: Spread about 1 tablespoon of meat mixture down the middle of the masa.
', 'Step 26: Roll up the corn husk starting at one of the long sides.
', "Step 27: Fold the narrow end of the husk onto the rolled tamale and tie with a piece of butchers' twine.
", 'Step 28: Place tamales in a steamer basket.
', 'Step 29: Steam over boiling water for approximately one hour, until masa is firm and holds its shape.
', 'Step 30: Make sure steamer does not run out of water.
', 'Step 31: Serve immediately, allowing each person to unwrap their own tamales.
', 'Step 32: Allow any leftovers (still in husks) to cool, uncovered, in the refrigerator.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '346.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '23.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '38 mg', 'fatContent': '24.4 g', 'fiberContent': '3.2 g', 'proteinContent': '9.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '9.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '247.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.2 g'}

Title: Chipotle Barbacoa
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 (2 pound) beef chuck roast, trimmed and cut into 4 to 6 pieces', '⅓ cup apple cider', '4 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '3 tablespoons lime juice', '4 cloves garlic, peeled, or more to taste', '4 teaspoons cumin', '1 serrano chile pepper, chopped', '1 tablespoon ground cayenne pepper, or more to taste', '2 ½ teaspoons dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground cloves', '1 cup chicken broth', '1 small onion, finely chopped', '3 bay leaves']

', 'Step 5: Pour over beef in the slow cooker.
', 'Step 6: Stir chicken broth, onion, and bay leaves into the slow cooker.
', 'Step 7: Cook on Low until beef is fork-tender, 6 to 8 hours.
', 'Step 8: Shred beef using 2 forks.
']

Title: Black Bean and Rice Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '1 onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chilies', '¼ cup picante sauce', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '2 cups cooked brown rice', '8 (6 inch) flour tortillas, warmed', '1 cup salsa', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', '¼ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']

', 'Step 12: Uncover and sprinkle with cilantro and 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 13: Bake until cheese is melted, 2 to 3 minutes.
']

Title: Terrific Turkey Chili
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '1 ½ pounds ground turkey', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon chili pepper flakes', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can beef broth', '1 (7 ounce) can salsa', '1 (14.5 ounce) can crushed tomatoes, or coarsely chopped tomatoes packed in puree', '1 (7 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '1 medium onion, finely chopped', '1 green bell pepper, diced', '3 medium zucchini, halved lengthwise and sliced', '1 bunch green onions, chopped', '1 cup sour cream', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large stock pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Crumble turkey into the pot, stirring with a wooden spoon to break apart as much as possible.
', 'Step 3: Season with taco seasoning mix, coriander, oregano, chili flakes, and tomato paste, and mix until meat is evenly coated with seasonings.
', 'Step 4: Continue cooking, reducing heat if necessary, until turkey is well browned.
', 'Step 5: Pour in beef broth, and simmer to reduce liquid slightly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add salsa, tomatoes, and green chilies, and continue cooking at a moderate simmer for ten minutes.
', 'Step 7: Adjust the thickness at any time you feel necessary by adding water.
', 'Step 8: While chili is still cooking, heat one tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 9: Cook onion and green bell pepper, stirring occasionally for 5 minutes, or until onion is translucent and bell pepper is lightly browned.
', 'Step 10: Add onion and bell pepper to the chili, and continue cooking at a very low simmer.
', 'Step 11: In the same skillet, heat the remaining tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 12: Add the zucchini, and cook stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes, or until lightly browned.
', 'Step 13: Add the zucchini to the chili, reduce heat, and continue cooking 15 minutes more.
', 'Step 14: Again, adjust the consistency with water as needed.
', 'Step 15: Ladle chili into serving bowls.
', 'Step 16: Top with sour cream, green onion, and cheddar cheese, and serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '506.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '24.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '124.8 mg', 'fatContent': '31.9 g', 'fiberContent': '5.5 g', 'proteinContent': '34.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '13.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '1521.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '7.5 g'}

Title: Chicken Fiesta Salad
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 (1.27 ounce) packet dry fajita seasoning, divided', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (11 ounce) can Mexican-style corn', '½ cup salsa', '1 (10 ounce) package mixed salad greens', '1 onion, chopped', '1 tomato, cut into wedges']

['Step 1: Rub chicken evenly with 1/2 the fajita seasoning.
', 'Step 2: Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat, and cook the chicken 8 minutes on each side, or until juices run clear; set aside.
', 'Step 3: In a large saucepan, mix beans, corn, salsa and other 1/2 of fajita seasoning.
', 'Step 4: Heat over medium heat until warm.
', 'Step 5: Prepare the salad by tossing the greens, onion and tomato.
', 'Step 6: Top salad with chicken and dress with the bean and corn mixture.
']

Title: Shrimp Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 onion, sliced', '1 red bell pepper, sliced', '1 green bell pepper, sliced', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '1 lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil, or as needed', '6 large flour tortillas', '3 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir onion, red bell pepper, and green bell pepper in the hot oil, stirring frequently, until onion is translucent and peppers are soft, 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir salt, cumin, and chili powder into onion and bell peppers.
', 'Step 4: Stir shrimp into onion and bell peppers and cook until shrimp are opaque and no longer pink in the center, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove skillet from heat; stir jalapeno pepper and lime juice into shrimp mixture.
', 'Step 6: Heat a skillet over medium heat and brush with about 1 teaspoon vegetable oil.
', 'Step 7: Place a tortilla in the hot oil.
', 'Step 8: Spoon about 1/6 shrimp filling and 1/2 cup Mexican cheese blend on one side of tortilla.
', 'Step 9: Fold tortilla in half.
', 'Step 10: Cook until bottom of tortilla is lightly browned, about 5 minutes; flip and cook other side until lightly browned, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.
']

', 'Step 2: Blend until fairly smooth.
', 'Step 3: Heat the bean mixture in a saucepan over medium heat until thoroughly heated.
', 'Step 4: Ladle soup into 4 individual bowls, and top each bowl with 1 tablespoon of the sour cream and 1/2 tablespoon green onion.
']

Title: Spicy Fish Soup
Ingredients: ['½ onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 ½ cups chicken broth', '1 (4 ounce) can canned green chile peppers, chopped', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 ½ cups canned peeled and diced tomatoes', '½ cup chopped green bell pepper', '½ cup shrimp', '½ pound cod fillets', '¾ cup plain nonfat yogurt']

['Step 1: Spray a large saucepan with the vegetable cooking spray over medium high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add the onions and saute, stirring often, for about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add the garlic and chili powder and saute for 2 more minutes.
', 'Step 4: Then add the chicken broth, chile peppers and cumin, stirring well.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Next, add the tomatoes, green bell pepper, shrimp and cod.
', 'Step 7: Return to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for another 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Gradually stir in the yogurt until heated through.
']

Title: Taco Tuesday Casserole
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 pounds ground beef', '½ cup diced onion', '1 ½ cups water', '9 tablespoons taco seasoning mix', '5 flour tortillas', '1 (10 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '8 corn tortilla chips, or more to taste', '¼ cup diced tomatoes, or to taste', '2 tablespoons chopped olives, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until almost browned and crumbly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add onion; cook and stir until beef is browned and onion is softened, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Mix water and taco seasoning into beef mixture; simmer until water evaporates, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Line the prepared baking dish with tortillas and top with 1/2 of the ground beef mixture.
', 'Step 8: Spoon 1/2 of the corn over the beef layer and top with 1/3 of the Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 9: Crush tortilla chips over cheese layer.
', 'Step 10: Repeat layers with remaining ingredients, ending with Cheddar cheese, tomatoes, and olives.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until heated through and cheese is melted, 15 to 20 minutes.
']

Title: Stuffed Mexican Peppers
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '¾ cup water', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '½ cup cooked rice', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon garlic salt', '⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 (8 ounce) cans tomato sauce, divided', '3 large red bell peppers', '6 (1 inch) cubes Colby-Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Place the ground beef into a skillet over medium heat, and brown the meat, breaking it apart into crumbles as it cooks, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Drain excess fat.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the taco seasoning, water, chili powder, cooked rice, salt, garlic salt, black pepper, and 1 can of tomato sauce; mix until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 6: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, cut the bell peppers in half lengthwise, and remove stems, membranes, cores, and seeds.
', 'Step 8: Place a steamer insert into a large saucepan, and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 9: Cover, and bring the water to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 10: Place the peppers into the steamer insert, cover the pan, and steam until just tender, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Place the steamed peppers into the prepared baking dish, and fill lightly with the meat filling.
', 'Step 12: Press 1 cube of Colby-Jack cheese into the center of the filling in each pepper, and spoon the remaining can of tomato sauce over the peppers.
', 'Step 13: Cover the dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until the peppers are tender and the filling is hot, 25 to 30 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '321.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '17.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '73 mg', 'fatContent': '18.5 g', 'fiberContent': '3.1 g', 'proteinContent': '21.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '9.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '1182.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '7.1 g'}

Title: Aguachile
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ cups fresh squeezed lime juice', '4 fresh serrano chiles', '⅓ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 ½ teaspoons salt, divided, or to taste', '1 pound large shrimp - peeled, deveined and butterflied', '1 small red onion, thinly sliced', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and sliced', '1 cucumber, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine lime juice, chiles, cilantro, and 1 teaspoon salt in a blender; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 2: Divide shrimp onto 2 shallow plates.
', 'Step 3: Pour chile-lime mixture evenly over the 2 plates of shrimp.
', 'Step 4: Place in the refrigerator and marinate until the shrimp turn opaque and white, 15 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Top each plate with red onion and avocado.
', 'Step 6: Place cucumber around the edges.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle with remaining salt.
']

', 'Step 2: Layer the guacamole on top of the beans.

Title: Authentic Mexican Picadillo
Ingredients: ['6 tomatoes', '¾ cup water', '¼ onion, halved', '1 clove garlic', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '½ onion, chopped', '1 serrano pepper', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 tomato, chopped', '2 pounds lean ground beef', '1 (7.75 ounce) can Mexican-style hot tomato sauce (such as El Pato®)', '3 potatoes, peeled and cubed', '3 medium carrots, peeled and cubed', '1 jalapeno pepper, sliced', '2 tablespoons chicken bouillon granules', '½ tablespoon ground cumin', '1 bay leaf', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring 6 whole tomatoes to a boil in a small pot.
', 'Step 2: Transfer to a blender.
', 'Step 3: Add 3/4 cup water, onion halves, and whole garlic clove.
', 'Step 4: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Add chopped onion and serrano pepper.
', 'Step 7: Cook until onion is transparent.
', 'Step 8: Add minced garlic; cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 9: Add chopped tomato and cook for 1 minute more.
', 'Step 10: Add ground beef; cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Pour canned tomato sauce into the beef mixture.
', 'Step 12: Cook for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Mix in potatoes and carrots.
', 'Step 14: Cook for 2 minutes; add the blended tomatoes, jalapeno, chicken bouillon, cumin, and bay leaf.
', 'Step 15: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 16: Mix well, reduce heat, and simmer until most of the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Let sit for 5 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Mexican Beef and Rice Casserole
Ingredients: ['nonstick cooking spray', '1 pound ground beef', '1 yellow onion, diced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained', '1 (14 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '1 bunch fresh spinach, trimmed and coarsely chopped', '2 cups low-sodium chicken broth', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided', '1 cup long-grain rice', '1 cup red salsa']

Title: Jalapeno and Cucumber Margarita
Ingredients: ['½ cup tequila, or more to taste', '½ cup fresh lime juice', '¼ cup orange liqueur', '¼ cup simple syrup', '1 jalapeno pepper, halved and seeded', '4 thin slices cucumber, or more to taste', '4 wedges lime', '2 tablespoons kosher salt, or as needed', 'ice, as needed', '4 slices cucumber']

Title: Mexican-Style Air Fryer Stuffed Chicken Breasts
Ingredients: ['4 extra-long toothpicks', '4 teaspoons chili powder, divided', '4 teaspoons ground cumin, divided', '1 skinless, boneless chicken breast', '2 teaspoons chipotle flakes', '2 teaspoons Mexican oregano', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ red bell pepper, sliced into thin strips', '½ onion, sliced into thin strips', '1 fresh jalapeno pepper, sliced into thin strips', '2 teaspoons corn oil', '½ lime, juiced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place toothpicks in a small bowl and cover with water; let them soak to keep them from burning while cooking.
', 'Step 2: Mix 2 teaspoons chili powder and 2 teaspoons cumin in a shallow dish.
', 'Step 3: Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Place chicken breast on a flat work surface.
', 'Step 5: Slice horizontally through the middle.
', 'Step 6: Pound each half using a kitchen mallet or rolling pin until about 1/4-inch thick.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle each breast half equally with remaining chili powder, remaining cumin, chipotle flakes, oregano, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Place 1/2 the bell pepper, onion, and jalapeno in the center of 1 breast half.
', 'Step 9: Roll the chicken from the tapered end upward and use 2 toothpicks to secure.
', 'Step 10: Repeat with other breast, spices, and vegetables and secure with remaining toothpicks.
', 'Step 11: Roll each roll-up in the chili-cumin mixture in the shallow dish while drizzling with olive oil until evenly covered.
', 'Step 12: Place roll-ups in the air-fryer basket with the toothpick side facing up.
', 'Step 13: Set timer for 6 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Turn roll-ups over.
', 'Step 15: Continue cooking in the air fryer until juices run clear and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 16: Drizzle lime juice evenly on roll-ups before serving.
']

Title: Arrachera (Mexican Skirt Steak for Tacos)
Ingredients: ['2 pounds thinly sliced skirt steaks (arrachera)', '2 limes, juiced', '3 (.18 ounce) packets sazon with coriander and annatto', '1 tablespoon adobo seasoning (such as Goya® All-Purpose Seasoning with Cumin)', '1 small onion, chopped', '1 (12 fluid ounce) bottle Mexican beer']

['Step 1: Place a single layer of steak in a shallow casserole dish.
', 'Step 2: Sprinkle a portion of lime juice, sazon, and adobo seasoning.
', 'Step 3: Top with chopped onion pieces.
', 'Step 4: Repeat layers until all pieces of steak are seasoned.
', 'Step 5: Pour beer over the mixture.
', 'Step 6: Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 24 hours.
', 'Step 7: Preheat a grill to medium-high.
', 'Step 8: Discard marinade.
', 'Step 9: Grill steak until lightly charred on the outside but still slightly tender in the center for medium doneness, 6 to 7 minutes per side.
']

Title: Empanadas
Ingredients: ['½ cup butter, softened', '1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese', '1 cup sifted all-purpose flour', '1 cup fruit preserves', '⅓ cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: DAY BEFORE: Cream butter and cream cheese together until smoothly blended.
', 'Step 2: Beat in the flour.
', 'Step 3: Shape dough into a smooth ball, wrap in foil or cling wrap, and refrigerate overnight or up to a week.
', 'Step 4: AT BAKING TIME: Remove dough from refrigerator 30 minutes before using.
', 'Step 5: Start heating oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Roll chilled dough thin.
', 'Step 7: Cut with 3 or 4 inch round cookie cutter.
', 'Step 8: Place small spoonful of jam in center of each round, moisten edges with water.
', 'Step 9: Fold round over and press edges together.
', 'Step 10: Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 15 to 20 minutes.
', "Step 11: Immediately roll in sugar mixed with cinnamon (traditional) OR in confectioners' sugar if preferred.
"]
