Title: Authentic Enchiladas Verdes
Ingredients: ['2 bone-in chicken breast halves', '2 cups chicken broth', '¼ white onion', '1 clove garlic', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 pound fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '5 serrano peppers', '¼ white onion', '1 clove garlic', '1 pinch salt', '12 corn tortillas', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '1 cup crumbled queso fresco', '½ white onion, chopped', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a saucepan, combine chicken breast with chicken broth, one quarter onion, a clove of garlic, and 2 teaspoons salt.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, and then boil for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Reserve broth, set chicken aside to cool, and discard onion and garlic.
', 'Step 4: When cool enough to handle, shred chicken with your hands.
', 'Step 5: Place tomatillos and serrano chiles in a pot with water, enough to cover them.
', 'Step 6: Bring to boil, and continue boiling until tomatillos turn a different shade of green (from bright green to a dull, army green).
', 'Step 7: Strain tomatillos and chiles, and place in a blender with another quarter piece of onion, 1 clove garlic, and a pinch of salt.
', 'Step 8: Pour in reserved chicken broth, so that liquid just covers the veggies in the blender by about an inch.
', 'Step 9: Blend all ingredients until they are completely pureed.
', 'Step 10: Pour salsa in a medium saucepan, and bring to a low boil.
', 'Step 11: Pour oil in a frying pan, and allow to get very hot.
', 'Step 12: Slightly fry tortillas one by one in hot oil, setting each on a paper towel afterwards to soak some of the oil.
', 'Step 13: Finally, dip slightly fried tortillas in low-boiling green salsa, until tortillas become soft again.
', 'Step 14: Place on plates, 3 per person.
', 'Step 15: Fill or top tortillas with shredded chicken, then extra green sauce.
', 'Step 16: Top with crumbled cheese, chopped onion, and chopped cilantro.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '559.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '48.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '84 mg', 'fatContent': '25 g', 'fiberContent': '8.2 g', 'proteinContent': '37.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '1344 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.7 g'}

Title: Restaurant-Style Taco Meat Seasoning
Ingredients: ['1 ½ tablespoons corn flour', '4 ½ teaspoons chili powder', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon seasoned salt', '½ teaspoon paprika', '¼ teaspoon cumin', '½ teaspoon garlic salt', '¼ teaspoon sugar', '1 teaspoon dried minced onion', '½ teaspoon beef bouillon granules', '¼ teaspoon ground red pepper', '1 ⅓ pounds lean ground chuck', '1 cup water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a medium bowl, combine the corn flour, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, and seasoned salt.
', 'Step 2: Stir in the paprika, cumin, garlic salt, and sugar.
', 'Step 3: Blend in the onion, bouillon, and ground red pepper, stirring until all spices are well blended.
', 'Step 4: Crumble the ground chuck into a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Cook, stirring, until browned.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat, rinse meat with hot water, and drain water and grease from beef.
', 'Step 7: Return meat to skillet, and pour in seasoning.
', 'Step 8: Stir in water.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until most of the liquid has cooked away, about 20 minutes.
']

Title: Shrimp Burritos
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '½ cup chopped onion', '¾ cup long-grain white rice', '¾ teaspoon cumin', '¾ teaspoon garlic salt', '1 ½ cups chicken broth', '½ cup canned diced tomatoes', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '¾ teaspoon garlic salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '12 ounces frozen cooked shrimp without tails, thawed', '2 teaspoons minced garlic', '½ cup plain yogurt', '½ cup mayonnaise', '2 teaspoons pureed chipotle peppers in adobo sauce', '6 (10 inch) flour tortillas, warmed', '3 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '⅓ cup salsa']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add the onion, and cook until tender, stirring frequently.
', 'Step 3: Stir in rice, and season with cumin and 3/4 teaspoon of garlic salt.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir until the rice is lightly toasted, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour in the chicken broth and the diced tomatoes.
', 'Step 6: Bring to a boil, then cover and cook over low heat for 15 to 20 minutes, until all of the liquid has been absorbed.
', 'Step 7: In a small saucepan, stir together the refried beans, 3/4 teaspoon of garlic salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 8: Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally until heated through.
', 'Step 9: Place shrimp in a bowl, and stir in garlic until shrimp is coated.
', 'Step 10: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat, and coat with cooking spray.
', 'Step 11: Saute shrimp until heated through and lightly browned.
', 'Step 12: In a small bowl, stir together the yogurt, mayonnaise, and chipotle peppers until smooth.
', 'Step 13: Refrigerate until ready to use.
', 'Step 14: Place about 1/4 cup of cheese onto each warm tortilla.
', 'Step 15: Then place about 1/2 cup of shrimp on the cheese.
', 'Step 16: Top with 1/4 cup of beans, and 1/4 cup of rice.
', 'Step 17: Spread on about a tablespoon of the chipotle sauce, and salsa to taste.
', 'Step 18: Roll up, and serve.
']

Title: Layered Chicken and Black Bean Enchilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['2 cups diced chicken breast meat', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (4.5 ounce) can diced green chile peppers, drained', '1 (10 ounce) can red enchilada sauce', '8 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '2 cups shredded Mexican blend cheese', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat a large skillet over medium heat, and spray with vegetable cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Saute chicken with cumin and coriander until chicken is cooked through.
', 'Step 4: Transfer to a medium bowl.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the cilantro, black beans, and green chile peppers.
', 'Step 6: Spread half of the enchilada sauce over the bottom of an 11x7 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Place 4 tortillas over the sauce, overlapping if necessary.
', 'Step 8: Spoon half of the chicken mixture over the tortillas, and sprinkle with half of the cheese and half of the sour cream.
', 'Step 9: Spoon the remaining enchilada sauce over the cheese, and make another layer of tortillas.
', 'Step 10: Layer the remaining chicken mixture over the tortillas.
', 'Step 11: Cover dish with a lid or aluminum foil.
', 'Step 12: Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 13: Remove the cover, and sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top and dot with sour cream.
', 'Step 14: Continue cooking, uncovered, for an additional 5 to 10 minutes, or until cheese melts.
', 'Step 15: Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Green Chicken Enchilada

Title: Authentic Mexican Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['6 dried chile de arbol peppers', '1 clove garlic', '1 teaspoon salt', '¾ cup water', '1 cup vegetable oil for frying', '18 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '3 cups crumbled queso fresco', '1 cup sour cream', '1 cup shredded lettuce', '2 medium tomatoes, thinly sliced', '½ cup chopped green onions']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Snap the tops off of the dried chilies, and place in a saucepan with enough water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, and simmer for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain the water, and place chilies into a food processor or blender with the garlic and salt.
', 'Step 4: Puree until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Press sauce through a strainer, and set aside.
', 'Step 6: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Soak each tortilla in the sauce, then place in the hot oil.
', 'Step 8: Turn over almost immediately, and fry for about 5 seconds on the other side.
', 'Step 9: Remove to a plate that is lined with paper towels.
', 'Step 10: The easiest way to do this is to fry the tortillas and stack them directly on top of each other until you have fried them all.
', 'Step 11: This will keep the tortillas pliable until you are ready to fill them.
', 'Step 12: Take one fried tortilla at a time, and fill with about 2 tablespoons of the queso fresco.
', 'Step 13: Roll up, and place seam side down on a plate.
', 'Step 14: Place three of these on each plate.
', 'Step 15: Top in the following order: Start with a layer of sour cream, then a small handful of lettuce, three tomato slices, 2 more tablespoons of queso fresco, and finally, 1 tablespoon of green onions.
']

', 'Step 2: Gradually mix in the shortening and flour.

Title: Easy Keto Beef Tacos

Title: Slow Cooker Creamy Chicken Taco Soup
Ingredients: ['1 serving nonstick cooking spray', '1 cup diced onion', '1 cup diced bell pepper', '2 teaspoons salt, divided', '2 cups chicken broth', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 (10 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles (such as Ortega®)', '2 tablespoons oil', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast', '1 (8 ounce) package Neufchatel cheese, softened']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Spray a slow cooker with cooking spray.
', 'Step 2: Add onions, bell pepper, and 1 teaspoon salt.
', 'Step 3: Stir in chicken broth, diced tomatoes, condensed soup, and chiles.
', 'Step 4: Combine oil, taco seasoning, 1 teaspoon salt, cumin, and black pepper in a bowl.
', 'Step 5: Add chicken and toss to coat on all sides.
', 'Step 6: Transfer to the slow cooker.
', 'Step 7: Cook on Low until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 2 to 3 hours.
', 'Step 8: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Remove from the slow cooker and shred.
', 'Step 10: Add Neufchatel cheese to the slow cooker and stir until melted.
', 'Step 11: Return chicken to the slow cooker and cook until warmed through, 20 to 30 minutes more.
']

Title: Homemade Chicken Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut into strips', '4 tablespoons olive oil, or more as needed', '2 bell peppers, sliced', '1 onion, thinly sliced', '8 (6 inch) flour tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk chili powder, paprika, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, and garlic powder for fajita seasoning together in a small bowl.
', 'Step 2: Trim chicken of any excess fat and place in a large, lidded bowl.
', 'Step 3: Add 2 tablespoons olive oil and sprinkle with about 3/4 of the fajita seasoning.
', 'Step 4: Toss, adding more oil if necessary, until coated.
', 'Step 5: Poke chicken with a knife to allow penetration of seasoning and oil.
', 'Step 6: Place the lid on the bowl and shake until chicken is thoroughly coated.
', 'Step 7: Marinate in the refrigerator, shaking every couple of hours, for 4 to 6 hours.
', 'Step 8: Remove the marinating bowl from the refrigerator and let sit on the counter until chicken is room temperature, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 9: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 10: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Make 2 stacks of 4 tortillas, and wrap each one in aluminum foil.
', 'Step 12: Heat remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Add peppers and onion.
', 'Step 14: Stir in remaining fajita seasoning and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are soft, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 15: While vegetables are cooking, place tortillas in the oven to warm.
', 'Step 16: At the same time, grill chicken, turning halfway through, until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 17: To assemble fajitas, fill warmed tortillas with chicken, peppers, and onions.
']

Title: Shredded Beef Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['3 pounds beef chuck roast', '¼ cup water', '1 ½ cups beef broth', '3 tablespoons red wine vinegar', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 large onion, chopped', '2 (4 ounce) cans chopped green chile peppers', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '2 cups sour cream', '3 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '1 cup oil for frying', '20 (6 inch) corn tortillas']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place roast in a large saucepan that has a tight-fitting lid.
', 'Step 2: Pour in water, cover, and simmer on low for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Increase heat to medium/high, and brown the roast on all sides.
', 'Step 4: Once the water has boiled away, pour in the beef broth, vinegar, chili powder and 1 tablespoon of cumin.
', 'Step 5: Cover tightly and reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 6: Simmer for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until the beef falls apart when you try to pick it up.
', 'Step 7: Shred the beef, using 2 forks or your fingers.
', 'Step 8: Place shredded beef back into the saucepan with all the juices, and let cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 9: In a large skillet, saute the onion until just soft, not browned.
', 'Step 10: Mix in flour and green chilies.
', 'Step 11: Stir constantly for 2 minutes to cook the flour taste out.
', 'Step 12: Stir in sour cream and 2 cups of Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 13: Cook on low for 10 minutes, stirring often, until the cheese is all melted and mixed.
', 'Step 14: Set aside and let cool.
', 'Step 15: In a large heavy skillet, heat the olive oil.
', 'Step 16: Using tongs dip the tortillas, one at a time, into the oil for 30 seconds each side.
', 'Step 17: Drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 18: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 19: Spread 4 tablespoons of sour cream mixture down the center of the tortilla.
', 'Step 20: Top with about the same amount of beef.
', 'Step 21: Roll up and place seam side down in one or two 8x11 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 22: Repeat for each tortilla.
', 'Step 23: Continue until you are out of the filling.
', 'Step 24: Sprinkle with remaining Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 25: Bake in a pre-heated oven for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbling.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '576.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '30.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '112.3 mg', 'fatContent': '38 g', 'fiberContent': '4.4 g', 'proteinContent': '30 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '18.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '666.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.2 g'}

Title: Mexican Chicken Soup

Title: California Tacos

Title: Beef Fajitas
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil', '1 lime, juiced', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons finely chopped onion', '3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 (8 ounce) boneless New York strip steaks, cut into thin strips', '8 (6 inch) white corn tortillas, or more as needed', '1 (8 ounce) jar salsa', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend']

Title: Easy Mexican Pork Burritos
Ingredients: ['3 pounds bone-in pork shoulder roast', '1 onion, sliced', '6 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '6 cups water, or as needed to cover', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (16 ounce) can refried beans', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles, or to taste', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 (16 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese', '20 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '¼ cup vegetable oil, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring pork shoulder roast, onion, garlic, and 1 package taco seasoning to a boil in a large pot with enough water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender and no longer pink in the center, 2 to 3 hours.
', 'Step 3: Check water level every 45 minutes, adding more as needed.
', 'Step 4: Reserve about 1 cup cooking liquid.
', 'Step 5: Shred pork with a fork, discarding excess fat and bone.
', 'Step 6: Stir in tomatoes, refried beans, green chiles, and remaining package of taco seasoning.
', 'Step 7: If the mixture is too dry, add reserved cooking liquid.
', 'Step 8: Spread pork mixture evenly down the center of each tortilla; sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 9: Fold bottom and top edges of each tortilla over filling; roll sides up to enclose filling completely.
', 'Step 10: Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil a large skillet over medium heat; fry burritos in batches, seam sides down, until tortillas are golden, about 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 11: Drain fried burritos on a paper towel-lined plate.
']

Title: Vegan Bean Taco Filling

', 'Step 2: Stir in onion, garlic, and bell pepper; cook until tender.

Title: Real Chiles Rellenos
Ingredients: ['4 large poblano peppers', '½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese', '½ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '¼ cup all-purpose flour for dredging', '1 (14.5 ounce) can Mexican-style stewed tomatoes', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '½ onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 ½ cups chicken broth', '2 tablespoons distilled white vinegar', '1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano, crushed', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon black pepper', '½ teaspoon hot pepper sauce (such as Cholula®)', '⅛ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '⅓ cup all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon salt', '5 egg whites at room temperature', '1 egg yolk, beaten', '¼ cup all-purpose flour for dredging', '1 cup oil for frying, or as needed', 'sour cream for garnish']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack at about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, and place the peppers onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 8 to 10 minutes per side.
', 'Step 4: When the peppers are about 80 percent blackened, place them a plastic bag, seal, and allow the peppers to steam as they cool, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Once cool, remove the skins and discard.
', 'Step 6: Cut a slit lengthwise into the side of each pepper, and remove seeds and veins.
', 'Step 7: To reduce spiciness, rinse out any remaining seeds with water.
', 'Step 8: Pat the peppers dry with paper towels.
', 'Step 9: Mix together the shredded mozzarella, Monterey Jack, and Cheddar cheese in a bowl until thoroughly blended.
', 'Step 10: Divide the cheese into 4 portions, and squeeze each portion lightly in your hands to make a cone shape.
', 'Step 11: Insert a cone into the slit in each pepper, and pin the openings closed with toothpicks.
', 'Step 12: Dredge each pepper in flour, dust off the excess, and place on a small baking sheet lined with parchment paper or waxed paper.
', 'Step 13: Place the peppers in the freezer for at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 14: To make sauce, blend the stewed tomatoes in a blender until pureed, and set aside.
', 'Step 15: Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat, and cook and stir the onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Add the garlic, cook and stir for about 30 seconds, and pour in the pureed tomatoes, chicken broth, vinegar, oregano, cumin, black pepper, hot pepper sauce, and cinnamon.
', 'Step 17: Reduce to medium-low, and simmer the sauce until reduced by half and thickened, about 20 minutes, stirring often.
', 'Step 18: Preheat an oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C), and warm a platter in the oven.
', 'Step 19: To make batter and finish the chiles rellenos, mix 1/3 cup flour with salt in a bowl.
', 'Step 20: In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric mixer until the whites form stiff peaks.
', 'Step 21: Lightly mix the egg yolk and flour-salt mixture into the egg whites to make a fluffy batter.
', 'Step 22: Remove peppers from freezer and coat them in flour again; shake off excess flour, and dip each pepper into the egg batter, using a spoon to gently but completely coat each pepper with batter.
', 'Step 23: Heat frying oil in a heavy cast iron skillet over medium-high heat until the oil shimmers.
', 'Step 24: Gently lay the coated peppers into the hot oil, and fry on both sides until the batter is golden brown and the cheese filling is hot, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 25: Remove peppers to warmed platter while you finish frying.
', 'Step 26: To serve, ladle a generous spoonful of sauce onto plate, and place pepper on sauce.
', 'Step 27: Serve peppers hot with a dollop of sour cream.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '423.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '34.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '91.1 mg', 'fatContent': '23.1 g', 'fiberContent': '4.9 g', 'proteinContent': '21.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '9.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '1239.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.9 g'}

Title: Lime Chicken Soft Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast meat - cubed', '⅛ cup red wine vinegar', '½ lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 green onions, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '10 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '1 tomato, diced', '¼ cup shredded lettuce', '¼ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '¼ cup salsa']

', 'Step 5: Place a tortilla in the pan, warm, and turn over to heat the other side.
', 'Step 6: Repeat with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 7: Serve lime chicken mixture in warm tortillas topped with tomato, lettuce, cheese and salsa.
']

Title: Easy Mexican Sopes
Ingredients: ['3 cups masa harina', '1 tablespoon salt', '2 cups warm water, or as needed', '1 quart oil for frying']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk masa harina and salt together; stir enough water into mixture until dough is smooth and holds together.
', 'Step 2: Form dough into 2-inch balls.
', 'Step 3: Flatten each ball to a 1/2-inch thick circle.
', 'Step 4: Heat oil to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) in a deep-fryer or large saucepan.
', 'Step 5: Fry dough in the hot oil until sopes are just lightly browned, about 30 seconds per side.
', 'Step 6: Remove sopes with tongs and place on a paper towel-lined plate; cool just until sopes can be handled.
', "Step 7: Pinch the edges of each sope together forming little 'boats'.
", 'Step 8: Return to hot oil and fry until golden and cooked through, 1 to 2 minutes.
']

Title: Seafood Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 onion, chopped', '1 tablespoon butter', '½ pound fresh crabmeat', '¼ pound shrimp - peeled, deveined and coarsely chopped', '8 ounces Colby cheese', '6 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '1 cup half-and-half cream', '½ cup sour cream', '¼ cup butter, melted', '1 ½ teaspoons dried parsley', '½ teaspoon garlic salt']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a large skillet, saute onions in 1 tablespoon butter until transparent.
', 'Step 3: Remove the skillet from heat and stir in crabmeat and shrimp.
', 'Step 4: Shred the cheese and mix half of it into the seafood.
', 'Step 5: Place a large spoonful of the mixture into each tortilla.
', 'Step 6: Roll the tortillas up around the mixture and arrange the rolled tortillas in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 7: In a saucepan over medium-low heat, combine half-and-half, sour cream, 1/4 cup butter, parsley and garlic salt.
', 'Step 8: Stir until the mixture is lukewarm and blended.
', 'Step 9: Pour sauce over the enchiladas, and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 10: Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes.
']

Title: South Texas Carne Guisada
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 pounds beef sirloin, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 large red bell pepper, chopped', '4 large tomatoes, chopped', '5 cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried, crushed Mexican oregano', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon paprika', '⅓ cup water']

', 'Step 4: Continue cooking, stirring often, until the meat is tender, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Mexican Style Cornbread
Ingredients: ['2 eggs', '¼ cup corn oil', '1 cup buttermilk', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (8 ounce) can cream-style corn', '1 large onion, chopped', '2 fresh jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced', '1 cup cornmeal', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '½ teaspoon salt']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease an 8 inch square baking dish or a cast iron skillet.
', 'Step 3: In a small bowl, beat eggs.
', 'Step 4: Mix in corn oil and buttermilk.
', 'Step 5: Stir in 1 cup shredded cheese, creamed corn, onion, and jalapenos.
', 'Step 6: In a large bowl, whisk together cornmeal, flour, baking powder, soda, and salt.
', 'Step 7: Stir the egg mixture into the dry ingredients.
', 'Step 8: Mix well.
', 'Step 9: Pour batter into prepared pan.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup cheese on top.
', 'Step 11: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes until center is set and top is golden brown.
']

Title: Beef Enchiladas with Spicy Red Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '½ cup finely chopped onion', '4 teaspoons minced garlic', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '3 ½ teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon dried basil', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried cilantro', '½ cup prepared salsa', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '2 cups chicken broth', '1 pound ground beef', '¾ cup finely chopped onion', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ cup prepared red enchilada sauce', '½ cup beef broth', '½ cup shredded Mexican-style cheese blend', 'cooking spray', '8 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Mexican-style cheese blend', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: To make the spicy red sauce, heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat, and cook and stir 1/2 cup of onion until the onion is softened, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Stir in 4 teaspoons of garlic, and cook and stir until fragrant, another 3 to 5 minutes, watching carefully to avoid burning the garlic.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the oregano, 3 1/2 teaspoons of chili powder, basil, salt and black pepper, 1 teaspoon of cumin, the dried cilantro, salsa, tomato sauce, tomato paste, and chicken broth until the sauce is smoothly combined.
', 'Step 4: Bring the sauce to a simmer, reduce heat to low, and simmer about 30 minutes, stirring often, until the flavors have blended and the sauce has thickened slightly.
', 'Step 5: While spicy red sauce is simmering, cook and stir the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat until the meat is evenly browned.
', 'Step 6: Break the meat up into crumbles as it cooks, and drain off excess grease.
', 'Step 7: Mix in 3/4 cup of onion, 1 tablespoon of garlic, 1/2 teaspoon of chili powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of cumin into the meat, and cook and stir until the onions are softened and the meat mixture is fragrant with spices, 5 to 10 more minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the enchilada sauce and beef broth; simmer for 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir in 1/2 cup of Mexican cheese blend, and allow the cheese to melt into the meat sauce.
', 'Step 10: Reduce heat to low, and simmer the meat sauce for 30 more minutes to thicken.
', 'Step 11: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 13: Spray both sides of each tortilla with cooking spray, stack up the tortillas with a piece of aluminum foil between each tortilla, and wrap the stack with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 14: Place the tortillas into the preheated oven to warm, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Spread about 1/2 cup of the spicy red sauce over the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 16: Fill each tortilla with the meat sauce, reserving about 1/2 cup of the meat sauce; roll the tortillas into enchiladas, and arrange in the baking dish, seam sides down.
', 'Step 17: Pour the remaining spicy red sauce over the enchiladas.
', 'Step 18: Sprinkle with the reserved 1/2 cup of meat mixture, and top with remaining 2 cups of Mexican cheese blend.
', 'Step 19: Bake until the cheese topping is golden brown and the sauce is bubbly, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Remove from oven and sprinkle with cilantro to serve.
']

Title: Impossible Cake
Ingredients: ["¼ cup cajeta, sweetened caramelized goat's milk syrup", '1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '6 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '½ cup butter, softened', '2 ½ tablespoons butter, softened', '1 cup white sugar', '1 egg', '2 tablespoons strong brewed coffee', '1 cup whole milk', '2 ½ cups evaporated milk', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '4 eggs', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease the base and sides of a 10-inch fluted tube pan.
', 'Step 3: Dust lightly with flour; tap to remove excess.
', 'Step 4: Fill a shallow baking pan with enough water to come 1/3 of the way up the sides of the tube pan.
', 'Step 5: Place water bath in the oven to warm up while it is preheating.
', 'Step 6: Pour caramel sauce into a microwave-safe bowl.
', 'Step 7: Microwave until warm and pourable, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 8: Pour into the prepared tube pan, covering the base completely.
', 'Step 9: Mix flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and baking powder together in a bowl.
', 'Step 10: Beat 1/2 cup plus 2 1/2 tablespoons butter in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth.
', 'Step 11: Add sugar; beat until light and fluffy.
', 'Step 12: Beat in 1 egg and coffee.
', 'Step 13: Alternate adding flour mixture and milk, mixing well between additions.
', 'Step 14: Pour cake batter evenly over caramel in the tube pan.
', 'Step 15: Combine evaporated milk, condensed milk, 4 eggs, and vanilla extract in the bowl of a food processor; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 16: Pour over cake batter through a fine sieve.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the water bath in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the chocolate cake comes out clean, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 18: Let cake cool, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 19: Carefully run a thin knife around the edges to loosen the cake, cover with a serving plate, and flip onto the plate.
']

Title: Taco in a Bag
Ingredients: ['1 pound lean ground beef', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '4 (2.5 ounce) packages corn chips', '2 cups shredded lettuce', '1 chopped fresh tomato', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '⅓ cup salsa', '½ cup sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place ground beef in a large skillet.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir over medium heat until browned.
', 'Step 3: Drain excess oil.
', 'Step 4: Mix in the taco seasoning and prepare according to the directions on the package.
', 'Step 5: With the bags unopened, gently crush the corn chips.
', 'Step 6: Snip the corners off the bags using scissors and slit open the bags along the side edge.
', 'Step 7: Spoon equal amounts of the beef mixture, lettuce, tomato, Cheddar cheese, salsa and sour cream into the bags on top of the crushed chips.
', 'Step 8: Serve in the bag and eat using a fork.
']

Title: Birria de Res Tacos (Beef Birria Tacos)
Ingredients: ['6 dried guajillo chile peppers, seeded', '2 dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded', '4 dried chile de arbol peppers, stemmed and seeded', '4 pounds beef chuck roast', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed', '4 Roma tomatoes', '2 tablespoons white vinegar', '2 garlic cloves', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '4 whole cloves', '1 pinch ground cinnamon', '1 pinch ground cumin', '1 pinch ground thyme', '1 pinch dried marjoram', '1 pinch dried oregano', '18 corn tortillas', '1 large white onion, finely chopped', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Fill a pot with water and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Add guajillo, ancho, and arbol chile peppers; boil for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove pot from heat and allow peppers to soak until cool.
', 'Step 4: Drain, reserving 1/4 cup of the water.
', 'Step 5: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Rinse meat and pat dry with paper towels.
', 'Step 7: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 9: Add meat and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 11: Line a heavy cast-iron grill pan or griddle with aluminum foil and place over high heat.
', 'Step 12: Arrange tomatoes in a single layer on top.
', 'Step 13: Grill until tomato skin is burned on all sides and begins to peel, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Combine soaked chile peppers, cooked tomatoes, vinegar, garlic, 2 teaspoons black pepper, cloves, cinnamon, cumin, thyme, marjoram, oregano, and salt to taste in a blender.
', 'Step 15: Pour in reserved 1/4 cup of chile water; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 16: Strain chile sauce through a mesh strainer and pour over the browned meat in the Dutch oven, turning roast so it is completely covered with sauce.
', 'Step 17: Cover the Dutch oven and place in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 18: Bake, basting meat every 45 minutes with the sauce, until birria begins to fall apart, 3 to 4 hours.
', 'Step 19: Remove lid and bake uncovered until birria is crispy on top, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Remove from oven, cover with 2 layers of aluminum foil, and allow to rest in a warm area for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Meanwhile, warm tortillas on a griddle.
', 'Step 22: Fill each tortilla with birria and top with chopped onion and cilantro.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '739.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '55.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '137.5 mg', 'fatContent': '37 g', 'fiberContent': '8.3 g', 'proteinContent': '44.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '14 g', 'sodiumContent': '165.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '3 g'}

Title: Easy Tamale Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 small onion, chopped', '2 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans, rinsed and drained', '2 (15 ounce) cans crushed tomatoes', '1 (15 ounce) can cream-style corn', '1 (6 ounce) box cornbread mix', '1 egg, lightly beaten', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 4: Season beef with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Stir onion into the ground beef; cook and stir for 1 minute and immediately remove skillet from heat.
', 'Step 6: Stir pinto beans and crushed tomatoes into the beef mixture.
', 'Step 7: Beat cream-style corn, cornbread mix, and egg together in a bowl until smooth; spread over the top of the ground beef mixture in the skillet.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle Cheddar cheese over the corn mixture.
', 'Step 9: Bake in preheated oven until the cheese is melted and the cornbread is set in the middle, about 25 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '515.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '56.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '98.6 mg', 'fatContent': '21 g', 'fiberContent': '9 g', 'proteinContent': '27.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '8.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '1402.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.8 g'}

Title: Homemade Enchilada Sauce
Ingredients: ['¼ cup vegetable oil', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 cup water, or more if needed', '¼ teaspoon cumin', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir flour and chili powder into the oil; cook and stir until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Gradually stir tomato sauce, water, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, and brown sugar into the flour mixture, respectively.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to low and cook until thickened, about 10 minutes.
']

Title: Quick Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['¼ cup reduced-fat sour cream', '2 tablespoons lime juice', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 jalapeno pepper, halved lengthwise', '2 ½ cups shredded red cabbage', '4 green onions, thinly sliced', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 pound tilapia fillets, cut into strips', '8 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix sour cream and lime juice together in a large bowl; season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 2: Reserve about half the mixture in another bowl for serving.
', 'Step 3: Mince half the jalapeno pepper; save other half for later.
', 'Step 4: Toss cabbage, green onions, and minced jalapeno half in remaining sour cream mixture until slaw is well mixed.
', 'Step 5: Heat olive oil and remaining jalapeno half in a large skillet over medium heat; swirl oil to coat skillet evenly.
', 'Step 6: Season tilapia fillets with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Pan-fry fish strips in the skillet in 2 batches until fish is golden brown and easily flaked with a fork, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Discard jalapeno half.
', 'Step 9: Heat tortillas in the microwave on high until warm, 20 to 30 seconds.
', 'Step 10: Serve fish in warmed tortillas topped with cabbage slaw, reserved sour cream mixture, and cilantro.
']

Title: DASH Diet Mexican Bake
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups cooked rice, preferably brown', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut in bite-sized pieces', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans no-salt-added tomatoes, diced or crushed', '1 (15 ounce) can no-salt-added black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 cup frozen yellow corn kernels', '1 cup chopped red bell pepper', '1 cup chopped poblano pepper', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon cumin', '4 garlic cloves, crushed', '1 cup shredded reduced-fat Monterey Jack cheese', '¼ cup jalapeno pepper slices']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
', 'Step 2: Spread rice in a shallow 3-quart casserole.
', 'Step 3: Top with chicken.
', 'Step 4: In a bowl, combine tomatoes, beans, corn, peppers, seasonings and garlic; pour over chicken.
', 'Step 5: Top with cheese and optional jalapeno.
', 'Step 6: Bake 45 minutes.
']

Title: Chile Colorado
Ingredients: ['9 New Mexico dry chiles - washed, with stems and seeds removed', '3 cups water', '5 pounds boneless beef chuck roast, trimmed of fat', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '1 tablespoon black pepper', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large yellow onion, chopped', '2 cups beef stock or water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chiles and 3 cups water into a medium stockpot, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Remove from heat and steep for 30 minutes to soften.
', 'Step 3: Strain into a bowl, reserving the cooking liquid.
', 'Step 4: Place the chiles and some of the liquid into a blender, and puree until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Add more liquid as necessary to form a smooth sauce.
', 'Step 6: Pass sauce through a fine mesh strainer to remove any seeds and the tough skins; set aside.
', 'Step 7: Cut the roast into 1 to 2 inch chunks.
', 'Step 8: In a medium bowl, combine flour, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 9: Dredge the beef chunks in the seasoned flour; set aside.
', 'Step 10: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Saute onion until tender and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add beef chunks a few at a time, so as not to overcrowd the pot, and cook until evenly brown.
', 'Step 13: Remove cooked meat, and continue browning remaining meat.
', 'Step 14: Return reserved cooked meat to the pot.
', 'Step 15: Stir in pureed chile mixture.
', 'Step 16: Add beef stock to just cover beef chunks, or to personal preference.
', 'Step 17: Bring to a boil over medium heat.
', 'Step 18: Reduce heat to lowest setting, and simmer for 3 hours, or until meat is tender.
', 'Step 19: If necessary, adjust with more stock during cooking.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '543.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '6.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '136.1 mg', 'fatContent': '41.6 g', 'fiberContent': '0.7 g', 'proteinContent': '33.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '15.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '624.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '1 g'}

Title: Mexican Shrimp Cocktail
Ingredients: ['2 pounds cooked shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1 tablespoon crushed garlic', '½ cup finely chopped red onion', '¼ cup fresh cilantro, chopped', '1 ½ cups tomato and clam juice cocktail', '¼ cup ketchup', '¼ cup fresh lime juice', '1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce, or to taste', '¼ cup prepared horseradish', 'salt to taste', '1 ripe avocado - peeled, pitted and chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the shrimp in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Stir garlic, red onion, and cilantro.
', 'Step 3: Mix in tomato and clam juice cocktail, ketchup, lime juice, hot pepper sauce, and horseradish.
', 'Step 4: Season with salt.
', 'Step 5: Gently stir in avocado.
', 'Step 6: Cover, and refrigerate 2 to 3 hours.
', 'Step 7: Serve in one large bowl or ladle into individual bowls.
']

Title: Restaurant Style Chicken Nachos

Title: Easy Creamy Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 (10 ounce) can Old El Paso® Red Enchilada Sauce', '2 ½ cups shredded deli rotisserie chicken', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '1 (1 ounce) package fajita seasoning mix*', '10 Old El Paso® flour tortillas for soft tacos & fajitas (6 inch)']

', 'Step 5: Roll up each tortilla tightly; place seam side down in baking dish.

Title: Ranch Taco Soup
Ingredients: ['1 pound lean ground beef', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '2 (15 ounce) cans crushed tomatoes', '2 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans, drained', '2 ½ cups water', '1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 (3.8 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained', '2 tablespoons ranch dressing mix (such as Hidden Valley Ranch®)', '1 (1 ounce) envelope taco seasoning mix']

']

Title: Easy Chicken Posole
Ingredients: ['2 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '4 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '1 onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '2 ½ quarts chicken broth', '3 cups water', '1 teaspoon crumbled dried oregano', '2 teaspoons salt', '4 tablespoons chili powder, or to taste', '3 cups white hominy, rinsed and drained', '10 tostada shells']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons canola oil in a deep skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken breasts, and cook until no longer pink and juices run clear, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from skillet, drain, and cool.
', 'Step 4: When completely cooled, shred chicken with a fork.
', 'Step 5: Heat remaining 2 tablespoons canola oil in the same skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir onion and garlic until soft and transparent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Return shredded chicken to the skillet.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the chicken broth, water, oregano, salt, and chili powder.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook about 90 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir in the hominy and cook until tender, about 15 minutes more.
', 'Step 11: Taste to adjust seasonings, adding more salt and chili powder, if desired.
', 'Step 12: Serve in soup bowls with1 tostada shell per serving.
', 'Step 13: Garnish as desired.
']

Title: Refried Bean and Cheese Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 (16 ounce) cans refried beans', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided', '½ cup chopped onion', '12 small corn tortillas', '2 (10 ounce) cans red enchilada sauce']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch casserole dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Mix refried beans, 1 1/2 cup Mexican cheese blend, and onion in a microwave-safe bowl; heat in microwave until cheese is melted, about 1 minute.

', 'Step 6: Pour enough enchilada sauce onto a small plate to cover.
', 'Step 7: Quickly dip both sides of each tortilla in enchilada sauce.
', 'Step 8: Spoon bean filling down the middle of each dipped tortilla and wrap tortilla around filling.
', 'Step 9: Arrange filled tortillas in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Pour remaining enchilada sauce over filled tortillas and sprinkle remaining cheese over sauce layer.
', 'Step 11: Cover dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbling and cheese is melted, 35 and 40 minutes.
']

Title: Sweet Corn Cake
Ingredients: ['½ cup butter, softened', '⅓ cup masa harina', '¼ cup water', '1 ½ cups frozen whole-kernel corn, thawed', '¼ cup cornmeal', '⅓ cup white sugar', '2 tablespoons heavy whipping cream', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon baking powder']

['Step 1: In a medium bowl beat butter until it is creamy.
', 'Step 2: Add the Mexican corn flour and water and beat until well mixed.

', 'Step 11: Allow to cool for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Use an ice cream scoop for easy removal from pan.
']

Title: Mexican Tomato-Flavored Rice
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 cup long-grain rice', '2 ½ cups water', '1 ½ tablespoons tomato-flavored bouillon powder (such as Knorr®)', '2 dashes onion powder', '2 dashes garlic powder']
Cooking Instructions:

Title: Pressure Cooker Chili
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '2 teaspoons olive oil', '1 sweet onion, chopped', '1 small green bell pepper, finely chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans dark red kidney beans, drained and rinsed', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes, undrained', '3 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 tablespoon dark brown sugar', '2 teaspoons unsweetened cocoa powder', '¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '½ teaspoon kosher salt, or to taste', '2 cups water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the ground beef in the pressure cooker over medium high heat; cook until brown and crumbly, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove the ground beef, and drain off the excess fat.
', 'Step 3: Return the open pressure cooker to the burner over medium heat, pour in the olive oil, and stir in the onion, green pepper, and jalapeno pepper.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir for 3 to 4 minutes, until the onion is translucent.
', 'Step 5: Add the garlic, and cook and stir for about 30 more seconds.
', 'Step 6: Return the meat to the pressure cooker; mix in the kidney beans, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, brown sugar, cocoa powder, red pepper flakes, chili powder, cumin, salt, and water.
', 'Step 7: Lock the lid, bring the cooker up to pressure, reduce heat to maintain pressure, and cook for 8 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove cooker from the heat, and let the pressure reduce on its own, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: When the pressure is fully released, remove the lid, stir the chili, and serve.
']

Title: Mexican Chorizo

['Step 1: Place the pork, Aleppo pepper, chili powder, garlic, salt, black pepper, oregano, cumin, cloves, and coriander into a bowl, and lightly toss the pork with the seasonings until thoroughly blended.

", 'Step 3: Fill a large mixing bowl with ice cubes, and place a smaller metal bowl in the ice cubes to catch the ground meat.
', 'Step 4: Assemble the chilled meat grinder, and grind the pork and seasonings using a coarse cutting plate.
', 'Step 5: Return ground meat to refrigerator for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Lightly stir the ground pork with the vinegar and water until thoroughly mixed, form into patties, and refrigerate overnight, covered, to let flavors develop.
', 'Step 7: Heat vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium-low heat, and pan-fry the patties until browned and no longer pink in the middle, 5 to 8 minutes per side.
']

Title: Charley's Slow Cooker Mexican Style Meat
Ingredients: ['1 (4 pound) chuck roast', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 ¼ cups diced green chile pepper', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '1 (5 ounce) bottle hot pepper sauce', '1 teaspoon garlic powder']

Title: Pastel de Tres Leches (Three Milk Cake)
Ingredients: ['6 eggs, separated', '1 cup white sugar', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon baking powder', '½ cup milk', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk', '1 cup whipped cream', '1 cup sliced fresh strawberries']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 10x15-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Beat egg whites in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on high until stiff peaks form; gradually beat in sugar until mixture is glossy.
', 'Step 4: Beat in egg yolks, one at a time, combining each yolk before adding the next.
', 'Step 5: Reduce mixer speed to medium and add flour, about 1 tablespoon at a time, to the mixture, beating continuously; beat in baking powder, milk, and vanilla extract.
', 'Step 6: Pour batter into prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until cake is lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Let cake cool for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Pour 1 cup cream, sweetened condensed milk, and evaporated milk in a blender and pulse several times until well blended.
', 'Step 10: Pour three-milk mixture evenly over the cake.
', 'Step 11: Refrigerate cake until cold and the milk mixture has soaked in, at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 12: Cut in squares and top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream and a few sliced strawberries.
', 'Step 13: Refrigerate leftovers.
']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

', 'Step 4: Cook, stirring until melted and well blended.

Title: Chile Rellenos
Ingredients: ['12 Anaheim chile peppers, charred and peeled', '1 pound Cheddar cheese, cut into strips', '1 cup milk', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 egg, beaten', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon canola oil', '½ cup all-purpose flour for coating']

['Step 1: Remove seeds and membranes from peppers.
', 'Step 2: Stuff each pepper with a strip of cheese.
', 'Step 3: In a small bowl combine milk, the 1 cup flour, egg, baking powder, baking soda, salt and canola oil; mix well to make a batter.
', 'Step 4: Pour enough oil in heavy frying pan to reach 1 inch in depth and heat over medium-high heat.

', 'Step 6: Fry until lightly browned on both sides.
']

Title: Simple Sweet and Spicy Chicken Wraps
Ingredients: ['½ cup mayonnaise', '¼ cup finely chopped seedless cucumber', '1 tablespoon honey', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', 'ground black pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into thin strips', '1 cup thick and chunky salsa', '1 tablespoon honey', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '8 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '1 (10 ounce) bag baby spinach leaves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix together the mayonnaise, cucumber, 1 tablespoon of honey, 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne pepper, and black pepper in a bowl until smooth.
', 'Step 2: Cover and refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 3: Heat the olive oil in a skillet on medium-high heat, and cook and stir the chicken breast strips until they are beginning to turn golden and are no longer pink in the middle, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the salsa, 1 tablespoon of honey, and 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 5: Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the flavors have blended, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stack the tortillas, 4 at a time, in a microwave oven and heat until warm and pliable, 20 to 30 seconds per batch.
', 'Step 7: Spread each tortilla with 1 tablespoon of the mayonnaise-cucumber mixture, top with a layer of baby spinach leaves, and arrange about 1/2 cup of chicken mixture on the spinach leaves.
', 'Step 8: Fold the bottom of each tortilla up about 2 inches, and start rolling the burrito from the right side.
', 'Step 9: When the burrito is half-rolled, fold the top of the tortilla down, enclosing the filling, and continue rolling to make a tight, compact cylinder.
']

', 'Step 2: Plastic or metal are not recommended.

']

Title: Air Fryer Chicken Fajitas
Ingredients: ['1 medium red bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '1 medium green bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '1 large onion, sliced into petals', '3 teaspoons olive oil, divided', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 pound chicken tenders, cut into strips', '2 teaspoons fajita seasoning', '8 (6 inch) flour tortillas, warmed']

', 'Step 2: Drizzle 2 teaspoons of olive oil over the top and season with salt and pepper.

', 'Step 5: Drizzle with remaining 1 teaspoon olive oil and mix until evenly combined with your hands.

', 'Step 7: Add chicken to the basket and cook for 12 minutes, shaking halfway through cook time.
', 'Step 8: Transfer to a plate to let rest while you cook the vegetables.

', 'Step 2: Gradually stir in the milk.

Title: Black Bean and Corn Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons olive oil', '3 tablespoons finely chopped onion', '1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (10 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 tablespoon brown sugar', '¼ cup salsa', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '2 tablespoons butter, divided', '8 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided']

', 'Step 2: Stir in onion, and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.

', 'Step 4: Cook until heated through, about 3 minutes.

', 'Step 6: Place a tortilla in the skillet, sprinkle evenly with cheese, then top with some of the bean mixture.

Title: Fajita Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '½ onion, sliced', '½ green bell pepper, sliced', 'salt to taste', '4 flour tortillas', '½ pound cooked steak, cut into 1/4-inch thick pieces', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion and green bell pepper in the hot oil until onions are softened, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Season mixture with salt and transfer to a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Brush 1 side of each tortilla with remaining oil.
', 'Step 4: Place 1 tortilla, oil-side down, in the same skillet; sprinkle with 1/2 the steak, 1/2 the onion mixture, and 1/2 the Mexican cheese mixture.
', 'Step 5: Place a second tortilla, oil-side up, onto cheese layer, pressing down with a spatula to seal.
', 'Step 6: Cook quesadilla over medium heat until cheese melts and tortillas are browned, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
', 'Step 7: Remove quesadilla from skillet and cut into wedges.
', 'Step 8: Repeat with remaining ingredients for second quesadilla.
']

Title: Mexican Strawberry Water (Agua de Fresa)
Ingredients: ['4 cups strawberries, sliced', '1 cup white sugar', '8 cups cold water', '1 lime, cut into 8 wedges', '8 fresh mint sprigs']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a medium bowl, mix together sliced strawberries, sugar, and 1 cup of water.
', 'Step 2: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator for 4 hours.
', 'Step 3: n Remove the strawberry mixture from the refrigerator and pour into a blender.
', 'Step 4: Blend on high until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Pour the blended berry mixture through a wire mesh strainer set over a large mixing bowl; discard the pulp and seeds.
', 'Step 6: n Add the remaining 7 cups cold water to the pureed strawberries and mix well.
', 'Step 7: Place the Aqua de Fresa in the refrigerator to chill for several hours or pour over ice and serve immediately.
', 'Step 8: Garnish with lime slices or mint leaves.
']

Title: Air Fryer Mini Breakfast Burritos
Ingredients: ['¼ cup Mexican-style chorizo', '1 tablespoon bacon grease', '½ cup diced potatoes', '2 tablespoons chopped onion', '1 serrano pepper, chopped', '2 large eggs', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '4 (8 inch) flour tortillas', 'avocado oil cooking spray']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cook chorizo in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until sausage turns a dark red, 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove from the skillet and set aside.
', 'Step 3: Melt bacon grease in the same skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Add diced potatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add onion and serrano pepper and continue cooking and stirring until potatoes are fork-tender, onion is translucent, and serrano pepper is soft, 2 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add eggs and chorizo; stir until cooked and completely incorporated into potato mixture, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Meanwhile, heat tortillas in a large skillet or directly on the grates of a gas stove until soft and pliable.
', 'Step 9: Place 1/3 cup chorizo mixture down the center of each tortilla.
', 'Step 10: Fold top and bottom of tortillas over the filling, then roll each into a burrito shape.
', 'Step 11: Mist with cooking spray and place in the basket of an air fryer.
', 'Step 12: Air fry at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 4 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Flip each burrito over, mist with cooking spray, and air fry until lightly browned, 2 to 4 minutes more.
']

Title: Tres Leches Cake
Ingredients: ['1 cup white sugar', '5 egg yolks', '5 egg whites', '⅓ cup milk', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk', '1 pint heavy whipping cream', '10 maraschino cherries']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Butter and flour bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
', 'Step 3: Beat the egg yolks with 3/4 cup sugar until light in color and doubled in volume.
', 'Step 4: Stir in milk, vanilla, flour and baking powder.
', 'Step 5: In a small bowl, beat egg whites until soft peaks form.
', 'Step 6: Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar.
', 'Step 7: Beat until firm but not dry.
', 'Step 8: Fold 1/3 of the egg whites into the yolk mixture to lighten it; fold in remaining egg whites.
', 'Step 9: Pour batter into prepared pan.
', 'Step 10: Bake in preheated oven for 45 to 50 minutes or until cake tester inserted into the middle comes out clean.
', 'Step 11: Allow to cool 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Loosen edge of cake with knife before removing side of pan.
', 'Step 13: Cool cake completely on a wire rack.
', 'Step 14: Place cooled cake on a deep serving plate.
', 'Step 15: Use a two-pronged meat fork or a cake tester to pierce the surface of cake.
', 'Step 16: Mix together condensed milk, evaporated milk and 1/4 cup of the whipping cream.
', 'Step 17: Set aside 1 cup of the measured milk mixture and refrigerate for another use.
', 'Step 18: Pour remaining milk mixture over cake slowly until absorbed.
', 'Step 19: Whip the remaining whipping cream until it thickens and reaches spreading consistency.
', 'Step 20: Frost cake with whipped cream and garnish with cherries.
', 'Step 21: Store cake in the refrigerator.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '642 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '75 g', 'cholesterolContent': '240.7 mg', 'fatContent': '33 g', 'fiberContent': '0.4 g', 'proteinContent': '14.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '19.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '270.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '61 g'}

Title: Burrito Pie
Ingredients: ['2 pounds ground beef', '1 onion, chopped', '2 teaspoons minced garlic', '1 (2 ounce) can black olives, sliced', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chili peppers', '1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers', '1 (16 ounce) jar taco sauce', '2 (16 ounce) cans refried beans', '12 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '9 ounces shredded Colby cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the ground beef for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add the onion and garlic, and saute for 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 4: Drain any excess fat, if desired.
', 'Step 5: Mix in the olives, green chile peppers, tomatoes with green chile peppers, taco sauce and refried beans.
', 'Step 6: Stir mixture thoroughly, reduce heat to low, and let simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Spread a thin layer of the meat mixture in the bottom of a 4 quart casserole dish.
', 'Step 8: Cover with a layer of tortillas followed by more meat mixture, then a layer of cheese.
', 'Step 9: Repeat tortilla, meat, cheese pattern until all the tortillas are used, topping off with a layer of meat mixture and cheese.
', 'Step 10: Bake for 20 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until cheese is slightly brown and bubbly.
']

Title: Enchiladas Verdes
Ingredients: ['2 cloves garlic', '3 serrano peppers', '2 ¼ pounds small green tomatillos, husks removed', '1 cup vegetable oil for frying', '9 corn tortillas', '3 cups water', '4 teaspoons chicken bouillon granules', '½ store-bought rotisserie chicken, meat removed and shredded', '¼ head iceberg lettuce, shredded', '1 cup cilantro leaves', '1 (8 ounce) container Mexican crema, crema fresca', '1 cup grated cotija cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cover a large griddle with aluminum foil and preheat to medium-high.
', 'Step 2: Cook the garlic, serrano peppers, and tomatillos on the hot griddle until toasted and blackened, turning occasionally, about 5 minutes for the garlic, 10 minutes for the peppers, and 15 minutes for the tomatillos.
', 'Step 3: Remove to a bowl and allow to cool.
', 'Step 4: Heat oil in a small, deep skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Using kitchen tongs, fry the tortillas individually, turning them once.
', "Step 6: They shouldn't be in the hot oil for more than 5 seconds per side.
", 'Step 7: Remove excess oil with paper towels and keep warm.
', 'Step 8: Remember that the hotter the oil, the less that the tortillas will absorb.
', 'Step 9: Place the toasted garlic, serrano peppers, tomatillos, and the water in a blender and blend until smooth; pour into a saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 10: Dissolve the chicken bouillon into the mixture, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer until slightly thickened, about 10 minutes.
', "Step 11: The sauce shouldn't be too thick.
", 'Step 12: Soak three tortillas in the sauce, one at a time, for a few seconds, fill them with shredded chicken, sprinkle the meat with some of the sauce, roll them and place them seam side down on a pasta bowl.
', 'Step 13: Spoon a generous amount of sauce over them and top them with lettuce, cilantro, crema, and cotija cheese.
', 'Step 14: Pour a little more sauce over the whole thing if desired.
', 'Step 15: Repeat the procedure twice more.
', 'Step 16: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Delicious Black Bean Burritos

Title: Beef Nacho Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 ½ cups chunky salsa', '1 (10 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '¾ cup creamy salad dressing (e.g. Miracle Whip)', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '2 cups crushed tortilla chips', '2 cups Colby cheese']

Title: Slow Cooker Cilantro Lime Chicken

Title: Hot Tamale Pie
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 pounds ground beef', '2 cups diced poblano peppers', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 (16 ounce) jar salsa', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground dried chipotle pepper', '2 (8.5 ounce) boxes dry corn muffin mix (such as Jiffy®)', '2 eggs', '⅔ cup milk, divided', '4 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '4 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '8 ounces frozen corn, thawed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch casserole dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir ground beef in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat until meat starts to brown and release juices, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to medium and stir in poblano peppers, salt, salsa, oregano, and chipotle powder; cook and stir until seasoned beef is crumbly and no longer pink, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Mix one package of corn muffin mix in a large bowl with 1 egg and 1/3 cup of milk.
', 'Step 6: Whisk to combine.
', 'Step 7: In a separate large bowl, mix the second package of corn muffin mix with 1 egg, 1/3 cup of milk and half the Cheddar and Monterey Jack cheeses.
', 'Step 8: Spread the prepared corn muffin mixture without cheese into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle corn over the muffin mix, followed by remaining half of the cheeses, then the beef mixture.
', 'Step 10: Spoon the corn muffin mix with cheese on top of the beef and carefully spread over the top with a fork, leaving about half an inch from the edges of the pan.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven for 50-60 minutes, until golden brown.
']

', 'Step 2: Grill corn until hot and lightly charred all over, 7 to 10 minutes, depending on the temperature of the grill.

', 'Step 4: Sprinkle with cotija cheese and serve with a lime wedge.

Title: One-Skillet Mexican Quinoa
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 medium jalapeño pepper, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '1 cup yellow corn', '1 cup quinoa', '1 cup chicken broth', '1 tablespoon red pepper flakes, or to taste', '1 ½ teaspoons chili powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', 'kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 medium avocado - peeled, pitted, and diced', '1 medium lime, juiced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']

['Step 1: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Sauté jalapeño pepper and garlic in the hot oil until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 3: Stir black beans, tomatoes, corn, quinoa, and chicken broth into the skillet.
', 'Step 4: Season with pepper flakes, chili powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Cover the skillet with a lid, reduce heat to low, and simmer until quinoa is tender and liquid is mostly absorbed, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add avocado, lime juice, and cilantro and stir until combined.
']

Title: Authentic Mexican Breakfast Tacos
Ingredients: ['6 ounces chorizo sausage', '8 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '6 eggs', '¼ cup milk', '½ teaspoon pepper', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 dash hot pepper sauce (e.g. Tabasco™), or to taste', '½ cup salsa']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Crumble the sausage into a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir until evenly brown.
', 'Step 3: Set aside.
', 'Step 4: Heat one skillet over medium heat, and heat another skillet over high heat.
', 'Step 5: The skillet over high heat is for warming tortillas.
', 'Step 6: In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Spray the medium heat skillet with some cooking spray, and pour in the eggs.
', 'Step 8: Cook and stir until almost firm.
', 'Step 9: Add the sausage, and continue cooking and stirring until firm.
', 'Step 10: Meanwhile, warm tortillas for about 45 seconds per side in the other skillet, so they are hot and crispy on the edges, but still pliable.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle a little shredded cheese onto each tortilla while it is still hot.
', 'Step 12: Top with some of the scrambled egg and sausage, then add hot pepper sauce and salsa to your liking.
']

Title: Carne en su Jugo (Meat in its Juices)
Ingredients: ['6 slices bacon', '4 fresh tomatillos, husks removed', '3 serrano chile peppers, seeded and chopped', '1 clove garlic, peeled', '3 cups water', '2 pounds flank steak, cut into 1/2-inch squares', '1 cube chicken bouillon', '2 (15.5 ounce) cans pinto beans', '½ onion, chopped', '6 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', 'ground black pepper, to taste', '1 lime, cut into 6 wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cook the bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat until crispy, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
', 'Step 3: Crumble the bacon and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Combine the tomatillos, serrano peppers, garlic, and water in a small saucepan over medium-high heat; bring to a boil, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove the pan from the heat and allow to cool.
', 'Step 6: Transfer the contents to a blender and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Set aside.
', 'Step 8: You can skip the simmering step and blend all the ingredients raw with a few pieces of browned flank steak if you like.
', 'Step 9: Place a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat; cook the flank steak in the hot skillet until completely browned.
', 'Step 10: Pour the tomatillo mixture over the beef and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 11: Stir the chicken bouillon into the mixture, and reduce heat to medium.
', 'Step 12: Cover the skillet and simmer until tender, at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour.
', 'Step 13: Meanwhile, heat the pinto beans in a saucepan over medium heat until warm; reduce heat to low to keep warm until needed.
', 'Step 14: Stir the bacon and pinto beans into the flank steak mixture; divide the mixture between 6 bowls.
', 'Step 15: Garnish each with onion, cilantro, black pepper, and a lime wedge.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '373.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '27.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '57.8 mg', 'fatContent': '16.3 g', 'fiberContent': '8.1 g', 'proteinContent': '29.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '860.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.5 g'}

Title: Mexican Ceviche
Ingredients: ['5 large lemons, juiced', '1 pound jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste', 'tomato and clam juice cocktail', '2 white onions, finely chopped', '1 cucumber, peeled and finely chopped', '1 large tomatoes, seeded and chopped', '3 fresh jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced', '1 bunch radishes, finely diced', '2 cloves fresh garlic, minced', 'tortilla chips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place shrimp in a bowl (You may either coarsely chop the shrimp, or leave them whole, depending on your preference.
', 'Step 2: ) Add lemon, covering shrimp completely.
', 'Step 3: Cover, and refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until opaque and slightly firm.
', 'Step 4: Add tomatoes, onions, cucumber, radishes, and garlic; toss to combine.
', 'Step 5: Gradually add cilantro and jalapenos to desired taste (jalapeno will grow stronger while marinating).
', 'Step 6: Stir in tomato and clam juices to desired consistency.
', 'Step 7: Cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour.
', 'Step 8: Serve chilled with tortilla chips.
']

Title: Best Guacamole

', 'Step 5: Cover the bowl, and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.
