Title: Papas Rellenas (Fried Stuffed Potatoes)
Ingredients: ['4 large potatoes, peeled and cubed', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '½ cup chopped onion', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 pound ground beef', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '4 teaspoons tomato paste', '1 tablespoon distilled white vinegar', '4 eggs', '2 cups dry bread crumbs', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 quart vegetable oil for frying']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain and allow to steam dry for a minute or two.
', 'Step 4: Mash in a bowl with 1/2 teaspoon salt until no lumps remain.
', 'Step 5: Set aside to cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Cook and stir the onion, green pepper, and garlic in the hot skillet until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Increase heat to medium-high, and stir in the ground beef.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir until the beef is crumbly and no longer pink.
', 'Step 10: Stir in 1 teaspoon salt, cumin, pepper, tomato paste, and vinegar until the tomato paste has dissolved.
', 'Step 11: Scrape into a mixing bowl, and allow to cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 12: Line a baking sheet with plastic wrap or waxed paper, and set aside.
', 'Step 13: Beat the eggs in a mixing bowl, and set aside.
', 'Step 14: Pour the bread crumbs and flour into separate, shallow dishes, and set aside.
', 'Step 15: Once the potatoes and beef have cooled, form the potato balls: grab a handful of mashed potatoes, and split into two equal portions.
', 'Step 16: Form each piece into a small bowl shape, and fill with the ground beef mixture.
', 'Step 17: Place the two halves together, seal the edges, and smooth to make a round ball.
', 'Step 18: Gently roll the ball in the flour to coat and shake off the excess flour.
', 'Step 19: Dip into the beaten egg, then gently roll in bread crumbs.
', "Step 20: Gently toss between your hands so any bread crumbs that haven't stuck can fall away.
", 'Step 21: Place the breaded potato balls onto the prepared baking sheet while breading the rest.
', 'Step 22: Refrigerate 2 to 4 hours, or freeze for later use.
', 'Step 23: To cook, heat the oil for frying in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 24: Cook the potato balls in the hot oil in batches, using tongs to roll the balls around as they cook to ensure even browning, until crispy and golden brown, about 3 minutes per batch.
', 'Step 25: Drain on a paper towel-lined plate before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '380.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '45.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '84.9 mg', 'fatContent': '15.8 g', 'fiberContent': '3.5 g', 'proteinContent': '14.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '488.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '3 g'}

Title: Chicken Wonton Tacos
Ingredients: ['⅓ head red cabbage, sliced and chopped', '4 small carrots, peeled and grated', '¼ cup coleslaw dressing', '¼ cup red wine vinegar', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '2 tablespoons teriyaki sauce', '2 tablespoons sesame oil', '1 pound ground chicken', '¼ cup stir-fry sauce', '14 wonton wrappers']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix cabbage, carrots, coleslaw dressing, vinegar, soy sauce, and teriyaki together in a bowl; refrigerate until flavors blend, 1 hour to overnight.
', 'Step 2: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 3: Heat sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir ground chicken in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add stir-fry sauce, cover skillet, reduce heat to low, and simmer.
', 'Step 6: Form wonton wrappers into taco shapes and arrange between the cups of an inverted muffin tin.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until firm and lightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Spoon 2 to 3 tablespoons chicken mixture into each wonton taco shell and top with slaw.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '244.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '21.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '43.8 mg', 'fatContent': '9.7 g', 'fiberContent': '2.5 g', 'proteinContent': '17.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '754.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '7 g'}

Title: Taqueria Style Tacos - Carne Asada
Ingredients: ['3 pounds flank steak', '⅓ cup white vinegar', '½ cup soy sauce', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '2 limes, juiced', '½ cup olive oil', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon ground white pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 white onion, chopped', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 lime, juiced', '2 large tomatoes, chopped', '2 jalapeno peppers, chopped', '1 white onion, quartered', '4 cloves garlic, peeled', '4 dried New Mexico chile pods', '1 pinch salt and pepper to taste', '1 (32 ounce) package corn tortillas', '2 cups grated cotija cheese', '2 limes, cut into wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Lay the flank steak in a large glass baking dish.
', 'Step 2: In a medium bowl, whisk together the vinegar, soy sauce, 4 cloves of garlic, juice of two limes, and olive oil.
', 'Step 3: Season with salt, black pepper, white pepper, garlic powder, chili powder, oregano, cumin and paprika.
', 'Step 4: Whisk until well blended, then pour over the steak in the dish.
', 'Step 5: Turn over once to coat both sides.
', 'Step 6: Cover with plastic wrap, and marinate for 1 to 8 hours.
', 'Step 7: In a small bowl, stir together 1 chopped white onion, cilantro, and the juice of 1 lime.
', 'Step 8: Set aside to use as a relish for the tacos.
', 'Step 9: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Toast chile pods in the skillet for a few minutes, then remove to a bowl of water to soak for about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Place the tomatoes, 1 onion, jalapenos, and 4 cloves of garlic onto a baking sheet.
', 'Step 13: Roast in the oven for about 20 minutes, until toasted but not burnt.
', 'Step 14: Place the roasted vegetables, and soaked chile pods into a blender or food processor, along with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 15: Puree until smooth.
', 'Step 16: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 17: Cut the marinated flank steak into cubes or strips.
', 'Step 18: Cook, stirring constantly, until the meat is cooked through and most of the liquid has evaporated.
', 'Step 19: Warm the tortillas in a skillet for about a minute on each side to make them pliable.
', 'Step 20: Tortillas may also be warmed in a microwave oven.
', 'Step 21: Arrange two or three tortillas on a plate, and lay a generous amount of beef over them.
', 'Step 22: Top with a sprinkle of the onion relish and a large spoonful of the pureed salsa.
', 'Step 23: Add as much cheese as you like.
', 'Step 24: Garnish with lime wedges, and serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '369 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '32.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '44.1 mg', 'fatContent': '19.7 g', 'fiberContent': '5 g', 'proteinContent': '18.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '839.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.3 g'}

Title: Big Mac® Burritos
Ingredients: ['¼ cup mayonnaise', '1 tablespoon sugar-free ketchup', '1 teaspoon mustard', '1 teaspoon pickle juice', '1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar', '1 ¼ teaspoons salt, divided', '¾ teaspoon ground black pepper, divided', '12 slices dill pickle', '1 pound ground beef', '½ cup diced onion', '2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce', '6 (8 inch) low-carb tortillas', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese', 'avocado oil cooking spray', '1 teaspoon sesame seeds, or to taste', '1 ½ cups shredded romaine lettuce, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard, pickle juice, vinegar, ¼ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper together in a small bowl until well combined.
', 'Step 2: Cut each pickle slice in quarters for 48 total pieces.
', 'Step 3: Set both aside.
', 'Step 4: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Add ground beef and cook, crumbling with a spoon and stirring often, until browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Drain grease (if desired).
', 'Step 7: Add onion to the beef and cook for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir in Worcestershire sauce, remaining 1 teaspoon salt, and remaining ½ teaspoon pepper.
', 'Step 9: Remove from the heat.
', 'Step 10: Place one tortilla on a work surface.
', 'Step 11: Add ½ cup Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 12: Top with about ½ cup beef mixture, 8 pieces pickle, and about 1 teaspoon sauce.
', 'Step 13: Fold in the sides of the tortilla and roll over the filling into a burrito.
', 'Step 14: Place burrito, seam-side down, on a plate while you prepare the remaining burritos.
', 'Step 15: Spray each burrito with cooking spray and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
', 'Step 16: Place, seam-side down, in the air fryer basket.
', 'Step 17: Air-fry at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) until golden and toasted, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Serve with the remaining sauce and shredded lettuce.
']

Title: Cast Iron Chicken Fajitas
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil', '2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons garlic powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 large onion, sliced', '1 large red bell pepper, sliced', '1 large green bell pepper, sliced']

['Step 1: Combine olive oil, lime juice, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken breast and toss until well coated.
', 'Step 3: Cover bowl and refrigerate, 4 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 4: Heat a cast iron skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Add chicken breasts to the hot skillet, reserving the marinade.
', 'Step 6: Cook until browned, 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove chicken from skillet, slice, and set aside.
', 'Step 8: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in the same skillet and add onion, bell peppers, and reserved marinade.
', 'Step 9: Cook until vegetables are soft and tender, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Add chicken back to the skillet, stir, and cook until warmed through, 2 to 4 minutes.
']

Title: Better Spanish Rice

Title: Addictive Sweet Potato Burritos
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 onion, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '6 cups canned kidney beans, drained', '2 cups water', '3 tablespoons chili powder', '4 teaspoons prepared mustard', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '3 tablespoons soy sauce', '4 cups mashed cooked sweet potatoes', '12 (10 inch) flour tortillas, warmed', '8 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a medium skillet and saute onion and garlic until soft.
', 'Step 3: Mash beans into the onion mixture.
', 'Step 4: Gradually stir in water; heat until warm, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat and stir in the soy sauce, chili powder, mustard, cumin, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 6: Divide bean mixture and mashed sweet potatoes evenly between the tortillas; top with cheese.
', 'Step 7: Fold tortillas burrito-style around the fillings and place on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until warmed through, about 12 minutes.
']

Title: Cilantro-Lime Dressing
Ingredients: ['1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and coarsely chopped', '1 clove garlic', '¾ teaspoon minced fresh ginger root', '¼ cup lime juice', '⅓ cup honey', '2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar', '½ teaspoon salt, or to taste', '¼ cup packed cilantro leaves', '½ cup extra-virgin olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the jalapeno pepper, garlic clove, and ginger into a food processor or blender; pulse until the jalapeno and garlic are finely chopped.
', 'Step 2: Pour in the lime juice, honey, balsamic vinegar, and salt, add the cilantro leaves; pulse a few times to blend.
', 'Step 3: Turn the food processor or blender on, and slowly drizzle in the olive oil until incorporated into the dressing.
', 'Step 4: Season to taste with salt before serving.
']

Title: Enchiladas Suizas
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '⅔ cup chopped Spanish onion', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 ½ cups chicken broth', '1 cup chopped green chile peppers', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¾ teaspoon salt', '1 dash ground cumin', '12 (8 inch) corn tortillas', 'canola oil for frying', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 cup shredded mild Cheddar cheese', '2 cups shredded, cooked chicken breast meat', '1 cup heavy cream', '¼ cup chopped green onion', '½ cup sliced green olives', '1 pint cherry tomatoes']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Prepare salsa verde: Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Saute the onion until soft.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the flour.
', 'Step 4: Add the broth, then add the chiles, garlic, salt, and cumin.
', 'Step 5: Simmer about 15 minutes to blend flavors, then set aside.
', 'Step 6: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C.) In a heavy skillet, lightly fry tortillas in shallow oil, being careful not to make them too crisp to roll.
', 'Step 7: Combine the cheeses and keep 1/2 cup aside for topping.
', 'Step 8: Dip each tortilla in salsa verde (both sides.
', 'Step 9: ) Place 2 heaping tablespoons chicken and about 2 tablespoons cheese down the center of each; roll and place seam side down in a shallow dish.
', 'Step 10: After all the rolled tortillas are in the dish, spoon additional salsa verde over them and then cover evenly with heavy cream.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese mixture, and with the green onions.
', 'Step 12: Bake uncovered in preheated oven for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Serve immediately, garnished with the olives, cherry tomatoes, and with additional salsa on the side.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '737 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '42.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '136.1 mg', 'fatContent': '52.1 g', 'fiberContent': '5.1 g', 'proteinContent': '28.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '22.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '977.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.5 g'}

Title: Dutch Oven Chili Colorado
Ingredients: ['4 ancho chiles', '4 pounds boneless beef chuck, trimmed and cut into 3/4-inch pieces', '1 pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '2 medium onions, coarsely chopped', '6 cloves garlic', '¼ cup ground red chile pepper', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '1 cup Mexican beer, or more as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Soak the ancho chiles in boiling hot water to cover for 1 hour.
', 'Step 2: While dried chiles soak, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 3: Season beef with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 4: Heat a cast iron Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Brown the beef on all sides, working in small batches, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Drain chiles; remove stems and seeds.
', 'Step 8: Place chiles, onions, garlic, ground chile pepper, salt, cumin seeds, oregano, and coriander in the bowl of a food processor.
', 'Step 9: Pulse to chop, then process into a thick paste.
', 'Step 10: Add 1 cup beer and continue processing to blend.
', 'Step 11: Place meat and any accumulated juices back in the Dutch oven, pour in sauce, and stir well.
', 'Step 12: Cover with a sheet of aluminum foil, then place lid on top for a tight seal.
', 'Step 13: Bake on the middle rack of the preheated oven for 1 hour; stir.
', 'Step 14: Continue to bake, stirring every 15 minutes, until meat is fork-tender, 30 minutes to 1 hour more, adding more beer if sauce seems too thick.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '275.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '7.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '68.7 mg', 'fatContent': '17.9 g', 'fiberContent': '2.9 g', 'proteinContent': '19.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '447.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.8 g'}

Title: Flan Mexicano (Mexican Flan)
Ingredients: ['1 cup white sugar', '1 cup whole milk', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '3 eggs', '3 egg yolks', '¼ cup freshly squeezed orange juice', '1 tablespoon grated orange peel', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '1 cup heavy cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place sugar in a heavy saucepan over medium-high heat, and cook, stirring constantly, until the sugar melts and turns a golden amber color, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Watch carefully once syrup begins to change color, because it burns easily.
', 'Step 3: Carefully pour the melted sugar syrup into a flan mold.
', 'Step 4: Let cool.
', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Pour whole milk, sweetened condensed milk, eggs, egg yolks, orange juice, orange peel, vanilla extract, and cornstarch into a blender, and blend for a minute or so, until the mixture is smooth.
', 'Step 7: Pour in the cream, and pulse several times to incorporate the cream.
', 'Step 8: Pour the mixture over the cooled caramel syrup in the flan mold.
', 'Step 9: Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel.
', 'Step 10: Place the flan mold on the towel, inside roasting pan, and place roasting pan on oven rack.
', 'Step 11: Fill roasting pan with boiling water to reach halfway up the sides of the baking dish.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until the center of the flan is set but still slightly jiggly when moved, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
', 'Step 13: Let the flan cool, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
', 'Step 14: To serve, run a sharp paring knife around the inside of the mold to release the flan.
', 'Step 15: Invert a plate on the mold, flip the mold over, and gently remove the mold to unmold the flan and reveal the syrupy caramel topping.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '434.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '56.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '207 mg', 'fatContent': '19.8 g', 'fiberContent': '0.1 g', 'proteinContent': '8.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '11.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '115.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '54.1 g'}

Title: Southwestern Egg Rolls
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 skinless, boneless chicken breast half', '2 tablespoons minced green onion', '2 tablespoons minced red bell pepper', '⅓ cup frozen corn kernels', '¼ cup black beans, rinsed and drained', '2 tablespoons frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained', '2 tablespoons diced jalapeno peppers', '½ tablespoon minced fresh parsley', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '⅓ teaspoon salt', '1 pinch ground cayenne pepper', '¾ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '5 (6 inch) flour tortillas', '1 quart oil for deep frying']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Rub 1 tablespoon vegetable oil over chicken breast.
', 'Step 2: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, cook chicken approximately 5 minutes per side, until meat is no longer pink and juices run clear.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Heat remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Stir in green onion and red pepper.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir 5 minutes, until tender.
', 'Step 7: Dice chicken and mix into the pan with onion and red pepper.
', 'Step 8: Mix in corn, black beans, spinach, jalapeno peppers, parsley, cumin, chili powder, salt and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir 5 minutes, until well blended and tender.
', 'Step 10: Remove from heat and stir in Monterey Jack cheese so that it melts.
', 'Step 11: Wrap tortillas with a clean, lightly moist cloth.
', 'Step 12: Microwave on high approximately 1 minute, or until hot and pliable.
', 'Step 13: Spoon even amounts of the mixture into each tortilla.
', 'Step 14: Fold ends of tortillas, then roll tightly around mixture.
', 'Step 15: Secure with toothpicks.
', 'Step 16: Arrange in a medium dish, cover with plastic, and place in the freezer.
', 'Step 17: Freeze at least 4 hours.
', 'Step 18: In a large, deep skillet, heat oil for deep frying to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 19: Deep fry frozen, stuffed tortillas 10 minutes each, or until dark golden brown.
', 'Step 20: Drain on paper towels before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '419.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '21.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '28.8 mg', 'fatContent': '31.2 g', 'fiberContent': '2.6 g', 'proteinContent': '13.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7 g', 'sodiumContent': '575.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.4 g'}

Title: Mexican Wedding Cookies
Ingredients: ['1 cup butter', '½ cup white sugar', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '2 teaspoons water', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '1 cup chopped almonds', "½ cup confectioners' sugar"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Beat butter and sugar together in a medium bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
', 'Step 2: Beat in vanilla and water.
', 'Step 3: Add flour and almonds; beat until dough is just combined.
', 'Step 4: Cover and chill for 3 hours.
', 'Step 5: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Shape dough into balls or crescents.
', 'Step 7: Place on an unprepared cookie sheet.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from pan to cool on wire racks.
', "Step 10: When cookies are cool, roll in confectioners' sugar.
", 'Step 11: Store at room temperature in an airtight container.
']

Title: Ground Beef with Homemade Taco Seasoning Mix
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons dried minced onion', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon cornstarch', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon dried minced garlic', '¼ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 pound ground beef', '½ cup water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix minced onion, salt, chili powder, cornstarch, cumin, red pepper flakes, cayenne pepper, dried minced garlic, and oregano in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Crumble ground beef into the hot skillet.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir until the beef is completely browned, 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain and discard any excess grease.
', 'Step 6: Return ground beef to heat.
', 'Step 7: Pour seasoning mixture and water over the beef; stir to combine.
', 'Step 8: Bring to a simmer and cook until the moisture absorbs into the meat, about 5 minutes.
']

Title: Tequila Sunrise

Title: Huevos Rancheros Brunch Casserole with Ham and Cheese
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons canola oil, divided', '6 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 (8 ounce) pre-cooked ham steak, diced', '½ cup diced yellow onion', '¾ teaspoon kosher salt, divided', '1 (14 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers', 'cooking spray', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 ¾ cups pico de gallo', '6 large eggs', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 medium avocado, diced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Fry tortillas, one at a time, until golden and lightly crisp, about 30 seconds per side.
', 'Step 4: Drain on paper towels and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Add ham to the skillet and cook until lightly browned, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 6: Transfer ham with a slotted spoon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain; set aside.
', 'Step 7: Heat remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons oil in the skillet.
', 'Step 8: Add onion and 1/2 teaspoon salt; cook, stirring often, until onion is translucent.
', 'Step 9: Add beans and green chiles; cook, stirring and partially mashing, for 1 minute.
', 'Step 10: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 11: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish liberally with cooking spray.
', 'Step 12: Place tortillas in a single layer on the bottom.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle ham and cheese over the tortillas.
', 'Step 14: Top evenly with the black bean mixture and pico de gallo.
', 'Step 15: Form 6 shallow wells in the pico layer; crack an egg into each well.
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until egg whites are just set and yolks are runny, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Sprinkle with pepper and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt.
', 'Step 18: Top with avocado and cilantro.
']

Title: Heather's Cilantro, Black Bean, and Corn Salsa
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) can yellow corn, drained', '1 (15 ounce) can white corn, drained', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (14.5 ounce) can Italian-style diced tomatoes, drained', '1 bunch finely chopped cilantro', '5 green onions, finely sliced', '1 small red onion, finely chopped', '1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '¼ cup lime juice', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and diced', '2 tablespoons olive oil, or to taste']

', 'Step 2: Gently mix in the lime juice and avocado.
', 'Step 3: Drizzle with olive oil to serve.

Title: Super Nachos
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '¾ cup water', '1 (18 ounce) package restaurant-style tortilla chips', '1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, or more to taste', '1 (15.5 ounce) can refried beans', '1 cup salsa', '1 cup sour cream, or more to taste', '1 (10 ounce) can pitted black olives, drained and chopped', '4 green onions, diced', '1 (4 ounce) can sliced jalapeno peppers, drained']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cook and stir ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until meat is crumbly and no longer pink, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain excess grease.
', 'Step 3: Stir in taco seasoning mix and water and simmer until beef mixture has thickened, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the broiler.
', 'Step 5: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 6: Spread tortilla chips on the prepared baking sheet; top with Cheddar cheese and dot with refried beans and ground beef mixture.
', 'Step 7: Broil in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, watching carefully to prevent burning, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Top nachos with salsa, sour cream, black olives, green onions, and jalapeno peppers.
']

Title: Cheeseburger Quesadilla
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon butter', '½ small yellow onion, chopped', '2 pounds ground beef', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', 'cooking spray', '8 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Colby cheese', '4 teaspoons ketchup, or to taste', '4 teaspoons yellow mustard, or to taste', '4 teaspoons sweet relish, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat butter in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion until slightly tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Add ground beef, Worcestershire sauce, salt, black pepper, and garlic powder; cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat, drain liquid from beef, and let sit for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Heat a griddle or flat pan over medium heat and spray with cooking spray.
', 'Step 5: Place 1 tortilla on the hot griddle, top with some of the Colby cheese, 1/4 of the beef mixture, 1 teaspoon ketchup, 1 teaspoon mustard, and 1 teaspoon relish.
', 'Step 6: Top with more Colby cheese and 1 tortilla.
', 'Step 7: Flatten the quesadilla with your hand.
', 'Step 8: Flip quesadilla with a spatula and cook until browned and cheese is melted, 3 to 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 9: Cut quesadilla into 4 pieces.
', 'Step 10: Repeat with remaining tortillas, ground beef, cheese, ketchup, mustard, and relish.
']

Title: Authentic Mexican Tortillas
Ingredients: ['3 cups all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '2 teaspoons salt', '¾ cup shortening', '¾ cup hot water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
', 'Step 2: Either by hand or with a pastry cutter, cut in the shortening till the mixture is crumbly.
', 'Step 3: If the mixture looks more floury than crumbly, be sure to add just one or two more tablespoons of shortening till it is crumbly.
', 'Step 4: Add about 3/4 cup hot water to the mixture, or just enough to make the ingredients look moist.
', 'Step 5: With your hand or a large fork, knead the mixture making sure to rub the dough against the sides of the large mixing bowl to gather any clinging dough.
', 'Step 6: If the dough still sticks to the side of the bowl, add a couple more tablespoons of flour until the dough forms a soft round shape.
', 'Step 7: The dough is ready to roll out now, but it is best to let it rest.
', 'Step 8: Cover it with a dish towel, and let it sit for about an hour or so.
', 'Step 9: Take the dough, and pull it apart into 10 to 12 balls.
', 'Step 10: Lightly flour your rolling area, and roll each ball with a rolling pin to about 1/8 inch thickness.
', 'Step 11: Place each tortilla on a medium hot cast iron skillet.
', 'Step 12: Cook for about 1 to 2 minutes on each side, or until the tortilla does not look doughy.
']

Title: Birria Recipe
Ingredients: ['5 dried Anaheim chile peppers, stemmed and seeded', '5 guajillo chile peppers, stemmed and seeded', 'water to cover', '¼ onion', '1 tablespoon mixed spices, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon salt, or to taste', '3 pounds cubed beef stew meat', '6 bay leaves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place Anaheim and guajillo peppers in a saucepan and cover with water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove saucepan from heat and cool for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Pour chiles and water into a blender; add onion, mixed spices, and salt.
', 'Step 5: Blend until sauce is smooth.
', 'Step 6: Mix stew meat, sauce, and bay leaves in a large pot; cook over medium-low heat until meat is very tender, 3 to 5 hours.
']

Title: Barbacoa-Style Shredded Beef
Ingredients: ['1 (3 pound) beef chuck roast, cut into 6 to 8 chunks', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '½ cup beef broth', '¼ cup apple cider vinegar', '¼ cup fresh lime juice', '4 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, chopped', '5 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 tablespoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '3 bay leaves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Season beef chunks with salt and pepper on all sides.
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Add beef in batches; cook until browned, about 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 4: Transfer beef to a slow cooker.
', 'Step 5: Combine beef broth, apple cider vinegar, lime juice, chipotle peppers, garlic, cumin, oregano, and cloves in a bowl.
', 'Step 6: Season with salt and pepper and mix well.
', 'Step 7: Pour over beef in the slow cooker.
', 'Step 8: Stir in bay leaves.
', 'Step 9: Cook on Low until beef is fork-tender, 8 to 10 hours.
', 'Step 10: Discard bay leaves.

', 'Step 12: Return beef to the slow cooker to marinate in the sauce for at least 10 more minutes before serving.
']

Title: Lola's Horchata
Ingredients: ['1 cup uncooked white long-grain rice', '5 cups water', '½ cup milk', '½ tablespoon vanilla extract', '½ tablespoon ground cinnamon', '⅔ cup white sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Pour the rice and water into the bowl of a blender; blend until the rice just begins to break up, about 1 minute.

', 'Step 3: Strain the rice water into a pitcher and discard the rice.
', 'Step 4: Stir the milk, vanilla, cinnamon, and sugar into the rice water.
', 'Step 5: Chill and stir before serving over ice.
']

Title: Air Fryer Churros
Ingredients: ['¼ cup butter', '½ cup milk', '1 pinch salt', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '2 eggs', '¼ cup white sugar', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Pour in milk and add salt.
', 'Step 3: Lower heat to medium and bring to a boil, continuously stirring with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 4: Quickly add flour all at once.
', 'Step 5: Keep stirring until the dough comes together.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat and let cool for 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Mix in eggs with the wooden spoon until pastry comes together.
', 'Step 8: Spoon dough into a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip.
', 'Step 9: Pipe dough into strips straight into the air fryer basket.
', 'Step 10: Air fry churros at 340 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Meanwhile combine sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl and pour onto a shallow plate.
', 'Step 12: Remove fried churros from air fryer and roll in the cinnamon-sugar mixture.
']

Title: Annie's Fruit Salsa and Cinnamon Chips
Ingredients: ['2 kiwis, peeled and diced', '2 Golden Delicious apples - peeled, cored and diced', '8 ounces raspberries', '1 pound strawberries', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '1 tablespoon brown sugar', '3 tablespoons fruit preserves, any flavor', '10 (10 inch) flour tortillas', 'butter flavored cooking spray', '2 tablespoons cinnamon sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large bowl, thoroughly mix kiwis, Golden Delicious apples, raspberries, strawberries, white sugar, brown sugar and fruit preserves.
', 'Step 2: Cover and chill in the refrigerator at least 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Coat one side of each flour tortilla with butter flavored cooking spray.
', 'Step 5: Cut into wedges and arrange in a single layer on a large baking sheet.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle wedges with desired amount of cinnamon sugar.
', 'Step 7: Spray again with cooking spray.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven 8 to 10 minutes.

', 'Step 10: Allow to cool approximately 15 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Serve with chilled fruit mixture.
']

Title: Easy Taco Casserole
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 cup salsa', '½ cup chopped onion', '½ cup mayonnaise', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '2 cups crushed tortilla chips, divided', '4 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '4 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain and discard any excess grease.
', 'Step 4: Stir salsa, onion, mayonnaise, chili powder, and cumin into the beef.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 6: Spread about half the ground beef mixture into the bottom of a 2-quart casserole dish.
', 'Step 7: Spread about half the tortilla chips in a layer atop the beef mixture.
', 'Step 8: Layer about half of each of the Cheddar and Monterey Jack cheeses over the tortilla chip layer.
', 'Step 9: Repeat layers with remaining ingredients, ending with Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 10: Cover dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 11: Bake in preheated oven until the cheese is melted in the middle, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Refried Beans Without the Refry
Ingredients: ['1 onion, peeled and halved', '3 cups dry pinto beans, rinsed', '½ fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped', '2 tablespoons minced garlic', '5 teaspoons salt', '1 ¾ teaspoons fresh ground black pepper', '⅛ teaspoon ground cumin, optional', '9 cups water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the onion, rinsed beans, jalapeno, garlic, salt, pepper, and cumin into a slow cooker.
', 'Step 2: Pour in the water and stir to combine.
', 'Step 3: Cook on High for 8 hours, adding more water as needed.
', 'Step 4: Note: if more than 1 cup of water has evaporated during cooking, then the temperature is too high.
', 'Step 5: Once the beans have cooked, strain them, and reserve the liquid.
', 'Step 6: Mash the beans with a potato masher, adding the reserved water as needed to attain desired consistency.
']

Title: Taco Lasagna
Ingredients: ['2 pounds lean ground beef', '2 (1.25 ounce) packages taco seasoning mix', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '½ cup water', '18 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 (24 ounce) jar salsa', '1 cup sliced green onion', '1 (16 ounce) container sour cream', '1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place ground beef in a large, deep skillet.
', 'Step 2: Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown.
', 'Step 3: Drain, then season with taco seasoning, garlic, cayenne pepper, chili powder and water.
', 'Step 4: Simmer for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Grease the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Place 6 tortillas into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Spread 1/3 of the salsa on top of the tortillas.
', 'Step 9: Spread 1/2 of the meat mixture evenly over the salsa.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle with 1/2 of the green onions.
', 'Step 11: Drop 1/2 of the sour cream randomly over the green onions.
', 'Step 12: Top with 1/2 cup Cheddar and 1/2 cup Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 13: Repeat layers.
', 'Step 14: Top with 6 tortillas, spread with remaining salsa, and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
', 'Step 15: Bake in a preheated oven for 30 to 45 minutes or until cheeses are melted.
']

Title: Grilled Fish Tacos with Chipotle-Lime Dressing
Ingredients: ['¼ cup extra virgin olive oil', '2 tablespoons distilled white vinegar', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '2 teaspoons lime zest', '1 ½ teaspoons honey', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '½ teaspoon cumin', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon seafood seasoning, such as Old Bay™', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce, or to taste', '1 pound tilapia fillets, cut into chunks', '1 (8 ounce) container light sour cream', '½ cup adobo sauce from chipotle peppers', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '2 teaspoons lime zest', '¼ teaspoon cumin', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon seafood seasoning, such as Old Bay™', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 (10 ounce) package tortillas', '3 ripe tomatoes, seeded and diced', '1 bunch cilantro, chopped', '1 small head cabbage, cored and shredded', '2 limes, cut in wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: To make the marinade, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, lime juice, lime zest, honey, garlic, cumin, chili powder, seafood seasoning, black pepper, and hot sauce in a bowl until blended.
', 'Step 2: Place the tilapia in a shallow dish, and pour the marinade over the fish.
', 'Step 3: Cover, and refrigerate 6 to 8 hours.
', 'Step 4: To make the dressing, combine the sour cream and adobo sauce in a bowl.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the lime juice, lime zest, cumin, chili powder, seafood seasoning.
', 'Step 6: Add salt, and pepper in desired amounts.
', 'Step 7: Cover, and refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 8: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil grate.
', 'Step 9: Set grate 4 inches from the heat.
', 'Step 10: Remove fish from marinade, drain off any excess and discard marinade.
', 'Step 11: Grill fish pieces until easily flaked with a fork, turning once, about 9 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Assemble tacos by placing fish pieces in the center of tortillas with desired amounts of tomatoes, cilantro, and cabbage; drizzle with dressing.
', 'Step 13: To serve, roll up tortillas around fillings, and garnish with lime wedges.
']

Title: Jalapeno Cream Cheese Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['3 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 large onion, minced', '2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced (wear gloves)', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 (28 ounce) can green enchilada sauce', '7 flour tortillas', '8 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Season chicken breasts with 1 teaspoon of cayenne pepper, 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 3: Place into a baking dish.
', 'Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until the chicken is no longer pink inside and the juices run clear, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Allow chicken to cool, and shred with 2 forks.
', 'Step 6: Set chicken aside.
', 'Step 7: Heat butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, and cook the onion and jalapenos until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes; stir in the cream cheese in chunks, and allow cream cheese to melt and soften.
', 'Step 8: Stir in cream cheese, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, paprika, chili powder, and cumin.
', 'Step 9: Mix in the cooked chicken meat; remove from heat.
', 'Step 10: Pour half the green enchilada sauce into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 11: Lay tortillas out onto a work surface, and place chicken mixture in a line down the center of each tortilla; sprinkle with about 1 tablespoon of Monterey Jack cheese per tortilla.
', 'Step 12: Roll up the tortillas, and place into the sauce in the dish, seam sides down; pour the remaining sauce over the enchiladas.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle remaining 4 ounces of Monterey Jack cheese over the top.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until the filling is hot and bubbling and the cheese has melted, 30 to 35 minutes.
']

Title: Carnitas - Pressure Cooker
Ingredients: ['1 (6 pound) pork butt roast', '1 ½ tablespoons salt', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon chile powder', '½ teaspoon paprika', '2 tablespoons olive oil, or more to taste', '1 cup orange juice', '1 onion, coarsely chopped', '4 cloves garlic, diced, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Trim excess fat from pork butt; cut pork into 2-inch cubes and transfer to a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Combine salt, oregano, cumin, black pepper, chile powder, and paprika together in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Rub pork cubes with spice mixture.
', 'Step 4: Coat seasoned pork cubes lightly in olive oil; place in pressure cooker.
', 'Step 5: Cover pork cubes with orange juice, onion, and garlic.
', 'Step 6: Place lid on pressure cooker and lock; bring to full pressure over medium heat until pork is no longer pink in the center, about 60 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Let pressure come down naturally, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove pork from pressure cooker and shred meat.
']

Title: Spinach Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '½ cup sliced green onions', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach , thawed, drained and squeezed dry', '1 cup ricotta cheese', '½ cup sour cream', '2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '10 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 (19 ounce) can enchilada sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add garlic and onion; cook for a few minutes until fragrant, but not brown.
', 'Step 4: Stir in spinach, and cook for about 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from the heat, and mix in ricotta cheese, sour cream, and 1 cup of Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 6: In a skillet over medium heat, warm tortillas one at a time until flexible, about 15 seconds.
', 'Step 7: Spoon about 1/4 cup of the spinach mixture onto the center of each tortilla.
', 'Step 8: Roll up, and place seam side down in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Pour enchilada sauce over the top, and sprinkle with the remaining cup of Monterey Jack.
', 'Step 10: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until sauce is bubbling and cheese is lightly browned at the edges.
']

Title: Easy Chicken Fajita Marinade
Ingredients: ['½ cup vegetable oil', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '2 tablespoons lime juice', '2 tablespoons honey', '2 tablespoons garlic powder', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '3 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into strips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk vegetable oil, chili powder, lime juice, honey, garlic powder, paprika, and black pepper in a bowl to make a marinade.
', 'Step 2: Place chicken strips into a large resealable plastic bag; pour marinade over chicken.
', 'Step 3: Knead bag to coat chicken with marinade.
', 'Step 4: Squeeze out air, seal bag, and refrigerate 4 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 5: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 6: Remove chicken strips from marinade; discard used marinade.
', 'Step 7: Grill chicken on preheated grill until browned, the juices run clear, and an instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the thickest piece reads at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), about 10 minutes per side.
']

Title: Absolute Mexican Cornbread
Ingredients: ['1 cup butter, melted', '1 cup white sugar', '4 eggs', '1 (15 ounce) can cream-style corn', '½ (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers, drained', '½ cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 cup yellow cornmeal', '4 teaspoons baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: In a large bowl, beat together butter and sugar.
', 'Step 4: Beat in eggs one at a time.
', 'Step 5: Blend in cream corn, chiles, Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 6: In a separate bowl, stir together flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt.

Title: Mexican Capirotada
Ingredients: ['3 cups water', '3 cups brown sugar, divided', '2 cinnamon sticks', '2 cups butter, softened', '2 loaves sliced white bread, toasted', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon, or to taste', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg, or to taste', '⅛ teaspoon ground cloves, or to taste', '2 cups raisins', '2 cups peanuts', '1 pound shredded sharp Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine water, 2 cups brown sugar, and cinnamon sticks together in a saucepan; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until sugar is dissolved and liquid has reduced into a syrup, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove cinnamon sticks from syrup using a slotted spoon.
', 'Step 5: Spread butter onto each toasted bread slice.
', 'Step 6: Make 1 layer of buttered bread in a deep casserole dish or oven-proof stockpot.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves over bread layer.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle 1/4 the raisins, 1/4 the peanuts, 1/4 the remaining brown sugar, and 1/4 the Cheddar cheese over bread layer.
', 'Step 9: Repeat layering with remaining ingredients.
', 'Step 10: Pour cinnamon syrup over entire dish; cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Cool for 20 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Chicken Enchiladas II
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '½ cup chopped green onions', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup', '½ cup sour cream', '1 ½ cups cubed cooked chicken breast meat', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, divided', '6 (12 inch) flour tortillas', '¼ cup milk']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a large baking dish.
', 'Step 3: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and saute the green onion until tender (about 3 to 4 minutes).
', 'Step 4: Add the garlic powder, then stir in the green chiles, cream of mushroom soup and sour cream.
', 'Step 5: Mix well.
', 'Step 6: Reserve 3/4 of this sauce and set aside.
', 'Step 7: To the remaining 1/4 of the sauce in the saucepan, add the chicken and 1/2 cup of shredded Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 8: Stir together.
', 'Step 9: Fill each flour tortilla with the chicken mixture and roll up.
', 'Step 10: Place seam side down in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 11: In a small bowl combine the reserved 3/4 of the sauce with the milk.
', 'Step 12: Spoon this mixture over the rolled tortillas and top with the remaining 1/2 cup of shredded Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly.
']

Title: Angela's Awesome Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast meat - cut into chunks', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '1 ¼ cups sour cream', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 small onion, chopped', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies, drained', '1 (1.25 ounce) package mild taco seasoning mix', '1 bunch green onions, chopped, divided', '1 cup water', '1 teaspoon lime juice', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '5 (12 inch) flour tortillas', '3 cups Cheddar cheese, shredded, divided', '1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce', '1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the chicken in a large pot and add water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the chicken pieces are no longer pink, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Shred chicken by placing two forks back to back and pulling meat apart.
', 'Step 4: Set the shredded chicken aside.
', 'Step 5: Meanwhile, combine the cream of chicken soup, sour cream, and chili powder in a saucepan.
', 'Step 6: Bring to a simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally, then turn off the heat and cover to keep warm.
', 'Step 7: Heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the onion; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add the shredded chicken, chopped green chilies, taco seasoning, half of the bunch of chopped green onion, and water.
', 'Step 10: Allow to simmer for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Stir in the lime juice, onion powder, and garlic powder; simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Stir 1 cup of the soup mixture into the skillet with the chicken mixture.
', 'Step 14: Spread the remaining soup mixture on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 15: Fill each tortilla with chicken mixture.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle Cheddar cheese over the chicken filling before folding the tortillas, reserving half of the shredded cheese for topping the enchiladas.
', 'Step 17: Fold tortillas over the filling and place seam-side down in the prepared pan.
', 'Step 18: Pour enchilada sauce evenly over the enchiladas.
', 'Step 19: Cover with the remaining 1 1/2 cups of Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 20: Sprinkle the reserved chopped green onions and the sliced olives on top of the cheese.
', 'Step 21: Bake in the preheated oven until filling is heated through and the cheese is melted and bubbling, about 25 minutes.
']

Title: Easy Sheet Pan Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '4 (5 ounce) mahi mahi fillets', '8 small flour tortillas', '1 medium lime, cut into wedges', '4 cups coleslaw mix', '½ cup finely chopped fresh cilantro', '1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 medium lime, juiced', '1 teaspoon red wine vinegar', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '1 canned chipotle pepper in adobo, finely chopped', '1 tablespoon adobo sauce', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil.
', 'Step 3: Mix together chili powder, paprika, cumin, onion powder, salt, and pepper for tacos in a small bowl until well combined.
', 'Step 4: Brush 2 tablespoons oil all over the prepared pan, then add mahi mahi fillets.
', 'Step 5: Drizzle remaining 1 tablespoon oil over the fillets and rub to coat.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle spice mixture evenly over both sides of the fillets.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes evenly with a fork and drippings are caramelized, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 8: While the fish is baking, prepare slaw by combining coleslaw mix, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, oil, lime juice, vinegar, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl; toss until well combined.
', 'Step 9: Stir together sour cream, chipotle in adobo, adobo sauce, and salt for crema together in a small bowl.
', 'Step 10: Char tortillas over a gas flame.
', 'Step 11: Remove fish from the oven and flake it with a fork.
', 'Step 12: Fill tortillas with fish and slaw.

Title: Vegetarian Mexican Inspired Stuffed Peppers

Title: Philly Ground Beef Quesadillas

', 'Step 2: Whisk in flour until well incorporated.

Title: Conchas (Mexican Sweet Bread)
Ingredients: ['2 ½ teaspoons yeast', '½ cup warm water', '½ cup evaporated milk', '⅜ cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon salt', '⅓ cup butter or margarine, melted', '1 egg', '4 cups all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '⅔ cup white sugar', '½ cup butter or margarine', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large bowl, stir together the yeast and warm water.
', 'Step 2: Mix in the milk, 3/8 cup sugar, 1/3 cup melted butter, salt, egg and half of the flour.
', 'Step 3: Gradually mix in the remaining flour, and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon.
', 'Step 4: Turn the dough out onto a floured counter to knead as soon as it pulls together enough.
', 'Step 5: Knead for 6 to 8 minutes, until smooth and elastic.
', 'Step 6: Place in a large greased bowl, and turn the dough to coat.
', 'Step 7: Cover, and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 8: Make the topping while the dough rises.
', 'Step 9: In a medium bowl, beat 2/3 cup sugar and 1/2 cup butter until light and fluffy.
', 'Step 10: Stir in the flour until the mixture is the consistency of thick paste.
', 'Step 11: Divide into two parts, and place one part in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 12: Mix cinnamon into one half, and vanilla into the other half.
', 'Step 13: When the dough is done rising, cut into 12 even-sized pieces.
', 'Step 14: Shape into balls, and place on a greased cookie sheet, spacing about 3 inches apart.
', 'Step 15: Divide each bowl of topping into 6 balls, and pat flat.
', 'Step 16: Place circles of topping on top of the dough balls patting down lightly.
', 'Step 17: Use a knife to cut grooves in the topping like a clam shell.
', 'Step 18: Cover and let rise until doubled, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 20: Bake for 20 minutes, or until lightly golden brown.
']

Title: Chicken Chimichangas with Sour Cream Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 large skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '3 cups water', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon onion powder', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 (7 ounce) can chopped green chilies, divided', '½ cup diced onion', '3 large cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons butter', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 cup water', '1 cube chicken bouillon', '½ cup sour cream', 'salt and pepper to taste', 'oil for frying', '8 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '8 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the chicken breasts into a large saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Pour in the water, and season with chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, cumin, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a simmer over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: After 15 minutes, stir in 4 ounces of green chiles, onion, and garlic; continue simmering until the liquid has reduced to 1 cup.
', 'Step 5: Reserve remaining 3 ounces of chopped green chilies.
', 'Step 6: Remove the chicken, shred with two forks, and return to the onion mixture.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the flour, and cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 9: Whisk in the water and bouillon cube until the water has thickened and the bouillon cube has dissolved, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Whisk in reserved 3 ounces of green chilies and the sour cream; season to taste with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 11: Keep warm.
', 'Step 12: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Place a tortilla onto your work surface, then spoon about 1/3 cup of the chicken filling halfway between the bottom edge and the center of the tortilla.
', 'Step 14: Flatten the filling into rectangle shape with the back of a spoon.
', 'Step 15: Sprinkle about 1 ounce of the Monterey Jack cheese over the filling.
', 'Step 16: Fold the bottom of the tortilla snugly over the filling, then fold in the left and right edges.
', 'Step 17: Roll the chimichanga up to the top edge, forming a tight cylinder; secure the ends with wooden toothpicks.
', 'Step 18: Repeat with the remaining ingredients.
', 'Step 19: Cook the chimichangas, 2 at a time, in the hot oil until they are crisp and golden brown on both sides, about 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 20: Drain on a paper towel-lined plate, and remove toothpicks.
', 'Step 21: Top with sour cream sauce to serve.
']

Title: Picadillo Ground Beef Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['1 medium potato, peeled and diced', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '1 pound lean ground beef', '½ cup diced red bell pepper', '½ cup diced onion', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '¼ cup water', '2 tablespoons olive brine', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ cup sliced pimento-stuffed green olives', '3 tablespoons raisins', 'cooking spray', '12 (8 inch) flour tortillas', '1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend']

Title: Best Breakfast Quesadilla

Title: Chili Rellenos Casserole
Ingredients: ['2 (7 ounce) cans whole green chile peppers, drained', '8 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, shredded', '8 ounces Longhorn or Cheddar cheese, shredded', '2 large eggs, or more to taste', '1 (5 ounce) can evaporated milk', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '½ cup milk', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Evenly layer 1 can chile peppers in the bottom of the baking dish.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle with half of the Jack and Cheddar cheeses, and cover with remaining chile peppers.
', 'Step 5: In a bowl, mix together the eggs, evaporated milk, and flour.
', 'Step 6: If too thick, feel free to add 1/2 cup regular milk.
', 'Step 7: Pour over the top of the chilies.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from oven, pour tomato sauce evenly over the top, and continue baking another 15 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Sprinkle with remaining Jack and Cheddar cheeses, pop under the broiler for a few minutes, and serve.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Chicken Taco Soup
Ingredients: ['1 onion, chopped', '1 (16 ounce) can chili beans', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans', '1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer', '2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with green chilies, undrained', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning', '3 whole skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 (8 ounce) container sour cream', '1 cup crushed tortilla chips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the onion, chili beans, black beans, corn, tomato sauce, beer, and diced tomatoes in a slow cooker.
', 'Step 2: Add taco seasoning, and stir to blend.
', 'Step 3: Lay chicken breasts on top of the mixture, pressing down slightly until just covered by the other ingredients.
', 'Step 4: Set slow cooker for low heat, cover, and cook for 5 hours.
', 'Step 5: Remove chicken breasts from the soup, and allow to cool long enough to be handled.
', 'Step 6: Stir the shredded chicken back into the soup, and continue cooking for 2 hours.
', 'Step 7: Serve topped with shredded Cheddar cheese, a dollop of sour cream, and crushed tortilla chips, if desired.
']

Title: Mexican Quesadilla Casserole
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 pound ground beef', '½ cup chopped onion', '1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with lime juice and cilantro (such as RO*TEL®)', '1 (8.75 ounce) can whole kernel sweet corn, drained', '1 (4.5 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '6 flour tortillas', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Prepare a 13x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is completely browned, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
', 'Step 5: Stir tomato sauce, black beans, diced tomatoes with lime juice and cilantro, corn, and chopped green chiles into the ground beef mixture; season with chili powder, cumin, garlic, oregano, and red pepper flakes.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat to low and cook mixture at a simmer for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Spread about 1/2 cup beef mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish; top with 3 tortillas, overlapping as needed.
', 'Step 8: Spread another 1/2 cup beef mixture over the tortillas.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle 1 cup Cheddar cheese over beef.
', 'Step 10: Finish with layers of remaining tortillas, beef mixture, and Cheddar cheese, respectively.
', 'Step 11: Bake in preheated oven until heated throughout and the cheese is melted, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Cool 5 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Quick and Easy Green Chile Chicken Enchilada Casserole
Ingredients: ['4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', 'garlic salt to taste', '18 (6 inch) corn tortillas, torn in half', '1 (28 ounce) can green chile enchilada sauce', '1 (16 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '1 (8 ounce) container reduced fat sour cream']

', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a medium baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Season chicken with garlic salt.
', 'Step 4: Arrange in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 5: Bake 45 minutes in the preheated oven, until no longer pink and juices run clear.

Title: White Chicken Enchilada Slow-Cooker Casserole

', 'Step 2: Continue to boil until the chicken is done, about 10 minutes.

', 'Step 9: Repeat with remaining tortillas, chicken, soup, and cheese.

', 'Step 12: Top with chives.

Title: Tater Tot Taco Casserole

Title: Caldo de Res (Mexican Beef Soup)
Ingredients: ['2 pounds beef shank, with bone', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '1 onion, chopped', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '3 cups beef broth', '4 cups water', '2 medium carrot, coarsely chopped', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 potato, quartered', '2 ears corn, husked and cut into thirds', '2 chayotes, quartered', '1 medium head cabbage, cored and cut into wedges', '¼ cup sliced pickled jalapenos', '¼ cup finely chopped onion', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 limes, cut into wedges', '4 radishes, quartered']

['Step 1: Cut the meat from the beef bones into about 1/2 inch pieces, leaving some on the bones.
', 'Step 2: Heat a heavy soup pot over medium-high heat until very hot.
', 'Step 3: Add the oil, tilting the pan to coat the bottom.
', 'Step 4: Add the meat and bones, and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir until thoroughly browned.
', 'Step 6: Add 1 onion, and cook until onion is also lightly browned.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the tomatoes and broth.
', 'Step 8: The liquid should cover the bones by 1/2 inch.
', 'Step 9: If not, add enough water to compensate.
', 'Step 10: Reduce heat to low, and simmer for 1 hour with the lid on loosely.
', 'Step 11: If meat is not tender, continue cooking for another 10 minutes or so.
', 'Step 12: Pour in the water, and return to a simmer.
', 'Step 13: Add the carrot and 1/4 cup cilantro, and cook for 10 minutes, then stir in the potato, corn and chayote.
', 'Step 14: Simmer until vegetables are tender.
', 'Step 15: Push the cabbage wedges into the soup, and cook for about 10 more minutes.
', 'Step 16: Ladle soup into large bowls, including meat vegetables and bones.
', 'Step 17: Garnish with jalapenos, minced onion, and additional cilantro.
', 'Step 18: Squeeze lime juice over all, and serve with radishes.
']

Title: Enchanted Sour Cream Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 cups cubed cooked chicken', '1 cup sour cream', '⅛ teaspoon salt', '1 pinch ground black pepper', '½ cup vegetable oil for frying', '12 (5 inch) corn tortillas', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies, drained', '2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese']

Title: Corn in a Cup (Elote en Vaso)

Title: Air Fryer Chicken Taquitos
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '2 tablespoons diced onion', '1 clove garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons chopped green chiles (such as Ortega®)', '2 tablespoons Mexican-style hot tomato sauce (such as El Pato®)', '1 cup shredded rotisserie chicken', '2 tablespoons Neufchatel cheese', '½ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste', '6 each corn tortillas', '1 serving avocado oil cooking spray']

Title: Authentic Mexican Shrimp Cocktail (Coctel de Camarones estilo Mexicano)

Title: Salsa Chicken Rice Casserole

Title: Caldo de Pollo

Title: Fish Tacos
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons cornstarch', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 egg', '1 cup beer', '½ cup plain yogurt', '½ cup mayonnaise', '1 lime, juiced', '1 jalapeno pepper, minced', '1 teaspoon minced capers', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon dried dill weed', '1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '1 quart oil for frying', '1 pound cod fillets, cut into 2 to 3 ounce portions', '1 (12 ounce) package corn tortillas', '½ medium head cabbage, finely shredded']

['Step 1: To make beer batter: In a large bowl, combine flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt.
', "Step 2: Blend egg and beer, then quickly stir into the flour mixture (don't worry about a few lumps).
", 'Step 3: To make white sauce: In a medium bowl, mix together yogurt and mayonnaise.
', 'Step 4: Gradually stir in fresh lime juice until consistency is slightly runny.
', 'Step 5: Season with jalapeno, capers, oregano, cumin, dill, and cayenne.
', 'Step 6: Heat oil in deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

', 'Step 8: Dip into beer batter, and fry until crisp and golden brown.
', 'Step 9: Drain on paper towels.

', 'Step 11: To serve, place fried fish in a tortilla, and top with shredded cabbage, and white sauce.
']

Title: Spinach and Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '½ cup sliced green onions', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 large cooked chicken breast halves, diced', '1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach - thawed, drained, and squeezed dry', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '⅛ teaspoon salt', '1 cup ricotta cheese', '½ cup sour cream', '1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided', '1 ½ cups shredded mozzarella cheese, divided', '5 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '2 (10 ounce) cans enchilada sauce']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir green onions and garlic in butter until fragrant and softened, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir chicken, spinach, chili powder, black pepper, and salt into the green onion mixture and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 5: Mix ricotta cheese, sour cream, 1 cup Monterey Jack cheese, and 1 cup of mozzarella cheese into chicken mixture until thoroughly combined.

', 'Step 8: Spoon about 3/4 cup of chicken filling down the center of each tortilla in a line.
', 'Step 9: Roll tortillas around filling and place with seam sides down into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Pour enchilada sauce over filled enchiladas and sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of Monterey Jack and mozzarella cheeses over the top.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until filling is bubbling and cheese topping is browned at the edges, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Grandma Kay's Chicken Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['8 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese', '½ (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers, drained', '24 flour tortillas', '2 (10.75 ounce) cans cream of chicken soup', '2 cups half and half', '1 cup chicken broth', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease an 11x15-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Place the chicken breasts in a saucepan with enough water to barely cover; bring to a boil over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from the pan, drain, and shred with two forks.
', 'Step 6: Place the shredded chicken into a bowl and mix with 8 ounces of Colby-Monterey Jack cheese and canned green chilies.
', 'Step 7: Spoon about 3 tablespoons of chicken mixture in a line down the center of each tortilla and fold the tortilla in half, enclosing the filling.
', 'Step 8: Starting at the filled side, roll the folded tortilla into a cylinder.
', 'Step 9: Place the rolls into the prepared baking dish with the seam sides down.
', 'Step 10: In a bowl, whisk together the soup, half-and-half, chicken broth, and about 1/3 of the 2nd package of shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 11: Pour the sauce over the enchiladas, sprinkle remaining Colby-Monterey Jack cheese over the casserole, and let stand for 10 to 15 minutes.

Title: Baked Tortilla Chips

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Title: Best Beef Enchiladas
Ingredients: ['2 pounds ground beef', '¼ medium onion, finely chopped', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '½ cup sour cream', '1 tablespoon dried parsley', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 ½ cups enchilada sauce', '1 ½ teaspoons chili powder', '1 clove garlic, minced', '½ teaspoon salt', '8 flour tortillas', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (4 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained', '¼ cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir ground beef with onion in a skillet over medium heat until meat is crumbly and no longer pink, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain grease.
', 'Step 4: Stir 1 cup Cheddar cheese, sour cream, parsley, taco seasoning, oregano, and black pepper into the ground beef until cheese has melted.
', 'Step 5: Mix in enchilada sauce, chili powder, garlic, and salt; bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low, and simmer until meat sauce is slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Lay a tortilla onto a work surface and spoon about 1/4 cup of meat sauce down the center of the tortilla.
', 'Step 7: Top meat sauce with 1 tablespoon black beans and a sprinkling of black olives.
', 'Step 8: Roll the tortilla up, enclosing the filling, and lay seam-side down into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Repeat with remaining tortillas.
', 'Step 10: Spoon any remaining meat sauce over the enchiladas and scatter any remaining black beans and black olives over the top.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle tortillas with 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese topping is melted and enchiladas and sauce are bubbling, 20 to 22 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Sopapilla Cheesecake Pie
Ingredients: ['2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened', '1 ¾ cups white sugar, divided', '1 teaspoon Mexican vanilla extract', '2 (8 ounce) cans refrigerated crescent rolls', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ cup butter, room temperature', '¼ cup honey']

['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Prepare a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.

Title: Authentic Mexican Chili Rellenos
Ingredients: ['6 fresh Anaheim chile peppers', '1 (8 ounce) package queso asadero (white Mexican cheese), cut into 3/4-inch thick strips', '2 eggs, separated', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '¾ cup all-purpose flour', '1 cup vegetable shortening for frying']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack at about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Place peppers onto the prepared baking sheet, and cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Turn the peppers often to blacken all sides.
', 'Step 5: Place the blackened peppers into a bowl, and tightly seal with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 6: Allow the peppers to steam as they cool, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Rinse cooled peppers under cold water to peel off the skins, and cut a slit along the long side of each pepper to remove the seeds and core.
', 'Step 8: Rinse the peppers inside and out, and pat dry with paper towels.
', 'Step 9: Stuff the peppers with strips of the cheese.
', 'Step 10: Whisk the egg yolks in a bowl with the baking powder.
', 'Step 11: In a second metal bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric mixer until the whites form stiff peaks.
', 'Step 12: Gently fold the beaten egg whites into the yolk mixture.
', 'Step 13: Place flour into a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 14: Heat the vegetable shortening in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 15: Roll each stuffed pepper in flour, tap off excess flour, and dip the peppers into the egg mixture to coat both sides.
', 'Step 16: Gently lay the coated peppers into the hot shortening.
', 'Step 17: Fry peppers until lightly golden brown and the cheese has melted, about 5 minutes per side.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '263.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '17.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '101.7 mg', 'fatContent': '16 g', 'fiberContent': '1.1 g', 'proteinContent': '13.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '8.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '356.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.6 g'}

Title: Authentic Mole Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 cups chicken broth', '2 dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded', '2 dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded', '3 dried chipotle chiles, stemmed and seeded', '1 dinner roll, torn into pieces', '2 corn tortillas, cut into 1-inch strips', '2 tomatoes, cut in half crosswise', '5 tomatillos, cut in half crosswise', '1 tablespoon lard', '1 onion, halved and thinly sliced', '½ head garlic, peeled and sliced', '⅓ cup chopped peanuts', '¼ cup raisins', '2 tablespoons cumin seeds', '1 tablespoon dried thyme', '3 cinnamon sticks', '5 whole cloves', '6 whole allspice berries', '5 ounces dark chocolate, coarsely chopped', '1 cup chicken broth', '3 tablespoons white sugar', '1 teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Toast guajillo chiles, ancho chiles, and chipotle chiles in a dry pan over medium heat, stirring constantly, until warm and aromatic, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Transfer to the blender with chicken broth.
', 'Step 3: Heat 2 cups chicken broth in a saucepan until it begins to simmer, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Pour broth into a blender.
', 'Step 5: Toast dinner roll pieces and tortilla strips in a dry pan over medium heat, stirring constantly, until lightly browned, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Transfer to the blender with chicken broth and chiles Allow the chiles and toasted bread and tortillas to soak, fully submerged, in the chicken broth until softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Blend the mixture until smooth.
', 'Step 8: Cook tomatoes and tomatillos in a dry skillet on medium-high heat until soft and blackened, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
', 'Step 9: Place tomatoes in the blender with the chile puree.
', 'Step 10: Melt lard in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Stir in onion, garlic, peanuts, raisins, cumin seeds, thyme, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and allspice berries; cook and stir until onions are soft and golden, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove the cinnamon sticks and other whole spices; add onion mixture to the blender with the chile-tomato mixture and blend until smooth.
', 'Step 13: Pour chile puree into a large saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 14: Stir in chocolate chicken broth, sugar, and salt.
', 'Step 15: Bring mixture to a simmer; stir until chocolate is melted and sauce is thickened and slightly reduced, 10 to 15 minutes.
']

Title: Chicken Quesadillas
Ingredients: ['1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast, diced', '1 (1.27 ounce) packet fajita seasoning', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 green bell peppers, chopped', '2 red bell peppers, chopped', '1 onion, chopped', '10 (10 inch) flour tortillas', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 tablespoon bacon bits', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese']

', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the green bell peppers, red bell peppers, onion, and chicken.
', 'Step 8: Cook and stir until the vegetables have softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Layer half of each tortilla with the chicken and vegetable mixture, then sprinkle with the Cheddar cheese, bacon bits, and Monterey Jack.

', 'Step 2: Cook garlic cloves in hot oil, turning once, until brown on both sides, 4 to 5 minutes.

Title: Churros
Ingredients: ['1 cup water', '2 ½ tablespoons white sugar', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '2 quarts oil for frying', '½ cup white sugar, or to taste', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine water, 2 1/2 tablespoons sugar, salt and 2 tablespoons vegetable oil.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil and remove from heat.
', 'Step 3: Stir in flour until mixture forms a ball.
', 'Step 4: Heat oil for frying in a deep fryer or deep pot to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Pipe 5- to 6-inch strips of dough into the hot oil using a sturdy pastry bag fitted with a medium star tip.
', 'Step 6: Do not overcrowd the oil.
', 'Step 7: Fry until golden; drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 8: Combine 1/2 cup sugar and cinnamon.
', 'Step 9: Roll drained churros in cinnamon and sugar mixture.
']

Title: Enchilada Sauce
Ingredients: ['¼ cup vegetable oil', '2 tablespoons self-rising flour', '¼ cup New Mexico or California chili powder', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 ½ cups water', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon onion salt', 'salt to taste']

', 'Step 2: Stir in flour and chili powder, reduce heat to medium, and cook until fragrant and deepened in color, stirring constantly to prevent the flour from burning, about 1 minute.

Title: Taco Bake Casserole
Ingredients: ['cooking spray (such as Pam®)', '1 ½ pounds ground beef', '1 cup chopped onion', '½ cup water', '1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '1 (10 ounce) can refried beans', '½ cup salsa', '1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '15 taco shells, broken up, or more to taste', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Cook ground beef and onions in a skillet over medium heat until beef is browned, 7 to 10 minutes; drain grease.
', 'Step 4: Stir in water and taco seasoning; cook, stirring often, until thickened, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add refried beans, salsa, olives, and green chiles.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir over low heat until ingredients are warmed through, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Place half of the taco shells in the bottom of the baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Pour in half of the ground beef mixture; sprinkle with half of the Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 9: Repeat with remaining taco shells, ground beef mixture, and Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbly, 20 to 25 minutes.
']

Title: Ground Turkey Taco Meat
Ingredients: ['1 ½ tablespoons chili powder', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '12 ounces ground turkey', '½ cup water', '1 tablespoon cider vinegar', '1 ½ teaspoons brown sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, and cayenne together in a small bowl.
', 'Step 2: Cook turkey in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, stirring to break up clumps, until no longer pink, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in chili powder mixture and water.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid has been absorbed, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir cider vinegar and brown sugar into the skillet.
', 'Step 6: Simmer until flavors combine, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Transfer to a serving bowl.
']

Title: Pinto Beans With Mexican-Style Seasonings
Ingredients: ['1 pound dried pinto beans, rinsed', '2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®)', '½ pound bacon, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', '1 yellow onion, chopped', '1 tablespoon chili powder, or to taste', '1 tablespoon ground cumin, or to taste', '1 ½ teaspoons garlic powder, or to taste', '½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place pinto beans into a large pot and pour in enough water to cover by 2 to 3 inches.
', 'Step 2: Let beans soak overnight.
', 'Step 3: Drain beans, return to pot, and pour in fresh water to cover; add diced tomatoes, bacon, onion, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 3 hours.
', 'Step 5: Stir cilantro and salt into bean mixture; simmer until beans are soft, about 1 more hour.
']
